heading: The fly connectome reveals a path to the effectome
authors: Dean A. PospisilMax J. AragonJonathan W. Pillow
description: Analysis of the whole-brain fly connectome reveals high-dimensional dynamics supported by many small independent circuits, motivating a proposal for optogenetic perturbation to efficiently learn a whole-brain causal neural dynamics model.

heading: Bulk high-temperature superconductivity in pressurized tetragonal La2PrNi2O7
description: Bulk high-temperature superconductivity observed in pressurized tetragonal La2PrNi2O7 was testified by detecting clear diamagnetic signals below about 75 K with appreciable superconducting shielding volume fractions at a pressure of above 15 GPa.

heading: Network statistics of the whole-brain connectome of Drosophila
description: The network of the fly brain is highly recurrent and displays rich-club organization, with a large population (30%) of preferentially connected neurons.

heading: Neuronal wiring diagram of an adult brain
description: FlyWire presents a neuronal wiring diagram of the whole fly brain with annotations for cell types, classes, nerves, hemilineages and predicted neurotransmitters, with data products and an open ecosystem to facilitate exploration and browsing.

heading: Rapid homologue juxtaposition during meiotic chromosome pairing
description: Homologue juxtaposition during meiosis is examined in real time by imaging of tagged chromosomal loci at high resolution in budding yeast, showing that corresponding loci come together and complete pairing in a very short time.

heading: Flickering gamma-ray flashes, the missing link between gamma glows and TGFs
description: Flickering gamma-ray flashes associated with terrestrial thunderstorms have been observed, which may be the missing link between gamma-ray glows and TGFs.

heading: Differences in misinformation sharing can lead to politically asymmetric sanctions
description: We find that conservatives tend to share more low-quality news through social media than liberals, and so even if technology companies enact politically neutral anti-misinformation policies, political asymmetries in enforcement should be expected.

heading: A Drosophila computational brain model reveals sensorimotor processing
authors: Philip K. ShiuGabriella R. SterneKristin Scott
description: We create a computational model of the adult Drosophila brain that accurately describes circuit responses upon activation of different gustatory and mechanosensory subtypes and generates experimentally testable hypotheses to describe complete sensorimotor transformations.

heading: Signature of the western boundary currents in local climate variability
authors: James G. LarsonDavid W. J. ThompsonJames W. Hurrell
description: Analyses based on high-spatial-resolution data demonstrate that sea surface temperature variability in the western boundary currents has a more robust signature in local climate variability than previously indicated.

heading: Mortality caused by tropical cyclones in the United States
description: A large-scale evaluation of the long-term effects of tropical cyclones on human mortality in the contiguous United States estimates that the average tropical cyclone results in 7,000–11,000 excess deaths, far exceeding previous estimates.

heading: Whole-brain annotation and multi-connectome cell typing of Drosophila
authors: Philipp SchlegelYijie YinGregory S. X. E. Jefferis
description: A consensus cell type atlas for the fly brain provides both an intellectual framework and open-source toolchains for brain-scale comparative connectomics.

heading: RNA m5C oxidation by TET2 regulates chromatin state and leukaemogenesis
description: Chromatin-associated retrotransposon RNA 5-methylcytosine can be recognized by the methyl-CpG-binding-domain protein MBD6, which guides deubiquitination of nearby monoubiquitinated Lys119 of histone H2A to promote an open chromatin state in TET2-deficient cells.

heading: Tuft cells act as regenerative stem cells in the human intestine
description: Four distinct tuft cell states are identified by combining analysis of primary human intestinal resection material and organoids, and studying tuft cell development shows that they represent a damage-induced reserve intestinal stem cell pool in humans.

heading: Highly dynamic gamma-ray emissions are common in tropical thunderclouds
description: Tropical thunderclouds over ocean and coastal regions are shown to emit gamma rays for several hours over areas of up to a few thousand square kilometres, contradicting the quasi-stationary picture of glows.

heading: Neuronal parts list and wiring diagram for a visual system
authors: Arie MatsliahSzi-chieh YuGregory S. X. E. Jefferis
description: An analysis of the Drosophila connectome yields all cell types intrinsic to the optic lobe, and their rules of connectivity.

heading: Connectomic reconstruction predicts visual features used for navigation
description: Electron-microscopy data are used to reconstruct the neurons that make up the anterior visual pathway in the Drosophila brain, providing insight into how visual features are encoded to guide navigation.

heading: LYCHOS is a human hybrid of a plant-like PIN transporter and a GPCR
authors: Charles Bayly-JonesChristopher J. LuptonAndrew M. Ellisdon
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the human lysosomal transmembrane protein LYCHOS show that it comprises a transporter-like domain fused to a G-protein-coupled receptor, and that the transporter domain is similar to the plant PIN family.

heading: Calcium-permeable AMPA receptors govern PV neuron feature selectivity
description: Calcium-permeable AMPA receptors are identified to have a role in maintaining low feature selectivity in a specific population of inhibitory interneurons, and this function is conserved across ferrets, rodents, marmosets and humans.

heading: Predicting visual function by interpreting a neuronal wiring diagram
description: A study demonstrates the interpretation of a neuronal wiring diagram of the optic lobe of Drosophila, yielding theoretical predictions about visual functions of this structure.

heading: Neural circuit mechanisms underlying context-specific halting in Drosophila
description: Two halting mechanisms, ‘walk-OFF’ and ‘brake’, are shown to be engaged by distinct neural circuits in Drosophila, in a context dependent manner.

heading: CRISPR–Cas9 screens reveal regulators of ageing in neural stem cells
authors: Tyson J. RuetzAngela N. PogsonAnne Brunet
description: CRISPR–Cas9 screens in cultures of young and old neural stem cells (NSCs) and in vivo in old mice identify gene knockouts that can boost old NSC activation and neurogenesis, with Slc2a4, which encodes the glucose transporter GLUT4, showing particular efficacy.

heading: Inducing novel endosymbioses by implanting bacteria in fungi
authors: Gabriel H. GigerChantal ErnstJulia A. Vorholt
description: A study presents an approach to establish and track a new endosymbiotic partnership by implanting bacteria in a non-host fungus and shows that stable inheritance of the implanted bacteria is possible with positive selection.

heading: Silicon heterojunction back contact solar cells by laser patterning
High-efficiency and thermally stable FACsPbI3 perovskite photovoltaics
Impurity-healing interface engineering for efficient perovskite submodules
H5N1 clade 2.3.4.4b dynamics in experimentally infected calves and cows
authors: Nico Joel HalweKonner CoolJuergen A. Richt

heading: The evolution of private reputations in information-abundant landscapes
description: In an information-abundant landscape, people can accurately judge the reputations of others by researching only a fraction of the available information while forgiving some instances of bad behaviour.

heading: Forest fire size amplifies postfire land surface warming
description: Climate warming has increased forest fire sizes, amplifying postfire summer warming, with broadleaf trees mitigating this effect; climate-smart forestry should increase broadleaf tree cover to manage future fire risks.

heading: Future increase in extreme El Niño supported by past glacial changes
description: A combination of palaeoclimate proxies and simulations shows that a common mechanism controls El Niño variation in cold and warm states, which supports expectations of more extreme El Niño occurrence in the future.

heading: Intragenic DNA inversions expand bacterial coding capacity
authors: Rachael B. ChaninPatrick T. WestAmi S. Bhatt
description: Reversible DNA inversions found entirely within genes enable increased coding capacity by encoding multiple versions of a protein in bacteria and archaea.

heading: Transferrin receptor targeting chimeras for membrane protein degradation
description: Transferrin receptor targeting chimeras have been developed that enable targeting of drug resistance in epidermal growth factor receptor-driven lung cancer and reversible control of human primary chimeric antigen receptor T cells, representing a promising new family of bifunctional antibodies for targeted cancer therapy.

heading: The genetic architecture of protein stability
description: By experimentally sampling from sequence spaces larger than 1010 and using thermodynamic models, the genetic structure of at least some proteins can be well described, indicating that protein genetics is simpler than anticipated.

heading: Larger and more instructable language models become less reliable
description: Scaling up and shaping up large language models increased their tendency to provide sensible yet incorrect answers at difficulty levels humans cannot supervise, highlighting the need for a fundamental shift in artificial intelligence design towards reliability.

heading: Human hippocampal and entorhinal neurons encode the temporal structure of experience
description: Single-neuron recordings from intracranial electrodes inserted into human brains for clinical reasons suggest that the temporal structure of human experience is encoded in human hippocampal and entorhinal neurons.

heading: Jet stream controls on European climate and agriculture since 1300 ce
description: Tree-ring records used to reconstruct the variability of the European jet stream from 1300 to 2004 ce show modulation of extreme regional climate events and extensive impacts on agriculture and human well-being.

heading: AARS1 and AARS2 sense l-lactate to regulate cGAS as global lysine lactyltransferases
description: The tRNA synthases AARS1 and AARS2 are identified as evolutionarily conserved sensors of intracellular l-lactate to mediate the global lysine lactylome.

heading: Microbial iron limitation in the ocean’s twilight zone
description: The distribution and uptake of siderophores across a meridional section of the eastern Pacific Ocean suggests that iron availability limits microbial metabolism in the upper mesopelagic in several large ocean basins.

heading: Brazilian fossils reveal homoplasy in the oldest mammalian jaw joint
authors: James R. G. RawsonAgustín G. MartinelliEmily J. Rayfield
description: The dentary–squamosal contact, traditionally considered to be a typical mammalian feature, evolved more than once and is more evolutionary labile than previously considered.

heading: Designed endocytosis-inducing proteins degrade targets and amplify signals
description: Computationally designed genetically encoded proteins can be used to target surface proteins, thereby triggering endocytosis and subsequent intracellular degradation, activating signalling or increasing cellular uptake in specific tissues.

heading: Bendable non-silicon RISC-V microprocessor
description: Flex-RV, a 32-bit microprocessor based on an open RISC-V instruction set fabricated with indium gallium zinc oxide thin-film transistors on a flexible polyimide substrate, enables an ultralow-cost bendable and flexible microprocessor.

heading: Using both faces of polar semiconductor wafers for functional devices
description: A new approach is described for fabricating devices on each of the faces of the same gallium nitride semiconductor wafer, using the cation face for photonic devices and the anion face for electronic devices.

heading: The type 2 cytokine Fc–IL-4 revitalizes exhausted CD8+ T cells against cancer
description: Fc–IL-4, a typical type 2 cytokine, reinvigorates exhausted CD8+ T cells in tumours, underscoring this fusion protein as a potent immunotherapy that synergizes effectively with type 1 immunity against cancer.

heading: Nitrogen-doped amorphous monolayer carbon
description: Free-standing nitrogen-doped amorphous monolayer carbon consisting of mixed five-, six- and seven-membered rings was prepared through the polymerization of pyrrole within the confined interlayer cavity of a removable layered-double-hydroxide template.

heading: Phages reconstitute NAD+ to counter bacterial immunity
description: A study shows that many phages are capable of evading antiphage defence systems of bacteria by reconstituting NAD+ from its degradation products in infected cells.

heading: Single-cell multi-omics map of human fetal blood in Down syndrome
authors: Andrew R. MardersteinMarco De ZuaniAna Cvejic
description: Using single-cell and multi-omics data of fetal blood, a high-resolution molecular map of dysregulated haematopoiesis in Down syndrome is provided.

heading: Single-cell CAR T atlas reveals type 2 function in 8-year leukaemia remission
description: Elevated type 2 functionality in CAR T cell infusion products is significantly associated with maintenance of a median B cell aplasia duration of 8.4 years in paediatric patients with acute lymphocytic leukaemia.

heading: Direct evidence for a carbon–carbon one-electron σ-bond
description: The one-electron oxidation of a hydrocarbon with an elongated C–C single bond provides direct evidence for a one-electron σ-bond between carbon atoms.

heading: Structural basis of archaeal FttA-dependent transcription termination
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the Thermococcus kodakarensis transcription pre-termination complex suggest a mechanism by which the archaeal termination factor FttA applies mechanical force to a transcription elongation complex to trigger termination, and reveal similarities in factor-dependent termination in bacteria, archaea, and eukaryotes.

heading: A lymphocyte chemoaffinity axis for lung, non-intestinal mucosae and CNS
Advanced CMOS manufacturing of superconducting qubits on 300 mm wafers
authors: J. Van DammeS. MassarK. De Greve
description: Superconducting transmon qubits have been fabricated in a 300 mm complementary metal–oxide–semiconductor (CMOS) pilot line using industrial fabrication methods, achieving relaxation and coherence times exceeding 100 μs.

heading: Opto-twistronic Hall effect in a three-dimensional spiral lattice
description: Opto-twistronic Hall effect driven by structural chirality and coherence length is observed in a three-dimensional self-assembled twisted spiral superlattice of WS2.

heading: Commensal consortia decolonize Enterobacteriaceae via ecological control
description: Transplants of consortia with limited numbers of strains of commensal bacteria derived from healthy human stool samples are able to suppress intestinal Enterobacteriaceae by regulating gluconate availability, suggesting potential therapies for infectious and inflammatory diseases.

heading: One step from oxides to sustainable bulk alloys
description: A one-step hydrogen-based redox process turns oxides directly into green alloys in bulk forms, with application-worthy properties.

heading: Temporal BMP4 effects on mouse embryonic and extraembryonic development
description: Temporally dynamic extraembryonic and embryonic BMP4 signalling shapes mouse embryo lineage choices.

heading: Two-factor authentication underpins the precision of the piRNA pathway
description: In male mouse germline development, the precise DNA methylation of young, active transposons requires a two-step process in which SPIN1 and SPOCD1 mark young LINE1 elements before the piRNA pathway triggers DNA methylation.

heading: Controlled patterning of crystalline domains by frontal polymerization
authors: Justine E. PaulYuan GaoNancy R. Sottos
description: Frontal polymerization spin mode dynamics is used to autonomously fabricate patterned crystalline domains in poly(cyclooctadiene) with multiscale organization.

heading: Observation of quantum entanglement with top quarks at the ATLAS detector
description: Entanglement was observed in top–antitop quark events by the ATLAS experiment produced at the Large Hadron Collider at CERN using a proton–proton collision dataset with a centre-of-mass energy of √s  = 13 TeV and an integrated luminosity of 140 fb−1.

heading: Mars’s induced magnetosphere can degenerate
description: When the cone angle between the solar wind velocity and the solar wind magnetic field is small at Mars, the induced magnetosphere degenerates.

heading: Black hole jets on the scale of the cosmic web
authors: Martijn S. S. L. OeiMartin J. HardcastleS. G. Djorgovski
description: Radio images reveal distant black hole jets of cosmological length, suggesting that the environmental impact of supermassive black holes extends further in space and time than previously thought.

heading: Three-dimensional wave breaking
authors: M. L. McAllisterS. DraycottT. S. van den Bremer
description: We conduct experiments in a wave tank and show that waves with realistic three-dimensional spreading can become two times steeper than two-dimensional waves before breaking, with three breaking regimes identified.

heading: Rules of river avulsion change downstream
authors: James H. GearonHarrison K. MartinDouglas A. Edmonds
description: A novel theoretical framework reveals how topography surrounding rivers causes dramatic changes in their courses, with implications for natural hazard prediction, particularly in the Global South.

heading: Micronuclear battery based on a coalescent energy transducer
description: A micronuclear battery is built based on an autoluminescent americium–terbium compound that couples radioisotopes with energy transducers at the molecular level, resulting in an 8,000-fold enhancement in energy conversion efficiency.

heading: Endogenous opioid signalling regulates spinal ependymal cell proliferation
authors: Wendy W. S. YueKouki K. TouharaDavid Julius
description: Paracrine κ-opioid signalling among cells surrounding the spinal cord central canal modulates scar formation after injury.

heading: Targeted protein relocalization via protein transport coupling
authors: Christine S. C. NgAofei LiuSteven M. Banik
description: Targeted protein relocalization using shuttle proteins with potent ligands amenable to incorporation into targeted relocalization activating molecules could be used to regulate cellular physiology and correct disease states in neurodegenerative diseases, cancer and genetic disorders.

heading: Dynamic transition and Galilean relativity of current-driven skyrmions
description: The emergent electrodynamics induced by skyrmion lattice motion in Gd2PdSi3 is facilitated by its giant topological Hall effect dynamic transition, and implies the emergent Galilean relativity of current-driven skyrmions.

heading: Observation-constrained projections reveal longer-than-expected dry spells
authors: Irina Y. PetrovaDiego G. MirallesMargot Bador
description: A newly identified emergent constraint applied to a key drought metric reduces uncertainty in future predictions of the longest annual dry spells, revealing that their increase due to climate change will be 40–50% greater than climate models project at present.

heading: Pathogenic hypothalamic extracellular matrix promotes metabolic disease
authors: Cait A. BeddowsFeiyue ShiGarron T. Dodd
description: Experiments in mice show that the perineural net has a key role in metabolic disease by controlling insulin access to neurons in the arcuate nucleus of the hypothalamus.

heading: Space radiation measurements during the Artemis I lunar mission
description: Measurements from the heavily shielded Orion spacecraft during the uncrewed Artemis I mission show dose-rate reductions due to shielding and orientation for Van Allen belt crossings and quantify the interplanetary cosmic-ray radiation in a human-rated spacecraft.

heading: Gasdermin D-mediated metabolic crosstalk promotes tissue repair
Structure of human TIP60-C histone exchange and acetyltransferase complex
Heteromeric amyloid filaments of ANXA11 and TDP-43 in FTLD-TDP Type C
One month convection timescale on the surface of a giant evolved star
description: Presenting a series of interferometric images of R Doradus, this study reveals prominent convective structures on the surface of this giant evolved star that have a timescale of about one month.

heading: Two-dimensional-lattice-confined single-molecule-like aggregates
description: A molecular aggregate formed in a two-dimensional organic–inorganic hybrid perovskite superlattice with a near-equilibrium distance is shown to have a near-unity photoluminescence quantum yield like that of single molecules, despite being in an aggregated state.

heading: Two-axis twisting using Floquet-engineered XYZ spin models with polar molecules
description: A study demonstrates the application of Floquet Hamiltonian engineering to ultracold trapped polar molecules to realize interactions relevant to quantum metrology and many-body physics.

heading: Mechanism of BRCA1–BARD1 function in DNA end resection and DNA protection
authors: Ilaria CeppiMaria Rosaria Dello StrittoPetr Cejka
description: BRCA1–BARD1 directly promotes double-strand break repair by stimulating long-range DNA end resection pathways.

heading: Molecular programs guiding arealization of descending cortical pathways
description: Using cross-areal mapping of axonal projections in the mouse neocortex, we identify the subtype-specific developmental dynamics of extratelencephalic neurons and show the functional transcriptional programs driving extratelencephalic neuron diversity.

heading: Linear symmetric self-selecting 14-bit kinetic molecular memristors
description: Harnessing precise molecular kinetics, a 14-bit, energy-efficient dot product engine is realized that unlocks neuromorphic hardware’s potential for core computations.

heading: Multi-pass, single-molecule nanopore reading of long protein strands
description: A technique for threading long protein strands through a nanopore by electrophoresis and back using a protein unfoldase motor, ClpX, enables single protein molecules to be analyzed multiple times with single-amino-acid sensitivity.

heading: Decoding drivers of carbon flux attenuation in the oceanic biological pump
authors: M. BressacE. C. Laurenceau-CornecP. W. Boyd
description: In situ experimental findings from six contrasting oceanic regimes, at multiple mesopelagic depths, are used to determine the mechanisms that drive microbially mediated carbon flux attenuation in the oceanic biological pump.

heading: Ancient Rapanui genomes reveal resilience and pre-European contact with the Americas
authors: J. Víctor Moreno-MayarBárbara Sousa da MotaAnna-Sapfo Malaspinas
description: An analysis of 15 ancient genomes from individuals dating to AD 1670–1950 from Rapa Nui (also known as Easter Island) addresses questions about the population history of the island.

heading: Drosophila are hosts to the first described parasitoid wasp of adult flies
authors: Logan D. MooreToluwanimi Chris AmuwaMatthew J. Ballinger
description: A study reports the discovery of a parasitoid wasp species that uses the adult stage of Drosophila fruit flies as its host.

heading: Axon-like active signal transmission
description: A method using semi-stable edge of chaos in LaCoO3 enables continuous signal amplification in metallic conductors without separate amplifiers, potentially revolutionizing electronic chip design.

heading: Cooling positronium to ultralow velocities with a chirped laser pulse train
description: The one-dimensional laser cooling of positronium enables testing of quantum electrodynamics and could realize Bose–Einstein condensation in positronium.

heading: The ultra-high affinity transport proteins of ubiquitous marine bacteria
description: Genome-wide characterization of solute-binding proteins in SAR11, a group of ubiquitous marine bacteria, reveals that they generally combine high binding affinities with narrow binding specificities, suggesting a molecular mechanism for the adaptation of SAR11 to diverse marine environments.

heading: Controllable p- and n-type behaviours in emissive perovskite semiconductors
description: The charge carrier polarity and concentrations in an emissive perovskite semiconductor can be adjusted by incorporating a molecular dopant widely used for the passivation and structural control of optoelectronic perovskite materials.

heading: A brain-to-gut signal controls intestinal fat absorption
description: Neurons in the dorsal motor nucleus of vagus are involved in the absorption of fat in the intestine, and the natural compound puerarin shows utility in modulating this brain–gut axis to reduce fat absorption.

heading: Agonist antibody to guanylate cyclase receptor NPR1 regulates vascular tone
description: Durable agonism of NPR1 achieved with a novel investigational monoclonal antibody could mirror the positive hemodynamic changes in blood pressure and heart failure identified in humans with lifelong exposure to NPR1 coding variants.

heading: Genetic links between ovarian ageing, cancer risk and de novo mutation rates
description: Analyses focusing on protein-truncating variants from 106,973 women from in the UK Biobank identify variants in genes that reinforce the link between reproductive lifespan in women and cancer risk in both sexes.

heading: Ultrahigh electromechanical response from competing ferroic orders
description: Ultrahigh electromechanical response is accomplished by inducing extreme structural instability from competing antiferroelectric and ferroelectric orders.

heading: Brain-wide dynamics linking sensation to action during decision-making
description: Brain-wide recordings in mice show that learning leads to sensory evidence integration in many brain areas simultaneously, allowing sensory input to drive global movement preparatory dynamics, which collapse upon movement onset.

heading: Observing the two-dimensional Bose glass in an optical quasicrystal
description: The two-dimensional Bose glass state of matter is realized experimentally using ultracold atoms in an eight-fold symmetric quasicrystalline optical lattice, and the phase transition between Bose glass and superfluid is directly observed.

heading: Promotion of DNA end resection by BRCA1–BARD1 in homologous recombination
description: Using highly purified protein factors, we provide evidence that BRCA1–BARD1 physically interacts with EXO1, BLM and WRN and upregulates the activity of all three resection pathways.

heading: Connectome-constrained networks predict neural activity across the fly visual system
authors: Janne K. LappalainenFabian D. TschoppSrinivas C. Turaga
description: A study demonstrates how experimental measurements of only the connectivity of a biological neural network can be used to predict neural responses across the fly visual system at single-neuron resolution using deep learning techniques.

heading: Self-organized tissue mechanics underlie embryonic regulation
description: Mechanical forces act at the core of bird embryonic self-organization, shaping both tissues and gene expression to robustly yet plastically canalize early development.

heading: Stereospecific radical coupling with a non-natural photodecarboxylase
Perovskite-silicon tandem solar cells with bilayer interface passivation
A γδ T cell–IL-3 axis controls allergic responses through sensory neurons
authors: Cameron H. FlayerIsabela J. KerninCaroline L. Sokol
description: A γδ T cell–IL-3 signalling axis is defined that controls the allergen responsiveness of cutaneous sensory neurons, leading to evidence for an immune rheostat that governs sensory neuronal responses to allergens on first exposure.

heading: Frontostriatal salience network expansion in individuals in depression
authors: Charles J. LynchImmanuel G. ElbauConor Liston
description: Precision functional mapping shows that the frontostriatal salience network occupies nearly twice as much of the cortex in people with depression, and this was unaffected by mood changes and detected in children before onset of symptoms.

heading: A local-to-global emissions inventory of macroplastic pollution
authors: Joshua W. CottomEd CookCostas A. Velis
description: A global macroplastic pollution emissions inventory and methodology is developed using machine learning and probabilistic material flow analysis, to identify hotspots across more than 50,000 municipalities worldwide from five land-based plastic waste emission sources.

heading: A climate threshold for ocean deoxygenation during the Early Cretaceous
authors: Kohen W. BauerN. Ryan McKenzieSean A. Crowe
description: Rapid ocean deoxygenation during the Early Cretaceous OAE1a is shown to provide evidence for a strong link between volcanic CO2 emissions, weathering and ocean oxygen content that is characterized by a climate threshold.

heading: Recurrent evolution and selection shape structural diversity at the amylase locus
description: The impact of structural variation on the evolution of the amylase genes is explored using human pangenome resources and ancient DNA data.

heading: CDK5–cyclin B1 regulates mitotic fidelity
description: Cyclin B1 is a mitotic co-factor of CDK5.

heading: Immune system adaptation during gender-affirming testosterone treatment
description: Examination of immunological changes in transgender individuals undergoing gender-affirming testosterone treatment reveals sex hormone-regulated pathways in humans and explains sex-divergent responses in cisgender individuals.

heading: Diverse viral cas genes antagonize CRISPR immunity
authors: Mark A. KatzEdith M. SawyerAlexander J. Meeske
description: We demonstrate that phages have co-opted cas genes from CRISPR defence systems, which subsequently evolved anti-defence functions.

heading: Signatures of magnetism control by flow of angular momentum
description: Signatures of magnetism control by the flow of angular momentum are observed in Pt/Al/Fe/GaAs(001) multilayers by the application of an in-plane charge current in Pt.

heading: Frequency ratio of the 229mTh nuclear isomeric transition and the 87Sr atomic clock
description: A vacuum ultraviolet frequency comb is used to directly excite the narrow 229Th nuclear clock transition in a solid-state CaF2 host material, marking the start of nuclear-based solid-state optical clocks.

heading: Gravitational instability in a planet-forming disk
description: Observations of gravitational instability in the disk around AB Aurigae using deep observations of 13CO and C18O line emission provide evidence that giant protoplanets can be formed from collapsing fragments of vast spiral arms.

heading: An aberrant immune–epithelial progenitor niche drives viral lung sequelae
description: CD8+ T cell–macrophage interactions have a central role in impairing alveolar regeneration and driving fibrotic sequelae after acute viral pneumonia in a mouse model of long COVID.

heading: A polymer-like ultrahigh-strength metal alloy
description: A polymer-like ultrahigh-strength TiNi alloy was fabricated by a simple three-step process to give a combination of a polymer-like ultralow elastic modulus and a steel-like ultrahigh yield strength over a wide temperature range, and such exotic properties arise from a unique strain glass state.

heading: DNA methylation controls stemness of astrocytes in health and ischaemia
authors: Lukas P. M. KremerSantiago CerrizuelaAna Martin-Villalba
description: Single-cell analysis of the transcriptome, chromatin accessibility and methylome of adult neural stem cells and astrocytes demonstrates that stemness is driven by methylation profiles distinct from those of astrocytes.

heading: Global marine microbial diversity and its potential in bioprospecting
description: Analysis of 43,191 genomes obtained from publicly available marine bacterial and archaeal metagenome data provides insights into marine bacterial evolution, CRISPR–Cas defence and antibiotic resistance genes, and demonstrates the potential of marine metagenomes for biotechnological applications.

heading: Alternating high-fat diet enhances atherosclerosis by neutrophil reprogramming
description: Re-exposure to a high-fat diet in mice led to emergency myelopoiesis and increased neutrophils in the blood, which infiltrated plaques and released neutrophil extracellular traps, exacerbating atherosclerosis.

heading: Mechanisms that clear mutations drive field cancerization in mammary tissue
authors: Marta CiwinskaHendrik A. MessalJacco van Rheenen
description: The authors use lineage tracing to map the fate of wild-type and Brca1−/−;Trp53−/− cells in the adult mouse mammary gland, identifying three layers of protection that limit the spread of mutant cells at the expense of allowing a minority of mutant cells to expand, which leads to field cancerization.

heading: The hepatitis C virus envelope protein complex is a dimer of heterodimers
authors: Elias Honerød AugestadChristina Holmboe OlesenJannick Prentoe
description: Structural studies of a homodimeric arrangement of hepatitis C virus envelope E1/E2 heterodimers reveals the molecular basis of intracomplex interactions and  provides mechanistic insights into neutralizing antibody evasion and membrane fusion with host cells.

heading: Early intermittent hyperlipidaemia alters tissue macrophages to fuel atherosclerosis
description: Early intermittent feeding of mice with a high-cholesterol Western-type diet accelerates atherosclerosis compared with late continuous exposure to the Western-type diet, despite similar cumulative circulating LDL-C levels.

heading: A pathology foundation model for cancer diagnosis and prognosis prediction
description: A study describes the development of a generalizable foundation machine learning framework to extract pathology imaging features for cancer diagnosis and prognosis prediction.

heading: Farmed fur animals harbour viruses with zoonotic spillover potential
description: Fur farming represents an important hub of cross-species transmission for viral zoonoses.

heading: Mapping glycoprotein structure reveals Flaviviridae evolutionary history
authors: Jonathon C. O. MifsudSpyros LytrasJoe Grove
description: Combined phylogenetic analyses and glycoprotein structure prediction across the Flaviviridae reveals divergent membrane fusion systems and provides insights into the complex evolutionary history within this family of viruses.

heading: Engineered T cell therapy for central nervous system injury
description: This study presents a new T cell therapy targeting spinal cord injury, providing a potential new approach for injured CNS.

heading: Synthesis of non-canonical amino acids through dehydrogenative tailoring
description: Effective dehydrogenation of amino acids and short peptides using cobalt and photocatalysis is used to make a range of unnatural products of value in chemistry and biology.

heading: Electrocatalytic reductive deuteration of arenes and heteroarenes
description: Reductive deuteration and deuterodefluorination of arenes and heteroarenes is achieved through a scalable and general electrocatalytic method using a nitrogen-doped ruthenium electrode and heavy water.

heading: Reductive alkyl–alkyl coupling from isolable nickel–alkyl complexes
authors: Samir Al ZubaydiShivam WaskeChristo S. Sevov
description: Alkyl–alkyl cross-coupling reactions are achieved by forming nickel–alkyl complexes directly by oxidative addition of alkyl halides, redox-active esters or pyridinium salts, and then combining them with a second alkyl electrophile.

heading: Uncertain competition coefficients undermine inferences about coexistence
M. N. Van Dyke et al. reply
authors: Mary N. Van DykeJonathan M. LevineNathan J. B. Kraft

heading: To remain modern the coexistence program requires modern statistical rigour
Carbon emissions from the 2023 Canadian wildfires
description: Satellite carbon monoxide observations show that carbon emissions from the 2023 Canadian forest fires are comparable to the annual fossil fuel emissions of large nations.

heading: Long-lived isospin excitations in magic-angle twisted bilayer graphene
description: A combination of exciton sensing and optical pump–probe spectroscopy is used to investigate the dynamics of isospin orders in MATBG with WSe2 substrate across the entire flat band, achieving sub-picosecond resolution.

heading: Signatures of hybridization of multiple Majorana zero modes in a vortex
description: We observe signatures of the existence and hybridization of multiple Majorana zero modes in a single vortex.

heading: Cellular communities reveal trajectories of brain ageing and Alzheimer’s disease
authors: Gilad Sahar GreenMasashi FujitaPhilip L. De Jager
description: A comprehensive cell atlas of the aged prefrontal cortex identifies two distinct cellular trajectories of ageing driven by specific glial and neuronal subpopulations, some of which are associated with clinicopathologic traits that define Alzheimer’s disease.

heading: Mating proximity blinds threat perception
description: A state-dependent dopamine filter system in the male Drosophila brain balances threat perception against the drive to mate.

heading: Earth’s ambipolar electrostatic field and its role in ion escape to space
description: The ambipolar field of Earth controls the structure of the polar ionosphere and boosts its scale height by 271%, physically driving  the polar wind and acting as the source of the magnetospheric cold H+ ion population.

heading: A population code for spatial representation in the zebrafish telencephalon
description: Using a tracking microscope for freely moving animals, the authors discover a population of place cells in the zebrafish brain and demonstrate that a non-amniote brain is capable of integrating allothetic and idiothetic information to create a neural map of space.

heading: Fate induction in CD8 CAR T cells through asymmetric cell division
authors: Casey S. LeeSisi ChenChristoph T. Ellebrecht
description: We show that target-induced proximity labelling enables isolation of first-division CD8 chimeric antigen receptor T cells that asymmetrically distribute their surface proteome and transcriptome, resulting in distinct phenotypic, metabolic and functional profiles in proximal and distal daughter cells.

heading: Spatially clustered type I interferon responses at injury borderzones
authors: V. K. NinhD. M. CalcagnoK. R. King
description: Cardiomyocytes are the dominant initiators of a type I interferon response in the infarct borderzone.

heading: Embryonic genome instability upon DNA replication timing program emergence
description: A single-cell genome-wide DNA replication atlas of pre-implantation mouse embryos reveals an abrupt replication program switch accompanied by a transient period of genomic instability.

heading: Superconductivity under pressure in a chromium-based kagome metal
description: The emergence of superconductivity under pressure is reported in a chromium-based kagome metal, CsCr3Sb5, which has strong electron correlations, frustrated magnetism and characteristic flat bands close to the Fermi level.

heading: Probing plant signal processing optogenetically by two channelrhodopsins
description: Using new optogenetic tools to induce distinct ion fluxes, a study shows that these discrete signals trigger different metabolic and transcriptional pathways that allow plants to respond to specific types of stress.

heading: Photoredox phase engineering of transition metal dichalcogenides
description: Chemical lithiation of two-dimensional transition metal dichalcogenides can be accelerated by up to six orders of magnitude using low-power illumination and a variety of phase transition agents.

heading: Cooperative thalamocortical circuit mechanism for sensory prediction errors
authors: Shohei FurutachiAlexis D. FranklinSonja B. Hofer
description: Experiments in mice show that a cortico-thalamic circuit generates prediction-error signals in primary visual cortex that amplify visual input that deviates from animals’ expectations.

heading: AI generates covertly racist decisions about people based on their dialect
description: Despite efforts to remove overt racial prejudice, language models using artificial intelligence still show covert racism against speakers of African American English that is triggered by features of the dialect.

heading: Sympathetic neuropeptide Y protects from obesity by sustaining thermogenic fat
description: We find that, relative to central neuropeptide Y, peripheral neuropeptide Y produced by sympathetic nerves has the opposite effect on body weight by sustaining energy expenditure independently of food intake.

heading: Tuberculosis in otherwise healthy adults with inherited TNF deficiency
description: Human TNF is required for respiratory-burst-dependent immunity to Mycobacterium tuberculosis in macrophages but seems to be largely redundant physiologically.

heading: Sperm-origin paternal effects on root stem cell niche differentiation
description: TREE1 and its homologue DAZ3 are expressed exclusively in Arabidopsis sperm, showing how genetic deficiencies can exert enduring paternal effects on specific plant organ differentiation and how parental-of-origin genes interact to ensure normal embryogenesis.

heading: Fibrin drives thromboinflammation and neuropathology in COVID-19
description: Fibrin drives inflammation and neuropathology in SARS-CoV-2 infection, and fibrin-targeting immunotherapy may represent a therapeutic intervention for patients with long COVID.

heading: Closed-loop transfer enables artificial intelligence to yield chemical knowledge
authors: Nicholas H. AngelloDavid M. FridayNicholas E. Jackson
description: Integration of closed-loop experiments with physics-based feature selection and supervised learning, denoted as closed-loop transfer, yields chemical insights in parallel with optimization of objective functions.

heading: Birth of protein folds and functions in the virome
authors: Jason NomburgErin E. DohertyJennifer A. Doudna
description: Structural comparison of predicted viral protein structures with known protein structures suggests taxonomic relationships and functions for up to 25% of unannotated viral proteins, including many with putative functions in host immune evasion.

heading: Catalytic asymmetric synthesis of meta benzene isosteres
description: A palladium-catalysed reaction converts hydrocarbon-derived precursors to chiral boron-containing nortricyclanes, and the shape of these nortricyclanes makes them plausible isosteres for meta disubstituted aromatic rings.

heading: Chiral kagome superconductivity modulations with residual Fermi arcs
description: Using normal and Josephson scanning tunnelling microscopy, chiral kagome superconductivity modulations with corresponding residual Fermi arcs are detected in KV3Sb5 and CsV3Sb5.

heading: Effective realization of abatement measures can reduce HFC-23 emissions
description: Fulfilment of current abatement technology at the factory level could reduce HFC-23 emissions by approximately 84%.

heading: Short-term post-fast refeeding enhances intestinal stemness via polyamines
description: Post-fast refeeding increases intestinal stem cell function and tumour formation by augmenting protein synthesis via polyamine metabolism.

heading: Highly variable magmatic accretion at the ultraslow-spreading Gakkel Ridge
description: Results from a high-resolution ocean-bottom seismometer experiment at the ultraslow-spreading Gakkel Ridge show unexpected highly variable crustal thickness and a relatively large average value, which can be explained by an active mantle upwelling model.

heading: Structural insights into the high-affinity IgE receptor FcεRI complex
description: A study presents high-resolution cryogenic electron microscopy structures detailing how the elements of FcεRI assemble and how this receptor complex interacts with the target immunoglobulin E.

heading: Human XPR1 structures reveal phosphate export mechanism
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of human XPR1 in different bound forms reveal the structural basis for XPR1 gating and regulation by inositol polyphosphates.

heading: Visualizing chaperonin function in situ by cryo-electron tomography
authors: Jonathan WagnerAlonso I. CarvajalF. Ulrich Hartl
description: Visualizing chaperonin complexes in their natural cellular environment using cryo-electron tomography, the authors propose a GroEL–GroES reaction cycle that consists of linked asymmetrical and symmetrical subreactions mediating protein folding.

heading: Thermal infrared directs host-seeking behaviour in Aedes aegypti mosquitoes
description: The mosquito Aedes aegypti can detect humans through infrared radiation for highly effective mid-range navigation.

heading: The periosteum provides a stromal defence against cancer invasion into the bone
description: Experiments in mouse models and histology of human head and neck squamous cell carcinomas show that TIMP1-mediated periosteal thickening in proximity to tumours acts as a barrier to cancer invasion of the bone.

heading: Stem cells tightly regulate dead cell clearance to maintain tissue fitness
authors: Katherine S. StewartMerve Deniz AbdusselamogluElaine Fuchs
description: The spatiotemporal activation of phagocytosis by hair follicle cells is orchestrated by lipids released from surrounding apoptotic cells and retinoids released by healthy cells.

heading: Loss of plasticity in deep continual learning
authors: Shibhansh DohareJ. Fernando Hernandez-GarciaRichard S. Sutton
description: The pervasive problem of artificial neural networks losing plasticity in continual-learning settings is demonstrated and a simple solution called the continual backpropagation algorithm is described to prevent this issue.

heading: NAC guides a ribosomal multienzyme complex for nascent protein processing
description: Cotranslational N-terminal methionine excision and acetylation of eukaryotic proteins on ribosomes is coordinated by the nascent polypeptide-associated complex.

heading: Oligodendrocytes and myelin limit neuronal plasticity in visual cortex
description: Through genetic blocking of oligodendrocyte differentiation and myelination in adolescent mice, we demonstrate that oligodendrocytes have a critical role in shaping the maturation and stabilization of visual cortical circuits.

heading: Multi-habitat landscapes are more diverse and stable with improved function
authors: Talya D. HackettAlix M. C. SauveJane Memmott
description: Species interaction data, a field experiment and modelling of plant–insect communities show that landscapes with more habitat types support more even species, more complementary interactions, are more consistently robust to species loss, and confer greater pollination function.

heading: Prefrontal and lateral entorhinal neurons co-dependently learn item–outcome rules
authors: Heechul JunJason Y. LeeKei M. Igarashi
description: The bidirectional loop circuit between layers 5/6 of the lateral entorhinal cortex and the medial prefrontal cortex encodes item–outcome associative memory in mice.

heading: Observation of the antimatter hypernucleus \({}_{\bar{{\boldsymbol{\Lambda }}}}{}^{{\bf{4}}}\bar{{\bf{H}}}\)
authors: M. I. AbdulhamidB. E. AboonaM. Zyzak
description: An antimatter hypernucleus formed by an anti-lambda hadron, an antiproton and two antineutrons was observed through its two-body decay after production in ultrarelativistic heavy-ion collisions.

heading: Lysosomes drive the piecemeal removal of mitochondrial inner membrane
description: We show that cytosolic inner mitochondrial membrane vesicles, devoid of outer mitochondrial membrane or mitochondrial matrix, are formed during resting state and directly herniate into lysosomes through pores formed by voltage-dependent anion channel 1 in the outer mitochondrial membrane, thereby allowing their selective removal.

heading: Chandrayaan-3 APXS elemental abundance measurements at lunar high latitude
authors: Santosh V. VadawaleN. P. S. MithunAmitabh
description: In situ measurements of the elemental abundances in the lunar southern high-latitude regions show that the local terrain is fairly uniform and mostly composed of ferroan anorthosite, a product of lunar magma ocean crystallization.

heading: Attosecond delays in X-ray molecular ionization
description: Time-resolved measurements of the X-ray photoemission delay of core-level electrons using attosecond soft X-ray pulses from a free-electron laser can be used to determine the complex correlated dynamics of photoionization.

heading: Low-latitude mesopelagic nutrient recycling controls productivity and export
description: To facilitate more accurate long-term projections of primary production and export over oceanic low latitudes (LLs), we identified the first-order importance of the temperature dependence of remineralization of the LL nutrient reservoir, with this serving to enhance LL mesopelagic retention under warming.

heading: Neoarchaean oxygen-based nitrogen cycle en route to the Great Oxidation Event
description: Observations of strongly positive nitrogen isotopic compositions of sedimentary rocks in the 2.68-Gyr-old shallow to deep marine sedimentary deposit of the Serra Sul Formation suggest that oxygenic photosynthesis predated the Great Oxidation Event.

heading: On-chip multi-degree-of-freedom control of two-dimensional materials
description: An on-chip platform with in situ adjustable interfacial properties, using a microelectromechanical system, provides multi-degree-of-freedom control of two-dimensional materials, including twisting and pressurizing.

heading: Structure of a fully assembled γδ T cell antigen receptor
authors: Benjamin S. GullyJoão Ferreira FernandesSimon J. Davis
description: Cryogenic electron microscopy determines the structure of a fully assembled, MR1-reactive, human Vγ8Vδ3 TCR–CD3δγε2ζ2 complex bound by anti-CD3ε antibody Fab fragments.

heading: Remodelling of the translatome controls diet and its impact on tumorigenesis
description: During fasting, hepatocytes selectively remodel the translatome while global translation is downregulated, showing a new signalling property of fatty acids and that, on a ketogenic diet, treatment with eFT508 (also known as tomivosertib; a P-eIF4E inhibitor) restrains pancreatic tumour growth.

heading: Mitochondrial complex I promotes kidney cancer metastasis
description: Studying changes in the metabolic properties of kidney cancer in patients reveals an increased need for mitochondrial metabolism as tumors metastasize from the kidney to distant organs.

heading: A Scottish provenance for the Altar Stone of Stonehenge
authors: Anthony J. I. ClarkeChristopher L. KirklandRob A. Ixer
description: Mineral ages and chemical analysis of fragments of the Altar Stone from the Neolithic stone circle at Stonehenge suggest that it was transported from northeast Scotland, more than 750 km away, probably by sea.

heading: Encoding of female mating dynamics by a hypothalamic line attractor
description: An oestrus cycle-dependent hypothalamic line attractor is discovered to encode the dynamics of female mating behaviour.

heading: Molecular architecture of coronavirus double-membrane vesicle pore complex
description: A study details the molecular architecture of the double-membrane-spanning pore formed by the proteins nsp3 and nsp4 in double-membrane vesicles of SARS-CoV-2.

heading: Human organoids with an autologous tissue-resident immune compartment
description: We combined human intestinal immuno-organoids and single-cell transcriptomics to investigate intestinal inflammation triggered by cancer-targeting biologics, which was associated with an activated population of CD8+ T cells that progressively acquired intraepithelial and cytotoxic features.

heading: Structural basis for the activity of the type VII CRISPR–Cas system
description: We describe the structure and activity of Cas14 nuclease, a component of the type VII CRISPR–Cas interference complex with Cas5 and Cas7, in different functional states.

heading: Origin and evolution of the bread wheat D genome
description: Analysis of 46 newly sequenced or re-sequenced Tausch’s goatgrass (Aegilops tauschii) accessions establishes the origin of the bread wheat (Triticum aestivum) D genome from genetically and geographically discrete Ae. tauschii subpopulations.

heading: Substrate binding and inhibition mechanism of norepinephrine transporter
description: Structures of human NET in the apo state and bound to meta-iodobenzylguanidine and radafaxine provide insights into the mechanism of substrate recognition and orthosteric inhibition of hNET.

heading: Abstract representations emerge in human hippocampal neurons during inference
description: A task in which participants learned to perform inference led to the formation of hippocampal representations whose geometric properties reflected the latent structure of the task, indicating that abstract or disentangled neural representations are important for complex cognition.

heading: Continuously fluctuating selection reveals fine granularity of adaptation
authors: M. C. BitterS. BerardiD. A. Petrov
description: Natural environmental and ecological shifts impose sufficiently strong selection to drive exceptionally rapid, parallel and fluctuating adaptive tracking in a Drosophila melangaster mesocosm.

heading: On-chip topological beamformer for multi-link terahertz 6G to XG wireless
description: An on-chip topological beamformer for multi-link terahertz 6G to XG wireless communication achieves complete 360° azimuthal beamforming with gains of up to 20 dBi, radiating THz signals into free space with neural-network-driven customizable beams enabling up to eight simultaneous 40-Gbps wireless links.

heading: De novo design of allosterically switchable protein assemblies
description: We investigate the de novo design of allostery and suggest that it can arise from global coupling of the energetics of protein substructures without optimized allosteric communication pathways, providing a roadmap for the design of switchable molecular systems.

heading: Twist-assisted all-antiferromagnetic tunnel junction in the atomic limit
authors: Yuliang ChenKartik SamantaStuart S. P. Parkin
description: By twisting two bilayers of CrSBr, which is a 2D antiferromagnet, a >700% nonvolatile tunnelling magnetoresistance at zero field is shown, demonstrating a new strategy for constructing all-antiferromagnetic tunnel junctions down to the atomic limit.

heading: A hot-emitter transistor based on stimulated emission of heated carriers
description: A mixed-dimensional hot-emitter transistor based on mixed-dimensional graphene/germanium Schottky junctions uses stimulated emission of heated carriers, achieving an ultralow subthreshold swing and a high negative differential resistance.

heading: Recognition and control of neutrophil extracellular trap formation by MICL
description: How MICL recognizes and autoregulates the formation of neutrophil extracellular traps is explored in mouse models and human patients where disease severity is associated with aberrant neutrophil extracellular trap formation.

heading: Unimolecular net heterolysis of symmetric and homopolar σ-bonds
authors: Anna F. TiefelDaniel J. GrendaAlexander Breder
description: Net heterolysis of symmetric and homopolar σ-bonds by stimulated doublet–doublet electron transfer is reported in a series of atypical SN1 reactions, in which selenides show SDET-induced nucleofugalities rivalling those of more electronegative halides or diazoniums.

heading: Growth of complete ammonia oxidizers on guanidine
description: Nitrospira inopinata and probably most other comammox microorganisms can grow on the non-conventional substrate guanidine as the sole source of energy, reductant and nitrogen.

heading: Precision spectroscopy on 9Be overcomes limitations from nuclear structure
description: A high-precision measurement of the shielding effects of multiple electrons on the nuclear magnetic moment is made possible by spectroscopy of hydrogen-like 9Be3+, which overcomes limitations from the nuclear structure.

heading: The genomes of all lungfish inform on genome expansion and tetrapod evolution
description: We find that massive genome expansion seems to be related to a reduction of PIWI-interacting RNAs and C2H2 zinc-finger and KRAB-domain protein genes that suppress transposable element expansion, and lungfish chromosomes still conservatively reflect the ur-tetrapod karyotype.

heading: Causal evidence of a line attractor encoding an affective state
description: Single-cell optogenetic stimulation and calcium imaging experiments provide direct evidence of line-attractor dynamics, including functional network connectivity, in the mammalian hypothalamus.

heading: The genomic basis of childhood T-lineage acute lymphoblastic leukaemia
authors: Petri PölönenDanika Di GiacomoDavid T. Teachey
description: Comprehensive genomic and transcriptomics analyses of more than 1,300 cases of childhood T-lineage acute lymphoblastic leukaemia identify 15 distinct subtypes that are associated with specific outcomes.

heading: Structural basis for transthiolation intermediates in the ubiquitin pathway
authors: Tomasz KochańczykZachary S. HannChristopher D. Lima
description: Structural analyses of analogues of stable ubiquitin transthiolation intermediates with E1, E2 and E3 enzymes reveal a population of intermediate states that provide insights into the directional transfer of ubiquitin between E1, E2 and E3.

heading: Black holes regulate cool gas accretion in massive galaxies
description: Supermassive black holes regulate the amount of atomic hydrogen in galaxies and the atomic hydrogen gas mass to stellar masses ratio is more strongly correlated with black hole masses.

heading: Amplification of autoimmune organ damage by NKp46-activated ILC1s
description: NKp46+ innate lymphoid cells are identified as pivotal signal amplifiers of autoinflammatory responses in lupus nephritis.

heading: Structure of the human dopamine transporter and mechanisms of inhibition
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structure of the human dopamine transporter in complex with multiple inhibitors illuminates mechanisms of allosteric inhibition.

heading: Dopamine reuptake and inhibitory mechanisms in human dopamine transporter
description: Structural analyses of the human dopamine transporter in apo and substrate-bound states and in complex with drugs and inhibitors reveal key binding residues and conformational transitions that occur during substrate transport.

heading: The ribosome lowers the entropic penalty of protein folding
authors: Julian O. StreitIvana V. BukvinJohn Christodoulou
description: Structures of the growing peptide chain on and off the ribosome reveal that the ribosome destabilizes the unfolded nascent chain, promoting the formation of partially folded intermediate states.

heading: Architecture and activation mechanism of the bacterial PARIS defence system
description: The bacterial phage anti-restriction-induced system, PARIS, operates as a toxin–antitoxin system, in which the antitoxin AriA sequesters and inactivates the toxin AriB until triggered by the T7 phage counterdefence protein Ocr.

heading: DNA-sensing inflammasomes cause recurrent atherosclerotic stroke
description: This study describes sensing of circulating cell-free DNA after stroke as the mechanism leading to recurrent ischemic events.

heading: Glycosphingolipid synthesis mediates immune evasion in KRAS-driven cancer
description: Functional genomics and lipidomic analyses reveal that sphingolipid synthesis is required for tumour immune evasion and tumour growth in vivo, mediated in part by the impact of glycosphingolipid synthesis on cell surface expression of IFNγ receptors.

heading: A virally encoded tRNA neutralizes the PARIS antiviral defence system
description: Structural and functional studies reveal how viral proteins trigger the phage antirestriction induced system (PARIS) to degrade host tRNA and how viral tRNAs suppress the PARIS nuclease and thereby overcome this phage defense system.

heading: A nebular origin for the persistent radio emission of fast radio bursts
description: Observations of a third, less luminous persistent radio source associated with the repeating fast radio burst FRB 20201124A indicate that the burst originates from a young magnetar surrounded by a nebula of ionized gas.

heading: Membrane prewetting by condensates promotes tight-junction belt formation
description: Experimental and theoretical results demonstrate that tight-junction formation depends on the growth of a condensed layer of ZO-1 proteins at the interface of the apical and lateral membrane, providing insight into self-assembly of complex mesoscale structures in cells.

heading: The genomic landscape of 2,023 colorectal cancers
authors: Alex J. CornishAndreas J. GruberRichard S. Houlston
description: Whole-genome sequencing of more than 2,000 colorectal carcinoma samples provides a highly detailed view of the genomic landscape of this cancer and identifies new driver mutations.

heading: PTER is a N-acetyltaurine hydrolase that regulates feeding and obesity
description: The orphan enzyme phosphotriesterase-related (PTER) is identified as a mammalian N-acetyltaurine hydrolase that has roles in regulating body weight and energy balance.

heading: Coevolution of craton margins and interiors during continental break-up
authors: Thomas M. GernonThea K. HincksAnne Glerum
description: By integrating geological observations, statistical analysis, geodynamic simulations and landscape-evolution models, a physical model is proposed to link the coevolution of craton margins and interiors with continental rifting.

heading: Prognostic genome and transcriptome signatures in colorectal cancers
description: A large integrated genome and transcriptome analysis of colorectal cancer identifies prognostic mutations and expression subtypes.

heading: Titration of RAS alters senescent state and influences tumour initiation
authors: Adelyne S. L. ChanHaoran ZhuMasashi Narita
description: Oncogenic RAS dose-escalation models are used to explore how the level of RAS determines whether cells enter a senescent state or have tumour-initiating activity.

heading: Structure of the human dopamine transporter in complex with cocaine
authors: Jeppe C. NielsenKristine SalomonClaus J. Loland
description: A study using cryo-electron microscopy has determined the structure of the human dopamine transporter with bound cocaine, revealing molecular details about neurotransmitter transport and how it is affected by neuropsychiatric drugs.

heading: Teosinte Pollen Drive guides maize diversification and domestication by RNAi
description: An example of hybrid incompatibility between maize and teosinte reveals a selfish toxin–antidote system mediated by small RNAs that may have contributed to the origin of maize.

heading: Highest ocean heat in four centuries places Great Barrier Reef in danger
authors: Benjamin J. HenleyHelen V. McGregorBraddock K. Linsley
description: High ocean temperatures that caused mass coral bleaching and mortality on the Great Barrier Reef in the past decade are the warmest in 400 years and are the result of human-caused climate change.

heading: Unforeseen plant phenotypic diversity in a dry and grazed world
authors: Nicolas GrossFernando T. MaestreYoann Le Bagousse-Pinguet
description: Analysis of 20 chemical and morphological plant traits at diverse sites across 6 continents shows that the transition from semi-arid to arid zones is associated with an unexpected 88% increase in trait diversity.

heading: Neuronal substance P drives metastasis through an extracellular RNA–TLR7 axis
description: Hyperactivation of sensory neurons regulates multiple aspects of metastatic progression in breast cancer.

heading: Single-crystalline metal-oxide dielectrics for top-gate 2D transistors
description: By using intercalative oxidation techniques, stable, stoichiometric and atomically thin single-crystalline Al2O3 films can be produced, which can be effectively used as a dielectric in top-gated field-effect transistors based on two-dimensional materials.

heading: Fully forward mode training for optical neural networks
description: We present fully forward mode learning, which conducts machine learning operations on site, leading to faster learning and promoting advancement in numerous fields.

heading: Molecular mimicry in multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children
authors: Aaron BodanskyRobert C. MettelmanJoseph L. DeRisi
description: A cross-reactive antibody and T cell response is identified in a large portion of patients with multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children.

heading: A spatial expression atlas of the adult human proximal small intestine
description: A comprehensive spatial expression atlas of the adult human proximal small intestine reveals branched villi, immune activation at the villus tip, and a switch of migrating enterocytes from lipid droplet assembly and iron uptake at the villus bottom to chylomicron biosynthesis and iron release at the tip.

heading: ILC2-derived LIF licences progress from tissue to systemic immunity
authors: Mayuri GogoiPaula A. ClarkAndrew N. J. McKenzie
description: Disruption of leukaemia inhibitory factor production from group 2 innate lymphoid cells prevents immune cells leaving the lungs to migrate to lymph nodes, leading to plasmacytoid dendritic cells becoming retained in the lungs following viral infection.

heading: The catalytic asymmetric polyene cyclization of homofarnesol to ambrox
description: The catalytic asymmetric polyene cyclization of homofarnesol to ambrox is achieved using a highly Brønsted-acidic and confined imidodiphosphorimidate catalyst.

heading: Transport and inhibition mechanisms of the human noradrenaline transporter
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the noradrenaline transporter (NET) reveal binding modes of adrenaline, coordination of sodium and chloride ion binding and the binding sites and mechanisms of inhibition by conotoxin, bupropion and ziprasidone.

heading: Dopamine biases decisions by limiting temporal integration
authors: Aditya K. GauthamLauren E. MinerMichael A. Crickmore
description: In Drosophila, dopamine sets motivational state during mating by regulating the integration of competing drives in copulation decision neurons, potentially indicative of a more general role for control over neuronal integration time in the regulation of behavioural decisions.

heading: Histone serotonylation regulates ependymoma tumorigenesis
description: Serotonin has a role in ependymoma tumorigenesis through modifying histones and thereby regulating key transcription factors and activating specific oncogenic transcriptional networks in brain cells.

heading: Molecular mechanism of ligand gating and opening of NMDA receptor
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of NMDA receptors in open and apo states reveal the molecular mechanism underlying the dual ligand requirement for its channel gating and opening.

heading: FANCD2–FANCI surveys DNA and recognizes double- to single-stranded junctions
authors: Pablo AlcónArtur P. KaczmarczykLori A. Passmore
description: FANCD2–FANCI is a sliding clamp that diffuses on double-stranded DNA but stalls when it reaches a single-stranded gap, providing a unified molecular mechanism that reconciles the roles of FANCD2–FANCI in the recognition and protection of stalled replication forks.

heading: Organ systems of a Cambrian euarthropod larva
authors: Martin R. SmithEmma J. LongXiguang Zhang
description: Youti yuanshi is a euarthropod species newly described from a fossilized larva from Yunnan Province, China dating approximately to late Atdabanian stage, Cambrian period, and provides insights into the evolution of arthropods.

heading: Gut microbiota carcinogen metabolism causes distal tissue tumours
description: A study links environmental nitrosamines to bladder cancer through their metabolism by specific commensal microorganisms occurring in the gastrointestinal tract of humans and mice.

heading: The development of terrestrial ecosystems emerging after glacier retreat
description: Across 46 proglacial landscapes worldwide, environmental properties and biodiversity have shown complex patterns of change since glaciers retreated.

heading: High-performance 4-nm-resolution X-ray tomography using burst ptychography
description: X-ray computed tomography is combined with burst ptychography and filtered back-propagation to achieve high-speed, three-dimensional imaging of features as small as 4 nm.

heading: Turbinate-homing IgA-secreting cells originate in the nasal lymphoid tissues
description: Nasal vaccination induces B cell expansion in the nasal-associated lymphoid tissues, followed by homing to the nasal turbinates and glandular acinar structures.

heading: Deep crustal assimilation during the 2021 Fagradalsfjall Fires, Iceland
authors: James M. D. DaySavannah KellyThor Thordarson
description: Using osmium isotopes, the 2021 Fagradalsfjall lavas in Iceland are shown to be both fractionally crystallized and strongly crustally contaminated, probably by mid-ocean-ridge gabbros and older basalts underlying the Reykjanes Peninsula.

heading: Propofol rescues voltage-dependent gating of HCN1 channel epilepsy mutants
authors: Elizabeth D. KimXiaoan WuCrina M. Nimigean
description: Propofol repairs malfunctioning mutant HCN1 channels associated with epilepsy, and its unusual mechanism of action on these ion channels can potentially be exploited to design precision drugs targeting HCN channelopathies.

heading: Immunological memory diversity in the human upper airway
description: This study of immunological memory diversity in the human upper airway provides new understanding of immune memory at a major mucosal barrier tissue in humans.

heading: Passive wing deployment and retraction in beetles and flapping microrobots
description: We find that rhinoceros beetles passively deploy and retract their hindwings without muscular activity, demonstrating this with insect-like microrobots.

heading: Structural switch in acetylcholine receptors in developing muscle
description: Structures of fetal and adult muscle acetylcholine receptors reveal a developmental switch that alters channel biophysics and pharmacology to enable neuromuscular junction maturation, uncovering pathogenic mechanisms underlying congenital myasthenic syndromes.

heading: Partial coherence enhances parallelized photonic computing
description: Two photonic platforms using a convolutional processing system with partially coherent light sources is shown to boost computing parallelism, demonstrated using the classification of gaits of patients with Parkinson’s disease and the MNIST handwritten digits dataset.

heading: Spectroscopic confirmation of two luminous galaxies at a redshift of 14
authors: Stefano CarnianiKevin HainlineChristopher N. A. Willmer
description: JWST–NIRSpec spectroscopic confirmation of two luminous galaxies is presented, proving that luminous galaxies were already in place 300 million years after the Big Bang and are more common than what was expected before JWST.

heading: Spillover of highly pathogenic avian influenza H5N1 virus to dairy cattle
authors: Leonardo C. CasertaElisha A. FryeDiego G. Diel
description: Spillover of the highly pathogenic avian influenza H5N1 virus to dairy cattle and the findings of a clinical, pathological and epidemiological investigation in nine affected farms are reported.

heading: AI models collapse when trained on recursively generated data
description: Analysis shows that indiscriminately training generative artificial intelligence on real and generated content, usually done by scraping data from the Internet, can lead to a collapse in the ability of the models to generate diverse high-quality output.

heading: Blood culture-free ultra-rapid antimicrobial susceptibility testing
description: An ultra-rapid antimicrobial susceptibility testing method is introduced that bypasses the need for traditional blood culture, demonstrating the potential to significantly reduce the turnaround time of reporting drug susceptibility profiles.

heading: Cryo-EM architecture of a near-native stretch-sensitive membrane microdomain
description: Cryo-electron microscopy, in vitro reconstitution and molecular dynamics simulations provide insight into the architecture of a plasma membrane microdomain in yeast, the organization and dynamics of the membrane lipids within this microdomain and how it responds to mechanical stress.

heading: A human autoimmune organoid model reveals IL-7 function in coeliac disease
authors: António J. M. SantosVincent van UnenCalvin J. Kuo
description: A human in vitro model of coeliac disease comprising duodenal organoids that maintain both epithelium and an immune microenvironment finds a previously unsuspected role for IL-7 in gluten-induced epithelial destruction.

heading: Methyl-reducing methanogenesis by a thermophilic culture of Korarchaeia
description: We show methanogenic growth by a member of the lineage Korarchaeia and, following cultivation, methanol reduction to methane using hydrogen as an electron donor, which could be critical for a thorough evaluation of methanogens.

heading: Isolation of a methyl-reducing methanogen outside the Euryarchaeota
description: Methanosuratincola petrocarbonis LWZ-6 is a strict hydrogen-dependent methylotrophic methanogen that does not ferment sugars, peptides or amino acids.

heading: Cultivation and visualization of a methanogen of the phylum Thermoproteota
description: We demonstrate that the ability to conserve energy coupled to methane production is not restricted to the Euryarchaeota and is much more widespread than originally thought.

heading: Deep, hot, ancient melting recorded by ultralow oxygen fugacity in peridotites
authors: Suzanne K. BirnerElizabeth CottrellJessica M. Warren
description: Analysis of peridotites reveals ultralow oxygen fugacity, suggesting that rafts of ancient, ultrareduced mantle were generated by deep melting at high temperatures and continue to circulate in the modern mantle, although they contribute little to modern ridge volcanism.

heading: Global net climate effects of anthropogenic reactive nitrogen
description: A comprehensive model framework is used to estimate the global net direct radiative forcing of anthropogenic reactive nitrogen as being about −0.34 W m−2, which has a cooling effect on the climate.

heading: Jurassic fossil juvenile reveals prolonged life history in early mammals
authors: Elsa PanciroliRoger B. J. BensonStig Walsh
description: Juvenile and adult skeletons of Middle Jurassic Krusatodon from the Isle of Skye, Scotland, show that this mouse-sized mammaliaform had longer development and lifespan than modern mammals of similar mass.

heading: Molecular basis of human noradrenaline transporter reuptake and inhibition
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structures of the human noradrenaline transporter in both the apo state and bound to substrates or antidepressant drugs are resolved.

heading: Shifts in receptors during submergence of an encephalitic arbovirus
description: Knockout studies using CRISPR–Cas9 identify PCDH10 as a selective host cellular receptor for western equine encephalitis virus.

heading: Human TMEFF1 is a restriction factor for herpes simplex virus in the brain
description: A study of two childhood cases of herpes simplex encephalitis shows that TMEFF1 interacts with the HSV-1 cell-surface receptor NECTIN-1, preventing HSV-1 from fusing with the cell membrane and entering cortical neurons.

heading: Single-cell multiregion dissection of Alzheimer’s disease
description: A regional atlas of the ageing human brain—spanning six distinct anatomical regions from individuals with and without Alzheimer’s dementia—provides insights into cellular vulnerability, response and resilience to Alzheimer’s disease pathology

heading: Multi-heterojunctioned plastics with high thermoelectric figure of merit
description: Thermoelectric plastics with a high figure of merit, suppressed thermal conductivity and an enhanced power factor are realized by combining layered and bulk heterojunctions to create a polymeric multi-heterojunction.

heading: A temperate super-Jupiter imaged with JWST in the mid-infrared
authors: E. C. MatthewsA. L. CarterF. Philipot
description: We report on JWST images of a temperate super-Jupiter in the system Epsilon Ind A—a K5V star at a distance of just 3.6 pc—in the mid-infrared.

heading: Neoantigen-specific cytotoxic Tr1 CD4 T cells suppress cancer immunotherapy
description: Type 1 regulatory T cells (Tr1) represent a major obstacle that compromises naturally occurring and therapeutically induced tumour-specific immunity.

heading: Global atmospheric methane uptake by upland tree woody surfaces
description: Studies of in situ woody surface methane exchange in upland tropical, temperate and boreal forest trees find that methane uptake can result in a net tree methane sink that is globally significant and demonstrates an additional climate benefit provided by trees.

heading: peri-Fused polyaromatic molecular contacts for perovskite solar cells
description: A peri-fused polyaromatic core structure is used to produce a relatively chemically inert and structurally rigid molecular contact that improves the efficiency and durability of perovskite solar cells.

heading: Neural circuit basis of placebo pain relief
description: Analgesia from the expectation of pain relief is mediated by rostral anterior cingulate cortex neurons that project to the pontine nucleus.

heading: In vivo interaction screening reveals liver-derived constraints to metastasis
description: Interactions between plexin B2 on hepatocytes and sempahorins on disseminated tumour cells regulate metastatic seeding in the liver.

heading: TMEFF1 is a neuron-specific restriction factor for herpes simplex virus
description: A study identifies TMEFF1 as a neuron-specific restriction factor essential for prevention of replication of herpes simplex virus type 1 in the central nervous system.

heading: SMYD5 methylation of rpL40 links ribosomal output to gastric cancer
description: The lysine methyltransferase SMYD5 and its newly identified substrate ribosomal protein L40 are implicated in the progression of gastric adenocarcinoma, and ablation of SMYD5 prevents metastatic disease in mouse models of this cancer.

heading: Neural general circulation models for weather and climate
description: A hybrid model that combines a differentiable solver for atmospheric dynamics with machine-learning components is capable of weather forecasts and climate simulations on par with the best machine-learning and physics-based methods.

heading: Dopamine-mediated interactions between short- and long-term memory dynamics
