description: In the brain of fruit flies, the mushroom body achieves flexible learning by using interconnected short- and long-term memory units for dopamine-mediated integration of innate valences with learnt valences obtained through experience.

heading: Catalysis of an SN2 pathway by geometric preorganization
authors: Gabriel J. LovingerMarcus H. SakEric N. Jacobsen
description: A small-molecule (646 Da) hydrogen-bond-donor catalyst accelerates the SN2 step of an enantioselective Michaelis–Arbuzov reaction by recapitulating the geometric preorganization principle used by enzymes.

heading: The enduring world forest carbon sink
description: Data from boreal, temperate and tropical forests over the past three decades reveal that the global forest carbon sink has remained steady during that time, despite considerable regional variation.

heading: Symbolic recording of signalling and cis-regulatory element activity to DNA
description: Enhancer-driven genomic recording of transcriptional activity in multiplex (ENGRAM) is used for multiplex recording of the cell-type-specific activities of dozens to hundreds of cis-regulatory elements with high fidelity, sensitivity and reproducibility.

heading: Giant chiral magnetoelectric oscillations in a van der Waals multiferroic
description: Precision measurement of the dynamical magnetoelectric coupling in an exfoliated van der Waals multiferroic shows a giant natural optical activity at terahertz frequencies.

heading: Superconductivity in pressurized trilayer La4Ni3O10−δ single crystals
description: The application of pressure effectively suppresses the spin–charge order in trilayer nickelate La4Ni3O10−δ single crystals, leading to the emergence of superconductivity.

heading: Inhibition of IL-11 signalling extends mammalian healthspan and lifespan
authors: Anissa A. WidjajaWei-Wen LimStuart A. Cook
description: IL-11 is identified as a key regulator of ERK–AMPK–mTORC1 signalling, metabolism, inflammation and age-related disease and lifespan in mouse and human.

heading: An engineered enzyme embedded into PLA to make self-biodegradable plastic
description: Embedding of a new engineered thermostable hydrolase into polymer materials enables the production of biodegradable and home-compostable plastics suitable for industrial packaging applications.

heading: Thresholds for adding degraded tropical forest to the conservation estate
authors: Robert M. EwersC. David L. OrmeCristina Banks-Leite
description: An analysis of the impact of logging intensity on biodiversity in tropical forests in Sabah, Malaysia, identifies a threshold of tree biomass removal below which logged forests still have conservation value.

heading: Adaptation to photoperiod via dynamic neurotransmitter segregation
authors: G. MaddaloniY. J. ChangS. M. Dymecki
description: Changes in day length, conveyed by the preoptic area, drive axonal neurotransmitter reorganization in median raphe dual serotonin–glutamate neurons to regulate behaviour and sleep timing, highlighting a photoperiod-sensitive brain circuit.

heading: A hot-Jupiter progenitor on a super-eccentric retrograde orbit
authors: Arvind F. GuptaSarah C. MillhollandCarl Ziegler
description: The spectroscopic and photometric observations of a high-mass, transiting warm Jupiter, TIC 241249530 b, with an orbital eccentricity of 0.94, provide evidence that hot Jupiters may have formed by means of a high-eccentricity tidal-migration pathway.

heading: Psilocybin desynchronizes the human brain
authors: Joshua S. SiegelSubha SubramanianNico U. F. Dosenbach
description: Healthy adults were tracked before, during and after high doses of psilocybin and methylphenidate to assess how psychedelics can change human brain networks, and psilocybin was found to massively disrupt functional connectivity in cortex and subcortex with some changes persisting for weeks.

heading: A eukaryotic-like ubiquitination system in bacterial antiviral defence
authors: Lydia R. ChambersQiaozhen YeKevin D. Corbett
description: A study reports the structure and molecular mechanism of the Bil anti-phage defence system, demonstrating that it is the closest prokaryotic homologue of canonical eukaryotic ubiquitination pathways.

heading: A holistic platform for accelerating sorbent-based carbon capture
description: A framework that integrates materials, process design, techno-economics and life-cycle assessment can be used to accelerate the development of carbon-capture technology as we aim for a net-zero world.

heading: Identification of plant transcriptional activation domains
authors: Nicholas MorffyLisa Van den BroeckLucia C. Strader
description: A high-throughput yeast-based assay is used to identify more than 1,500 activation domains (ADs) in Arabidopsis transcription factors, and a deep learning approach applied to this dataset can predict AD activity on the basis of sequence features.

heading: Position-dependent function of human sequence-specific transcription factors
description: The effect of transcription factor binding on transcription initiation is dependent on the position of the transcription factor binding site.

heading: Groundwater-dependent ecosystem map exposes global dryland protection needs
authors: Melissa M. RohdeChristine M. AlbanoJohn C. Stella
description: Mapping of groundwater-dependent ecosystems, which support biodiversity and rural livelihoods, shows they occur on more than one-third of global drylands analysed, but lack protections to safeguard these critical ecosystems and the societies dependent upon them from groundwater depletion.

heading: Singular dielectric nanolaser with atomic-scale field localization
description: Singularity enables breaking the optical diffraction limit in a dielectric nanolaser.

heading: Mechanical release of homogenous proteins from supramolecular gels
description: A stiff hydrogel gel is presented that encapsulates and stabilizes proteins without additives or excipients and uses mechanical strain to release them, offering low-cost and versatile delivery of therapies.

heading: Clonal inactivation of TERT impairs stem cell competition
description: Studies in mice show that telomerase reverse transcriptase (TERT) has a role in enhancing stem cell competition that is independent of its reverse transcriptase activity, and promotes chromatin accessibility and activity of the MYC oncogene.

heading: Sources of gene expression variation in a globally diverse human cohort
authors: Dylan J. TaylorSurya B. ChhetriRajiv C. McCoy
description: A new open-access RNA sequencing dataset, MAGE, of 731 individuals across geographically diverse human populations provides a valuable resource to study genetic diversity and evolution and expands the capacity to identify new genetic associations.

heading: Sunlight-powered sustained flight of an ultralight micro aerial vehicle
description: Solar-powered, untethered, sustained flight of an ultralight micro aerial vehicle under natural sunlight conditions is achieved using an electrostatic-driven propulsion system with a high lift-to-power efficiency.

heading: Tubulin code eraser CCP5 binds branch glutamates by substrate deformation
description: Cryo-electron microscopy and X-ray structures of the glutamylation eraser CCP5 in complexes with glutamylated microtubules and tubulin tails show that the substrate backbone adopts a bent conformation that presents the branch glutamate to a substrate-binding pocket on CCP5.

heading: Bacteria conjugate ubiquitin-like proteins to interfere with phage assembly
description: To mitigate phage infection, an antiphage defence system in bacteria conjugates a ubiquitin-like protein to a structural protein of the phage, demonstrating that conjugation of ubiquitin-like proteins is an antiviral strategy conserved across all life forms.

heading: In vivo single-cell CRISPR uncovers distinct TNF programmes in tumour evolution
description: A CRISPR-based strategy for screening genes that affect clonal expansion finds that genes that are frequently mutated in squamous cell carcinoma converge on a TNF signalling module involving macrophages.

heading: Split intein-mediated protein trans-splicing to express large dystrophins
authors: Hichem TasfaoutChristine L. HalbertJeffrey S. Chamberlain
description: A method is developed for expressing large dystrophins to enhance muscle function in mouse models of muscular dystrophy, with potential clinical benefits for numerous disorders caused by mutations in large genes that exceed the adeno-associated virus capacity.

heading: Inhomogeneous terminators on the exoplanet WASP-39 b
description: The atmospheric terminator region of WASP-39 b, a hot gas giant exoplanet, is inhomogeneous, despite past assumptions, with the evening terminator being hotter and thus probably clearer, and the morning terminator probably being cloudy and consequently cooler.

heading: De novo variants in the RNU4-2 snRNA cause a frequent neurodevelopmental syndrome
description: The non-coding RNA RNU4-2, which is highly expressed in the developing human brain, is identified as a syndromic neurodevelopmental disorder gene, and, using RNA sequencing, 5′ splice-site use is shown to be systematically disrupted in individuals with RNU4-2 variants.

heading: The quantum transition of the two-dimensional Ising spin glass
description: We find that, in the quantum transition of Ising spin glass, the closing of the gap at the critical point can remain algebraic by restricting the symmetry of possible excitations, which is crucial for quantum annealing.

heading: A liver immune rheostat regulates CD8 T cell immunity in chronic HBV infection
description: A liver-intrinsic mechanism is presented that suppresses effective anti-hepatitis virus B responses in mice and humans by rendering virus-specific CD8 T cells refractory to activation causing loss of effector functions.

heading: CryoET of β-amyloid and tau within postmortem Alzheimer’s disease brain
authors: Madeleine A. G. GilbertNayab FatimaRené A. W. Frank
description: The in-tissue architectures of β-amyloid and tau pathology in a postmortem Alzheimer’s disease donor brain are determined, showing fibril heterogeneity is spatially organized by subcellular location and suggesting applications to a broad range of neurodegenerative diseases.

heading: Dissociable hindbrain GLP1R circuits for satiety and aversion
authors: Kuei-Pin HuangAlisha A. AcostaAmber L. Alhadeff
description: The neural circuits in the hindbrain that link satiety and aversion are shown to be separate, raising the possibility of developing obesity drugs without the common side effects of nausea and vomiting.

heading: Plasticity in single-crystalline Mg3Bi2 thermoelectric material
description: The thermoelectric material Mg3Bi2 is shown to be ductile in single-crystal form along certain directions, with a room-temperature tensile strain of 100%, which is attributed to the gliding of dislocations.

heading: Plasmacytoid dendritic cells control homeostasis of megakaryopoiesis
description: Plasmacytoid dendritic cells monitor the bone marrow for apoptotic megakaryocytes (MKs) and deliver IFNα to the MK niche, triggering local on-demand proliferation and maturation of MK progenitors.

heading: Brainstem Dbh+ neurons control allergen-induced airway hyperreactivity
description: Mapping a full allergen circuit from the lung to the brainstem and back, repeated exposure of mice to inhaled allergen activated the nuclei of solitary tract neurons in a mast cell-, interleukin-4- and vagal nerve-dependent manner.

heading: Interferon subverts an AHR–JUN axis to promote CXCL13+ T cells in lupus
authors: Calvin LawVanessa Sue WaclecheDeepak A. Rao
description: Insufficient AHR activation has been suggested in SLE, and augmenting AHR activation therapeutically may prevent CXCL13+ TPH/TFH differentiation and the subsequent recruitment of B cells and formation of lymphoid aggregates in inflamed tissues.

heading: Deeper and stronger North Atlantic Gyre during the Last Glacial Maximum
authors: Jack H. WhartonMartin RenoultDavid J. R. Thornalley
description: Analysis of benthic foraminiferal δ18O profiles from sediment cores in two depth transects in the Northwest Atlantic suggests that the subtropical gyre was deeper and stronger during the Last Glacial Maximum compared with today.

heading: Fast-moving stars around an intermediate-mass black hole in ω Centauri
authors: Maximilian HäberleNadine NeumayerGlenn van de Ven
description: Observations of seven fast-moving stars in the central 3 arcsec (0.08  pc) of ω Centauri indicate an intermediate-mass black hole in ω Centauri.

heading: Cellular adaptation to cancer therapy along a resistance continuum
description: Tumour cells adapt to anticancer drug treatments by a series of cellular state transitions, each inducing distinct gene expression programmes and leading to increased drug resistance.

heading: Tumour vasculature at single-cell resolution
description: An atlas of tumour vasculature shows that tumour angiogenesis is initiated from venous endothelial cells and extended towards arterial endothelial cells.

heading: A maternal brain hormone that builds bone
authors: Muriel E. BabeyWilliam C. KrauseHolly A. Ingraham
description: A brain-derived hormone, CCN3, is newly identified to have a role as an osteoanabolic factor to build bone in lactating females and in the viability of offspring.

heading: In situ targeted base editing of bacteria in the mouse gut
authors: Andreas K. BrödelLoïc H. CharpenayDavid Bikard
description: Edited bacteria were stably maintained in mouse gut for at least 42 days following the delivery of a base editor using an engineered phage-derived particle to modify Escherichia coli colonizing the gut.

heading: An enterococcal phage-derived enzyme suppresses graft-versus-host disease
description: An analysis of the intestinal microbiome of people who have undergone allogenic haematopoietic cell transplantation shows that an enzyme derived from a bacteriophage has specific antibacterial activity against Enterococcus faecalis, and suppresses E. faecalis-associated graft-versus-host disease.

heading: Alveolar fibroblast lineage orchestrates lung inflammation and fibrosis
description: In mouse and human, lung-specialized alveolar fibroblasts adopt multiple molecular states that are induced by pro-inflammatory and fibrotic signals and have diverse protective roles against lung injury.

heading: Antiferromagnetic phase transition in a 3D fermionic Hubbard model
description: Antiferromagnetic phase transition is observed in a three-dimensional fermionic Hubbard system comprising lithium-6 atoms in a uniform optical lattice with approximately 800,000 sites.

heading: Phage anti-CRISPR control by an RNA- and DNA-binding helix–turn–helix protein
description: The helix–turn–helix domain of an anti-CRISPR-associated (Aca) protein represses transcription of anti-CRISPR (Acr)-encoding genes and inhibits their translation to protein via distinct binding modes to DNA and RNA, respectively.

heading: Airborne DNA reveals predictable spatial and seasonal dynamics of fungi
description: Using a globally distributed standardized aerial sampling of fungal spores, we show that the hyperdiverse kingdom of fungi follows globally highly predictable spatial and temporal dynamics, with seasonality in both species richness and community composition increasing with latitude.

heading: Single-cell atlas of the human brain vasculature across development, adulthood and disease
description: Endothelial cells from vascular-dependent central nervous system (CNS) diseases reveal reactivated fetal pathways, display common hallmarks of disease — including a partial loss of arteriovenous specification and CNS-specific properties as well as an upregulation of MHC class II receptors — and play a key role in the human brain neurovascular unit across development, adulthood and disease.

heading: Repeated plague infections across six generations of Neolithic Farmers
description: Population-scale ancient genomics are used to infer ancestry, social structure and pathogen infection in 108 Scandinavian Neolithic individuals from eight megalithic graves and a stone cist, showing that Neolithic plague was widespread.

heading: Glutamate acts on acid-sensing ion channels to worsen ischaemic brain injury
description: Glutamate functions as a positive allosteric modulator for acid-sensing ion channels to exacerbate ischaemic neurotoxicity.

heading: Magnetic field expulsion in optically driven YBa2Cu3O6.48
description: A time-dependent magnetic field expulsion was measured in optically driven YBa2Cu3O6.48 above the equilibrium superconducting transition temperature and all the way to room temperature.

heading: Emergence of large-scale cell death through ferroptotic trigger waves
authors: Hannah K. C. CoChia-Chou WuSheng-hong Chen
description: Ferroptosis can propagate across human cells over long distances (≥5 mm) at constant speeds (around 5.5 μm per minute) through self-regenerating waves of reactive oxygen species; such waves facilitate large-scale cell death in the developing avian limb.

heading: Hydrogen sulfide and metal-enriched atmosphere for a Jupiter-mass exoplanet
description: The exoplanet HD 189733b has a metal-enriched atmosphere with the possible presence of H2O (13.4σ), CO2 (11.2σ), CO (5σ) and H2S (4.5σ).

heading: Pathogenicity and transmissibility of bovine H5N1 influenza virus
description: HPAI H5N1 virus isolated from infected cow milk is characterized in mice and ferrets, was inefficiently transmitted in ferrets, and bound to sialic acids expressed in human upper airways, showing features that may facilitate infection in mammals.

heading: Two-dimensional perovskitoids enhance stability in perovskite solar cells
description: We find that 2D–3D perovskitoid passivation applied to perovskite solar cells impedes cation migration and decreases carrier recombination at the interface, providing enhanced operating stability at elevated temperatures and increased power conversion efficiencies.

heading: Geographical migration and fitness dynamics of Streptococcus pneumoniae
description: Mathematical modelling of 15 years of data from South Africa reveals the spread and vaccine-driven changes in fitness and antimicrobial resistance of Streptococcus pneumoniae.

heading: Electron holography observation of individual ferrimagnetic lattice planes
description: The magnetic fields of an individual lattice plane inside materials with a non-uniform structure were observed under magnetic-field-free conditions by electron holography.

heading: Molecular definition of the endogenous Toll-like receptor signalling pathways
description: Myddosomes, in which MyD88 forms barrel-like scaffold structures for effector protein recruitment and activation, contain proteins that act at all stages and regulate all effector responses of the TLR signalling pathways.

heading: Giant stem tetrapod was apex predator in Gondwanan late Palaeozoic ice age
authors: Claudia A. MarsicanoJason D. PardoHelke Mocke
description: A study describes a new giant stem tetrapod, Gaiasia jennyae, from high-palaeolatitude early Permian-aged deposits in Namibia that challenges current hypotheses of early tetrapod evolution.

heading: Human degradation of tropical moist forests is greater than previously estimated
description: A global survey on the magnitude and persistence of moist forest cover change and canopy height following degradation using satellite remote sensing data finds that the effects are substantial and persist for decades.

heading: Targeting pericentric non-consecutive motifs for heterochromatin initiation
description: Zinc-finger proteins ZNF512 and ZNF512B are shown to target pericentric DNA through a conserved mechanism that depends on their atypical long linkers, providing insight into how constitutive heterochromatin formation is initiated across various species.

heading: Narrative cave art in Indonesia by 51,200 years ago
description: A cave art scene at Leang Karampuang, Indonesia, dated to at least 51,200 years ago using laser-ablation uranium-series imaging, depicts human-like figures interacting with a pig.

heading: Spike deep mutational scanning helps predict success of SARS-CoV-2 clades
description: Pseudovirus-based SARS-CoV-2 spike deep mutational scanning is used to measure how mutations across the spikes affect ACE2 binding, cell entry or escape from human sera, producing data that could enable better prediction of viral evolution.

heading: Dirac mass induced by optical gain and loss
description: By using a photonic synthetic lattice, it can be experimentally demonstrated that Dirac masses can be induced by means of non-Hermitian perturbations based on optical gain and loss.

heading: Inhibition of M. tuberculosis and human ATP synthase by BDQ and TBAJ-587
description: Cryogenic electron microscopy structures of Mycobacterium tuberculosis ATP synthase and human ATP synthase bound to the anti-tuberculosis drug bedaquiline or its analogue TBAJ-587 shed light on drug binding and could lead to new treatments for tuberculosis.

heading: Evidence of striped electronic phases in a structurally modulated superlattice
description: Evidence of modulated metallic and superconducting states stemming from an incommensurate structural stripe motif is reported in the bulk van der Waals superlattice SrTa2S5.

heading: Semantic encoding during language comprehension at single-cell resolution
description: By tracking the activity of individual neurons using microarrays and Neuropixels probes, a study examines the representation of linguistic meaning, at the single-cell level, during natural speech processing in humans.

heading: Middle and Late Pleistocene Denisovan subsistence at Baishiya Karst Cave
description: Zooarchaeological and proteomic analyses of bones from Baishiya Karst Cave on the Tibetan Plateau identify a hominin rib specimen, and provide insight into the ways Denisovans interacted with their surrounding environment and made use of animal resources.

heading: Imaging tunable Luttinger liquid systems in van der Waals heterostructures
description: Layer-stacking domain walls in van der Waals heterostructures form a broadly tunable Luttinger liquid system, including both isolated and coupled arrays.

heading: A µ-opioid receptor modulator that works cooperatively with naloxone
authors: Evan S. O’BrienVipin Ashok RangariBrian K. Kobilka
description: A newly discovered negative allosteric modulator of the µ-opioid receptor works together with naloxone to potently block opioid agonist signalling with reduced adverse effects.

heading: The cortical amygdala consolidates a socially transmitted long-term memory
description: Experiments in mice show that brain circuitry centred on the posteromedial nucleus of the cortical amygdala has a key role in consolidating socially transmitted long-term memories.

heading: NBS1 lactylation is required for efficient DNA repair and chemotherapy resistance
description: Lactylation of NBS1 by TIP60 promotes homologous recombination-driven DNA repair and resistance to chemotherapy in cancer cells and links altered cancer cell metabolism to increase genome stability.

heading: Adenosine signalling to astrocytes coordinates brain metabolism and function
authors: Shefeeq M. TheparambilOlga KopachAlexander V. Gourine
description: This study explores how adenosine A2B receptors can act as astrocytic sensors of brain metabolic activity and how cAMP signalling in astrocytes may support core brain functions such as sleep and memory.

heading: 3D printable elastomers with exceptional strength and toughness
description: Three-dimensional photo-printable resin chemistry yields an elastomer with tensile strength of 94.6  MPa and toughness of 310.4  MJ  m−3, both of which far exceed that of any three-dimensional printed elastomer.

heading: An anti-CRISPR that pulls apart a CRISPR–Cas complex
authors: Chantel N. TrostJing YangAlan R. Davidson
description: AcrIF25 inhibits the type I-F CRISPR–Cas system by disassembling its ribonucleoprotein effector complex without an external energy source.

heading: Observation of the scaling dimension of fractional quantum Hall anyons
description: The scaling dimension of fractional quantum Hall anyons shows agreement with expectations following examination of thermal-to-shot-noise crossover measurements by fitting to the predicted finite-temperature expression involving both the scaling dimension of quasiparticles and their charge.

heading: Kinetic features dictate sensorimotor alignment in the superior colliculus
description: Motor units in the superior colliculus of mice exhibit poorly defined representation of static visual fields and instead rely largely on kinetic visual features to link visual inputs to behavioural outcomes.

heading: Chemical reservoir computation in a self-organizing reaction network
authors: Mathieu G. BaltussenThijs J. de JongWilhelm T. S. Huck
description: A chemical reservoir computer based on the formose reaction has been discovered that can perform several nonlinear classification tasks in parallel, predict the dynamics of other complex systems and achieve time-series forecasting.

heading: Molecular basis for transposase activation by a dedicated AAA+ ATPase
authors: Álvaro de la GándaraMercedes Spínola-AmilibiaErnesto Arias-Palomo
description: Solution and cryogenic electron microscopy studies using IS21 as a model transposase system show how AAA+ ATPases induce structural changes to prime target DNA and activate their associated transposases.

heading: Zinc mediates control of nitrogen fixation via transcription factor filamentation
description: Zinc acts as a second messenger in root nodules and regulates nitrogen homeostasis by controlling the transition between the active state and the inactive filamentous state of the novel transcriptional regulator FIXATION UNDER NITRATE (FUN).

heading: TnpB homologues exapted from transposons are RNA-guided transcription factors
authors: Tanner WiegandFlorian T. HoffmannSamuel H. Sternberg
description: RNA-guided transcription factors arose repeatedly via the domestication of transposon-encoded tnpB genes, representing a parallel evolutionary path to CRISPR-Cas adaptive immunity.

heading: Explainable El Niño predictability from climate mode interactions
description: An extended nonlinear recharge oscillator model shows skilful and explainable El Niño–Southern Oscillation forecasts at lead times up to 16–18 months, better than global climate models and comparable to the most skilful artificial intelligence forecasts.

heading: Cenozoic history of the tropical marine biodiversity hotspot
description: A reconstruction of Cenozoic marine biodiversity in the Indo-Australian Archipelago reveals decreasing rates of net diversification and identifies the factors that have established it as the richest marine biodiversity hotspot.

heading: Titanium:sapphire-on-insulator integrated lasers and amplifiers
description: A photonic platform enables miniaturization and scalability of titanium:sapphire photonic technology, reducing footprint and cost by three orders of magnitude.

heading: Synaptic architecture of leg and wing premotor control networks in Drosophila
authors: Ellen LesserAnthony W. AzevedoJohn C. Tuthill
description: We use connectomics to compare the wiring logic of premotor circuits controlling the Drosophila leg and wing, finding that both premotor networks cluster into modules that link motor neurons innervating muscles with related functions.

heading: Buried interface molecular hybrid for inverted perovskite solar cells
description: High efficiency in perovskite solar cells is achieved by using a molecular hybrid of a self-assembled monolayer with nitrilotribenzoic acid.

heading: Megastudy shows that reminders boost vaccination but adding free rides does not
authors: Katherine L. MilkmanSean F. EllisAngela L. Duckworth
description: Contrary to expectations, offers of free transportation to vaccine sites did not increase COVID-19 vaccine uptake more than text message reminders, a finding that has implications for future policy decision-making to promote vaccination.

heading: Connectomic reconstruction of a female Drosophila ventral nerve cord
description: Automated reconstruction of dense neural networks in the ventral nerve cord of the fruit fly provides a resource for investigating the neural control of movement.

heading: Structural mechanism of bridge RNA-guided recombination
description: Using cryo-electron microscopy, the structural mechanism by which non-coding bridge RNA confers target and donor DNA specificity to IS110 recombinases for programmable DNA recombination is explored.

heading: Experimental observation of repulsively bound magnons
description: Comparison of terahertz spectroscopy measurements with theoretical results for the Heisenberg–Ising chain antiferromagnet demonstrates the existence of repulsively bound magnons in large transverse fields below the quantum critical point.

heading: An intermediate Rb–E2F activity state safeguards proliferation commitment
description: Cells actively sense external and internal signals to stay quiescent or proliferate, and this trigger relies on being in a reversible primed G1 state of partial retinoblastoma inactivation and E2F activation.

heading: Hotspot shelters stimulate frog resistance to chytridiomycosis
description: Artificial thermal refugia—sites heated to temperatures higher than that of the surrounding environment—provide a way to protect an endangered Australian frog species from a fungal disease that has caused the extinction of many amphibians.

heading: Measuring gravitational attraction with a lattice atom interferometer
authors: Cristian D. PandaMatthew J. TaoHolger Müller
description: Using an optical lattice to suspend atoms, the gravitational attraction of a miniature source mass can be determined by an atom interferometer with much greater accuracy compared with atoms in free fall.

heading: Unconventional superconductivity in chiral molecule–TaS2 hybrid superlattices
description: By incorporating chiral molecules into conventional superconductor lattices such as TaS2 to form a hybrid superlattice, non-centrosymmetry could be introduced and can be shown to help lead to unconventional superconductivity.

heading: Brain Chimeroids reveal individual susceptibility to neurotoxic triggers
description: An analysis in 3D multidonor Chimeroids—a scalable multidonor human brain organoid model—shows that human genetic background may be an important mediator of neurotoxin susceptibility.

heading: Transposase-assisted target-site integration for efficient plant genome engineering
description: Fusion of rice Pong transposase to the Cas9 or Cas12a programmable nucleases provides sequence-specific targeted insertion of enhancer elements, an open reading frame and gene expression cassette into the genome of the model plant Arabidopsis and crop soybean.

heading: Bridge RNAs direct programmable recombination of target and donor DNA
authors: Matthew G. DurrantNicholas T. PerryPatrick D. Hsu
description: A bispecific non-coding RNA expressed by the IS110 family of mobile genetic elements forms the basis of a programmable genome-editing system that enables the insertion, excision or inversion of specific target DNA sequences.

heading: Oxylipins and metabolites from pyroptotic cells act as promoters of tissue repair
description: Defining the composition of the secretome of pyroptotic macrophages reveals the involvement of the component factors in wound healing.

heading: Drosophila immune cells transport oxygen through PPO2 protein phase transition
description: Drosophila haemocytes collaborate with the tracheal system to reserve and transport oxygen through the phase transition of PPO2 crystals, facilitating internal oxygen homeostasis in a process that is comparable to vertebrate respiration.

heading: Terahertz phonon engineering with van der Waals heterostructures
description: In an application of terahertz phonon engineering, terahertz phonons were generated, detected and manipulated through precise integration of atomically thin layers in van der Waals heterostructures.

heading: Observations of diapycnal upwelling within a sloping submarine canyon
authors: Bethan L. Wynne-CattanachNicole CoutoMatthew H. Alford
description: A dye-release experiment within a sloping submarine canyon provides direct evidence that vigorous mixing at topographic features, such as canyons, leads to rapid diapycnal upwelling of deep water.

heading: Mechanism for the initiation of spliceosome disassembly
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of human and nematode spliceosomes show that the disassembly of this complex is initiated by the licensing of the disassembly helicase to act on the catalytic U6 small nuclear RNA.

heading: No massive black holes in the Milky Way halo
description: The results of the search for long-timescale microlensing events among the light curves of nearly 80 million stars located in the Large Magellanic Cloud indicate that there are no massive black holes in the Milky Way halo.

heading: Water- and heat-activated dynamic passivation for perovskite photovoltaics
description: A living passivation strategy enables dynamic self-healing of perovskite solar cells to ensure device performance and stability on exposure to heat or moisture.

heading: Bound star clusters observed in a lensed galaxy 460 Myr after the Big Bang
description: JWST observations of the Cosmic Gems arc resolve the light of an infant galaxy into five gravitationally bound star clusters located in a region smaller than 70 pc.

heading: An alternative broad-specificity pathway for glycan breakdown in bacteria
authors: Seyed Amirhossein NasseriAleksander C. LazarskiStephen G. Withers
description: A screen of a human gut microbiome metagenomic library reveals a cluster of enzymes with an unconventional mechanism and an extremely broad substrate scope.

heading: Detecting hallucinations in large language models using semantic entropy
description: Hallucinations (confabulations) in large language model systems can be tackled by measuring uncertainty about the meanings of generated responses rather than the text itself to improve question-answering accuracy.

heading: Control of proton transport and hydrogenation in double-gated graphene
description: Independent control of the electric field and charge-carrier density in double-gated graphene allows the decoupling of proton transport and lattice hydrogenation, enabling both accelerated proton transport and proton-based logic operations.

heading: Room-temperature spin injection across a chiral perovskite/III–V interface
authors: Matthew P. HautzingerXin PanMatthew C. Beard
description: By using a chiral halide perovskite material, spin injection at room temperature into a conventional III–V semiconductor multiple quantum well light-emitting diode is demonstrated, resulting in a semiconductor platform that can also control spin.

heading: Tunable superconductivity in electron- and hole-doped Bernal bilayer graphene
description: Tunable superconductivity and a series of flavour-symmetry-breaking phases are observed in electron- and hole-doped Bernal bilayer graphene.

heading: Multiscale topology classifies cells in subcellular spatial transcriptomics
description: A method for topological automatic cell type classification across subcellular resolution spatial transcriptomic platforms is proposed, resolving cell type information and locating sparsely dispersed cells in human kidney and mouse kidney and brain.

heading: Amazon forest biogeography predicts resilience and vulnerability to drought
authors: Shuli ChenScott C. StarkScott R. Saleska
description: Drought response is structured by water-table depth in higher-fertility Southern Amazonia, whereas lower-fertility Northern Amazonia supports more-drought-resilient forests independent of water-table depth.

heading: Single-cell and spatial atlases of spinal cord injury in the Tabulae Paralytica
description: The Tabulae Paralytica, a compilation of four molecular atlases of spinal cord injury, provides a window into the pathobiology of spinal cord injury, establishing a framework for integrating multimodal, genome-scale measurements in four dimensions to study biology and medicine.

heading: Krause corpuscles are genital vibrotactile sensors for sexual behaviours
description: Krause corpuscles of the clitoris and penis are highly sensitive mechanical vibration detectors that mediate sexually dimorphic mating behaviours in mice.

heading: Human SARS-CoV-2 challenge uncovers local and systemic response dynamics
authors: Rik G. H. LindeboomKaylee B. WorlockSarah A. Teichmann
description: A human SARS-CoV-2 challenge study in individuals without previous exposure to the virus or vaccines provides detailed profiles of local and systemic epithelial and immune cell response dynamics over time and infection status.

heading: Atomic dynamics of electrified solid–liquid interfaces in liquid-cell TEM
description: The development of advanced polymer electrochemical liquid cells for transmission electron microscopy allows direct monitoring of the atomic dynamics of electrified solid–liquid interfaces during copper-catalysed CO2 electroreduction reactions.

heading: Computational design of soluble and functional membrane protein analogues
authors: Casper A. GoverdeMartin PacesaBruno E. Correia
description: A deep learning approach enables accurate computational design of soluble and functional analogues of membrane proteins, expanding the soluble protein fold space and facilitating new approaches to drug screening and design.

heading: The mechanism for directional hearing in fish
description: A study demonstrates that the fish Danionella cerebrum is able to discriminate the direction of sound by comparing the relative phase of pressure and particle motion.

heading: Glassy gels toughened by solvent
description: Solvating polar polymers with ionic liquids at appropriate concentrations can produce a unique class of materials called glassy gels with desirable properties of both glasses and gels.

heading: Direct radical functionalization of native sugars
description: A radical-based method for functionalizing native sugars shows a way to remove typical protecting-group manipulations.

heading: dsRNA formation leads to preferential nuclear export and gene expression
description: Antisense RNAs boost gene expression by accelerating the export of mRNA from the nucleus to the cytoplasm through the Dbp2-mediated formation of double-stranded RNAs, which might explain the prevalence of antisense RNAs.

heading: Dynamic stereomutation of vinylcyclopropanes with metalloradicals
description: A Ni(I) metalloradical catalyst enables reversible cis/trans-isomerization of vinylcyclopropanes under chiral inversion.

heading: Harnessing landrace diversity empowers wheat breeding
description: Genomic and phenomic screens of 827 wheat landraces from the A. E. Watkins collection provide insight into the wheat population genetic background, unlocking many agronomic traits and revealing haplotypes that could potentially be used to improve modern wheat cultivars.

heading: Catalytic glycosylation for minimally protected donors and acceptors
description: A glycosylation platform is demonstrated that enables selective coupling between a wide range of unprotected or minimally protected donor and acceptor sugars, producing 1,2-cis-O-glycosides in a catalyst-controlled, site-selective manner.

heading: Hydroamination of alkenes with dinitrogen and titanium polyhydrides
description: A trititanium hydride framework is used to achieve direct hydroamination of simple feedstock hydrocarbons with inert nitrogen gas to obtain the corresponding alkyl amines.

heading: Fabrication of red-emitting perovskite LEDs by stabilizing their octahedral structure
description: Red-emitting perovskite LEDs were fabricated by stabilizing their octahedral structure with a ligand to yield devices with enhanced efficiency, spectral stability and lifetime.

heading: Endoplasmic reticulum–plasma membrane contact gradients direct cell migration
description: The density and size of contact gradients between the endoplasmic reticulum and the plasma membrane control the speed and direction of cell migration by restricting receptor signalling to the front.

heading: Ancient Plasmodium genomes shed light on the history of human malaria
description: Genomic analysis of Plasmodium DNA from 36 ancient individuals provides insight into the global distribution and spread of malaria-causing species during around 5,500 years of human history.

heading: CTLA-4-expressing ILC3s restrain interleukin-23-mediated inflammation
authors: Anees AhmedAnn M. JosephGregory F. Sonnenberg
description: Subsets of ILC3s upregulate the immunoregulatory checkpoint molecule CTLA-4 after stimulation in a microbiota-dependent manner, and advances to support CTLA-4+ ILC3s may represent a treatment opportunity in IL-23-driven chronic inflammation.

heading: Maize smart-canopy architecture enhances yield at high densities
description: A natural mutant of maize exhibits leaf characteristics in line with the ‘smart canopy’ ideotype for high-density planting and boosts yields in large-scale field trials.

heading: The respiratory system influences flight mechanics in soaring birds
authors: Emma R. SchachnerAndrew J. MooreKarl T. Bates
description: An investigation of the subpectoral diverticulum—an inflatable air sac structure between the major flight muscles—in 68 avian species reveals that the respiratory system has a role in the mechanics of flight in soaring birds.

heading: DNA mismatch and damage patterns revealed by single-molecule sequencing
authors: Mei Hong LiuBenjamin M. CostaGilad D. Evrony
description: A DNA sequencing method with single-molecule fidelity detects mismatches and damage present in only one of the two DNA strands with patterns that are both similar and distinct compared to known mutation patterns.

heading: Onset of coupled atmosphere–ocean oxygenation 2.3 billion years ago
authors: Chadlin M. OstranderAndy W. HeardSune G. Nielsen
description: The Great Oxidation Event represents a tipping point in Earth’s O2 mass balance—when more O2 was being produced than destroyed—that forever changed the habitability of worldwide oceans.

heading: Ancient genomes reveal insights into ritual life at Chichén Itzá
description: We present genome-wide data from 64 subadults interred in Chichén Itzá around ad 500–900 that gives insight into burial rituals, and shows that their genomic legacy is still present and has adapted to immune challenges post-1492.

heading: Strand-resolved mutagenicity of DNA damage and repair
authors: Craig J. AndersonLana TalmaneMartin S. Taylor
description: How strand-asymmetric processes such as replication and transcription interact with DNA damage to drive mechanisms of repair and mutagenesis is explored.

heading: Global variability in atmospheric new particle formation mechanisms
description: Molecular-level experiments are described to develop a detailed assessment of 11 new particle formation mechanisms in a global climate model and, in comparison with simulations and observations, the dominant mechanisms worldwide are mapped.

heading: A self-healing multispectral transparent adhesive peptide glass
description: A tyrosine tripeptide was discovered to unexpectedly form a supramolecular amorphous glassy material by constructing a non-specific hydrogen bonding network with structural water molecules.

heading: Experiment-free exoskeleton assistance via learning in simulation
description: A learning-in-simulation framework for wearable robots uses dynamics-aware musculoskeletal and exoskeleton models and data-driven reinforcement learning to bridge the gap between simulation and reality without human experiments to assist versatile activities.

heading: A multimodal generative AI copilot for human pathology
description: PathChat, a multimodal generative AI copilot for human pathology, has been trained on a large dataset of visual-language instructions to interactively assist users with diverse pathology tasks.

heading: Optical manipulation of the charge-density-wave state in RbV3Sb5
description: The charge-density-wave state in RbV3Sb5 can be optically manipulated by applying linearly polarized light along high-symmetry directions, which demonstrates the potential of light as a control knob to manipulate complex quantum phenomena in correlated materials.

heading: Sleep loss diminishes hippocampal reactivation and replay
description: A study of neuronal activity in rats finds that sleep loss adversely affects hippocampal function and memory by dissociating hippocampal sharp-wave ripples from memory replay and reactivation events.

heading: Hybrid working from home improves retention without damaging performance
description: A trial investigating the effects of a hybrid working schedule in a Chinese technology firm in 2021–2022 shows that working from home two days a week improved job satisfaction, reduced quitting and did not affect performance.

heading: Genetic drivers and cellular selection of female mosaic X chromosome loss
description: A large-scale meta-analysis across eight biobank datasets identifies common genetic variants associated with mosaic loss of the X chromosome in female participants.

heading: A two-site Kitaev chain in a two-dimensional electron gas
authors: Sebastiaan L. D. ten HaafQingzhen WangSrijit Goswami
description: We have implemented a two-site Kitaev chain in a two-dimensional electron gas by coupling quantum dots through Andreev bound states in a superconductor–semiconductor hybrid region.

heading: Obesity induces PD-1 on macrophages to suppress anti-tumour immunity
authors: Jackie E. BaderMelissa M. WolfJeffrey C. Rathmell
description: A study demonstrates that metabolic signalling and inflammatory cues associated with obesity selectively induce expression of PD-1 on tumour-associated macrophages to suppress anti-tumour immunity.

heading: Mental navigation in the primate entorhinal cortex
description: Measurements of activity in the entorhinal cortex of monkeys indicate that the recruitment of a cognitive map is a key part of mental navigation, and that cognitive maps can support behavior in the absence of external sensory input.

heading: Inner core backtracking by seismic waveform change reversals
description: Matching seismic waveforms show that the inner core of Earth gradually super-rotated from 2003 to 2008, and then more slowly sub-rotated from 2008 to 2023 back through the same path.

heading: Oligomerization-mediated autoinhibition and cofactor binding of a plant NLR
description: Cryo-electron microscopy reveals that the tomato immune receptor NRC2 forms oligomers to stabilize its inactive state and sequester it from activation, with inositol phosphates acting as immunoregulatory cofactors.

heading: Tunable entangled photon-pair generation in a liquid crystal
description: Electric-field tunable generation of entangled photon pairs is achieved by spontaneous parametric down-conversion in a ferroelectric nematic liquid crystal, with an efficiency comparable to that of the best nonlinear crystals.

heading: Interactions between immune cell types facilitate the evolution of immune traits
description: By profiling immune cell variation in bone marrow of 54 genetically diverse mouse strains and analysing the evolutionary record, we found that genes associated with the frequency of a particular cell type but expressed in a different cell type increase the evolvability of the immune system.

heading: A general strategy for the synthesis of taxane diterpenes
description: We describe a versatile synthetic strategy for making a range of taxanes belonging to the family of anticancer drug taxol using a single precursor.

heading: A virtual rodent predicts the structure of neural activity across behaviours
description: We built an artificial neural network to control a biomechanically realistic virtual rodent, which, when trained to imitate real rats, predicts neural activity and variability across natural behaviours.

heading: Molecular and physiological changes in the SpaceX Inspiration4 civilian crew
authors: Christopher W. JonesEliah G. OverbeyChristopher E. Mason
description: SpaceX’s Inspiration4 mission sent an all-civilian crew into orbit to study physiological, neurovestibular and neurocognitive changes in the astronauts and found that short-duration civilian space missions do not pose a major health risk.

heading: The Space Omics and Medical Atlas (SOMA) and international astronaut biobank
authors: Eliah G. OverbeyJangKeun KimChristopher E. Mason
description: An integrated data and sample repository for clinical, cellular and multi-omics research from diverse spaceflight missions known as Space Omics and Medical Atlas (SOMA) is presented.

heading: Most nearby young star clusters formed in three massive complexes
description: Analysis of data from Gaia Data Release 3 and other large spectroscopic surveys shows that nearly 60% of high-quality young clusters within 1 kpc of the Sun originated from just three distinct star-forming complexes.

heading: Mechanisms of actin filament severing and elongation by formins
authors: Nicholas J. PalmerKyle R. BarrieRoberto Dominguez
description: Cryo-electron microscopy shows five structural states of inverted formin 2 and two of formin diaphanous 1 bound to F-actin, providing step-by-step visualization of the mechanisms of F-actin severing and elongation by formins.

heading: Widespread horse-based mobility arose around 2200 bce in Eurasia
description: Analyses of 475 ancient horse genomes show modern horses emerged around 2200 bce, coinciding with sudden expansion across Eurasia, refuting the narrative of large horse herds accompanying earlier migrations of steppe peoples across Europe.

heading: Unlocking carbene reactivity by metallaphotoredox α-elimination
authors: Benjamin T. BoyleNathan W. DowDavid W. C. MacMillan
description: Metal carbenes are accessed using a metallaphotoredox platform that exploits iron carbene reactivity using readily available chemical feedstocks and α-elimination.

heading: A virally encoded high-resolution screen of cytomegalovirus dependencies
description: A genetic screen that expresses single guide RNA libraries targeting host genes in the human cytomegalovirus genome enables identification of host factors and provides insights into their roles during the viral replication cycle.

heading: A disease-associated gene desert directs macrophage inflammation through ETS2
authors: C. T. StankeyC. BourgesJ. C. Lee
description: ETS2—which is associated with inflammatory bowel disease, ankylosing spondylitis, primary sclerosing cholangitis and Takayasu’s arteritis—is a central regulator of human inflammatory macrophages.

heading: Profiling phagosome proteins identifies PD-L1 as a fungal-binding receptor
description: Proximity labelling of phagosomal contents is used to identify proteins that localize to phagosomes in host–microorganism interactions.

heading: MYCT1 controls environmental sensing in human haematopoietic stem cells
authors: Júlia Aguadé-GorgorióYasaman Jami-AlahmadiHanna K. A. Mikkola
description: MYCT1 is identified as a crucial regulator of cellular properties essential for the stemness of human haematopoietic stem cells, a finding that may help improve successful in vitro expansion of these cells for therapeutics.

heading: Observation of 2D-magnesium-intercalated gallium nitride superlattices
description: The spontaneous formation of magnesium-intercalated gallium nitride superlattices by the interstitial intercalation of two-dimensional magnesium results in considerable compressive strain perpendicular to the layers, leading to enhanced hole transport.

heading: Fault-network geometry influences earthquake frictional behaviour
authors: Jaeseok LeeVictor C. TsaiDaniel T. Trugman
description: Analysis of some of the main fault zones in California shows that the presence of complex earthquake fault-network geometries results in geometric locking that promotes stick-slip behaviour, whereas simpler geometries lead to smooth fault creep.

heading: Injectable ultrasonic sensor for wireless monitoring of intracranial signals
description: A bioresorbable, wireless hydrogel (metagel) sensor, encompassing both biodegradable and stimulus-responsive hydrogels for ultrasonic monitoring of intracranial signals, was implanted into intracranial space with a puncture needle and deformed in response to physiological environmental changes.

heading: A late-Ediacaran crown-group sponge animal
description: Cross-hatch impressions from Ediacaran rocks in China are interpreted as having been left by a crown-group sponge fossil, Helicolocellus cantori gen. et sp. nov., characterized by an organic latticework skeleton.

heading: Myelin plasticity in the ventral tegmental area is required for opioid reward
description: Oligodendrogenesis is shown to be involved in reward learning, with dopaminergic neuronal activity-regulated myelin plasticity being an important reward circuit modification.

heading: Early stages of covalent organic framework formation imaged in operando
description: The operando imaging of the early formation stages of covalent organic frameworks with the optical technique interferometric scattering microscopy leads to mechanistic insights, enabling the rational development of a synthesis protocol at room temperature instead of elevated temperatures.

heading: Nuclear position and local acetyl-CoA production regulate chromatin state
description: Analyses of histone acetylation in Drosophila wing imaginal discs reveal distinct patterns of acetylation and cellular metabolism that affect gene expression and cell specification.

heading: The time between Palaeolithic hearths
description: High-resolution time differences between six Middle Palaeolithic hearths from El Salt Unit x (Spain) obtained through archaeomagnetic and archaeostratigraphic analyses show sometimes decade-long intervals between hearths.

heading: Structure and topography of the synaptic V-ATPase–synaptophysin complex
description: Using cryo-electron tomography and single-particle cryo-electron microscopy of functional synaptic vesicles, a V-ATPase–synaptophysin interface was found to regulate synaptic vesicle biogenesis and alter seizure susceptibility.

heading: Senescent glia link mitochondrial dysfunction and lipid accumulation
authors: China N. ByrnsAlexandra E. PerlegosNancy M. Bonini
description: The authors identify naturally occurring senescent glia in aged Drosophila brains and decipher their origin and influence, determining that they can appear in response to neuronal mitochondrial dysfunction and that they promote lipid accumulation, indicating that these cells link key ageing phenomena.

heading: Descending networks transform command signals into population motor control
description: Command-like descending neurons in Drosophila melanogaster recruit additional descending neuronal networks to co-ordinate behaviours that require multiple motor subroutines controlling numerous body parts.

heading: Large-area, self-healing block copolymer membranes for energy conversion
authors: Christian C. M. SpronckenPeng LiuAlessandro Ianiro
description: We introduce a self-assembly strategy that uses the interface of an aqueous two-phase system to template and stabilize molecularly thin biomimetic block copolymer bilayers of scalable area that can exceed 10 cm2 without defects.

heading: Scaling neural machine translation to 200 languages
description: Scaling neural machine translation to 200 languages is achieved by No Language Left Behind, a single massively multilingual model that leverages transfer learning across languages.

heading: Global shortfalls in documented actions to conserve biodiversity
authors: Rebecca A. SeniorRuby BagwynDavid S. Wilcove
description: A global assessment of conservation interventions for threatened species across a range of data sources finds that interventions for most species remain insufficient or absent.

heading: Epigenetic inheritance of diet-induced and sperm-borne mitochondrial RNAs
description: A study shows that epididymal spermatozoa are sensitive to preconception diet, identifies mitochondrial tRNAs and their fragments as sperm-borne factors and demonstrates epigenetic inheritance of mitochondrial tRNAs.

heading: Microbial competition for phosphorus limits the CO2 response of a mature forest
authors: Mingkai JiangKristine Y. CrousDavid S. Ellsworth
description: Microbial pre-emption of mineralized soil P limits the capacity of trees for increased P uptake and assimilation under elevated CO2 and therefore restricts their capacity to sequester extra C.

heading: Capturing carbon dioxide from air with charged-sorbents
authors: Huaiguang LiMary E. ZickAlexander C. Forse
description: Charged-sorbents are a new class of designer sorbent materials for the capture of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere, and can be regenerated at low temperatures with direct heating generation using renewable electricity.

heading: Companies inadvertently fund online misinformation despite consumer backlash
description: Many companies unknowingly advertise on websites that publish misinformation despite the reputational and financial risks, and increased transparency for consumers and advertisers could counter unintended ad revenue going to misinformation websites.

heading: Single-cell nascent RNA sequencing unveils coordinated global transcription
authors: Dig B. MahatNathaniel D. TippensPhillip A. Sharp
description: Nascent transcription in genes and enhancers genome-wide at the single-cell level is quantified using global run-on and sequencing (GRO–seq) with click chemistry.

heading: Observation of edge states derived from topological helix chains
description: Unusual electronic states derived from topological helix chains were observed that support the emergent bound states in elemental tellurium.

heading: Post-January 6th deplatforming reduced the reach of misinformation on Twitter
authors: Stefan D. McCabeDiogo FerrariKevin M. Esterling
description: Difference-in-differences analysis indicates that the decision by Twitter to deplatform 70,000 users following the events at the US Capitol on 6 January 2021 had wider effects on the spread of misinformation.

heading: Visualization of oxygen vacancies and self-doped ligand holes in La3Ni2O7−δ
description: Direct visualization of oxygen vacancies and self-doped ligand holes reveals the role of ligand oxygen in La3Ni2O7−δ and provides further understanding of superconducting nickelate materials.

heading: Observation of Bose–Einstein condensation of dipolar molecules
description: Bose–Einstein condensate of sodium–caesium molecules is observed by means of evaporative cooling and collisional shielding.

heading: A site-resolved two-dimensional quantum simulator with hundreds of trapped ions
description: In this work, stable trapping of a two-dimensional Wigner crystal of above 500 ions is achieved, and the quantum simulation of 300 ions with individual state detection demonstrated.

heading: Heterogeneous integration of spin–photon interfaces with a CMOS platform
description: A modular quantum system-on-chip architecture integrates thousands of individually addressable spin qubits in two-dimensional quantum microchiplet arrays into an integrated circuit designed for cryogenic control, supporting full connectivity for quantum memory arrays across spin–photon channels.

heading: Transcriptional control of the Cryptosporidium life cycle
description: The transcription factor Myb-M is the earliest determinant of male fate in the parasite Cryptosporidium parvum.

heading: Reproducible graphene synthesis by oxygen-free chemical vapour deposition
description: Assessment of surface contamination shows that trace oxygen is a key factor influencing the trajectory and quality of graphene grown by low-pressure chemical vapour deposition, with oxygen-free synthesis showing increased reproducibility and quality.

heading: The complete sequence and comparative analysis of ape sex chromosomes
authors: Kateryna D. MakovaBrandon D. PickettAdam M. Phillippy
description: Reference assemblies of great ape sex chromosomes show that Y chromosomes are more variable in size and sequence than X chromosomes and provide a resource for studies on human evolution and conservation genetics of non-human apes.

heading: Streamflow seasonality in a snow-dwindling world
description: Analysis of streamflow measurements from 1950 to 2020 across 3,049 snow-affected catchments over the Northern Hemisphere shows that seasonal streamflow occurs earlier in snow-heavy catchments but later in less snowy regions.

heading: Van der Waals polarity-engineered 3D integration of 2D complementary logic
description: We develop a method for high-density vertical stacking of active-device multi-layers, implementing memory and logic functions, using unique VIP-FETs where a van der Waals intercalation layer modulates the p- or n-type nature of the FETs.

heading: A vision chip with complementary pathways for open-world sensing
description: Inspired by the human visual system, a vision chip with primitive-based complementary pathways is developed to overcome the power and bandwidth wall of vision systems, achieving fast, precise, robust and high-dynamic-range sensing efficiently in the open world.

heading: Unlocking bacterial potential to reduce farmland N2O emissions
authors: Elisabeth G. HiisSilas H. W. VickLars R. Bakken
description: A study presents a method to mitigate emissions of nitrous oxide from farmland using bacteria to consume nitrous oxide in soil with organic waste as a substrate and vector.

heading: Structural basis for pegRNA-guided reverse transcription by a prime editor
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the prime editor bound to a prime editing guide RNA and target DNA, in the pre-initiation, initiation and elongation and termination states, provide insights into the mechanism by which prime editing occurs.

heading: Canted spin order as a platform for ultrafast conversion of magnons
authors: R. A. LeendersD. AfanasievR. V. Mikhaylovskiy
description: A study demonstrates a new functionality of canted spin order for magnonics and shows that it facilitates mechanisms for ultrafast nonlinear conversion of magnons.

heading: An alternative cell cycle coordinates multiciliated cell differentiation
authors: Semil P. ChoksiLauren E. ByrnesJeremy F. Reiter
description: A distinct cell cycle redeploys many canonical cell cycle regulators to control the differentiation of multiciliated cells, with the transcription factor E2F7 playing a pivotal part in this modified cell cycle.

heading: A Gram-negative-selective antibiotic that spares the gut microbiome
authors: Kristen A. MuñozRebecca J. UlrichPaul J. Hergenrother
description: Lolamicin, a novel antibiotic developed from a pyridinepyrazole precursor, exhibits potent activity against a broad range of Gram-negative multidrug-resistant clinical isolates, and good efficacy in mouse models of infection without inducing gut dysbiosis.

heading: Nano-achiral complex composites for extreme polarization optics
description: Multilayer composites of 2D nanomaterials manufactured using a layer-by-layer methodology demonstrates strong polarization rotation, mechanical robustness and operational temperatures as high as 250 °C, despite being nano-achiral and partially disordered.

heading: High-resolution in situ structures of mammalian respiratory supercomplexes
description: Mammalian respiratory supercomplexes are imaged in their native membrane environment by in situ cryo-electron microscopy, providing insight into their reactive intermediates and conformational dynamics.

heading: Membraneless channels sieve cations in ammonia-oxidizing marine archaea
authors: Andriko von KügelgenC. Keith CassidyTanmay A. M. Bharat
description: The Nitrosopumilus maritimus surface layer (S-layer) concentrates ammonium ions on its cell-facing side, acting as a multichannel sieve on the cell membrane.

heading: Pro-CRISPR PcrIIC1-associated Cas9 system for enhanced bacterial immunity
description: Comprehensive analyses of Cas9 proteins shed light on the evolution of the CRISPR–Cas9 system, and identify a pro-CRISPR accessory protein in bacteria that boosts CRISPR-mediated immunity by enhancing the DNA binding and cleavage activity of Cas9.

heading: A contact binary satellite of the asteroid (152830) Dinkinesh
description: Observations from the Lucy spacecraft of the small main-belt asteroid (152830) Dinkinesh reveals unexpected complexity, with a longitudinal trough and equatorial ridge, as well as the discovery of the first contact binary satellite.

heading: Selective lignin arylation for biomass fractionation and benign bisphenols
description: By controlling C–C bond formation in catalytic arylation, lignin can be efficiently extracted from biomass and converted into benign bisphenols that can be used as replacements for their fossil-based counterparts.

heading: Work hardening in colloidal crystals
description: Deformation of soft colloidal crystals lead to work hardening, similar to that seen in the deformation of metals.

heading: Molecular basis for differential Igk versus Igh V(D)J joining mechanisms
description: Experiments in mouse models, and in cell lines that only allow primary Vκ-to-Jκ rearrangements, enable characterization of the mechanisms of V(D)J recombination.

heading: Acceleration of radiative recombination for efficient perovskite LEDs
description: A dual-additive crystallization method using PyNI and 5AVA as additives results in highly efficient 3D perovskite films with enhanced photoluminescence quantum efficiencies and external quantum efficiencies, and hence increased LED performance.

heading: Low-latency automotive vision with event cameras
description: Use of a 20 frames per second (fps) RGB camera plus an event camera can achieve the same latency as a 5,000-fps camera with the bandwidth of a 45-fps camera without compromising accuracy.

heading: The sex of organ geometry
description: In fruit flies, three-dimensional organ arrangement is stereotypical, sexually dimorphic and actively maintained by muscle-vessel mechanochemical crosstalk.

heading: Asymmetric hydrogenation of ketimines with minimally different alkyl groups
description: An Earth-abundant manganese catalyst that can hydrogenate imines to amines with high enantioselectivity works even for small differences in the groups on the imine, which is still a challenge for precious metal catalysts.

heading: Stereospecific alkenylidene homologation of organoboronates by SNV reaction
description: We report an SNV reaction, a rare nucleophilic substitution that involves electronically unbiased vinyl electrophiles, which allows the synthesis of cross-conjugated polyenes and bioactive compounds with multi-substituted alkenes.

heading: Mapping model units to visual neurons reveals population code for social behaviour
authors: Benjamin R. CowleyAdam J. CalhounMala Murthy
description: A deep neural network with ‘knockout training’ is used to model sensorimotor transformations and neural perturbations of male Drosophila melanogaster during visually guided social behaviour and provides predictions and insights into relationships between stimuli, neurons and behaviour.

heading: The solar dynamo begins near the surface
description: Simple analytic estimates and detailed numerical calculations show that the solar dynamo begins near the surface, rather than at the much-deeper tachocline.

heading: Life-cycle-coupled evolution of mitosis in close relatives of animals
description: We analyse cell division in ichthyosporeans and find that multinucleated life cycles favour the evolution of closed mitosis, in which the cell constructs a spindle within an intact nucleus.

heading: Natural proteome diversity links aneuploidy tolerance to protein turnover
description: Proteomic data from natural isolates of Saccharomyces cerevisiae provide insight into how these cells tolerate aneuploidy (an imbalance in the number of chromosomes), and reveal differences between lab-engineered aneuploids and diverse natural yeasts.

heading: Covalent targeted radioligands potentiate radionuclide therapy
description: Radiopharmaceuticals engineered with click chemistry to selectively bind to tumour-specific proteins can be used to successfully target tumour cells, boosting the pharmacokinetics of radionuclide therapy and improving tumour regression.

heading: Transcranial volumetric imaging using a conformal ultrasound patch
description: A conformal ultrasound patch can be used for hands-free volumetric imaging and continuous monitoring of cerebral blood flow

heading: Lense–Thirring precession after a supermassive black hole disrupts a star
description: The accretion disk from a star tidally disrupted by a supermassive black hole undergoes Lense–Thirring precession with strong, quasi-periodic X-ray flux and temperature modulations.

heading: Distinct µ-opioid ensembles trigger positive and negative fentanyl reinforcement
description: Experiments using fentanyl treatment of mice show that µ-opioid receptors mediate positive reinforcement in the ventral tegmental area and negative reinforcement in central amygdala, thereby identifying the circuits that lead to opioid addiction.

heading: Adhesive anti-fibrotic interfaces on diverse organs
description: A study shows that implants with an adhesive implant–tissue interface mitigate the formation of a fibrous capsule when attached to various organs in mice, rats and pigs.

heading: Osmosensor-mediated control of Ca2+ spiking in pollen germination
description: Screening in Escherichia coli and biochemical experiments show that in Arabidopsis thaliana, OSCA2.1 and OSCA2.2 function as plant sensors of hypo-osmolarity, utilize Ca2+ oscillations as second messengers and have crucial roles in pollen germination.

heading: Porous isoreticular non-metal organic frameworks
description: The use of computational crystal-structure prediction has enabled the targeted assembly of frameworks of porous organic ammonium halide salts that have many of the qualities of metal–organic frameworks despite containing no metal.

heading: Capturing electron-driven chiral dynamics in UV-excited molecules
description: Time-resolved photoelectron circular dichroism with a temporal resolution of 2.9 fs is used to track the ultrafast electron dynamics following ultraviolet excitation of neutral chiral molecules, which generate chiral currents that exhibit periodic rotation direction reversal.

heading: Structural insights into the cross-exon to cross-intron spliceosome switch
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of cross-exon pre-B and B-like complexes contribute new insights into the molecular mechanisms that mediate the switch from a cross-exon to a cross-intron organized spliceosome.

heading: A whole-slide foundation model for digital pathology from real-world data
description: Prov-GigaPath, a whole-slide pathology foundation model pretrained on a large dataset containing around 1.3 billion pathology images, attains state-of-the-art performance in cancer classification and pathomics tasks.

heading: Imaging surface structure and premelting of ice Ih with atomic resolution
description: Atomic-resolution imaging of the surface structure of hexagonal water ice is achieved using cryogenic atomic force microscopy, providing a molecular perspective on the origin and mechanism of of ice premelting.

heading: Legionella effector LnaB is a phosphoryl-AMPylase that impairs phosphosignalling
description: An effector protein called LnaB from Legionella pneumophila catalyses a unique type of AMPylation, and LnaB and its homologues represent a distinct family of AMPylases with specific structural features.

heading: Acquisition of epithelial plasticity in human chronic liver disease
description: Single-cell RNA sequencing and 3D imaging have revealed the cellular changes and structural reorganization that occur during the progression of human chronic liver disease and as the liver attempts to regenerate.

heading: Observation of a promethium complex in solution
authors: Darren M. DriscollFrankie D. WhiteAlexander S. Ivanov
description: Stable chelation of the 147Pm radionuclide in aqueous solution by the newly synthesized organic diglycolamide ligand is demonstrated and the resulting complex studied, showing accelerated shortening of bonds at the beginning of the lanthanide series.

heading: Metals strengthen with increasing temperature at extreme strain rates
description: Microballistic impact testing at strain rates greater than 106 s−1 shows that pure metals, including copper, gold and titanium, become stronger with increasing temperature.

heading: Monolithic three-dimensional tier-by-tier integration via van der Waals lamination
description: We develop a low-temperature, damage-free process using van der Waals lamination to integrate multiple circuit tiers into a monolithic three-dimensional device, incorporating unique multi-tier functionality and resolving legacy issues with the layering technology.

heading: Electric recycling of Portland cement at scale
authors: Cyrille F. DunantShiju JosephJulian M. Allwood
description: Recovered cement paste can be reclinkered if used as a partial substitute for the lime–dolomite flux used in steel recycling, which can reduce waste and carbon emissions.

heading: Selective haematological cancer eradication with preserved haematopoiesis
description: An antibody–drug conjugate that targets the pan-haematopoietic marker CD45 combined with transplanted stem cells engineered to be shielded from it can eradicate leukaemic cells while preserving haematopoiesis.

heading: Bitter taste TAS2R14 activation by intracellular tastants and cholesterol
description: A cryogenic electron microcopy study of structures of a human receptor for bitter taste finds that cholesterol can activate the receptor, while the tastant molecule acts allosterically on the receptor.

heading: Kainate receptor channel opening and gating mechanism
authors: Shanti Pal GangwarMaria V. YelshanskayaAlexander I. Sobolevsky
description: Structures of the kainate receptor GluK2 with and without concanavilin A and BPAM344 show how these ligands modulate channel activity and reveal the molecular basis of kainate receptor gating.

heading: Molecular mechanism of choline and ethanolamine transport in humans
description: Structural analysis of the human choline and ethanolamine transporters FLVCR1 and FLVCR2 clarifies the mechanisms of transport, the conformational dynamics of these proteins and the disease-associated mutations that interfere with these processes.

heading: Strain-invariant stretchable radio-frequency electronics
authors: Sun Hong KimAbdul BasirYei Hwan Jung
description: Stretchable radio-frequency electronics based on a dielectro-elastic elastomer is demonstrated to be capable of completely maintaining operating frequencies unaffected by strain and shows superior electrical, mechanical and thermal properties compared with conventional stretchable substrate materials.

heading: A warm Neptune’s methane reveals core mass and vigorous atmospheric mixing
authors: David K. SingZafar RustamkulovJeff A. Valenti
description: Observations of the warm Neptune WASP-107b show that the planet has a hot interior with an intrinsic temperature of about 460 K.

heading: A deep catalogue of protein-coding variation in 983,578 individuals
description: A dataset of coding variation, derived from exome sequencing of nearly one million individuals from a range of ancestries, provides insight into rare variants and could accelerate the discovery of disease-associated genes and advance precision medicine efforts.

heading: A high internal heat flux and large core in a warm Neptune exoplanet
authors: Luis WelbanksTaylor J. BellKenneth E. Arnold
description: Analysis of the panchromatic transmission spectrum of the warm, low-density, Neptune-sized exoplanet WASP-107b from instruments aboard the HST and JWST suggests that tidal interaction with its host star led to changes in its atmospheric chemistry.

heading: In vitro reconstitution of epigenetic reprogramming in the human germ line
description: A new strategy that involves signalling-molecule-driven differentiation can induce epigenetic reprogramming of human pluripotent stem cell-derived primordial germ cell-like cells to pro-spermatogonia and oogonia-like cells with massive propagation and high efficiency.

heading: Imprinting of serum neutralizing antibodies by Wuhan-1 mRNA vaccines
description: In mouse experiments and in clinical trials in humans, boosting with Omicron-specific mRNA following immunization with Wuhan-1 spike mRNA results in immune responses focused on conserved rather than variant-specific epitopes.

heading: Evolution of a novel adrenal cell type that promotes parental care
description: The adrenal gland of the oldfield mouse (Peromyscus polionotus) has a recently evolved cell type that promotes monogamous-typical parenting behaviour and is not present in closely related species.

heading: Suppressed thermal transport in silicon nanoribbons by inhomogeneous strain
description: We report on a method for inducing uncontaminated and precise inhomogeneous strain in nanoscale silicon ribbons and its use for determining physical effects in these strained materials, in particular, an increase in the range and control of thermal conductivity.

heading: The rise of baobab trees in Madagascar
description: We carried out genomic and ecological analyses of all eight extant baobab species, providing insights into their evolutionary history and recommendations for conservation efforts.

heading: Arresting failure propagation in buildings through collapse isolation
description: A design approach arrests collapse propagation in buildings after major initial failures by ensuring that specific elements fail before the failure of the most important components for global stability.

heading: Dispersion-assisted high-dimensional photodetector
description: By combining spatial and frequency dispersive thin-film interfaces with deep residual learning, a miniature photodetector allowing the acquisition of high-dimensional information on light in a single-shot fashion is described.

heading: GLP-1-directed NMDA receptor antagonism for obesity treatment
description: Unimolecular integration of NMDA receptor antagonism with GLP-1 receptor agonism effectively reverses obesity, hyperglycaemia and dyslipidaemia in rodent models of metabolic disease.

heading: Photocatalytic doping of organic semiconductors
description: A previously undescribed photocatalytic approach enables the effective p-type and n-type doping of organic semiconductors at room temperature using only widely available weak dopants such as oxygen and triethylamine.

heading: The temperature sensor TWA1 is required for thermotolerance in Arabidopsis
description: TWA1 is a temperature-sensing transcriptional co-regulator that is needed for basal and acquired thermotolerance in Arabidopsis thaliana.

heading: Temporal multiplexing of perception and memory codes in IT cortex
authors: Liang SheMarcus K. BennaDoris Y. Tsao
