heading: Water-responsive supercontractile polymer films for bioelectronic interfaces
description: Water-responsive supercontractile polymer films composed of poly(ethylene oxide) and poly(ethylene glycol)-α-cyclodextrin inclusion complex contract by more than 50% of their original length within seconds after wetting and become soft and stretchable hydrogel thin films that can be used in bioelectronic interfaces.

heading: Evolution of neuronal cell classes and types in the vertebrate retina
description: Single-cell and single-nucleus transcriptomic analysis of retina from 17 vertebrate species shows high conservation of retinal cell types and suggests that midget retinal ganglion cells in primates evolved from orthologous cells in ancestral mammals.

heading: Reconfigurable moiré nanolaser arrays with phase synchronization
description: A reconfigurable coherent moiré nanolaser array based on optical flatbands in twisted photonic graphene lattices enables arrays with phase synchronization and high spatial and spectral coherence across a range of distinct patterns.

heading: Cortical reactivations predict future sensory responses
authors: Nghia D. NguyenAndrew LutasMark L. Andermann
description: Offline cortical reactivations predict the gradual drift and separation in sensory cortical response patterns and may enhance sensory discrimination.

heading: Single-cell analysis of chromatin accessibility in the adult mouse brain
description: An atlas of candidate cis-regulatory DNA elements (cCREs) in the adult mouse brain unravels the transcriptional regulatory programs that drive the heterogeneity and complexity of brain structure and function.

heading: Kerr-induced synchronization of a cavity soliton to an optical reference
description: The passive and electronics-free Kerr-induced synchronization of optical-frequency combs could be used in their control and stabilization and to simplify optical clock systems.

heading: A shock flash breaking out of a dusty red supergiant
description: A type II supernova (SN 2023ixf) was observed in the galaxy M101 at a distance of 6.85  ±  0.15 Mpc, at about 1.0  h after the explosion.

heading: Multiscale stress deconcentration amplifies fatigue resistance of rubber
description: A rubber in which highly entangled long polymers strongly adhere with rigid particles deconcentrates stress across multiple scales, amplifying the fatigue threshold.

heading: Large-scale single-neuron speech sound encoding across the depth of human cortex
authors: Matthew K. LeonardLaura GwilliamsEdward F. Chang
description: High-density single-neuron recordings show diverse tuning for acoustic and phonetic features across layers in human auditory speech cortex.

heading: Molecularly defined and spatially resolved cell atlas of the whole mouse brain
description: A comprehensive cell atlas of the whole mouse brain with high molecular and spatial resolution is generated.

heading: Modelling post-implantation human development to yolk sac blood emergence
description: A genetically inducible stem cell-derived embryoid model of early post-implantation human embryogenesis captures the codevelopment of embryonic tissue and extra-embryonic endoderm and mesoderm niche with early haematopoiesis, with potential for drug testing and disease modelling.

heading: Tumour circular RNAs elicit anti-tumour immunity by encoding cryptic peptides
description: The tumour-specific circular RNA FAM53B is highly immunogenic and can induce anti-tumour responses in mouse models of breast cancer and melanoma, expanding the repertoire of anticancer targets for development.

heading: GDF15 linked to maternal risk of nausea and vomiting during pregnancy
description: Elevated circulating levels of GDF15 in pregnant women are associated with severe nausea and vomiting, and sensitivity to such symptoms during pregnancy is partly determined by prepregnancy levels of this hormone.

heading: The molecular cytoarchitecture of the adult mouse brain
authors: Jonah LangliebNina S. SachdevEvan Z. Macosko
description: To construct a comprehensive atlas of cell types in each brain structure, we paired high-throughput single-nucleus RNA sequencing with Slide-seq, a recently developed spatial transcriptomics method with near-cellular resolution, across the entire mouse brain.

heading: Slide-tags enables single-nucleus barcoding for multimodal spatial genomics
authors: Andrew J. C. RussellJackson A. WeirFei Chen
description: Slide-tags enables multiomic sequencing of single cells and their localization within tissues.

heading: Spread in climate policy scenarios unravelled
authors: Mark M. DekkerAndries F. HofDetlef P.  van Vuuren
description: A Sobol attribution analysis unveils the roles of mitigation targets, model differences and scenario assumptions in shaping climate policy scenario outcomes.

heading: Brain-wide correspondence of neuronal epigenomics and distant projections
description: This study uses epi-retro-seq to link single-cell epigenomes and cell types to long-distance projections for neurons dissected from different regions projecting to different targets across the whole mouse brain.

heading: Inhaled SARS-CoV-2 vaccine for single-dose dry powder aerosol immunization
description: An inhalable, single-dose dry powder aerosol SARS-CoV-2 vaccine shows good storage stability, results in sustained antigen delivery to antigen-presenting cells in the lungs and induces a potent antiviral immune response.

heading: Control of lipolysis by a population of oxytocinergic sympathetic neurons
description: Oxytocin derived from peripheral sympathetic neurons is shown to regulate lipolysis and systemic metabolism.

heading: Base-editing mutagenesis maps alleles to tune human T cell functions
description: Massive-scale mutational screening across 385 genes reveals a wide spectrum of alleles that govern tunable T cell functions, including cytokine production and cytotoxicity.

heading: A unified explanation for the morphology of raised peatlands
authors: Alexander R. CobbRené DommainCharles F. Harvey
description: Physical analysis of processes universal to raised peatlands produces an equation that explains their morphology and carbon storage across biomes, from Alaska to New Zealand.

heading: Prevention of respiratory virus transmission by resident memory CD8+ T cells
authors: Ida UddbäckSarah E. MichaletsJacob E. Kohlmeier
description: Experiments in a mouse model of natural parainfluenza virus transmission show that tissue-resident memory T cells in the respiratory tract have important interferon-γ-dependent roles in protection against and limiting the transmission of viral disease.

heading: A molecular switch for neuroprotective astrocyte reactivity
authors: Evan G. CameronMichael NahmouJeffrey L. Goldberg
description: The authors identify a molecular switch that regulates the balance between neurotoxic and neuroprotective astrocyte populations, with potential application in the treatment of glaucoma and other optic neuropathies.

heading: Cell-type-directed design of synthetic enhancers
authors: Ibrahim I. TaskiranKatina I. SpanierStein Aerts
description: Deep learning models were used to design synthetic cell-type-specific enhancers that work in fruit fly brains and human cell lines, an approach that also provides insights into these gene regulatory elements.

heading: Targeted design of synthetic enhancers for selected tissues in the Drosophila embryo
authors: Bernardo P. de AlmeidaChristoph SchaubAlexander Stark
description: Deep learning and transfer learning were used to design tissue-specific enhancers in the Drosophila embryo that were active and specific, validating this approach to achieve tissue-, cell type- and cell state-specific expression control.

heading: SlyB encapsulates outer membrane proteins in stress-induced lipid nanodomains
description: SlyB, a lipoprotein in the PhoPQ stress regulon in Gram-negative bacteria, forms stable stress-induced complexes with the outer membrane proteome.

heading: Transport and inhibition mechanisms of human VMAT2
description: Structures of human vesicular monoamine transporter 2 in complexes with serotonin and three clinical drugs provide insights into the structural basis for serotonin transport and inhibition of transporter activity by the drugs.

heading: Distinct Hodgkin lymphoma subtypes defined by noninvasive genomic profiling
authors: Stefan K. AligMohammad Shahrokh EsfahaniAsh A. Alizadeh
description: The potential use of circulating tumour DNA in classic Hodgkin lymphoma detection, classification and monitoring is defined.

heading: Bipolar outflows out to 10 kpc for massive galaxies at redshift z ≈ 1
description: An ultra-deep MUSE image of the mean Mg II emission for a sample of galaxies at redshift z ≈ 1 suggests the presence of bipolar outflows on scales of 10 kpc or more.

heading: N1-methylpseudouridylation of mRNA causes +1 ribosomal frameshifting
authors: Thomas E. MulroneyTuija PöyryAnne E. Willis
description: A study demonstrates that nucleotide modifications in mRNA-based therapeutics can lead to +1 ribosomal frameshifting during translation, yielding products that can trigger immune responses.

heading: A novel antidiuretic hormone governs tumour-induced renal dysfunction
description: Experiments using conserved tumour models show that the G-protein-coupled receptor TkR99D in Drosophila Malphigian tubular stellate cells and NK3R in mouse renal tubules link malignant tumours to defective excretory functions.

heading: Biological carbon pump estimate based on multidecadal hydrographic data
description: By using several decades of hydrographic data and an inverse biogeochemical model that implicitly accounts for all known export pathways, a top-down estimate of the strength of the biological carbon pump is calculated.

heading: A genomic mutational constraint map using variation in 76,156 human genomes
authors: Siwei ChenLaurent C. FrancioliKonrad J. Karczewski
description: A genomic constraint map for the human genome constructed using data from 76,156 human genomes from the Genome Aggregation Database shows that non-coding constrained regions are enriched for regulatory elements and variants associated with complex diseases and traits.

heading: TAF15 amyloid filaments in frontotemporal lobar degeneration
description: Cryogenic electron microscopy structures of amyloid filaments extracted from patient brains reveal that the protein TAF15 forms filaments that characterize certain cases of frontotemporal lobar degeneration.

heading: Single-molecule electron spin resonance by means of atomic force microscopy
description: By using a pump–probe atomic force microscopy detection scheme, electron spin transitions between non-equilibrium triplet states of individual pentacene molecules, as well as the ability to manipulate electron spins over tens of microseconds, is demonstrated.

heading: A human embryonic limb cell atlas resolved in space and time
description: Using single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, human embryonic limb development across space and time and the diversification and cross-species conservation of cells are demonstrated.

heading: An IL-4 signalling axis in bone marrow drives pro-tumorigenic myelopoiesis
description: Single-cell transcriptomics studies on human and mouse non-small cell lung cancer and conditional knockout mouse models show that IL-4 from bone marrow basophils drives the development of granulocyte-monocyte progenitors to myeloid cells that suppress antitumour immunity.

heading: Logical quantum processor based on reconfigurable atom arrays
authors: Dolev BluvsteinSimon J. EveredMikhail D. Lukin
description: A programmable quantum processor based on encoded logical qubits operating with up to 280 physical qubits is described, in which improvement of algorithmic performance using a variety of error-correction codes is enabled.

heading: Organ aging signatures in the plasma proteome track health and disease
description: Blood plasma protein data was combined with machine learning models for a simple method to determine differences in organ-specific aging; the study provides a basis for the prediction of diseases and aging effects using plasma proteomics.

heading: Dictionary of immune responses to cytokines at single-cell resolution
description: An extensive global transcriptomics analysis of in vivo responses to 86 cytokines across more than 17 immune cell types reveals enormous complexity of cellular responses to cytokines, providing the basis of the Immune Dictionary and its companion software Immune Response Enrichment Analysis.

heading: Self-assembled photonic cavities with atomic-scale confinement
authors: Ali Nawaz BabarThor August Schimmell WeisSøren Stobbe
description: Silicon photonic nanocavities based on surface forces and conventional lithography and etching are developed, demonstrating pioneering technology that integrates atomic dimensions with the scalability of planar semiconductors.

heading: Reverse metabolomics for the discovery of chemical structures from humans
authors: Emily C. GentryStephanie L. CollinsPieter C. Dorrestein
description: A new discovery strategy, ‘reverse metabolomics’, facilitates high-throughput matching of mass spectrometry spectra in public untargeted metabolomics datasets, and a proof-of-concept experiment identified an association between microbial bile amidates and inflammatory bowel disease.

heading: Hypoblast from human pluripotent stem cells regulates epiblast development
description: Authentic hypoblast cells created from naive human pluripotent stem cells (hPSCs) spontaneously assemble with naive hPSCs to form a three-dimensional bilaminar structure (bilaminoids) with a pro-amniotic-like cavity.

heading: Genetic risk converges on regulatory networks mediating early type 2 diabetes
authors: John T. WalkerDiane C. SaundersMarcela Brissova
description: Integration of multiomics data with functional analysis of pancreatic tissues from individuals with early-stage type 2 diabetes indicates that the genetic risk converges on RFX6, which regulates chromatin architecture at multiple risk loci.

heading: Accelerating ‘Oumuamua with H2 is challenging
Reply to: Accelerating ‘Oumuamua with H2 is challenging
A stable atmospheric-pressure plasma for extreme-temperature synthesis
description: A plasma set-up consisting of a pair of carbon-fibre-tip-enhanced electrodes enables the generation of a uniform, ultra-high temperature and stable plasma (up to 8,000  K) at atmospheric pressure using a combination of vertically oriented long and short carbon fibres.

heading: MSL2 ensures biallelic gene expression in mammals
description: After loss of MSL2, a class of dosage-sensitive genes transitions from biallelic to monoallelic expression, whereby one allele remains active, retaining active histone modifications and transcription factor binding, and the other allele is silenced, exhibiting loss of promoter–enhancer contacts and the acquisition of DNA methylation.

heading: An autonomous laboratory for the accelerated synthesis of novel materials
description: An autonomous laboratory, the A-Lab, is presented that combines computations, literature data, machine learning and active learning, which discovered and synthesized 41 novel compounds from a set of 58 targets after 17 days of operation.

heading: On-surface synthesis of aromatic cyclo[10]carbon and cyclo[14]carbon
description: We provide a modified strategy for the on-surface synthesis of cyclocarbons with 10 or 14 carbon atoms that provides a route for characterizing annular carbon allotropes.

heading: FOXP3 recognizes microsatellites and bridges DNA through multimerization
description: FOXP3 uses the forkhead domain to form a higher-order multimer after binding to TnG repeat microsatellites.

heading: Identification of constrained sequence elements across 239 primate genomes
authors: Lukas F. K. KudernaJacob C. UlirschKyle Kai-How Farh
description: Whole-genome alignment of 239 primate species reveals noncoding regulatory elements that are under selective constraint in primates but not in other placental mammals, that are enriched for variants that affect human gene expression and complex traits in diseases.

heading: A resonant sextuplet of sub-Neptunes transiting the bright star HD 110067
description: Observations of six transiting planets around the bright nearby star HD 110067 show that they follow a chain of resonant orbits, with three of the planets inferring the presence of large hydrogen-dominated atmospheres.

heading: Landscape dynamics and the Phanerozoic diversification of the biosphere
description: A model of sediment flux from the land to the oceans over the Phanerozoic eon explains differences in the fossil records of marine animal genera and land plant genera.

heading: Exploring large-scale entanglement in quantum simulation
description: On a 51-ion quantum simulator, we investigate locality of entanglement Hamiltonians for a Heisenberg chain, demonstrating Bisognano–Wichmann predictions of quantum field theory applied to lattice many-body systems, and observe the transition from area- to volume-law scaling of entanglement entropies.

heading: Associative pyridinium electrolytes for air-tolerant redox flow batteries
authors: Mark E. CarringtonKamil SokołowskiOren A. Scherman
description: The redox behaviour of pyridinium electrolytes under representative flow battery conditions is investigated, offering insights into air tolerance of batteries containing these electrolytes while providing a universal physico-chemical descriptor of their reversibility.

heading: The genetic legacy of the expansion of Bantu-speaking peoples in Africa
authors: Cesar A. Fortes-LimaConcetta BurgarellaCarina M. Schlebusch
description: We gathered genetic data for 1,763 individuals from 147 populations across 14 African countries, and 12 Late Iron Age individuals, to trace the expansion of Bantu-speaking peoples over the past 6,000 years.

heading: Ending extreme poverty has a negligible impact on global greenhouse gas emissions
description: Global emissions associated with the economic growth needed to alleviate extreme poverty are limited.

heading: Scaling deep learning for materials discovery
description: A protocol using large-scale training of graph networks enables high-throughput discovery of novel stable structures and led to the identification of 2.2 million crystal structures, of which 381,000 are newly discovered stable materials.

heading: Pesticide use negatively affects bumble bees across European landscapes
description: Results from 316 Bombus terrestris colonies at 106 agricultural sites across eight European countries find pesticides in bumble bee pollen to be associated with reduced colony performance, especially in areas of intensive agriculture.

heading: mRNA reading frame maintenance during eukaryotic ribosome translocation
description: The accuracy of eukaryotic ribosome translocation relies on eukaryote-specific elements of the 80S ribosome, elongation factor 2 and transfer RNAs, all of which contribute to the maintenance of the messenger RNA reading frame.

heading: Human mobility networks reveal increased segregation in large cities
description: There is extreme socioeconomic segregation in large US cities, arising from a greater choice of differentiated spaces targeted to specific socioeconomic groups, which can be countered by positioning city hubs (such as shopping centres) to bridge diverse neighbourhoods.

heading: Cellular development and evolution of the mammalian cerebellum
description: Single-nucleus RNA-sequencing data from the cerebellum of human, mouse and opossum is used to analyse the developmental dynamics of cell types and states in mammalian cerebellum and provide evolutionary insights.

heading: Evidence for chiral supercurrent in quantum Hall Josephson junctions
description: Ultra-narrow quantum Hall Josephson junctions defined in encapsulated graphene nanoribbons exhibit a chiral supercurrent, visible up to 8  T.

heading: Disease-specific tau filaments assemble via polymorphic intermediates
authors: Sofia LövestamDavid LiSjors H. W. Scheres
description: A time-resolved cryogenic electron microscopy analysis provides structural information on the processes of primary and secondary nucleation of tau amyloid formation, with implications for the development of new therapies.

heading: Cascaded compression of size distribution of nanopores in monolayer graphene
description: Cascaded compression, in which nanopores are compressed by cycles of shrinkage and expansion, is described, leading tohigh-density nanopores in monolayer graphene with a narrow pore-size distribution, left skewness and ultrasmall tail deviation.

heading: A probable Keplerian disk feeding an optically revealed massive young star
authors: Anna F. McLeodPamela D. KlaassenAdam Ginsburg
description: The authors suggest that a probable Keplerian disk is feeding an optically revealed massive young stellar object in the Large Magellanic Cloud.

heading: Remote collaboration fuses fewer breakthrough ideas
description: Analysis of research articles and patent applications shows that members of teams that collaborate remotely are less likely to make breakthrough discoveries than members of on-site teams.

heading: HIV-1 Env trimers asymmetrically engage CD4 receptors in membranes
description: HIV-1 Env trimers bound to one, two and three CD4 molecules are observed at membrane–membrane interfaces between HIV-1 and CD4-decorated virus-like particles.

heading: Sequential appetite suppression by oral and visceral feedback to the brainstem
authors: Truong LyJun Y. OhZachary A. Knight
description: Genetically distinct neural circuits in the caudal brainstem receive feedback from the mouth and gut to regulate feeding behaviour on short and long timescales.

heading: Structural insights into intron catalysis and dynamics during splicing
description: Analysis of the group II intron ribonucleoprotein shows the molecular interactions involved in branchpoint adenosine recognition, lariat formation and exon ligation, providing clues to the evolutionary conservation of structural components and catalytic mechanisms in premessenger RNA splicing.

heading: Phages overcome bacterial immunity via diverse anti-defence proteins
description: A study reports the discovery and characterization of four distinct families of phage-encoded anti-defence proteins that inhibit a variety of bacterial defence systems.

heading: Repeated Omicron exposures override ancestral SARS-CoV-2 immune imprinting
description: Exposure to early variants of SARS-CoV-2 results in immune imprinting in mouse models and in humans, reducing neutralizing antibody titres against Omicron variants, which could be mitigated with multiple updated boosters.

heading: Trans-vaccenic acid reprograms CD8+ T cells and anti-tumour immunity
description: A screen of nutrient-derived compounds identified trans-vaccenic acid as a promoter of effector T cell function, and functional assays demonstrate that this occurs via inactivation of GPR43 on T cells.

heading: Porin-independent accumulation in Pseudomonas enables antibiotic discovery
authors: Emily J. GeddesMorgan K. GuggerPaul J. Hergenrother
description: We use a whole-cell accumulation assay to assess the ability of non-antibiotic, structurally diverse small molecules to accumulate in Pseudomonas aeruginosa, with potential application in developing drugs to target this pathogen.

heading: Structural basis of Gabija anti-phage defence and viral immune evasion
authors: Sadie P. AntineAlex G. JohnsonPhilip J. Kranzusch
description: X-ray crystallography, cryo-EM and biochemical analysis provide insight into the assembly of the bacterial Gabija complex, an anti-phage system, and reveal how viruses can evade this defence mechanism.

heading: Imaging quantum oscillations and millitesla pseudomagnetic fields in graphene
description: Imaging of quantum oscillations in Bernal-stacked trilayer graphene with dual gates enables high-precision reconstruction of the highly tunable bands and reveals naturally occurring pseudomagnetic fields as low as 1 mT corresponding to graphene twisting by 1 millidegree.

heading: Structural insights into cytokine cleavage by inflammatory caspase-4
description: The human lipopolysaccharide receptor caspase-4 captures its cytokine substrate pro-IL-18 via a mechanism that is distinct from known caspase–substrate interactions, leading to inflammasome-independent IL-18 release from macrophages.

heading: Recognition and maturation of IL-18 by caspase-4 noncanonical inflammasome
description: Activated human caspase-4 directly and efficiently processes IL-18 in vitro and during bacterial infections, cleaving the same tetrapeptide site in pro-IL-18 as caspase-1.

heading: Epithelial IFNγ signalling and compartmentalized antigen presentation orchestrate gut immunity
description: IFNγ signalling in epithelial cells promotes antigen presentation that confers intra-epithelial T cells the ability to limit extracellular ATP and consequent NLRP3 inflammasome activation, controlling pathogenic transformation of CD4+ T cells that promotes colitis and colorectal cancer in mouse models.

heading: Intermediate conformations of CD4-bound HIV-1 Env heterotrimers
authors: Kim-Marie A. DamChengcheng FanPamela J. Bjorkman
description: Single-particle cryo-electron microscopy structures of HIV-1 envelope (Env) trimers bound to one or two CD4 receptors identify intermediate Env conformations that precede host–virus fusion and inform the design of therapeutics to prevent HIV-1 infection.

heading: Hopfion rings in a cubic chiral magnet
authors: Fengshan ZhengNikolai S. KiselevRafal E. Dunin-Borkowski
description: Transmission electron microscopy is used to observe three-dimensional topological solitons known as hopfions that in a chiral magnet are found to form rings around skyrmion strings, and a nucleation protocol for these rings is provided.

heading: Autoimmune amelogenesis imperfecta in patients with APS-1 and coeliac disease
authors: Yael GruperAnette S. B. WolffJakub Abramson
description: A large fraction of patients with APS-1 and coeliac disease develop enamel dystrophy, characterized by the presence of autoantibodies against the enamel matrix, which are generated through the breakdown of either central (APS-1) or peripheral (coeliac) tolerance to a battery of ameloblast-sepecific proteins.

heading: Genetic continuity and change among the Indigenous peoples of California
description: Genome-wide analyses of ancient DNA from individuals from California and Mexico shed light on the spread of Mexican ancestry to California and how it correlates with linguistic flow.

heading: Aligning climate scenarios to emissions inventories shifts global benchmarks
description: Aligning the IPCC-assessed mitigation pathways with the national greenhouse gas inventories shows that key global mitigation benchmarks become harder to achieve, requiring achieving earlier net-zero and lower cumulative emissions.

heading: Methane throughout the atmosphere of the warm exoplanet WASP-80b
authors: Taylor J. BellLuis WelbanksJohn A. Stansberry
description: Transmission and emission spectra of the 825 K warm Jupiter WASP-80b taken with the NIRCam instrument of the JWST show strong evidence of CH4 at greater than 6σ significance

heading: Single-cell, whole-embryo phenotyping of mammalian developmental disorders
description: A study reports single-cell RNA-sequencing profiles for more than 1.6 million cell nuclei from 101 whole mouse embryos including 22 mutant and 4 wild-type genotypes, from one experiment.

heading: Bacterial cGAS senses a viral RNA to initiate immunity
authors: Dalton V. BanhCameron G. RobertsLuciano A. Marraffini
description: Staphylococcus CdnE03 cyclase recognizes structured RNA molecules produced by staphylococcal phages, triggering cyclic oligonucleotide production and, thereby, bacterial cell death—a mechanism of antiviral defence conserved across domains of life.

heading: Imaging inter-valley coherent order in magic-angle twisted trilayer graphene
description: Scanning tunnelling microscopy imaging of the correlated phases of magic-angle twisted trilayer graphene shows marked signatures of interaction-driven spatial symmetry breaking.

heading: The social and structural architecture of the yeast protein interactome
description: A protein interaction network constructed with data from high-throughput affinity enrichment coupled to mass spectrometry provides a highly saturated yeast interactome with 31,004 interactions, including low-abundance complexes, membrane protein complexes and non-taggable protein complexes.

heading: Kinetic magnetism in triangular moiré materials
description: Minimization of kinetic energy leads to ferromagnetic correlations between itinerant electrons in MoSe2/WS2 moiré lattices even in the absence of exchange interactions.

heading: Embryo-scale reverse genetics at single-cell resolution
authors: Lauren M. SaundersSanjay R. SrivatsanCole Trapnell
description: We present the ‘zebrafish single-cell atlas of perturbed embryos’, single-cell trancriptomic data of developing zebrafish embryos across various timepoints and with genetic perturbations.

heading: Minutes-duration optical flares with supernova luminosities
authors: Anna Y. Q. HoDaniel A. PerleyWeiKang Zheng
description: Observations of optical flares from AT2022tsd (the ‘Tasmanian Devil’) show that they have durations on the timescale of minutes, occur over a period of months, are highly energetic, are probably nonthermal and have supernova luminosities.

heading: CD201+ fascia progenitors choreograph injury repair
description: Spatiotemporal regulation of wound healing in mice and humans occurs via retinoic acid and hypoxia signalling, which regulate the differentiation of CD201+ fibroblast progenitors into proinflammatory and myofibroblast states.

heading: Quantum gas mixtures and dual-species atom interferometry in space
authors: Ethan R. ElliottDavid C. AvelineJason R. Williams
description: Using upgraded hardware of the multiuser Cold Atom Lab (CAL) aboard the International Space Station (ISS), Bose–Einstein condensates (BECs) of two atomic isotopes are simultaneously created and used to demonstrate interspecies interactions and dual species atom interferometry in space.

heading: Potentiating glymphatic drainage minimizes post-traumatic cerebral oedema
description: Acute oedema after traumatic brain injury is accompanied by the suppression of glymphatic and lymphatic fluid flow due to excessive systemic release of noradrenaline.

heading: Dynamic diagnosis of metamaterials through laser-induced vibrational signatures
description: A high-throughput, non-contact framework is described that uses the laser-induced vibrational signatures of metamaterials to non-destructively quantify their omnidirectional elastic information, dynamic linear properties, damping properties and defects.

heading: Quasi-experimental evaluation of a nationwide diabetes prevention programme
description: Analysis of the largest behaviour change programme for prediabetes globally provides causal evidence that lifestyle advice and counselling implemented at scale can improve key cardiovascular risk factors.

heading: Illuminating protein space with a programmable generative model
description: Evolution has produced a range of diverse proteins, and now a generative model called Chroma can expand that set by allowing the user to design new proteins and protein complexes with desired properties and functions.

heading: Aligned grains and scattered light found in gaps of planet-forming disk
authors: Ian W. StephensZhe-Yu Daniel LinRyo Tazaki
description: Deep, high-resolution polarization observations of HL Tau at 870  µm show gaps that have polarization angles with a notable azimuthal component and a higher polarization fraction than the rings.

heading: Stress granules plug and stabilize damaged endolysosomal membranes
description: Stress granules function at sites of intracellular membrane damage by forming on and stabilizing the ruptured membrane and promoting membrane repair.

heading: SO2, silicate clouds, but no CH4 detected in a warm Neptune
description: The JWST MIRI transmission spectrum of WASP-107b, a transiting planet with Neptune-like mass and Jupiter-like radius, shows observations of sulfur dioxide and silicate clouds but no methane in its atmosphere, providing evidence of disequilibrium chemistry and active photochemistry.

heading: Single-cell CRISPR screens in vivo map T cell fate regulomes in cancer
description: Analyses of causal gene regulatory networks have identified key checkpoints mediating the progressive differentiation of CD8+ cytotoxic T cells, findings that have implications for anticancer immunotherapies such as adoptive cell therapy and immune checkpoint blockade.

heading: Clostridioides difficile ferrosome organelles combat nutritional immunity
description: Ferrosome organelles produced by Clostridioides difficile are required to support colonization of the inflamed gut, highlighting the potential of targeting ferrosome formation as an antimicrobial strategy against this important pathogen.

heading: Ultralow-resistance electrochemical capacitor for integrable line filtering
description: A miniaturized narrow-channel in-plane electrochemical capacitor shows drastically reduced ionic resistances within both the electrode material and the electrolyte and an ultrahigh areal capacitance by downscaling the channel width with femtosecond-laser scribing.

heading: The extracellular matrix dictates regional competence for tumour initiation
description: Experiments in mice show that expression of the oncogene SmoM2 induces basal cell carcinoma in the ear epidermis but not in the back skin, and that this difference in susceptibility is regulated by the extracellular matrix.

heading: Vision-controlled jetting for composite systems and robots
authors: Thomas J. K. BuchnerSimon RoglerRobert K. Katzschmann
description: We have developed an automated and high-throughput, three-dimensional, vision-controlled inkjet deposition process that enables the high-resolution, contactless printing of a range of materials with varying elastic moduli to create complex structures and robots.

heading: Stepwise requirements for polymerases δ and θ in theta-mediated end joining
description: Polymerase delta is required for multiple steps in polymerase theta-dependent repair of chromosome breaks, a pathway targeted in cancer therapy.

heading: Trait-based sensitivity of large mammals to a catastrophic tropical cyclone
authors: Reena H. WalkerMatthew C. HutchinsonRyan A. Long
description: A study that tracked mammal populations before, during and after a severe storm in Mozambique’s Gorongosa National Park finds that behavioural responses and survival are linked to body size, with increased mortality of small species owing to limited mobility and changes in food availability.

heading: Computational prediction of complex cationic rearrangement outcomes
description: Computers equipped with a comprehensive knowledge-base of mechanistic steps augmented by physical-organic chemistry rules, as well as quantum mechanical and kinetic calculations, can use a reaction-network approach to analyse the mechanisms of cationic rearrangements.

heading: Continuous symmetry breaking in a trapped-ion spin chain
description: A one-dimensional trapped-ion quantum simulator with up to 23 spins is used to demonstrate a continuous symmetry-breaking phase that relies on long-range interactions.

heading: Integrated global assessment of the natural forest carbon potential
authors: Lidong MoConstantin M. ZohnerThomas W. Crowther
description: Analysis of ground-sourced and satellite-derived models reveals a global forest carbon potential of 226 Gt outside agricultural and urban lands, with a difference of only 12% across these modelling approaches.

heading: Predicting multiple conformations via sequence clustering and AlphaFold2
description: An analysis of the evolutionary distribution of predicted structures for the metamorphic protein KaiB using AF-Cluster reveals that both conformations of KaiB were distributed in clusters across the KaiB family.

heading: Phosphorus-bearing molecules PO and PN at the edge of the Galaxy
authors: L. A. KoelemayK. R. GoldL. M. Ziurys
description: We report the presence of gas-phase phosphorous at the edge of the Galaxy and suggest it is produced by neutron-capture processes in lower mass asymptotic giant branch stars.

heading: Tuning sterol extraction kinetics yields a renal-sparing polyene antifungal
authors: Arun MajiCorinne P. SoutarMartin D. Burke
description: A study reports the development of a structural derivative of amphotericin B with broad antifungal activity in mice but without the renal toxicity associated with amphotericin B.

heading: Neural landscape diffusion resolves conflicts between needs across time
description: Behavioural and electrophysiological studies in simultaneously thirsty and hungry mice reveal a neural basis for resolving conflicts between needs, in which choices are guided by a persistent and distributed neural goal state that undergoes spontaneous transitions between goals.

heading: Targeting of intracellular oncoproteins with peptide-centric CARs
authors: Mark YarmarkovichQuinlen F. MarshallJohn M. Maris
description: Peptide-centric chimeric antigen receptors (PC-CARs) provide a platform to address the challenges involved in targeting intracellular oncoproteins, and PC-CARs based on the neuroblastoma-dependency gene PHOX2B induce elimination of aggressive tumors.

heading: m1A in CAG repeat RNA binds to TDP-43 and induces neurodegeneration
description: TDP-43 binds to N1-methyladenosine on CAG repeat RNA, resulting in the formation of gel-like TDP-43 aggregates in the cytoplasm that resemble those observed in neurological disease pathology.

heading: Three-dimensional flat bands in pyrochlore metal CaNi2
authors: Joshua P. WakefieldMingu KangJoseph G. Checkelsky
description: Angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy of CaNi2 shows a band with vanishing dispersion across the full 3D Brillouin zone that is identified with the pyrochlore flat band as well as two additional flat bands that arise from multi-orbital interference of Ni d-electrons.

heading: Observing the primary steps of ion solvation in helium droplets
authors: Simon H. AlbrechtsenConstant A. SchouderHenrik Stapelfeldt
description: The initial steps of the ion solvation process are observed for the solvation of a single sodium ion in liquid helium, opening possibilities for benchmarking theoretical descriptions of ion solvation.

heading: Latent human herpesvirus 6 is reactivated in CAR T cells
authors: Caleb A. LareauYajie YinAnsuman T. Satpathy
description: Genomics analyses reveal that in vitro culture of CAR T cells can lead to reactivation of a latent herpesvirus, which might be involved in complications in patients receiving associated cell therapies.

heading: Single-molecule dynamics show a transient lipopolysaccharide transport bridge
description: As well as being the substrate for the lipopolysaccharide transport protein complex comprising LptA–G, lipopolysaccharide binding to Lpt proteins promotes their assembly into a bridge linking the inner and outer membranes of Gram-negative bacteria.

heading: Asymmetric distribution of parental H3K9me3 in S phase silences L1 elements
description: The epigenetic modification H3K9me3 is asymmetrically partitioned at long interspersed nuclear element retrotransposons for their silencing in S phase, a newly discovered mechanism that is mediated by the HUSH complex and the DNA polymerase Pol ε.

heading: Plant carbonic anhydrase-like enzymes in neuroactive alkaloid biosynthesis
authors: Ryan S. NettYaereen DhoElizabeth S. Sattely
description: We show how neuroactive alkaloids from clubmosses are biosynthesized, which reveals an unexpected role for carbonic anhydrase-like enzymes in alkaloid scaffold formation.

heading: A Milky Way-like barred spiral galaxy at a redshift of 3
authors: Luca CostantinPablo G. Pérez-GonzálezL. Y. Aaron Yung
description: We report observations of ceers-2112 that show that this galaxy, at a redshift of 3, unexpectedly has a barred spiral structure.

heading: TNRC18 engages H3K9me3 to mediate silencing of endogenous retrotransposons
description: Trinucleotide-repeat-containing 18 (TNRC18), which has poorly understood functions, is now identified as an H3K9me3-specific reader that silences endogenous retroviruses.

heading: Preserved neural dynamics across animals performing similar behaviour
authors: Mostafa SafaieJoanna C. ChangJuan A. Gallego
description: Recordings of neural populations from motor cortex and striatum spanning monkeys and mice demonstrate that neural dynamics in individuals from the same species are preserved when they perform similar behaviour.

heading: Predicting crystal form stability under real-world conditions
authors: Dzmitry FirahaYifei Michelle LiuMarcus A. Neumann
description: Accuracy of free-energy calculations can be improved by constructing an experimental benchmark for solid–solid free-energy differences, quantifying statistical errors for the computed free energies and placing both hydrate and anhydrate crystal structures on the same energy landscape.

heading: An evolutionary continuum from nucleated dwarf galaxies to star clusters
description: In the Virgo galaxy cluster, we identified a continuum of objects that maps the morphological transition between nucleated dwarf galaxies and ultra-compact dwarf galaxies (UCDs), providing evidence for the formation of UCDs through tidal stripping of ancient dwarf galaxies.

heading: Aspartate all-in-one doping strategy enables efficient all-perovskite tandems
description: AspCl doping in Sn–Pb perovskite solar cells improves their performance and stability.

heading: Functional composites by programming entropy-driven nanosheet growth
description: Following a micro-then-nano growth sequence to fabricate composites that are blends of block-copolymer-based supramolecules, small molecules and nanoparticles shows that high-performance barrier materials can be manufactured by means of entropy-driven assembly.

heading: Autoantibodies against type I IFNs in humans with alternative NF-κB pathway deficiency
authors: Tom Le VoyerAudrey V. ParentAnne Puel
description: Inborn errors of the alternative NF-κB pathway in humans impair the development of AIRE-expressing medullary thymic epithelial cells, thereby underlying the production of autoantibodies against type I IFNs and predisposition to viral diseases

heading: Revising the global biogeography of annual and perennial plants
description: The prevalence of annual plants worldwide rises in response to hot-dry summers, year-to-year variations, and disturbances, potentially impacting the future of ecosystem services provided by perennials.

heading: Deconstruction of rheumatoid arthritis synovium defines inflammatory subtypes
description: Single-cell transcriptomic and proteomic data from synovial tissue from individuals with rheumatoid arthritis classify patients into groups based on abundance of cell states that can provide insights into pathology and predict individual treatment responses.

heading: Recognition of methamphetamine and other amines by trace amine receptor TAAR1
description: We report on the structures of the TAAR1–G-protein complex when bound to methamphetamine and other amines.

heading: Ligand recognition and G-protein coupling of trace amine receptor TAAR1
description: TAAR1 has a rigid consensus binding motif that binds to endogenous trace amine stimuli as well as two extended binding pockets that accommodate diverse chemotypes.

heading: 15NH3 in the atmosphere of a cool brown dwarf
description: Observations from the JWST MIRI showed the detection of 14NH3 and 15NH3 isotopologues in the atmosphere of a cool brown dwarf, along with a 14N/15N value consistent with star-like formation by gravitational collapse.

heading: Carbon-to-nitrogen single-atom transmutation of azaarenes
description: A new type of transformation converting a heteroaromatic carbon atom into a nitrogen atom, turning quinolines into quinazolines to enable manipulation of molecular properties, is reported.

heading: Injectable tissue prosthesis for instantaneous closed-loop rehabilitation
description: An injectable hydrogel for use as a scaffold to aid tissue repair is described, the material of which is conductive so that it can be used both for electrophysiological measurement and electrostimulation in closed-loop robot-assisted rehabilitation.

heading: Epigenetic regulation during cancer transitions across 11 tumour types
description: A pan-cancer epigenetic and transcriptomic atlas identifies epigenetic drivers associated with cancer transitions.

heading: Glioma synapses recruit mechanisms of adaptive plasticity
description: In glioma, malignant synapses hijack mechanisms of synaptic plasticity to increase glutamate-dependent currents in tumour cells and the formation of neuron–glioma synapses, thereby promoting tumour proliferation and progression.

heading: iPS-cell-derived microglia promote brain organoid maturation via cholesterol transfer
description: The authors seek to understand the precise roles of microglia in the early human brain by coculturing brain organoids with primitive-like macrophages generated from the same human induced pluripotent stem cells (iMac).

heading: Mechanisms of neurotransmitter transport and drug inhibition in human VMAT2
description: Structures of a vesicular monoamine transporter in complex with drugs and substrate provide insights into the physiology and pharmacology of neurotransmitter packaging.

heading: Homogenizing out-of-plane cation composition in perovskite solar cells
description: We added out-of-plane cations to homogenize the distribution of cations in perovskite films, resulting in a solar cell with improved efficiency and stability.

heading: IL-1β+ macrophages fuel pathogenic inflammation in pancreatic cancer
description: Single-cell and spatial gene expression analyses of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma uncover a population of interleukin-1β-expressing macrophages that drive inflammatory reprogramming of neighboring tumour cells leading to disease progression and poor prognosis for patients.

heading: Molecular evidence of anteroposterior patterning in adult echinoderms
description: RNA tomography and in situ hybridization in echinoderms suggest a new ambulacral-anterior model to relate echinoderm pentaradial symmetry to the ancestral bilateral symmetry.

heading: Vagal sensory neurons mediate the Bezold–Jarisch reflex and induce syncope
description: The molecular mechanisms underlying the Bezold–Jarisch reflex and syncope (fainting) involve vagal sensory neurons that express neuropeptide Y receptor Y2, the deletion of which in animal models abolishes the Bezold–Jarisch reflex.

heading: Moon-forming impactor as a source of Earth’s basal mantle anomalies
description: Computer simulations show that mantle material from Theia, a proto-planet theorized to have struck the proto-Earth in the Moon-forming giant impact, may be the source of Earth’s basal mantle anomalies.

heading: Neural signal propagation atlas of Caenorhabditis elegans
authors: Francesco RandiAnuj K. SharmaAndrew M. Leifer
description: Measurements of signal propagation in more than 23,000 pairs of neurons from nematode worms show that predictions of neural function made on the basis of anatomy are often incorrect, in part owing to the effects of extrasynaptic signalling.

heading: Structure of the native myosin filament in the relaxed cardiac sarcomere
description: A cryo-electron tomography study reports the structure of thick myosin filaments of mouse cardiac muscle in the relaxed state in situ and the MyBP-C links that connect them with the surrounding thin actin filaments.

heading: Fossil evidence for a pharyngeal origin of the vertebrate pectoral girdle
description: Computed tomography analysis of the braincase of the Early Devonian placoderm fish Kolymaspis sibirica suggests a skeletal gill support was involved in the origin of the shoulder girdle and provides new evidence reconciling historic theories about the evolution of paired fins.

heading: Historical narratives about the COVID-19 pandemic are motivationally biased
description: How people remember various aspects of the COVID-19 pandemic, including their own behaviour, perception of risk and attitudes towards science and governmental policies, is biased by their perceptions and behaviour today.

heading: Condensin dysfunction is a reproductive isolating barrier in mice
description: Species divergence in condensin regulation and centromere organization between the mice Mus musculus domesticus and Mus spretus drives chromosome decondensation and mis-segregation in their F1 hybrid oocytes, reducing female fertility.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of the human cardiac myosin filament
description: The intricate molecular architecture and interactions of the human cardiac myosin filament offer insights into cardiac physiology, disease and drug therapy.

heading: Mouse genome rewriting and tailoring of three important disease loci
description: This study describes a method to insert large stretches of exogenous DNA into mammalian genomes, which is used to insert human ACE2 loci into mouse to produce a model of human SARS-CoV-2 infection.

heading: CHIT1-positive microglia drive motor neuron ageing in the primate spinal cord
description: Motor neuron senescence and neuroinflammation with microglial hyperactivation are intertwined hallmarks of spinal cord ageing.

heading: A superconducting nanowire single-photon camera with 400,000 pixels
authors: B. G. OripovD. S. RampiniA. N. McCaughan
description: The development of a 400,000-pixel superconducting nanowire single-photon detector array is described, improving the current state of the art by a factor of 400 and showing scalability well beyond the present demonstration.

heading: Interface design for all-solid-state lithium batteries
description: The inclusion of a Mg–Bi-based interlayer between the lithium metal and solid electrolyte and a F-rich interlayer on the cathode improves the stability and performance of solid-state lithium-metal batteries.

heading: On-surface synthesis of a doubly anti-aromatic carbon allotrope
description: The carbon allotrope cyclo[16]carbon has been synthesized using on-surface chemistry and characterized with scanning tunnelling microscopy and atomic force microscopy, revealing orbital densities and bond-length alternation, which show it to be doubly anti-aromatic.

heading: Normative spatiotemporal fetal brain maturation with satisfactory development at 2 years
authors: Ana I. L. NambureteBartłomiej W. PapieżStephen H. Kennedy
description: A normative digital atlas of fetal brain maturation produced using 1,059 optimal quality, three-dimensional ultrasound brain volumes from 899 fetuses presents a unique spatiotemporal benchmark from a large cohort with normative postnatal growth and neurodevelopment at 2 years of age.

heading: An ON-type direction-selective ganglion cell in primate retina
authors: Anna Y. M. WangManoj M. KulkarniTeresa Puthussery
description: Transcriptomic data and functional experiments on macaque retina are used to identify the ON-type direction-selective ganglion cells responsible for detecting moving images and initiating gaze-stabilization mechanisms.

heading: Dipolar quantum solids emerging in a Hubbard quantum simulator
description: The realization of dipolar quantum solids with an ultracold gas of magnetic atoms in an optical lattice ushers in quantum simulation of many-body systems with long-range anisotropic interactions.

heading: Remarkable heat conduction mediated by non-equilibrium phonon polaritons
description: Measurements of thermal transport along 3C-SiC nanowires with and without a gold coating on the end(s) suggest that thermally excited surface phonon polaritons can be used in nanostructures to substantially enhance thermal conductivity.

heading: Evidence for a liquid silicate layer atop the Martian core
description: Using multiply diffracted P waves and first-principles computations of the thermoelastic properties of liquid iron-rich alloys, we show that the core of Mars is smaller and denser than previously thought.

heading: Structure and electromechanical coupling of a voltage-gated Na+/H+ exchanger
description: Upon hyperpolarization, the S4 voltage-sensing segment of sea urchin SLC9C1 moves down, removing inhibition caused by an intracellular helix and enabling Na+/H+ exchange, leading to pH-dependent activation of sAC and sperm chemotaxis.

heading: All-analog photoelectronic chip for high-speed vision tasks
description: An all-analog chip combining electronic and light computing achieves systemic energy efficiency of more than three orders of magnitude and a computing speed of more than one order of magnitude compared with state-of-the-art computing processors.

heading: Disruption of sugar nucleotide clearance is a therapeutic vulnerability of cancer cells
description: An enzyme called UXS1 that converts one sugar nucleotide to another is needed more in some cancer cells than in normal cells, providing a potential weakness that can be exploited therapeutically.

heading: Structures of a sperm-specific solute carrier gated by voltage and cAMP
description: This study proposes a molecular mechanism of voltage activation in SLC9C1, a transporter essential for male fertility.

heading: Heavy-element production in a compact object merger observed by JWST
authors: Andrew J. LevanBenjamin P. GompertzDavid Alexander Kann
description: Observations from the JWST of the second brightest GRB ever detected, GRB 230307A, indicate that it belongs to the class of long-duration GRBs resulting from compact object mergers, with the decay of lanthanides powering the longlasting optical and infrared emission.

heading: Dopaminergic systems create reward seeking despite adverse consequences
description: In Drosophila, a subpopulation of reward-encoding dopaminergic neurons antagonizes punishment-encoding neurons and can override punishment or hunger cues in favour of reward-seeking behaviour.

heading: Leishmania genetic exchange is mediated by IgM natural antibodies
authors: Tiago D. SerafimEva IniguezJesus G. Valenzuela
description: Genetic exchange of Leishmania parasites in the sand fly host is mediated by natural IgM antibodies, providing insights that will help generate reproducible and increased recovery of backcrosses for research purposes.

heading: On the origin of diffuse intensities in fcc electron diffraction patterns
description: Some of the diffuse intensities observed in electron diffraction patterns of face-centred cubic multi-principal element alloys are due to reflections from higher-order Laue zones.

heading: TMPRSS2 is a functional receptor for human coronavirus HKU1
description: We demonstrate that the transmembrane protease TMPRSS2 is a receptor for coronavirus HKU1; it triggers HKU1-mediated cell–cell fusion and viral entry by binding to both HKU1A and HKU1B spikes.

heading: A single photoreceptor splits perception and entrainment by cotransmission
description: The Drosophila R8 photoreceptor separates signals for image perception and circadian photoentrainment by co-releasing histamine and acetylcholine, and this segregation is further established in the postsynaptic circuitry in the medulla.

heading: Assessing the illegal hunting of native wildlife in China
description: Analysis of a database of convictions for illegal hunting in China reveals the scale of the threat to biodiversity posed by illegal hunting in China.

heading: Geophysical evidence for an enriched molten silicate layer above Mars’s core
description: We provide observational evidence that suggests the presence of a molten silicate layer above the core of Mars, which is overlain by a partially molten layer, indicating that the core of Mars is smaller than previously thought.

heading: A microfluidic transistor for automatic control of liquids
description: Flow limitation is exploited to develop a microfluidic device exhibiting flow–pressure behaviour analogous to the current–voltage characteristics of an electronic transistor.

heading: Human-like systematic generalization through a meta-learning neural network
description: The meta-learning for compositionality approach achieves the systematicity and flexibility needed for human-like generalization.

heading: Low-loss contacts on textured substrates for inverted perovskite solar cells
authors: So Min ParkMingyang WeiEdward H. Sargent
description: A co-adsorbent is used to achieve a uniform self-assembled phosphonic acid monolayer on a textured substrate, leading to more efficient inverted perovskite solar cells.

heading: Antigenicity and receptor affinity of SARS-CoV-2 BA.2.86 spike
description: A severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 Omicron subvariant, BA.2.86, was found to be no more resistant to human sera than the currently dominant XBB.1.5 and EG.5.1, but it had a remarkably higher receptor affinity.

heading: Chromatin compartmentalization regulates the response to DNA damage
description: After the production of double-stranded breaks in mammalian cells, ATM drives the formation of the D compartment, which regulates DNA damage-responsive genes, through the clustering of damaged topologically associating domains, with a mechanism that is consistent with polymer–polymer phase separation.

heading: Highest terrestrial 3He/4He credibly from the core
authors: F. HortonP. D. AsimowX. M. Boyes
description: Olivines from Baffin Island lavas have the highest magmatic 3He/4He ratio measured so far in terrestrial igneous rocks, indicating that the helium in these lavas might derive from Earth’s core.

heading: High-resolution maps show that rubber causes substantial deforestation
description: Satellite data used to generate high-resolution maps across Southeast Asia show that rubber-related deforestation is at least twofold to threefold higher than suggested by estimates used for setting policy.

heading: Coherent nanophotonic electron accelerator
description: A scalable nanophotonic electron accelerator with a high particle acceleration gradient and good beam confinement achieves an energy gain of 43%.

heading: Overshooting the critical threshold for the Greenland ice sheet
description: Simulations using two state-of-the-art ice-sheet models show that abrupt melting of the Greenland ice sheet following overshooting of the global mean temperature critical threshold can be mitigated by subsequent cooling to below 1.5 °C.

heading: Macromolecular condensation buffers intracellular water potential
description: Water thermodynamics drive changes in macromolecular assembly that rapidly restore intracellular water availability in response to physiological fluctuations in temperature, pressure and osmotic strength.

heading: Sustained antidepressant effect of ketamine through NMDAR trapping in the LHb
description: The discrepancy between the short half-life of ketamine and its long-lasting effects is due to ketamine being trapped in NMDA receptors, and its release depends on neural activity in the lateral habenula.

heading: Orbital multiferroicity in pentalayer rhombohedral graphene
description: Orbital multiferroicity reported in pentalayer rhombohedral graphene features ferro-orbital-magnetism and ferro-valleytricity, both of which can be controlled by an electric field.

heading: Bacteriophages suppress CRISPR–Cas immunity using RNA-based anti-CRISPRs
description: In response to bacterial CRISPR–Cas immunity, phages and plasmids have evolved small non-coding RNA anti-CRISPRs, known as Racrs, that sequester Cas proteins in abberrant complexes and thereby inhibit immunity.

heading: Cavity-mediated thermal control of metal-to-insulator transition in 1T-TaS2
description: Cavity-mediated thermal control of metal-to-insulator transition is achieved by embedding the charge density wave material 1T-TaS2 into cryogenic tunable terahertz cavities.

heading: The episodic resurgence of highly pathogenic avian influenza H5 virus
description: Recent resurgences of highly pathogenic avian influenza H5 viruses have different origins and virus ecologies as their epicentres shift and viruses evolve, with changes indicating increased adaptation among domestic birds.

heading: Sublithospheric diamond ages and the supercontinent cycle
description: The ages and geochemical compositions of inclusions of sublithospheric diamonds indicate additions to the mantle keel of Gondwana by the underplating of buoyant subducted material, originating from 300–700-km depth, which may have contributed to supercontinent stability during long-distance migration.

heading: The burden and dynamics of hospital-acquired SARS-CoV-2 in England
authors: Ben S. CooperStephanie EvansGwenan M. Knight
description: Data from acute hospitals in England are used to quantify hospital-acquired SARS-CoV-2 infections, evaluate likely pathways of spread and factors associated with heightened transmission risk, and explore the impact on community transmission.

heading: Anion–π interactions suppress phase impurities in FAPbI3 solar cells
description: The use of anion–π interactions during perovskite film formation is shown to give better quality perovskite layers with high phase purity, leading to improved photovoltaic devices with high power conversion efficiency.

heading: Antiviral type III CRISPR signalling via conjugation of ATP and SAM
description: The Bacteroides fragilis type III CRISPR protein Cmr conjugates ATP to S-adenosyl methionine, generating S-adenosyl methionine (SAM)-AMP, a novel second messenger with a role in antiviral signalling.

heading: Measurement-induced entanglement and teleportation on a noisy quantum processor
description: Measurement-induced phases of quantum information have been observed in a system of 70 superconducting qubits.

heading: Clinical trial links oncolytic immunoactivation to survival in glioblastoma
authors: Alexander L. LingIsaac H. SolomonE. Antonio Chiocca
description: Treatment with the oncolytic herpes virus CAN-3110 is associated with improved survival responses in patients with recurrent glioblastoma, particularly in individuals who are seropositive for HSV1.

heading: Targeting myeloid chemotaxis to reverse prostate cancer therapy resistance
authors: Christina GuoAdam SharpJohann S. de Bono
description: A translational study demonstrates the role of myeloid inflammatory cells in driving disease progression and treatment resistance in prostate cancer and shows that these cells can be targeted therapeutically.

heading: Arenium-ion-catalysed halodealkylation of fully alkylated silanes
authors: Tao HeHendrik F. T. KlareMartin Oestreich
description: A new method is described that uses arenium-ion-catalysed halodealkylation of silanes with four alkyl groups, typically considered synthetic dead ends, to convert Me4Si and related quaternary silanes into orthogonally substituted (functionalized) silanes.

heading: Genotyping, sequencing and analysis of 140,000 adults from Mexico City
description: Genotype and exome sequencing of 150,000 participants and whole-genome sequencing of 9,950 selected individuals recruited into the Mexico City Prospective Study constitute a valuable, publicly available resource of non-European sequencing data.

heading: Unraveling the functional dark matter through global metagenomics
authors: Georgios A. PavlopoulosFotis A. BaltoumasNikos C. Kyrpides
description: A computational approach to generate reference-free protein families from the sequence space in metagenomes reveals an enormously diverse functional space.

heading: Precipitation regime changes in High Mountain Asia driven by cleaner air
description: Dipolar precipitation change in High Mountain Asia during summer is primarily driven by weakened westerly jet and decadal variations in the South Asian monsoon, and the dipolar pattern is projected to shift to a monopolar wetting trend in the 2040s.

heading: Apoptotic stress causes mtDNA release during senescence and drives the SASP
description: During senescence, minority mitochondrial outer membrane permeabilization leads to the release of mtDNA into the cytosol through BAX and BAK macropores, in turn activating the cGAS–STING pathway, a major regulator of the senescence-associated secretory phenotype.

heading: Mexican Biobank advances population and medical genomics of diverse ancestries
description: Nationwide genomic biobank in Mexico unravels demographic history and complex trait architecture from 6,057 individuals.

heading: State estimation of a physical system with unknown governing equations
description: A parametrization strategy for stochastic variational inference with Markov Gaussian processes is presented for state estimation of a physical system whose underlying dynamical equations are partially or completely unknown.

heading: Learning from prepandemic data to forecast viral escape
authors: Nicole N. ThadaniSarah GurevDebora S. Marks
description: EVEscape, a flexible framework using deep learning and biophysical structural information, enables early identification of concerning mutations in viruses with pandemic potential, facilitating the development of vaccines and therapeutics.

heading: High-fidelity gates and mid-circuit erasure conversion in an atomic qubit
description: This study reports gates between qubits encoded in the nuclear spin state of Yb atoms trapped in optical tweezers, reaching very high fidelity and demonstrating mid-circuit conversion of errors into erasure errors.

heading: Ultra-fast deep-learned CNS tumour classification during surgery
description: Sturgeon is a pretrained neural network that uses incremental results from nanopore sequencing to rapidly classify central nervous system tumours and can be used to aid critical decision-making during surgery.

heading: Erasure conversion in a high-fidelity Rydberg quantum simulator
description: Erasure conversion and detection are used in a Rydberg quantum simulator to create Bell states with high fidelity, competitive with other state-of-the-art platforms.

heading: Structures illustrate step-by-step mitochondrial transcription initiation
description: A cryogenic electron microscopy study presents structures characterizing the initiation of RNA synthesis by yeast mitochondrial RNA polymerase at single-nucleotide addition steps.

heading: Doping of molecular semiconductors through proton-coupled electron transfer
description: Proton-coupled electron-transfer reactions are used to achieve efficient chemical doping of organic semiconductor thin films under ambient conditions, and a reference-electrode-free, resistive pH sensor based on the method is proposed.

heading: Design and testing of a humanized porcine donor for xenotransplantation
authors: Ranjith P. AnandJacob V. LayerWenning Qin
description: Using kidneys from a genetically engineered porcine donor transplanted into a cynomolgus monkey model, the design, creation and long-term function of kidney grafts supporting life are explored.

heading: Flexible circuit mechanisms for context-dependent song sequencing
authors: Frederic A. RoemschiedDiego A. PachecoMala Murthy
description: Insights into the underlying neuronal circuitry of the Drosophila song production system are provided using song patterning of males near versus far from the female.

heading: High-fidelity parallel entangling gates on a neutral-atom quantum computer
authors: Simon J. EveredDolev BluvsteinMikhail D. Lukin
description: The realization of two-qubit entangling gates with 99.5% fidelity on up to 60 rubidium atoms in parallel is reported, surpassing the surface-code threshold for error correction and laying the groundwork for neutral-atom quantum computers.

heading: A planetary collision afterglow and transit of the resultant debris cloud
description: Infrared brightening and luminosity observations from a young, solar-like star suggest a collision between two exoplanets producing a hot, highly extended post-impact remnant and transit of the debris causing the visible light eclipse of the host star.

heading: An extra-erythrocyte role of haemoglobin body in chondrocyte hypoxia adaption
description: Haemoglobin produced by chondrocytes forms eosin-positive haemoglobin bodies in their cytoplasm, and deletion of these bodies causes severe hypoxia.

heading: Global evidence of rapid urban growth in flood zones since 1985
description: Analysis of high-resolution annual data shows that global human settlements have expanded continuously and rapidly into flood zones, with those in the most hazardous zones increasing by 122% from 1985 to 2015.

heading: Rock organic carbon oxidation CO2 release offsets silicate weathering sink
authors: Jesse R. ZondervanRobert G. HiltonMateja Ogrič
description: Silicate weathering of uplifted rock depletes atmospheric CO2, but oxidation of revealed rock organic carbon supplies CO2, offsetting depletion to a degree dependent on regional geological history.

heading: Assembly theory explains and quantifies selection and evolution
description: Assembly theory conceptualizes objects as entities defined by their possible formation histories, allowing a unified language for describing selection, evolution and the generation of novelty.

heading: Large-scale plasma proteomics comparisons through genetics and disease associations
description: Comparisons of phenotypic and genetic association with protein levels from Icelandic and UK Biobank cohorts show that using multiple analysis platforms and stratifying populations by ancestry improves the detection of associations and allows the refinement of their location within the genome.

heading: A continuous fish fossil record reveals key insights into adaptive radiation
description: This study presents a continuous fossil record, extracted from a series of sediment cores, that shows how haplochromine cichlids came to dominate the fish fauna of Lake Victoria in Africa.

heading: The PTPN2/PTPN1 inhibitor ABBV-CLS-484 unleashes potent anti-tumour immunity
authors: Christina K. BaumgartnerHakimeh Ebrahimi-NikRobert T. Manguso
description: An orally bioavailable small-molecule active-site inhibitor of the phosphatases PTPN2 and PTPN1, ABBV-CLS-484, demonstrates immunotherapeutic efficacy in mouse models of cancer resistant to PD-1 blockade.

heading: Rare variant associations with plasma protein levels in the UK Biobank
authors: Ryan S. DhindsaOliver S. BurrenSlavé Petrovski
description: A set of three papers in Nature reports a new proteomics resource from the UK Biobank and initial analysis of common and rare genetic variant associations with plasma protein levels.

heading: Sialoglycan binding triggers spike opening in a human coronavirus
authors: Matti F. PronkerRobert CreutznacherDaniel L. Hurdiss
description: Binding of a sialoglycan-based primary receptor by the spike protein of the common cold human coronavirus HKU1 triggers conformational changes to a state that would allow binding to a second receptor required for cell entry.

heading: Bridging two insect flight modes in evolution, physiology and robophysics
description: Asynchronous flight in all major groups of insects likely arose from a single common ancestor with reversions to a synchronous flight mode enabled by shifts back and forth between different regimes in the same set of dynamic parameters.

heading: Ongoing declines for the world’s amphibians in the face of emerging threats
authors: Jennifer A. LuedtkeJanice ChansonSimon N. Stuart
description: The second Global Amphibian Assessment finds that the status of amphibians is continuing to deteriorate globally, driven predominantly by climate change, disease and habitat loss.

heading: Stringent test of QED with hydrogen-like tin
description: A high-precision, high-field test of quantum electrodynamics measuring the bound-electron g factor in hydrogen-like tin is described, which—together with state-of-the-art theory calculations—yields a stringent test in the strong-field regime.

heading: Universality in long-distance geometry and quantum complexity
authors: Adam R. BrownMichael H. FreedmanLeonard Susskind
description: Many different homogeneous metrics on Lie groups, which may have markedly different short-distance properties, are shown to exhibit nearly identical distance functions at long distances, suggesting a large universality class of definitions of quantum complexity.

heading: Plasma proteomic associations with genetics and health in the UK Biobank
authors: Benjamin B. SunJoshua ChiouChristopher D. Whelan
description: The Pharma Proteomics Project generates the largest open-access plasma proteomics dataset to date, offering insights into trans protein quantitative trait loci across multiple biological domains, and highlighting genetic influences on ligand–receptor interactions and pathway perturbations across a diverse collection of cytokines and complement networks.

heading: Complex molecule synthesis by electrocatalytic decarboxylative cross-coupling
description: We report a radical-based Ni/Ag-electrocatalytic cross-coupling of substituted carboxylic acids, enabling an approach to accessing complex molecular architectures, which relies on a silver additive that forms an active Ag nanoparticle-coated electrode surface along with carefully chosen ligands.

heading: Nucleic-acid-triggered NADase activation of a short prokaryotic Argonaute
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of a short prokaryotic Argonaute (pAgo) and the associated TIR-APAZ proteins bound by guide RNA and target DNA shed light on the mechanisms of assembly and activation of pAgo systems.

heading: The high optical brightness of the BlueWalker 3 satellite
description: We report the outcome of an international optical observation campaign of a prototype constellation satellite, AST SpaceMobile’s BlueWalker 3, which features a 64.3 m2 phased-array antenna and a launch vehicle adaptor.

heading: Enhanced optoelectronic coupling for perovskite/silicon tandem solar cells
description: An independently certified power conversion efficiency of 32.5% for perovskite/silicon tandem solar cells is achieved through improved charge transfer at the amorphous indium zinc oxide interconnecting layer and reduced optical losses at the front and rear electrodes.

heading: The sex-specific factor SOA controls dosage compensation in Anopheles mosquitoes
authors: Agata Izabela KalitaEric MaroisClaudia Isabelle Keller Valsecchi
description: A newly identified gene, sex chromosome activation (SOA), is a master regulator of dosage compensation in Anopheles gambiae.

heading: Observation of the effect of gravity on the motion of antimatter
authors: E. K. AndersonC. J. BakerJ. S. Wurtele
description: Magnetically confined neutral antihydrogen atoms released in a gravity field were found to fall towards Earth like ordinary matter, in accordance with Einstein’s general theory of relativity.

heading: Protected areas slow declines unevenly across the tetrapod tree of life
authors: A. Justin NowakowskiJames I. WatlingLuke O. Frishkoff
description: An analysis of 2,239 terrestrial vertebrate populations shows that they decline more slowly in protected areas than outside protected areas, but the benefits vary across vertebrate classes and depend on the regional context of the protected area.

heading: Uniquely preserved gut contents illuminate trilobite palaeophysiology
description: Fossilized gut contents of an Ordovician trilobite shed light on the feeding habits of one of the most common and well-known extinct arthropods.

heading: Weather explains the decline and rise of insect biomass over 34 years
description: Insect biomass data covering 27 years were reanalysed using sample-specific information on weather conditions during sampling and weather anomalies during the insect life cycle, finding that biomass is driven by complex weather conditions.

heading: Seasonal advance of intense tropical cyclones in a warming climate
description: We identify a seasonal advance of intense tropical cyclones that is closely related to the seasonal advance of rapid intensification events, favoured by the observed earlier onset of favourable oceanic conditions.

heading: Proteome census upon nutrient stress reveals Golgiphagy membrane receptors
authors: Kelsey L. HickeySharan SwarupJ. Wade Harper
description: A proteomics analysis demonstrates that, during nutrient stress, mammalian cells prioritize degradation by autophagy of membrane proteins and identifies receptors that mediate this process at the Golgi and also have a role in Golgi remodelling during neuronal differentiation.

heading: The geography of climate and the global patterns of species diversity
authors: Marco Túlio P. CoelhoElisa BarretoCatherine H. Graham
description: Nearly 90% of global variation in species richness of birds, mammals, amphibians and reptiles is shown to be explained by the joint effects of climate and the geographic structure (area and isolation) of climate.

heading: A quantum engine in the BEC–BCS crossover
description: This study reports the creation of a model thermodynamic engine that is fuelled by the energy difference resulting from changing the statistics of a quantum gas from bosonic to fermionic.

heading: Electrically driven organic laser using integrated OLED pumping
authors: Kou YoshidaJunyi GongIfor D. W. Samuel
description: An electrically driven organic semiconductor laser is achieved by integrating a device structure that efficiently couples an organic light-emitting diode, with extremely high internal-light generation, with a polymer distributed feedback laser.

heading: Inactivation of the Kv2.1 channel through electromechanical coupling
authors: Ana I. Fernández-MariñoXiao-Feng TanKenton J. Swartz
description: The exploration of voltage-gated potassium channels using cryo-electron microscopy and electrophysiology identifies a mechanism of inactivation involved in regulating neuron firing.

heading: Precessing jet nozzle connecting to a spinning black hole in M87
description: This study analyses radio observations of the jet in galaxy M87, from which the existence of a spinning black hole that induces Lense–Thirring precession of a misaligned accretion disk is inferred.

heading: Transposon-encoded nucleases use guide RNAs to promote their selfish spread
authors: Chance MeersHoang C. LeSamuel H. Sternberg
description: TnpB and IscB nucleases use transposon-encoded guide RNAs to target genomic sequences for cleavage, thereby favouring copying and spreading of transposable elements.

heading: A bioelectrical phase transition patterns the first vertebrate heartbeats
authors: Bill Z. JiaYitong QiAdam E. Cohen
description: The first heartbeat of a zebrafish was captured, and development of cardiac excitability and conduction around this singular event were analysed, showing how development of single-cell properties produces a transition from quiescence to coordinated beating.

heading: Earth’s early continental crust formed from wet and oxidizing arc magmas
description: The use of two zircon oxybarometers to simultaneously determine fO2 and H2O contents shows that Archaean granitoids were mostly formed from relatively oxidizing and H2O-rich magmas, probably at ancient subduction zones.
