heading: Dopaminergic error signals retune to social feedback during courtship
description: In male zebra finches, dopamine responses in Area X are retuned away from self-evaluation of song performance and towards social feedback to song performance when females are present.

heading: Inhibition of fatty acid oxidation enables heart regeneration in adult mice
description: Inhibition of the fatty acid oxidation metabolic pathway through inactivation of Cpt1b enhances cardiomyocyte survival and proliferation and allows heart regeneration in adult mice.

heading: Assembloid CRISPR screens reveal impact of disease genes in human neurodevelopment
description: Assembloids are integrated with CRISPR screening to investigate the involvement of 425 neurodevelopmental disorder genes in human interneuron development, showing endoplasmic reticulum displacement before nuclear translocation and interference from LNPK deletion, resulting in abnormal migration.

heading: Spatial atlas of the mouse central nervous system at molecular resolution
description: In situ spatial transcriptomic analysis of more than 1 million cells are used to create a 200-nm-resolution spatial molecular atlas of the adult mouse central nervous system and identify previously unknown tissue architectures.

heading: piRNA processing by a trimeric Schlafen-domain nuclease
authors: Nadezda PodvalnayaAlfred W. BronkhorstRené F. Ketting
description: The endoribonuclease PUCH, a trimer of Schlafen-like-domain proteins, initiates piRNA processing in the nematode Caenorhabditis elegans through 5′-end piRNA precursor cleavage.

heading: Resonant X-ray excitation of the nuclear clock isomer 45Sc
description: Resonant X-ray excitation of the  45Sc nuclear isomeric state was achieved by irradiation of a Sc-metal foil with 12.4-keV photon pulses from a state-of-the-art X-ray free-electron laser, allowing a high-precision determination of the transition energy.

heading: A molnupiravir-associated mutational signature in global SARS-CoV-2 genomes
description: A specific class of long phylogenetic branches, distinguished by a high proportion of G-to-A and C-to-T mutations, are almost exclusively found in sequences from 2022, after molnupiravir treatment was introduced, indicating that molnupiravir treatment can give rise to viable mutagenized viruses.

heading: Distinguishing features of long COVID identified through immune profiling
description: Individuals with long COVID show marked biological changes in cortisol and immune factors relative to convalescent populations.

heading: Global effects of marine protected areas on food security are unknown
A crystalline doubly oxidized carbene
description: The synthesis and isolation of a crystalline dication derived from a bis(imino)carbene through a two-electron oxidation/oxide-ion abstraction strategy is reported that bypasses the carbene radical cation, maintaining significant electrophilicity with two accessible vacant orbitals.

heading: Reply to: Global effects of marine protected areas on food security are unknown
Geminal-atom catalysis for cross-coupling
description: Heterogeneous geminal-atom catalysts, which pair single-atom sites in specific coordination and spatial proximity, offer a new avenue for the sustainable manufacture of fine chemicals.

heading: The contribution of wildfire to PM2.5 trends in the USA
description: Ground- and satellite-based air pollution data from 2000 to 2022 quantify the contribution of wildfire smoke to stagnation or reversal in PM2.5 concentration trends, showing that this contribution will grow as the climate continues to warm.

heading: Cingulate dynamics track depression recovery with deep brain stimulation
authors: Sankaraleengam AlagapanKi Sueng ChoiChristopher J. Rozell
description: This study demonstrates how activity in the cingulate cortex tracks depression recovery, providing symptom relief using deep brain stimulation.

heading: Reductive carboxylation epigenetically instructs T cell differentiation
description: Reductive carboxylation of glutamine by isocitrate dehydrogenase 2 (IDH2) has a role in determining the fate of T cells, and inhibiting this enzyme promotes the differentiation of memory T cells.

heading: Global population exposure to landscape fire air pollution from 2000 to 2019
description: The global population is increasingly exposed to daily landscape fire-sourced air pollution but there are socioeconomic disparities, with this pollution four times higher in low-income countries than in high-income countries during the period 2000–2019.

heading: Multistable sheets with rewritable patterns for switchable shape-morphing
description: To demonstrate the power of multistability, a specific class of groovy metasheets is introduced as a new shape-morphing platform that allows repeated switching from the flat state to multiple, precisely selected and stable three-dimensional shapes.

heading: Acetyl-methyllysine marks chromatin at active transcription start sites
authors: William J. Lu-CulliganLeah J. ConnorMatthew D. Simon
description: Cellular lysine residues can be both methylated and acetylated on the same sidechain to form Nε-acetyl-Nε-methyllysine (Kacme), which is found on histone H4 across a range of species and across mammalian tissues and is associated with active chromatin.

heading: Cryo-EM structures reveal native GABAA receptor assemblies and pharmacology
description: Using cryo-EM, structures of three major assemblies of type A GABA receptors, which regulate brain excitability, are revealed in the mouse brain and provide a basis for the development of subtype-specific drugs.

heading: Synthesis of portimines reveals the basis of their anti-cancer activity
description: A scalable total synthesis of portimines enables structural reassignment of portimine B and in-depth functional evaluation of portimine A, revealing that portimine A induces translation inhibition selectively in human cancer cells and is efficacious in vivo tumour-clearance models.

heading: Transgenic ferret models define pulmonary ionocyte diversity and function
authors: Feng YuanGrace N. GasserJohn F. Engelhardt
description: Conditional genetic ferret models enable ionocyte lineage tracing, ionocyte ablation and ionocyte-specific deletion of CFTR to elucidate the roles of pulmonary ionocyte biology and function during human health and disease.

heading: The β1-adrenergic receptor links sympathetic nerves to T cell exhaustion
description: Stress-associated catecholamines promote CD8+ T cell exhaustion through the β1-adrenergic receptor, and blocking β-adrenergic signalling may help restore anti-tumour functions.

heading: Transcriptional linkage analysis with in vivo AAV-Perturb-seq
authors: Antonio J. SantinhaEsther KlinglerRandall J. Platt
description: An in vivo single-cell CRISPR screening method identifies transcriptional phenotypes of 22q11.2 deletion syndrome associated with a broad dysregulation of a class of disease susceptibility genes that are important for RNA processing and synaptic function.

heading: A multi-stem cell basis for craniosynostosis and calvarial mineralization
authors: Seoyeon BokAlisha R. YallowitzMatthew B. Greenblatt
description: The calvarial stem cell niche is populated by a cathepsin K-expressing cell lineage and a newly identified discoidin domain-containing receptor 2-expressing lineage, both of which are required for proper calvarial mineralization.

heading: Global iron and steel plant CO2 emissions and carbon-neutrality pathways
description: A CO2 emissions inventory of 4,883 individual iron and steel plants along with their technical characteristics is described, allowing the identification and guidance of the most appropriate emissions mitigation and decarbonization pathways for each plant.

heading: The oldest three-dimensionally preserved vertebrate neurocranium
authors: Richard P. DeardenAgnese LanzettiIvan J. Sansom
description: Computed tomography reveals that the cranial anatomy of Ordovician stem-group gnathostome Eriptychius americanus from the Harding Sandstone of Colorado, USA, is distinct among vertebrates.

heading: Neural circuitry for maternal oxytocin release induced by infant cries
authors: Silvana ValtchevaHabon A. IssaRobert C. Froemke
description: Experiments in mice identify a neural circuit that relays information about infant cries from the maternal auditory thalamus to hypothalamic oxytocin neurons to induce the release of oxytocin and modulate maternal behaviour.

heading: Evidence for the earliest structural use of wood at least 476,000 years ago
authors: L. BarhamG. A. T. DullerP. Nkombwe
description: Wooden artefacts from waterlogged deposits in Zambia dating back 477 ka indicate hitherto unknown sophistication in woodworking at an early date.

heading: Cholinergic neurons trigger epithelial Ca2+ currents to heal the gut
description: A subpopulation of cholinergic neurons triggers Ca2+ currents among enterocytes to promote return to homeostasis after injury, and disruption of this process leads to gut inflammation and hyperplasia in Drosophila.

heading: Bacterial pathogens deliver water- and solute-permeable channels to plant cells
description: The bacterial effector proteins of the AvrE family function as membrane channels in plant cells, enabling the passage of water and solutes from host cells to support pathogen growth, and disrupting the viability of the host cell.

heading: DNA-based programmable gate arrays for general-purpose DNA computing
description: Generic single-stranded oligonucleotides used as a uniform transmission signal can reliably integrate large-scale DNA integrated circuits with minimal leakage and high fidelity for general-purpose computing.

heading: A foundation model for generalizable disease detection from retinal images
authors: Yukun ZhouMark A. ChiaPearse A. Keane
description: RETFound, a foundation model for retinal images that learns generalizable representations from unlabelled images, is trained on 1.6 million unlabelled images by self-supervised learning and then adapted to disease detection tasks with explicit labels.

heading: Clustering predicted structures at the scale of the known protein universe
description: The novel Foldseek clustering algorithm defines 2.30 million clusters of AlphaFold structures, identifying remote structural similarity of human immune-related proteins in prokaryotic species.

heading: Phase-dependent growth of Pt on MoS2 for highly efficient H2 evolution
description: We report the production of MoS2 nanosheets with high phase purity, showing that the 2H-phase templates facilitate epitaxial growth of Pt nanoparticles, whereas the 1T′ phase supports single-atomically dispersed Pt atoms.

heading: Causes and consequences of child growth faltering in low-resource settings
description: Analysis of data from 33 longitudinal cohorts from low- and middle-income countries indicates that conditions during pre-conception, pregnancy and the first few months of life are crucial in determining the risk of growth faltering in young children.

heading: Single-cell brain organoid screening identifies developmental defects in autism
authors: Chong LiJonas Simon FleckJuergen A. Knoblich
description: We develop a high-throughput CRISPR screening system in cerebral organoids and identify vulnerable cell types and gene regulatory networks associated with autism spectrum disorder from single-cell transcriptomes and chromatin modalities.

heading: Learning heterogeneous reaction kinetics from X-ray videos pixel by pixel
authors: Hongbo ZhaoHaitao Dean DengMartin Z. Bazant
description: Analysis of a large dataset of scanning transmission X-ray microscopy images of carbon-coated lithium iron phosphate nanoparticles shows that the heterogeneous reaction kinetics of battery materials can be learned from such videos pixel by pixel.

heading: Structural basis for thioredoxin-mediated suppression of NLRP1 inflammasome
description: Structural and mutational studies and cellular assays show that the inflammasome sensor NLRP1 forms a complex with thioredoxin, which acts as a negative regulator of inflammasome activity.

heading: Child wasting and concurrent stunting in low- and middle-income countries
description: An analysis of longitudinal cohort data across diverse populations suggests that the incidence of wasting between birth and 24 months is higher than previously thought, and highlights the role of seasonal factors that affect child growth.

heading: Projected decline in European bumblebee populations in the twenty-first century
description: A quantitative study of past, present and future ecological suitability of Europe for bumblebees finds that for 38–76% of species now considered non-threatened, suitable territory could decrease by at least 30% by 2061–2080.

heading: Flatband λ-Ti3O5 towards extraordinary solar steam generation
description: A route to greatly elevate joint densities of states by introducing a flat-band electronic structure is demonstrated, showing metallic λ-Ti3O5 powders have a high solar absorptivity and offering insights into access to cost-effective solar-to-steam generation.

heading: Shape memory polymer with programmable recovery onset
description: A four-dimensional printable shape memory hydrogel with shape-shifting onset adjustable by changing the programming conditions is reported.

heading: Structural mobility tunes signalling of the GluA1 AMPA glutamate receptor
description: Calcium-permeable GluA1 AMPA glutamate receptors are structurally and functionally distinct from the prototypical GluA2-containing AMPA receptors, impacting their role in signal transmission, synaptic plasticity and learning.

heading: Uncovering new families and folds in the natural protein universe
description: The extent to which the AlphaFold database has structurally illuminated proteins that are challenging to annotate for function or putative biological role using standard homology-based approaches at high predicted accuracy is investigated.

heading: A cross-species proteomic map reveals neoteny of human synapse development
description: A study presents a cross-species proteomic map of synapse development in neocortex and reveals that the human postsynaptic density assembly develops two to three times slower than that in macaques and mice.

heading: A vertebral skeletal stem cell lineage driving metastasis
description: Vertebral osteoblasts in mouse and human are formed from a precursor skeletal stem cell population that is distinct from long bone skeletal stem cells in function, location and transcriptional programme.

heading: Molecular basis of methyl-salicylate-mediated plant airborne defence
description: Aphid-transmitted viruses encode proteins that suppress the plant airborne defence response—which is triggered by volatile chemicals released by neighbouring plants after aphid attack—and the plants consequently become less repellent to aphids and more suitable for aphid survival, infestation and viral transmission.

heading: Sustainably sourced components to generate high-strength adhesives
authors: Clayton R. WestermanBradley C. McGillJonathan J. Wilker
description: We present a sustainably sourced adhesive system, with performance comparable to that of current industrial products, made from epoxidized soy oil, malic acid and tannic acid, all biomass derived, low cost and readily available.

heading: Early-childhood linear growth faltering in low- and middle-income countries
description: A pooled analysis of longitudinal studies in low- and middle-income countries identifies the typical age of onset of linear growth faltering and investigates recurrent faltering in early life.

heading: Tropical Atlantic multidecadal variability is dominated by external forcing
authors: Chengfei HeAmy C. ClementLisa N. Murphy
description: Anthropogenic and volcanic aerosols dominate multidecadal variability in aspects of the tropical Atlantic climate, such as sea surface temperatures, Sahel rainfall and hurricanes.

heading: C. difficile intoxicates neurons and pericytes to drive neurogenic inflammation
description: The molecular mechanism underlying the severe neurogenic inflammation induced by Clostridioides difficile is presented, providing a therapeutic target for treating this infection.

heading: Molecular mechanism of de novo replication by the Ebola virus polymerase
description: A study reports the three-dimensional structure of the Ebola virus polymerase in complex with VP35 and RNA, and reveals features required for initiation of viral replication.

heading: Towards linking lab and field lifetimes of perovskite solar cells
description: We correlate lab test and field test results to better predict the performance of perovskite photovoltaics as a step towards real-world implementation.

heading: Molecular mechanisms of SARS-CoV-2 resistance to nirmatrelvir
description: A biochemical and structural analysis demonstrates that alterations at the substrate-binding pocket of the main protease of SARS-CoV-2 can allow the virus to develop resistance to nirmatrelvir in two distinct ways.

heading: Amniote metabolism and the evolution of endothermy
authors: Ryosuke MotaniDavid A. GoldGeerat J. Vermeij

heading: Reply to: Amniote metabolism and the evolution of endothermy
authors: Jasmina WiemannIris MenéndezDerek E. G. Briggs

heading: Thymic mimetic cells function beyond self-tolerance
description: Multiomic analyses of mouse thymic epithelial cells identify several unconventional subsets that are mimetics of various populations of terminally differentiated parenchymal cells and provide insights into their development, molecular features and function.

heading: Stack growth of wafer-scale van der Waals superconductor heterostructures
description: Stacks of van der Waals superconductor heterostructures comprising many layers and several blocks of two-dimensional materials have been grown in a highly controllable manner at a wafer scale using a high-to-low temperature strategy.

heading: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19
A catalytically active oscillator made from small organic molecules
authors: Matthijs ter HarmselOliver R. MaguireSyuzanna R. Harutyunyan
description: We report a small-organic-molecule oscillator that catalyses an independent chemical reaction in situ without impairing its oscillating properties, allowing the construction of complex systems enhancing applications in automated synthesis and systems and polymerization chemistry.

heading: Polθ is phosphorylated by PLK1 to repair double-strand breaks in mitosis
description: In mitosis, genome integrity is maintained by DNA polymerase theta-dependent repair of DNA double-strand breaks, which is regulated by Polo-like kinase 1 activity.

heading: Phosphoantigens glue butyrophilin 3A1 and 2A1 to activate Vγ9Vδ2 T cells
description: Phosphoantigen-mediated BTN2A1 association drives BTN3A1 intracellular fluctuations outwards in a thermodynamically favourable manner, thereby enabling BTN3A1 to push off from the BTN2A1 ectodomain to initiate T cell receptor–mediated γδ T cell activation.

heading: Polarized thermal emission from dust in a galaxy at redshift 2.6
authors: J. E. GeachE. Lopez-RodriguezK. E. K. Coppin
description: Linearly polarized thermal emission from dust grains in a strongly lensed, intrinsically luminous galaxy forming stars at a rate more than 1,000 times that of the Milky Way is detected.

heading: A new avialan theropod from an emerging Jurassic terrestrial fauna
description: An avialan species from the Zhenghe Fauna—a collection of vertebrate fossils from the Late Jurassic of China—had an unusual combination of features, including very long hindlimbs, suggesting that it had a terrestrial or wading lifestyle.

heading: Hydrogen-bond-acceptor ligands enable distal C(sp3)–H arylation of free alcohols
description: Ligands enable alcohol-directed arylation of δ-C(sp3)–H bonds by stabilizing hydroxyl coordination to palladium through charge balance and hydrogen bonding.

heading: Adsorbate motors for unidirectional translation and transport
description: An adsorbate motor that moves unidirectionally on a copper surface is achieved by inducing intramolecular hydrogen transfer in a single molecule.

heading: CD300ld on neutrophils is required for tumour-driven immune suppression
description: A CRISPR–Cas9 screen in a tumour mouse model identifies CD300ld as a tumour receptor on polymorphonuclear myeloid-derived suppressor cells and in vivo experiments indicate that it is a promising target for cancer immunotherapy.

heading: Specialized astrocytes mediate glutamatergic gliotransmission in the CNS
description: A subpopulation of astrocytes selectively expresses synaptic-like glutamate-release machinery, actively secretes the transmitter and is localized to discrete sites in the hippocampus.

heading: Spatial predictors of immunotherapy response in triple-negative breast cancer
authors: Xiao Qian WangEsther DanenbergH. Raza Ali
description: Imaging mass cytometry is used to map the multicellular dynamics of immune checkpoint blockade-treated triple-negative breast cancer, finding that key proliferative fractions and cell–cell interactions drive response, and immunotherapy distinctively remodels tumour structure.

heading: Turbulence suppression by cardiac-cycle-inspired driving of pipe flow
description: Turbulence can be reduced by more than 25% in ordinary pipe flow by unsteady, pulsatile driving specifically mimicking the cardiac cycle and extending this method to large Reynolds numbers.

heading: Pervasive downstream RNA hairpins dynamically dictate start-codon selection
description: Double-stranded RNA structures downstream of start codons play a role in translation initiation by regulating start-codon selection in plant immune responses, and also contribute to translational reprogramming in mammalian systems.

heading: Complete human day 14 post-implantation embryo models from naive ES cells
description: The culture of genetically unmodified human naive embryonic stem cells in specific growth conditions gives rise to structures that recapitulate those of post-implantation human embryos up to 13–14 days after fertilization.

heading: Visualizing interfacial collective reaction behaviour of Li–S batteries
description: In situ liquid-cell electrochemical transmission electron microscopy allows the direct visualization of the transformation of lithium polysulfides over electrode surfaces at the atomic scale, leading to a new energy-storage mechanism in lithium–sulfur batteries.

heading: Climate warming increases extreme daily wildfire growth risk in California
authors: Patrick T. BrownHolt HanleyCraig B. Clements
description: Quantification of climate warming in California using machine learning shows increased daily wildfire growth risk by 25%, with an expected increase of 59% and 172% in 2100, for low- and very-high-emissions scenarios, respectively.

heading: Epitope editing enables targeted immunotherapy of acute myeloid leukaemia
description: Epitope engineering of donor haematopoietic stem/progenitor cells endows haematopoietic lineages with selective resistance to CAR T cells or monoclonal antibodies, without affecting protein function or regulation, enabling the targeting of genes that are essential for leukaemia survival and reducing the risk of tumour immune escape.

heading: Marine heatwaves are not a dominant driver of change in demersal fishes
authors: Alexa L. FredstonWilliam W. L. CheungMalin L. Pinsky
description: Of 248 marine heatwaves between 1993 and 2019 in North American and European seas, the effects on fish biomass were often minimal, and the heatwaves were not consistently associated with tropicalization or deborealization.

heading: First observation of 28O
description: Observation of 28O and 27O through their decay into 24O and four and three neutrons, respectively, is reported, with the 28O nucleus being of particular interest owing to proton and neutron magic numbers and its extremely asymmetric neutron-to-proton ratio.

heading: A pentameric TRPV3 channel with a dilated pore
description: High-speed atomic force microscopy single-molecule imaging and cryo-EM analysis discover and reveal the structure of a TRPV3 pentamer, providing evidence for a non-canonical pentameric TRP-channel assembly, laying the foundation for new directions in TRP channel research.

heading: A super-massive Neptune-sized planet
description: Observations of the super-massive Neptune-sized transiting planet TOI-1853 b show a mass almost twice that of any other Neptune-sized planet known so far and a bulk density implying that heavy elements dominate its mass.

heading: Identifying attacks in the Russia–Ukraine conflict using seismic array data
authors: Ben D. E. DandoBettina P. Goertz-AllmannAlexander Liashchuk
description: Analysis of seismic waves caused by explosions in northern Ukraine recorded by a local network in 2022 demonstrated the ability to automatically identify individual attacks during the Russia–Ukraine conflict in close to real time.

heading: CRISPR screens decode cancer cell pathways that trigger γδ T cell detection
description: A combination of genome-wide CRISPR screens in target cancer cells identifies pathways that regulate γδ T cell killing and BTN3A cell surface expression.

heading: Structure evolution at the gate-tunable suspended graphene–water interface
description: Using centimetre-sized substrate-free monolayer graphene suspended on aqueous electrolyte surface, the structural evolution versus gate voltage at the graphene–water interface is shown, demonstrating minimal influence of extrinsic factors.

heading: Neutralization, effector function and immune imprinting of Omicron variants
description: Convergent mutations in hot spots of the spike proteins of currently circulating SARS-CoV-2 Omicron variants increase the binding affinity for the host receptor and promote more efficient fusion with host cell membranes.

heading: An orexigenic subnetwork within the human hippocampus
authors: Daniel A. N. BarbosaSandra GattasCasey H. Halpern
description: An appetite-regulating subnetwork in humans involving the lateral hypothalamus and the dorsolateral hippocampus is implicated in obesity and related eating disorders.

heading: Champion-level drone racing using deep reinforcement learning
description: An autonomous system is described that combines deep reinforcement learning with onboard sensors collecting data from the physical world, enabling it to fly faster than human world champion drone pilots around a race track.

heading: Gut microbial carbohydrate metabolism contributes to insulin resistance
description: Faecal carbohydrates, particularly host-accessible monosaccharides, are increased in individuals with insulin resistance and are associated with microbial carbohydrate metabolisms and host inflammatory cytokines.

heading: Hippocampal representation during collective spatial behaviour in bats
description: In bats engaged in spontaneous collective spatial behaviour, a robust spatial structure emerges at the group level whereby behaviour is anchored to specific locations, movement patterns and individual social preferences, and many hippocampal neurons are tuned to key features of group dynamics.

heading: Identification of an alternative triglyceride biosynthesis pathway
description: Triacylglycerols are an energy source produced in humans by DGAT1 and DGAT2, but disrupting these enzymes reveals a noncanonical pathway involving the protein DIESL (formerly TMEM68) and its regulator TMX1, which is important during lipid scarcity.

heading: Scalable spin squeezing in a dipolar Rydberg atom array
description: In the dipolar XY model, quench dynamics from a polarized initial state lead to spin squeezing that improves with increasing system size, and two refinements show further enhanced squeezing and extended lifetime of the squeezed state by freezing its dynamics.

heading: Realizing spin squeezing with Rydberg interactions in an optical clock
authors: William J. EcknerNelson Darkwah OppongAdam M. Kaufman
description: Spin squeezing in an optical atomic clock based on arrays of neutral atoms is used to realize measurement performance below the standard quantum limit.

heading: Metabolic programs of T cell tissue residency empower tumour immunity
description: A study describes the metabolic adaptations supporting differentiation, survival and function of tissue-resident memory CD8+ T cells and how to leverage them to enhance immunity against pathogens and tumours.

heading: High-resolution landscape of an antibiotic binding site
description: A collection of RNA polymerase mutants spanning all possible substitutions of the rifampicin binding site is generated and characterized, increasing our understanding of antibiotic mechanisms and bacterial physiology.

heading: Widespread retreat of coastal habitat is likely at warming levels above 1.5 °C
description: Without mitigation, relative sea-level rises under current climate change projections will exceed the capacity of coastal habitats such as mangroves and tidal marshes to adjust, leading to instability and profound changes to coastal ecosystems.

heading: Anthropogenic fingerprints in daily precipitation revealed by deep learning
description: Deep learning using a convolutional neural network trained with daily precipitation fields and annual global mean surface air temperature data demonstrates that anthropogenically induced climate change has a detectable effect on daily hydrological fluctuations.

heading: A microscale soft ionic power source modulates neuronal network activity
description: A study describes the development of a miniaturized hydrogel-based soft power source capable of modulating the activity of networks of neuronal cells without the need for metal electrodes.

heading: Indistinguishable telecom band photons from a single Er ion in the solid state
description: Er3+ is implanted into CaWO4, a material with non-polar site symmetry free of background rare earth ions, to realize reduced optical spectral diffusion in nanophotonic devices, representing a step towards making telecom band quantum repeater networks with single ions.

heading: LTP induction by structural rather than enzymatic functions of CaMKII
authors: Jonathan E. TullisMatthew E. LarsenK. Ulrich Bayer
description: Several independent lines of evidence demonstrated long-term potentiation induction by a structural function of calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II rather than by its enzymatic activity.

heading: Quantum-enhanced sensing on optical transitions through finite-range interactions
authors: Johannes FrankeSean R. MuleadyChristian F. Roos
description: A method is described for the generation of large-scale entanglement that can be used for quantum-enhanced sensing even when systems are limited to short-range interactions in experiments with up to 51 trapped ions.

heading: Outflows from the youngest stars are mostly molecular
authors: T. P. RayM. J. McCaughreanG. Wright
description: Near-infrared imagery and spectroscopy from JWST of the Herbig-Haro 211 system, an analogue of the young Sun, reveals  supersonic jets of hot molecules that can explain the origin of the ‘green fuzzies’ phenomenon.

heading: Reply to: Palaeospondylus and the early evolution of gnathostomes
Palaeospondylus and the early evolution of gnathostomes
Light-enabled deracemization of cyclopropanes by Al-salen photocatalysis
description: Irradiation of chiral Al-salen complexes with violet light demonstrates efficient deracemization of cyclopropanes, enabling reactivity and enantioselectivity to be regulated simultaneously, negating the requirement for tailored catalyst–substrate recognition motifs.

heading: Increased Amazon carbon emissions mainly from decline in law enforcement
authors: Luciana V. GattiCamilla L. CunhaGuilherme B. M. Machado
description: Comparison of the carbon balance during 2010–2018 with 2019 and 2020 shows that a decline in law enforcement may have led to an increase in Amazon forest carbon emissions.

heading: Forced changes in the Pacific Walker circulation over the past millennium
description: Analysis of a new annually resolved, multi-method, palaeoproxy-derived reconstruction ensemble for the period 1200–2000 suggests that recent variability in the Pacific Walker circulation is unusual but not unprecedented over the past 800 years.

heading: Reef-building corals farm and feed on their photosynthetic symbionts
description: Long-term experiments show that corals acquire dissolved inorganic nitrogen and phosphorus by feeding on symbiont cells, which provide essential nutrients enabling their success in nutrient-poor waters.

heading: Proton transport through nanoscale corrugations in two-dimensional crystals
authors: O. J. WahabE. DaviddiP. R. Unwin
description: A study using high-resolution scanning electrochemical cell microscopy attributes proton permeation through defect-free graphene and hexagonal boron nitride to transport across areas of the structure that are under strain.

heading: The complete sequence of a human Y chromosome
description: We present the complete 62,460,029-base-pair sequence of a human Y chromosome from the HG002 genome (T2T-Y) that corrects multiple errors in GRCh38-Y and adds over 30 million base pairs of sequence to the reference.

heading: Native diversity buffers against severity of non-native tree invasions
authors: Camille S. DelavauxThomas W. CrowtherDaniel S. Maynard
description: Analysis combining multiple global tree databases reveals that whether a location is invaded by non-native tree species depends on anthropogenic factors, but the severity of the invasion depends on the native species diversity.

heading: A high-performance speech neuroprosthesis
authors: Francis R. WillettErin M. KunzJaimie M. Henderson
description: A speech-to-text brain–computer interface that records spiking activity from intracortical microelectrode arrays enabled an individual who cannot speak intelligibly to achieve 9.1 and 23.8% word error rates on a 50- and 125,000-word vocabulary, respectively.

heading: An analog-AI chip for energy-efficient speech recognition and transcription
description: A low-power chip that runs AI models using analog rather than digital computation shows comparable accuracy on speech-recognition tasks but is more than 14 times as energy efficient.

heading: Non-cell-autonomous cancer progression from chromosomal instability
authors: Jun LiMelissa J. HubiszSamuel F. Bakhoum
description: Chromosomal instability in cancer is linked to endoplasmic reticulum stress signalling, immune suppression and metastasis, which is mediated by the cGAS–STING pathway, suppression of which can reduce metastasis.

heading: A high-performance neuroprosthesis for speech decoding and avatar control
authors: Sean L. MetzgerKaylo T. LittlejohnEdward F. Chang
description: A study using high-density surface recordings of the speech cortex in a person with limb and vocal paralysis demonstrates real-time decoding of brain activity into text, speech sounds and orofacial movements.

heading: OPA1 helical structures give perspective to mitochondrial dysfunction
authors: Sarah B. NyenhuisXufeng WuJenny E. Hinshaw
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of OPA1, mutations of which are associated with the disease dominant optic atrophy, provide insight into how structural features of OPA1 enable this protein to mediate mitochondrial-membrane fusion and remodelling.

heading: Tropical forests are approaching critical temperature thresholds
authors: Christopher E. DoughtyJenna M. KeanyJoshua B. Fisher
description: Ground truthed thermal data from a new NASA satellite combined with experimental warming data from three continents in an empirical model suggests that tropical forests are closer to a high temperature threshold than previously thought.

heading: A global rise in alluvial mining increases sediment load in tropical rivers
authors: Evan N. DethierMiles SilmanDavid A. Lutz
description: The assembly and analysis of a 37-year satellite database covering almost 400 mining districts in 49 countries shows that a rise in river mineral mining has substantially increased riverine sediment load in tropical rivers worldwide.

heading: Landscape-scale benefits of protected areas for tropical biodiversity
authors: Jedediah F. BrodieJayasilan Mohd-AzlanMatthew Scott Luskin
description: Protected areas across mega-diverse Southeast Asia are associated with elevated vertebrate biodiversity inside their boundaries and in surrounding areas.

heading: Structural mechanism of mitochondrial membrane remodelling by human OPA1
authors: Alexander von der MalsburgGracie M. SappHalil Aydin
description: Human OPA1 embeds itself into cardiolipin-containing membranes through a lipid-binding paddle domain, and OPA1 oligomerization through multiple assembly interfaces promotes the helical assembly of a flexible OPA1 lattice on the membrane, driving mitochondrial fusion in cells.

heading: Assembly of 43 human Y chromosomes reveals extensive complexity and variation
description: De novo assemblies of 43 Y chromosomes spanning 182,900 years of human evolution reveal considerable diversity in the size and structure of the human Y chromosome.

heading: Increased hyaluronan by naked mole-rat Has2 improves healthspan in mice
description: Mice overexpressing Has2 from the naked mole-rat showed an increase in hyaluronan levels in several tissues, and a lower incidence of spontaneous and induced cancer, attenuated inflammation through several pathways, extended lifespan and improved healthspan.

heading: Quinone-mediated hydrogen anode for non-aqueous reductive electrosynthesis
authors: Jack TwiltonMathew R. JohnsonShannon S. Stahl
description: A quinone-mediated hydrogen anode design shows that hydrogen can be used as the electron source in non-aqueous reductive electrosynthesis, for a more sustainable way to make molecules at larger scale.

heading: Observation of fractionally quantized anomalous Hall effect
description: Transport measurements in twisted bilayer MoTe2 reveal quantized Hall resistance plateaus and composite Fermi liquid-like behaviour under zero magnetic field, constituting a direct observation of integer and fractional quantum anomalous Hall effects.

heading: Magneto-optics in a van der Waals magnet tuned by self-hybridized polaritons
description: In the layered magnetic semiconductor CrSBr, emergent light–matter hybrids (polaritons) increase the spectral bandwidth of correlations between the magnetic, electronic and optical properties, enabling largely tunable optical responses to applied magnetic fields and magnons.

heading: Endothelial sensing of AHR ligands regulates intestinal homeostasis
description: Single-cell transcriptomics and in vivo challenge models establish a key role for the aryl hydrocarbon receptor in regulating the function of enteric endothelial cells in response to environmental cues.

heading: Long-molecule scars of backup DNA repair in BRCA1- and BRCA2-deficient cancers
description: Linked-read whole-genome sequencing reveals patterns of structural DNA variants that are specific to homologous recombination deficiency and can be used to distinguish between BRCA1- and BRCA2-deficient phenotypes.

heading: Xiphoid nucleus of the midline thalamus controls cold-induced food seeking
description: Through leverage of whole-brain screening, in vivo calcium imaging and chemo- and optogenetic manipulations, it is demonstrated that the xiphoid nucleus serves as a key brain region in the promotion of cold-induced food-seeking behaviours.

heading: Endothelial AHR activity prevents lung barrier disruption in viral infection
description: The environmental sensor aryl hydrocarbon receptor (AHR) and diet-derived AHR ligands play an important part in protecting against tissue damage following viral pathogen infection in the lung.

heading: Interferon-ε is a tumour suppressor and restricts ovarian cancer
authors: Zoe R. C. MarksNicole K. CampbellPaul J. Hertzog
description: Interferon-ε is a tumour suppressor expressed in the epithelial cell of origin of ovarian cancer, which it restricts by direct action on tumour cells and especially by activation of anti-tumour immunity.

heading: Nuclear genetic control of mtDNA copy number and heteroplasmy in humans
description: We quantify mitochondrial DNA copy number and heteroplasmy levels and study their association with nuclear genetic loci in population-scale biobanks.

heading: Quantum textures of the many-body wavefunctions in magic-angle graphene
authors: Kevin P. NuckollsRyan L. LeeAli Yazdani
description: High-resolution scanning tunnelling microscopy is used to observe the quantum textures of the many-body wavefunctions of the correlated insulating, pseudogap and superconducting phases in magic-angle graphene.

heading: A viral ADP-ribosyltransferase attaches RNA chains to host proteins
description: Bacteriophage T4 uses an enzyme known as ADP-ribosyltransferase ModB to modify the translational apparatus of bacteria it infects, not only by ADP-ribosylating proteins, but also by attaching entire RNA chains in a process known as RNAylation.

heading: Platelet factors attenuate inflammation and rescue cognition in ageing
authors: Adam B. SchroerPatrick B. VenturaSaul A. Villeda
description: Platelet factors transfer the benefits of young blood to the ageing brain in mice through CXCR3, which mediates the cellular, molecular and cognitive benefits of systemic PF4 on the aged brain.

heading: Transient naive reprogramming corrects hiPS cells functionally and epigenetically
description: A new reprogramming strategy used to produce human induced pluripotent stem cells from somatic cells results in epigenetic and functional profiles that are highly similar to those of human embryonic stem cells.

heading: Global methane emissions from rivers and streams
authors: Gerard Rocher-RosEmily H. StanleyRyan A. Sponseller
description: A spatially explicit global estimate reveals that land–water connections are important for regulating methane supply to running waters, and that these connections are vulnerable to both climate change and direct human modifications of the land.

heading: Microstructure and crystal order during freezing of supercooled water drops
description: Optical microscopy and X-ray diffraction are used to study the freezing of water droplets in vacuum, leading to the development of a seven-stage model of freezing and the mapping of ice structures and crystal order.

heading: High-entropy halide perovskite single crystals stabilized by mild chemistry
description: Room-temperature-solution (20 °C) and low-temperature-solution (80 °C) synthesis procedures are developed for a new class of metal halide perovskite high-entropy semiconductor single crystals.

heading: Mapping the T cell repertoire to a complex gut bacterial community
description: Germ-free mice were colonized with complex defined communities to show T cell recognition of commensals is focused on widely conserved, highly expressed cell-surface antigens, opening the door to new therapeutic strategies.

heading: Persistent equatorial Pacific iron limitation under ENSO forcing
authors: Thomas J. BrowningMak A. SaitoAlessandro Tagliabue
description: An assessment of variations in phytoplankton nutrient limitation in the tropical Pacific over the past two decades finds that phytoplankton iron limitation is more stable in response to ENSO dynamics than models predict.

heading: Direct observation of the conformational states of PIEZO1
description: The plasma membrane can expand the blades of the PIEZO1 ion channel, impacting channel activation.

heading: Future emergence of new ecosystems caused by glacial retreat
description: By 2100, the decline of all glaciers outside the Antarctic and Greenland ice sheets will produce new terrestrial, marine and freshwater ecosystems, posing both challenges and opportunities for conservation.

heading: Reversible spin-optical interface in luminescent organic radicals
description: We report organic molecules showing both efficient luminescence and near-unity generation yield of excited states with high spin multiplicity, simultaneously supporting a high efficiency of initialization, spin manipulations and light-based readout at room temperature.

heading: New reptile shows dinosaurs and pterosaurs evolved among diverse precursors
authors: Rodrigo T. MüllerMartín D. EzcurraSterling J. Nesbitt
description: A well-preserved partial skeleton (Upper Triassic, Brazil) of the new lagerpetid Venetoraptor gassenae gen. et sp. nov. offers a more comprehensive look into the skull and ecology of dinosaur and pterosaur precursors.

heading: Proximity superconductivity in atom-by-atom crafted quantum dots
description: Proximity-induced superconductivity on a single spin-degenerate quantum level of a surface state confined in a quantum corral on a superconducting substrate built atom by atom by a scanning tunnelling microscope is investigated.

heading: Confirmation and refutation of very luminous galaxies in the early Universe
authors: Pablo Arrabal HaroMark DickinsonJorge A. Zavala
description: JWST spectroscopy confirms redshifts for two very luminous galaxies with z > 11, and also demonstrates that another candidate with suggested z ≈ 16 instead has z = 4.9.

heading: Neuronal migration prevents spatial competition in retinal morphogenesis
description: Experiments in zebrafish and human tissues show that, during retinal morphogenesis, emerging photoreceptor cells migrate in a bidirectional manner, which lessens competition for space and helps to ensure that the retina is formed correctly.

heading: No evidence for magnetic field effects on the behaviour of Drosophila
description: Following testing of magnetic field effects on 97,658 flies moving in a two-arm maze and on 10,960 flies performing spontaneous escape behaviour (negative geotaxis), no evidence was found for magnetically sensitive behaviour in Drosophila.

heading: Sustained wet–dry cycling on early Mars
description: Observations by the Curiosity rover at Gale Crater on Mars indicate that high-frequency wet–dry cycling occurred on the early Martian surface, indicating a possible seasonal climate conducive to prebiotic evolution on early Mars.

heading: Reversed Holocene temperature–moisture relationship in the Horn of Africa
authors: A. J. BaxterD. VerschurenJ. S. Sinninghe Damsté
description: Climate-proxy data indicate that during the last glacial period in the Horn of Africa higher temperatures were associated with greater moisture availability, whereas during the current interglacial period, as well as historically, higher temperatures have been associated with increased drought.

heading: Lactate limits CNS autoimmunity by stabilizing HIF-1α in dendritic cells
authors: Liliana M. SanmarcoJoseph M. RoneFrancisco J. Quintana
description: Lactate produced by dendritic cells (DCs) suppresses T-cell-mediated autoimmunity through a mechanism in which lactate activates HIF-1α–NDUFA4L2 signalling in DCs and thereby limits DC-mediated pro-inflammatory responses such as the development of encephalitogenic T cells.

heading: R-loop-dependent promoter-proximal termination ensures genome stability
description: SOSS–INTAC stimulates promoter-proximal termination of transcription and attenuates R-loops associated with paused RNA polymerase II to prevent R-loop-induced genome instability.

heading: Carbonate-rich crust subduction drives the deep carbon and chlorine cycles
authors: Chunfei ChenMichael W. FörsterSvyatoslav S. Shcheka
description: New experiments show that most carbonates in carbonate-rich crustal rocks survive devolatilization and hydrous melting in cold and warm subduction zones, demonstrating their role in driving the deep carbon and chlorine cycles since the Mesoproterozoic.

heading: Mitochondrial integrated stress response controls lung epithelial cell fate
description: This study highlights the role of mitochondrial complex I-dependent NAD+ regeneration in directing lung epithelial cell fate during postnatal alveolar development by preventing pathological integrated stress response induction.

heading: The recovery of European freshwater biodiversity has come to a halt
authors: Peter HaaseDiana E. BowlerEllen A. R. Welti
description: Improvements in European freshwater biodiversity occurred mainly before 2010 but have since plateaued, and communities downstream of dams, urban areas and cropland were less likely to experience recovery.

heading: Solid-body trajectoids shaped to roll along desired pathways
authors: Yaroslav I. SobolevRuoyu DongBartosz A. Grzybowski
description: An algorithm is developed to design a shape, a trajectoid, that can trace any given infinite periodic trajectory when rolling down a slope, finding unexpected implications for quantum and classical optics.

heading: Dopamine and glutamate regulate striatal acetylcholine in decision-making
authors: Lynne ChantranupongCelia C. BeronBernardo L. Sabatini
description: Experiments in mice provide insight into the dynamic relationship between dopamine and acetylcholine in the ventrolateral striatum and how this signalling circuit affects decision-making and behaviour.

heading: Europeans’ support for refugees of varying background is stable over time
description: Surveys conducted in 15 European countries in 2016 and 2022 show stable attitudes towards asylum seekers and refugees with different attributes over this period with a slight increase in support for asylum seekers in general.

heading: Pines’ demon observed as a 3D acoustic plasmon in Sr2RuO4
authors: Ali A. HusainEdwin W. HuangPeter Abbamonte
description: Evidence is presented for a Pines’ demon as a three-dimensional acoustic plasmon in the multiband metal Sr2RuO4 from momentum-resolved electron energy-loss spectroscopy using a collimated, defocused beam with high momentum resolution.

heading: Coral reefs benefit from reduced land–sea impacts under ocean warming
authors: Jamison M. GoveGareth J. WilliamsGregory P. Asner
description: Surveys of reef change are combined with a unique 20-year time series of land–sea human impacts and the results show that integrated land–sea management could help achieve coastal ocean conservation goals and provide coral reefs with the best opportunity to persist in our changing climate.

heading: TRIM5α restricts poxviruses and is antagonized by CypA and the viral protein C6
description: The well-characterized HIV restriction factor TRIM5α also restricts orthopoxviruses and is countered by the viral protein C6 and the proviral activity of CypA, which in turn is antagonized by CsA and derivatives alisporivir and NIM811.

heading: Intrinsic dopamine and acetylcholine dynamics in the striatum of mice
authors: Anne C. KrokMarta MalteseNicolas X. Tritsch
description: In the absence of reward, dopamine and acetylcholine levels in the striatum fluctuate in a phasic manner, with their dynamics autonomously organized by extra-striatal neurons.

heading: Tautomeric mixture coordination enables efficient lead-free perovskite LEDs
description: Lead-free perovskite light-emitting diodes (LEDs) prepared using tautomeric mixture coordination provide improved ordering in the crystal structure, reduced recombination and enhanced exciton binding energy compared with lead-containing perovskite-based LEDs.

heading: Dissecting human population variation in single-cell responses to SARS-CoV-2
description: Population differences in immune responses to SARS-CoV-2 can be explained by environmental exposures, but also by local adaptation acting through genetic variants acquired after admixture with archaic hominin forms.

heading: A cool runaway greenhouse without surface magma ocean
description: It is reported using a consistent climate model that pure steam atmospheres are commonly shaped by radiative layers, making their thermal structure strongly dependent on the stellar spectrum and internal heat flow.

heading: Tail engagement of arrestin at the glucagon receptor
description: Structures of the glucagon receptor bound to β-arrestin 1 are reported, providing further information about the arrestin-mediated modulation of G protein-coupled receptors.

heading: Diverse values of nature for sustainability
description: Following a wide-ranging review of studies, reports and policies about nature’s multiple values, combinations of values-centred approaches are proposed to improve valuation of nature, address barriers to uptake in decision-making, and make transformative changes towards more just and sustainable futures.

heading: Bonding wood with uncondensed lignins as adhesives
description: A straightforward strategy for preparing lignin-based wood adhesives from lignocellulosic biomass is described, with the resulting adhesives demonstrating performance attractive for plywood manufacture.

heading: Reply to: Revisiting the intrinsic mycobiome in pancreatic cancer
Synthesis and properties of cyclic sandwich compounds
description: The design, synthesis and characterization of a series of circular sandwich compounds, cyclocenes, is described, and these cyclic sandwich compounds are expected to lead to further innovations in new functional organometallic materials.

heading: Revisiting the intrinsic mycobiome in pancreatic cancer
authors: Ashley A. FletcherMatthew S. KellyPeter J. Allen

heading: 3D integration enables ultralow-noise isolator-free lasers in silicon photonics
description: Three-dimensional integration of distributed-feedback lasers and ultralow-loss silicon nitride waveguides results in ultralow-noise lasers without the need for optical isolators.

heading: Fennoscandian tree-ring anatomy shows a warmer modern than medieval climate
description: Annually resolved Fennoscandian tree-ring anatomy records show that the climate of the current industrial era is substantially warmer than that of the medieval period.

heading: A heavyweight early whale pushes the boundaries of vertebrate morphology
description: Perucetus colossus, a basilosaurid whale from the middle Eocene epoch of Peru with an extremely pachyosteosclerotic postcranium, is estimated to have a greater skeletal mass than any known mammal or aquatic vertebrate.

heading: GPCR activation and GRK2 assembly by a biased intracellular agonist
description: Structural studies on the complex containing G-protein-coupled receptor kinase 2 (GRK2), neurotensin receptor 1 (NTSR1), Gαq and the arrestin-biased ligand SBI-553 provide insights into these interactions and a foundation for the design of arrestin-biased ligands for G-protein-coupled receptors.

heading: Ultrafast deposition of faceted lithium polyhedra by outpacing SEI formation
description: We report the discovery of lithium metal’s intrinsic growth morphology, a rhombic dodecahedron, and leverage these rhombic dodecahedra as nucleation seeds for improved battery performance.

heading: Netrin-1 blockade inhibits tumour growth and EMT features in endometrial cancer
description: We describe netrin-1 upregulation in a majority of human endometrial carcinomas and demonstrate that netrin-1 blockade, using the anti-netrin-1 antibody NP137, is effective both in a mouse model and in patients with endometrial carcinomas.

heading: TDP-43 forms amyloid filaments with a distinct fold in type A FTLD-TDP
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures and mass spectrometry analyses show that TAR DNA-binding protein 43 (TDP-43) forms amyloid filaments with a distinct fold in type A frontotemporal lobar degeneration with TDP-43 pathology (FTLD-TDP) compared with TDP-43 filaments in type B FTLD-TDP and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.

heading: Pharmacological targeting of netrin-1 inhibits EMT in cancer
description: Netrin-1 is upregulated in cancer models that undergo spontaneous epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition, and its targeting blocks the progression of tumour cells to a late mesenchymal state, suggesting possible therapeutic applications.

heading: Frustration- and doping-induced magnetism in a Fermi–Hubbard simulator
description: The magnetic phases of the geometrically frustrated triangular lattice Hubbard model are directly investigated using ultracold fermionic atoms, indicating a possible transition to ferromagnetism at a filling of 1.2.

heading: Einkorn genomics sheds light on history of the oldest domesticated wheat
authors: Hanin Ibrahim AhmedMatthias HeubergerSimon G. Krattinger
description: Around 1% of the A subgenome of modern bread wheat (Triticum aestivum) originates from einkorn (Triticum monococcum), the first domesticated wheat species.

heading: Long-term organic carbon preservation enhanced by iron and manganese
authors: Oliver W. MooreLisa CurtiCaroline L. Peacock
description: Catalysis of simple organic carbon molecules into complex macromolecules by Fe and Mn may play a fundamental role in organic carbon preservation, to a degree that could substantially affect the Earth’s carbon and oxygen cycles.

heading: Consent document translation expense hinders inclusive clinical trial enrolment
authors: Maria A. VelezBeth A. GlennEdward B. Garon
description: The availability of translated consent documents improves recruitment of patients with limited English proficiency to clinical trials, indicating a potentially modifiable barrier to the inclusion of patients with limited English proficiency.

heading: Africa-specific human genetic variation near CHD1L associates with HIV-1 load
description: Africa-specific genetic variation on chromosome 1 near CHD1L is associated with HIV replication in vivo.

heading: Quantum oscillations of the quasiparticle lifetime in a metal
description: Quantum oscillations in the three-dimensional topological semimetal CoSi are reported, where selected oscillation frequencies have no corresponding extremal Fermi surface cross-sections, representing instead oscillations of the quasiparticle lifetime.

heading: cGAS–STING drives ageing-related inflammation and neurodegeneration
description: The cGAS–STING signalling pathway is a critical driver of chronic inflammation and functional decline during ageing, and could be targeted to halt neurodegenerative processes during old age.

heading: The break of earthquake asperities imaged by distributed acoustic sensing
description: Distributed acoustic sensing technology is utilized to image four high-frequency rupture subevents of the 2021 Antelope Valley, California, earthquake; the results indicate that the subevents are due to the breaking of fault asperities.

heading: Authigenic mineral phases as a driver of the upper-ocean iron cycle
description: Analysis of a new dissolved iron, ligand and particulate iron seasonal dataset shows that authigenic iron phases help control ocean dissolved iron distributions and the coupling between dissolved and particulate iron pools.

heading: Synergy and oxygen adaptation for development of next-generation probiotics
description: The anaerobic gut bacterium Faecalibacterium prausnitzii was isolated and adapted for oxygen tolerance to develop a next-generation probiotic for the treatment of conditions such as inflammatory bowel disease and type 2 diabetes.

heading: Spin-mediated shear oscillators in a van der Waals antiferromagnet
description: Using several ultrafast diffraction and microscopy techniques, demagnetization-driven interlayer shear of a van der Waals antiferromagnet is visualized at the nanoscale.

heading: Central role of Tim17 in mitochondrial presequence protein translocation
authors: Laura F. FieldenJakob D. BuschNils Wiedemann
description: Tim17 contains conserved negative charges close to the intermembrane space side of the bilayer, which are essential to initiate presequence protein translocation along a distinct transmembrane cavity of Tim17 for both classes of preproteins.

heading: Conserved class B GPCR activation by a biased intracellular agonist
description: A study reports an orally available small-molecule agonist that binds between a G protein and its receptor, and characterizes this new binding mode.

heading: Like-minded sources on Facebook are prevalent but not polarizing
description: A large-scale field intervention experiment on 23,377 US Facebook users during the 2020 presidential election shows that reducing exposure to content from like-minded social media sources has no measurable effect on political polarization or other political attitudes and beliefs.

heading: Reply to: Re-evaluating evidence for adaptive mutation rate variation
authors: J. Grey MonroeKevin D. MurrayDetlef Weigel

heading: Re-evaluating evidence for adaptive mutation rate variation
Evolutionary histories of breast cancer and related clones
description: By using phylogenetic analyses of multiple microdissected samples from both cancer and non-cancer lesions, unique evolutionary histories of breast cancers harbouring a common driver alteration are shown, providing new insight into how breast cancer evolves.

heading: Sub-1.4 cm3 capsule for detecting labile inflammatory biomarkers in situ
authors: M. E. Inda-WebbM. JimenezT. K. Lu
description: A biosensor comprising bacteria engineered to respond to transient inflammatory signals has been packaged with electronic readout and transmission circuits in a small device that could be swallowed to monitor gastrointestinal health.

heading: Global hotspots of traded phylogenetic and functional diversity
authors: Liam J. HughesMike R. MassamDavid P. Edwards
description: Using a global dataset of traded species, it is found that the highest levels of traded phylogenetic and functional diversity are from tropical regions, where high numbers of evolutionary distinct and globally endangered species occur.

heading: Oligomerization-mediated activation of a short prokaryotic Argonaute
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures and biochemical analyses provide insight into how short prokaryotic Argonaute proteins are assembled and activated, and reveal that oligomerization has a key role in driving catalytic activity.

heading: Rewiring cancer drivers to activate apoptosis
description: A new class of molecules can recruit downstream transcription factors or endogenous cancer drivers to cell death promoters and activate the expression of these genes.

heading: Small protein modules dictate prophage fates during polylysogeny
authors: Justin E. SilpeOlivia P. DuddyBonnie L. Bassler
description: Prophage lysogeny-to-lysis transitions are controlled by regulatory modules consisting of transcription factors and partner small proteins that are activated through DNA-damage-independent pathways, including by quorum sensing, and these modules determine inter-prophage competition outcomes.

heading: Accelerating the energy transition towards photovoltaic and wind in China
description: To meet China’s goal of carbon neutrality by 2060, substantial investment in upgrading power systems needs to be made to optimize the deployment of new photovoltaic and wind power plants.

heading: Subsecond periodic radio oscillations in a microquasar
description: Two instances of approximately 5-Hz transient periodic oscillation features from the source detected in the 1.05- to 1.45-GHz radio band that occurred in January 2021 and June 2022 are reported.

heading: Extensive pedigrees reveal the social organization of a Neolithic community
description: The burial community at Gurgy ‘les Noisats’ (France) was genetically connected by two main pedigrees, spanning seven generations, that were patrilocal and patrilineal, with evidence for female exogamy and exchange with genetically close neighbouring groups.

heading: Neural basis for fasting activation of the hypothalamic–pituitary–adrenal axis
authors: Amelia M. DouglassJon M. ReschBradford B. Lowell
description: Fasting-activated hypothalamic AgRP-expressing neurons trigger fasting-induced hypothalamic–pituitary–adrenal axis activation through projections to the paraventricular hypothalamus, where they activate CRH neurons by presynaptically inhibiting the terminals of tonically active GABAergic afferents from the bed nucleus of the stria terminalis.

heading: Evolutionarily divergent mTOR remodels translatome for tissue regeneration
description: Rapid activation of protein synthesis in the axolotl highlights the unanticipated impact of a translatome on orchestrating the early steps of wound healing and provides a missing link in our understanding of vertebrate regenerative potential.

heading: Thermodynamic evidence of fractional Chern insulator in moiré MoTe2
description: Thermodynamic evidence of both integer and fractional Chern insulators at zero magnetic field is reported in small-angle twisted bilayer MoTe2 by combining the local electronic compressibility and magneto-optical measurements.

heading: Heat-assisted detection and ranging
description: Heat-assisted detection and ranging is experimentally shown to see texture and depth through darkness as if it were day, and also perceives decluttered physical attributes beyond RGB or thermal vision.

heading: Rift-induced disruption of cratonic keels drives kimberlite volcanism
authors: Thomas M. GernonStephen M. JonesAnne Glerum
description: Most kimberlites erupting in the past billion years on Earth did so about 30 million years after continental breakup, with dynamical and analytical models suggesting a control from rifting-related mantle delamination.

heading: Earth’s evolving geodynamic regime recorded by titanium isotopes
description: Titanium isotope measurements for chondrites, ancient terrestrial mantle-derived lavas and modern ocean island basalts imply the preservation of a primordial lower-mantle reservoir for most of Earth’s geologic history.

heading: Universal equation of state for wave turbulence in a quantum gas
description: Equilibrium-like state variables, related by an equation of state, are identified in a study of turbulent cascade of matter waves in a far-from-equilibrium ultracold atomic Bose gas.

heading: Structure of an endogenous mycobacterial MCE lipid transporter
description: Proteins of the Mycobacterium smegmatis Mce1 system assemble to form an elongated ABC transporter complex that is long enough to span the impermeable mycobacterial cell envelope.

heading: Increased occurrences of consecutive La Niña events under global warming
description: Analysis of climate models under future greenhouse-gas forcings shows that the frequency of consecutive La Niña events will increase, driven by ocean–atmosphere feedbacks that slow the heat recharge of the equatorial Pacific.

heading: Mammary duct luminal epithelium controls adipocyte thermogenic programme
authors: Sanil PatelNjeri Z. R. SparmanPrashant Rajbhandari
description: In mice, sympathetic nerves associated with female mammary glands control the secretion of thermogenesis-controlling factors by epithelial cells in the adipocyte niche, revealing sex-specific differences in adipose thermogenesis.

heading: Water in the terrestrial planet-forming zone of the PDS 70 disk
description: Observations with the sensitive mid-infrared spectrometer MIRI on board JWST reveal the presence of a water vapour reservoir in the terrestrial plant-forming zone of the young planetary system PDS 70.

heading: Dilemma in optical identification of single-layer multiferroics
Reply to: Dilemma in optical identification of single-layer multiferroics
A spatially resolved timeline of the human maternal–fetal interface
description: A multiomics approach is used to produce a spatiotemporal atlas of the human maternal–fetal interface in the first half of pregnancy, revealing relationships among gestational age, extravillous trophoblasts and spiral artery remodelling.

heading: p53 governs an AT1 differentiation programme in lung cancer suppression
authors: Alyssa M. KaiserAlberto GattoLaura D. Attardi
description: p53 is shown to have a pivotal role in the differentiation of alveolar type 1 cells in cancer and alveolar repair after injury, and loss of this governance can promote diseases such as lung adenocarcinoma.

heading: KRAS(G12D) drives lepidic adenocarcinoma through stem-cell reprogramming
authors: Nicholas H. JuulJung-Ki YoonTushar J. Desai
description: A study identifies the AT1 cell as a cell of origin for lung adenocarcinoma, and demonstrates that expression of oncogenic KRAS in differentiated AT1 cells reprograms them back into AT2 stem cells that generate indolent lepidic tumours.

heading: Extreme dynamics in a biomolecular condensate
description: Two highly charged disordered human proteins phase-separate into viscous complex coacervates while retaining their rapid conformational dynamics through pico- to nanosecond exchange of short-lived side-chain interactions.

heading: A common allele of HLA is associated with asymptomatic SARS-CoV-2 infection
authors: Danillo G. AugustoLawton D. MurdoloJill A. Hollenbach
description: The human leukocyte antigen allele HLA-B*15:01 is associated with asymptomatic SARS-CoV-2 infection due to pre-existing T cell immunity.

heading: Autonomous healing of fatigue cracks via cold welding
authors: Christopher M. BarrTa DuongBrad L. Boyce
description: We report that fatigue cracks in pure metals can undergo intrinsic self-healing; they were observed to heal by crack flank cold welding induced by local stress state and grain boundary migration.

heading: A rotating white dwarf shows different compositions on its opposite faces
authors: Ilaria CaiazzoKevin B. BurdgeDave I. Sahman
description: The Zwicky Transient Facility has observed a transitioning white dwarf with two faces, with one side of its atmosphere dominated by hydrogen and the other by helium.

heading: Superconductivity and strong interactions in a tunable moiré quasicrystal
authors: Aviram UriSergio C. de la BarreraPablo Jarillo-Herrero
description: A moiré quasicrystal constructed by twisting three layers of graphene with two different twist angles shows high tunability between a periodic-like regime at low energies and a strongly quasiperiodic regime at higher energies alongside strong interactions and superconductivity.

heading: A long-period radio transient active for three decades
description: The discovery of a long-period radio transient, GPM J1839–10, prompted a search of radio archives, thereby finding that this source has been repeating since at least 1988.

heading: The global wildland–urban interface
description: A global assessment shows that the wildland–urban interface occurs on all continents, showing its broad-scale patterns and providing a basis for future research on dynamics and socioeconomic and biophysical processes.

heading: Early contact between late farming and pastoralist societies in southeastern Europe
description: Archaeogenetic analysis of 135 individuals from the zone between southeastern Europe and the northwestern Black Sea region indicates contacts between farming and pastoralist populations at the end of the Copper Age.

heading: RNA polymerase II associates with active genes during DNA replication
description: Protein complexes containing RNA polymerase II and immature RNA are associated with active genes immediately after replication, suggesting that transmission of active transcriptional states to daughter cells may not require any additional epigenetic bookmarks.

heading: Diverse modes of H3K36me3-guided nucleosomal deacetylation by Rpd3S
description: Structural and biochemical studies of the Saccharomyces cerevisiae Rpd3 small complex in free and H3K36me3 nucleosome-bound states reveal multiple nucleosome-binding modes and provide insights into mechanisms underlying epigenetic regulation by histone modification.

heading: Spin–vibronic coherence drives singlet–triplet conversion
authors: Shahnawaz R. RatherNicholas P. WeingartzLin X. Chen
description: Many aspects of materials chemistry rely on singlet–triplet spin conversion, but spin–vibronic effects are shown to accelerate the process when vibronic coupling causes the quantum-mechanical mixing of spin states.

heading: An atlas of healthy and injured cell states and niches in the human kidney
description: A high-resolution kidney cellular atlas of 51 main cell types, including rare and previously undescribed cell populations, represents a comprehensive benchmark of cellular states, neighbourhoods, outcome-associated signatures and publicly available interactive visualizations.

heading: Mixing of moiré-surface and bulk states in graphite
description: The electronic states in three-dimensional crystals such as graphite can be tuned by a superlattice potential occurring at the interface with crystallographically aligned hexagonal boron nitride.

heading: Mixed-dimensional moiré systems of twisted graphitic thin films
description: Transport measurements of dual-gated devices constructed by slightly rotating a monolayer graphene sheet atop a thin bulk graphite crystal are performed, showing that moiré potential transforms the electronic properties of an entire graphitic thin film.

heading: Mega-scale experimental analysis of protein folding stability in biology and design
description: Large-scale assays using cDNA display proteolysis are used to measure the folding stabilities of protein domains, providing a method to quantify the effects of mutations on protein folding, with applications in protein design.

heading: Organization of the human intestine at single-cell resolution
authors: John W. HickeyWinston R. BeckerMichael Snyder
description: Intestinal cell types are organized into distinct neighbourhoods and communities within the healthy human intestine, with distinct immunological niches.

heading: Diverse clonal fates emerge upon drug treatment of homogeneous cancer cells
description: Anti-cancer treatment often results in a subset of the clonal cell population developing resistance to therapy, with resistant cells displaying a diversity of fate types resulting from the intrinsic variability among the clonal population before treatment.

heading: Carbonaceous dust grains seen in the first billion years of cosmic time
authors: Joris WitstokIrene ShivaeiChristopher N. A. Willmer
description: An (ultraviolet) dust attenuation feature at 2,175 Å, attributed to carbonaceous dust grains in the Milky Way and nearby galaxies, also exists in galaxies up to a redshift of 7.

heading: Indirect effects shape species fitness in coevolved mutualistic networks
authors: Leandro G. CosmoAna Paula A. AssisPaulo R. Guimarães Jr
description: A numerical analysis of mutualistic interactions between species shows that indirect effects from species they do not interact with directly are the biggest source of variation and cause the largest decreases to species fitness.

heading: Molecular features driving cellular complexity of human brain evolution
description: A single-cell genomics analysis of humans, chimpanzees and rhesus macaques reveals the molecular features that drive cellular and regulatory complexity of human brain evolution.

heading: A cell-type-specific error-correction signal in the posterior parietal cortex
authors: Jonathan GreenCarissa A. BrunoChristopher D. Harvey
description: A molecularly defined subset of somatostatin-positive inhibitory neurons in the mouse posterior parietal cortex carries a cell-type-specific error-correction signal for navigation.

heading: OBOX regulates mouse zygotic genome activation and early development
description: OBOX, PRD-like homeobox domain transcription factors (OBOX1–OBOX8), are key regulators of mouse zygotic genome activation and early embryogenesis.

heading: Reply to: Cold induction of nuclear FRIGIDA condensation in Arabidopsis
Cold induction of nuclear FRIGIDA condensation in Arabidopsis
Co-transplantation of autologous Treg cells in a cell therapy for Parkinson’s disease
description: In mouse and rat models of Parkinson’s disease, co-transplanting regulatory T cells (Treg cells) improves the survival of grafted midbrain dopamine neurons in cell therapies by reducing the inflammatory response caused by surgical injury.

heading: Assembly of functional diversity in an oceanic island flora
authors: Martha Paola Barajas BarbosaDylan CravenHolger Kreft
description: On the oceanic island of Tenerife, dispersal, speciation and persistence drive the diversity and distribution of plant functional traits.

heading: Large language models encode clinical knowledge
description: Med-PaLM, a state-of-the-art large language model for medicine, is introduced and evaluated across several medical question answering tasks, demonstrating the promise of these models in this domain.

heading: Agricultural pesticide land budget and river discharge to oceans
authors: Federico MaggiFiona H. M. TangFrancesco N. Tubiello
description: A global assessment of the mobility of 92 agricultural pesticides from points of application in major agricultural catchments downstream to rivers and oceans identifies flow pathways and pollution hotspots in which monitoring could improve risk mitigation.

heading: Mast cells link immune sensing to antigen-avoidance behaviour
description: Mast cells are shown to function as sensor cells linking antigen recognition in type 2 immunity to antigen-specific avoidance behaviour, preventing immune activation and inflammation.

heading: Homomeric chains of intermolecular bonds scaffold octahedral germanium perovskites
authors: Amin Morteza NajarianFilip DinicEdward H. Sargent
description: We report assembly of an organic scaffold within perovskite structures, resulting in the suppression of the lone pair expression of Ge and templating the symmetric octahedra.

heading: Linear-in-temperature resistivity for optimally superconducting (Nd,Sr)NiO2
authors: Kyuho LeeBai Yang WangHarold Y. Hwang
description: By moving to a substrate that better stabilizes conditions, the doping series of Nd1–xSrxNiO2 is synthesized free from extended defects, resulting in enhancement of superconductivity in terms of transition temperature and range of doping.

heading: Generation of genuine entanglement up to 51 superconducting qubits
description: A scalable approach is provided for preparing and verifying intermediate-scale genuine entanglement on a 66-qubit superconducting quantum processor.

heading: Immune sensing of food allergens promotes avoidance behaviour
authors: Esther B. FlorsheimNathaniel D. BachtelRuslan Medzhitov
description: A study using mouse models of food allergy shows that allergic sensitization drives antigen-specific avoidance behaviour mediated by immunoglobulin E antibodies and mast cells.

heading: PLSCR1 is a cell-autonomous defence factor against SARS-CoV-2 infection
description: Phospholipid scramblase 1 (PLSCR1), a protein induced by IFNγ, acts as a defence factor against SARS-CoV-2 and other coronaviruses by inhibiting the fusion of the virus with host-cell membranes.

heading: Retrotransposons hijack alt-EJ for DNA replication and eccDNA biogenesis
description: Retrotransposons hijack the alternative end-joining DNA repair process of the host for a circularization step to synthesize their second-strand DNA.

heading: Diverse organic-mineral associations in Jezero crater, Mars
description: Raman and fluorescence spectra, consistent with several species of aromatic organic molecules, are reported in the Crater Floor sequences of Jezero crater, Mars, suggesting multiple mechanisms of organic synthesis, transport, or preservation.

heading: Fluidic self-assembly for MicroLED displays by controlled viscosity
