heading: De novo design of luciferases using deep learning
description: A deep-learning-based strategy is used to design artificial luciferases that catalyse the oxidative chemiluminescence of diphenylterazine with high substrate specificity and catalytic efficiency.

heading: Topological spin texture in the pseudogap phase of a high-Tc superconductor
description: Using Lorentz transmission electron microscopy, one of the first direct observations of topological spin texture is described, in the pseudogap phase of a high-temperature cuprate superconductor based on YBa2Cu3O6+x.

heading: Autoimmunity in Down’s syndrome via cytokines, CD4 T cells and CD11c+ B cells
description: An autoimmune-prone state of steady-state cytokinopathy, hyperactivated CD4 T cells and ongoing B cell activation contributes to a breach in immune tolerance in individuals with Down’s syndrome.

heading: Suppressing quantum errors by scaling a surface code logical qubit
description: A study demonstrating increasing error suppression with larger surface code logical qubits, implemented on a superconducting quantum processor.

heading: A population of red candidate massive galaxies ~600 Myr after the Big Bang
description: James Webb Space Telescope early release observations used to search for intrinsically red galaxies from the first 750 million years of cosmic history find six candidate massive galaxies, possibly including one of roughly 1011 solar masses.

heading: Sequence determinant of small RNA production by DICER
description: Massively parallel assays reveal a highly conserved sequence motif termed the GYM motif, which potentiates RNA interference by directing Dicer-mediated small RNA processing.

heading: Controlled growth of perovskite layers with volatile alkylammonium chlorides
description: In situ grazing-incidence wide-angle X-ray diffraction and scanning electron microscopy were used to evaluate the crystallization process and surface morphology of perovskite thin films coated with alkylammonium chlorides, which were used to fabricate high-efficiency perovskite solar cells.

heading: The case for standardizing gene nomenclature in vertebrates
authors: Fiona M. McCarthyTamsin E. M. JonesElspeth A. Bruford

heading: Reply to: The case for standardizing gene nomenclature in vertebrates
Evidence for Dirac flat band superconductivity enabled by quantum geometry
description: The authors investigate the effect of small velocity in a superconducting Dirac flat band system, finding evidence for small pairs and that superfluid stiffness is not dominated by kinetic energy.

heading: Spherical symmetry in the kilonova AT2017gfo/GW170817
description: Spectra taken after the kilonova associated with GW170817 show a high degree of spherical symmetry and a line shape is found that is consistent with a completely spherical expansion to within a few per cent.

heading: Core origin of seismic velocity anomalies at Earth’s core–mantle boundary
description: Investigations of the crystallization of FeSi in Fe–Si–H melt under high pressure−temperature conditions provide evidence of a new process that explains geochemical and geophysical observations at the core–mantle boundary.

heading: Electronic metadevices for terahertz applications
description: Through microscopic manipulation of radiofrequency fields, a new class of compact terahertz devices is proposed, setting the stage for next-generation ultrafast semiconductor electronics.

heading: Suppressed basal melting in the eastern Thwaites Glacier grounding zone
authors: Peter E. D. DavisKeith W. NichollsKeith Makinson
description: Despite observations from a hot-water-drilled access hole showing warm ocean waters beneath Thwaites Glacier Eastern Ice Shelf, the basal melt rate is strongly suppressed due to the low current speeds and strong density stratification.

heading: Less extreme and earlier outbursts of ice-dammed lakes since 1900
description: An assessment of ice-dam failures in six mountain regions shows that extreme peak flows and volumes have declined sharply since 1900, and that ice-dam floods today originate at higher elevations and earlier in the year.

heading: A universal interface for plug-and-play assembly of stretchable devices
description: A universal interface connects soft, rigid and encapsulation modules together to form robust, stretchable devices in a plug-and-play manner by pressing without using pastes, which will simplify and accelerate development of on-skin and implantable devices.

heading: A NPAS4–NuA4 complex couples synaptic activity to DNA repair
authors: Elizabeth A. PollinaDaniel T. GilliamMichael E. Greenberg
description: A neuron-specific activity-dependent DNA repair mechanism is identified, the impairment of which may lead to neurodevelopmental disorders, neurodegeneration and ageing.

heading: Effects of moisture and density-dependent interactions on tropical tree diversity
description: Moist soil strengthens density-dependent mortality with long-lasting effects on species diversity of tropical trees.

heading: Origination of the modern-style diversity gradient 15 million years ago
authors: Isabel S. FentonTracy AzeErin E. Saupe
description: Quantification of planktonic fossils from the past 40 million years shows that the present-day diversity gradient arose only 15 million years ago as the climate started to cool.

heading: Realization of a minimal Kitaev chain in coupled quantum dots
description: A minimal artificial Kitaev chain can be realized by using two spin-polarized quantum dots in an InSb nanowire strongly coupled by both elastic co-tunnelling and crossed Andreev reflection.

heading: Heterogeneous melting near the Thwaites Glacier grounding line
description: Thwaites Eastern Ice Shelf observations from a new underwater vehicle show that high melt rates occur where ice is sharply sloped at the ocean interface, with lower melt where the ice is comparatively flat.

heading: Late Cenozoic cooling restructured global marine plankton communities
description: Analysis of Triton, a high-resolution dataset documenting the macroperforate planktonic foraminifera fossil record, reveals a global climate-linked equatorward shift of ecological and morphological community equitability over the past 8 million years.

heading: Structure and thiazide inhibition mechanism of the human Na–Cl cotransporter
description: Using cryo-electron microscopy, the structures of human Na–Cl cotransporter are determined alone and in complex with a thiazide diuretic.

heading: Autonomous self-burying seed carriers for aerial seeding
description: A study describes a wood-based, three-tailed, biodegradable seed carrier that self-drills into the ground in response to moisture fluctuations with a success rate higher than that of natural self-drilling seeds.

heading: Enantioselective transition-metal catalysis via an anion-binding approach
authors: John M. OvianPetra VojáčkováEric N. Jacobsen
description: Chiral hydrogen-bond donors bind anions of organometallic catalysts to achieve enantiocontrol and reaction-rate enhancement through ion pairing together with other non-covalent interactions.

heading: Reply to: Concerns about data linking delta land gain to human action
authors: J. H. NienhuisA. D. AshtonT. E. Törnqvist

heading: Concerns about data linking delta land gain to human action
Aberrant phase separation and nucleolar dysfunction in rare genetic diseases
description: Frameshift mutations that create arginine-rich basic tails in transcription factors and other proteins can lead to altered phase separation in the nucleolus, which in turn leads to syndromes such as brachyphalangy, polydactyly and tibial aplasia.

heading: An E1–E2 fusion protein primes antiviral immune signalling in bacteria
authors: Hannah E. LedvinaQiaozhen YeAaron T. Whiteley
description: This study demonstrates that bacteria use a ubiquitin transferase-like enzyme to prime cGAS/DncV-like nucleotidyltransferase activation and use a deubiquitinase-like enzyme to decrease activity.

heading: Spin-polarized spatially indirect excitons in a topological insulator
description: A topological insulator, Bi2Te3, has been found to have spatially indirect spin-polarized excitonic states, opening the prospect of combining exciton and topological physics.

heading: TET2 guards against unchecked BATF3-induced CAR T cell expansion
description: Disruption of TET2 increases the antitumour efficacy of CAR T cells, but establishes an epigenetic state that is prone to hyperproliferation and accumulation of secondary mutations.

heading: Extensive global wetland loss over the past three centuries
authors: Etienne Fluet-ChouinardBenjamin D. StockerPeter B. McIntyre
description: We reconstruct the spatial distribution and timing of wetland loss through conversion to seven human land uses between 1700 and 2020, elucidating the magnitude and land-use drivers of global wetland losses to improve assessments of wetland loss impacts.

heading: A dense ring of the trans-Neptunian object Quaoar outside its Roche limit
authors: B. E. MorgadoB. SicardyJ. de Wit
description: The authors report observations of a dense and inhomogeneous ring at a surprisingly large distance from the trans-Neptunian body Quaoar.

heading: Water splitting with silicon p–i–n superlattices suspended in solution
authors: Taylor S. TeitsworthDavid J. HillJames F. Cahoon
description: The simplicity of particle suspension reactors and the precise synthetic control afforded by silicon nanowire growth are used to develop a system that can produce hydrogen fuel by splitting water with sunlight.

heading: The cellular coding of temperature in the mammalian cortex
authors: M. VestergaardM. CartaJ. F. A. Poulet
description: A study using calcium imaging in the mouse forepaw system identifies neurons in the posterior insular cortex that respond to cooling and/or warming with distinct response dynamics.

heading: Dissecting cell identity via network inference and in silico gene perturbation
description: A machine-learning-based strategy called CellOracle combines computational perturbation with modelling of gene-regulatory networks to analyse how cell identity is regulated by transcription factors, and correctly predicts phenotypic changes after transcription factor perturbation in the developing zebrafish.

heading: Electrolyte design for Li-ion batteries under extreme operating conditions
description: An electrolyte design strategy based on a group of soft solvents is used to achieve lithium-ion batteries that operate safely under extreme conditions without lithium plating and with the capability of fast charging.

heading: The structural basis for HIV-1 Vif antagonism of human APOBEC3G
authors: Yen-Li LiCaroline A. LangleyJohn D. Gross
description: The authors report the cryo-EM structure of human A3G bound to HIV-1 Vif, and the hijacked cellular proteins that promote ubiquitin-mediated proteolysis, suggesting how Vif antagonizes A3G by intercepting it to prevent viral restriction.

heading: Severe multi-year drought coincident with Hittite collapse around 1198–1196 bc
authors: Sturt W. ManningCindy KocikJed P. Sparks
description: Tree-ring analysis is correlated with stable isotope data and historical texts to identify an unusual multi-year period of drought from around 1198 to 1196 bc associated with the collapse of the Hittite Empire.

heading: Operando studies reveal active Cu nanograins for CO2 electroreduction
description: By investigation of structural dynamics during the life cycle of Cu nanocatalysts, correlation of multimodal operando techniques was found to serve as a powerful platform to advance understanding of their complex structural evolution.

heading: Telomere-to-mitochondria signalling by ZBP1 mediates replicative crisis
description: Dysfunctional telomeres activate innate immune responses through mitochondrial TERRA–ZBP1 complexes to eliminate cells that are destined for neoplastic transformation.

heading: Polygenic architecture of rare coding variation across 394,783 exomes
authors: Daniel J. WeinerAjay NadigLuke J. O’Connor
description: An analysis of rare coding variants across 22 common traits and diseases indicates that these variants will contribute substantially to biological insights but modestly to population risk stratification.

heading: Universal logic with encoded spin qubits in silicon
authors: Aaron J. WeinsteinMatthew D. ReedMatthew G. Borselli
description: In this alternative approach to quantum computation, the all-electrical operation of two qubits, each encoded in three physical solid-state spin qubits, realizes swap-based universal quantum logic in an extensible physical architecture.

heading: Reply to: GOT1 constrains TH17 cell differentiation, while promoting iTreg cell differentiation
A high-mass X-ray binary descended from an ultra-stripped supernova
authors: Noel D. RichardsonClarissa M. PavaoJeremy Hare
description: A recently discovered high-mass X-ray binary has an evolutionary history showing the neutron star component formed during an ultra-stripped supernova, and has orbital elements that should allow for forming a binary neutron star in the future.

heading: Biomolecular analyses enable new insights into ancient Egyptian embalming
authors: Maxime RageotRamadan B. HusseinPhilipp W. Stockhammer
description: Philological analysis of labels and instructions, together with gas chromatography–mass spectrometry analysis of residues on vessels recovered from a 26th Dynasty embalming workshop at Saqqara, Egypt provide insights into ancient Egyptian embalming practices.

heading: mRNA ageing shapes the Cap2 methylome in mammalian mRNA
description: Cap2 methylation increases on transcripts as they age, reducing activation of innate immunity.

heading: Field-linked resonances of polar molecules
description: A type of universal scattering resonance between ultracold microwave-dressed polar molecules associated with field-linked tetramer bound states in the long-range potential well is observed, providing a general strategy for resonant scattering between ultracold polar molecules.

heading: Exceptional fossil preservation and evolution of the ray-finned fish brain
description: A well-preserved 319-million-year-old brain of the extinct vertebrate Coccocephalus wildi provides insights into neural anatomy deep within the phylogeny of ray-finned fish.

heading: GOT1 constrains TH17 cell differentiation, while promoting iTreg cell differentiation
authors: Wei XuChirag H. PatelJonathan D. Powell

heading: A Feshbach resonance in collisions between triplet ground-state molecules
description: Observations of a pronounced and narrow Feshbach resonance in collisions between two triplet ground-state NaLi molecules are described, providing evidence for the existence of long-lived coherent intermediate complexes even in systems without reaction barriers.

heading: Reducing affinity as a strategy to boost immunomodulatory antibody agonism
authors: Xiaojie YuChristian M. OrrMark S. Cragg
description: In contrast to direct-targeting monoclonal antibodies, low affinity confers agonistic monoclonal antibodies with more potency.

heading: Slow TCA flux and ATP production in primary solid tumours but not metastases
authors: Caroline R. BartmanDaniel R. WeilandtJoshua D. Rabinowitz
description: As solid tumours develop, cancer cells shed energetically expensive tissue-specific functions, enabling uncontrolled growth despite a limited ability to produce ATP.

heading: Single-cell spatial immune landscapes of primary and metastatic brain tumours
authors: Elham KarimiMiranda W. YuLogan A. Walsh
description: Imaging mass cytometry of human brain tumours provides spatial information that, combined with existing transcriptomic data, reveals the existence of a cellular neighbourhood containing a rare macrophage population associated with prolonged survival.

heading: Probing site-resolved correlations in a spin system of ultracold molecules
authors: Lysander ChristakisJason S. RosenbergWaseem S. Bakr
description: Experiments demonstrate the powerful capabilities of ultracold molecules to study dynamics in the context of quantum magnetism, and create new possibilities for studying quantum physics with ultracold molecules more broadly.

heading: Measurement of the axial vector form factor from antineutrino–proton scattering
description: The authors measure the nucleon axial vector form factor, which encodes information on the distribution of the nucleon weak charge, through antineutrino–proton scattering.

heading: Vertical full-colour micro-LEDs via 2D materials-based layer transfer
description: We report full-colour, vertically stacked µLEDs that achieve exceptionally high array density (5,100 pixels per inch) and small size (4 µm) via a 2D material-based layer transfer technique, allowing the creation of full-colour µLED displays for augmented and virtual reality.

heading: Structural basis for substrate selection by the SARS-CoV-2 replicase
authors: Brandon F. MaloneJason K. PerrySeth A. Darst
description: Cryo-EM is used to visualize the SARS-CoV-2 RTC bound to each of the natural NTPs as well as remdesivir triphosphate (RDV-TP) in states poised for incorporation, explaining the interactions required for NTP recognition and RDV-TP selectivity.

heading: Pseudospin-selective Floquet band engineering in black phosphorus
description: In black phosphorus, a model semiconductor, analysis of time and angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy measurements demonstrates a strong light-induced band renormalization with light polarization dependence, suggesting pseudospin-selective Floquet band engineering.

heading: Tunable itinerant spin dynamics with polar molecules
description: Tunable itinerant spin dynamics enabled by dipolar interactions are demonstrated with polar molecules, establishing an interacting spin platform that allows for exploration of many-body spin dynamics and spin-motion physics using strong, tunable dipolar interaction.

heading: Single-cell spatial landscapes of the lung tumour immune microenvironment
description: Using imaging mass cytometry, the tumour and immunological spatial landscapes of 416 lung adenocarcinomas are characterized, which, when combined with deep learning, can predict clinical outcomes with high accuracy.

heading: Architecture of chloroplast TOC–TIC translocon supercomplex
description: A cryo-electron microscopy analysis of the Chlamydomonas reinhardtii TOC–TIC supercomplex reveals that Tic214 traverses the chloroplast inner membrane, the intermembrane space and the outer membrane, connecting the TOC complex with the TIC proteins.

heading: Organic reaction mechanism classification using machine learning
description: Mechanistic elucidation through currently available kinetic analysis is limited by mathematical approximations and human interpretation, here a deep neural network model has been trained to analyse ordinary kinetic data and automatically elucidate the corresponding mechanism class.

heading: Visualization of translation and protein biogenesis at the ER membrane
description: Structural studies of the ribosome-associated endoplasmic reticulum translocon complex based on cryo-electron tomography and molecular modelling reveal multiple intermediate states and interactions between the components of the complex and its cofactors.

heading: Attosecond field emission
description: By using sub-cycle light transients to induce optical field emission of electron pulses from tungsten nanotips and a weak replica of the same transient, investigation of attosecond emission dynamics in real time is demonstrated.

heading: Stigma receptors control intraspecies and interspecies barriers in Brassicaceae
description: A signalling mechanism ensuring intraspecies and interspecies reproductive barriers in flowering plants is uncovered.

heading: Tissue CD14+CD8+ T cells reprogrammed by myeloid cells and modulated by LPS
authors: Laura J. PallettLeo SwadlingMala K. Maini
description: Bacterial products in the gut–liver axis and tissue stromal factors can tune liver immunity by driving myeloid instruction of CD8+ T cells with immunomodulatory ability.

heading: Structure of the lysosomal mTORC1–TFEB–Rag–Ragulator megacomplex
description: Cryogenic-electron microscopy is used to determine the structure of TFEB as presented to mTORC1 for phosphorylation and an explanation is found for the strong dependence of TFEB phosphorylation on FLCN and the RagC GDP state.

heading: Annelid functional genomics reveal the origins of bilaterian life cycles
authors: Francisco M. Martín-ZamoraYan LiangJosé M. Martín-Durán
description: Comparative chromosome-scale genome sequencing and transcriptomic and epigenomic profiling of three different species of annelid provide insight into the evolutionary origin of larvae.

heading: Down-conversion of a single photon as a probe of many-body localization
description: An experiment is described in which the conversion of a single photon in a multimode cavity into a shower of low-energy photons was attempted, but failed owing to many-body localization and violation of Fermi’s golden rule.

heading: A Prox1 enhancer represses haematopoiesis in the lymphatic vasculature
description: A transcriptional enhancer element regulates Prox1 expression and lymphatic endothelial cell identity.

heading: Structural basis of Rho-dependent transcription termination
description: Structures presented in this study confirm decades of genetic and biochemical evidence for the mechanism of Rho-dependent termination in bacteria.

heading: Mitochondrial complexome reveals quality-control pathways of protein import
description: An analysis of MitCOM—a comprehensive resource for the identification, organization and interaction of mitochondrial machineries and pathways in yeast—identifies a constitutive pathway for the removal of preproteins.

heading: Triassic stem caecilian supports dissorophoid origin of living amphibians
authors: Ben T. KligmanBryan M. GeeMichelle R. Stocker
description: Analysis of fossils of the oldest known caecilian provide insights into the origin and morphological and functional evolution of caecilians.

heading: A wearable cardiac ultrasound imager
description: Innovations in device design, material fabrication and deep learning are described, leading to a wearable ultrasound transducer capable of dynamic cardiac imaging in various environments and under different conditions.

heading: Insulin-regulated serine and lipid metabolism drive peripheral neuropathy
authors: Michal K. HandzlikJivani M. GengatharanChristian M. Metallo
description: Serine deficiency can increase small fibre neuropathy in wild-type mice and serine replacement in diabetic mice alleviates diabetic neuropathy, directly linking amino acid metabolism to peripheral nerve disorders.

heading: Observation of intrinsic chiral bound states in the continuum
description: Chiral metasurfaces have been produced, with experimental observation of intrinsic chiral bound states in the continuum, which may lead to applications in chiral light sources and detectors, chiral sensing, valleytronics and asymmetric photocatalysis.

heading: Spontaneous behaviour is structured by reinforcement without explicit reward
authors: Jeffrey E. MarkowitzWinthrop F. GillisSandeep Robert Datta
description: Photometric recordings and optogenetic manipulation show that dopamine fluctuations in the dorsolateral striatum in mice modulate the use, sequencing and vigour of behavioural modules during spontaneous behaviour.

heading: Modern temperatures in central–north Greenland warmest in past millennium
description: A reconstruction of temperatures in central and north Greenland from ad 1000 to 2011 shows that that the final decade of this period was on average 1.5 ± 0.4 °C warmer compared to pre-industrial temperatures, accompanied by increased meltwater run-off.

heading: Magnetically mediated hole pairing in fermionic ladders of ultracold atoms
description: The direct observation of hole pairing in a doped Hubbard model is demonstrated using ultracold atoms in a quantum gas microscope setting by engineering mixed-dimensional fermionic ladders.

heading: Mono- and biallelic variant effects on disease at biobank scale
authors: H. O. HeyneJ. KarjalainenM. J. Daly
description: An analysis of biobank data from the FinnGen project examines dosage effects of genetic variants on disease, andidentifies a benefit when considering more complex inheritance in the genetics of common as well as Mendelian diseases.

heading: A molecular network of conserved factors keeps ribosomes dormant in the egg
description: Mass spectrometry and structural studies demonstrate the specific changes in protein composition that accompany the transition of ribosomes in zebrafish and Xenopus eggs from a dormant to an active state during early embryogenesis.

heading: Octupole-driven magnetoresistance in an antiferromagnetic tunnel junction
description: The authors report observation of tunnelling magnetoresistance in an all-antiferromagnetic tunnel junction consisting of Mn3Sn/MgO/Mn3Sn, laying the foundation for the development of ultrafast and efficient spintronic devices using antiferromagnets.

heading: In-plane charged domain walls with memristive behaviour in a ferroelectric film
description: The direct observation of in-plane charged domain walls in BiFeO3 ferroelectric films a few nanometres thick, their deterministic creation, manipulation and annihilation by applied voltage, as well the demonstration of their memristive functionality is reported.

heading: Preparing random states and benchmarking with many-body quantum chaos
description: An emergent randomness arising from partial measurement of an interacting many-body system is uncovered, and a widely applicable fidelity estimation scheme is presented that works at shorter evolution times and with reduced experimental complexity.

heading: Mesolimbic dopamine adapts the rate of learning from action
authors: Luke T. CoddingtonSarah E. LindoJoshua T. Dudman
description: Analysis of data collected from mice learning a trace conditioning paradigm shows that phasic dopamine activity in the brain can regulate direct learning of behavioural policies, and dopamine sets an adaptive learning rate rather than an error-like teaching signal.

heading: Functional T cells are capable of supernumerary cell division and longevity
description: Through iterative cycles of viral challenge and rechallenge over ten years, mouse T cells are demonstrated to have essentially infinite potential for population expansion and longevity without malignant transformation or loss of functional competence.

heading: Room-temperature magnetoresistance in an all-antiferromagnetic tunnel junction
description: A new exchange-bias effect between two different antiferromagnetic layers enables the fabrication of all-antiferromagnetic structures that have a large room-temperature tunnelling magnetoresistance and potential applications for ultrafast memory technologies.

heading: Giant spin polarization and a pair of antiparallel spins in a chiral superconductor
description: The simultaneous observation of spin–orbit interaction enhancement and chirality represented by a pair of oppositely polarized spins is reported for an organic chiral superconductor in the vicinity of the superconducting transition temperature.

heading: FinnGen provides genetic insights from a well-phenotyped isolated population
description: Genome-wide association studies of individuals from an isolated population (data from the Finnish biobank study FinnGen) and consequent meta-analyses facilitate the identification of previously unknown coding variant associations for both rare and common diseases.

heading: Stellar initial mass function varies with metallicity and time
description: A direct star-counting method of about 93,000 M-dwarf stars in the solar neighbourhood indicates a variable stellar initial mass function that depends on both metallicity and stellar age.

heading: Coherent correlation imaging for resolving fluctuating states of matter
description: Nanoscale magnetic fluctuations are spatiotemporally resolved beyond conventional resolution limits using coherent correlation imaging, in which frames in Fourier space are recorded and analysed using an iterative hierarchical clustering algorithm.

heading: Rotational multimaterial printing of filaments with subvoxel control
authors: Natalie M. LarsonJochen MuellerJennifer A. Lewis
description: A 3D printing platform comprising a rotational multimaterial printhead is demonstrated, enabling the fabrication of helically architected filaments and lattices with programmable subvoxel control.

heading: The person-to-person transmission landscape of the gut and oral microbiomes
description: Data from more than 9,700 human stool and oral metagenomes has been used to decipher the strain transmission patterns of the human microbiome from mother to infant, within households and within populations.

heading: Future temperature extremes threaten land vertebrates
description: Future extreme thermal events will force many vertebrate species and assemblages into constant severe thermal stress; however, lowering emissions would greatly reduce overall exposures.

heading: Vertical organic electrochemical transistors for complementary circuits
description: Vertical organic electrochemical transistors demonstrating unprecedented performances in both p- and n-type operation modes have been synthesized from new electro-active and ion-permeable semiconducting polymers by the interface engineering of electro-active blend layers.

heading: Non-epitaxial single-crystal 2D material growth by geometric confinement
description: Geometric confinement on arbitrary substrates promotes, without epitaxial seeding, the layer-by-layer growth of two-dimensional single-crystal monolayers and bilayers of transition metal dichalcogenides.

heading: Pattern of global spin alignment of ϕ and K*0 mesons in heavy-ion collisions
authors: M. S. AbdallahB. E. AboonaM. Zyzak
description: At the Relativistic Heavy Ion Collider, observations of two meson species produced by heavy-ion collisions, ϕ and K*0, show surprising patterns of global spin alignment, being unexpectedly large and consistent with zero, respectively.

heading: Molecular fate-mapping of serum antibody responses to repeat immunization
authors: Ariën SchiepersMarije F. L. van ’t WoutGabriel D. Victora
description: Serum antibody responses to sequential homologous booster vaccines derive overwhelmingly from primary cohort B cells at the expense of de novo responses; this ‘primary addiction’ can be overcome by boosting with variant antigens.

heading: Targeting TBK1 to overcome resistance to cancer immunotherapy
description: Targeting TBK1 is an effective strategy to overcome resistance to cancer immunotherapy.

heading: Financial incentives for vaccination do not have negative unintended consequences
authors: Florian H. SchneiderPol Campos-MercadeArmando N. Meier
description: Findings from large-scale studies in Sweden and the USA indicate that providing financial incentives for vaccination and informing about state incentive programmes do not have any negative unintended consequences.

heading: Grain shape effects in bed load sediment transport
authors: Eric DealJeremy G. VendittiJ. Taylor Perron
description: Theoretical and experimental analysis of the effect of grain shape in bed load sediment transport is performed and a shape-corrected sediment transport law that provides greater accuracy in predictions is proposed.

heading: Spike and nsp6 are key determinants of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron BA.1 attenuation
description: Comparisons of a chimeric recombinant version of SARS-CoV-2, the ancestral SARS-CoV-2 strain and an Omicron isolate show that the attenuated virulence of Omicron is caused by mutations in both the spike protein and nsp6.

heading: A ligand insertion mechanism for cooperative NH3 capture in metal–organic frameworks
authors: Benjamin E. R. SnyderAri B. TurkiewiczJeffrey R. Long
description: A three-dimensional metal–organic framework reversibly binds ammonia by cooperative insertion into its metal–linker bonds to form a dense, one-dimensional coordination polymer, enabling high-capacity ammonia uptake with intrinsic thermal management.

heading: γδ T cells are effectors of immunotherapy in cancers with HLA class I defects
authors: Natasja L. de VriesJoris van de HaarEmile E. Voest
description: γδ T cells contribute to the response to immune checkpoint blockade treatment in patients with HLA-class-I-negative DNA mismatch repair-deficient colon cancers. .

heading: Seasonal temperatures in West Antarctica during the Holocene
authors: Tyler R. JonesKurt M. CuffeyJames W. C. White
description: Analysis of a continuous record of water-isotope ratios from the West Antarctic Ice Sheet Divide ice core reveals a dominant role for annual maximum insolation in determining West Antarctic summer temperature during the Holocene.

heading: Long-range ordered porous carbons produced from C60
description: A new type of carbon, long-range ordered porous carbon, is synthesized from carbon fullerenes at the gram scale and under ambient pressure.

heading: Short tRNA anticodon stem and mutant eRF1 allow stop codon reassignment
description: Analyses of in-frame stop codons in protein-coding genes of Blastocrithidia nonstop with all three stop codons reassigned reveal a mechanism for UGA reassignment in eukaryotes involving shortening of the tRNA anticodon stem and a mutant eRF1 release factor.

heading: An electric molecular motor
description: An electrically driven motor on the molecular scale based on [3]catenane is described, in which two cyclobis(paraquat-p-phenylene) rings operate by means of redox reactions, demonstrating highly unidirectional movement around a circular loop.

heading: STEREO neutrino spectrum of 235U fission rejects sterile neutrino hypothesis
description: Accurate measurements of the antineutrino energy spectrum of 235U fission by the STEREO detector reject the sterile neutrino hypothesis and point to biases in the nuclear data to explain the discrepancies with the prediction.

heading: Unitary p-wave interactions between fermions in an optical lattice
description: The authors measure elastic p-wave interaction energies in pairs of fermionic atoms occupying the lowest two orbitals of an optical lattice; isolation of individual pairs of atoms protects against three-body recombination, enabling a theoretical maximum of interaction energy to be achieved.

heading: An atlas of substrate specificities for the human serine/threonine kinome
authors: Jared L. JohnsonTomer M. YaronLewis C. Cantley
description: Analysis of the kinase activity of 300 protein Ser/Thr kinases reveals that the substrate specificity of the kinome is substantially more diverse than expected and is driven extensively by negative selectivity

heading: Approaching the quantum limit in two-dimensional semiconductor contacts
description: The electrical contact of two-dimensional transistors is pushed close to the quantum limit by hybridization of the energy bands with antimony; the contacts have low contact resistance and excellent stability.

heading: Periclase deforms more slowly than bridgmanite under mantle conditions
description: The authors model the creep of MgO periclase at lower mantle pressures and temperatures, finding that it deforms more slowly than bridgmanite at mantle strain rate.

heading: Enhanced superconductivity in spin–orbit proximitized bilayer graphene
description: Placing monolayer tungsten diselenide on Bernal-stacked bilayer graphene promotes enhanced superconductivity, indicating that proximity-induced spin–orbit coupling plays a key role in stabilizing the pairing, paving the way for engineering tunable, ultra-clean graphene-based superconductors.

heading: Structural basis for intrinsic transcription termination
description: Structural studies of Escherichia coli transcription intrinsic termination complexes representing distinct intermediates using cryo-electron microscopy provide insights into the steps and mechanism of transcription termination.

heading: Early Release Science of the exoplanet WASP-39b with JWST NIRCam
description: Time-series observations from the JWST of the transiting exoplanet WASP-39b show gaseous water in the planet’s atmosphere and place an upper limit on the abundance of methane.

heading: Kilohertz quasiperiodic oscillations in short gamma-ray bursts
description: Two signals identified in short gamma-ray bursts from archival Burst and Transient Source Experiment data show kilohertz quasiperiodic oscillations, implying the ringing of a hypermassive neutron star before collapsing to a black hole.

heading: Early Release Science of the exoplanet WASP-39b with JWST NIRSpec G395H
description: The medium-resolution transmission spectrum of the exoplanet WASP-39b, described using observations from the Near Infrared Spectrograph G395H grating aboard JWST, shows significant﻿ absorption from CO2 and H2O and detection of SO2.

heading: Early Release Science of the exoplanet WASP-39b with JWST NIRISS
description: The transmission spectrum of the exoplanet WASP-39b is obtained using observations from the Single-Object Slitless Spectroscopy mode of the Near Infrared Imager and Slitless Spectrograph instrument aboard the JWST.

heading: Early Release Science of the exoplanet WASP-39b with JWST NIRSpec PRISM
description: A broad-wavelength 0.5–5.5 µm atmospheric transmission spectrum of WASP-39b, a 1,200 K, roughly Saturn-mass, Jupiter-radius exoplanet, demonstrates JWST’s sensitivity to a rich diversity of exoplanet compositions and chemical processes.

heading: Electrochemical reactor dictates site selectivity in N-heteroarene carboxylations
description: An electrochemical strategy is described in which the direct carboxylation of pyridines and related N-heteroarenes with CO2 shows divergent site selectivity depending on the type of reactor used.

heading: Neogene burial of organic carbon in the global ocean
authors: Ziye LiYi Ge ZhangBenjamin J. W. Mills
description: A ‘bottom-up’ approach for calculating the rate of organic carbon burial in the global ocean shows larger variability than has been previously estimated, suggesting that the organic carbon cycle acted as positive feedback of past global warming.

heading: Structural basis of broad-spectrum β-lactam resistance in Staphylococcus aureus
authors: J. Andrew N. AlexanderLiam J. WorrallNatalie C. J. Strynadka
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of Staphylococcus aureus BlaR1 reveal dynamic signalling states regulating broad spectrum β-lactam antibiotic resistance through cleavage of the transcriptional repressor BlaI and induced expression of the β-lactamase blaZ and the β-lactam-resistant cell-wall transpeptidase mecA.

heading: Influenza vaccination reveals sex dimorphic imprints of prior mild COVID-19
authors: Rachel SparksWilliam W. LauJohn S. Tsang
description: Immune responses to influenza vaccination are affected by previous mild COVID-19 in a sex-dimorphic manner.

heading: Extreme redox variations in a superdeep diamond from a subducted slab
authors: Fabrizio NestolaMargo E. RegierJeffrey W. Harris
description: The authors investigate chemical anomalies in superdeep diamond inclusions, leading them to suggest that there is an extremely variable redox environment in the deep mantle.

heading: Papers and patents are becoming less disruptive over time
description: A decline in disruptive science and technology over time is reported, representing a substantive shift in science and technology, which is attributed in part to the reliance on a narrower set of existing knowledge.

heading: Metabolic regulation of species-specific developmental rates
description: An in vitro system that recapitulates temporal characteristics of embryonic development demonstrates that the different rates of mouse and human embryonic development stem from differences in metabolic rates and—further downstream—the global rate of protein synthesis.

heading: Synaptic gradients transform object location to action
authors: Mark DombrovskiMartin Y. PeekGwyneth M. Card
description: Analysis of behaviour, physiology, anatomy and connectomics in Drosophila shows how direction-specific visual information is transformed onto downstream premotor networks and converted into appropriate motor responses.

heading: RNA targeting unleashes indiscriminate nuclease activity of CRISPR–Cas12a2
authors: Jack P. K. BravoThomson HallmarkDavid W. Taylor
description: Structural analysis of Cas12a2, a CRISPR-associated nuclease that nonspecifically cleaves ssRNA, ssDNA and dsDNA, reveals a complete activation pathway involved in the abortive infection system protecting cells against invasion.

heading: Structures and mechanisms of tRNA methylation by METTL1–WDR4
description: Using cryo-electron microscopy, structural and mechanistic insights into how the METTL1–WDR4 complex catalyses methylation of tRNAs are shown.

heading: Ultrathin quantum light source with van der Waals NbOCl2 crystal
authors: Qiangbing GuoXiao-Zhuo QiAndrew T. S. Wee
description: A van der Waals crystal, niobium oxide dichloride, with vanishing interlayer electronic coupling and considerable monolayer-like excitonic behaviour in the bulk, as well as strong and scalable second-order optical nonlinearity, is discovered, which enables a high-performance quantum light source.

heading: HIV silencing and cell survival signatures in infected T cell reservoirs
authors: Iain C. ClarkPrakriti MudvariEli A. Boritz
description: HIV-infected memory CD4 T cells under antiretroviral therapy are a distinctive population of cells with transcriptomic patterns that favour HIV silencing, cell survival and cell proliferation.

heading: A quantitative map of nuclear pore assembly reveals two distinct mechanisms
authors: Shotaro OtsukaJeremy O. B. TempkinJan Ellenberg
description: Single-molecule calibrated live microscopy and computational modelling have revealed that human nuclear pore complex assembly takes different pathways during the exit from mitosis and during nuclear growth in interphase.

heading: Intracluster light is already abundant at redshift beyond unity
description: A study of intracluster light (ICL) in ten high-redshift galaxy clusters finds evidence that gradual stripping may not be the dominant mechanism of ICL formation, but may occur alongside the formation and growth of the brightest cluster galaxies, and/or accretion of preprocessed stars.

heading: Integrated intracellular organization and its variations in human iPS cells
authors: Matheus P. VianaJianxu ChenSusanne M. Rafelski
description: A dataset of 3D images from more than 200,000 human induced pluripotent stem cells is used to develop a framework to analyse cell shape and the location and organization of major intracellular structures.

heading: Cas12a2 elicits abortive infection through RNA-triggered destruction of dsDNA
authors: Oleg DmytrenkoGina C. NeumannChase L. Beisel
description: RNA targeting by the Sulfuricurvum type V single-effector nuclease SuCas12a2 drives abortive infection through non-specific cleavage of double-stranded DNA—after recognition of an RNA target through an activating protospacer-flanking sequence, SuCas12a2 efficiently degrades ssRNA, ssDNA and dsDNA.

heading: Identification of astrocyte regulators by nucleic acid cytometry
authors: Iain C. ClarkMichael A. WheelerAdam R. Abate
description: The pathogenic function of XBP1-expressing astrocytes in experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis and multiple sclerosis have been studied using FIND-seq, a new method combining microfluidics cytometry, PCR-based detection of nucleic acids and cell sorting for in-depth single-cell transcriptomics analyses of rare cells.

heading: Solar-to-hydrogen efficiency of more than 9% in photocatalytic water splitting
description: Photocatalytic water splitting with a high solar-to-hydrogen efficiency of more than nine per cent is achieved using pure water, concentrated solar light and an indium gallium nitride photocatalyst.

heading: Structural basis of regulated m7G tRNA modification by METTL1–WDR4
description: Structures of the human METTL1–WDR4 complex are revealed, providing molecular insights into substrate recognition, modification and catalytic regulation by the N7-methylguanosine methyltransferase complex.

heading: Photonic flatband resonances for free-electron radiation
description: A study demonstrates full energy–momentum matching, and enhanced interaction, between free electrons and photons through a continuum of flatband resonances, realized in a silicon-on-insulator photonic crystal slab.

heading: Coupled ferroelectricity and superconductivity in bilayer Td-MoTe2
description: The authors show a hysteretic behaviour of superconductivity as a function of electric field in bilayer Td-MoTe2, representing observations of coupled ferroelectricity and superconductivity.

heading: Neonatal imprinting of alveolar macrophages via neutrophil-derived 12-HETE
description: The production of eicosanoids by neutrophils during the neonatal period is necessary for the self-renewal and maintenance of alveolar macrophages during lung development.

heading: Pathogenic bacteria modulate pheromone response to promote mating
description: Infection of Caenorhabditis elegans by Pseudomonas aeruginosa causes an increased pheromone response via the pheromone receptor STR-44 and increases mating with males, a potential mechanism for promoting adaptation in the host.

heading: A few-layer covalent network of fullerenes
description: A two-dimensional crystalline polymer of C60, termed graphullerene, is synthesized by chemical vapour transport, and mechanically exfoliated to produce molecularly thin flakes with clean interfaces for potential optoelectronic applications.

heading: A DNA methylation atlas of normal human cell types
description: We describe a human DNA methylome atlas based on deep whole-genome bisulfite sequencing, allowing fragment-level analysis of cell-type-specific markers and providing an essential resource for studies of gene regulation and for deconvolution of cell mixtures and liquid biopsies.

heading: Cost-effective mitigation of nitrogen pollution from global croplands
description: A meta-analysis of 1,521 field observations from the past two decades led to the identification of 11 key measures to cost-effectively mitigate nitrogen pollution from global croplands.

heading: Phenotypic signatures of immune selection in HIV-1 reservoir cells
description: A proteogenomic profiling analysis of single cells from the blood and lymph nodes of individuals living with HIV-1 reveals that CD4+ memory T cells harbouring intact provirus show signatures associated with resistance to immune-mediated killing and cell survival.

heading: Reply to: Climate versus tectonics as controls on river profiles
Black carbon attribution
Reply to: Black carbon attribution
authors: Joseph R. McConnellNathan J. ChellmanAndreas Stohl

heading: Climate versus tectonics as controls on river profiles
authors: Hansjörg SeyboldWouter R. BerghuijsJames W. Kirchner

heading: R-loop-derived cytoplasmic RNA–DNA hybrids activate an immune response
authors: Magdalena P. CrossleyChenlin SongKarlene A. Cimprich
description: RNA–DNA hybrids are immunogenic species that can aberrantly accumulate in the cytoplasm after R-loop processing, linking R-loop accumulation to cell death through the innate immune response.

heading: Actin cytoskeleton and complex cell architecture in an Asgard archaeon
description: Culture and analysis of ‘Candidatus Lokiarchaeum ossiferum’—a member of the Asgard phylum—reveals an elaborate cell architecture with extensive membranous protrusions.

heading: Topological lattices realized in superconducting circuit optomechanics
description: Optomechanical lattices in one and two dimensions with exceptionally low disorder are realized, showing how the optomechanical interaction can be exploited for direct measurements of the Hamiltonian, beyond the tight-binding approximation.

heading: A cortico-collicular circuit for orienting to shelter during escape
description: The retrosplenial cortex and superior colliculus of mouse form a neural circuit that specifically encodes shelter location, facilitating rapid escape from predatory threats.

heading: Inheritance of paternal DNA damage by histone-mediated repair restriction
description: In Caenorhabditis elegans, paternal exposure to ionizing radiation results in HIS-24 and HPL-1-dependent genome instability phenotypes, causing embryonic lethality in the offspring.

heading: BRD8 maintains glioblastoma by epigenetic reprogramming of the p53 network
description: BRD8 is identified as a specific epigenetic vulnerability for glioblastomas that harbour wild-type p53.

heading: Reconstruction and deconstruction of human somitogenesis in vitro
description: Somitoids and segmentoids—culture systems that recapitulate the formation of somite-like structures—reveal that an initial salt-and-pepper expression pattern of MESP2 in a newly formed segment is transformed into compartments of anterior and posterior identity through an active cell-sorting mechanism.

heading: Vela pulsar wind nebula X-rays are polarized to near the synchrotron limit
description: Polarization can exceed 60% at the leading edge of the inner part of the Vela pulsar wind nebula; in contrast with the case of the supernova remnant, the electrons in the pulsar wind nebula are accelerated with little or no turbulence in a highly uniform magnetic field.

heading: Senescence atlas reveals an aged-like inflamed niche that blunts muscle regeneration
description: A lifetime cartography of in vivo senescent cells shows that they are heterogeneous. Senescent cells create an aged-like inflamed niche that mirrors inflammation associated with ageing and arrests stem cell proliferation and tissue regeneration.

heading: The molecular evolution of spermatogenesis across mammals
description: Evolutionary analyses of single-nucleus transcriptome data for testes from 11 species are reported, illuminating the molecular evolution of spermatogenesis and associated forces, and providing a resource for investigating the testis across mammals.

heading: Synthesis-on-substrate of quantum dot solids
description: Ultrasmall monodisperse perovskite quantum dots are synthesized in situ on a substrate via ligand structure regulation, yielding the highest external quantum efficiency blue perovskite LEDs reported so far.

heading: Locus coeruleus activity improves cochlear implant performance
description: Behavioural studies with deafened rats show that locus coeruleus activity and plasticity are key to rapid adaptation to and long-term hearing performance with cochlear implants.

heading: Reconstituting human somitogenesis in vitro
description: A 3D model of human segmentation and somitogenesis derived from induced pluripotent stem cells captures the oscillatory dynamics of the segmentation clock as well as morphological and molecular features of the developing embryonic axis and tail.

heading: Imprinted SARS-CoV-2 humoral immunity induces convergent Omicron RBD evolution
description: Convergent mutations in hotspots of the SARS-CoV-2 Omicron receptor-binding domain can cause immune evasion and maintain sufficient ACE2-binding capability.

heading: Ovarian cancer mutational processes drive site-specific immune evasion
description: Multi-modal analysis of genomically unstable ovarian tumours characterizes the contribution of anatomical sites and mutational processes to evolutionary phenotypic divergence and immune resistance mechanisms.

heading: A male germ-cell-specific ribosome controls male fertility
description: RibosomeST—a ribosome with a specialized nascent polypeptide exit tunnel—cotranslationally regulates the folding of a subset of male germ-cell-specific proteins that are essential for the formation of sperm.

heading: Disorder-assisted assembly of strongly correlated fluids of light
description: Using particle-by-particle assembly and adiabatic manipulation of disorder, low-entropy, strongly correlated quantum fluids of light are constructed, opening up new possibilities for the preparation of exotic phases of synthetic matter.

heading: Recurrent repeat expansions in human cancer genomes
authors: Graham S. ErwinGamze GürsoyMichael P. Snyder
description: An atlas explores the landscape of recurrent repeat expansions in human cancer genomes.

heading: NLR surveillance of pathogen interference with hormone receptors induces immunity
description: The tomato spotted wilt orthotospovirus nonstructural protein NSs interferes with phytohormone signalling in plants to compromise plant defences by interacting with plant TCP21—this effect of the viral protein is counteracted by the plant NLR immune receptor protein Tsw.

heading: The WHO estimates of excess mortality associated with the COVID-19 pandemic
description: Msemburi et al. describe how the World Health Organization has estimated the excess mortality associated with the COVID-19 pandemic, by month and for 2020 and 2021, and analyse their estimates across the WHO member states, with 14.83 million global excess deaths estimated.

heading: Periodic inhibition of Erk activity drives sequential somite segmentation
authors: M. Fethullah SimsekAngad Singh ChandelErtuğrul M. Özbudak
description: The zebrafish segmentation clock drives sequential segmentation of somites by periodically lowering double-phosphorylated Erk and therefore projecting its oscillation on the double-phosphorylated Erk gradient.

heading: Wetland emission and atmospheric sink changes explain methane growth in 2020
description: Using both bottom-up and top-down approaches, the record high increase in the methane growth rate in 2020 is attributed mainly to emissions from wetlands, which have been exacerbated by a warmer and wetter climate, and to the reduced atmospheric methane sink, in response to emissions reduction of air pollutants during COVID-19 lockdowns.

heading: Microglia regulate central nervous system myelin growth and integrity
authors: Niamh B. McNamaraDavid A. D. MunroVeronique E. Miron
description: Resident microglia in the central nervous system are identified as the specific macrophage population that regulates myelin growth and integrity.

heading: Enantioselective sensing by collective circular dichroism
authors: Ryeong Myeong KimJi-Hyeok HuhKi Tae Nam
description: An array of 2D crystals of isotropic, 432-symmetric chiral gold nanoparticles is shown to exhibit collective resonances with a strong and uniform chiral near field, allowing enantioselective detection by the collective circular dichroism.

heading: Autonomous rhythmic activity in glioma networks drives brain tumour growth
description: A population of highly interconnected cells in glioblastoma makes these tumours resistant to general damage but vulnerable to targeted disruption of this small fraction of cells and their rhythmic Ca2+ oscillations.

heading: A microbiome-dependent gut–brain pathway regulates motivation for exercise
description: It is demonstrated that the brain circuitry involved in regulating the motivation for physical activity is not strictly central nervous system autonomous but is shaped by peripheral influences that originate in the intestinal microbial community.

heading: Logged tropical forests have amplified and diverse ecosystem energetics
description: Logged forests in Borneo have higher energy flow from vegetation to and broad range of bird and mammal species relative to old-growth forests and oil palm plantations, showing that they can be diverse and ecologically vibrant ecosystems.

heading: Structural insights into the mechanism of the sodium/iodide symporter
description: Mutations in the sodium/iodide symporter (NIS) cause congenital hypothyroidism, and our results yield insights into how NIS selects, couples and translocates anions, thereby establishing a framework for understanding NIS function.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 infection and persistence in the human body and brain at autopsy
authors: Sydney R. SteinSabrina C. RamelliDaniel S. Chertow
description: A study reports the distribution, replication and persistence of SARS-CoV-2 throughout the human body including in the brain at autopsy from acute infection to more than seven months following symptom onset.

heading: Majorana-like Coulomb spectroscopy in the absence of zero-bias peaks
description: Valentini et al. devise a method through which they can perform both tunnelling spectroscopy and Coulomb blockade spectroscopy on the same hybrid nanowire island to reduce ambiguities in the detection of Majorana.

heading: Primate gastrulation and early organogenesis at single-cell resolution
description: In-depth transcriptomic analyses of 56,636 single cells from monkey embryos revealed transcriptional features of major perigastrulation cell types, and comparative analyses with mouse embryos and human embryoids uncovered conserved and divergent features of perigastrulation development across species.

heading: Cortical–hippocampal coupling during manifold exploration in motor cortex
description: A new study explores the activity dialogue between hippocampus and cortex as neuronal representations of learning or adaptation are consolidated.

heading: Active eosinophils regulate host defence and immune responses in colitis
description: Single-cell transcriptomic profiling and functional assays are used to identify subpopulations of eosinophils that are present in the mouse gastrointestinal tract and provide insight into the role of these cells in inflammatory bowel diseases in humans.

heading: Programming multicellular assembly with synthetic cell adhesion molecules
authors: Adam J. StevensAndrew R. HarrisWendell A. Lim
description: Synthetic cell adhesion molecules yield customized cell–cell interactions with adhesion properties that are similar to native interactions, and offer abilities for cell and tissue engineering and for systematically studying multicellular organization.

heading: Principles of mitoribosomal small subunit assembly in eukaryotes
description: The structures of both human and yeast mitochondrial ribosomal small subunits undergoing assembly are uncovered.

heading: Discriminatory attitudes against unvaccinated people during the pandemic
description: Vaccinated people express discriminatory attitudes towards unvaccinated individuals across cultures.

heading: Genetic diversity fuels gene discovery for tobacco and alcohol use
authors: Gretchen R. B. SaundersXingyan WangScott Vrieze
description: A multi-ancestry meta-regression study analyses diverse genome-wide association studies and genome loci associated with tobacco and alcohol use.

heading: Gigaelectronvolt emission from a compact binary merger
description: The observation of transient-like gigaelectronvolt emission in the high-energy gamma-rays of GRB 211211A, from the merger of two compact binary objects, is reported.

heading: A kilonova following a long-duration gamma-ray burst at 350 Mpc
authors: Jillian C. RastinejadBenjamin P. GompertzChristina C. Thöne
description: A possible kilonova associated with a nearby, long-duration gamma-ray burst suggests that gamma-ray bursts with long and complex light curves can be spawned from the merger of two compact objects, contrary to the established gamma-ray burst paradigm.

heading: A signalling pathway for transcriptional regulation of sleep amount in mice
description: Virus-mediated somatic genetics experiments in adult mouse brain identify key roles of LKB1 and SIK3 upstream of HDAC4/5 and CREB in the transcriptional regulation of non-rapid eye movement sleep.

heading: Formation of robust bound states of interacting microwave photons
description: An experimental investigation of the dynamics of the spin ½ Floquet XXZ model finds bound states as predicted, and also robustness to noise and non-integrability when theoretical descriptions start to fail.

heading: A plant-derived natural photosynthetic system for improving cell anabolism
description: Proof of concept of the viability of a plant-derived photosynthetic system based on nanothylakoid units encapsulated in a chondrocyte membrane to enhance cell anabolism in chondrocytes is demonstrated.

heading: A nearby long gamma-ray burst from a merger of compact objects
authors: E. TrojaC. L. FryerA. J. Castro-Tirado
description: A bright, long-duration gamma-ray burst observed by the Swift observatory has hybrid high-energy properties, suggesting that its origin is the merger of a compact binary.

heading: Close relatives of MERS-CoV in bats use ACE2 as their functional receptors
description: NeoCoV and its close relative, PDF-2180, can efficiently bind to and use specific bat ACE2 orthologues and, less favourably, human ACE2 as entry receptors through their receptor-binding domains on the spike protein.

heading: In vitro production of infectious Plasmodium falciparum sporozoites
authors: Abraham G. EappenTao LiStephen L. Hoffman
description: Plasmodium falciparum sporozoites produced in vitro recapitulate the P. falciparum life cycle from gametocyte to gametocyte without mosquitoes or primates.

heading: Autoimmunity-associated T cell receptors recognize HLA-B*27-bound peptides
authors: Xinbo YangLee I. GarnerK. Christopher Garcia
description: A study shows that cross-reactivity of microbial antigens and self-antigens presented by HLA-B*27 may be important in the pathogenesis of diseases associated with HLA-B*27 and identifies the shared binding motif responsible.

heading: Structural variants drive context-dependent oncogene activation in cancer
description: Results are presented that indicate that alterations to gene regulatory three-dimensional architecture are a critical mechanism that enables structural variant-based oncogene activation in cancer genomes and sheds light on the essential elements for such gene activation events.

heading: A transcriptional switch controls sex determination in Plasmodium falciparum
authors: A. R. GomesA. Marin-MenendezA. M. Talman
description: A non-genetic mechanism of sex determination in the human malaria parasite, Plasmodium falciparum, is described, and the male development 1 gene is identified as a potential target for interventions that block malaria transmission.

heading: Microbial predators form a new supergroup of eukaryotes
authors: Denis V. TikhonenkovKirill V. MikhailovPatrick J. Keeling
description: Provora is an ancient supergroup of microbial predators that are genetically, morphologically and behaviourally distinct from other eukaryotes, and comprise two divergent clades of predators—Nebulidia and Nibbleridia—that differ fundamentally in ultrastructure, behaviour and gene content.

heading: Patterned cPCDH expression regulates the fine organization of the neocortex
description: The diverse yet patterned expression of clustered protocadherins regulates the precise spatial arrangement and synaptic connectivity of excitatory neurons in the mouse neocortex.

heading: Kinase signalling in excitatory neurons regulates sleep quantity and depth
description: Forward genetics analyses and targeted genetic manipulation in mice show that regulation of sleep quantity and quality is mediated by the LKB1–SIK3–HDAC4–HDAC5 pathway.

heading: CLSTN3β enforces adipocyte multilocularity to facilitate lipid utilization
description: An adipocyte-selective product of the Clstn3 locus (CLSTN3β) facilitates the use of stored triglyceride by limiting lipid droplet (LD) expansion, defining a molecular mechanism that regulates LD form and function to facilitate lipid utilization in thermogenic adipocytes.

heading: Widespread herbivory cost in tropical nitrogen-fixing tree species
authors: Will BarkerLiza S. ComitaSarah A. Batterman
description: Nitrogen-fixing trees are favoured by herbivorous animals relative to non-fixing trees, increasing their carbon opportunity cost and potentially constraining global nitrogen fixation.

heading: A long-duration gamma-ray burst with a peculiar origin
description: Analysis of the long-duration GRB 211211A led to observations of emission properties differing from all known type I bursts, yet its multiband behaviour suggests a non-massive-star origin, pointing towards a new progenitor type.

heading: Plastic futures and their CO2 emissions
description: Three alternative CO2 emission-mitigation pathways were analysed for the global plastics sector, covering their production to waste management. A circular bioeconomy strategy could achieve negative emissions in the long term, while at the same time allowing landfilling to be phased out and reducing resource consumption.

heading: Decoupling of respiration rates and abundance in marine prokaryoplankton
authors: Jacob H. Munson-McGeeMelody R. LindsayRamunas Stepanauskas
description: Cell-specific respiration rates differ by more than 1,000× among prokaryoplankton genera, and the majority of respiration was found to be performed by minority members of prokaryoplankton, whereas cells of the most prevalent lineages had extremely low respiration rates.

heading: A 2-million-year-old ecosystem in Greenland uncovered by environmental DNA
authors: Kurt H. KjærMikkel Winther PedersenEske Willerslev
description: Analysis of two-million-year-old ancient environmental DNA from the Kap København Formation in North Greenland shows there was an open boreal forest with diverse plant and animal species, of which several taxa have not previously been detected at the site, representing an ecosystem that has no present-day analogue.

heading: Electrophotocatalytic oxygenation of multiple adjacent C–H bonds
description: Installation of multiple C–O bonds by concurrent oxygenation of contiguous C–H bonds in a selective fashion is highly desirable, and this is achieved by repeated operation of a potent oxidative catalyst via electrophotocatalysis.

heading: Antibody feedback regulates immune memory after SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination
description: Pre-existing high-affinity antibodies alter germinal centre and memory B cell selection by lowering the activation threshold for B cells and through direct masking of their cognate epitopes, thereby permitting a diverse set of abundant lower-affinity clones targeting alternate epitopes to participate in the immune response.

heading: Dendritic cells direct circadian anti-tumour immune responses
description: Rhythmic trafficking of dendritic cells to the tumour draining lymph node governs a circadian response of tumour-antigen-specific CD8+ T cells that is dependent on the circadian expression of the co-stimulatory molecule CD80.

heading: FXR inhibition may protect from SARS-CoV-2 infection by reducing ACE2
description: FXR regulates the levels of ACE2 in tissues of the respiratory and gastrointestinal systems that are affected by COVID-19, and inhibiting FXR with ursodeoxycholic acid downregulates ACE2 and reduces susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection.

heading: When did mammoths go extinct?
Reply to: When did mammoths go extinct?
Genomic signature of Fanconi anaemia DNA repair pathway deficiency in cancer
authors: Andrew L. H. WebsterMathijs A. SandersAgata Smogorzewska
description: Defective DNA interstrand crosslink repair in Fanconi anaemia drives extensive genomic rearrangements, thereby substantially increasing the risk of cancer development.

heading: A very luminous jet from the disruption of a star by a massive black hole
description: A series of early-time, multiwavelength observations of an optical transient, AT2022cmc, indicate that it is a relativistic jet from a tidal disruption event originating from a supermassive black hole.

heading: Social trauma engages lateral septum circuitry to occlude social reward
authors: Long LiRomain Durand-de CuttoliScott J. Russo
description: The authors show that, in a chronic social defeat stress rodent model, a subset of male and female mice avoided social interaction with non-aggressive, same-sex juvenile mice and did not develop context-dependent social reward following these encounters.

heading: A photonic integrated continuous-travelling-wave parametric amplifier
description: By using Si3N4 photonic integrated circuits on a silicon chip, a continuous-travelling-wave parametric amplifier is shown to yield a parametric gain exceeding both on-chip propagation loss as well as fibre–chip–fibre coupling losses.

heading: Structure-based design of bitopic ligands for the µ-opioid receptor
description: Bitopic functionalized ligands based on fentanyl can target the sodium ion-binding site of the mu-opioid receptor and selectively modulate downstream signalling pathways, potentially leading to safer analgesics.

heading: PLD3 affects axonal spheroids and network defects in Alzheimer’s disease
description: Amyloid-plaque-associated axonal spheroids are prominent contributors to neural network dysfunction in an Alzheimer’s model and can be reversed by endolysosomal modulation.

heading: Strong cloud–circulation coupling explains weak trade cumulus feedback
description: Analysis of new observations from the EUREC4A field campaign shows that lower-tropospheric mixing does not desiccate the base of trade cumulus clouds, refuting the mixing-desiccation hypothesis and explaining the weak trade cumulus feedback.

heading: Human fetal cerebellar cell atlas informs medulloblastoma origin and oncogenesis
description: Integrated single-cell atlases of human fetal cerebella and MBs show potential cell populations predisposed to transformation and regulatory circuitries underlying tumour cell states and oncogenesis, highlighting hitherto unrecognized transitional progenitor intermediates predictive of disease prognosis.

heading: Ras drives malignancy through stem cell crosstalk with the microenvironment
description: Aberrant crosstalk between cancer stem cells and their microenvironment triggers angiogenesis and TGFβ signalling, creating conditions that are conducive for hijacking leptin and leptin receptor signalling, which in turn launches downstream PI3K–AKT–mTOR signalling during the benign-to-malignant transition.

heading: Deglacial increase of seasonal temperature variability in the tropical ocean
description: Mass spectrometry imaging of long-chain alkenones in sediments from the Cariaco Basin shows that average temperatures remained stable during the Younger Dryas to Holocene transition but seasonality more than doubled and interannual variability intensified.

heading: Global hotspots of salt marsh change and carbon emissions
description: Analysis of Landsat imagery from the past two decades allows quantification of the changes in salt marsh ecosystems, as well as associated carbon emissions resulting from net global losses.

heading: A membrane-based seawater electrolyser for hydrogen generation
description: An efficient and scalable direct seawater electrolysis method for hydrogen production that addresses the side-reaction and corrosion problems associated with using seawater instead of pure water is demonstrated.

heading: Dopamine promotes head direction plasticity during orienting movements
authors: Yvette E. FisherMichael MarquisRachel I. Wilson
description: A study demonstrates that plasticity in the head direction system in Drosophila is modulated by dopamine, which increases learning when reorienting movements are bringing in new spatial information.

heading: Cretaceous ornithurine supports a neognathous crown bird ancestor
description: A new taxon of toothed Late Cretaceous ornithurine preserving a pterygoid is reported, overturning assumptions about the nature of the ancestral crown bird skull.

heading: The pupal moulting fluid has evolved social functions in ants
authors: Orli SnirHanan AlwaseemDaniel J. C. Kronauer
description: Ant pupae secrete a fluid, derived from the moulting fluid, that elicits parental care behaviour, provides nutrients for larvae and must be removed for pupal survival.

heading: Traversable wormhole dynamics on a quantum processor
description: A sparsified SYK model is constructed using learning techniques and the corresponding traversable wormhole dynamics are observed, representing a step towards a program for studying quantum gravity in the laboratory.

heading: Filopodia are a structural substrate for silent synapses in adult neocortex
description: A study using super-resolution protein imaging to visualize synaptic proteins from layer 5 pyramidal neurons in the primary visual cortex of adult mice shows that filopodia are a structural substrate for silent synapses.

heading: Two broadly conserved families of polyprenyl-phosphate transporters
description: A study identifies two broadly conserved families of flippases that catalyse the transport of undecaprenyl phosphate in bacteria and could function to recycle dolichol phosphate in eukaryotes and archaea.

heading: Common and rare variant associations with clonal haematopoiesis phenotypes
description: Exome sequence data from 628,388 individuals was used to identify 24 risk loci in 40,208 carriers of clonal haematopoiesis of indeterminate potential and link them to other conditions including COVID-19, cardiovascular disease and cancer.

heading: Undecaprenyl phosphate translocases confer conditional microbial fitness
description: Members of the DUF368-containing and DedA transmembrane protein families have conditional roles in undecaprenyl phosphate translocation in Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria and may have a widely conserved function in the biogenesis of microbial cell surface glycopolymers.

heading: Molecular basis for selective activation of DREADD-based chemogenetics
authors: Shicheng ZhangRyan H. GumpperBryan L. Roth
description: The mechanism of action of muscarinic receptor-based DREADDs, important chemogenetic tools in neuroscience and cellular signalling research, are described in molecular detail.

heading: Chiral assemblies of pinwheel superlattices on substrates
description: Chiroptically active pinwheel assemblies on substrates are formed by tetrahedral gold nanoparticles from the effective ‘compression’ of a perovskite-like, low-density phase, thereby enabling the manufacture of metastructured coatings with special chiroptical characteristics as identified by photon-induced near-field electron microscopy and chirality measures.

heading: Cryo-EM structures of the active NLRP3 inflammasome disc
description: We report cryogenic electron microscopy structures of disc-shaped active NLRP3 oligomers in complex with NEK7 and ASC, and propose that the role of NEK7 is to transform NLRP3 into the active NLRP3 inflammasome disc.

heading: Structures of the holo CRISPR RNA-guided transposon integration complex
authors: Jung-Un ParkAmy Wei-Lun TsaiElizabeth H. Kellogg
description: Structural studies of the CRISPR-associated transposon comprising Cas12k, TnsC, TnsB and TniQ from Scytonema hofmannii using cryo-electron microscopy reveal insights into the architecture and mechanism of RNA-guided DNA transposition.

heading: Antiviral signalling by a cyclic nucleotide activated CRISPR protease
description: A CalpL–CalpT–CalpS cascade mediated by cyclic oligoadenylates is identified as a mechanism to detect viral RNA and activate subsequent antivirus responses in microorganisms.

heading: Singlet and triplet Cooper pair splitting in hybrid superconducting nanowires
description: Controllable detection of singlet and triplet Cooper pair splitting via crossed Andreev reflection is demonstrated in spin-polarized quantum dots on a superconducting nanowire platform with strong spin–orbit coupling.

heading: Regulation of the mammalian-brain V-ATPase through ultraslow mode-switching
description: Single-molecule measurements of synaptic vesicles show that V-ATPases do not pump continuously in time but instead stochastically switch between ultralong-lived proton-pumping, inactive and proton-leaky modes.

heading: Structural basis of tankyrase activation by polymerization
description: Structural insights into the poly-ADP-ribosyltransferase tankyrase reveal its filamentous architecture and illustrate how assembly controls catalytic and non-catalytic functions.

heading: The encoding of touch by somatotopically aligned dorsal column subdivisions
authors: Josef TurecekBrendan P. LehnertDavid D. Ginty
description: Distinct subdivisions of low-threshold mechanoreceptors and postsynaptic dorsal column neurons converge at the dorsal column nuclei to code precise tactile representations.

heading: Anomalous thermal transport under high pressure in boron arsenide
description: Competition between three- and four-phonon scattering processes is shown to be the source of a unique anomalous thermal conductivity in boron arsenide at high pressures.

heading: MYC multimers shield stalled replication forks from RNA polymerase
description: MYC dissociation from active promoters alters its interactions with proteins involved in transcription termination and RNA processing, influencing DNA repair and thus, potentially, tumour cell growth.

heading: Structured cerebellar connectivity supports resilient pattern separation
authors: Tri M. NguyenLogan A. ThomasWei-Chung Allen Lee
description: Mapping of the mouse cerebellar cortex using 3D reconstruction from electron microscopy, as well as numerical simulation of neuronal activity, shows non-random redundancy of connectivity that may favour resilient learning over encoding capacity.

heading: Emergent charge order in pressurized kagome superconductor CsV3Sb5
description: The evolution of CDW and superconductivity with pressure in CsV3Sb5 by 51V NMR measurements shed new light on the interplay of superconductivity and CDW, revealing new electronic correlation effects in kagome superconductors AV3Sb5.

heading: Spin cross-correlation experiments in an electron entangler
description: Spin correlation experiments are demonstrated in an electron entangler device based on the ‘splitting’ of Cooper pairs from a superconductor, which can potentially be used to investigate many fundamental phases and processes related to the electron spin.

heading: Distributed quantum sensing with mode-entangled spin-squeezed atomic states
authors: Benjamin K. MaliaYunfan WuMark A. Kasevich
description: A spatially distributed, atomic clock network entangled via quantum nondemolition measurements offers better precision and lower noise compared to an equivalent mode-separable network, and the improvements scale with network size.

heading: Polarized blazar X-rays imply particle acceleration in shocks
description: Polarization measurements are reported for the blazar Mk501, revealing a degree of X-ray polarization that is more than twice the optical value and supporting the shock-accelerated energy-stratified electron population scenario.

heading: Pre-T cell receptor self-MHC sampling restricts thymocyte dedifferentiation
authors: Jonathan S. Duke-CohanAoi AkitsuEllis L. Reinherz
description: Aberrant thymocyte developmental programming results when interactions between thymic stroma and pre-T cell receptors occur in the absence of major histocompatibility complex bound to antigen peptide.

heading: T cells specific for α-myosin drive immunotherapy-related myocarditis
authors: Margaret L. AxelrodWouter C. MeijersJustin M. Balko
description: Cytotoxic CD8+ T cells specific for α-myosin are identified as pivotal players in myocarditis associated with immune checkpoint inhibitor anticancer therapies.

heading: Direct activation of a bacterial innate immune system by a viral capsid protein
