description: Genetic, biochemical and structural studies provide insights into the function of Escherichia coli CapRelSJ46 as a fused anti-phage toxin–antitoxin system that binds SECΦ27 Gp57 capsid protein.

heading: Effect of the intratumoral microbiota on spatial and cellular heterogeneity in cancer
authors: Jorge Luis Galeano NiñoHanrui WuSusan Bullman
description: Spatial profiling and single-cell RNA sequencing are used to map the spatial distribution of the microbiota within human tumours, revealing how intratumoral microbial communities contribute to tumour heterogeneity and cancer progression.

heading: Pathogen spillover driven by rapid changes in bat ecology
authors: Peggy EbyAlison J. PeelRaina K. Plowright
description: A study reveals how land-use change and climate interact to drive the spillover of a zoonotic virus, and identifies an ecological mechanism that prevents spillover.

heading: Colon tumour cell death causes mTOR dependence by paracrine P2X4 stimulation
description: Chemotherapy-induced death of colon cancer cells causes ATP release triggering P2X4 to mediate an mTOR-dependent pro-survival program in neighbouring cancer cells, which renders them sensitive to mTOR inhibition.

heading: A hybrid optical–wireless network for decimetre-level terrestrial positioning
authors: Jeroen C. J. KoelemeijHan DunChristian C. J. M. Tiberius
description: A terrestrial networked positioning system based on a hybrid optical–wireless telecommunication infrastructure and that is independent of global navigation satellite systems is demonstrated for urban environments with decimetre-level accuracy.

heading: Enterococci enhance Clostridioides difficile pathogenesis
authors: Alexander B. SmithMatthew L. JeniorJoseph P. Zackular
description: Enterococci enhance the fitness and pathogenesis of Clostridioides difficile in the gut by altering the amino acid composition and providing signals that increase its virulence towards the host.

heading: Spin–orbit microlaser emitting in a four-dimensional Hilbert space
description: A fully integrated semiconductor microlaser that exploits spin–orbit coupling of light emits in a four-dimensional Hilbert space, with flexible control of up to six degrees of freedom.

heading: Using machine learning to assess the livelihood impact of electricity access
description: Advancements in satellite imagery and machine learning can be used to infer the causal impact of electricity access on livelihoods, providing a low-cost, generalizable approach to evaluating public policy in data-spare environments.

heading: Medin co-aggregates with vascular amyloid-β in Alzheimer’s disease
description: Medin promotes the formation of vascular aggregates with amyloid-β in mouse models and in human patients with Alzheimer’s disease, and is associated with vascular defects and cognitive decline.

heading: Ferroptosis of tumour neutrophils causes immune suppression in cancer
description: Pathologically activated neutrophils, termed myeloid-derived suppressor cells, in the tumour microenvironment spontaneously undergo ferroptosis, which negatively regulates anti-tumour immunity through the release of oxygenated lipids, therefore limiting the activity of human and mouse T cells.

heading: APOE4 impairs myelination via cholesterol dysregulation in oligodendrocytes
authors: Joel W. BlanchardLeyla Anne AkayLi-Huei Tsai
description: APOE4 is associated with widespread gene expression changes across all cell types of the human brain, altered cholesterol homeostasis and transport signalling pathways, and decreased myelination in the brain.

heading: THP9 enhances seed protein content and nitrogen-use efficiency in maize
description: Genetic analyses of teosinte, the wild ancestor of maize, identify a locus (THP9) that is associated with high seed protein content and increased nitrogen-use efficiency, suggesting that THP9 could have applications in crop breeding.

heading: Ocean currents show global intensification of weak tropical cyclones
description: Both drifter current observations and satellite-based tropical cyclone (TC)-induced sea surface cooling demonstrate that weak TCs have intensified in recent decades.

heading: Integrated femtosecond pulse generator on thin-film lithium niobate
description: A femtosecond pulse generator is realized using an electro-optic time-lens system integrated on a lithium niobate photonic chip, capable of tunable repetition rates and wavelengths.

heading: Regulating surface potential maximizes voltage in all-perovskite tandems
description: Because open-circuit voltage deficit is greater in wide-bandgap perovskite solar cells, the authors introduce diammonium molecules to modify perovskite surface states and achieve a more uniform spatial distribution of surface potential, enabling record voltage all-perovskite tandem solar cells.

heading: Non-viral precision T cell receptor replacement for personalized cell therapy
authors: Susan P. FoyKyle JacobyStefanie J. Mandl
description: A first-in-human phase I clinical trial demonstrates the feasibility and safety of non-viral precision genome-engineering of a personalized adoptive cell transfer anticancer therapeutic.

heading: Parenchymal border macrophages regulate the flow dynamics of the cerebrospinal fluid
description: Perivascular and leptomeningeal macrophages, collectively termed here parenchymal border macrophages, are shown to regulate flow dynamics of cerebrospinal fluid, implicating this cell population as new therapeutic targets in neurological diseases such as Alzheimer’s.

heading: The neurons that restore walking after paralysis
description: Transcriptomic analysis following epidural electrical stimulation of the lumbar spinal cord during neurorehabilitation in mice identifies a population of neurons that orchestrates the restoration of walking following paralysis.

heading: Odour motion sensing enhances navigation of complex plumes
description: Odour motion contains valuable directional information that is absent from the airflow alone, and Drosophila use this directional information to shape their navigational decisions.

heading: Locomotion activates PKA through dopamine and adenosine in striatal neurons
description: Dopamine and adenosine act together in the striatum to regulate protein kinase A activity, which in turn coordinates animal locomotion.

heading: Perovskite solar cells based on screen-printed thin films
description: Using a stable and viscosity-tunable perovskite ink, a hybrid perovskite thin-film photovoltaic device can be deposited by the screen-printing method, which exhibits higher efficiency compared with previously investigated techniques.

heading: Separating water isotopologues using diffusion-regulatory porous materials
description: The authors demonstrate efficient separation of water isotopologues at room temperature using two porous coordination polymers that amplify their diffusion-rate difference.

heading: Metastatic recurrence in colorectal cancer arises from residual EMP1+ cells
description: A poor prognosis gene programme in patients with colorectal cancer is expressed by a unique tumour cell population that we name high-relapse cells (HRCs), and ablation of cells expressing the HRC marker EMP1 or neoadjuvant immunotherapy prevented metastatic recurrence in mice.

heading: Cumulative polarization in conductive interfacial ferroelectrics
description: Surface potential measurements of parallel WSe2 and MoS2 multi-layers with aligned and anti-aligned configurations of the polar interfaces were conducted showing evenly spaced, nearly decoupled potential steps, indicative of highly confined interfacial electric fields.

heading: Liver tumour immune microenvironment subtypes and neutrophil heterogeneity
description: Tumour-associated neutrophil populations enriched in the myeloid-cell-enriched tumour immune microenvironment subtype are associated with unfavourable prognosis in humans and mice with liver cancer.

heading: Extensive inland thinning and speed-up of Northeast Greenland Ice Stream
authors: Shfaqat A. KhanYoungmin ChoiAnders A. Bjørk
description: Analysis of global navigation satellite system observations and satellite data shows that frontal changes in 2012 of the North-East Greenland Ice Stream led to speed-up and thinning at least 200 km inland.

heading: Quantum field simulator for dynamics in curved spacetime
description: The behaviour of quantum fields in curved spacetime is simulated using a two-dimensional trapped quantum gas of potassium atoms with a configurable trap and adjustable interaction strength.

heading: Shock cooling of a red-supergiant supernova at redshift 3 in lensed images
description: The early stages of a lensed supernova at redshift 3 are found in images taken by the Hubble Space Telescope, with observations beginning from around 5.8 hours after the explosion.

heading: Ultra-bright, efficient and stable perovskite light-emitting diodes
description: The authors develop a method for the production of ultra-bright, efficient and stable perovskite light-emitting diodes, achieved with a simple in situ reaction process.

heading: Ferrobotic swarms enable accessible and adaptable automated viral testing
description: A handheld printed circuit board-based programmable platform using ferrobots can perform the complex, laboratory-equivalent procedures involved in multiplexed and pooled nucleic acid amplification testing, allowing for the decentralization of viral diagnostics.

heading: Two annual cycles of the Pacific cold tongue under orbital precession
authors: John C. H. ChiangAlyssa R. AtwoodAnthony J. Broccoli
description: The Pacific cold tongue is shown to possess two distinct annual cycles with complex interference effects, calling for a reassessment of its seasonal dynamics and re-evaluation of tropical Pacific palaeoclimate records of annual cycle phase changes.

heading: Multiple pathways for SARS-CoV-2 resistance to nirmatrelvir
description: Nirmatrelvir, an oral antiviral targeting the 3CL protease of SARS-CoV-2, has been demonstrated to be clinically useful against COVID-19, but viral resistance to the drug was found to arise readily via multiple pathways in vitro.

heading: A spatiotemporally resolved single-cell atlas of the Plasmodium liver stage
description: Single-cell RNA sequencing and single-molecule RNA transcript imaging have been used to characterize spatially and temporally resolved mouse liver and parasite expression programmes during infection with the rodent malaria parasite Plasmodium berghei ANKA.

heading: Discovery of chalcogenides structures and compositions using mixed fluxes
authors: Xiuquan ZhouVenkata Surya Chaitanya KolluruMercouri G. Kanatzidis
description: A new methodology for the discovery of chalcogenides by tuning the temperature and flux ratios of systems using mixed fluxes is demonstrated, leading to the synthesis of 30 new and unreported compounds or compositions.

heading: Spatial genomics maps the structure, nature and evolution of cancer clones
description: A workflow centred around base-specific in situ sequencing generates detailed maps of, and can phenotypically characterize, the unique set of subclones of cancers.

heading: A multinational Delphi consensus to end the COVID-19 public health threat
description: A diverse, multidisciplinary panel of 386 experts in COVID-19 response from 112 countries provides health and social policy actions to address inadequacies in the pandemic response and help to bring this public health threat to an end.

heading: Entorhinal cortex directs learning-related changes in CA1 representations
description: Analysis of the activity of CA1 cells in mice performing a learning task shows that the entorhinal cortex signals behavioural timescale synaptic plasticity to generate learning-related changes in the hippocampus.

heading: Inulin fibre promotes microbiota-derived bile acids and type 2 inflammation
description: Dietary inulin fibre alters the composition and metabolism of gut microbiota, resulting in elevated levels of bile acids that subsequently trigger mucosal type 2 inflammation characterized by eosinophilia, with clinical implications for allergy and anti-helminth defence.

heading: Blocking PD-L1–PD-1 improves senescence surveillance and ageing phenotypes
description: PD-L1 expression by senescent cells renders them resistant to clearance by CD8 T cells, suggesting PD-L1 as a target for mitigating the effects of ageing.

heading: Non-redundant functions of group 2 innate lymphoid cells
authors: Katja J. JarickPatrycja M. TopczewskaChristoph S. N. Klose
description: Specific deletion of group 2 innate lymphoid cells in mice shows these cells have roles in the recruitment of eosinophils and in mounting immune and epithelial type 2 responses.

heading: Characterization of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron BA.4 and BA.5 isolates in rodents
description: Results indicate that the sublineages BA.4 and BA.5 of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron variants have similar pathogenicity to that of the BA.2 sublineage in rodents, highlighting the importance of evaluating viral replication and pathogenesis using clinical isolates.

heading: Light competition drives herbivore and nutrient effects on plant diversity
description: Competition for light can cause plant diversity loss in grassland ecosystems when fertilized or herbivores are excluded, and experimentally restoring light can mitigate this biodiversity loss.

heading: Nociceptor neurons affect cancer immunosurveillance
description: Melanoma cells interact with pain-mediating sensory neurons by increasing their release of the neuropeptide CGRP, which increases the exhaustion of CD8+ T cells and thus promotes the survival of cancer cells.

heading: Histone H2B.8 compacts flowering plant sperm through chromatin phase separation
description: H2B.8 is identified as a histone variant that mediates a newly described mechanism of transcription-compatible chromatin condensation in flowering plant sperm cells.

heading: Strain-retardant coherent perovskite phase stabilized Ni-rich cathode
description: The introduction of a coherent perovskite phase into the layered structure of a lithium-ion battery reduces lattice strain and stress to produce a robust crystal structure.

heading: Hydroclimatic vulnerability of peat carbon in the central Congo Basin
description: Between around 5,000 to 2,000 years ago, a drying climate in the vast peatlands of the Congo Basin triggered peat decomposition and carbon release to the atmosphere, implying that this region may be vulnerable to future climate change.

heading: An optical atomic clock based on a highly charged ion
authors: Steven A. KingLukas J. SpießPiet O. Schmidt
description: An optical atomic clock operating on a magnetic-dipole transition in a highly charged argon ion is shown to improve uncertainties for the absolute transition frequency and isotope shift by several orders of magnitude.

heading: Broad transcriptomic dysregulation occurs across the cerebral cortex in ASD
authors: Michael J. GandalJillian R. HaneyDaniel H. Geschwind
description: RNA sequencing reveals widespread transcriptomic changes across the cerebral cortex in autism spectrum disorder, including primary sensory regions, in addition to association regions, as well as an attenuation of regional identity.

heading: Neuropeptide regulation of non-redundant ILC2 responses at barrier surfaces
description: The development of a new genetic tool to selectively deplete or modify group 2 innate lymphoid cells (ILC2s) addresses the debate regarding the non-redundant functions of this immune cell type.

heading: Real-time bioelectronic sensing of environmental contaminants
authors: Joshua T. AtkinsonLin SuCaroline M. Ajo-Franklin
description: The combination of synthetic biology and materials engineering enabled the development of biosensors that produce electrical readouts and real-time detection capabilities.

heading: Small rainfall changes drive substantial changes in plant coexistence
authors: Mary N. Van DykeJonathan M. LevineNathan J. B. Kraft
description: Reduced precipitation changes competitive outcomes among plant species, and species pairs that were functionally more similar were less likely to experience these changes.

heading: Extracellular fluid viscosity enhances cell migration and cancer dissemination
description: Elevated viscosity counterintuitively increases the motility of various cell types in vitro and imprints mechanical memory to tumour cells, which enables them to disseminate more efficiently in vivo.

heading: Coherent surface plasmon polariton amplification via free-electron pumping
description: Stimulated emission by free electrons is used to amplify terahertz surface plasmon polaritons in a manner resembles that of light amplification in a high-gain free-electron laser.

heading: Volcanic trigger of ocean deoxygenation during Cordilleran ice sheet retreat
description: Deoxygenation in the North Pacific immediately after the Cordilleran ice sheet retreat was shown to be linked with volcanism, suggesting that coupling between atmosphere, ocean, cryosphere and solid-Earth systems can drive biogeochemical change.

heading: Pivotal role of reversible NiO6 geometric conversion in oxygen evolution
description: An electron transfer mechanism that involves a light-triggered geometric conversion between metal and oxygen redox chemistry shows superior performance compared with approaches that use either metal or oxygen redox chemistry.

heading: Bestrophin-2 and glutamine synthetase form a complex for glutamate release
description: Electrophysiological, structural and biochemical studies on the bestrophin-2 anion channel reveal asymmetric permeability to glutamate and show that it forms a cooperative machinery in complex with glutamine synthetase for glutamate release.

heading: Hydroxamic acid pre-adsorption raises the efficiency of cosensitized solar cells
description: Two newly designed co-adsorbed dye-sensitized solar cells that harvest light quantitatively across the entire visible domain are described, which offer promising applications as power supplies and battery replacements for low-power electronic devices.

heading: 3D-printed machines that manipulate microscopic objects using capillary forces
authors: Cheng ZengMaya Winters FaaborgVinothan N. Manoharan
description: By harnessing capillary forces, 3D-printed machines with cross-sections that vary by height can move floating objects programmatically in two dimensions and even braid filaments without physical contact.

heading: Structural basis of actin filament assembly and aging
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of skeletal F-actin show solvent-driven rearrangements governing actin filament assembly and aging with potential application in design of drugs and small molecules for imaging and therapy.

heading: Single-cell genomic variation induced by mutational processes in cancer
description: Single-cell whole-genome sequencing shows that 'foreground' cell-to-cell structural variation and alterations in copy number are associated with genomic diversity and evolution in triple-negative breast and high-grade serous ovarian cancers.

heading: Muscles that move the retina augment compound eye vision in Drosophila
authors: Lisa M. FenkSofia C. AvritzerGaby Maimon
description: Drosophila are shown to have retinal muscles that allow them to smoothly track visual motion and also to make rapid eye movements, and the associated functions and mechanisms involved are discussed.

heading: Adenylate cyclase activity of TIR1/AFB auxin receptors in plants
description: Adenylate cyclase activity in TIR1/AFB, the canonical auxin receptor, has an essential role in auxin-mediated root growth inhibition in land plants.

heading: Non-canonical β-adrenergic activation of ERK at endosomes
description: β2-adrenergic receptor(β2AR) signalling induces ERK activity at endosomes, but not at the plasma membrane, and this activity is dependent on active, endosome-localized Gαs and requires ligand-stimulated β2AR endocytosis.

heading: Functional antibodies exhibit light chain coherence
authors: David B. JaffePayam ShahiWyatt J. McDonnell
description: Among naturally occurring antibodies that have adapted to antigen, those with similar heavy chains usually have similar light chains.

heading: Open-channel metal particle superlattices
description: DNA-mediated assembly of hollow nanoparticles can be used in an edge-bonding approach to design and synthesize nanoscale open-channel superlattices, with control of symmetry, geometry and topology.

heading: Functional CeOx nanoglues for robust atomically dispersed catalysts
description: Nanometre-sized ‘nanoglue’ islands of CeOx on high-surface-area SiO2 are shown to suppress sintering and confine on average one Pt atom per island, leading to stable single-atom catalysts under oxidizing and reducing environments.

heading: The co-evolution of the genome and epigenome in colorectal cancer
description: A study maps genetic and epigenetic heterogeneity of primary colorectal adenomas and cancers at single-clone resolution through spatial multi-omic profiling of individual glands and adjacent normal tissue.

heading: Measurement of 19F(p, γ)20Ne reaction suggests CNO breakout in first stars
description: Observation of a new resonance in the 19-fluorine to 20-neon thermonuclear reaction at the China JinPing Underground Laboratory (over 2 km below ground) may provide clues to observed discrepancies in calcium production in the evolution of the first stars.

heading: Extreme escalation of heat failure rates in ectotherms with global warming
description: Within the stressful temperature range, heat failure rate increases by more than 100% per degree Celsius across a broad range of ectotherm taxa.

heading: Intrinsic glassy-metallic transport in an amorphous coordination polymer
description: An unusual new material, NiTTFtt, is reported that is structurally amorphous, precluding a classical band structure, but detailed characterization reveals high conductivity and a metallic character.

heading: Subtype-specific 3D genome alteration in acute myeloid leukaemia
description: Extensive genomic analyses of the chromatin architecture in acute myeloid leukaemia reveals several characteristics, including subtype-specific distal enhancers and silencers, that may represent new anticancer therapeutic targets.

heading: Environmental signal in the evolutionary diversification of bird skeletons
authors: Guillermo NavalónAlexander BjarnasonRoger B. J. Benson
description: Morphological diversification in living birds is analysed, with substantial variation in evolutionary modes among subgroups and skeletal parts found, along with an important role for environmental divergence in structuring the radiation of crown-group birds.

heading: Synchrotron tomography of a stem lizard elucidates early squamate anatomy
description: A study using high-resolution synchrotron phase-contrast tomography documents the near-complete skeleton of a stem squamate, Bellairsia gracilis, from the Middle Jurassic epoch of Scotland, providing insights into early squamate anatomy.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of the SEA complex
description: The cryo-EM structure of the yeast SEA complex suggests that SEACAT functions as a scaffold for binding TORC1 regulators.

heading: Phenotypic plasticity and genetic control in colorectal cancer evolution
description: Intratumour genetic ancestry only infrequently affects gene expression traits and subclonal evolution in colorectal cancer, with most genetic intratumour variation having no detected phenotypic consequence and transcriptional plasticity being widespread within a tumour.

heading: Quantifying the cost savings of global solar photovoltaic supply chains
authors: John Paul HelvestonGang HeMichael R. Davidson
description: Modelling shows that a globalized solar photovoltaic module supply chain has resulted in photovoltaic installation cost savings of billions of dollars.

heading: Neoadjuvant relatlimab and nivolumab in resectable melanoma
authors: Rodabe N. AmariaMichael PostowHussein A. Tawbi
description: Patients with resectable clinical stage III or oligometastatic stage IV melanoma were given neoadjuvant relatlimab and nivolumab combination immunotherapy, which induced a high pathologic complete response rate, indicating the efficacy and safety of this regimen.

heading: Bending forces and nucleotide state jointly regulate F-actin structure
authors: Matthew J. ReynoldsCarla HachichoGregory M. Alushin
description: The nucleotide state of actin modulates F-actin structural transitions evoked by bending forces.

heading: Condensed-phase isomerization through tunnelling gateways
authors: Arnab ChoudhuryJessalyn A. DeVineAlec M. Wodtke
description: Measurements of  isomerization rates  of CO isotopologues on an NaCl surface show a nonmonotonic mass dependence that arises from  resonantly enhanced cross-barrier coupling, or ‘tunnelling gateways’, which  are intrinsic to condensed-phase tunnelling.

heading: Identification of environmental factors that promote intestinal inflammation
authors: Liliana M. SanmarcoChun-Cheih ChaoFrancisco J. Quintana
description: The herbicide propyzamide increases inflammation in the small and large intestine, and the AHR–NF-κB–C/EBPβ signalling axis—which operates in T cells and dendritic cells to promote intestinal inflammation—is targeted by propyzamide.

heading: Additive manufacturing of micro-architected metals via hydrogel infusion
authors: Max A. SacconeRebecca A. GallivanJulia R. Greer
description: An additive manufacturing technique that infuses 3D printed hydrogels with metallic precursors leads to metallic micromaterials, providing new opportunities for the fabrication of energy materials, micro-electromechanical systems and biomedical devices.

heading: Recognition of cyclic dinucleotides and folates by human SLC19A1
description: Two cyclic dinucleotide molecules bind within the cavity of human SLC19A1 as a compact dual-molecule unit, whereas folate and antifolate bind to SLC19A1 as a monomer and occupy a distinct pocket of the cavity.

heading: A tape-reading molecular ratchet
description: A molecular ratchet, in which a crown ether is pumped from solution onto an encoded molecular strand by a pulse of chemical fuel, opens the way for the reading of information along molecular tapes.

heading: Reply to: Triassic sauropodomorph eggshell might not be soft
authors: Mark A. NorellJasmina WiemannDarla K. Zelenitsky

heading: Triassic sauropodomorph eggshell might not be soft
The E3 ligase adapter cereblon targets the C-terminal cyclic imide degron
authors: Saki IchikawaHope A. FlaxmanChristina M. Woo
description: C-terminal cyclic imides are physiological degrons that enable the ubiquitin E3 ligase adapter protein cereblon to target substrates for degradation.

heading: A 0.6 Mpc H i structure associated with Stephan’s Quintet
description: Atomic hydrogen observations in the vicinity of Stephan’s Quintet are reported, showing a large gaseous structure of around 0.6 Mpc in size in the velocity range of 6,550–6,750 km s−1.

heading: Nonlinear decision-making with enzymatic neural networks
description: Mimicking traditional digital neural networks with DNA-encoded ‘enzymatic’ neurons overcomes issues with other chemical approaches, and could allow notable increases in miniaturization and molecular implementation of these AI models, with potential applications including DNA data storage or cancer diagnosis.

heading: Mechanism of an intramembrane chaperone for multipass membrane proteins
authors: Luka SmalinskaitėMin Kyung KimRamanujan S. Hegde
description: Biochemical and structural analysis of intermediates during multipass membrane protein biogenesis showed how an intramembrane chaperone guides nascent membrane proteins to a semi-enclosed lipid-filled cavity where they are inserted and folded correctly.

heading: Calcium dissolution in bridgmanite in the Earth’s deep mantle
description: Experiments show that calcium solubility in bridgmanite increases with depth in Earth’s lower mantle, resulting in the disappearance of CaSiO3 perovskite and indicating a transition from a two-perovskite to a single-perovskite domain.

heading: Borgs are giant genetic elements with potential to expand metabolic capacity
authors: Basem Al-ShayebMarie C. SchoelmerichJillian F. Banfield
description: Borgs are remarkably large, divergent archaeal extrachromosomal elements with metabolic genes linked to the methane cycle.

heading: Entanglement-enhanced matter-wave interferometry in a high-finesse cavity
authors: Graham P. GreveChengyi LuoJames K. Thompson
description: A matter-wave interferometer is demonstrated with an interferometric phase noise below the standard quantum limit, combining two core concepts of quantum mechanics, that a particle can simultaneously be in two places at once and entanglement between distinct particles.

heading: Ion regulation at gills precedes gas exchange and the origin of vertebrates
authors: Michael A. SackvilleChristopher B. CameronColin J. Brauner
description: Measurements in three taxa with the characteristics of vertebrate ancestors (lamprey ammocoetes, amphioxus and acorn worms) suggest that gas exchange at gills has a vertebrate origin, but that ion regulation at gills has an earlier and possibly stem deuterostome origin.

heading: Gut bacteria alleviate smoking-related NASH by degrading gut nicotine
description: Nicotine accumulates in the intestine during tobacco smoking and accelerates the progression of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), but it can be degraded effectively by the human symbiont Bacteroides xylanisolvens.

heading: Fast resupply of synaptic vesicles requires synaptotagmin-3
authors: Dennis J. WeingartenAmita ShresthaSkyler L. Jackman
description: Synaptotagmin-3 is identified as the presynaptic high-affinity calcium sensor to rapidly replenish synaptic vesicles to maintain steady synaptic transmission.

heading: From planetary to regional boundaries for agricultural nitrogen pollution
authors: L. F. Schulte-UebbingA. H. W. BeusenW. de Vries
description: Modelling of regional and planetary boundaries for agricultural nitrogen pollution finds that the global nitrogen surplus boundary is lower than the current nitrogen surplus.

heading: More losses than gains during one century of plant biodiversity change in Germany
description: Time-series data including 1,794 plant species from 7,738 vegetation plots in Germany between 1927 and 2020 reveal patterns of change in biodiversity, and suggest that more species declined than increased in abundance during this period.

heading: An integrated imaging sensor for aberration-corrected 3D photography
description: A meta-imaging sensor detects an extra-fine 4D light field distribution using a vibrating microlens array, enabling high-resolution 3D photography up to a gigapixel with fast aberration correction, demonstrated on a telescope aimed at the Moon.

heading: Semi-automated assembly of high-quality diploid human reference genomes
authors: Erich D. JarvisGiulio FormentiKaren H. Miga
description: Which combination of current genome sequencing and assembly approaches results in high-quality, complete diploid genome assemblies is determined.

heading: Evolution of immune genes is associated with the Black Death
authors: Jennifer KlunkTauras P. VilgalysLuis B. Barreiro
description: Klunk and colleagues identify signatures of natural selection imposed by Yersinia pestis and demonstrate their effect on genetic diversity and susceptibility to certain diseases in the present day.

heading: Behavioural and dopaminergic signatures of resilience
description: Neural recording and closed-loop manipulation during chronic stress in mice reveal causal links between dopamine, behavior and resilience.

heading: Measured proton electromagnetic structure deviates from theoretical predictions
description: Measurements of the proton’s electromagnetic structure show enhancement of its electric generalized polarizability compared with theoretical expectations, confirming the presence of a new dynamical mechanism not accounted for by current theories.

heading: Clathrin-associated AP-1 controls termination of STING signalling
description: The adaptor protein AP-1 controls the shutdown of STING signalling through a mechanism in which AP-1 recognizes a dileucine motif in phosphorylated STING, which leads to targeted transport of STING to the endolysosomal system for degradation.

heading: Genetic insights into the social organization of Neanderthals
description: Genetic data for 13 Neanderthals from 2 Middle Palaeolithic sites in the Altai Mountains of southern Siberia presented provide insights into the social organization of an isolated Neanderthal community at the easternmost extent of their known range.

heading: Accommodating unobservability to control flight attitude with optic flow
authors: Guido C. H. E. de CroonJulien J. G. DupeyrouxFranck Ruffier
description: Attitude can be extracted from optic flow when combined with a motion model that relates attitude to acceleration direction, which leads to stable flight attitude control with slight oscillations due to unobservable conditions.

heading: HRG-9 homologues regulate haem trafficking from haem-enriched compartments
description: HRG-9 (also known as TANGO2) is an evolutionarily conserved haem chaperone that traffics haem from sites of storage or synthesis in eukaryotic cells.

heading: Substrate-driven assembly of a translocon for multipass membrane proteins
description: Biochemical reconstitution and functional analysis reveal how newly synthesized multipass membrane proteins dynamically remodel the translocon to facilitate their successful biogenesis.

heading: Warm pool ocean heat content regulates ocean–continent moisture transport
description: Geochemical proxies from 360,000-year-old sediment cores and numerical simulations are used to show that the upper ocean heat content of the Indo-Pacific Warm Pool greatly affects the Asian monsoon hydroclimate.

heading: Shape memory in self-adapting colloidal crystals
authors: Seungkyu LeeHeather A. CalcaterraChad A. Mirkin
description: Preparing crystals held together with macromolecular bonds can create shape memory materials that can be engineered to exhibit a wide range of reversible changes useful for chemical sensing, optics and robotics.

heading: Structural principles of B cell antigen receptor assembly
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the mouse class M immunoglobulin B cell receptor complex provide insight into B cell receptor subunit assembly, domain architecture and signalling mechanism.

heading: Movement is governed by rotational neural dynamics in spinal motor networks
authors: Henrik LindénPeter C. PetersenRune W. Berg
description: A study presents ensemble recordings of neurons in the lumbar spinal cord indicating that activity in spinal cord circuits for movement follows low-dimensional rotational dynamics, and proposes a theory of neural generation of movements.

heading: Structures of the TMC-1 complex illuminate mechanosensory transduction
description: Structural studies of the native transmembrane channel-like protein 1 (TMC-1) mechanosensory transduction channel complex of Caenorhabditis elegans reveal the subunit composition and the roles of protein–membrane interactions in the conversion of mechanical force to ion channel activity.

heading: Maturation and circuit integration of transplanted human cortical organoids
description: Human stem cell-derived cortical organoids transplanted into rats mature and integrate into sensory and motivation circuits to influence behaviour.

heading: Activation of γ-globin expression by hypoxia-inducible factor 1α
description: Detailed mechanistic insight into fetal globin gene induction during hypoxia-associated stress erythropoiesis provides new therapeutic approaches to treat β-haemoglobinopathies, such as sickle cell disease and β-thalassaemia.

heading: Global trends of cropland phosphorus use and sustainability challenges
description: The historical and spatial patterns of the phosphorus budget and phosphorus use efficiency by country and crop type are reported, and used to determine phosphorus pollution and scarcity challenges.

heading: Structure of the OMEGA nickase IsrB in complex with ωRNA and target DNA
description: The cryogenic-electron microscopy structure of the D. thermocuniculi IsrB protein in complex with its cognate ωRNA and a target DNA shows that the RNA-dominant IsrB effector complex shares a common scaffold with the protein-dominant Cas9 effector complex.

heading: Optical superluminal motion measurement in the neutron-star merger GW170817
description: Optical superluminal motion in the binary neutron-star merger GW170817 is used to constrain the speed and morphology of the structured jet, and improve constraints on the inclination angle of the merging binary system.

heading: Spatiotemporal imaging of charge transfer in photocatalyst particles
description: Photovoltage measurements on cuprous oxide photocatalyst particles are used to spatiotemporally track the charge transfer processes on the femtosecond to second timescale at the single-particle level.

heading: Multi-environment robotic transitions through adaptive morphogenesis
description: A design strategy termed ‘adaptive morphogenesis’ enables a robot inspired by aquatic and terrestrial turtles to adapt its limb morphology and gait to specialize for locomotion in different environments.

heading: Attosecond clocking of correlations between Bloch electrons
description: By forcing electron–hole pairs onto closed trajectories attosecond clocking of delocalized Bloch electrons is achieved, enabling greater understanding of unexpected phase transitions and quantum-dynamic phenomena.

heading: A saturated map of common genetic variants associated with human height
description: A large genome-wide association study of more than 5 million individuals reveals that 12,111 single-nucleotide polymorphisms account for nearly all the heritability of height attributable to common genetic variants.

heading: Radiation-driven acceleration in the expanding WR140 dust shell
description: Multiepoch imagery of the circumstellar dust shell in WR140 is modelled to trace the expansion of the dust plume, which seems to be subject to radiation-driven acceleration.

heading: A function-based typology for Earth’s ecosystems
authors: David A. KeithJosé R. Ferrer-ParisRichard T. Kingsford
description: The International Union for Conservation of Nature’s Global Ecosystem Typology has been developed to provide a systematic framework for data on all of Earth’s ecosystems in a unified theoretical context to support biodiversity conservation and ecosystem services.

heading: Switchable chiral transport in charge-ordered kagome metal CsV3Sb5
authors: Chunyu GuoCarsten PutzkePhilip J. W. Moll
description: Change of chirality from left- to right-handed transport in the layered kagome metal CsV3Sb5 can be controlled by small magnetic field changes, a required feature for chiral electronic applications.

heading: Global hotspots for soil nature conservation
description: A global field survey that analyses samples of soil from all continents identifies hotspots for soil nature conservation, and shows that different ecological dimensions of soil are associated with different priority areas for conservation.

heading: Enhanced interactions of interlayer excitons in free-standing heterobilayers
description: Reduced dielectric screening in a free-standing heterobilayer results in higher formation efficiency of interlayer excitons and leads to strongly enhanced dipole–dipole interactions, enabling the observation of many-body correlations at the quantum limit.

heading: Personalizing exoskeleton assistance while walking in the real world
authors: Patrick SladeMykel J. KochenderferSteven H. Collins
description: A portable ankle exoskeleton uses a data-driven method and wearable sensors to adapt to the user as they walk in a natural setting.

heading: Spontaneous generation and active manipulation of real-space optical vortices
description: A photonic platform that allows the spontaneous generation and active manipulation of an optical vortex–antivortex pair using an external magnetic field is demonstrated.

heading: General-relativistic precession in a black-hole binary
description: Analysis of a gravitational-wave signal reveals a strongly precessing black-hole binary that contains a rapidly spinning black hole.

heading: Control of chiral orbital currents in a colossal magnetoresistance material
description: Current-control of chiral orbital current-enabled colossal magnetoresistance offers a new paradigm for quantum technologies.

heading: Fast charging of energy-dense lithium-ion batteries
description: A new approach to charging energy-dense electric vehicle batteries, using temperature modulation with a dual-salt electrolyte, promises a range in excess of 500,000 miles using only rapid (under 12 minute) charges.

heading: Nd isotope variation between the Earth–Moon system and enstatite chondrites
description: Isotopic analysis reveals that the samarium/neodymium ratio of the Earth–Moon system is higher than that of chondrites, and that the neodymium composition of Earth is similar to that of enstatite chondrites.

heading: Magnetic fields of 30 to 100 kG in the cores of red giant stars
description: Magnetic fields of 30 to 100 kilogauss are measured in the cores of three giant red stars observed with the Kepler satellite.

heading: Inferring and perturbing cell fate regulomes in human brain organoids
authors: Jonas Simon FleckSophie Martina Johanna JansenBarbara Treutlein
description: A multi-omic atlas of brain organoid development facilitates the inference of an underlying gene regulatory network using the newly developed Pando framework and shows—in conjunction with perturbation experiments—that GLI3 controls forebrain fate establishment through interaction with HES4/5 regulomes.

heading: Antibiotic combinations reduce Staphylococcus aureus clearance
description: Different pairs of antibiotics show qualitatively different bacterial clearance interactions—some pairs show reciprocal suppression whereby the drug mixture efficacy is weaker than the individual drugs alone, and the clearance efficacy decreases as more drugs are added.

heading: Scleromochlus and the early evolution of Pterosauromorpha
authors: Davide FoffaEmma M. DunnePaul M. Barrett
description: Using microcomputed tomographic scans, whole-skeletal reconstruction of the tiny Scleromochlus taylori from the early Late Triassic of Scotland reveals new anatomical details, identifying it as a cousin of pterosaurs.

heading: Opposing roles of hepatic stellate cell subpopulations in hepatocarcinogenesis
description: Subpopulations of cytokine-producing and myofibroblastic hepatic stellate cells, identified by single-cell RNA sequencing, protect against or promote the development of hepatocellular carcinoma via high expression of hepatocyte growth factor or type I collagen, respectively..

heading: The time-programmable frequency comb and its use in quantum-limited ranging
authors: Emily D. CaldwellLaura C. SinclairJean-Daniel Deschenes
description: A self-referenced optical frequency comb with digital electronics is used for real-time attosecond control of the comb’s pulse train, and can be used in quantum-limited sensing.

heading: Collagenolysis-dependent DDR1 signalling dictates pancreatic cancer outcome
description: Cleaved and intact type I collagen have different effects on pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC), and remodelling of type I collagen—mediated through DDR1 signalling—is a prognostic indicator for the survival of patients with PDAC.

heading: Structure of the NuA4 acetyltransferase complex bound to the nucleosome
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of NuA4 from Saccharomyces cerevisiae bound to the nucleosome illustrates how NuA4 is assembled and provides mechanistic insights into nucleosome recognition and transcription co-activation by a histone acetyltransferase.

heading: Free-space dissemination of time and frequency with 10−19 instability over 113 km
description: By using 1 W optical frequency combs and nanowatt-level linear optical sampling modules, a time–frequency dissemination over a free-space link of 113 km is achieved with a stability of less than 4 × 10−19 at 10,000 s.

heading: A dense 0.1-solar-mass star in a 51-minute-orbital-period eclipsing binary
authors: Kevin B. BurdgeKareem El-BadryThomas A. Prince
description: A 51-minute-orbital-period, fully eclipsing binary system consisting of a star with a comparable temperature to that of the Sun but a 100 times greater density, accreting onto a white dwarf is reported.

heading: Invisible ship tracks show large cloud sensitivity to aerosol
description: Investigations of the effect of aerosol emissions from shipping on cloud properties when both visible and invisible ship tracks are considered implies a large negative radiative effect (and associated cooling) from liquid water path adjustments.

heading: STING-induced regulatory B cells compromise NK function in cancer immunity
description: Systemic treatment of pancreatic cancer with STING agonist stimulates regulatory B cells to express immunosuppressive cytokine IL-35, which weakens the anti-tumour function of natural killer cells.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 disrupts host epigenetic regulation via histone mimicry
description: The SARS-CoV-2 protein ORF8 functions as a mimic of histone H3 to disrupt host cell epigenetic regulation.

heading: The γδ IEL effector API5 masks genetic susceptibility to Paneth cell death
description: Intraepithelial lymphocytes expressing γ and δ T cell receptor subunits protect Paneth cells from cell death caused by viral infection or Crohn's disease.

heading: Programmable RNA sensing for cell monitoring and manipulation
description: RNA sensing-mediated payload expression provides a specific, versatile, simple and generalizable means of detecting and manipulating animal cells with broad potential applications.

heading: NMR-guided directed evolution
authors: Sagar BhattacharyaEleonora G. MargheritisIvan V. Korendovych
description: NMR spectroscopy has been used to guide the directed evolution of myoglobin to a Kemp eliminase with high catalytic efficiency, outlining an approach that is likely to be generally applicable to other enzyme activities.

heading: Arctic Ocean annual high in \({{\boldsymbol{p}}}_{{{\bf{CO}}}_{{\bf{2}}}}\) could shift from winter to summer
description: Simulations suggest that the partial pressure of carbon dioxide in the Arctic Ocean will shift from a winter to a summer maximum owing to enhanced summer sea surface warming from earlier sea-ice retreat.

heading: Discovering faster matrix multiplication algorithms with reinforcement learning
description: A reinforcement learning approach based on AlphaZero is used to discover efficient and provably correct algorithms for matrix multiplication, finding faster algorithms for a variety of matrix sizes.

heading: Nuclear-embedded mitochondrial DNA sequences in 66,083 human genomes
authors: Wei WeiKatherine R. SchonPatrick F. Chinnery
description: A study examining DNA transfer from mitochondria to the nucleus using whole-genome sequences from 66,083 people shows that this is an ongoing dynamic process in normal cells with distinct roles in different types of cancer.

heading: Low-hysteresis shape-memory ceramics designed by multimode modelling
authors: Edward L. PangGregory B. OlsonChristopher A. Schuh
description: Combining computational thermodynamics and data science tools with lattice engineering enables the design of shape-memory ceramics with reduced hysteresis.

heading: Stroke genetics informs drug discovery and risk prediction across ancestries
description: A cross-ancestry meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies association signals for stroke and its subtypes at 89 (61 new) independent loci, reveals putative causal genes, highlighting F11, KLKB1, PROC, GP1BA, LAMC2 and VCAM1 as potential drug targets, and provides cross-ancestry integrative risk prediction.

heading: Viruses inhibit TIR gcADPR signalling to overcome bacterial defence
description: We identified Tad1, a large family of phage-encoded proteins that inhibit Thoeris immunity, and define the chemical structure of a central immune signalling molecule, showing a new mode of action by which pathogens can suppress host immunity.

heading: Prenatal immune stress blunts microglia reactivity, impairing neurocircuitry
description: Aberrantly formed microglia due to an adverse prenatal environment affect long-term microglia reactivity and proper striatal circuit development in mice

heading: The oldest gnathostome teeth
authors: Plamen S. AndreevIvan J. SansomMin Zhu
description: Direct evidence for the presence of jawed vertebrates in the early Silurian (around 439 million years ago) is provided by isolated tooth whorls of the gnathostome Qianodus duplicis from Guizhou province, China.

heading: LRRC15+ myofibroblasts dictate the stromal setpoint to suppress tumour immunity
authors: Akshay T. KrishnamurtyJustin A. ShyerShannon J. Turley
description: LRRC15-positive cancer-associated fibroblasts constitute a pivotal axis in tumorigenesis and are potential therapeutic targets to improve responses to immune checkpoint blockade.

heading: PD-1-cis IL-2R agonism yields better effectors from stem-like CD8+ T cells
description: Binding of the PD1-IL2v immunocytokine to PD-1 and IL-2Rβγ on the same cell leads to an alternative differentiation of stem-like CD8+ T cells into better effectors rather than exhausted T cells in models of both chronic infection and cancer.

heading: Bespoke library docking for 5-HT2A receptor agonists with antidepressant activity
authors: Anat Levit KaplanDanielle N. ConfairJonathan A. Ellman
description: New agonists of the serotonin 5-HT2A receptor (5-HT2AR) confer high brain permeability and antidepressant activity and—in contrast to classic 5-HT2AR agonists—lack psychedelic activity.

heading: Galeaspid anatomy and the origin of vertebrate paired appendages
description: Articulated remains of Tujiaaspis vividus reveal that galeaspids—extinct jawless vertebrates—had precursors to paired pectoral fins that consisted of paired, continuous pectoral–pelvic lateral fins that passively generated lift.

heading: Extending the spectrum of fully integrated photonics to submicrometre wavelengths
description: Fully integrated photonics at submicrometre wavelengths is realized by a heterogeneous integration technology.

heading: Topological Chern vectors in three-dimensional photonic crystals
description: Magnetically tunable three-dimensional photonic crystals are used to achieve the experimental demonstration of Chern vectors and their topological surface states, showing the Chern vector to be an intrinsic bulk topological invariant in three-dimensional topological materials.

heading: Universal control of a six-qubit quantum processor in silicon
authors: Stephan G. J. PhilipsMateusz T. MądzikLieven M. K. Vandersypen
description: The universal control of six qubits in a 28Si/SiGe quantum dot array is demonstrated, achieving Rabi oscillations for each qubit with visibilities of 93.5–98.0%, implying high readout and initialization fidelities.

heading: State-dependent pupil dilation rapidly shifts visual feature selectivity
authors: Katrin FrankeKonstantin F. WillekeAndreas S. Tolias
description: Computational modelling and functional imaging of awake, active mice show that behaviour directly changes neuronal tuning in the visual cortex through pupil dilation.

heading: Photonic topological insulator induced by a dislocation in three dimensions
description: By introducing a further modal dimension to transform a two-dimensional photonic waveguide array, a photonic topological insulator with protected topological surface states in three dimensions, enabled by a screw dislocation, is demonstrated.

heading: Anomalous slip in body-centred cubic metals
description: Observations by transmission electron microscopy of deforming niobium and tungsten at low temperature shows that anomalous slip in body-centred cubic metals arises from the unusually high mobility of multi-junctions, which is a source of softening.

heading: The oldest complete jawed vertebrates from the early Silurian of China
description: Two new species of well-preserved jawed fishes with complete bodies from the early Silurian period (Telychian age, around 436 million years ago) of Chongqing, South China are described: a jawed stem gnathostome, Xiushanosteus mirabilis, and a chondrichthyan, Shenacanthus vermiformis.

heading: PD-1 combination therapy with IL-2 modifies CD8+ T cell exhaustion program
description: PD-1+TCF1+ stem-like CD8+ T cells—precursors of exhausted CD8+ T cells—are not fate-locked into the exhaustion program; their differentiation trajectory can be changed by IL-2 signals.

heading: An LKB1–mitochondria axis controls TH17 effector function
description: OPA1 regulates the formation of the distinct mitochondrial morphology observed in T helper 17 cells, which influences cytokine expression via LKB1.

heading: Self-assembly of emulsion droplets through programmable folding
description: For a minimal model system of colloidal droplet chains, with programmable DNA interactions, it is shown that controlling the order in which interactions are switched on directs folding into unique structures.

heading: Spiny chondrichthyan from the lower Silurian of South China
authors: Plamen S. AndreevIvan J. SansomMin Zhu
description: Fanjingshania renovata possesses dermal shoulder girdle plates and fin spines similar to those of a subset of stem chondrichthyans, but also has osteichthyan-like resorptive shedding of scale odontodes and an absence of odontogenic tissues in its spines.

heading: Structure of the Ebola virus polymerase complex
description: Structural studies of the Ebola virus polymerase complex provide insights into its function and demonstrate the structural basis of its inhibition by suramin.

heading: Galaxy clusters enveloped by vast volumes of relativistic electrons
description: For four galaxy clusters it is shown that the radio halo emission is embedded in a much larger emission that extends over 2–3 Mpc, filling the volume of the clusters.

heading: A mechanism for oxidative damage repair at gene regulatory elements
authors: Swagat RayArwa A. AbugableSherif F. El-Khamisy
description: The nuclear mitotic apparatus protein NuMA helps to protect genes from oxidative damage by occupying regions around transcription start sites, binding DNA repair factors and promoting transcription following damage.

heading: Visualizing translation dynamics at atomic detail inside a bacterial cell
description: Cryo-electron tomography is used to reveal the structural dynamics and functional diversity of translating ribosomes in Mycoplasma pneumoniae, providing insight into the translation elongation cycle inside cells and how it is reshaped by antibiotics.

heading: CRISPR screens in Drosophila cells identify Vsg as a Tc toxin receptor
description: A genome-wide CRISPR–Cas9-mediated knockout screen in Drosophila cells identifies Visgun as a proteinaceous receptor for toxin complex toxins, demonstrating the utility of this approach for investigating insecticidal toxins and pathogens.

heading: Observations of a Magellanic Corona
description: By analysing Hubble Space Telescope/Cosmic Origins Spectrograph spectra, evidence is provided for the presence of a Magellanic Corona surrounding the Large Magellanic Cloud, as predicted given its high mass.

heading: Layered subsurface in Utopia Basin of Mars revealed by Zhurong rover radar
description: A ground-penetrating radar survey of Martian subsurface structure in a southern marginal area of Utopia Planitia constructed a detailed subsurface image profile showing a roughly 70-m-thick, multi-layered structure below regolith.

heading: Continuous air purification by aqueous interface filtration and absorption
description: An air purification strategy is presented that moves air in the form of bubbles through an ion-doped conjugated polymer-coated matrix, which captures larger particulate matter, infiltrated with a selected functional liquid, which captures smaller particulate matter.

heading: A wheat resistosome defines common principles of immune receptor channels
description: Evolutionary conservation of plant receptor structure allowed for generation of new variants of wheat and barley nucleotide-binding leucine-rich repeat receptors (NLRs) that recognize AvrSr35 of the wheat stem rust pathogen, supporting proof of principle for structure-based engineering of NLRs for crop improvement.

heading: Structural basis for directional chitin biosynthesis
description: Using cryo-electron microscopy, the directional multiple step mechanism of chitin biosynthesis is revealed.

heading: The Anglo-Saxon migration and the formation of the early English gene pool
description: Archaeogenetic study of ancient DNA from medieval northwestern Europeans reveals substantial increase of continental northern European ancestry in Britain, suggesting mass migration across the North Sea during the Early Middle Ages.

heading: Long-primed germinal centres with enduring affinity maturation and clonal migration
authors: Jeong Hyun LeeHenry J. SuttonShane Crotty
description: Using HIV Env protein immunogen priming in rhesus monkeys followed by a long period without further immunization, we demonstrate germinal centre B cells lasting at least 6 months, showing promise in regard to difficult vaccine targets.

heading: Antibody targeting of E3 ubiquitin ligases for receptor degradation
authors: Hadir MareiWen-Ting K. TsaiFelipe de Sousa e Melo
description: Membrane-bound E3 ubiquitin ligases RNF43 and ZNRF3 are overexpressed in colorectal cancer, and can be repurposed using proteolysis-targeting antibodies (PROTABs) to selectively degrade cell-surface receptors in tumours.

heading: A cellular hierarchy in melanoma uncouples growth and metastasis
description: A hierarchical model of melanoma tumour growth mirrors the cellular and molecular logic of cell-fate specification and differentiation of the underlying embryonic neural crest, and suggests that the ability to support growth and metastasis are limited to distinct pools of cells.

heading: Plant receptor-like protein activation by a microbial glycoside hydrolase
description: A structural analysis focusing on plant immunity reveals how LRR-containing receptor-like proteins recognize pathogenic ligands and consequently become activated, with the data suggesting that these proteins target pathogens through two different mechanisms.

heading: Compositionally complex doping for zero-strain zero-cobalt layered cathodes
description: A compositionally complex (high-entropy) doping strategy is proposed to fabricate zero-strain high-Ni and Co-free layered cathodes with superior structural and mechanical stabilities and long cycle life.

heading: CLN3 is required for the clearance of glycerophosphodiesters from lysosomes
description: The lysosomal transmembrane protein CLN3 is required for the lysosomal clearance of glycerophosphodiesters in mice and in human cells, suggesting that the loss of CLN3 causes Batten disease in children due to defects in glycerophospholipid metabolism.

heading: Common human genetic variants of APOE impact murine COVID-19 mortality
authors: Benjamin N. OstendorfMira A. PatelSohail F. Tavazoie
description: Mice bearing different variants of APOE exhibit different COVID-19 outcomes, with APOE2 and APOE4 associated with more severe disease, and this relationship between APOE genotype and disease severity is supported by clinical data in humans.

heading: A dynamically reprogrammable surface with self-evolving shape morphing
description: The work presents a reprogrammable metasurface, constructed from a matrix of filamentary metal traces, that can precisely and rapidly morph into a wide range of target shapes and dynamic shape processes.

heading: Aerial additive manufacturing with multiple autonomous robots
description: An additive manufacturing method using a team of autonomous aerial robots allows for scalable and adaptable three-dimensional printing, and is used to deposit building materials during flight.

heading: Atomically engineered interfaces yield extraordinary electrostriction
description: A system consisting of alternating thin films of two dielectrics is used to produce greatly enhanced electrostriction derived from coherent strain imparted by interfacial lattice discontinuity.

heading: A designed photoenzyme for enantioselective [2+2] cycloadditions
authors: Jonathan S. TrimbleRebecca CrawshawAnthony P. Green
description: A genetically encoded triplet photosensitizer is used to develop an efficient photoenzyme that can promote enantioselective intramolecular and bimolecular [2+2] cycloadditions by means of triplet energy transfer.

heading: Enantioselective [2+2]-cycloadditions with triplet photoenzymes
description: Triplet photoenzymes developed through genetic encoding and directed evolution result in excited-state photocatalysts that provide a valuable approach to enantioselective photochemical synthesis.

heading: Failure of human rhombic lip differentiation underlies medulloblastoma formation
authors: Liam D. HendrikseParthiv HaldipurMichael D. Taylor
description: Derailed differentiation of human-specific progenitors of the developing cerebellar rhombic lip is the cause of group 4 medulloblastoma, the most common childhood brain tumour.

heading: A fast radio burst source at a complex magnetized site in a barred galaxy
authors: H. XuJ. R. NiuJ. H. Zou
description: Analysis of a set of 1,863 bursts from the repeating source FRB 20201124A provides evidence of a complicated magnetized site within about an astronomical unit from the source in a barred galaxy.

heading: Quantifying hierarchy and dynamics in US faculty hiring and retention
authors: K. Hunter WapmanSam ZhangDaniel B. Larremore
description: An analysis of the academic employment and doctoral education of faculty members at all PhD-granting US universities from 2011 to 2020 shows that a small minority of universities (20.4%) supply a large majority of faculty members (80.0%).

heading: Unified rhombic lip origins of group 3 and group 4 medulloblastoma
authors: Kyle S. SmithLaure BihannicPaul A. Northcott
description: Multi-omic mapping shows that group 3 and group 4 medulloblastomas have a common, human-specific developmental origin in the cerebellar rhombic lip, providing a basis for their ambiguous molecular features and overlapping anatomical location, and for the difficulty of modelling these tumours in mice.

heading: Synthesis of meta-substituted arene bioisosteres from [3.1.1]propellane
description: The potential power of the saturated carbocycle bicyclo[3.1.1]heptane as a beneficial motif for improving the pharmacokinetic and physicochemical properties of drug candidates is demonstrated.

heading: Structures of α-synuclein filaments from human brains with Lewy pathology
description: The authors report on the structures of α-synuclein filaments from the brains of individuals with Parkinson's disease, Parkinson's disease dementia and dementia with Lewy bodies and how they differ from those seen in multiple system atrophy.

heading: Control of cell state transitions
authors: Oleksii S. RukhlenkoMelinda HalaszBoris N. Kholodenko
description: An approach called cell state transition assessment and regulation uses diverse multiomics data to map cell states, model their transitions, and understand the signalling networks that control them.

heading: A universal coupling mechanism of respiratory complex I
description: Cryo-electron microscopy studies of Escherichia coli complex I suggest a conserved mechanism of coupled proton transfers and electrostatic interactions that result in proton ejection from the complex exclusively at the distal NuoL subunit.

heading: Brain-restricted mTOR inhibition with binary pharmacology
description: The combination of the brain-permeable mTOR inhibitor RapaLink-1 and the brain-impermeable FKBP12 ligand RapaBlock enable brain-specific inhibition of mTOR.

heading: Discovery of charge density wave in a kagome lattice antiferromagnet
description: Analysis of the antiferromagnetic ordered phase of kagome lattice FeGe suggests that charge density wave is the result of a combination of electronic-correlations-driven antiferromagnetic order and instability driven by van Hove singularities.

heading: A year-round satellite sea-ice thickness record from CryoSat-2
authors: Jack C. LandyGeoffrey J. DawsonYevgeny Aksenov
description: Deep learning and numerical simulations of CryoSat-2 radar altimeter data are used to generate a pan-Arctic sea-ice thickness dataset for the Arctic melt period.

heading: CDK11 regulates pre-mRNA splicing by phosphorylation of SF3B1
description: CDK11 associates with SF3B1 and phosphorylates threonine residues at the N terminus of SF3B1 during spliceosome activation, and the inhibition of CDK11 blocks the activation and leads to widespread intron retention and the accumulation of non-functional spliceosomes on pre-mRNAs and chromatin.

heading: Glucose-driven TOR–FIE–PRC2 signalling controls plant development
description: Glucose signalling via TOR controls growth and differentiation through regulation of genome-wide histone methylation via FERTILIZATION-INDEPENDENT ENDOSPERM (FIE).

heading: Living material assembly of bacteriogenic protocells
description: A bacteriogenic strategy for constructing membrane-bounded, molecularly crowded, and compositionally, structurally and morphologically complex synthetic cells provides opportunities for the fabrication of new synthetic cell modules and augmented living/synthetic cell constructs.

heading: Tunable quantum criticalities in an isospin extended Hubbard model simulator
description: Using an experimental simulator of the extended Hubbard model with spin–valley isospins arising in chiral-stacked twisted double bilayer graphene, the presence of highly tunable quantum criticalities is demonstrated.

heading: Femtosecond laser writing of lithium niobate ferroelectric nanodomains
description: We propose and experimentally demonstrate a non-reciprocal near-infrared femtosecond laser-writing technique for reconfigurable three-dimensional nanoscale ferroelectric domain engineering in LiNbO3 crystals.

heading: Distinguishing externally from saccade-induced motion in visual cortex
description: Distinct activity patterns in the primary visual cortex distinguish movement in the environment from motion caused by eye movements.

heading: Independent origins of fetal liver haematopoietic stem and progenitor cells
description: In fetal liver, the structure of the differentiated haemapoietic progenitor cell population is established directly from precursor cells, independently of haemapoietic stem cells.

heading: Delayed fluorescence from inverted singlet and triplet excited states
description: A fluorescent molecule is described that does not follow Hund’s rule and instead shows singlet and triplet excited states with inverted energy levels, leading to high-efficiency OLEDs with potential implications for optoelectronic devices.

heading: Columnar structure of human telomeric chromatin
description: Cryogenic electron microscopy analyses reveal a new, compact structure of telomeric chromatin, providing mechanistic insight into telomere maintenance and function.

heading: Deformation and seismicity decline before the 2021 Fagradalsfjall eruption
description: As observed for the 2021 Fagradalsfjall eruption in Iceland, a release of tectonic stress followed by a decline in deformation and seismicity rate may be a characteristic precursory activity for a certain class of eruptions.

heading: The first-principles phase diagram of monolayer nanoconfined water
description: Monolayer water exhibits rich and diverse phase behaviour that is highly sensitive to temperature and the van der Waals pressure acting within the nanochannel.

heading: Rapid shifting of a deep magmatic source at Fagradalsfjall volcano, Iceland
authors: Sæmundur A. HalldórssonEdward W. MarshallAndri Stefánsson
description: Primitive lavas of the Fagradalsfjall eruption present a window into the deep roots of a magmatic system previously inaccessible to near-real-time investigation, showing that eruptible batches of basaltic magma mix on a timescale of weeks.

heading: Extended Bose–Hubbard model with dipolar excitons
description: Confining semiconductor dipolar excitons using an artificial two-dimensional square lattice emulates extended Bose–Hubbard Hamiltonians, thus enabling control of boson-like arrays in lattices with programmable geometries and more than 100 sites.

heading: Large harvested energy with non-linear pyroelectric modules
description: A macroscopic and scalable pyroelectric energy harvester in the form of multilayer capacitors produces 11.2 J of electrical energy, with a pyroelectric material generating up to 4.43 J cm−3 per cycle.

heading: The risks of overstating the climate benefits of ecosystem restoration
Reply to: The risks of overstating the climate benefits of ecosystem restoration
authors: Bernardo B. N. StrassburgAlvaro IribarremPiero Visconti

heading: An elementary quantum network of entangled optical atomic clocks
authors: B. C. NicholR. SrinivasD. M. Lucas
description: An elementary quantum network of two entangled atomic clocks is demonstrated; the high fidelity and speed of entanglement generation show that entangled clocks can offer practical enhancement for metrology.

heading: Delayed use of bioenergy crops might threaten climate and food security
description: Simulations of historical and future periods of climate change showed that delayed mitigation to limit global warming might reduce the capacity of bioenergy with carbon capture and storage and threaten climate stability and food security.

heading: Brainstem ADCYAP1+ neurons control multiple aspects of sickness behaviour
description: A studying using a set of unbiased methodologies shows that a specific subpopulation of neurons in the brainstem can regulate the diverse responses to a bacterial endotoxin that induces sickness behaviours.

heading: A phosphoinositide signalling pathway mediates rapid lysosomal repair
description: Lysosomal membrane damage triggers a lipid signalling pathway that repairs lysosomes via lipid transport at newly established endoplasmic reticulum–lysosomal membrane contact sites.

heading: Chiral monoterpenes reveal forest emission mechanisms and drought responses
description: Analysis of atmospheric data on two enantiomerically separated forms of monoterpene from a controlled drought and rewetting experiment in an enclosed tropical rainforest ecosystem showed distinct diel emission peaks, regulated by different production pathways.

heading: A RORγt+ cell instructs gut microbiota-specific Treg cell differentiation
authors: Ranit KedmiTariq A. NajarDan R. Littman
description: Induction of T regulatory cells by gut microbes is mediated by antigen-presenting RORγt+ cells, unlike that of T follicular helper and T helper 17 cells, which requires different cell types.

heading: Genomics to select treatment for patients with metastatic breast cancer
description: Targeted therapies matched to genomics improved progression-free survival when genomic alterations were classified as level I/II (according to ESCAT), and genomics should thus be driven by target actionability in patients with metastatic breast cancer.

heading: Biosynthesis of selenium-containing small molecules in diverse microorganisms
authors: Chase M. KayrouzJonathan HuangMohammad R. Seyedsayamdost
description: Using genome mining, a dedicated pathway for the production of selenosugars and selenoneine is uncovered, thereby expanding the use of biological selenium.

heading: Bifunctional hydroformylation on heterogeneous Rh-WOx pair site catalysts
description: Catalysts consisting of oxide-supported pair sites can enable bifunctional reaction mechanisms with high activity and selectivity for reactions and so overcome the limitations in industry imposed by the use of homogeneous catalysts.

heading: Anticyclonic eddies aggregate pelagic predators in a subtropical gyre
authors: Martin C. ArosteguiPeter GaubeCamrin D. Braun
description: Using a large-scale fishery dataset in the North Pacific Subtropical Gyre, a pervasive pattern of increased pelagic predator catch inside anticyclonic eddies relative to cyclones and non-eddy areas is shown.

heading: Identification of trypsin-degrading commensals in the large intestine
description: Colonization of trypsin-degrading commensal bacteria may contribute to the maintenance of intestinal homeostasis and protection against pathogen infection in humans and mice.

heading: Gut–brain circuits for fat preference
description: Behavioural and genetic experiments in mice reveal gut-to-brain circuits driving the development of fat preference, one responding to intestinal sugar and fat using cholecystokinin signalling, and the other responding only to fat.

heading: Structure of dynein–dynactin on microtubules shows tandem adaptor binding
description: The structure of the complete dynein–dynactin complex and its interaction with microtubules and cargo adaptors are visualized using cryo-electron microscopy.

heading: ILC3s select microbiota-specific regulatory T cells to establish tolerance in the gut
description: ILC3s expressing MHC class II control the fate of inflammatory versus tolerogenic T cells that respond to the microbiota by selecting for antigen-specific RORγt+ Treg cells and against TH17 cells, establishing intestinal homoeostasis.

heading: Imaging hydrodynamic electrons flowing without Landauer–Sharvin resistance
description: At elevated temperatures, electron hydrodynamics efficiently eliminate the ‘bulk Landauer–Sharvin’ resistance, demonstrating that hydrodynamics can dramatically modify the well-established rules obeyed by ballistic electrons.

heading: Novel antigen-presenting cell imparts Treg-dependent tolerance to gut microbiota
description: Single-cell transcriptomic and epigenetic analysis has enabled the identification of Thetis cells, a class of RORγt+ antigen-presenting cells with a key role in the differentiation of commensal microbiota-induced peripheral regulatory T cells.

heading: Surgical amputation of a limb 31,000 years ago in Borneo
authors: Tim Ryan MaloneyIndia Ella Dilkes-HallMaxime Aubert
description: Around 31,000 years ago, a young individual from Borneo had part of their left lower leg surgically amputated, probably as a child, and lived for another 6–9 years after amputation.

heading: Methotrexate recognition by the human reduced folate carrier SLC19A1
authors: Nicholas J. WrightJustin G. FedorSeok-Yong Lee
description: Cryo-EM structures provide insight into how the antifolate methotrexate, a chemotherapy drug, is recognized by the reduced folate carrier.

heading: Exciton-coupled coherent magnons in a 2D semiconductor
description: Excitons in the electronvolts range are found to couple strongly to coherent magnons in hundreds of microelectronvolts in an atomically thin two-dimensional antiferromagnetic semiconductor.

heading: Rapid quasi-periodic oscillations in the relativistic jet of BL Lacertae
authors: S. G. JorstadA. P. MarscherR. Chatterjee
description: Analysis of the optical and γ-ray flux monitoring of the blazar BL Lacertae during its outburst in 2020 shows the existence of quasi-periodic oscillations in the relativistic jet with cycles as short as 13 h.

heading: A solution-processed n-type conducting polymer with ultrahigh conductivity
description: A reaction is described combining oxidative polymerization and in situ reductive n-doping to yield poly(benzodifurandione), a facilely synthesized stable n-type conducting polymer with ultrahigh conductivity, with applications in organic electronics.

heading: A sustained high-temperature fusion plasma regime facilitated by fast ions
description: A magnetic confinement regime established at the Korea Superconducting Tokamak Advanced Research device enables the generation of plasmas over 108 kelvin for 20 seconds with the aid of fast ions without plasma edge instabilities or impurity accumulation.

heading: ABP1–TMK auxin perception for global phosphorylation and auxin canalization
description: Auxin-binding protein ﻿1 (ABP1) is an auxin receptor that, in complex with transmembrane kinase 1 (TMK1), has a key role in the auxin-induced global phosphorylation of proteins and downstream responses such as vascular regeneration.

heading: Identification of carbon dioxide in an exoplanet atmosphere
description: Transmission spectroscopy observations from the James Webb Space Telescope show the detection of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere of the gas giant exoplanet WASP-39b.

heading: Screening for generality in asymmetric catalysis
authors: Corin C. WagenSpencer E. McMinnEric N. Jacobsen
description: The analytical workflow outlined in this study allows multiple crude reaction mixtures to be analysed simultaneously, with substantial reductions in method development and analysis time, and maximizes the chances of finding catalytic systems with broad substrate scope.

heading: Surface reaction for efficient and stable inverted perovskite solar cells
description: A reactive surface engineering approach is used to produce an inverted perovskite solar cell that reaches a power conversion efficiency of 25% and has good operational stability.

heading: Comprehensive evidence implies a higher social cost of CO2
description: Coupling advances in socioeconomic projections, climate models, damage functions and discounting methods yields an estimate of the social cost of carbon of US$185 per tonne of CO2—triple the widely used value published by the US government.

heading: Tandem electrocatalytic N2 fixation via proton-coupled electron transfer
description: Using a molecular catalyst and a proton–electron transfer mediator in tandem delivers efficient electroreduction of nitrogen to ammonia at modest potentials, an approach that could be used to improve other important reactions.

heading: African-specific molecular taxonomy of prostate cancer
description: A molecular taxonomy for prostate cancer reveals a subtype associated with copy-number loss found in African and European populations that predicts poor outcomes and two subtypes—one associated with high mutational noise and one with copy-number gain—specific to African populations.

heading: Africa’s oldest dinosaurs reveal early suppression of dinosaur distribution
authors: Christopher T. GriffinBrenen M. WyndHazel R. Taruvinga
description: A new Triassic dinosaur assemblage from Zimbabwe reveals that the earliest dinosaurs were confined to a temperate region in the far south of Pangaea.

heading: A microbial supply chain for production of the anti-cancer drug vinblastine
authors: Jie ZhangLea G. HansenJay D. Keasling
description: De novo microbial biosynthesis of vindoline and catharanthine using a highly engineered yeast and in vitro chemical coupling to vinblastine is carried out, positioning yeast as a scalable platform to produce many monoterpene indole alkaloids.
