heading: Non-viral, specifically targeted CAR-T cells achieve high safety and efficacy in B-NHL
description: Non-viral CAR-T cells with gene-specific targeted integration are safe and effective in patients with lymphoma.

heading: Aligned macrocycle pores in ultrathin films for accurate molecular sieving
description: Selectively functionalized macrocycles were synthesized with reactivities that preferentially aligned to create well-defined pores across an ultrathin nanofilm offering a strategy to create subnanometre channels in polymer membranes, and demonstrating potential for accurate molecular separations.

heading: Intralayer charge-transfer moiré excitons in van der Waals superlattices
authors: Mit H. NaikEmma C. ReganSteven G. Louie
description: By combining large-scale first-principles GW-BSE calculations and micro-reflection spectroscopy, the nature of the exciton resonances in WSe2/WS2 moiré superlattices is identified, highlighting non-trivial exciton states and suggesting new ways of tuning many-body physics.

heading: The origin of placental mammal life histories
authors: Gregory F. FunstonPaige E. dePoloStephen L. Brusatte
description: Using palaeohistology and geochemistry, the placental-like life history of a pantodont species 62 million years of age is determined.

heading: Dysregulated naive B cells and de novo autoreactivity in severe COVID-19
authors: Matthew C. WoodruffRichard P. RamonellIgnacio Sanz
description: Single-cell B cell repertoire analysis identifies the expansion of a naive-derived population of antibody-secreting cells contributing to de novo autoreactivity in patients with severe COVID-19 and those with post-COVID symptoms.

heading: Revealing the short-range structure of the mirror nuclei 3H and 3He
description: A comparison of electron scattering from the mirror nuclei hydrogen-3 and helium-3 reveals that proton–proton pairs have a much larger contribution to short-range correlations in helium-3 than in heavier nuclei, implying an unexpected nuclear structure.

heading: A brainstem map for visceral sensations
authors: Chen RanJack C. BoettcherStephen D. Liberles
description: In vivo two-photon calcium imaging analyses of sensory inputs from the gastrointestinal tract and upper airways in mice reveal spatial organization and coding principles of the interoceptive nervous system.

heading: Hippocampal astrocytes encode reward location
description: Astrocytes can encode an expected reward location in familiar spatial contexts.

heading: Precursor-free eruption triggered by edifice rupture at Nyiragongo volcano
description: The 2021 eruption of Mount Nyiragongo, DR Congo demonstrated that magma storage close to the surface in open systems means that eruptions may occur with very short-term precursory activity, raising major challenges for their monitoring.

heading: Enhanced ocean oxygenation during Cenozoic warm periods
description: By using foraminifera-bound nitrogen isotopes, it is shown that, during two warm periods of the Cenozoic, oxygen-deficient zones contracted rather than expanded, suggesting that global warming may not necessarily lead to increased oceanic anoxia.

heading: Emergence of mesoscale quantum phase transitions in a ferromagnet
description: LiHoF4, a dipolar Ising ferromagnet, is investigated near its transverse-field quantum critical point, showing that well-defined mesoscale quantum phase transitions arise when tilting the magnetic field away from the hard axis.

heading: The role of somatosensory innervation of adipose tissues
description: Beige-fat-innervating sensory neurons modulate adipocyte function by acting as a brake on the sympathetic system.

heading: Structures of a phycobilisome in light-harvesting and photoprotected states
authors: María Agustina Domínguez-MartínPaul V. SauerCheryl A. Kerfeld
description: Cryogenic electron microscopy structures of the Synechocystis phycobilisome—alone and bound with orange carotenoid protein—reveal detailed information regarding the biophysical basis of the control of cyanobacterial light harvesting.

heading: Heterodimensional superlattice with in-plane anomalous Hall effect
description: A heterodimensional superlattice consisting of an alternating array of a two-dimensional material and a one-dimensional material shows unconventional octahedral stacking and an unexpected room-temperature anomalous Hall effect.

heading: The whisking oscillator circuit
description: The whisking oscillator—consisting of parvalbumin-expressing inhibitory neurons located in the vibrissa intermediate reticular nucleus—in mice is an all-inhibitory network and recurrent synaptic inhibition has a key role in its rhythmogenesis.

heading: Embryo model completes gastrulation to neurulation and organogenesis
description: Synthetic mouse embryos assembled from embryonic stem cells, trophoblast stem cells and induced extraembryonic endoderm stem cells closely recapitulate the development of wild-type and mutant natural mouse embryos up to embryonic day 8.5.

heading: Mechanism of AAA+ ATPase-mediated RuvAB–Holliday junction branch migration
description: Structures of the ATP-hydrolysing RuvAB complex captured in multiple conformations provide mechanistic insights into coordinated ATPase and motor activity during DNA recombination.

heading: Postcranial evidence of late Miocene hominin bipedalism in Chad
description: Analyses of a thigh bone and a pair of elbow bones from Sahelanthropus tchadensis discovered in Chad suggest that the earliest hominin exhibited bipedalism with substantial arboreal clambering.

heading: RASA2 ablation in T cells boosts antigen sensitivity and long-term function
description: Genome-wide CRISPR screens, biochemical studies and animal models show that RASA2 has a key role in regulating T cell function and has potential as a genetic target for enhancing anti-tumour immunity.

heading: Natural switches in behaviour rapidly modulate hippocampal coding
description: During rapid behavioural switches in flying bats, hippocampal neurons can rapidly switch their core computation to represent the relevant behavioural variables, supporting behavioural flexibility.

heading: Kardar–Parisi–Zhang universality in a one-dimensional polariton condensate
description: Experiments show that the dynamics of phase fluctuations  in a one-dimensional polariton condensate falls in the Kardar–Parisi–Zhang universality class, and theoretical analysis supports this finding revealing the key signatures of this universality class.

heading: Integrated ozone depletion as a metric for ozone recovery
authors: John A. PyleJames KeeblePaul T. Griffiths
description: An integrated ozone depletion metric indicates the impact of any new emission and provides a useful complementary metric of the impact of specific emissions of an ozone depleting substance for both the scientific and policy communities.

heading: Efficient generation of entangled multiphoton graph states from a single atom
description: Using a single memory atom in a cavity, a deterministic protocol is implemented to efficiently grow Greenberger–Horne–Zeilinger and linear cluster states by means of single-photon emissions.

heading: Mechanical integrated circuit materials
authors: Charles El HelouBenjamin GrossmannRyan L. Harne
description: A mechanical integrated circuit material based on Boolean mathematics and reconfigurable electrical circuits is created to demonstrate scalable information processing in synthetic, engineered soft matter.

heading: Divergent genomic trajectories predate the origin of animals and fungi
description: Detailed ancestral gene content reconstruction shows that the large phenotypic differences between Metazoa and Fungi are the outcome of sharply contrasting trajectories of genomic changes that predated the origin of both groups.

heading: Selective TnsC recruitment enhances the fidelity of RNA-guided transposition
authors: Florian T. HoffmannMinjoo KimSamuel H. Sternberg
description: CRISPR-associated transposons exploit a proofreading checkpoint to ensure high-fidelity selection of genomic sites for DNA insertion through specific recruitment of TnsC oligomers by the Cascade complex.

heading: Fos ensembles encode and shape stable spatial maps in the hippocampus
authors: Noah L. PettitEe-Lynn YapChristopher D. Harvey
description: Fos-expressing hippocampal neurons form highly correlated ensembles that contribute to spatial coding by forming reliable, long-lasting and spatially unbiased maps of an environment.

heading: Brain–phenotype models fail for individuals who defy sample stereotypes
authors: Abigail S. GreeneXilin ShenR. Todd Constable
description: Predictive models that relate brain activity to phenotype reliably fail when applied to subgroups of participants who do not fit stereotypical profiles, showing that the utility of a one-size-fits-all modelling approach is limited.

heading: Phosphorylation of muramyl peptides by NAGK is required for NOD2 activation
description: N-acetylglucosamine kinase catalyses the phosphorylation of muramyl dipeptide and is thus essential for its recognition and immunostimulatory activity in human and mouse cells.

heading: Fast-charging aluminium–chalcogen batteries resistant to dendritic shorting
description: An aluminium–chalcogen battery operating with a molten-salt electrolyte composed of NaCl–KCl–AlCl3 is presented, which allows rapid charging at up to 200C for hundreds of cycles, and is scalable, fire-resistant and low cost.

heading: Microporous water with high gas solubilities
authors: Daniel P. ErdosyMalia B. WennyJarad A. Mason
description: Modification of the internal and external surface chemistry of microporous zeolite and metal–organic framework nanocrystals leads to a generalizable strategy to aqueous porous liquids and impart high gas-carrying capacities to liquid water.

heading: Quantum error correction with silicon spin qubits
description: By using three silicon spin qubits to construct a phase-correcting code, quantum error correction is implemented and protection of the three-qubit state against any phase-flip error on one of the three qubits is demonstrated.

heading: R-loop formation and conformational activation mechanisms of Cas9
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of Streptococcus pyogenes Cas9 in multiple DNA-bound states provide insights on the mechanism of Cas9 activation by target DNA.

heading: Photoexcited nitroarenes for the oxidative cleavage of alkenes
description: Oxidative cleavage of alkenes is achieved using nitroarenes and light irradiation as an alternative to using ozone to break the carbon–carbon bonds, avoiding the explosive intermediates formed with ozone.

heading: Post-translational control of beige fat biogenesis by PRDM16 stabilization
description: The ubiquitin E3 ligase CUL2–APPBP2 determines PRDM16 protein stability by catalysing PRDM16 polyubiquitination in beige fat.

heading: In vivo single-molecule analysis reveals COOLAIR RNA structural diversity
description: The structures of single COOLAIR RNA isoforms change in abundance and shape in response to external conditions; structural mutation of these isoforms altered FLC expression and flowering time, consistent with a regulatory role of the COOLAIR structure in FLC transcription.

heading: Saccorhytus is an early ecdysozoan and not the earliest deuterostome
authors: Yunhuan LiuEmily CarlislePhilip C. J. Donoghue
description: Analyses of newly discovered specimens of the early Cambrian microscopic animal Saccorhytus coronarius support its taxonomic classification in total-group Ecdysozoa.

heading: Endocytosis in the axon initial segment maintains neuronal polarity
description: Endocytosis and degradation of plasma membrane proteins in the axon initial segment, together with the diffusion-barrier mechanism, maintain a polarized distribution of plasma membrane proteins in Caenorhabditis elegans, mouse, rat and human neurons.

heading: Formation of moiré interlayer excitons in space and time
description: Multidimensional time- and angle-resolved photoelectron spectroscopy is used to determine the interlayer exciton formation process, reveal a direct hallmark of the superlattice moiré modification, and reconstruct the real-space wavefunction distribution.

heading: MYB orchestrates T cell exhaustion and response to checkpoint inhibition
description: CD62L+ precursors of exhausted T cells retain long-term proliferative potential, multipotency and repopulation capacity, and the transcription factor MYB is essential for the development and function of this population of cells.

heading: Self-oscillating pump in a topological dissipative atom–cavity system
description: A mechanism for self-oscillating pumping in a quantum gas is demonstrated using a Bose–Einstein condensate coupled to a dissipative cavity, where a particle current is observed without external periodic driving.

heading: Live-seq enables temporal transcriptomic recording of single cells
description: Live-seq, a single-cell transcriptome profiling approach that preserves cell viability during RNA extraction using fluidic force microscopy, can address a range of biological questions by transforming scRNA-seq from an end-point to a temporal analysis approach.

heading: Continental configuration controls ocean oxygenation during the Phanerozoic
description: Analysis of a series of Earth system model experiments shows that continental rearrangement during the Phanerozoic had a marked influence on variations in ocean oxygenation, independent of atmospheric pO2.

heading: A condensate dynamic instability orchestrates actomyosin cortex activation
authors: Victoria Tianjing YanArjun NarayananStephan W. Grill
description: A phase portrait study is presented that shows the chemically driven dynamics of short-lived F-actin-rich condensates that support actomyosin cortex formation.

heading: When and where to protect forests
authors: Ian H. LubySteve J. MillerStephen Polasky
description: A dynamic optimization approach using plant species data from 458 forest ecoregions suggests a strategy for when and where to conserve forests globally over the next 50 years to maximize the conservation of plant biodiversity.

heading: Spatial profiling of chromatin accessibility in mouse and human tissues
description: Spatial-ATAC-seq—spatially resolved chromatin accessibility profiling of tissue sections using next-generation sequencing—delineated tissue-region-specific epigenetic landscapes in mouse embryos and identified gene regulators involved in the development of the central nervous system and the lymphoid tissue.

heading: Floating perovskite-BiVO4 devices for scalable solar fuel production
description: This work introduces lightweight, leaf-like photoelectrochemical devices for unassisted water splitting and syngas production, which could be used in the fabrication of floating systems for solar fuel production.

heading: Ordered and deterministic cancer genome evolution after p53 loss
authors: Timour BaslanJohn P. Morris IVScott W. Lowe
description: Malignant evolution enabled by p53 inactivation in mice proceeds through an ordered and predictable pattern of Trp53 loss of heterozygosity, accumulation of deletions, genome doubling and the emergence of gains and amplifications.

heading: A compute-in-memory chip based on resistive random-access memory
description: A compute-in-memory neural-network inference accelerator based on resistive random-access memory simultaneously improves energy efficiency, flexibility and accuracy compared with existing hardware by co-optimizing across all hierarchies of the design.

heading: Observation of Rabi dynamics with a short-wavelength free-electron laser
description: Rabi dynamics between the ground state and an excited state in helium atoms are generated using femtosecond extreme-ultraviolet pulses from a seeded free-electron laser, which may allow ultrafast manipulation of coherent processes at short wavelengths.

heading: LACC1 bridges NOS2 and polyamine metabolism in inflammatory macrophages
description: Findings suggest that l-ornithine could serve as a novel nutraceutical to ameliorate LACC1-associated immunological dysfunctions.

heading: Preservation of high-pressure volatiles in nanostructured diamond capsules
description: The nanostructured diamond capsule process with the inert gases solid argon and neon is demonstrated, where the trapped volatile gases could sustain their high-pressure states without confinement of conventional high-pressure vessels, opening up the possibility of in-depth investigations of high-pressure phenomena.

heading: Evidence for intrinsic charm quarks in the proton
description: Through machine learning analysis of a large set of collider data, a study disentangles intrinsic from radiatively generated charm, and finds evidence for an intrinsic charm quark within the proton wavefunction.

heading: An asymmetric sp3–sp3 cross-electrophile coupling using ‘ene’-reductases
description: A highly chemoselective and enantioselective cross-electrophile coupling using ‘ene’-reductases is reported, and photoexcited enzymes demonstrate the ability to carry out reactions between electrophiles that are not known for small-molecule catalysis.

heading: Context-specific emergence and growth of the SARS-CoV-2 Delta variant
authors: John T. McCroneVerity HillMoritz U. G. Kraemer
description: Analysis of SARS-CoV-2 genomes from around the world show that following initial importation largely from India, Delta spread in England was driven first by inter-regional travel and then by local population mixing.

heading: Pandemic-scale phylogenomics reveals the SARS-CoV-2 recombination landscape
description: A new phylogenomic method is developed that can detect recombinations in virus lineages in pandemic-scale datasets.

heading: Reply to: On yoctosecond science
On yoctosecond science
Quantum cascade of correlated phases in trigonally warped bilayer graphene
authors: Anna M. SeilerFabian R. GeisenhofR. Thomas Weitz
description: A cascade of gate-tunable correlated insulating and metallic phases is observed in trigonally warped Bernal bilayer graphene at large electric fields.

heading: Sufficient conditions for rapid range expansion of a boreal conifer
authors: Roman J. DialColin T. MaherPatrick F. Sullivan
description: A boreal conifer is advancing northwards into Arctic tundra, with this treeline advance facilitated by climate warming together with winter winds, deeper snow and increased soil nutrient availability.

heading: 4-bit adhesion logic enables universal multicellular interface patterning
authors: Honesty KimDominic J. SkinnerIngmar H. Riedel-Kruse
description: A synthetic cell-cell adhesion logic using swarming E. coli with 4 bits of information is introduced, enabling the programming of interfaces that combine to form universal tessellation patterns over a large scale.

heading: Giant impacts and the origin and evolution of continents
authors: Tim E. JohnsonChristopher L. KirklandMichael I. H. Hartnady
description: Oxygen isotope compositions of dated magmatic zircon show that the Pilbara Craton in Western Australia, Earth’s best-preserved Archaean continental remnant, was built in three stages initiated by a giant meteorite impact.

heading: Spatial multi-omic map of human myocardial infarction
authors: Christoph KuppeRicardo O. Ramirez FloresRafael Kramann
description: A time-resolved high-resolution map of human cardiac remodelling after myocardial infarction, integrating single-cell transcriptomic, chromatin accessibility and spatial transcriptomic data, provides a valuable resource for the field.

heading: Antarctic calving loss rivals ice-shelf thinning
authors: Chad A. GreeneAlex S. GardnerAlexander D. Fraser
description: Data from multiple satellite sensors show that Antarctica lost almost 37,000 km2 of ice-shelf area from 1997 to 2021, and that calving losses are as important as ice-shelf thinning.

heading: A mechanically strong and ductile soft magnet with extremely low coercivity
description: An iron–cobalt–nickel–tantalum–aluminium multicomponent alloy with ferromagnetic matrix and paramagnetic coherent nanoparticles is described, showing high tensile strength and ductility, along with very low coercivity.

heading: Diverse mutational landscapes in human lymphocytes
authors: Heather E. MachadoEmily MitchellPeter J. Campbell
description: Sequencing of individual human lymphocyte clones shows that they are highly prone to mutations, with higher burdens in memory cells than in naive cells arising from mutational processes associated with differentiation and tissue residency.

heading: A monocyte–leptin–angiogenesis pathway critical for repair post-infection
authors: Rachel M. KratofilHanjoo B. ShimPaul Kubes
description: Monocytes recruited to skin infection are not involved in bacterial clearance but instead regulate local angiogenesis and healing.

heading: Perovskite superlattices with efficient carrier dynamics
description: Fabrication of a low-dimensional metal halide perovskite superlattice by chemical epitaxy is reported, with a criss-cross two-dimensional network parallel to the substrate, leading to efficient carrier transport in three dimensions.

heading: Spatially resolved clonal copy number alterations in benign and malignant tissue
description: Copy number variations inferred from spatial transcriptomics data in benign and malignant tissue reveal clonal architecture at the organ-wide level.

heading: Pyramidal neuron subtype diversity governs microglia states in the neocortex
description: Spatial and single-cell transcriptomic characterization of microglia in the mouse somatosensory cortex show that the state of these cells is determined by signals from diverse surrounding neurons.

heading: Cyclic nucleotide-induced helical structure activates a TIR immune effector
description: A bacterial antiviral defence system generates a cyclic tri-adenylate that binds to a TIR–SAVED effector, inducing formation of a superhelical structure with adjacent TIR domains organizing into an active site, allowing NAD+ degradation.

heading: Self-emergence of robust solitons in a microcavity
description: Slow nonlinearities of a free-running microresonator-filtered fibre laser are shown to transform temporal cavity solitons into the system’s dominant attractor, leading to reliable self-starting oscillation of microcavity-solitons that are naturally robust to perturbations.

heading: Truncated FGFR2 is a clinically actionable oncogene in multiple cancers
description: Truncation of exon 18 of FGFR2 (FGFR2ΔE18) is a potent driver mutation in mice and humans, and FGFR-targeted therapy should be considered for patients with cancer expressing stable FGFR2ΔE18 variants.

heading: Direct evidence for phosphorus limitation on Amazon forest productivity
authors: Hellen Fernanda Viana CunhaKelly M. AndersenCarlos Alberto Quesada
description: Nutrient manipulation of low-phosphorus soil in an old growth Amazon rainforest shows that phosphorus availability drives forest productivity and is likely to limit the response to increasing atmospheric CO2 concentrations.

heading: Experimental demonstration of optical stochastic cooling
description: Stochastic cooling at optical frequencies is demonstrated in an experiment at the Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory’s Integrable Optics Test Accelerator, substantially increasing the bandwidth of stochastic cooling compared with conventional systems.

heading: The retroelement Lx9 puts a brake on the immune response to virus infection
description: Experiments in mice show that a LINE-1 transposable element, Lx9c11, has a functional role in immunity by negatively regulating the response to viral infection to protect the host from an over-reactive immune response.

heading: Warm springs alter timing but not total growth of temperate deciduous trees
authors: Cameron DowAlbert Y. KimKristina J. Anderson-Teixeira
description: Warmer spring temperatures affect the timing of stem diameter growth of temperate deciduous trees but have little effect on annual growth.

heading: Realizing a 1D topological gauge theory in an optically dressed BEC
description: An optically coupled Bose–Einstein condensate of potassium atoms is used to engineer chiral interactions and perform the quantum simulation of a one-dimensional reduction of the topological Chern–Simons gauge theory.

heading: Even modest climate change may lead to major transitions in boreal forests
description: The survival of southern boreal tree saplings decreases in response to even modest warming and reduced rainfall, which,together with species-specific growth responses, could lead to regeneration failure of currently dominant tree species.

heading: Molecular editing of aza-arene C–H bonds by distance, geometry and chirality
description: A unified catalytic remote-directing template strategy enabled precise differentiation of remote and adjacent C6–H and C7–H bonds, and similar C3–H and C7–H bonds of a pharmaceutically relevant bicyclic aza-arene scaffold.

heading: The mechanism of RNA capping by SARS-CoV-2
authors: Gina J. ParkAdam OsinskiVincent S. Tagliabracci
description: Reconstitution of the SARS-CoV-2 RNA 5′ cap reveals the unconventional mechanism by which SARS-CoV-2 caps its RNA genome, providing a new target in the development of antiviral agents to treat COVID-19.

heading: Hormone- and antibody-mediated activation of the thyrotropin receptor
description: Thyroid-stimulating hormone and autoantibody M22 push the extracellular domain of the thyrotropin receptor into an upright active conformation, revealing a universal activation mechanism of glycoprotein hormone receptors and providing the molecular basis of Graves’ disease, hypothyroidism and Hashimoto’s disease.

heading: DOCK2 is involved in the host genetics and biology of severe COVID-19
description: A genome-wide association study highlights a variant in DOCK2, which is common in East Asian populations but rare in Europeans, as a host genetic risk factor for severe COVID-19.

heading: Autoantibody mimicry of hormone action at the thyrotropin receptor
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the thyrotropin receptor reveal the basis for the activation of the receptor by autoantibodies in patients with Graves’ disease.

heading: Diverse tsunamigenesis triggered by the Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha’apai eruption
description: January 2022 saw the first observations of a tsunami resulting from a large emergent volcanic eruption (Hunga Tonga) captured using modern instrumentation, with broad implications for hazard management in similar geophysical settings.

heading: A non-canonical vitamin K cycle is a potent ferroptosis suppressor
description: Biochemical and lipidomic analyses identify an anti-ferroptotic function of vitamin K and reveal ferroptosis suppressor protein 1 (FSP1) as the enzyme mediating warfarin-resistant vitamin K reduction in the canonical vitamin K cycle.

heading: A mitotic chromatin phase transition prevents perforation by microtubules
authors: Maximilian W. G. SchneiderBryan A. GibsonDaniel W. Gerlich
description: Histone deacetylation at the onset of mitosis induces a chromatin-intrinsic phase transition that endows chromosomes with the physical characteristics necessary for their precise movement during cell division.

heading: A first update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19
authors: Gita A. PathakJuha KarjalainenJ. Kenneth Baillie

heading: Inhibition of ASGR1 decreases lipid levels by promoting cholesterol excretion
description: Inhibiting the asialoglycoprotein receptor ASGR1 increases cholesterol excretion to the bile and then faeces, providing a unique way to lower cholesterol, and therefore providing a safe and effective way to treat cardiovascular disease.

heading: Architecture and self-assembly of the jumbo bacteriophage nuclear shell
description: The nucleus-like compartment formed in bacteria during infection by jumbo phage 201phi2-1 is composed of the bacteriophage protein chimallin, which can self-assemble into closed compartments in vitro.

heading: Cellular recovery after prolonged warm ischaemia of the whole body
description: OrganEx—an extracorporeal pulsatile-perfusion system with cytoprotective perfusate for porcine whole-body settings—preserved tissue integrity, decreased cell death and restored selected molecular and cellular processes across multiple vital organs after 1 h of warm ischaemia in pigs.

heading: Pulsed hydraulic-pressure-responsive self-cleaning membrane
description: The PiezoMem membrane responsive to hydraulic pressure is introduced, showing the ability to convert pressure pulses into electroactive responses for in situ self-cleaning and enabling broad-spectrum antifouling action towards a range of membrane foulants.

heading: Coronaviruses exploit a host cysteine-aspartic protease for replication
description: Coronaviruses exploit the host caspase-6 to cleave coronavirus nucleocapsid protein into fragments with interferon-antagonizing activity to facilitate virus replication.

heading: A physical wiring diagram for the human immune system
description: Systematic measurements of the interactions between proteins found on the surfaces of human leukocytes provides a global view of the way that immune cells are dynamically connected by receptors.

heading: Brown-fat-mediated tumour suppression by cold-altered global metabolism
description: Mild cold exposure activates a substantial amount of brown adipose tissue (BAT) in a patient with cancer, reducing tumour-associated glucose uptake, and activation of BAT in mice inhibits the growth of tumours by decreasing blood glucose and impeding glycolysis-based metabolism in cancer cells.

heading: Strong yet ductile nanolamellar high-entropy alloys by additive manufacturing
description: An additive manufacturing strategy is used to produce dual-phase nanolamellar high-entropy alloys that show a combination of enhanced high yield strength and high tensile ductility.

heading: Transcriptome variation in human tissues revealed by long-read sequencing
authors: Dafni A. GlinosGarrett GarborcauskasBeryl B. Cummings
description: To understand the contribution of variants to transcript expression regulation, long-read transcriptome data are generated from the GTEx resource, and a new software package to perform allele-specific analysis is developed.

heading: Highly efficient blue InGaN nanoscale light-emitting diodes
description: Using a sol–gel passivation method, the fabrication of blue InGaN nanorod-LEDs with the highest external quantum efficiency value ever reported for LEDs in the nanoscale is demonstrated.

heading: Timescales for pluton growth, magma-chamber formation and super-eruptions
authors: M. E. van ZalingeD. F. MarkA. Rust
description: Analysis of inherited zircons and sanidines from Miocene ignimbrites in the Central Andes shows that plutons were emplaced for up to 4 million years prior to onset of volcanism and that disruption of plutonic rock occurs a few decades or less just before or during super-eruptions.

heading: Non-Hermitian morphing of topological modes
description: It is experimentally demonstrated that the non-Hermitian skin effect can convert localized topological modes into extended modes of unconventional shapes while preserving the topological characteristics, which presents opportunities for topological manipulations of waves and light.

heading: Teixobactin kills bacteria by a two-pronged attack on the cell envelope
description: Using a combination of methods, the mechanism of the antibiotic teixobactin is revealed.

heading: The challenge of unprecedented floods and droughts in risk management
authors: Heidi KreibichAnne F. Van LoonGiuliano Di Baldassarre
description: Unprecedented floods and droughts bring new challenges for risk reduction, as is clear from this analysis of the drivers of changing impacts in many cases worldwide, with implications for efficient governance and investment in integrated management.

heading: Modular strategy for development of the hierarchical visual network in mice
description: The visual network in mice develops in a modular manner with initial establishment of parallel modules followed by their concatenation.

heading: RNA editing underlies genetic risk of common inflammatory diseases
authors: Qin LiMichael J. GloudemansJin Billy Li
description: cis-RNA editing quantitative trait loci, which are associated with immunogenic double-stranded RNAs, underlie genome-wide association study variants in common autoimmune and inflammatory diseases.

heading: Transformations of neural representations in a social behaviour network
description: BNSTprEsr1 activity is required to gate the transition from appetitive to consummatory male social behaviours towards both sexes, by controlling sex- and behaviour-specific representations in VMHvl and MPOA, respectively.

heading: Structural insights into auxin recognition and efflux by Arabidopsis PIN1
description: Structures of the Arabidopsis thaliana auxin exporter PIN1 in the apo state, bound to the natural auxin or bound to an inhibitor provide insights into the polar auxin transport mechanisms mediated by PIN family transporters.

heading: Structures and mechanisms of the Arabidopsis auxin transporter PIN3
description: Arabidopsis thaliana PIN3 structures reveal the molecular mechanisms of the transport of indole-3-acetic acid and the inhibition of polar auxin transport by N-1-naphthylphthalamic acid.

heading: Social capital I: measurement and associations with economic mobility
description: Analyses of data on 21 billion friendships from Facebook in the United States reveal associations between social capital and economic mobility.

heading: Social capital II: determinants of economic connectedness
description: Social disconnection across socioeconomic lines is explained by both differences in exposure to people with high socioeconomic status and friending bias—the tendency for people to befriend peers with similar socioeconomic status even conditional on exposure.

heading: P-type electrical contacts for 2D transition-metal dichalcogenides
description: Clean van der Waals contacts of high-work-function metals have been demonstrated on few- and single-layered MoS2 and WSe2, leading to p-type characteristics on single-layer MoS2 and purely p-type characteristics on WSe2.

heading: Impaired ketogenesis ties metabolism to T cell dysfunction in COVID-19
description: The ketone body β-hydroxybutyrate can be used as an alternative carbon source by T cells to maintain their function during severe respiratory viral infections, including infection with SARS-CoV-2.

heading: Concerns of assuming linearity in the reconstruction of thermal maxima
Reply to: Concerns of assuming linearity in the reconstruction of thermal maxima
Dislocation-induced stop-and-go kinetics of interfacial transformations
description: Environmental transmission electron microscopy is used to reveal that mismatch dislocations modulate the interfacial transformation of copper oxide to copper metal in an intermittent manner.

heading: Dual action of ketamine confines addiction liability
description: Experiments in mice show that although ketamine has positive reinforcement properties, which are driven by its action on the dopamine system, it does not induce the synaptic plasticity that is typically observed with addiction.

heading: Dairying, diseases and the evolution of lactase persistence in Europe
authors: Richard P. EvershedGeorge Davey SmithMark G. Thomas
description: Examination of archaeological pottery residues and modern genes suggest that environmental conditions, subsistence economics and pathogen exposure may explain selection for lactase persistence better than prehistoric consumption of milk.

heading: Exceptional-point-based accelerometers with enhanced signal-to-noise ratio
description: Experiments and theory show that transmission peak degeneracies near exceptional points in an electromechanical accelerometer can be used to improve the signal-to-noise ratio of the sensor.

heading: PI3K drives the de novo synthesis of coenzyme A from vitamin B5
authors: Christian C. DibbleSamuel A. BarrittAlex Toker
description: The PI3K–PANK4 axis regulates coenzyme A synthesis, the abundance of acetyl-CoA, and CoA-dependent processes such as lipid metabolism, and these regulatory mechanisms coordinate cellular CoA supplies with the demands of hormone and growth-factor-driven or oncogene-driven metabolism and growth.

heading: Magnetic memory and spontaneous vortices in a van der Waals superconductor
description: An alternating stack of a candidate spin liquid and a superconductor shows a spontaneous vortex phase in the superconducting state without magnetism in the normal state. This indicates the presence of  unconventional magnetic ordering independent of the superconductor.

heading: The developing bird pelvis passes through ancestral dinosaurian conditions
authors: Christopher T. GriffinJoão F. BotelhoBhart-Anjan S. Bhullar
description: The developing pelvis in birds revisits its dinosaurian state before transitioning to the characteristic avian form, providing evidence of terminal addition during evolution.

heading: Recording gene expression order in DNA by CRISPR addition of retron barcodes
authors: Santi Bhattarai-KlineSierra K. LearSeth L. Shipman
description: Retro-Cascorder, a system for time-ordered recording of transcriptional output, uses retrons as a tag to mediate DNA barcode acquisition in a CRISPR array.

heading: Evaporation of microwave-shielded polar molecules to quantum degeneracy
description: A general and efficient approach to evaporatively cool ultracold polar molecules through elastic collisions to create a degenerate quantum gas in three dimensions is demonstrated using microwave shielding.

heading: Akkermansia muciniphila phospholipid induces homeostatic immune responses
description: Overall, this study describes the molecular mechanism of a druggable pathway that recapitulates in cellular assays the immunomodulatory effects associated with Akkermansia muciniphila, a prominent member of the gut microbiota.

heading: Cortical feedback loops bind distributed representations of working memory
description: Experiments in mice alternating between a visual working memory task and a task that is independent of working memory provide insight into the neural representation of working memory and the distributed nature of its maintenance.

heading: A device-independent quantum key distribution system for distant users
description: A system based on trapped rubidium atoms for generating quantum secure keys between distant users is presented, which could operate in a device-independent fashion.

heading: Secreted fungal virulence effector triggers allergic inflammation via TLR4
authors: Eric V. DangSusan LeiHiten D. Madhani
description: Cryptococcus neoformans secretes CPL1 protein, which induces alternative activation of macrophages via Toll-like receptor 4 in mice and is essential for fungal virulence.

heading: Threshold response to melt drives large-scale bed weakening in Greenland
description: An analysis of basal-friction variability across western Greenland shows melt forcing influences bed strength in opposite ways in northern and southern Greenland, establishing melt has an important role in ice-sheet evolution that is mainly dictated by whether a region is land or marine terminating.

heading: Tracking single adatoms in liquid in a transmission electron microscope
authors: Nick ClarkDaniel J. KellySarah J. Haigh
description: The ability to resolve single atoms in a liquid environment is demonstrated by combining a transmission electron microscope and a robust double graphene liquid cell, enabling studies of adatom motion at solid–liquid interfaces.

heading: Molecular interplay of an assembly machinery for nitrous oxide reductase
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the bacterial protein machinery that is involved in the production and function of nitrous oxide provide insight into the assembly pathway of this enzyme and the mechanisms of copper transport.

heading: Experimental quantum key distribution certified by Bell's theorem
description: This study demonstrates the experimental realization of a complete protocol for quantum key distribution using entangled trapped strontium ions with device-independent quantum security guarantees.

heading: Discovery, structure and mechanism of a tetraether lipid synthase
authors: Cody T. LloydDavid F. IwigSquire J. Booker
description: In Methanocaldococcus jannaschii, a radical S-adenosylmethionine enzyme catalyses the formation of the biphytanyl chain.

heading: Quantized current steps due to the a.c. coherent quantum phase-slip effect
authors: Rais S. ShaikhaidarovKyung Ho KimOleg V. Astafiev
description: Direct observation of the physical dual a.c. Josephson effect, a series of quantized current steps in a superconducting nanowire, is reported and may offer a way to establish new metrological standards for currents.

heading: Electroreduction of nitrogen with almost 100% current-to-ammonia efficiency
description: A high-efficiency, robust process using a high-concentration imide-based lithium-salt electrolyte enables the electroreduction of nitrogen with stabilized ammonia yield rates of 150 ± 20 nmol s−1  cm−2 and a current-to-ammonia efficiency that is close to 100%.

heading: Organizing structural principles of the IL-17 ligand–receptor axis
authors: Steven C. WilsonNathanael A. CaveneyK. Christopher Garcia
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of IL-25–IL-17RB–IL-17RA and IL-17A–IL-17RC–IL-17RA complexes show a tip-to-tip architecture, which is a key organizing principle of the IL-17 receptor family.

heading: Competition for pollinators destabilizes plant coexistence
authors: Christopher A. JohnsonProneet DuttJonathan M. Levine
description: Competition for pollinators weakens plant coexistence by destabilizing interactions between plant species; this is crucial for determining the effects of the decline in pollinators.

heading: Sestrin mediates detection of and adaptation to low-leucine diets in Drosophila
description: Fruitflies require Sestrin to regulate mTORC1 signalling in response to dietary leucine, survive a diet low in leucine, and control leucine-sensitive physiological characteristics, which establishes Sestrin as a physiologically relevant leucine sensor.

heading: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK Biobank
authors: Bjarni V. HalldorssonHannes P. EggertssonKari Stefansson
description: To measure selection on variants, whole-genome sequencing of approximately 150,000 individuals from the UK Biobank is used to rank sequence variants by their level of depletion.

heading: Mechanisms of APOBEC3 mutagenesis in human cancer cells
description: Endogenous APOBEC3 deaminases generate prevalent mutational signatures in human cancer cells, and APOBEC3A is the main driver of these mutations.

heading: Perpendicular full switching of chiral antiferromagnetic order by current
description: Full, perpendicular and bidirectional spin–orbit torque switching of chiral antiferromagnetic order using an electrical current is experimentally demonstrated with epitaxial heterostructures.

heading: ADAR1 averts fatal type I interferon induction by ZBP1
description: ADAR1 prevents Z-RNA-dependent activation of pathogenic type I interferon responses by ZBP1, whose activity may contribute to pathology in type I interferonopathies with ADAR1 mutations.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of an active bacterial TIR–STING filament complex
authors: Benjamin R. MorehouseMatthew C. J. YipPhilip J. Kranzusch
description: Through structural analysis of the activation of bacterial STING, the molecular basis of STING filament formation and TIR effector domain activation in antiphage signalling is defined.

heading: Inner ear biomechanics reveals a Late Triassic origin for mammalian endothermy
description: The functional morphology of the fluid-filled semicircular ducts of the inner ear is adapted to body temperature and behavioural activity and can be used to investigate the evolution of endothermy.

heading: Deep whole-genome ctDNA chronology of treatment-resistant prostate cancer
description: Deep whole-genome sequencing of serial blood samples and matched metastatic tissue reveals that circulating tumour DNA profiling enables detailed study of treatment-driven subclone dynamics, epigenomics and genome-wide somatic evolution in metastatic human cancers.

heading: Giant pyroelectricity in nanomembranes
description: By examining three model pyroelectric materials with different bonding characters along the out-of-plane direction, it is shown that their pyroelectric coefficients increase rapidly when the thickness of free-standing sheets becomes small.

heading: Electrocatalytic metal hydride generation using CPET mediators
description: Concerted proton–electron transfer mediators enable facile electrochemical metal hydride formation and thus improve CO2 reduction to useful chemicals, and could benefit a range of catalytic reactions involving metal hydride intermediates.

heading: Dynamical topological phase realized in a trapped-ion quantum simulator
authors: Philipp T. DumitrescuJustin G. BohnetAndrew C. Potter
description: A dynamical topological phase with edge qubits that are dynamically protected from control errors, cross-talk and stray fields, is demonstrated in a quasiperiodically driven array of ten 171Yb+ hyperfine qubits in a model trapped-ion quantum processor.

heading: Neurotensin orchestrates valence assignment in the amygdala
description: In mouse brain, neurotensin released into the basolateral amygdala by neurons in the paraventricular nucleus of the thalamus assigns positive or negative valence during associative learning.

heading: Extended far-ultraviolet emission in distant dwarf galaxies
description: Observations by the Ultra-Violet Imaging Telescope on AstroSat reveal ten blue compact dwarf galaxies with excess far-ultraviolet emission in their outer region, indicating star formation in accreting disks.

heading: Membrane-anchored HDCR nanowires drive hydrogen-powered CO2 fixation
authors: Helge M. DietrichRicardo D. RighettoJan M. Schuller
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of the filamentous hydrogen-dependent CO2 reductase (HDCR) enzyme from Thermoanaerobacter kivui, together with enzymatic analysis and in situ cryo-electron tomography, provides insight into the high catalytic activity of HDCR.

heading: A new elpistostegalian from the Late Devonian of the Canadian Arctic
authors: Thomas A. StewartJustin B. LembergNeil H. Shubin
description: A new elpistostegalian from the Late Devonian period has been discovered that shows disparity in the group and represents a previously hidden ecological expansion, a secondary return to open water, near the origin of limbed vertebrates.

heading: ADAR1 mutation causes ZBP1-dependent immunopathology
authors: Nicholas W. HubbardJoshua M. AmesAndrew Oberst
description: The autoinflammatory pathology associated with alteration of the ZBD domain of the RNA-editing enzyme ADAR1 is driven by signalling that is dependent on the nucleotide sensor ZBP1.

heading: ADAR1 prevents autoinflammation by suppressing spontaneous ZBP1 activation
description: In addition to its role in suppressing MDA5 and PKR activation, ADAR1 is a negative regulator of ZPB1-mediated apoptosis and necroptosis, providing insights into the pathology of Aicardi–Goutières syndrome.

heading: Oocytes maintain ROS-free mitochondrial metabolism by suppressing complex I
description: Oocytes prevent the production of reactive oxygen species by remodelling the mitochondrial electron transport chain through elimination of complex I, a strategy that enables their long-term viability.

heading: A DNA origami rotary ratchet motor
description: A nanoscale rotary motor made of DNA origami, driven by ratcheting and powered by an external electric field, shows the ability to wind up a spring and has mechanical capabilities approaching those of biological motors.

heading: Digital quantum simulation of Floquet symmetry-protected topological phases
description: Signatures of non-equilibrium Floquet SPT phases with a programmable superconducting quantum processor are observed in which the discrete time translational symmetry only breaks at the boundaries and not in the bulk.

heading: Archaic chaperone–usher pili self-secrete into superelastic zigzag springs
description: The Csu pili of the multidrug-resistant nosocomial pathogen Acinetobacter baumannii assemble into an ultrathin zigzag architecture secured by a clinch mechanism that provides the pilus with high mechanical stability and superelasticity.

heading: Bacterial retrons encode phage-defending tripartite toxin–antitoxin systems
description: Retron-Sen2 of Salmonella Typhimurium encodes a toxin and a reverse transcriptase, which, together with the Sen2 multi-copy single-stranded DNA synthesized by the reverse transcriptase make up a tripartite toxin–antitoxin system that functions in anti-phage defence.

heading: Restoration prioritization must be informed by marginalized people
Reply to: Restoration prioritization must be informed by marginalized people
authors: Bernardo B. N. StrassburgAlvaro IribarremPiero Visconti

heading: Structure of the MRAS–SHOC2–PP1C phosphatase complex
authors: Zachary J. HausemanMichelle FodorDaniel A. King
description: A structure of the MRAS–SHOC2–PP1C complex supports a RAS-driven and multi-molecular model for RAF activation in which individual RAS–GTP molecules recruit RAF–14-3-3 and SHOC2–PP1C to activate the downstream pathway.

heading: Optical observation of single spins in silicon
authors: Daniel B. HigginbottomAlexander T. K. KurkjianStephanie Simmons
description: Individually addressable ‘T centre’ photon-spin qubits are integrated in silicon photonic structures and their spin-dependent telecommunications-band optical transitions characterized, creating opportunities to construct silicon-integrated, telecommunications-band quantum information networks.

heading: Visual recognition of social signals by a tectothalamic neural circuit
description: A tectothalamic pathway for social affiliation in developing zebrafish dissociates neuronal control of attraction from repulsion during affiliation, revealing a circuit underpinning of collective behaviour

heading: Within-host evolution of a gut pathobiont facilitates liver translocation
description: Within-host evolution is a critical regulator of commensal pathogenicity that provides a unique source of stochasticity in the development and progression of microbiota-driven disease.

heading: Post-extinction recovery of the Phanerozoic oceans and biodiversity hotspots
description: The diversity hotspots hypothesis attributes the overall increase in global diversity during the Late Mesozoic and Cenozoic eras to the development of diversity hotspots under prolonged conditions of Earth system stability and maximum continental fragmentation.

heading: Structure–function analysis of the SHOC2–MRAS–PP1C holophosphatase complex
authors: Jason J. KwonBehnoush HajianAndrew J. Aguirre

heading: Atomic imaging of zeolite-confined single molecules by electron microscopy
description: Using integrated differential phase contrast scanning transmission electron microscopy, the atomic imaging of single pyridine and thiophene molecules identifies host–guest interactions in zeolite ZSM-5 and their adsorption and desorption behaviours can be studied.

heading: Measuring the knot of non-Hermitian degeneracies and non-commuting braids
authors: Yogesh S. S. PatilJudith HöllerJack G. E. Harris
description: Control loops generically produce braids of eigenfrequencies, and these braids form a non-Abelian group that reflects the non-trivial geometry of the space of degeneracies; these features are demonstrated experimentally using a cavity optomechanical system.

heading: Dopamine subsystems that track internal states
authors: James C. R. GroveLindsay A. GrayZachary A. Knight
description: Distinct dopaminergic neurons in the ventral tegmental area respond to physiological fluid balance and nutrient cues at specific stages of ingestion, driving learning about the physiological effects of ingestion.

heading: Anti-reflection structure for perfect transmission through complex media
description: An anti-reflection structure is used to eliminate all back scattering of light passing through a diffusive medium.

heading: Reconstitution of a telomeric replicon organized by CST
authors: Arthur J. ZaugKaren J. GoodrichThomas R. Cech
description: The Polα–primase-associated CST complex organizes telomeric C-strand DNA synthesis, and, in combination with telomerase, it carries out complete replication of the single-stranded DNA overhang found at human telomeres.

heading: Nuclear chromosome locations dictate segregation error frequencies
authors: Sjoerd J. KlaasenMy Anh TruongGeert J. P. L. Kops
description: Using single-cell DNA sequencing after an error-prone mitosis in untransformed, diploid cell lines and organoids, chromosomes are shown to have different segregation error frequencies that result in non-random aneuploidy landscapes.

heading: Emerging signals of declining forest resilience under climate change
Mechanisms and inhibition of Porcupine-mediated Wnt acylation
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of human Porcupine in complex with palmitoleoyl-coenzyme A, the inhibitor LGK974 and its peptide substrate suggest a mechanism for Wnt acylation.

heading: Sub-second periodicity in a fast radio burst
description: Analysis of the pulse profile of a fast radio burst showed sub-second periodicity, providing evidence for a neutron-star origin of the event and favouring emission arising from the magnetosphere.

heading: Nuclear moments of indium isotopes reveal abrupt change at magic number 82
authors: A. R. VernonR. F. Garcia RuizD. T. Yordanov
description: Precision laser spectroscopy measurements of neutron-rich indium isotopes were performed to investigate the validity and identify limitations of theoretical descriptions of nuclei based on simple single-particle approaches.

heading: Prefrontal feature representations drive memory recall
description: Longitudinal imaging and functional perturbations during behaviour identified a brain region that represents constituent features of a contextual memory and enables feature-mediated memory recall.

heading: Structures of the human CST-Polα–primase complex bound to telomere templates
description: A structural analysis demonstrates how the single-stranded DNA-binding accessory protein complex CST physically organizes the human DNA polymerase-α–primase complex for efficient primer synthesis during telomere replication.

heading: Odd dynamics of living chiral crystals
description: Experiments show that swimming starfish embryos spontaneously assemble into large chiral crystals that exhibit self-sustained chiral oscillations and unconventional deformation responses characteristic of odd elastic materials.

heading: Elastocaloric determination of the phase diagram of Sr2RuO4
description: The phase diagram of the unconventional superconductor Sr2RuO4 in both normal and superconducting states is mapped out using high-precision measurements of the elastocaloric effect, showing similarities to other unconventional superconductors as well as unique features.

heading: Retrograde movements determine effective stem cell numbers in the intestine
description: Small intestinal crypts contain twice as many effective stem cells as large intestinal crypts, and this difference is determined by the degree of Wnt-driven retrograde cell movement—which is largely absent in the large intestine—counteracting conveyor-belt-like upward movement.

heading: Structure of Tetrahymena telomerase-bound CST with polymerase α-primase
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of Tetrahymena thermophila telomerase-bound Ctc1–Stn1–Ten1 and DNA polymerase α–primase provide insights into the molecular mechanisms underlying telomere replication and maintenance.

heading: ZBTB46 defines and regulates ILC3s that protect the intestine
description: A subset of group 3 innate lymphoid cells (ILC3s) expresses the transcription factor ZBTB46—which was previously thought to be restricted to conventional dendritic cells—and these ILC3s have a role in regulating intestinal health.

heading: 700,000 years of tropical Andean glaciation
authors: D. T. RodbellR. G. HatfieldS. Pierdominici
description: Analysis of a continuous and independently dated record of glaciation in the tropical Andes spanning 700,000 years shows that Andean glaciation follows patterns of global ice volume change, with a periodicity of approximately 100,000 years.

heading: Structure of the nutrient-sensing hub GATOR2
authors: Max L. ValensteinKacper B. RogalaDavid M. Sabatini
description: The 3D structure of the human nutrient-sensing complex GATOR2 is resolved using cryo-electron microscopy.

heading: Attosecond spectroscopy of size-resolved water clusters
description: Attosecond size-resolved cluster spectroscopy is introduced and the effect that the addition of single water molecules has is measured, indicating a direct link between electronic structure and attosecond photoionization dynamics.

heading: Wastewater sequencing reveals early cryptic SARS-CoV-2 variant transmission
description: Emerging SARS-CoV-2 variants of concern were detected early and multiple cases of virus spread not captured by clinical genomic surveillance were identified using high-resolution wastewater and clinical sequencing.

heading: Cell–matrix interface regulates dormancy in human colon cancer stem cells
description: A genetic lineage-tracing system in human colorectal organoids identifies a population of dormant cancer cells that persists during chemotherapy and enables cancer regrowth, and the cell-adhesion molecule COL17A1 has a key role in the process of breaking dormancy.

heading: A path forward for analysing the impacts of marine protected areas
Reply to: A path forward for analysing the impacts of marine protected areas
Nitrogen reduction by the Fe sites of synthetic [Mo3S4Fe] cubes
description: Iron atoms in a synthetic metal–sulfur cluster can capture nitrogen and catalyse its silylation, demonstrating successful nitrogen reduction by iron atoms in a sulfur-rich environment.

heading: Action suppression reveals opponent parallel control via striatal circuits
authors: Bruno F. CruzGonçalo GuiomarJoseph J. Paton
description: Experiments in mice show that direct- and indirect-pathway neurons in the basal ganglia are co-activated during movement but exhibit opposite patterns of activity during the active suppression of movement.

heading: Single-cell roadmap of human gonadal development
description: This study provides a comprehensive spatiotemporal map of human and mouse gonadal differentiation, using a combination of single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, chromatin accessibility assays and fluorescent microscopy, which can guide in vitro gonadogenesis.

heading: Super-enhancer hypermutation alters oncogene expression in B cell lymphoma
description: Active super-enhancers are highly and specifically hypermutated in 92% of diffuse large B cell lymphoma samples and display signatures of activation-induced cytidine deaminase activity, leading to the dysregulation of genes encoding B cell developmental regulators and oncogenes.

heading: Hippocampal place cells have goal-oriented vector fields during navigation
description: A vector-based model for flexible navigation in the hippocampus allows animals to optimally navigate to any location in their environment.

heading: C. elegans as a model for inter-individual variation in metabolism
authors: Bennett W. FoxOlga PonomarovaAlbertha J. M. Walhout
description: Using differences among strains as a model for inter-individual variation, this paper identifies a conserved metabolicadaptation in C. elegans that compensates for genetic variation.

heading: The neuronal logic of how internal states control food choice
description: High-resolution volumetric calcium imaging was used to create a functional atlas of the Drosophila melanogaster ventral brain and identify how and where metabolic and reproductive states alter processing of food-related sensory stimuli.

heading: Immune tolerance of food is mediated by layers of CD4+ T cell dysfunction
authors: Sung-Wook HongPeter D. KruegerMarc K. Jenkins
description: Immune tolerance to food is mediated by CD4+ T cells forming subsets of T helper cells lacking the capacity to trigger gut pathology but able to produce regulatory T cells that may suppress it.

heading: A receptor–channel trio conducts Ca2+ signalling for pollen tube reception
description: The molecular mechanism by which FERONIA, LORELEI and NORTIA work together to facilitate calcium-mediated synergid–pollen tube communication in flowering plants is presented.

heading: A synergistic mindsets intervention protects adolescents from stress
authors: David S. YeagerChristopher J. BryanJeremy P. Jamieson
description: An online training module that synergistically targets two different mindsets can reduce stress levels in adolescents in the context of social-evaluative stressors—stressful experiences in which individuals fear that others are judging them negatively.

heading: Direct observation of vortices in an electron fluid
description: Vortices in an electron fluid are directly observed in a para-hydrodynamic regime in which the spatial diffusion of electron momenta is enabled by small-angle scattering rather than electron–electron scattering.

heading: RETRACTED ARTICLE: Intrinsically unidirectional chemically fuelled rotary molecular motors
description: A homochiral rotary molecular motor shows autonomous unidirectional rotation around a single bond driven by a chemical fuel.

heading: Molecular landscapes of human hippocampal immature neurons across lifespan
description: Single-nucleus RNA-sequencing analysis supports the presence of immature dentate granule cells throughout the human lifespan and shows that these cells are reduced in number and dysregulated in Alzheimer's disease.

heading: Turbulent cold flows gave birth to the first quasars
authors: M. A. LatifD. J. WhalenT. E. Woods
description: Rare, converging cold flows gave birth to the massive black holes that were the seeds of the first quasars.

heading: Coherent interfaces govern direct transformation from graphite to diamond
description: The discovery of graphite–diamond hybrid carbon, Gradia, which consists of graphite and diamond nanodomains interlocked through coherent interfaces, clarifies the long-standing mystery of how graphite turns into diamond.

heading: Entangling single atoms over 33 km telecom fibre
description: Heralded entanglement between two independently trapped single rubidium atoms is generated over long telecom fibre links using quantum frequency conversion in an important step towards the realization of large-scale quantum network links.

heading: Biosynthesis of strychnine
description: The biosynthetic pathway of strychnine, brucine and diaboline is described, and the biosynthesis of these complex, pharmacologically active compounds has been successfully recapitulated in Nicotiana benthamiana from an upstream intermediate.

heading: Topologically protected magnetoelectric switching in a multiferroic
description: The electric polarization of a multiferroic is reversed by the application and subsequent removal of a magnetic field, resulting in topologically protected unidirectional magnetoelectric switching.

heading: A male steroid controls female sexual behaviour in the malaria mosquito
description: The discovery of a male-specific sex hormone in the mosquito Anopheles gambiae may allow new strategies for the control of this notorious disease vector.

heading: A transcriptomic axis predicts state modulation of cortical interneurons
description: Two-photon imaging and in situ transcriptomic analysis of the primary visual cortex in mice show that a single transcriptomic axis correlates with the state modulation of cortical inhibitory neurons.

heading: A time-resolved, multi-symbol molecular recorder via sequential genome editing
description: A DNA memory device, DNA Typewriter, uses sequential prime editing to record the order of multiple cellular events.

heading: Apoptotic brown adipocytes enhance energy expenditure via extracellular inosine
description: Untargeted metabolomics demonstrate that apoptotic brown adipocytes release a specific pattern of metabolites with purine metabolites being highly enriched, and inosine is identified as a metabolite released during apoptosis regulating thermogenic fat and counteracting obesity.

heading: Antibody evasion by SARS-CoV-2 Omicron subvariants BA.2.12.1, BA.4 and BA.5
description: Findings from a systematic antigenic analysis of these surging Omicron subvariants that this lineage of SARS-CoV-2 continues to evolve, successively yielding subvariants that are not only more transmissible but also more evasive to antibodies.

heading: A portrait of the Higgs boson by the CMS experiment ten years after the discovery
description: The most up-to-date combination of results on the properties of the Higgs boson is reported, which indicate that its properties are consistent with the standard model predictions, within the precision achieved to date.

heading: A detailed map of Higgs boson interactions by the ATLAS experiment ten years after the discovery
description: Ten years after the discovery of the Higgs boson, the ATLAS  experiment at CERN probes its kinematic properties with a significantly larger dataset from 2015–2018 and provides further insights on its interaction with other known particles.

heading: GTSF1 accelerates target RNA cleavage by PIWI-clade Argonaute proteins
description: The evolutionarily conserved RNA-binding protein GTSF1 and its homologues interact with members of the PIWI class of Argonaute proteins, increasing the efficiency of the RNA-cleaving activity of PIWI proteins, an essential function across the animal kingdom.

heading: Surface-to-space atmospheric waves from Hunga Tonga–Hunga Ha’apai eruption
authors: Corwin J. WrightNeil P. HindleyJia Yue
description: The Hunga Tonga eruption represents a natural experiment, being a clearly identifiable near-point source producing gravity waves across a broad range of spatiotemporal and frequency scales, observed by a diverse array of instruments worldwide.

heading: Scalable single-mode surface-emitting laser via open-Dirac singularities
description: A photonic crystal cavity arranged in a hexagonal pattern shows unconventional losses that allow single-mode lasing operation to be maintained as the cavity is scaled up in size.

heading: Optimization of avian perching manoeuvres
authors: Marco KleinHeerenbrinkLydia A. FranceGraham K. Taylor
description: To perch safely, large birds minimize the distance flown after stalling when swooping up from a dive to a perch, but not the time or energy required.

heading: Structural basis for SHOC2 modulation of RAS signalling
authors: Nicholas P. D. LiauMatthew C. JohnsonJawahar Sudhamsu
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structure, molecular dynamics and biochemical analyses of the SHOC2–PP1C–MRAS complex demonstrate the dependence of the complex formation on RAS–GTP and identify the determinants of RAS isoform preference for SHOC2–PP1C and specificity of the complex for RAF dephosphorylation.

heading: Hypocrystalline ceramic aerogels for thermal insulation at extreme conditions
description: Hypocrystalline ceramic aerogels with a zig-zag architecture show high thermal stability under thermal shock and exposure to high temperature, providing a reliable material system for thermal insulation at extreme conditions.

heading: Structural insights into dsRNA processing by Drosophila Dicer-2–Loqs-PD
description: Structures of the Dcr-2–Loqs-PD complex while it is processing a double-stranded RNA (dsRNA) substrate elucidate the interactions between Dcr-2 and Loqs-PD, and show that Dcr-2 undergoes substantial conformational changes during a dsRNA-processing cycle.

heading: Structures and mechanism of the plant PIN-FORMED auxin transporter
authors: Kien Lam UngMikael WinklerBjørn Panyella Pedersen
description: Structural and biophysical analysis of the Arabidopsis thaliana auxin transporter PIN8 reveal that PIN transporters export auxin using an elevator mechanism.

heading: GREM1 is required to maintain cellular heterogeneity in pancreatic cancer
description: The BMP inhibitor GREM1 is a key regulator of cellular heterogeneity in pancreatic cancer in human and mouse.

heading: Grey wolf genomic history reveals a dual ancestry of dogs
authors: Anders BergströmDavid W. G. StantonPontus Skoglund
description: DNA from ancient wolves spanning 100,000 years sheds light on wolves’ evolutionary history and the genomic origin of dogs.

heading: Enteric viruses replicate in salivary glands and infect through saliva
description: Enteric viruses replicate in salivary glands, can be propagated in salivary gland-derived spheroids and cell lines, and are released into saliva, which is a new transmission route having implications for therapeutics, diagnostics and sanitation measures.

heading: Increasing the resilience of plant immunity to a warming climate
authors: Jong Hum KimChristian Danve M. CastroverdeSheng Yang He
description: Suppression of salicylic acid production in Arabidopsis thaliana at high temperature is caused by decreased recruitment of GUANYLATE BINDING PROTEIN-LIKE 3 defence-associated condensates on promoter sites of master immune regulatory genes.

heading: Chiral molecular intercalation superlattices
description: By intercalating layered 2D atomic crystals with selected chiral molecules, a new class of chiral molecular intercalation superlattices is reported, demonstrating highly ordered structures and achieving high tunnelling magnetoresistance and spin polarization ratios.

heading: Mitochondrial RNA modifications shape metabolic plasticity in metastasis
YAP/TAZ activity in stromal cells prevents ageing by controlling cGAS–STING
description: tDeclining YAP/TAZ mechanotransduction drives ageing by unleashing cGAS–STING signalling, a pillar of innate immunity, so sustaining YAP/TAZ mechanosignalling or inhibiting STING present promising approaches for limiting senescence-associated inflammation and improving healthy ageing.

heading: A peroxisomal ubiquitin ligase complex forms a retrotranslocation channel
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of the membrane-embedded ubiquitin ligase complex reveals its function as a retrotranslocation channel for shuttling mobile receptors out of peroxisomes.

heading: Structure of the Dicer-2–R2D2 heterodimer bound to a small RNA duplex
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of Drosophila Dicer-2–R2D2 complexes with and without small interfering RNA reveal how the RNA is presented to Argonaute in the correct orientation for viral gene silencing.

heading: Landfalling hurricane track modes and decay
authors: Kelvin T. F. ChanKailin ZhangJohnny C. L. Chan

heading: Reply to: Landfalling hurricane track modes and decay
Engineering topological states in atom-based semiconductor quantum dots
authors: M. KiczynskiS. K. GormanM. Y. Simmons
description: Precision-engineered devices consisting of a linear array of ten quantum dots are used to realize both the trivial and topological phases of the many-body Su–Schrieffer–Heeger model.

heading: Ablation of cDC2 development by triple mutations within the Zeb2 enhancer
description: The transcription factor NFIL3 acts antagonistically to C/EBP proteins by binding the Zeb2 enhancer to prevent Zeb2 expression and the development of the conventional type 2 dendritic cell lineage.

heading: Integrated multi-omic characterization of congenital heart disease
authors: Matthew C. HillZachary A. KadowJames F. Martin
description: Single-nuclear transcriptomic and proteomic analyses identify molecular characteristics shared by multiple classes of congenital heart disease, including phenotypes associated with insulin resistance.

heading: Single-nucleus profiling of human dilated and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
Biosynthetic potential of the global ocean microbiome
description: Global ocean microbiome survey reveals the bacterial family ‘Candidatus Eudoremicrobiaceae’, which includes some of the most biosynthetically diverse microorganisms in the ocean environment.

heading: Asymmetric pore windows in MOF membranes for natural gas valorization
description: A metal–organic framework membrane based on fumarate and mesaconate linkers is shown to have a pore aperture shape that enables efficient and cost-effective removal of nitrogen and carbon dioxide from methane.

heading: Women are credited less in science than men
authors: Matthew B. RossBritta M. GlennonJulia I. Lane
description: The difference between the number of men and women listed as authors on scientific papers and inventors on patents is at least partly attributable to unacknowledged contributions by women scientists.

heading: Life rather than climate influences diversity at scales greater than 40 million years
Observation of a correlated free four-neutron system
description: Experiment based on knocking out an alpha particle from a high-energy helium isotope shows a resonance-like structure that is consistent with a quasi-bound tetraneutron state existing for a very short time.

heading: eIF5B and eIF1A reorient initiator tRNA to allow ribosomal subunit joining
authors: Christopher P. LapointeRosslyn GroselyJoseph D. Puglisi
description: Single-molecule spectroscopy and structural studies were used to examine the dynamics of association of eIF1A and eIF5B with the human translation initiation complex and their role in presenting tRNA to the complex to initiate translation.

heading: cBAF complex components and MYC cooperate early in CD8+ T cell fate
description: cBAF is a negative determinant of memory T cell fate and the manipulation of cBAF early in T cell differentiation can improve cancer immunotherapy.

heading: PIEZO1 transduces mechanical itch in mice
authors: Rose Z. HillMeaghan C. LoudArdem Patapoutian
description: Experiments in mice show that the mechanically activated ion channel PIEZO1 is expressed in itch-specific sensory neurons and has a role in transducing mechanical itch.

heading: Organic bipolar transistors
description: An organic bipolar junction transistor composed of highly crystalline rubrene thin films has a device architecture that could be used in organic electronics with greatly improved high-frequency performance

heading: The gut metabolite indole-3 propionate promotes nerve regeneration and repair
Clonally expanded CD8 T cells characterize amyotrophic lateral sclerosis-4
description: An immune signature characterized by activated antigen-specific CD8 T cells is identified in the brain and blood of mice with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis-4 (ALS4), suggesting that the immune system is involved in ALS4 neurodegeneration.

heading: De novo design of discrete, stable 310-helix peptide assemblies
authors: Prasun KumarNeil G. PatersonDerek N. Woolfson
description: A study demonstrates the rational de novo design of water-soluble assemblies constructed from long 310-helical peptides, and details their characterization by circular dichroism spectroscopy, analytical ultracentrifugation and X-ray crystallography.

heading: The metastatic spread of breast cancer accelerates during sleep
description: A study of patients with breast cancer and mouse models demonstrates that most circulating tumour cells are generated during the rest phase of the circadian rhythm, and that these cells are highly prone to metastasize.

heading: Many-body theory of positron binding to polyatomic molecules
description: A many-body theory of binding interactions between positrons and polar and nonpolar molecules is developed, showing agreement with experimental data up to within 1%.

heading: Hadean isotopic fractionation of xenon retained in deep silicates
description: An explanation of the Earth’s ‘missing Xe’ problem that involves multiple magma ocean stages combined with atmospheric loss is proposed.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of a type IV secretion system
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of a 2.8 megadalton bacterial type IV secretion system encoded by the plasmid R388 and comprising 92 polypeptides provide insights into the stepwise mechanism of pilus assembly.

heading: Induction of mouse totipotent stem cells by a defined chemical cocktail
description: Under chemically defined conditions, mouse pluripotent stem cells can be induced to closely resemble authentic totipotent stem cells that can differentiate to both embryonic and extraembryonic lineages.

heading: BA.2.12.1, BA.4 and BA.5 escape antibodies elicited by Omicron infection
description: Biochemical and structural studies of the interactions between antibodies and spike proteins from SARS-CoV-2 Omicron subvariants indicate how these variants have evolved to escape antibody-mediated neutralization.

heading: Site-selective, stereocontrolled glycosylation of minimally protected sugars
authors: Qiuhan LiSamuel M. LeviEric N. Jacobsen
description: A simplified synthesis strategy for stereo- and site-selective glycosylations, using minimally protected mono- and disaccharides and thiourea small-molecule catalysts, enables highly selective functionalization of carbohydrates.

heading: Spatial profiling of early primate gastrulation in utero
authors: Sophie BergmannChristopher A. PenfoldThorsten E. Boroviak
description: 3D transcriptomes reveal the molecular code of lineage specification in the primate embryo and provide an in vivo reference to decipher human development.

heading: Evidence for unconventional superconductivity in twisted trilayer graphene
description: High-resolution scanning tunnelling microscopy and spectroscopy are used to provide evidence for unconventional superconductivity in magic-angle twisted trilayer graphene.

heading: The source of the Black Death in fourteenth-century central Eurasia
Superconducting-qubit readout via low-backaction electro-optic transduction
authors: R. D. DelaneyM. D. UrmeyK. W. Lehnert
description: Readout of a superconducting qubit embedded in a circuit quantum electrodynamics architecture is demonstrated at optical frequencies through a low-noise electro-optomechanical transducer.

heading: Androgen receptor blockade promotes response to BRAF/MEK-targeted therapy
authors: Christopher P. VellanoMichael G. WhiteJennifer A. Wargo
description: Treatment with neoadjuvant BRAF/MEK-targeted therapy results in higher rates of major pathological response in female compared with male patients with melanoma, and pharmacological inhibition of androgen receptor signalling improved the responses of male and female mice to BRAF/MEK-targeted therapy.

heading: Mechanism of replication origin melting nucleated by CMG helicase assembly
authors: Jacob S. LewisMarta H. GrossAlessandro Costa
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the sequential assembly of the CMG replicative helicase on a chromatinized origin of replication provide insights into the mechanism through which DNA melting is initiated by ATP binding.

heading: A pan-cancer compendium of chromosomal instability
