description: Analysis of tide gauge observations shows that, in contrast to the current assumption of stationary storm surge extremes in Europe, the surge contribution to changes in extreme sea levels since 1960 is similar to that of sea-level rise, influencing future coastal planning.

heading: N6-methyladenosine in poly(A) tails stabilize VSG transcripts
authors: Idálio J. ViegasJuan Pereira de MacedoLuisa M. Figueiredo
description: N6-methyladenosine is enriched in poly(A) tails of VSG transcripts in Trypanosoma brucei, and when lacking result in mRNA degradation.

heading: Anatomic position determines oncogenic specificity in melanoma
authors: Joshua M. WeissMiranda V. HunterRichard M. White
description: In a zebrafish model of human cutaneous and acral melanomas, CRKL amplification causes tumours to favour a fin location, indicating that tumour location is determined by both the driver oncogenes and the pre-existing positional identity gene program.

heading: The colloidal nature of complex fluids enhances bacterial motility
description: Bacteria swimming in colloidal suspensions are shown to behave similarly to those in polymer solutions revealing a mechanism for motile behaviour in complex fluids.

heading: Targeting Xist with compounds that disrupt RNA structure and X inactivation
authors: Rodrigo AguilarKerrie B. SpencerJeannie T. Lee
description: A molecule identified in a screen for compounds that bind the non-coding mouse RNA Xist blocks Xist-dependent X-chromosome inactivation, demonstrating the utility of this approach for identifying drugs that target RNA.

heading: Catalogue of flat-band stoichiometric materials
description: A catalogue of the naturally occurring three-dimensional stoichiometric materials with flat bands around the Fermi level provides a powerful search engine for future theoretical and experimental studies.

heading: Crucial role and mechanism of transcription-coupled DNA repair in bacteria
description: Integrated structure–function studies show that transcription-coupled DNA repair (TCR)—rather than global genomic repair—is responsible for most chromosomal repair events in bacteria, and that TCR mainly occurs independently of the Mfd translocase.

heading: Genetic instability from a single S phase after whole-genome duplication
description: Extensive DNA damage occurs during the first interphase following induction of tetraploidy in human cells, largely as a result of the lower amount of protein relative to DNA.

heading: Orbital-resolved visualization of single-molecule photocurrent channels
description: Atomic-level imaging of photocurrents in a single molecule is achieved by combining a tunable laser with scanning tunnelling microscopy, revealing how photons turn into electric current via a photoexcited molecule.

heading: Human distal airways contain a multipotent secretory cell that can regenerate alveoli
authors: Maria C. BasilFabian L. Cardenas-DiazEdward E. Morrisey
description: Human respiratory bronchioles contain a unique population of secretory cells called respiratory airway secretory cells that are distinct from the cells in the larger proximal airways, and act as unidirectional progenitors for alveolar type 2 cells.

heading: Entropy of city street networks linked to future spatial navigation ability
description: An analysis of spatial navigation in nearly 400,000 people shows, by measuring their performance in a video game, that individuals who grew up outside cities are better at navigation than those who grew up in cities.

heading: Assembly of the basal mantle structure beneath Africa
authors: Nicolas FlamentÖmer F. BodurAndrew S. Merdith
description: Reconstruction of one billion years of mantle flow shows that mobile basal mantle structures are just as consistent with the Earth’s volcanic history as are fixed mantle structures.

heading: Differential assembly diversifies GABAA receptor structures and signalling
description: The diverse makeup and assembly of subunits augment the structure, physiology and pharmacology of GABAA receptors.

heading: Obesity alters pathology and treatment response in inflammatory disease
description: Obesity changes the characteristics of the immune response induced in a mouse model of atopic dermatitis, suggesting therapies that could be used against immune dysregulation in obesity.

heading: Plant phytochrome B is an asymmetric dimer with unique signalling potential
authors: Hua LiE. Sethe BurgieRichard D. Vierstra
description: The inactive Pr conformer of Arabidopsis phytochrome B shows a topologically complex dimeric organization that is distinct from its prokaryotic relatives.

heading: A highly magnified star at redshift 6.2
description: A massive star at a redshift of 6.2, corresponding to 900 million years after the Big Bang, is magnified greatly by lensing of the foreground galaxy cluster WH0137–08.

heading: Amyloid fibrils in FTLD-TDP are composed of TMEM106B and not TDP-43
authors: Yi Xiao JiangQin CaoDavid S. Eisenberg
description: Amyloid fibrils extracted from brains of patients with frontotemporal lobar degeneration with TAR DNA-binding-protein immunoreactivity (FTLD-TDP) are made up of transmembrane protein 106B.

heading: A﻿ TMPRSS2 inhibitor acts as a pan-SARS-CoV-2 prophylactic and therapeutic
description: A small-molecule inhibitor of TMPRSS2 is effective against SARS-CoV-2 variants of concern in human lung cells and in donor-derived colonoids, and also shows prophylactic and therapeutic benefits in a mouse model of COVID-19.

heading: [18F]Difluorocarbene for positron emission tomography
authors: Jeroen B. I. SapClaudio F. MeyerVéronique Gouverneur
description: Carbene chemistry is used to introduce difluoromethyl groups labelled with fluorine-18 into compounds for positron emission tomography imaging, using a reagent designed for high molar activity and versatility.

heading: Age-dependent formation of TMEM106B amyloid filaments in human brains
authors: Manuel SchweighauserDiana ArseniSjors H. W. Scheres
description: A study using structure determination by cryogenic electron microscopy identifies and characterizes TMEM106B amyloid filaments in human brain, and suggests that their formation is age dependent, with no obvious association with disease.

heading: Design of protein-binding proteins from the target structure alone
description: A design pipeline is presented whereby binding proteins can be designed de novo without the need for prior information on binding hotspots or fragments from structures of complexes with binding partners.

heading: [{Th(C8H8)Cl2}3]2− is stable but not aromatic
Models of flow through sponges must consider the sponge tissue
Reply to: Models of flow through sponges must consider the sponge tissue
Reply to: [{Th(C8H8)Cl2}3]2− is stable but not aromatic
authors: Josef T. BoronskiJohn A. SeedStephen T. Liddle

heading: Nivolumab plus chemotherapy or ipilimumab in gastro-oesophageal cancer
authors: Kohei ShitaraJaffer A. AjaniYelena Y. Janjigian
description: Results in the CheckMate 649 phase 3 trial for first-line combined nivolumab and chemotherapy treatment continue to show clinically meaningful efficacy in gastric, gastro-oesophageal junction or oesophageal adenocarcinoma after 24 months, with no new safety signals.

heading: The development and evolution of inhibitory neurons in primate cerebrum
authors: Matthew T. SchmitzKadellyn SandovalAlex A. Pollen
description: Evolutionary modelling shows that an initial set of inhibitory neurons serving olfactory bulbs may have been repurposed to diversify the taxonomy of interneurons found in the expanded striata and cortices in primates.

heading: Optimal metrology with programmable quantum sensors
description: A new approach to generating quantum sensors with close-to-optimal performance is demonstrated experimentally through Ramsey interferometry with (up to) N = 26 entangled atoms on a trapped-ion quantum computer, without a priori knowledge of the device or its noise environment.

heading: Androgen receptor activity in T cells limits checkpoint blockade efficacy
description: . Androgen-receptor blockade can overcome immunotherapy resistance in prostate cancer by intrinsically enhancing T cell function and IFNγ responses.

heading: High-brightness all-polymer stretchable LED with charge-trapping dilution
description: A material design strategy and fabrication process is described to produce all-polymer light-emitting diodes with high brightness, current efficiency and good mechanical stability, with applications in skin electronics and human–machine interfaces.

heading: Geophysical imaging of the Yellowstone hydrothermal plumbing system
authors: Carol A. FinnPaul A. BedrosianJade Crosbie
description: High-resolution images derived from airborne geophysical data reveal critical aspects of the Yellowstone hydrothermal system, which can be used to assess geochemical models of the evolution of thermal fluids worldwide.

heading: Subaqueous foraging among carnivorous dinosaurs
description: In extinct species including non-avian dinosaurs, bone density is shown to be a reliable indicator of aquatic behavioural adaptations, which emerged in spinosaurids during the Early Cretaceous.

heading: Emergence of Fermi arcs due to magnetic splitting in an antiferromagnet
description: Magnetic splitting in an antiferromagnetic state of cubic NdBi gives rise to Fermi arcs with bands that have opposing curvature.

heading: Reduced reproductive success is associated with selective constraint on human genes
authors: Eugene J. GardnerMatthew D. C. NevilleMatthew E. Hurles
description: Human genetic variants that impair genes that are intolerant of damaging genetic variation are associated with lower reproductive success that is probably mediated by genetically associated cognitive and behavioural traits, particularly in males.

heading: AAV-delivered suppressor tRNA overcomes a nonsense mutation in mice
description: The feasibility of adeno-associated-virus-delivered nonsense suppressor tRNAs operating on premature termination codons (AAV-NoSTOP) is explored to restore gene function, using a mouse model of mucopolysaccharidosis type I for proof of concept.

heading: Metastable hexagonal close-packed palladium hydride in liquid cell TEM
description: A metastable palladium hydride is synthesized where the unique environment in the liquid cell, namely the limited quantity of Pd precursors and the continuous supply of H, resulted in the formation of the hcp phase.

heading: Boron clusters as broadband membrane carriers
description: The superchaotropic nature of globular boron cluster anions enables direct passage of a wide range of molecules across lipid membranes.

heading: Inhibition of calcium-triggered secretion by hydrocarbon-stapled peptides
description: Peptides that disrupt Ca2+-triggered membrane fusion may enable the therapeutic modulation of mucin secretory pathways.

heading: A time-resolved picture of our Milky Way’s early formation history
description: A sample of approximately 250,000 subgiant stars enables an alternative view of the Milky Way’s assembly history, especially the early formation history of the old disk and halo.

heading: Intermolecular [2π+2σ]-photocycloaddition enabled by triplet energy transfer
description: A strain-release approach, realized by visible-light-mediated triplet energy transfer catalysis, enabled an intermolecular [2π+2σ]-photocycloaddition.

heading: Rolling back human pluripotent stem cells to an eight-cell embryo-like stage
authors: Md. Abdul MazidCarl WardMiguel A. Esteban
description: The development of a transgene-free, rapid and controllable method for producing eight-cell-like cells from human pluripotent stem cells provides a valuable resource to study early human embryogenesis.

heading: Eicosanoid signalling blockade protects middle-aged mice from severe COVID-19
description: A study reports the isolation and characterization of mouse-adapted SARS-CoV-2, demonstrates asapiprant to protect aged mice from its most severe effects, and identifies the PLA2G2D–PGD2/PTGDR pathway as a therapeutic target.

heading: On the role of atmospheric model transport uncertainty in estimating the Chinese land carbon sink
Reply to: The size of the land carbon sink in China
Reply to: On the role of atmospheric model transport uncertainty in estimating the Chinese land carbon sink
The size of the land carbon sink in China
Machine learning and phone data can improve targeting of humanitarian aid
description: Machine-learning algorithms can take advantage of survey and mobile phone data to help to identify people most in need of aid, complementing traditional methods for targeting humanitarian assistance.

heading: A multidimensional coding architecture of the vagal interoceptive system
authors: Qiancheng ZhaoChuyue D. YuRui B. Chang
description: Single-cell profiling of vagal sensory neurons from seven organs in mice and calcium-imaging-guided spatial transcriptomics reveal that interoceptive signals are coded through three distinct dimensions, allowing efficient processing of multiple signals in parallel using a combinatorial strategy.

heading: A genome-scale screen for synthetic drivers of T cell proliferation
description: A genome-scale gain-of-function screen using overexpression of nearly 12,000 open reading frames (ORFs) identifies positive regulators of human T cell function and suggests that ORF-based screens could be applied clinically to improve T cell therapies.

heading: A single-cell atlas of human and mouse white adipose tissue
authors: Margo P. EmontChristopher JacobsEvan D. Rosen
description: A single-cell atlas of white adipose tissue from mouse and human reveals diverse cell types and similarities and differences across species and dietary conditions.

heading: Limited increases in savanna carbon stocks over decades of fire suppression
description: A direct estimate is provided of the whole-ecosystem carbon response to fire suppression in a mesic African savanna, showing limited increase in carbon storage despite a large increase in tree cover.

heading: RETRACTED ARTICLE: New land-use-change emissions indicate a declining CO2 airborne fraction
authors: Margreet J. E. van MarleDave van WeesGuido. R. van der Werf
description: By generating a land use and land cover change emissions dataset using visibility data from two key deforestation regions, analysis of the data suggests a decrease in the CO2 airborne fraction since 1959.

heading: Steady Floquet–Andreev states in graphene Josephson junctions
description: Using continuous microwave application without substantial heating, Floquet–Andreev states in graphene Josephson junctions are realized, and their energy spectra are measured directly by superconducting tunnelling spectroscopy.

heading: Human gut bacteria produce ΤΗ17-modulating bile acid metabolites
description: Bacterially produced bile acids inhibit TH17 cell function, which may be relevant to the pathophysiology of inflammatory disorders such as inflammatory bowel disease.

heading: High-resolution laser resonances of antiprotonic helium in superfluid 4He
description: The spectral lines of antiprotonic helium atoms are shown to retain their sub-gigahertz linewidth upon submersion in a bath of superfluid helium, enabling the hyperfine structure to be resolved.

heading: Reproducible brain-wide association studies require thousands of individuals
authors: Scott MarekBrenden Tervo-ClemmensNico U. F. Dosenbach
description: Combined data from three large studies, with a total sample size of around 50,000 individuals, indicate that many previous studies linking the brain to complex phenotypes have been statistically underpowered, producing inflated and irreproducible effects.

heading: Single fibre enables acoustic fabrics via nanometre-scale vibrations
description: A piezoelectric fibre woven into a machine-washable fabric converts tenuous sound pressure into electric signals and is used to listen to cardiac sound, determine the source direction of a sound, and record and play back audio.

heading: Immune regulation by fungal strain diversity in inflammatory bowel disease
authors: Xin V. LiIrina LeonardiIliyan D. Iliev
description: Genetically diverse Candida albicans strains in patients with inflammatory bowel disease secrete a toxin and aggravate IL-1β-dependent intestinal inflammation.

heading: Cortical ensembles orchestrate social competition through hypothalamic outputs
description: Analyses of neural activity of mice competing in a social competition assay monitored by a computer vision tool reveal a neural circuit with a role in dynamically modulating social dominance.

heading: Activation mechanism of the class D fungal GPCR dimer Ste2
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of ligand-free, agonist-bound and antagonist-bound Ste2 show that this class D1 G protein-coupled receptor has a distinct mechanism of activation compared with other receptor classes.

heading: A kinase-cGAS cascade to synthesize a therapeutic STING activator
authors: John A. McIntoshZhijian LiuMatthew L. Maddess
description: Leveraging enzymatic selectivity, a single reaction stream provides a single diastereomer of the cyclic dinucleotide MK-1454, a promising immune-oncology drug candidate, without the use of protecting groups or chiral auxiliaries.

heading: Unbiasing fermionic quantum Monte Carlo with a quantum computer
authors: William J. HugginsBryan A. O’GormanJoonho Lee
description: A hybrid quantum-classical algorithm for solving many-electron problems is developed, enabling the simulation, with the aid of 16 qubits on a quantum processor, of chemical systems with up to 120 orbitals.

heading: Flat-surface-assisted and self-regulated oxidation resistance of Cu(111)
authors: Su Jae KimYong In KimSe-Young Jeong
description: The fabrication of copper thin films with ultraflat surfaces and only occasional mono-atomic steps, which show semi-permanent resistance to oxidation over long periods, is reported and the mechanism explained using first-principles calculations.

heading: Bacterial inhibition of Fas-mediated killing promotes neuroinvasion and persistence
description: Studies in a mouse model of neurolisteriosis show that the effector protein InlB produced by Listeria monocytogenes protects infected monocytes in the host from T cell-mediated cell death, and thereby increases bacterial neuroinvasion, persistence and transmission.

heading: Frontal neurons driving competitive behaviour and ecology of social groups
authors: S. William LiOmer ZeligerZiv M. Williams
description: Wireless tracking of neuronal activity in social groups of mice identifies neurons in the anterior cingulate that hold representations of an animal’s social rank and can influence the competitive effort that the animal exerts.

heading: Wind dispersal of battery-free wireless devices
description: A dandelion-inspired wireless solar-powered sensing device weighing 30 milligrams that transmits data through radio backscatter achieves dispersal over a wide area by travelling on the breeze, and successfully lands upright.

heading: Stability-limiting heterointerfaces of perovskite photovoltaics
description: Surface treatments for the passivation of defects in perovskite solar cells have a detrimental side effect that limits the maximum stability improvement.

heading: AGN as potential factories for eccentric black hole mergers
description: The accretion disk environments surrounding active galactic nuclei are potential locations where there is an excess of eccentric mergers of large black holes, which have different spin–orbit tilts compared with circular mergers.

heading: Aquaculture will continue to depend more on land than sea
Electron-catalysed molecular recognition
description: A simple and versatile strategy is established to facilitate molecular recognition by extending electron catalysis for use in supramolecular non-covalent chemistry.

heading: Weak cubic CaSiO3 perovskite in the Earth’s mantle
description: At temperatures and pressures typical of the Earth’s lower mantle, cubic CaSiO3 perovskite is found to have lower strength and viscosity compared to bridgmanite and ferropericlase, providing clues to its role in subduction regions.

heading: A non-canonical tricarboxylic acid cycle underlies cellular identity
authors: Paige K. ArnoldBenjamin T. JacksonLydia W. S. Finley
description: A non-canonical tricarboxylic acid cycle is required for changes in cell state.

heading: Tryptophan depletion results in tryptophan-to-phenylalanine substitutants
description: Tryptophan depletion, which occurs in tumours, results in in-frame translation across tryptophan-encoding codons by phenylalanine substitution.

heading: Ribosome collisions induce mRNA cleavage and ribosome rescue in bacteria
description: In bacteria, a newly identified endonuclease activated by ribosome collisions truncates mRNA to trigger rescue of stalled ribosomes.

heading: Bacterial ribosome collision sensing by a MutS DNA repair ATPase paralogue
authors: Federico CerulloSebastian FilbeckClaudio A. P. Joazeiro
description: Bacterial MutS2, a paralogue of the DNA mismatch-repair protein MutS, is found to bind collided ribosomes and function in translational quality control.

heading: The evolution, evolvability and engineering of gene regulatory DNA
authors: Eeshit Dhaval VaishnavCarl G. de BoerAviv Regev
description: A framework for studying and engineering gene regulatory DNA sequences, based on deep neural sequence-to-expression models trained on large-scale libraries of random DNA, provides insight into the evolution, evolvability and fitness landscapes of regulatory DNA.

heading: Cortical processing of flexible and context-dependent sensorimotor sequences
description: A sequence licking task reveals a set of key cortical regions for the coding of movement sequences in mice.

heading: Regulation of liver subcellular architecture controls metabolic homeostasis
authors: Güneş ParlakgülAna Paula ArrudaGökhan S. Hotamışlıgil
description: Detailed reconstruction using enhanced focused ion beam scanning electron microscopy imaging and deep-learning-based automated segmentation demonstrates that hepatocyte subcellular organelle architecture regulates metabolism.

heading: Discovery of a Ni2+-dependent guanidine hydrolase in bacteria
description: A bacterial enzyme is characterized and demonstrated to have Ni2+-dependent activity and high specificity for free guanidine enabling the bacteria to use guanidine as the sole nitrogen source for growth.

heading: Methane formation driven by reactive oxygen species across all living organisms
description: Methane formation by a ROS-mediated process is linked to metabolic activity and is identified as a conserved feature across living systems.

heading: Restoring and attributing ancient texts using deep neural networks
description: Ithaca—a deep neural network for textual restoration, geographical attribution and dating of ancient Greek inscriptions—collaboratively aids historians’ study of damaged texts.

heading: Structure of the moiré exciton captured by imaging its electron and hole
description: Imaging the electron and hole that bind to form interlayer excitons in a 2D moiré material enables direct measurement of its diameter and indicates the localization of its centre of mass.

heading: A large-scale microelectromechanical-systems-based silicon photonics LiDAR
description: A large focal plane switch array is constructed to steer the laser beam of a LiDAR system, leading to 3D imaging with 16,384 pixels, improving the resolution and coverage of solid-state LiDARs.

heading: Ultra-narrow optical linewidths in rare-earth molecular crystals
description: A study reports europium molecular crystals with optically addressable spin states that exhibit ultra-narrow linewidths, demonstrating the use of rare-earth molecular crystals as a platform for photonic quantum technologies.

heading: Vertical MoS2 transistors with sub-1-nm gate lengths
description: Ultra-scaled transistors based on two-dimensional MoS2 with physical gate lengths of 0.34 nm are reported, which show relatively good electrical characteristics and can be switched off.

heading: Birds can transition between stable and unstable states via wing morphing
authors: C. HarveyV. B. BaligaD. J. Inman
description: Analysis of inertial characteristics across 22 bird species shows that evolution has selected for avian manoeuvrability using both stable and unstable flight dynamics.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 is associated with changes in brain structure in UK Biobank
description: After infection with SARS-CoV-2, individuals show a greater reduction in grey matter thickness and tissue contrast in the orbitofrontal cortex and parahippocampal gyrus; greater changes in markers of tissue damage in regions that are functionally connected to the primary olfactory cortex; and a greater reduction in global brain size.

heading: Whole-genome sequencing reveals host factors underlying critical COVID-19
description: Whole-genome sequencing, transcriptome-wide association and fine-mapping analyses in over 7,000 individuals with critical COVID-19 are used to identify 16 independent variants that are associated with severe illness in COVID-19.

heading: Antibody evasion properties of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron sublineages
description: A study reports on the antigenic characterization of SARS-CoV-2 BA.1, BA.1.1 and BA.2 and the neutralizing activity of different monoclonal antibodies and sera against them.

heading: Biocatalytic oxidative cross-coupling reactions for biaryl bond formation
authors: Lara E. ZetzscheJessica A. YazariansAlison R. H. Narayan
description: A study presents a biocatalytic method for the formation of sterically hindered biaryl bonds, providing a tunable approach for assembling molecules with catalyst-controlled reactivity, site selectivity and atroposelectivity.

heading: Silent mutations reveal therapeutic vulnerability in RAS Q61 cancers
description: A translationally silent KRASG60G mutation, preventing the formation of a cryptic splice donor site and  enabling expression of KRAS(Q61K), reveals a vulnerability in RASQ61 cancers that are therapeutically exploitable in a mutant-selective manner.

heading: Structural basis for mismatch surveillance by CRISPR–Cas9
authors: Jack P. K. BravoMu-Sen LiuDavid W. Taylor
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of Cas9 during mismatch cleavage provide insight into the mechanisms that control off-target effects of Cas9, which will aid in the future design of high-fidelity Cas9 variants with reduced off-target cleavage.

heading: High-density switchable skyrmion-like polar nanodomains integrated on silicon
description: Two types of skyrmion-like polar nanodomain are observed in oxide bilayers transferred onto silicon, and these nanodomains, with distinct resistive behaviour, can be converted to each other under an external electric field.

heading: Structure determination of high-energy states in a dynamic protein ensemble
description: Combining NMR spectroscopy-derived pseudocontact shifts (PCSs) with Carr–Purcell–Meiboom–Gill (CPMG) relaxation dispersion enables protein structure determination of lowly populated high-energy states that are essential for macromolecular function.

heading: Molecular hallmarks of heterochronic parabiosis at single-cell resolution
description: A transcriptomics study demonstrates cell-type-specific responses to differentially aged blood and shows young blood to have restorative and rejuvenating effects that may be invoked through enhanced mitochondrial function.

heading: A persistent ultraviolet outflow from an accreting neutron star binary transient
description: A persistent, blue-shifted absorption feature is reported in time-resolved UV spectroscopy of the neutron star binary Swift J1858.6-0814, revealing a warm, moderately ionized component in the accretion disk that is wind driven from this system.

heading: Innovative ochre processing and tool use in China 40,000 years ago
description: A cultural assembly of traits at a 40,000-year-old archaeological site at Xiamabei, China supports a model of repeated early human expansions, cultural exchange and innovation in east Asia.

heading: Knowledge about others reduces one’s own sense of anonymity
description: When people learn more about a stranger, they think a stranger knows more about them, and when tested in a field experiment, this shifted residents’ perceptions of police officers’ knowledge of illegal activity.

heading: Imaging of isotope diffusion using atomic-scale vibrational spectroscopy
description: Vibrational electron energy-loss spectroscopy is used to distinguish two stable isotopes of carbon and to monitor their diffusion with subnanometre spatial resolution.

heading: Establishment of fetomaternal tolerance through glycan-mediated B cell suppression
description: Pathways of glycan-mediated B cell suppression during pregnancy are important for promoting fetomaternal tolerance.

heading: A wet heterogeneous mantle creates a habitable world in the Hadean
description: A hydrated, heterogeneous mantle resulting from magma ocean solidification is shown to be key to the rapid formation of Earth’s habitable surface environment during the Hadean era.

heading: Recovery time of a plasma-wakefield accelerator
description: Relaxation of a perturbed plasma back to its initial state over nanosecond timescales establishes that megahertz repetition rates are supported, and high luminosities and brilliances are in principle attainable with plasma-wakefield accelerator facilities.

heading: Overcoming universal restrictions on metal selectivity by protein design
description: An alternative approach to metalloprotein design shows that it is possible to overcome the restrictions of the Irving–Williams series and achieve both flexibility and specificity in the binding of metal ions.

heading: FSH blockade improves cognition in mice with Alzheimer’s disease
description: Follicle-stimulating hormone acts directly on hippocampal and cortical neurons to accelerate amyloid-β and Tau deposition and impair cognition in mice displaying features of Alzheimer’s disease.

heading: Molecular basis of receptor binding and antibody neutralization of Omicron
description: The structures of the open and closed states of the Omicron spike protein and its complex with the ACE2 receptor or a broadly neutralizing antibody are resolved and shed light on the receptor engagement and antibody neutralization of Omicron.

heading: A repeating fast radio burst source in a globular cluster
description: The fast radio burst FRB 20200120E is shown to originate from a globular cluster in the galaxy M81, and may be a collapsed white dwarf or a merged compact binary star system.

heading: A biophysical account of multiplication by a single neuron
authors: Lukas N. GroschnerJonatan G. MalisAlexander Borst
description: Release from shunting inhibition and coincident excitation implement a multiplication-like synaptic interaction in motion-sensing neurons of Drosophila melanogaster.

heading: Ancient DNA and deep population structure in sub-Saharan African foragers
authors: Mark LipsonElizabeth A. SawchukMary E. Prendergast
description: DNA analysis of 6 individuals from eastern and south-central Africa spanning the past approximately 18,000 years, and of 28 previously published ancient individuals, provides genetic evidence supporting hypotheses of increasing regionalization at the end of the Pleistocene.

heading: Free-standing homochiral 2D monolayers by exfoliation of molecular crystals
description: Sonication of layered metallacycle crystals gives free-standing nanosheets held together by weak non-covalent interactions, with chiral surfaces that show improved binding and enantiodiscrimination compared with individual metallacycle molecules.

heading: Quantum sensing for gravity cartography
description: A study reports a quantum gravity gradient sensor with a design that eliminates the need for long measurement times, and demonstrates the detection of an underground tunnel in an urban environment.

heading: TDP-43 loss and ALS-risk SNPs drive mis-splicing and depletion of UNC13A
description: Risk variants for ALS and FTD in the synaptic gene UNC13A increase the expression of an UNC13A cryptic exon in neurons with TDP-43 depletion.

heading: Emergent constraints on future precipitation changes
description: Model simulations show that the historical relationship between global temperature and precipitation under a medium greenhouse gas concentration scenario lowers the projected high end of future precipitation change.

heading: TDP-43 represses cryptic exon inclusion in the FTD–ALS gene UNC13A
authors: X. Rosa MaMercedes PrudencioAaron D. Gitler
description: TDP-43 controls an exon splicing event in UNC13A that results in the inclusion of a cryptic exon associated with frontotemporal dementia and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.

heading: Low-dose metformin targets the lysosomal AMPK pathway through PEN2
description: The molecular target of the antidiabetic medicine metformin is identified as PEN2, a subunit of γ-secretases, and the PEN2–ATP6AP1 axis offers potential targets for screening for metformin substitutes.

heading: A trispecific antibody targeting HER2 and T cells inhibits breast cancer growth via CD4 cells
description: A trispecific antibody targeting HER2 and T cells stimulates CD4 T cell-dependent inhibition of of breast cancer cell proliferation in vitro and tumor regression in a humanized mouse model.

heading: The lung microbiome regulates brain autoimmunity
description: Work in experimental autoimmune models shows that the lung microbiome is linked to immune reactivity in the brain through a mechanism in which the balance of pulmonary microorganisms regulates the activation state of microglia.

heading: The Mesozoic terminated in boreal spring
authors: Melanie A. D. DuringJan SmitJeroen H. J. L. van der Lubbe
description: Examination of fish that died on the day the Mesozoic ended reveal that the impact that caused the Cretaceous–Palaeogene mass extinction occurred during boreal spring.

heading: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease
authors: Benjamin B. SunMitja I. KurkiHeiko Runz
description: A meta-analysis combining whole-exome sequencing data from UK Biobank participants and imputed genotypes from FinnGen participants enables identification of genetic associations with human disease in the rare and low-frequency allelic spectrum

heading: Evidence for a single-layer van der Waals multiferroic
description: Multiple complementary optical signatures confirm the persistence of ferroelectricity and inversion-symmetry-breaking magnetic order down to monolayer NiI2, introducing the physics of type-II multiferroics into the area of van der Waals materials.

heading: A global timing mechanism regulates cell-type-specific wiring programmes
description: Integration of a global temporal transcriptional module with cell-type-specific transcription factors influences neuronal wiring in the fly visual system.

heading: Effective drug combinations in breast, colon and pancreatic cancer cells
authors: Patricia JaaksElizabeth A. CokerMathew J. Garnett
description: A survey of potency and efficacy of 2,025 clinically relevant two-drug combinations against 125 molecularly characterized breast, colorectal and pancreatic cancer cell lines identifies rare synergistic effects of anticancer drugs, informing rational combination treatments for specific cancer subtypes.

heading: Observed poleward freshwater transport since 1970
authors: Taimoor SohailJan D. ZikaJohn A. Church
description: A study uses a temperature-percentile water mass framework to analyse warm-to-cold poleward transport of freshwater in the Earth system, and establishes a constraint to help address biases in climate models.

heading: Hyperbolic shear polaritons in low-symmetry crystals
description: Shear phenomena in the infrared dielectric response of a monoclinic crystal are shown to unveil a new polariton class termed hyperbolic shear polariton that can emerge in any low-symmetry monoclinic or triclinic system.

heading: The bacterial toxin colibactin triggers prophage induction
authors: Justin E. SilpeJoel W. H. WongEmily P. Balskus
description: The bacterial genotoxin colibactin triggers prophage-mediated lysis of neighbouring bacteria, a finding that provides insight into the dynamics of microbial communities and relationships between bacterial metabolite production and phage behaviour.

heading: Electrochemically driven cross-electrophile coupling of alkyl halides
description: An electrochemical method is used to couple together two alkyl halides, enabling efficient cross-electrophile coupling of a variety of alkyl electrophiles with improved chemoselectivity compared with existing methods.

heading: Nuclear spin-wave quantum register for a solid-state qubit
description: Via spin-exchange interactions with 51V5+ ions, an optically addressed 171Yb3+ qubit in a nuclear-spin-rich yttrium orthovanadate crystal is used to implement a reproducible nuclear-spin-based quantum memory, and entangled Yb–V Bell states are demonstrated.

heading: Determinants of emissions pathways in the coupled climate–social system
description: A stylized model of the climate–social system could help to understand policy and emissions futures.

heading: Scaling of the strange-metal scattering in unconventional superconductors
description: Precise quantitative scaling laws are observed between the normalized T-linear coefficient and Tc among copper oxides, pnictides and a class of organic superconductors, suggesting a common underlying physics at work in these unconventional superconductors.

heading: Twin study reveals non-heritable immune perturbations in multiple sclerosis
description: In monozygotic twins discordant for multiple sclerosis, the influence of genetic predisposition and environmental factors is determined using matched-pair analyses.

heading: Mechanism-based traps enable protease and hydrolase substrate discovery
authors: Shan TangAdam T. BeattieJason W. Chin
description: Light-activated trapping is used in a mechanism-based assay to capture and identify substrates of protein hydrolases.

heading: Bat coronaviruses related to SARS-CoV-2 and infectious for human cells
description: A study reports the detection and characterization of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in Laotian cave-dwelling bats that are also demonstrated to infect human cells through the ACE2 pathway.

heading: Differential mechanisms underlie trace and delay conditioning in Drosophila
description: Trace and delay conditioning experiments in Drosophila reveal the different neurons and signalling mechanisms that underlie this behaviour and highlight similarities with observations of learning experiences in mammals.

heading: Structure and receptor recognition by the Lassa virus spike complex
description: The structure of the complete native spike complex of Lassa virus reveals its membrane topology and the matriglycan-depended recognition of its α-dystroglycan cellular receptor.

heading: Hydrogen trapping and embrittlement in high-strength Al alloys
description: Atom-scale analysis of hydrogen and other elements at the grain boundaries of a 7xxx aluminium alloy shows that co-segregation of elements favours grain boundary decohesion, and that hydrogen embrittlement is prevented by strong partitioning into the second-phase particles.

heading: Visualizing protein breathing motions associated with aromatic ring flipping
authors: Laura Mariño PérezFrancesco S. IelasiMalene Ringkjøbing Jensen
description: Nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy and X-ray crystallography capture how aromatic side chains can flip within the core of a protein via the generation of a local void volume.

heading: Warming weakens the night-time barrier to global fire
authors: Jennifer K. BalchJohn T. AbatzoglouA. Park Williams
description: An analysis of satellite observations and climate data shows that night-time fire intensity has increased over the past two decades owing to hotter and drier nights under anthropogenic climate change.

heading: Magnetic control of tokamak plasmas through deep reinforcement learning
description: A newly designed control architecture uses deep reinforcement learning to learn to command the coils of a tokamak, and successfully stabilizes a wide variety of fusion plasma configurations.

heading: Differential clock comparisons with a multiplexed optical lattice clock
description: Multiple ultracold ensembles of strontium atoms are trapped in the same optical lattice, realizing a multiplexed optical clock where precision measurements can benefit from having all atoms share the same trapping light and clock laser.

heading: Resolving the gravitational redshift across a millimetre-scale atomic sample
description: Reducing the fractional uncertainty over the measurement of the frequency of an ensemble of trapped strontium atoms enables observation of the gravitational redshift at the submillimetre scale.

heading: Thermal imaging of dust hiding the black hole in NGC 1068
authors: Violeta Gámez RosasJacob W. IsbellGerard Zins
description: Mid-infrared observations of the dusty structures of the galaxy NGC 1068 support the unified model of active galactic nuclei.

heading: Germinal centre-driven maturation of B cell response to mRNA vaccination
authors: Wooseob KimJulian Q. ZhouAli H. Ellebedy
description: Sequencing of B cell receptors and expression of the corresponding monoclonal antibodies is used to characterize the evolution of the long-term B cell response to SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination.

heading: Synthesis of chiral sulfinate esters by asymmetric condensation
authors: Xin ZhangEsther Cai Xia AngChoon-Hong Tan
description: A synthetic strategy for the stereoselective preparation of sulfinate esters and related sulfur stereogenic centres via asymmetric condensation expands the drug discovery toolbox for these compounds.

heading: A human brain vascular atlas reveals diverse mediators of Alzheimer’s risk
authors: Andrew C. YangRyan T. VestTony Wyss-Coray
description: A method called vessel isolation and nuclei extraction for sequencing (VINE-seq) produces a molecular map of vascular and perivascular cell types in the human brain and reveals their contributions to Alzheimer’s disease risk.

heading: A gut-derived metabolite alters brain activity and anxiety behaviour in mice
authors: Brittany D. NeedhamMasanori FunabashiSarkis K. Mazmanian
description: The gut-derived molecule 4-ethylphenol influences complex behaviours in mice through effects on oligodendrocyte function and myelin patterning in the brain.

heading: Single-cell dissection of the human brain vasculature
description: A study describes single-cell characterization of the human cerebrovasculature, revealing human-specific transcriptomic signatures and providing insights into transcriptional changes associated with Huntington’s disease.

heading: Moving bar of light evokes vectorial spatial selectivity in the immobile rat hippocampus
authors: Chinmay S. PurandareShonali DhingraMayank R. Mehta
description: In response to visual stimuli, hippocampal neurons in a body-fixed rat can respond to and encode visual information without locomotion or task demand, similar to the visual cortex.

heading: Superionic iron alloys and their seismic velocities in Earth’s inner core
description: Molecular dynamics simulations show that the light elements hydrogen, oxygen and carbon become highly diffusive like liquid in solid iron under the inner-core conditions, leading to a reduction in the seismic velocities.

heading: Ferroelectric incommensurate spin crystals
authors: Dorin RusuJonathan J. P. PetersMarin Alexe
description: Analysing the structure of a PbTiO3 epitaxial layer sandwiched between SrRuO3 electrodes led to observation of a topology with two periodic modulations that form an incommensurate polar crystal, providing an analogue to incommensurate spin crystals.

heading: A white dwarf accreting planetary material determined from X-ray observations
description: An X-ray source is detected at the expected position of the white dwarf star G29–38, which enables the calculation of the accretion rate of planetary material without using stellar atmosphere models.

heading: Genome-edited powdery mildew resistance in wheat without growth penalties
description: Tamlo-R32, an engineered wheat mutant allele of the Mildew resistance locus O (MLO) gene, confers resistance to powdery mildew, retains robust wheat growth, and can be transferred to other agriculturally important wheat varieties.

heading: Outracing champion Gran Turismo drivers with deep reinforcement learning
description: Using the game Gran Turismo, an agent was trained with a combination of deep reinforcement learning algorithms and specialized training scenarios, demonstrating success against championship-level human racers.

heading: Mechanisms of inhibition and activation of extrasynaptic αβ GABAA receptors
authors: Vikram Babu KasaragodMartin MortensenPaul S. Miller
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures are used to identify mechanisms underlying distinct features of extrasynaptic type A γ-aminobutyric acid receptors.

heading: A backbone-centred energy function of neural networks for protein design
description: Modelling by SCUBA of the backbone-centred energy surface extends the diversity of designable proteins.

heading: Mapping clustered mutations in cancer reveals APOBEC3 mutagenesis of ecDNA
authors: Erik N. BergstromJens LuebeckLudmil B. Alexandrov
description: An analysis of clustered substitutions and indels across 30 cancer types provides insight into the role of APOBEC3 in giving rise to clustered mutation events through its activity on extrachromosomal DNA.

heading: Time-reversal symmetry-breaking charge order in a kagome superconductor
description: An investigation of muon spin relaxation shows time-reversal symmetry-breaking charge order, intertwined with correlated superconductivity, due to orbital currents in the kagome superconductor KV3Sb5.

heading: Glioblastoma mutations alter EGFR dimer structure to prevent ligand bias
authors: Chun HuCarlos A. Leche IIMark A. Lemmon
description: Extracellular glioblastoma-associated mutations reduce the ability of the epidermal growth factor receptor to distinguish between its ligands.

heading: Real-space visualization of intrinsic magnetic fields of an antiferromagnet
description: Real-space visualization of the magnetic fields in antiferromagnetic haematite is achieved using atomic-resolution differential phase contrast scanning transmission electron microscopy in a magnetic-field-free environment.

heading: Signatures of TOP1 transcription-associated mutagenesis in cancer and germline
authors: Martin A. M. ReijnsDavid A. ParryAndrew P. Jackson
description: Defective ribonucleotide excision repair causes ID4, an indel cancer signature characterized by deletions of 2–5 base pairs.

heading: A nutrient-specific gut hormone arbitrates between courtship and feeding
authors: Hui-Hao LinMeihua Christina KuangJing W. Wang
description: Diuretic hormone 31 secreted by the gut in response to feeding on protein-rich food excites brain neurons that promote switching from feeding to mating behaviour in Drosophila.

heading: Evidence for the association of triatomic molecules in ultracold 23Na40K + 40K mixtures
description: Evidence is presented for the association of triatomic molecules near the Feshbach resonance in an ultracold gas comprising a mixture of 23Na40K molecules and 40K atoms, along with an estimation of the binding energy of the triatomic molecules.

heading: Early prediction of preeclampsia in pregnancy with cell-free RNA
authors: Mira N. MoufarrejSevahn K. VorperianStephen R. Quake
description: Analyses of circulating cell-free RNA (cfRNA) in blood samples from pregnant mothers identify changes in gene expression that could be used in liquid biopsy tests to identify and monitor individuals who are at risk of preeclampsia.

heading: A highly distorted ultraelastic chemically complex Elinvar alloy
authors: Q. F. HeJ. G. WangY. Yang
description: A chemically complex alloy that exhibits a high elastic strain limit and low internal friction is described; it also has an Elinvar effect (invariant elastic modulus) over a large temperature range, up to 627 °C.

heading: Charge-density-wave-driven electronic nematicity in a kagome superconductor
description: Charge-density-wave-driven electronic nematicity that occurs well below the charge-density-wave transition temperature is reported in the kagome superconductor CsV3Sb5.

heading: A discrete neuronal population coordinates brain-wide developmental activity
authors: Bryce T. BajarNguyen T. PhiOrkun Akin
description: Developmental activity in transient receptor potential gamma-expressing neurons controls global brain activity and synapse structure in the developing Drosophila brain.

heading: Automated iterative Csp3–C bond formation
authors: Daniel J. BlairSriyankari ChittiMartin D. Burke
description: Identification of a hyperstable boronate enables automated lego-like synthesis to access a wider range of three-dimensionally complex small organic molecules rich in Csp3–C bonds.

heading: Pyrimidine inhibitors synergize with nucleoside analogues to block SARS-CoV-2
authors: David C. SchultzRobert M. JohnsonSara Cherry
description: A combination of pyrimidine biosynthesis inhibitors and antiviral nucleoside analogues can boost the antiviral effect of nucleoside analogues against SARS-CoV-2.

heading: GD2-CAR T cell therapy for H3K27M-mutated diffuse midline gliomas
description: A phase I dose-escalation trial of GD2-CAR T cells in children and young adults with diffuse midline gliomas to assess the feasibility of manufacturing, safety and tolerability, and to preliminarily assess efficacy.

heading: ACE2 binding is an ancestral and evolvable trait of sarbecoviruses
authors: Tyler N. StarrSamantha K. ZepedaJesse D. Bloom
description: ACE2 binding is an ancestral, widespread trait of sarbecovirus receptor-binding domains, and many single mutations enable binding to different ACE2 receptors.

heading: Structure of the NLRP3 decamer bound to the cytokine release inhibitor CRID3
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of human NLRP3 in its resting state and bound to the inhibitor CRID3 provide insight into the binding mechanism of CRID3 and its mode of antagonism.

heading: No freshwater-filled glacial Arctic Ocean
authors: Robert F. SpielhagenJan C. ScholtenAnton Eisenhauer

heading: Reply to: No freshwater-filled glacial Arctic Ocean
Reply to: Rainfall an unlikely factor in Kīlauea’s 2018 rift eruption
Rainfall an unlikely factor in Kīlauea’s 2018 rift eruption
authors: Michael P. PolandShaul HurwitzChristina A. Neal

heading: Search for magnetic monopoles produced via the Schwinger mechanism
description: At the Large Hadron Collider, the MoEDAL experiment shows no evidence for magnetic monopoles generated via the Schwinger mechanism at integer Dirac charges below 3, and suggests a lower mass limit of 75 GeV/c2.

heading: Structure of a B12-dependent radical SAM enzyme in carbapenem biosynthesis
authors: Hayley L. KnoxErica K. SinnerSquire J. Booker
description: X-ray crystal structures of TokK, a cobalamin- or B12-dependent radical SAM methylase, provide insight into how these enzymes use sequential radical-mediated methylations to assemble the C6 side chain of carbapenem antibiotics.

heading: Irreversible synthesis of an ultrastrong two-dimensional polymeric material
description: The solution-phase irreversible synthesis of a two-dimensional polymer with excellent elastic modulus and yield strength is reported.

heading: Fluctuation-induced quantum friction in nanoscale water flows
description: The quantum contribution to friction enables the rationalization of the peculiar friction properties of water on carbon surfaces, and in particular the radius dependence of slippage in carbon nanotubes.

heading: Decade-long leukaemia remissions with persistence of CD4+ CAR T cells
authors: J. Joseph MelenhorstGregory M. ChenCarl H. June
description: Infusion of CD19-directed chimeric antigen receptor T cells into two patients with chronic lymphocytic leukaemia resulted in complete tumour remission and persistence of the infused cells more than ten years later.

heading: Crystallographic snapshots of a B12-dependent radical SAM methyltransferase
description: Structural and spectroscopic studies show how a B12-dependent radical SAM enzyme catalyses unique and challenging alkylation chemistry, including protein post-translational modification required for methane biosynthesis.

heading: Microwave background temperature at a redshift of 6.34 from H2O absorption
description: Measurement of the cosmic microwave background temperature using H2O absorption at a redshift of 6.34 is reported, the results of which were consistent with those from standard ΛCDM cosmology.

heading: Polarized phonons carry angular momentum in ultrafast demagnetization
description: Ultrafast electron diffraction is used here to reveal in nickel an almost instantaneous, long-lasting population of anisotropic phonons with angular momentum.

heading: Autism genes converge on asynchronous development of shared neuron classes
description: Haploinsufficiency in three genes associated with risk of autism spectrum disorder—KMT5B, ARID1B and CHD8—in cell lines from multiple donors results in cell-type-specific asynchronous development of GABAergic neurons and cortical deep-layer excitatory projection neurons.

heading: Streptococcal pyrogenic exotoxin B cleaves GSDMA and triggers pyroptosis
description: The Streptococcus pyogenes virulence factor SpeB triggers pyroptosis in keratinocytes by catalysing cleavage of host gasdermin A, a key event triggering the immune response to S. pyogenes infection.

heading: Domain-wall dynamics in Bose–Einstein condensates with synthetic gauge fields
description: The creation of density-dependent gauge fields in an ultracold atomic system is described, leading to formation of domain walls that behave as elementary excitations and respond to electric fields, enabling a path to simulating gauge physics.

heading: Attenuated fusogenicity and pathogenicity of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron variant
description: In vitro studies in human cell lines and in vivo studies in a hamster model show that the SARS-CoV-2 Omicron variant is less pathogenic than both the Delta variant and an ancestral strain of SARS-CoV-2.

heading: Altered TMPRSS2 usage by SARS-CoV-2 Omicron impacts infectivity and fusogenicity
description: The spike protein of the Omicron variant of SARS-CoV-2 has a higher affinity for ACE2 than Delta, and a marked change in its antigenicity increases Omicron’s evasion of therapeutic and vaccine-elicited neutralizing antibodies.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 Omicron variant replication in human bronchus and lung ex vivo
authors: Kenrie P. Y. HuiJohn C. W. HoMichael C. W. Chan
description: Omicron replicates faster than the wild-type, D614G, Alpha, Beta and Delta SARS-CoV-2 variants in the bronchi but less efficiently in the lung parenchyma.

heading: Vaccines elicit highly conserved cellular immunity to SARS-CoV-2 Omicron
description: Current vaccines induce broadly cross-reactive cellular immunity against SARS-CoV-2 variants, including Omicron, and provide protection against severe disease despite a substantially reduced neutralizing antibody response.

heading: T cell responses to SARS-CoV-2 spike cross-recognize Omicron
description: T cell responses to spike protein from the SARS-CoV-2 Omicron variant (B.1.1.529) are broadly similar to the responses to ancestral, Beta (B.1.351) and Delta (B.1.617.2) spike protein in vaccinated, infected and unvaccinated individuals.

heading: Memory B cell repertoire from triple vaccinees against diverse SARS-CoV-2 variants
description: Individual antibodies identified in the blood of people triple-vaccinated against SARS-CoV-2 predominantly bind spike protein and are highly effective at neutralizing SARS-CoV-2 variants, including Omicron (B.1.1.529).

The Living Planet Index does not measure abundance

heading: Emphasizing declining populations in the Living Planet Report
authors: Gopal MuraliGabriel Henrique de Oliveira CaetanoUri Roll

heading: Sensory representation and detection mechanisms of gut osmolality change
description: Vagal afferents innervating the hepatic portal area respond to changes in gut osmolality and regulate thirst and drinking behaviour in mice.

heading: Burning plasma achieved in inertial fusion
authors: A. B. ZylstraO. A. HurricaneG. B. Zimmerman
description: A burning plasma, a critical step towards self-sustaining fusion, is achieved at the US National Ignition Facility, with a subset of experiments demonstrating fusion self-heating beyond radiation and conduction losses.

heading: A radio transient with unusually slow periodic emission
description: Analysis of archival low-frequency radio data from the Murchison Widefield Array reveals a periodic transient with an unusual periodicity of 18.18 min, the source of which is localized to our Galaxy and could be an ultra-long-period magnetar.

heading: Cortical preparatory activity indexes learned motor memories
authors: Xulu SunDaniel J. O’SheaKrishna V. Shenoy
description: In rhesus monkeys, learning of a motor task is accompanied by uniform changes in preparatory activity in motor cortex that are orthogonal to the force-predictive neural state subspace.

heading: Unconventional spectral signature of Tc in a pure d-wave superconductor
description: A high-precision angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy (ARPES) study on the superconductor Bi2212 resolves the spectroscopic singularity associated with the superconducting transition temperature, and indicates that the transition is driven by phase fluctuations.

heading: Brahma safeguards canalization of cardiac mesoderm differentiation
authors: Swetansu K. HotaKavitha S. RaoBenoit G. Bruneau
description: The BAF chromatin-remodelling complex ATPase gene Brm safeguards cell identity during directed cardiogenesis of mouse embryonic stem cells.

heading: Centimetre-scale perovskite solar cells with fill factors of more than 86 per cent
description: Perovskite solar cells including charge transport material fabricated using a reverse-doping process have the highest certified efficiency for cells of 1-cm2 active area and the highest fill factor reported so far.

heading: Deep physical neural networks trained with backpropagation
authors: Logan G. WrightTatsuhiro OnoderaPeter L. McMahon
description: A hybrid algorithm that applies backpropagation is used to train layers of controllable physical systems to carry out calculations like deep neural networks, but accounting for real-world noise and imperfections.

heading: Petabase-scale sequence alignment catalyses viral discovery
description: Serratus, an open-source cloud-computing infrastructure, can be used to screen millions of nucleic acid sequencing libraries at the petabase scale, and has enabled many new RNA viruses to be identified efficiently.

heading: Emergent interface vibrational structure of oxide superlattices
authors: Eric R. HoglundDe-Liang BaoJames M. Howe
description: The vibrational states emerging at the interface in oxide superlattices are characterized theoretically and at atomic resolution, showing the impact of material length scales on structure and vibrational response.

heading: Quantum register of fermion pairs
description: Entangled pairs of fermionic atoms in an optical lattice array have long-lived motional coherence, and the motion of each pair results in a robust qubit, protected by exchange symmetry.

heading: Inhibiting the Leidenfrost effect above 1,000 °C for sustained thermal cooling
description: Structured thermal armours on the surface of a solid inhibit the Leidenfrost effect, even when heated to temperatures in excess of 1,000 °C, pointing the way towards new cooling strategies for high-temperature solids.

heading: Evolution of inner ear neuroanatomy of bats and implications for echolocation
authors: R. Benjamin SulserBruce D. PattersonZhe-Xi Luo
description: The presence of a variety of highly derived spiral ganglion structures of the inner ear is associated with diverse echolocation strategies in yangochiropteran bats and distinguishes them from Yinpterochiroptera.

heading: Clonally expanded B cells in multiple sclerosis bind EBV EBNA1 and GlialCAM
authors: Tobias V. LanzR. Camille BrewerWilliam H. Robinson
description: The identification of high-affinity molecular mimicry between the Epstein–Barr virus (EBV) transcription factor EBNA1 and the CNS protein GlialCAM provides a mechanistic link between multiple sclerosis and EBV.

heading: Attenuated replication and pathogenicity of SARS-CoV-2 B.1.1.529 Omicron
description: The replication and pathogenicity of the Omicron variant of SARS-CoV-2 is attenuated compared with the original strain and other variants.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 Omicron virus causes attenuated disease in mice and hamsters
description: A collaborative study demonstrates that, compared with previous SARS-CoV-2 variants, B.1.1.529 isolates cause less infection and disease in mice and hamsters, in agreement with preliminary data from studies in humans.

heading: Life histories of myeloproliferative neoplasms inferred from phylogenies
description: Whole-genome sequencing of 1,013 clonal haematopoietic colonies from myeloproliferative neoplasms of 12 individuals reveals haematopoietic phylogenies and indicates that driver mutations are acquired sequentially, starting early in life.

heading: Historical glacier change on Svalbard predicts doubling of mass loss by 2100
authors: Emily C. GeymanWard J. J. van PeltJack Kohler
description: Historical photographs, modern observations, and a simple space-for-time substitution approach predict that glacier mass loss from Svalbard is poised to double over the twenty-first century.

heading: Black-hole-triggered star formation in the dwarf galaxy Henize 2-10
description: Optical observations with a linear resolution of a few parsecs show that the outflow from the central black hole in the low-mass galaxy Henize 2-10 triggered a round of star formation.

heading: Topological triple phase transition in non-Hermitian Floquet quasicrystals
description: A triple phase transition, where changing a single parameter simultaneously gives rise to metal–insulator, topological and a parity–time symmetry-breaking phase transitions, is observed in non-Hermitian Floquet quasicrystals.

heading: Fast universal quantum gate above the fault-tolerance threshold in silicon
description: Single- and two-qubit gate fidelities above the fault-tolerance threshold for quantum computation are demonstrated in silicon quantum dots by fast electrical control using a micromagnet-induced gradient field and tunable coupling.

heading: Chemical crystallography by serial femtosecond X-ray diffraction
authors: Elyse A. SchriberDaniel W. PaleyJ. Nathan Hohman
description: Small-molecule serial femtosecond X-ray crystallography (smSFX) characterizes microcrystals by indexing sparse serial XFEL diffraction frames, with little sample preparation, without beam damage, and at room temperature and pressure.

heading: The cGAS–STING pathway drives type I IFN immunopathology in COVID-19
authors: Jeremy Di DomizioMuhammet F. GulenAndrea Ablasser
description: The cGAS–STING pathway has a central role in the pathogenesis of severe COVID-19 by driving the increase in type I interferons that occurs in the later stages of SARS-CoV-2 infection.

heading: Novel flight style and light wings boost flight performance of tiny beetles
authors: Sergey E. FarisenkovDmitry KolomenskiyAlexey A. Polilov
description: Three-dimensional reconstructions of morphology and flight mechanics of the beetle Paratuposa placentis reveal adaptations that enable extremely small insects to fly at speeds similar to those of much larger insects.

heading: Quantum logic with spin qubits crossing the surface code threshold
authors: Xiao XueMaximilian RussLieven M. K. Vandersypen
description: A spin-based quantum processor in silicon achieves single-qubit and two-qubit gate fidelities above 99.5% using gate-set tomography, exceeding the theoretical threshold required for fault-tolerant quantum computing.

heading: Global fine-scale changes in ambient NO2 during COVID-19 lockdowns
authors: Matthew J. CooperRandall V. MartinChris A. McLinden
description: The satellite instrument TROPOMI is used to assess ambient NO2 levels at approximately one-kilometre resolution across 215 cities worldwide during COVID-19 lockdowns, finding about 30% lower NO2 concentrations in countries with strict lockdowns.

heading: Precision tomography of a three-qubit donor quantum processor in silicon
description: Universal quantum logic operations with fidelity exceeding 99%, approaching the threshold of fault tolerance, are realized in a scalable silicon device comprising an electron and two phosphorus nuclei, and a fidelity of 92.5% is obtained for a three-qubit entangled state.

heading: Enantiomer-dependent immunological response to chiral nanoparticles
description: Nanoparticles with different chiralities have different in vitro and in vivo effects on the immune system, suggesting new ways of creating vaccine adjuvants.

heading: Ageing exacerbates ribosome pausing to disrupt cotranslational proteostasis
description: Ageing alters the kinetics of translation elongation in both Caenorhabditis elegans and Saccharomyces cerevisiae.

heading: Androgens increase excitatory neurogenic potential in human brain organoids
description: Experiments in cerebral organoids show that sex hormones have a role in regulating the number of excitatory neurons in the human neocortex, providing insight into the mechanistic basis of sex-related brain differences in humans.

heading: All-perovskite tandem solar cells with improved grain surface passivation
description: A certified efficiency of 26.4% in all-perovskite tandem solar cells, exceeding that of the best-performing single-junction perovskite solar cells, is achieved by control over surface defects in the Pb–Sn subcell.

heading: Au–Pd separation enhances bimetallic catalysis of alcohol oxidation
description: ‘Cooperative redox enhancement (CORE) effects, which arise through the coupling of oxidative dehydrogenation and oxygen reduction reactions, can lead to increased rates of reaction over spatially separated bimetallic heterogeneous catalysts.

heading: Star formation near the Sun is driven by expansion of the Local Bubble
description: Three-dimensional analysis of the solar neighbourhood shows that nearly all star-forming regions near the Sun lie on the surface of the Local Bubble, which was inflated by supernovae about 14 million years ago.

heading: Signatures of a strange metal in a bosonic system
description: Strange metallicity—in particular, resistance that is linear in temperature and magnetic field—is observed in a nanopatterned YBa2Cu3O7−δ bosonic system.

heading: Elastomeric electrolytes for high-energy solid-state lithium batteries
authors: Michael J. LeeJunghun HanSeung Woo Lee
description: An elastomeric solid-state electrolyte shows desirable mechanical properties and high electrochemical stability, and is used to demonstrate a high-energy solid-state lithium battery at ambient temperature.

heading: A WC/WO star exploding within an expanding carbon–oxygen–neon nebula
description: Observations of the supernova SN 2019hgp, identified about a day after its explosion, show that it occurred within a nebula of carbon, oxygen and neon, and was probably the explosion of a massive WC/WO star.

heading: Toroidal topology of population activity in grid cells
authors: Richard J. GardnerErik HermansenEdvard I. Moser
description: Simultaneous recordings from hundreds of grid cells in rats, combined with topological data analysis, show that network activity in grid cells resides on a toroidal manifold that is invariant across environments and brain states.

heading: Age of the oldest known Homo sapiens from eastern Africa
authors: Céline M. VidalChristine S. LaneClive Oppenheimer
description: Geochemical analyses correlating the stratum that overlies the sediments containing the Omo fossils with material from a volcanic eruption suggest that these fossils (the oldest known modern human fossils in eastern Africa) are over 200,000 years old.

heading: Air pollution exposure disparities across US population and income groups
description: Different racial/ethnic populations and income groups are found to have been exposed to different levels of air pollution in the USA during the years 2000 to 2016.

heading: Mutation bias reflects natural selection in Arabidopsis thaliana
description: Data on de novo mutations in Arabidopsis thaliana reveal that mutations do not occur randomly; instead, epigenome-associated mutation bias reduces the occurrence of deleterious mutations.

heading: A crossbar array of magnetoresistive memory devices for in-memory computing
description: A crossbar array of magnetic memory to execute analogue in-memory computing has been developed, and performs image classification and facial detection at low power.

heading: The effect of rainfall changes on economic production
description: A global assessment shows that increases in the number of wet days and extreme daily rainfall adversely affect economic growth, particularly in high-income nations and via the services and manufacturing sectors.

heading: Rapid epidemic expansion of the SARS-CoV-2 Omicron variant in southern Africa
description: The genomic profile and early transmission dynamics of the Omicron strain of SARS-CoV-2.

heading: Decoding gene regulation in the fly brain
description: A chromatin accessibility atlas of 240,919 cells in the adult and developing Drosophila brain reveals 95,000 enhancers, which are integrated in cell-type specific enhancer gene regulatory networks and decoded into combinations of functional transcription factor binding sites using deep learning.

heading: An early transition to magnetic supercriticality in star formation
description: An analysis of Zeeman measurements reveals that the reduction of magnetic flux relative to mass, which is necessary for star formation, seems to have occurred earlier than previously thought.

heading: Structural insights into inhibitor regulation of the DNA repair protein DNA-PKcs
authors: Shikang LiangSherine E. ThomasTom L. Blundell
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of DNA-dependent protein kinase catalytic subunit bound to ATPγS and four inhibitors (wortmannin, NU7441, AZD7648 and M3814) provide molecular details and insights useful for drug design.

heading: Emergence of methicillin resistance predates the clinical use of antibiotics
authors: Jesper LarsenClaire L. RaisenAnders R. Larsen
description: Methicillin-resistant strains of Staphylococcus aureus appeared in European hedgehogs in the pre-antibiotic era as a co-evolutionary adaptation to antibiotic-producing dermatophytes and have spread within the local hedgehog populations and between hedgehogs and secondary hosts.

heading: RNA profiles reveal signatures of future health and disease in pregnancy
description: Expression signatures from cell-free RNA of pregnant women can be used to reveal normal biology of pregnancy and predict development of pre-eclampsia.

heading: Depressed 660-km discontinuity caused by akimotoite–bridgmanite transition
description: X-ray diffraction experiments indicate that the depression of the Earth’s 660-kilometre seismic discontinuity beneath cold subduction zones is caused by a phase transition from akimotoite to bridgmanite, leading to slab stagnation.

heading: Behavioural immune landscapes of inflammation
description: High-dimensional datasets derived from time-resolved live imaging of leukocytes in mice were used to identify leukocyte identities and dynamic neutrophil states with high cellular resolution.

heading: A speech planning network for interactive language use
authors: Gregg A. CastellucciChristopher K. KovachMichael A. Long
description: Using intracranial electrocorticography and a series of motor tasks, a speech planning network that is central to natural language generation during social interaction is identified.

heading: A stellar stream remnant of a globular cluster below the metallicity floor
authors: Nicolas F. MartinKim A. VennAlessio Mucciarelli
description: Observations of a stellar stream below the metallicity floor for a disrupted globular cluster are described.

heading: A naturally inspired antibiotic to target multidrug-resistant pathogens
description: The discovery and synthesis of a colistin congener provide a promising clinical lead against mcr-1-encoding colistin-resistant pathogens, which are responsible for an increasing number of deaths from antibiotic-resistant infections.

heading: A 16-parts-per-trillion measurement of the antiproton-to-proton charge–mass ratio
authors: M. J. BorchertJ. A. DevlinS. Ulmer
description: Multiple high-precision measurement campaigns at CERN of the antiproton-to-proton charge-to-mass ratio—to a precision of 16 parts per trillion—in a cryogenic multi-Penning trap offer no evidence of charge–parity–time violation, and set stringent limits on the clock-weak-equivalence principle.

heading: Crystallization of bosonic quantum Hall states in a rotating quantum gas
description: Spontaneous crystallization of atoms occurs in a rotating ultracold Bose–Einstein condensate occupying the lowest Landau level, behaviour that is related to a quantum hydrodynamic instability driven by shear forces.

heading: Activity of convalescent and vaccine serum against SARS-CoV-2 Omicron
description: Sera from unvaccinated, vaccinated, and previously infected and vaccinated individuals show reduced neutralizing and spike protein-binding activity towards the Omicron (B.1.1.529) variant of SARS-CoV-2 compared to other variants.

heading: Omicron escapes the majority of existing SARS-CoV-2 neutralizing antibodies
description: A high-throughput yeast display platform is used to analyse the profiles of mutations in the SARS-CoV-2 receptor-binding domain (RBD) that enable escape from antibodies, and suggests that most anti-RBD antibodies can be escaped by the Omicron variant.

heading: Striking antibody evasion manifested by the Omicron variant of SARS-CoV-2
description: The B.1.1.529/Omicron variant of SARS-CoV-2 is resistant to neutralization by serum not only from patients who recovered from COVID-19, but also from individuals vaccinated with one of the four widely used COVID-19 vaccines.

heading: Time-resolved structural analysis of an RNA-cleaving DNA catalyst
description: Using high-resolution NMR characterization, the kinetics and dynamics of the catalytic function of a DNAzyme are shown.

heading: Evolution of enhanced innate immune evasion by SARS-CoV-2
authors: Lucy G. ThorneMehdi BouhaddouNevan J. Krogan
description: The SARS-CoV-2 Alpha variant suppresses innate immune responses more effectively than isolates of first-wave SARS-CoV-2, and this is a result of mutations outside of the spike coding region that lead to upregulation of viral innate immune antagonists.

heading: Broadly neutralizing antibodies overcome SARS-CoV-2 Omicron antigenic shift
description: Pseudovirus assays and surface plasmon resonance show that the Omicron receptor-binding domain binds to human ACE2 with increased affinity relative to the ancestral virus, and that most neutralizing antibodies are considerably less potent against Omicron.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 infection in free-ranging white-tailed deer
authors: Vanessa L. HalePatricia M. DennisAndrew S. Bowman
description: More than one-third of wild deer tested in northeast Ohio showed evidence of SARS-CoV-2 infection of human origin.

heading: Considerable escape of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron to antibody neutralization
description: An isolate of the Omicron variant of SARS-COV-2 was completely or partially resistant to neutralization by all nine clinically approved monoclonal antibodies tested.

heading: Omicron extensively but incompletely escapes Pfizer BNT162b2 neutralization
description: Plasma from individuals vaccinated with BNT162b2 exhibits 22-fold less neutralization capacity against Omicron (B.1.1.529) than against an ancestral SARS-CoV-2 strain but residual neutralization is maintained in those with high levels of neutralization of ancestral virus.

heading: Broadly neutralizing antibodies target a haemagglutinin anchor epitope
authors: Jenna J. GuthmillerJulianna HanPatrick C. Wilson
description: A distinct class of broadly neutralizing antibodies to the influenza virus target a membrane-proximal anchor epitope of the haemagglutinin stalk domain.

heading: Single-year radiocarbon dating anchors Viking Age trade cycles in time
description: Disturbances in the radiocarbon record anchor a precisely dated archaeological stratigraphy of a medieval trading emporium in Denmark in time, revealing that the Viking expansion was associated with competition for trade routes rather than with raids.

heading: MicroRNA sequence codes for small extracellular vesicle release and cellular retention
description: MicroRNAs encode sorting sequences that determine whether they are secreted in exosomal vesicles to regulate gene expression in distant cells or retained in cells that produced them, with different sequences used by individual cell types.

heading: A high-resolution picture of kinship practices in an Early Neolithic tomb
description: Archaeological and ancient DNA analyses of 35 individuals entombed at Hazleton North long cairn approximately 5,700 years ago are used to reconstruct kinship practices in Early Neolithic Britain.

heading: Local and systemic responses to SARS-CoV-2 infection in children and adults
authors: Masahiro YoshidaKaylee B. WorlockKerstin B. Meyer
description: Mechanisms explaining the milder clinical syndrome that is observed in children with SARS-CoV-2 infection.

heading: Targeting SWI/SNF ATPases in enhancer-addicted prostate cancer
description: PROTAC degrader–induced SWI/SNF inactivation abolishes DNA accessibility at enhancer elements of oncogenes and also tempers supra-physiologic expression of driver transcription factors, resulting in potent inhibition of tumour growth in mouse models.

heading: Spin splitting of dopant edge state in magnetic zigzag graphene nanoribbons
authors: Raymond E. BlackwellFangzhou ZhaoFelix R. Fischer
description: Decoupling spin-polarized edge states using substitutional N-atom dopants along the edges of a zigzag graphene nanoribbon (ZGNR) reveals giant spin splitting of a N-dopant edge state, and supports the predicted emergent magnetic order in ZGNRs.

heading: Valine tRNA levels and availability regulate complex I assembly in leukaemia
description: Restriction of dietary valine reduces growth of T cell acute lymphoblastic leukaemia through altered valine tRNA biogenesis and reduced translation of mRNAs that encode subunits of mitochondrial complex I.

heading: Integrated photonics enables continuous-beam electron phase modulation
authors: Jan-Wilke HenkeArslan Sajid RajaTobias J. Kippenberg
description: A silicon nitride microresonator is used for coherent phase modulation of a transmission electron microscope beam, with future applications in combining high-resolution microscopy with spectroscopy, holography and metrology.
