description: Mesoscale connectomic mapping of the cortico–basal ganglia–thalamic network reveals key architectural and information processing features.

heading: An atlas of cortical arealization identifies dynamic molecular signatures
description: RNA-sequencing analysis of the prenatal human brain at different stages of development shows that areal transcriptional signatures are dynamic and coexist with developmental and cell-type signatures.

heading: A transcriptomic and epigenomic cell atlas of the mouse primary motor cortex
description: The authors describe an integrated atlas of the diverse cell types in the mouse primary motor cortex.

heading: Metabolic modulation of tumours with engineered bacteria for immunotherapy
description: Injection of engineered bacteria that convert ammonia to l-arginine into tumours enhance the anti-tumour response in a mouse model and synergize with anti-PD-L1 treatment to clear tumours.

heading: Whole-cell organelle segmentation in volume electron microscopy
description: Focused ion beam scanning electron microscopy (FIB-SEM) combined with deep-learning-based segmentation is used to produce three-dimensional reconstructions of complete cells and tissues, in which up to 35 different organelle classes are annotated.

heading: A transcriptomic atlas of mouse cerebellar cortex comprehensively defines cell types
description: A comprehensive atlas of cell types and regional specializations in the mouse cerebellar cortex.

heading: Neurotoxic reactive astrocytes induce cell death via saturated lipids
authors: Kevin A. GuttenplanMaya K. WeigelBen A. Barres
description: Astrocytes can respond to diseases and injuries of the central nervous system by driving the death of neurons and mature oligodendrocytes through the delivery of long-chain saturated fatty acids contained in lipoparticles.

heading: DNA methylation atlas of the mouse brain at single-cell resolution
description: A comprehensive survey of the epigenome from 45 regions of the mouse cortex, hippocampus, striatum, pallidum and olfactory areas using single-nucleus DNA methylation sequencing enables identification of 161 cell clusters with distinct locations and projection targets and provides insights into the regulatory landscape underlying neuronal diversity and spatial regulation.

heading: Epigenomic diversity of cortical projection neurons in the mouse brain
description: Quantitative analysis of the methylation of mouse cortical neurons that project to different cortical and subcortical target regions provides insight into genetic mechanisms that contribute to differences in cell function.

heading: Single-cell epigenomics reveals mechanisms of human cortical development
authors: Ryan S. ZiffraChang N. KimTomasz J. Nowakowski
description: Analysis of chromatin state at a single-cell level in samples of developing human forebrain demonstrate both cell-type-specific and region-specific changes during neurogenesis.

heading: Cellular anatomy of the mouse primary motor cortex
description: Multi-modal analysis is used to generate a 3D atlas of the upper limb area of the mouse primary motor cortex, providing a framework for future studies of motor control circuitry.

heading: 5-HT modulation of a medial septal circuit tunes social memory stability
description: Experiments in mice identify the medial septum as an extrahippocampal input region that is critical for social memory formation, and show that modulation of the medial septum by serotonin regulates the stability of social memories.

heading: Thalamic circuits for independent control of prefrontal signal and noise
authors: Arghya MukherjeeNorman H. LamMichael M. Halassa
description: Two different cell types in the mediodorsal thalamus have complementary roles in decision-making, with one type of mediodorsal projection amplifying prefrontal activity under low signal levels and one type suppressing it under high noise levels.

heading: An open-access volume electron microscopy atlas of whole cells and tissues
authors: C. Shan XuSong PangHarald F. Hess
description: Open-access 3D images of whole cells and tissues with combined finer resolution and larger sample size are enabled by advances in focused ion beam-scanning electron microscopy.

heading: Isoform cell-type specificity in the mouse primary motor cortex
Hemispheric black carbon increase after the 13th-century Māori arrival in New Zealand
authors: Joseph R. McConnellNathan J. ChellmanAlberto J. Aristarain
description: Antarctic ice-core records and atmospheric transport modelling used here show that the 13th-century rise of Māori culture in New Zealand led to a threefold increase of atmospheric black carbon.

heading: Human neocortical expansion involves glutamatergic neuron diversification
authors: Jim BergStaci A. SorensenEd S. Lein
description: Combined patch clamp recording, biocytin staining and single-cell RNA-sequencing of human neurocortical neurons shows an expansion of glutamatergic neuron types relative to mouse that characterizes the greater complexity of the human neocortex.

heading: Quantum anomalous Hall octet driven by orbital magnetism in bilayer graphene
authors: Fabian R. GeisenhofFelix WintererR. Thomas Weitz
description: Bilayer graphene states are observed at anomalously small magnetic fields and show magnetic hysteresis, providing evidence for a quantum anomalous Hall effect driven by orbital magnetism.

heading: A multimodal cell census and atlas of the mammalian primary motor cortex
description: The BRAIN Initiative Cell Census Network has constructed a multimodal cell census and atlas of the mammalian primary motor cortex in a landmark effort towards understanding brain cell-type diversity, neural circuit organization and brain function.

heading: Spatially resolved cell atlas of the mouse primary motor cortex by MERFISH
description: As part of the BICCN consortium, the authors used a single-cell transcriptomic imaging method to produce a highly defined atlas of cell types across the mouse primary motor cortex.

heading: A pan-serotype dengue virus inhibitor targeting the NS3–NS4B interaction
authors: Suzanne J. F. KapteinOlivia GoethalsJohan Neyts
description: The small molecule JNJ-A07 interferes with the interaction between the NS3 and NS4B proteins of dengue virus and reduces the viral load in mice even when first administered at peak viraemia.

heading: An atlas of gene regulatory elements in adult mouse cerebrum
description: A comprehensive analysis of gene regulatory elements in 160 distinct cell types from the mouse cerebrum.

heading: Fine-regolith production on asteroids controlled by rock porosity
description: The absence of fine regolith on the asteroid Bennu is due to the high porosity of its rocks, which compress rather than fragment after impacts and exhibit slow thermal cracking.

heading: Colorimetric histology using plasmonically active microscope slides
description: Colour contrast is added to unstained histological samples by using surface plasmon polaritons whose properties depend on the sample’s dielectric constant.

heading: A single sulfatase is required to access colonic mucin by a gut bacterium
authors: Ana S. LuisChunsheng JinEric C. Martens
description: A single sulfatase produced by a bacterium found in the human colon is essential for degradation of sulfated O-glycans in secreted mucus.

heading: Fault-tolerant control of an error-corrected qubit
description: Fault-tolerant circuits for the control of a logical qubit encoded in 13 trapped ion qubits through a Bacon–Shor quantum error correction code are demonstrated.

heading: Regulation of prefrontal patterning and connectivity by retinoic acid
description: Studies in mice, humans and macaques show that retinoic acid signalling has an important role in the development of the prefrontal cortex (PFC) in primates and may also underlie the evolutionary diversification of the PFC.

heading: Hominini-specific regulation of CBLN2 increases prefrontal spinogenesis
description: The authors identify deletions in a retinoic acid signalling responsive genetic element that leads to disproportionate increase of dendritic spines on neurons of the human prefrontal cortex.

heading: Cascade of correlated electron states in the kagome superconductor CsV3Sb5
description: A study reveals a temperature-dependent cascade of different symmetry-broken electronic states in the kagome superconductor CsV3Sb5, and highlights intriguing parallels between vanadium-based kagome metals and materials exhibiting similar electronic phases.

heading: Skilful precipitation nowcasting using deep generative models of radar
description: A deep generative model using radar observations is used to create skilful precipitation predictions that are accurate and support real-world utility.

heading: Mercury stable isotopes constrain atmospheric sources to the ocean
description: Mercury deposition pathways from the atmosphere to the ocean remain uncertain, but mercury stable isotope measurements from the Atlantic and Mediterranean show that ocean uptake of gaseous elemental mercury is more important than previously thought.

heading: Non-Hermitian topological whispering gallery
description: An acoustic topological gallery insulator constructed from sonic crystals made of thermoplastic rods decorated with carbon nanotube films enables the out-coupling of amplified and focused sound at audible frequencies.

heading: The role of charge recombination to triplet excitons in organic solar cells
authors: Alexander J. GillettAlberto PriviteraRichard H. Friend
description: A substantial pathway for energy loss in organic solar cells may be suppressed by engineering hybridization between non-fullerene acceptor triplet excitons and spin-triplet charge transfer excitons.

heading: Mechanism for Cas4-assisted directional spacer acquisition in CRISPR–Cas
description: Structures of the Cas4–Cas1–Cas2 complex from Geobacter sulfurreducens show that a 3′-overhang in the protospacer adjacent motif is required for complex assembly and spacer insertion into the CRISPR array.

heading: Fine-root traits in the global spectrum of plant form and function
authors: Carlos P. CarmonaC. Guillermo BuenoRiin Tamme
description: The authors analyse the coordination and trade-off of the aboveground and fine-root traits of vascular plants using global trait databases.

heading: Structure-based classification of tauopathies
authors: Yang ShiWenjuan ZhangSjors H. W. Scheres
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of tau filaments from progressive supranuclear palsy and other tauopathies reveal new filament conformations, and suggest that tauopathies can be classified on several different levels according to their filament folds.

heading: Sensory processing during sleep in Drosophila melanogaster
authors: Alice S. FrenchQuentin GeissmannGiorgio F. Gilestro
description: The authors develop a paradigm to study sensory discrimination during sleep in Drosophila melanogaster.

heading: Extremely anisotropic van der Waals thermal conductors
description: Extremely anisotropic thermal conductors based on large-area van der Waals thin films with random interlayer rotations are reported here.

heading: The importance of lake breach floods for valley incision on early Mars
authors: Timothy A. GoudgeAlexander M. MorganCaleb I. Fassett
description: Lake breach flooding rapidly eroded almost a quarter of the volume of incised valleys on early Mars, influencing the topography of the wider Martian landscape.

heading: Imaging two-dimensional generalized Wigner crystals
description: So far, only indirect evidence of Wigner crystals has been reported, but a specially designed scanning tunnelling microscope is used here to directly image them in a moiré heterostructure.

heading: Blood and immune development in human fetal bone marrow and Down syndrome
description: A single-cell atlas of human fetal bone marrow in healthy fetuses and fetuses with Down syndrome provides insight into developmental haematopoiesis in humans and the transcription and functional differences that occur in Down syndrome.

heading: Roton pair density wave in a strong-coupling kagome superconductor
description: A study reports unconventional superconductivity and a pair density wave in the kagome superconductor CsV3Sb5, and provides a basis for understanding the microscopic origin of correlated electronic states and superconductivity in vanadium-based kagome metals.

heading: Circadian autophagy drives iTRF-mediated longevity
description: Circadian-regulated autophagy contributes to the health benefits of intermittent time-restricted feeding in Drosophila.

heading: Architecture and assembly mechanism of native glycine receptors
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of pig glycine receptors indicate that they are predominantly assembled with 4α:1β stoichiometry via α-homotrimer and homotetramer intermediates.

heading: Reply to: A finding of sex similarities rather than differences in COVID-19 outcomes
A finding of sex similarities rather than differences in COVID-19 outcomes
authors: Heather Shattuck-HeidornAnn Caroline DanielsenSarah S. Richardson

heading: Single-photon nonlinearity at room temperature
authors: Anton V. ZasedatelevAnton V. BaranikovPavlos G. Lagoudakis
description: Nonlinearity induced by a single photon is desirable because it can drive power consumption of optical devices to their fundamental quantum limit, and is demonstrated here at room temperature.

heading: Efficient and targeted COVID-19 border testing via reinforcement learning
description: A study reports the design and performance of a reinforcement learning algorithm that enabled efficient and targeted SARS-CoV-2 testing of passengers travelling to Greece in the summer of 2020.

heading: Three-dimensional electronic microfliers inspired by wind-dispersed seeds
authors: Bong Hoon KimKan LiJohn A. Rogers
description: With a design inspired by wind-dispersed seeds, a series of three-dimensional passive fliers at the macro-, meso- and microscale are realized that can bear active electronic payloads.

heading: The three major axes of terrestrial ecosystem function
description: Three key axes of variation of ecosystem functional changes and their underlying causes are identified from a dataset of surface gas exchange measurements across major terrestrial biomes and climate zones.

heading: Electron phase-space control in photonic chip-based particle acceleration
description: In a tiny chip-based particle accelerator, phase-space control of the emerging electron beam demonstrates guiding over a length of nearly 80 micrometres and an indispensable prerequisite to electron acceleration to high energies.

heading: Three-dimensional magnetic stripes require slow cooling in fast-spread lower ocean crust
authors: Sarah M. MaherJeffrey S. GeeBarbara E. John
description: A record of Earth’s magnetic field constructed from near-bottom magnetization observations and oriented samples provides three-dimensional imaging of magnetic stripes in fast-spread crust, and suggests slow cooling off-axis, as opposed to deep hydrothermal cooling close to the spreading ridge.

heading: Structural basis of gating modulation of Kv4 channel complexes
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the voltage-gated potassium channel Kv4.2 alone and in complex with auxiliary subunits (DPP6S and/or KChIP1) reveal the distinct mechanisms of these two different subunits in modulating channel activity.

heading: Genetic and epigenetic coordination of cortical interneuron development
authors: Kathryn C. AllawayMariano I. GabittoGord Fishell
description: The transcriptional programs and chromatin accessibility changes that cause two related interneuronal subtypes to diverge from common developmental origins and acquire specialized properties are elucidated.

heading: Paths and timings of the peopling of Polynesia inferred from genomic networks
description: Analysis of genomic networks from 430 modern individuals across 21 Pacific island populations reveals the human settlement history of Polynesia.

heading: Normal, dust-obscured galaxies in the epoch of reionization
description: Two serendipitously detected dust-obscured galaxies are reported at z = 6.7 and 7.4, with estimates that such galaxies provide an additional 10–25% contribution to the total star formation rate density at z > 6.

heading: Nucleation landscape of biomolecular condensates
authors: Shunsuke F. ShimobayashiPierre RoncerayClifford P. Brangwynne
description: Experiments using endogenous and biomimetic condensates in cells show that nucleation in cells resembles the physical process in inanimate materials, but is tuned by biomolecular features.

heading: Quenching of star formation from a lack of inflowing gas to galaxies
authors: Katherine E. WhitakerChristina C. WilliamsFrancesco Valentino
description: The authors report 1.3 mm observations of dust emission from strongly lensed galaxies where star formation is quenched, demonstrating that gas depletion is responsible for the cessation of star formation in some high-redshift galaxies.

heading: Structures of full-length glycoprotein hormone receptor signalling complexes
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the luteinizing hormone–choriogonadotropin receptor (LHCGR), in complex with Gs and in various states of activation, reveal a distinct mechanism of receptor activation, with implications for drug discovery.

heading: Kainate receptor modulation by NETO2
description: The authors report the structures of glutamate-gated kainate receptors in complex with NETO2 in both the resting and the desensitized states and reveal how kainate receptors in the brain are regulated by NETO2.

heading: Dopamine facilitates associative memory encoding in the entorhinal cortex
authors: Jason Y. LeeHeechul JunKei M. Igarashi
description: Cell-type-specific electrophysiological recording, fibre photometry and optogenetic manipulations in mice show that dopamine signals from the ventral tegmental area to the lateral entorhinal cortex have a key role in cue–reward associative learning.

heading: Biologically informed deep neural network for prostate cancer discovery
authors: Haitham A. ElmarakebyJustin HwangEliezer M. Van Allen
description: A biologically informed, interpretable deep learning model has been developed to evaluate molecular drivers of resistance to cancer treatment, predict clinical outcomes and guide hypotheses on disease progression.

heading: Fc-engineered antibody therapeutics with improved anti-SARS-CoV-2 efficacy
description: Optimization of monoclonal antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 for enhanced Fc-effector function increase their effectiveness for prevention and treatment of COVID-19 in multiple animal models of SARS-CoV-2 infection.

heading: Activation of TIR signalling boosts pattern-triggered immunity
description: A study reveals that activation of Toll/interleukin-1 receptor signalling is an important mechanism for boosting plant defence during pattern-triggered immunity.

heading: High genetic barrier to SARS-CoV-2 polyclonal neutralizing antibody escape
description: A complex range of mutations within the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein is needed to escape polyclonal plasma neutralizing antibodies, and plasma from individuals who were first infected then vaccinated display the greatest resilience to escape mutations.

heading: Vast CO2 release from Australian fires in 2019–2020 constrained by satellite
authors: Ivar R. van der VeldeGuido R. van der WerfIlse Aben
description: The amount of carbon dioxide released by the Australian wildfires of 2019–2020 is uncertain, but is estimated here using satellite observations of carbon monoxide to be more than twice the amount suggested by fire inventories.

heading: An engineered IL-2 partial agonist promotes CD8+ T cell stemness
description: H9T, an engineered IL-2 partial agonist, promotes the expansion of T cells while maintaining a stem-cell-like state, leading to improved efficacy of adoptive cell therapy in mouse models of melanoma and acute lymphoblastic leukaemia.

heading: The diffuse γ-ray background is dominated by star-forming galaxies
authors: Matt A. RothMark R. KrumholzSilvia Celli
description: The diffuse, isotropic background of gamma rays comes mainly from star-forming galaxies, according to a physical model of gamma-ray emission.

heading: Structural basis of human transcription–DNA repair coupling
description: The authors resolve the structure of five complexes containing RNA polymerase II and the CSA and CSB proteins, offering insight into how the repair of DNA lesions is coupled to transcription.

heading: Structural insights into hepatitis C virus receptor binding and entry
description: Crystal structures of the hepatitis C virus (HCV) glycoprotein E2 in complex with CD81 reveal the conformational changes that occur in E2 after binding of CD81 and the effects of pH on binding affinity.

heading: Dairying enabled Early Bronze Age Yamnaya steppe expansions
description: Analysis of ancient proteins suggests that Early Bronze Age dairying and horse domestication catalysed eastern Yamnaya migrations.

heading: Resurgence of Ebola virus in 2021 in Guinea suggests a new paradigm for outbreaks
authors: Alpha Kabinet KeitaFara R. KoundounoN’. Faly Magassouba
description: The viral lineage responsible for the February 2021 outbreak of Ebola virus disease in Guinea is nested within a clade that predominantly consists of genomes sampled during the 2013–2016 epidemic, suggesting that the virus might have re-emerged after a long period of latency within a previously infected individual.

heading: Acinar cell clonal expansion in pancreas homeostasis and carcinogenesis
authors: Patrick NeuhöferCaitlin M. RoakeSteven E. Artandi
description: A rare population of acinar cells expressing telomerase reverse transcriptase renew the acinar cell compartment during homeostasis, and are potential sources of premalignant cells in pancreatic carcinogenesis.

heading: Structural basis for tRNA methylthiolation by the radical SAM enzyme MiaB
authors: Olga A. EsakovaTyler L. GroveSquire J. Booker
description: Crystal structures reveal the catalytic mechanism through which the radical S-adenosylmethionine enzyme MiaB adds a methylthio group onto tRNA.

heading: Widespread phytoplankton blooms triggered by 2019–2020 Australian wildfires
description: Oceanic deposition of wildfire aerosols can enhance marine productivity, as supported here by satellite and in situ profiling floats data showing that emissions from the 2019–2020 Australian wildfires fuelled phytoplankton blooms in the Southern Ocean.

heading: Directed assembly of layered perovskite heterostructures as single crystals
authors: Michael L. AubreyAbraham Saldivar ValdesHemamala I. Karunadasa
description: Using organic molecules as directing groups, a wide range of perovskite heterostructures are shown to self-assemble in solution to yield single crystals.

heading: Structure-based classification predicts drug response in EGFR-mutant NSCLC
authors: Jacqulyne P. RobichauxXiuning LeJohn V. Heymach
description: Structural classification of mutations in the epidermal growth factor receptor causing non-small cell lung cancer is a better predictor of patient outcomes following drug treatment than traditional exon-based classification.

heading: Quantum criticality in twisted transition metal dichalcogenides
description: Metal-to-insulator transitions are characterized in twisted WSe, revealing strange metal behaviour and quantum criticality at low temperatures.

heading: Continuous Mott transition in semiconductor moiré superlattices
description: The interaction strength in moiré superlattices is tuned to drive a continuous metal-to-insulator transition at a fixed electron density.

heading: Aquatic foods to nourish nations
authors: Christopher D. GoldenJ. Zachary KoehnShakuntala H. Thilsted
description: Data on the nutrient content of almost 3,000 aquatic animal-source foods is combined with a food-systems model to show that an increase in aquatic-food production could reduce the inadequate intake of most nutrients.

heading: Environmental performance of blue foods
authors: Jessica A. GephartPatrik J. G. HenrikssonMax Troell
description: A range of environmental stressors are estimated for farmed and wild capture blue foods, including bivalves, seaweed, crustaceans and finfish, with the potential to inform more sustainable diets.

heading: Rational design of a new antibiotic class for drug-resistant infections
authors: Thomas F. Durand-RevilleAlita A. MillerRuben A. Tommasi
description: A lead-optimization strategy combining porin permeation properties and biochemical potency leads to development of a new class of antibiotic based on broad inhibition of penicillin-binding proteins from Gram-negative bacteria.

heading: UTX condensation underlies its tumour-suppressive activity
description: Phase separation properties are a major determinant of UTX activity in chromatin regulation in tumour suppression, and are dependent on a core intrinsically disordered region of the protein.

heading: Multicomponent alkene azidoarylation by anion-mediated dual catalysis
description: A streamlined synthesis of β-arylethylamines using two distinct copper catalysts is reported, and an azide anion is proposed to both react to form the product and facilitate catalyst regeneration.

heading: Virus-induced senescence is a driver and therapeutic target in COVID-19
description: Virus-induced senescence is a central pathogenic feature in COVID-19, and senolytics, which promote apoptosis of senescent cells, can reduce disease severity in hamsters,mice, as well as humans infected with SARS-CoV-2.

heading: Using DNA sequencing data to quantify T cell fraction and therapy response
description: A robust, cost-effective technique based on whole-exome sequencing data can be used to characterize immune infiltrates, relate the extent of these infiltrates to somatic changes in tumours, and enables prediction of tumour responses to immune checkpoint inhibition therapy.

heading: Tunable self-assembled Casimir microcavities and polaritons
description: Gold nanoflake pairs form by self-assembly in an aqueous ligand solution and offer stable and tunable microcavities by virtue of equilibrium between attractive Casimir forces and repulsive electrostatic forces.

heading: Transmembrane transport in inorganic colloidal cell-mimics
description: Hollow colloidal capsules, each with a single micropore, act as artificial cell-like structures that can capture and release payloads such as solid particles or bacteria from the external environment.

heading: Positive allosteric mechanisms of adenosine A1 receptor-mediated analgesia
description: MIPS521, a positive allosteric modulator of the adenosine A1 receptor, has analgesic properties in a rat model of neuropathic pain through a mechanism by which MIPS521 stabilizes the complex between adenosine, receptor and G protein.

heading: Cells of the human intestinal tract mapped across space and time
description: Cells from embryonic, fetal, paediatric and adult human intestinal tissue are analysed at different locations along the intestinal tract to construct a single-cell atlas of the developing and adult human intestinal tract, encompassing all cell lineages.

heading: Unextractable fossil fuels in a 1.5 °C world
description: A global energy system model finds that planned fossil fuel extraction is inconsistent with limiting global warming to 1.5 °C, because the majority of fossil fuel reserves must stay in the ground.

heading: The EDS1–PAD4–ADR1 node mediates Arabidopsis pattern-triggered immunity
description: The authors provide mechanistic insights into the crosstalk between signalling components of pattern-triggered immunity and effector-triggered immunity and their molecular linkers.

heading: A lymphocyte–microglia–astrocyte axis in chronic active multiple sclerosis
description: Single-nucleus transcriptomics defines a diverse set of immune and glial cells at the chronically inflamed leading edge of demyelinated white matter lesions in patients with multiple sclerosis.

heading: Inter-cellular CRISPR screens reveal regulators of cancer cell phagocytosis
authors: Roarke A. KamberYoko NishigaMichael C. Bassik
description: CRISPR-mediated gene knockout and activation are used to identify molecules in cancer cells and macrophages that regulate antibody-dependent cancer cell phagocytosis.

heading: Pollinators contribute to the maintenance of flowering plant diversity
description: The authors show that plant–pollinator interactions confer a fitness advantage to rare plant species in a biodiversity hotspot.

heading: Widespread woody plant use of water stored in bedrock
authors: Erica L. McCormickDavid N. DralleDaniella M. Rempe
description: Woody plants across the continental United States make extensive use of water stored in bedrock across diverse climates and biomes.

heading: Large metallicity variations in the Galactic interstellar medium
authors: Annalisa De CiaEdward B. JenkinsJens-Kristian Krogager
description: The metallicity of the interstellar medium measured towards 25 stars relatively near the Sun shows large variations, suggesting that infalling pristine gas is not efficiently mixed in the interstellar medium.

heading: High-fidelity laser-free universal control of trapped ion qubits
authors: R. SrinivasS. C. BurdD. H. Slichter
description: Laser-free universal control of two trapped-ion qubits using a combination of radiofrequency and microwave magnetic fields achieves some of the highest fidelities ever reported for two-qubit maximally entangled states.

heading: Bioaccumulation of therapeutic drugs by human gut bacteria
description: An analysis of the interactions between 15 drugs and 25 gut bacterial strains shows that bioaccumulation of drugs within bacterial cells is another mechanism through which gut microorganisms can alter drug availability and efficacy.

heading: Single-cell Ribo-seq reveals cell cycle-dependent translational pausing
authors: Michael VanInsbergheJeroen van den BergAlexander van Oudenaarden
description: Highly sensitive ribosome profiling of single cells at single-codon resolution enables identification of distinct cell cycle-dependent translational dynamic states in individual cells.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 B.1.617.2 Delta variant replication and immune evasion
authors: Petra MlcochovaSteven A. KempRavindra K. Gupta
description: A study of SARS-CoV-2 variants examining their transmission, infectivity, and potential resistance to therapies provides insights into the biology of the Delta variant and its role in the global pandemic.

heading: Programmable RNA targeting with the single-protein CRISPR effector Cas7-11
description: Cas7-11—the fusion of a putative Cas11 domain and four Cas7 subunits—cleaves RNA without detectable non-specific activity and, when optimized for RNA knockdown and editing in mammalian cells, has no effects on cell viability.

heading: AIM2 forms a complex with pyrin and ZBP1 to drive PANoptosis and host defence
description: AIM2 responds to infection with herpes simplex virus 1 or Francisella novicida by driving assembly of a large multi-protein complex containing multiple inflammasome sensors and cell death regulators.

heading: Scalable production of high-performing woven lithium-ion fibre batteries
description: Rechargeable lithium-ion batteries produced in the form of metre-long fibres can be woven into sturdy, washable textiles on an industrial loom and used to power other fabric-based electronic components.

heading: Structure of Geobacter pili reveals secretory rather than nanowire behaviour
description: Structural, functional and localization studies reveal that Geobacter sulfurreducens pili cannot behave as microbial nanowires, instead functioning in a similar way to secretion pseudopili to export cytochrome nanowires that are essential for extracellular electron transfer.

heading: Emergent hydrodynamics in a strongly interacting dipolar spin ensemble
description: A hybrid solid-state platform based on two strongly interacting dipolar species is used to study the emergence of the classical properties of a solid from its underlying microscopic quantum description.

heading: How deregulation, drought and increasing fire impact Amazonian biodiversity
description: Remote-sensing estimates of fires and the estimated geographic ranges of thousands of plant and vertebrate species in the Amazon Basin reveal that fires have impacted the ranges of 77–85% of threatened species over the past two decades.

heading: Measuring the density structure of an accretion hot spot
authors: C. C. EspaillatC. E. RobinsonJ. Muzerolle
description: An observed one-day difference between the peaks of emission of ultraviolet and optical light from the hot spot on GM Aurigae indicates that the hot spot has a radial density gradient.

heading: Superconductivity in rhombohedral trilayer graphene
description: Superconductivity is observed in rhombohedral trilayer graphene in the absence of a moiré superlattice, with two distinct superconducting states both occurring at a symmetry-breaking transition where the Fermi surface degeneracy changes.

heading: Enantioselective synthesis of ammonium cations
authors: Mark P. WalshJoseph M. PhelpsMatthew O. Kitching
description: Enantioselective supramolecular recognition allows for the asymmetric synthesis of nitrogen stereocentres, providing chiral ammonium cations in a dynamic crystallization process.

heading: Functional HPV-specific PD-1+ stem-like CD8 T cells in head and neck cancer
authors: Christiane S. EberhardtHaydn T. KissickRafi Ahmed
description: An analysis of human papillomavirus (HPV)-specific CD8 T cells in patients with head and neck cancer identifies functional PD-1+TCF-1+CD8 T cells in the tumour with implications for therapeutic vaccination and PD-1 directed immunotherapy.

heading: Half- and quarter-metals in rhombohedral trilayer graphene
description: A study shows that rhombohedral graphene is an ideal platform for well-controlled tests of many-body theory and reveals that magnetism in moiré materials is fundamentally itinerant in nature.

heading: The polar oxy-metabolome reveals the 4-hydroxymandelate CoQ10 synthesis pathway
authors: Robert S. BanhEsther S. KimMichael E. Pacold
description: 18O2 labelling is used to identify metabolites in human cells that incorporate gaseous oxygen, including 4-hydroxymandelate, an intermediate in the synthesis of the coenzyme Q10 head group.

heading: RecA finds homologous DNA by reduced dimensionality search
description: Observations of rapid repair of double-stranded DNA breaks in sister choromosomes in Escherichia coli are consistent with a reduced-dimensionality-search model of RecA-mediated repair.

heading: Structural basis for piRNA targeting
authors: Todd A. AnzelonSaikat ChowdhuryIan J. MacRae
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of a PIWI–piRNA complex provide insight into how piRNAs recognise target RNAs and reveal differences from the target mechanisms of microRNAs.

heading: The contribution of insects to global forest deadwood decomposition
description: Multi-year field experiments across six continents suggest that insects have an important contribution to decomposition and carbon release from forest deadwood.

heading: Decision trees within a molecular memristor
description: Multiple redox transitions in a molecular memristor can be harnessed as ‘decision trees’ to undertake complex and reconfigurable logic operations in a single time step.

heading: Multiple hominin dispersals into Southwest Asia over the past 400,000 years
authors: Huw S. GroucuttTom S. WhiteMichael D. Petraglia
description: Dated palaeolake sequences show that there were at least five Pleistocene hominin expansions into the Arabian interior, coinciding with windows of reduced aridity between 400 and 55 thousand years ago.

heading: Metallaphotoredox-enabled deoxygenative arylation of alcohols
description: A metallaphotoredox-based cross-coupling platform is capable of activating a wide range of free alcohols using N-heterocyclic carbene salts, cleaving C–O bonds to form free carbon radicals that are then used to form new C–C bonds.

heading: Lectins enhance SARS-CoV-2 infection and influence neutralizing antibodies
authors: Florian A. LemppLeah B. SoriagaDavide Corti
description: C-type lectins and SIGLEC1 function as attachment receptors for SARS-CoV-2 and enhance ACE2-mediated infection.

heading: Burden and characteristics of COVID-19 in the United States during 2020
description: Data-driven modelling including numbers of cases and population movements is used to simulate the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States in 2020, providing insights into the transmission of the disease.

heading: Unusual width of the superconducting transition in a hydride
Extensive phylogenies of human development inferred from somatic mutations
authors: Tim H. H. CoorensLuiza MooreMichael R. Stratton
description: Somatic mutations obtained from laser microdissected biopsies of human tissues are used to reconstruct the developmental phylogenies of these tissues back to the zygote.

heading: Universal pair polaritons in a strongly interacting Fermi gas
description: Directly coupling cavity photons to the photo-association resonances of pairs of atoms in a strongly interacting Fermi gas generates pair polaritons—hybrid excitaions coherently mixing photons, atom pairs and molecules.

heading: Hypothalamic dopamine neurons motivate mating through persistent cAMP signalling
authors: Stephen X. ZhangAndrew LutasMark L. Andermann
description: A population of hypothalamic dopamine neurons sustains mating drive in male mice through a persistent mode of biochemical signalling in target neurons.

heading: Single-crystal, large-area, fold-free monolayer graphene
description: Restricting the initial growth temperatures used for chemical vapour deposition of graphene on metal foils produces optimum conditions for growing large areas of fold-free, single-crystal graphene.

heading: Clonal dynamics in early human embryogenesis inferred from somatic mutation
authors: Seongyeol ParkNanda Maya MaliYoung Seok Ju
description: Adult human tissues from diverse sites around the body are used to reconstruct cellular phylogenies from early development, using somatic mutations as an internal barcode.

heading: Direct observation of ultrafast hydrogen bond strengthening in liquid water
description: Liquid ultrafast electron scattering measures structural responses in liquid water with femtosecond temporal and atomic spatial resolution to reveal a transient hydrogen bond contraction then thermalization preceding relaxation of the OH stretch.

heading: A body map of somatic mutagenesis in morphologically normal human tissues
description: Laser-capture microdissection and mini-bulk exome sequencing are combined to analyse somatic mutations in morphologically normal tissues from nine organs from five donors, revealing variation in mutation burdens, mutational signatures and clonal expansions.

heading: Sympathetic cooling of a trapped proton mediated by an LC circuit
description: A single electromagnetically trapped proton is sympathetically cooled to below ambient temperature by coupling it through a superconducting LC circuit to a laser-cooled cloud of Be+ ions stored in a spatially separated trap.

heading: A clinically applicable integrative molecular classification of meningiomas
description: Multi-omics datasets are integrated to generate a unified and clinically informed molecular classification of meningiomas.

heading: Photocatalytic solar hydrogen production from water on a 100-m2 scale
description: Carbon-neutral hydrogen can be produced through photocatalytic water splitting, as demonstrated here with a 100-m2 array of panel reactors that reaches a maximum conversion efficiency of 0.76%.

heading: High aboveground carbon stock of African tropical montane forests
authors: Aida Cuni-SanchezMartin J. P. SullivanEtienne Zibera
description: The aboveground carbon stock of a montane African forest network is comparable to that of a lowland African forest network and two-thirds higher than default values for these montane forests.

heading: A Triassic stem lepidosaur illuminates the origin of lizard-like reptiles
authors: Ricardo N. MartínezTiago R. SimõesSebastián Apesteguía
description: Taytalura alcoberi, represented by a three-dimensionally preserved skull from the Late Triassic epoch of Argentina, is phylogenetically inferred as the earliest known lepidosauromorph, and reveals that sphenodontian skull architecture is plesiomorphic for lepidosaurs.

heading: The mutational landscape of human somatic and germline cells
description: The authors report the mutational landscape of 29 cell types from microdissected biopsies from 19 organs and explore the mechanisms underlying mutation rates in normal tissues.

heading: APRIL limits atherosclerosis by binding to heparan sulfate proteoglycans
description: The heparan sulfate proteoglycan-binding cytokine APRIL has a protective role against atherosclerotic disease.

heading: Quantitative lineage analysis identifies a hepato-pancreato-biliary progenitor niche
description: Computational modelling and mouse genetics approaches show that multipotent progenitor cells that have the potential to populate the hepato-pancreato-biliary lineage tree persist in the pancreato-biliary organ rudiment.

heading: Rechargeable Na/Cl2 and Li/Cl2 batteries
description: Rechargeable Na/Cl2 and Li/Cl2 batteries are produced with a microporous carbon positive electrode, aluminium chloride in thionyl chloride as the electrolyte, and either sodium or lithium as the negative electrode.

heading: Genome of a middle Holocene hunter-gatherer from Wallacea
description: The palaeogenomic analysis of a pre-Neolithic skeleton associated with a Toalean burial context from Wallacea.

heading: Chromatic periodic activity down to 120 megahertz in a fast radio burst
description: The fast radio burst FRB 20180916B repeats with a periodicity of 16 days, and is now found to emit down to a frequency of 120 MHz, much lower than previously observed.

heading: Emergence and expansion of SARS-CoV-2 B.1.526 after identification in New York
description: The dynamics of the spread of the SARS-CoV-2 variant B.1.526 suggest that resistance to neutralization by antibodies may evolve in other variants and contribute to the spread of COVID-19.

heading: A crystalline tri-thorium cluster with σ-aromatic metal–metal bonding
authors: Josef T. BoronskiJohn A. SeedStephen T. Liddle
description: A crystalline cluster exhibits thorium–thorium bonding, adding to our knowledge of actinide–actinide bonding.

heading: Mobility gradients yield rubbery surfaces on top of polymer glasses
description: Surface enhancements in glass mobility are complicated in polymers by the interplay of the surface mobile layer thickness with a second length scale (the size of the polymer chains), giving rise to a transient rubbery surface even in polymers with short chains.

heading: Neuro-mesenchymal units control ILC2 and obesity via a brain–adipose circuit
authors: Filipa CardosoRoel G. J. Klein WolterinkHenrique Veiga-Fernandes
description: Signals from the sympathetic nervous system act via mesenchymal stromal cells to regulate the function of group 2 innate lymphoid cells and control adipocyte metabolism.

heading: The Montreal Protocol protects the terrestrial carbon sink
authors: Paul J. YoungAnna B. HarperRolando R. Garcia
description: Modelling suggests that the Montreal Protocol may be mitigating climate change by protecting the land carbon sink, as well as by protecting the ozone layer and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

heading: DAXX represents a new type of protein-folding enabler
description: A protein chaperone system is identified that consists of proteins with poly-Asp/Glu sequence, and may have an important role in diseases characterized by protein aggregation.

heading: Two-dimensional supersolidity in a dipolar quantum gas
description: Two-dimensional supersolidity is demonstrated using highly magnetic, ultracold dysprosium atoms.

heading: Dietary fructose improves intestinal cell survival and nutrient absorption
authors: Samuel R. TaylorShakti RamsamoojMarcus D. Goncalves
description: A high-fructose diet in mice improves the survival of intestinal epithelial cells, which leads to an increase in gut surface area, enhanced absorption of lipids and the promotion of tumour growth and obesity.

heading: Lenghu on the Tibetan Plateau as an astronomical observing site
description: The results of site testing at a local summit near Lenghu Town in Qinghai Province on the Tibetan Plateau indicate that the site is suitable as an astronomical observing site.

heading: Chronic social isolation signals starvation and reduces sleep in Drosophila
description: Behavioural and transcriptomic analyses show that chronic social isolation of Drosophila causes perturbed sleep and increased feeding, and induces a starvation-like brain state.

heading: Molecular basis for DarT ADP-ribosylation of a DNA base
description: Structural and mechanistic data of the ADP-ribosyltransferase DarT demonstrate the role of ADP-ribosylation of DNA by this enzyme in generating toxicity and regulating cellular signalling processes in bacteria.

heading: How to design an icosahedral quasicrystal through directional bonding
authors: Eva G. NoyaChak Kui WongJonathan P. K. Doye
description: Model patchy colloids with directional bonding are designed that assemble into icosahedral quasicrystals through the propagation of an icosahedral network of bonds and may be realized using DNA origami particles.

heading: Cotranslational prolyl hydroxylation is essential for flavivirus biogenesis
description: A proteomics-based strategy is used to examine how three different RNA viruses (polio, Zika and dengue) remodel translation in the host to recruit host machineries necessary for the production of viral proteins.

heading: Ghost hyperbolic surface polaritons in bulk anisotropic crystals
description: Hyperbolic phonon polaritons that exhibit long-distance, ray-like propagation and oblique wavefronts are described at the surface of an anisotropic bulk crystal.

heading: Direct imaging of single-molecule electrochemical reactions in solution
description: Optical imaging of single-molecule electrochemical reactions in aqueous solution enables super-resolution electrochemiluminescence microscopy, which can be used to monitor the adhesion dynamics of live cells with high spatiotemporal resolution.

heading: Phantom epistasis between unlinked loci
authors: Gibran HemaniJoseph E. PowellPeter M. Visscher

heading: Aged skeletal stem cells generate an inflammatory degenerative niche
authors: Thomas H. AmbrosiOwen MarecicCharles K. F. Chan
description: An analysis of skeletal stem cells in mice reveals that bone ageing occurs at the level of local niches affecting skeletal and haematopoietic lineage output, which may influence systemic aspects of multi-organ physiological ageing.

heading: Demonstration of reduced neoclassical energy transport in Wendelstein 7-X
authors: C. D. BeidlerH. M. SmithM. Zuin
description: Previously documented record values of the fusion triple product in the stellarator Wendelstein 7-X are shown to be evidence for reduced neoclassical energy transport in this optimized device.

heading: Actively variable-spectrum optoelectronics with black phosphorus
description: High-performance optoelectronic devices that operate in the infrared regime at room temperature exhibit wide-range, active and reversible tunability of the operating wavelengths with black phosphorus.

heading: Oxytocin neurons enable social transmission of maternal behaviour
authors: Ioana CarceaNaomi López CaraballoRobert C. Froemke
description: Behavioural studies and neural recordings in mice show that virgin mice can acquire maternal behaviour through an oxytocin-dependent mechanism.

heading: Cycling cancer persister cells arise from lineages with distinct programs
description: Lineage tracing by barcoding of individual cells using a lentivirus library shows that cycling and non-cycling drug-tolerant persister cells in cancer arise from different lineages with distinct transcriptional and metabolic programs.

heading: Cryo-EM structures of full-length Tetrahymena ribozyme at 3.1 Å resolution
description: Cryo-electron microscopy has been used to determine the structure of the Tetrahymena ribozyme (a catalytic RNA) at sufficiently high resolution to model side chains and metal ions.

heading: Evidence for an atomic chiral superfluid with topological excitations
description: A globally chiral atomic superfluid is induced by time-reversal symmetry breaking in an optical lattice and exhibits global angular momentum, which is expected to lead to topological excitations and the demonstration of a topological superfluid.

heading: Structured fabrics with tunable mechanical properties
description: A structured fabric constructed of linked hollow polyhedral particles (resembling chain mail) can be simply and reversibly tuned between flexible and rigid states; when it is compressed, its linked particles become jammed.

heading: A metabolic function of the hippocampal sharp wave-ripple
description: Sharp wave-ripples from the hippocampus are shown to modulate peripheral glucose homeostasis in rats, offering insights into the mechanism that links sleep disruption and blood glucose regulation in type 2 diabetes.

heading: Locally ordered representation of 3D space in the entorhinal cortex
description: Recordings from the brains of freely flying bats show that grid cells that represent 3D space have multiple firing fields and are organized with local rather than global order.

heading: Rare variant contribution to human disease in 281,104 UK Biobank exomes
description: The authors analyse rare protein-coding genetic variants for association with 18,780 traits in the UK Biobank cohort.

heading: Global upper-atmospheric heating on Jupiter by the polar aurorae
description: High-resolution observations confirm that Jupiter’s global upper atmosphere is heated by transport of energy from the polar aurora.

heading: Emergent order in hydrodynamic spin lattices
authors: Pedro J. SáenzGiuseppe PucciJohn W. M. Bush
description: A macroscopic analogue of a spin system is shown to emerge in an ensemble of droplets bouncing on the surface of a vibrating bath, revealing symmetry-breaking phenomena such as ‘magnetic’ ordering.

heading: Genetic insights into biological mechanisms governing human ovarian ageing
authors: Katherine S. RuthFelix R. DayJohn R. B. Perry
description: Hundreds of genetic loci associated with age at menopause, combined with experimental evidence in mice, highlight mechanisms of reproductive ageing across the lifespan.

heading: Structural insights into how Prp5 proofreads the pre-mRNA branch site
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of a newly identified, early spliceosomal complex reveals the mechanism by which the RNA helicase Prp5 enhances the fidelity of the excision of introns from precursor mRNAs.

heading: Pseudogap in a crystalline insulator doped by disordered metals
authors: Sae Hee RyuMinjae HuhKeun Su Kim
description: A back-bending band structure and an emerging pseudogap are observed at the interface between a crystalline solid (black phosphorus) and disordered alkali-metal dopants.

heading: Deficient H2A.Z deposition is associated with genesis of uterine leiomyoma
authors: Davide G. BertaHeli KuismaLauri A. Aaltonen
description: Analyses of samples from 728 women with uterine leiomyomas (uterine fibroids), and public data, show that somatic and germline mutations in the SRCAP histone-loading complex genes are associated with the condition.

heading: Satellite imaging reveals increased proportion of population exposed to floods
authors: B. TellmanJ. A. SullivanD. A. Slayback
description: Satellite imagery for the period 2000–2018 reveals that population growth was greater in flood-prone regions than elsewhere, thus exposing a greater proportion of the population to floods.

heading: Structure and mechanism of blood–brain-barrier lipid transporter MFSD2A
authors: Chase A. P. WoodJinru ZhangLiang Feng
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of mouse MFSD2A sheds light on the mechanism that underlies its lipid transport functions, which have a pivotal role in regulating the blood–brain barrier.

heading: Agrochemicals interact synergistically to increase bee mortality
authors: Harry SiviterEmily J. BailesMark J. F. Brown
description: A meta-analysis of studies in which bees were exposed to combinations of agrochemicals, nutritional stressors and/or parasites revealed evidence for synergistic effects on mortality when bees were exposed to multiple agrochemicals at field-realistic levels.

heading: Quantized nonlinear Thouless pumping
description: Nonlinearity is shown to induce quantized topological transport via soliton motion; specifically, we demonstrate nonlinear Thouless pumping of photons in waveguide arrays with a non-uniformly occupied energy band.

heading: The structural basis of odorant recognition in insect olfactory receptors
authors: Josefina del MármolMackenzie A. YedlinVanessa Ruta
description: Structural and functional analysis of an insect olfactory receptor shed light on how receptors can be activated by diverse odorants.

heading: Connectomes across development reveal principles of brain maturation
description: Serial-section electron microscopy is used to reconstruct the full brain connectome of eight individual Caenorhabditis elegans at various stages of development, providing insight into the principles underlying brain maturation.

heading: Microbes exploit death-induced nutrient release by gut epithelial cells
authors: Christopher J. AndersonChristopher B. MedinaKodi S. Ravichandran
description: Intestinal microorganisms exploit nutrients released by apoptotic gut epithelial cells for growth.

heading: Fair algorithms for selecting citizens’ assemblies
description: Principles from the field of fair division are used to develop selection algorithms for citizens’ assemblies that produce panels that are representative of the population while simultaneously selecting individuals with near-equal probabilities.

heading: Behavioural nudges increase COVID-19 vaccinations
description: Two randomized controlled trials demonstrate the ability of text-based behavioural ‘nudges’ to improve the uptake of COVID-19 vaccines, especially when designed to make participants feel ownership over their vaccine dose.

heading: Novel bile acid biosynthetic pathways are enriched in the microbiome of centenarians
description: The microbiota of centenarians (aged 100 years and older) comprise gut microorganisms that are capable of generating unique secondary bile acids, including isoallolithocholic acid, a bile acid with potent antimicrobial effects against Gram-positive—but not Gram-negative—multidrug-resistant pathogens.

heading: Spectroscopic evidence for a gold-coloured metallic water solution
authors: Philip E. MasonH. Christian SchewePavel Jungwirth
description: Spectroscopic measurements confirm that when water is adsorbed on drops of an alkali alloy at low pressure a gold-coloured metallic layer forms as electrons rapidly move from the drop into the water.

heading: Possible poriferan body fossils in early Neoproterozoic microbial reefs
description: Vermiform microstructure in microbial reefs dating to approximately 890 million years ago resembles the body fossils of Phanerozoic demosponges, and may represent the earliest known physical evidence of animals.

heading: A process-based approach to understanding and managing triggered seismicity
description: A multidisciplinary method for managing triggered seismicity is developed using detailed subsurface information to calibrate geomechanical and earthquake source physics models, and is applied to the Val d’Agri oil field in seismically active southern Italy.

heading: Rewiring of the ubiquitinated proteome determines ageing in C. elegans
description: Global loss of targeted protein degradation with age results in harmful accumulation of specific proteins in worms.

heading: Linear-in temperature resistivity from an isotropic Planckian scattering rate
description: Angle-dependent magnetoresistance measurements of a strange-metal phase of a hole-doped cuprate show a well defined Fermi surface and an isotropic linear-in-temperature scattering rate that saturates at the Planckian limit.

heading: Regulated control of gene therapies by drug-induced splicing
authors: Alex Mas MonteysAmiel A. HundleyBeverly L. Davidson
description: A switch system is developed to control the expression of therapeutic genes, involving the administration of a small-molecule drug to induce splicing-mediated control of mRNA translation.

heading: Molecular architecture of the developing mouse brain
description: A comprehensive single-cell transcriptomic atlas of the mouse brain between gastrulation and birth identifies hundreds of cellular states and reveals the spatiotemporal organization of brain development.

heading: Light bending and X-ray echoes from behind a supermassive black hole
authors: D. R. WilkinsL. C. GalloR. D. Blandford
description: One of the key predictions of general relativity, the bending of light around massive, compact objects, is observed for a supermassive black hole in the galaxy I Zwicky 1.

heading: Mechanisms of BRCA1–BARD1 nucleosome recognition and ubiquitylation
description: The authors elucidate the mechanisms for the ubiquitylation specificity and recruitment of the ubiquitin ligase complex BRCA1–BARD1 to damaged DNA within chromatin to facilitate homologous recombination.

heading: Rapid and stable mobilization of CD8+ T cells by SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccine
description: Longitudinal analyses of SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccine-elicited epitope-specific CD8+ T cell responses shows that CD8+ T cells are rapidly induced after prime vaccination and stably maintained after boost vaccination.

heading: Incoherent transport across the strange-metal regime of overdoped cuprates
description: Measurements of high-field magnetotransport in overdoped cuprates indicate that the strange-metal regime exists beyond the critical doping, and that it has both coherent and incoherent contributions.

heading: In silico saturation mutagenesis of cancer genes
description: A new computational approach to in silico mutagenesis screening allow comprehensive mapping of cancer driver mutations.

heading: BARD1 reads H2A lysine 15 ubiquitination to direct homologous recombination
authors: Jordan R. BeckerGillian CliffordJ. Ross Chapman
description: A tandem BRCT-domain-associated ubiquitin-dependent recruitment motif in BARD1 recruits BRCA1 to DNA double-strand breaks (DSBs) to promote homologous recombination and antagonize the 53BP1 DSB repair pathway that mediates non-homologous end joining.

heading: Structural basis of ketamine action on human NMDA receptors
description: Structures of ketamine bound to human NMDA receptors show how ketamine inhibits receptor activity.

heading: Highly accurate protein structure prediction for the human proteome
description: AlphaFold is used to predict the structures of almost all of the proteins in the human proteome—the availability of high-confidence predicted structures could enable new avenues of investigation from a structural perspective.

heading: Tonic prime-boost of STING signalling mediates Niemann–Pick disease type C
description: The lysosomal protein Niemann–Pick type C1 (NPC1) is identified as a cofactor in the trafficking of STING, and loss of NPC1 is shown to both ‘prime’ and ‘boost’ STING signalling leading to neurological disease.

heading: EGFR activation limits the response of liver cancer to lenvatinib
description: EGFR inhibition and lenvatinib treatment of liver cancer cells in vitro and in in vivo mouse models has potent anti-proliferative effects, and lenvatinib plus gefitinib treatment of 12 patients with advanced liver cancer resulted in meaningful clinical responses.

heading: Free-electron lasing at 27 nanometres based on a laser wakefield accelerator
description: Lasing in the extreme-ultraviolet range is demonstrated using a laser wakefield accelerator, as a step towards compact X-ray free-electron lasers.

heading: Gut cytokines modulate olfaction through metabolic reprogramming of glia
description: Glial metabolic reprogramming by gut-derived cytokines in Drosophila results in lasting changes in the sensory system of an ageing organism

heading: Pauli-limit violation and re-entrant superconductivity in moiré graphene
description: A large violation of the Pauli limit and re-entrant superconductivity in a magnetic field is reported for magic-angle twisted trilayer graphene, suggesting that the spin configuration of the superconducting state of this material is unlikely to consist of spin singlets.

heading: SAR1B senses leucine levels to regulate mTORC1 signalling
description: SAR1B, which is conserved between mammals and nematodes, is a leucine sensor that is involved in regulating mTORC1 signalling and potentially has a role in the development of lung cancer.

heading: Phenotype, specificity and avidity of antitumour CD8+ T cells in melanoma
description: The authors use single-cell profiling and T cell receptor specificity screening to show how tumour antigen recognition shapes the phenotypes of CD8+ T cells and antitumour immune responses.

heading: The nightside cloud-top circulation of the atmosphere of Venus
description: Cloud-top thermal images obtained by the Akatsuki orbiter show that Venus has almost null mean meridional circulation at the cloud top, because poleward circulation on the dayside is offset by equatorward circulation on the nightside.

heading: Layer Hall effect in a 2D topological axion antiferromagnet
description: A new type of Hall effect—the layer Hall effect—is produced in a 2D antiferromagnet that does not exhibit any net magnetization.

heading: Extreme flow simulations reveal skeletal adaptations of deep-sea sponges
description: High-performance hydrodynamic simulations show that the skeletal structure of the deep-sea sponge Euplectella aspergillum reduces the hydrodynamic stresses on it, while possibly being beneficial for feeding and reproduction.

heading: Orthogonal-array dynamic molecular sieving of propylene/propane mixtures
description: A dynamic molecular sieve made from a metal–organic framework with orthogonally arrayed pockets is capable of separating propylene (C3H6) from a propylene (C3H6)/propane (C3H8) gas mixture.

heading: Structural basis of human separase regulation by securin and CDK1–cyclin B1
description: Structures of separase in complex with either securin or cyclin B–CDK1 shed light on the regulation of chromosome separation during the cell cycle.

heading: Transcriptional programs of neoantigen-specific TIL in anti-PD-1-treated lung cancers
authors: Justina X. CaushiJiajia ZhangKellie N. Smith
description: Single-cell RNA sequencing and T cell receptor sequencing are combined to identify transcriptional programs specific to mutation-associated neoantigen-specific T cells in non-small cell lung cancers treated with anti-PD-1, providing insights into resistance to PD-1 blockade.

heading: A natively flexible 32-bit Arm microprocessor
description: Flexible electronic platforms would enable the integration of functional electronic circuitry with many everyday objects; here, a low-cost and fully flexible 32-bit microprocessor is produced.

heading: Cleaving arene rings for acyclic alkenylnitrile synthesis
description: Common aromatic rings, such as anilines, arylboronic acids and aryl halides, can be opened up and converted to alkenyl nitriles through carbon–carbon bond cleavage using a copper catalyst.

heading: Broad sarbecovirus neutralization by a human monoclonal antibody
authors: M. Alejandra TortoriciNadine CzudnochowskiMatteo Samuele Pizzuto
description: The human monoclonal antibody S2X259 cross-reacts with spike proteins from all clades of sarbecovirus, and provides prophylactic and therapeutic protection in vivo against parental SARS-CoV-2 and emerging variants of concern.

heading: Highly accurate protein structure prediction with AlphaFold
description: AlphaFold predicts protein structures with an accuracy competitive with experimental structures in the majority of cases using a novel deep learning architecture.

heading: A lithium-isotope perspective on the evolution of carbon and silicon cycles
authors: Boriana Kalderon-AsaelJoachim A. R. KatchinoffPhilip A. E. Pogge von Strandmann
description: Analysis of shallow-water marine carbonate samples from 101 stratigraphic units allows construction of a record of lithium isotopes from the past 3 billion years, tracking the evolution of the global carbon and silicon cycles.

heading: cGAS-like receptors sense RNA and control 3′2′-cGAMP signalling in Drosophila
authors: Kailey M. SlavikBenjamin R. MorehousePhilip J. Kranzusch
description: The authors identify Drosophila cGLR1 as a double-stranded RNA sensor and 3′2′-cGAMP as a nucleotide second messenger and activator of Drosophila STING signalling.

heading: The 13CO-rich atmosphere of a young accreting super-Jupiter
authors: Yapeng ZhangIgnas A. G. SnellenFrans Snik
description: Observations of 13CO in the atmosphere of a young, accreting super-Jupiter indicate a 13C-rich atmosphere, which is attributed to the accretion of carbon from ices enriched in 13C through fractionation.

heading: Exponential suppression of bit or phase errors with cyclic error correction
description: Repetition codes running many cycles of quantum error correction achieve exponential suppression of errors with increasing numbers of qubits.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 RBD antibodies that maximize breadth and resistance to escape
description: A survey of SARS-CoV-2 RBD antibodies identifies those with activity against diverse SARS-CoV-2 variants and SARS-related coronaviruses, highlighting epitopes and features to prioritize in antibody and vaccine development.

heading: Adaptive immunity induces mutualism between commensal eukaryotes
authors: Kyla S. OstTeresa R. O’MearaJune L. Round
description: Studies of mouse and human IgA responses against Candida albicans and other common fungal species show that host adaptive immunity selects for fungal effectors that promote commensalism and prevent intestinal disease.

heading: Acetate differentially regulates IgA reactivity to commensal bacteria
description: Acetate—a major gut microbial metabolite—increases the production of IgA in the colon, alters the capacity of the IgA pool to bind to specific microorganisms and alters the localization of these bacteria within the colon.

heading: Real-time optimal quantum control of mechanical motion at room temperature
description: Optimal quantum control of an optically trapped nanoparticle in its ground state is demonstrated at room temperature, using Kalman filtering to track its quantum trajectory in real time.

heading: Astrocytic interleukin-3 programs microglia and limits Alzheimer’s disease
authors: Cameron S. McAlpineJoseph ParkFilip K. Swirski
description: Interleukin-3 signalling from astrocytes to microglia readies microglia to defend against Alzheimer’s disease.

heading: Two cGAS-like receptors induce antiviral immunity in Drosophila
description: Two cGAS-like receptors, cGLR1 and cGLR2, identified in Drosophila melanogaster are shown to induce antiviral immunity in response to RNA or DNA virus infections through the production of 2′3′-cGAMP and 3′2′-cGAMP.

heading: Quantum control of a nanoparticle optically levitated in cryogenic free space
description: Quantum control of an optically levitated nanoparticle with a mass of just one femtogram is demonstrated in a cryogenic environment by feedback-cooling the motion of the particle to the quantum ground state.

heading: Amazonia as a carbon source linked to deforestation and climate change
authors: Luciana V. GattiLuana S. BassoRaiane A. L. Neves
description: Aircraft observations of atmospheric carbon dioxide and monoxide concentrations in Brazil show higher carbon emissions in eastern Amazonia than in the western part, which are linked to increased ecosystem stress and fire occurrence.

heading: Structures of rhodopsin in complex with G-protein-coupled receptor kinase 1
authors: Qiuyan ChenManolo PlasenciaJohn J. G. Tesmer
description: Cryo-EM structures of complexes between GRK1 and rhodopsin shed light on how a small number of GRKs can selectively recognize and be activated by hundreds of different G-protein-coupled receptors.

heading: A metabolomics pipeline for the mechanistic interrogation of the gut microbiome
authors: Shuo HanWill Van TreurenJustin L. Sonnenburg
description: A microbiome-focused metabolomics pipeline and interactive metabolomics profile explorer are a powerful tool for the characterization of gut-resident microorganisms and the interactions between microorganisms and their host.

heading: Dynamical prefrontal population coding during defensive behaviours
description: Dorsomedial prefrontal cortex represents threat and defensive action initiation, and the dynamic interplay between those representations dictates the temporal evolution of avoidance response to threats.

heading: Food cue regulation of AGRP hunger neurons guides learning
description: In response to food cues, a hypothalamic circuit in the mouse brain transiently inhibits neurons expressing agouti-related peptide, and this promotes learning of cue-initiated food-seeking tasks.

heading: Systems vaccinology of the BNT162b2 mRNA vaccine in humans
authors: Prabhu S. ArunachalamMadeleine K. D. ScottBali Pulendran
description: Profiling the immune responses of 56 volunteers vaccinated with BNT162b2 reveals how this mRNA vaccine primes the innate immune system to mount a potent response to SARS-CoV-2 after booster immunization.

heading: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19
authors: Mari E. K. NiemiJuha KarjalainenChloe Donohue
description: A global network of researchers was formed to investigate the role of human genetics in SARS-CoV-2 infection and COVID-19 severity; this paper reports 13 genome-wide significant loci and potentially actionable mechanisms in response to infection.

heading: Reduced sensitivity of SARS-CoV-2 variant Delta to antibody neutralization
description: The SARS-CoV-2 Delta variant partially evades neutralization by several monoclonal antibodies and by sera from individuals who have had COVID-19, but two doses of anti-COVID-19 vaccines still generate a strong neutralizing response.

heading: Operationalizing the net-negative carbon economy
description: To enable net-negative CO2 emissions, the repayment of previously accrued carbon debt by establishing the responsibility for the net removal of CO2 by carbon-emitting parties through carbon removal obligations is necessary.

heading: Caution over the use of ecological big data for conservation
Treatment of missing data determined conclusions regarding moralizing gods
authors: Bret BeheimQuentin D. AtkinsonAiyana K. Willard

heading: Shark mortality cannot be assessed by fishery overlap alone
Reply to: Shark mortality cannot be assessed by fishery overlap alone
authors: Nuno QueirozNicolas E. HumphriesDavid W. Sims

heading: A condensate-hardening drug blocks RSV replication in vivo
description: Cyclopamine and its chemical analogue A3E inhibit replication of human respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) by hardening the liquid–liquid phase-separated inclusion bodies, resulting in the inhibition of virus replication in the lungs of RSV-infected mice.

heading: Structure of human Cav2.2 channel blocked by the painkiller ziconotide
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of human Cav2.2 in the presence or absence of ziconotide reveal the molecular basis of the specificity of this painkiller for Cav2.2, and provide insights into electromechanical coupling in Cav channels.

heading: Supply chain diversity buffers cities against food shocks
description: An intensity−duration−frequency model linking food shock risk to supply chain diversity in the USA finds that boosting a city’s food supply chain diversity increases the resistance of a city to food shocks of mild to moderate severity.

heading: Bifunctional nanoprecipitates strengthen and ductilize a medium-entropy alloy
description: Increased strength and ductility in a medium-entropy alloy of Fe, Ni, Al and Ti is demonstrated using nanoprecipitates that simultaneously hinder phase transformation and block dislocation motion.

heading: Structural basis of early translocation events on the ribosome
authors: Emily J. RundletMikael HolmScott C. Blanchard
description: Cryo-electron microscopy and single-molecule fluorescence methods are used to elucidate the mechanism of early translocation events on the bacterial ribosome.

heading: Fluid-rich subducting topography generates anomalous forearc porosity
description: Electromagnetic data collected at the northern Hikurangi Margin, New Zealand show that a seamount on the incoming plate allows more water to subduct, compared with normal, unfaulted oceanic lithosphere.

heading: Antibody epitopes in vaccine-induced immune thrombotic thrombocytopaenia
description: Alanine-scanning mutagenesis is used to identify the PF4 epitope that is recognized by anti-PF4 antibodies in patients with vaccine-induced immune thrombotic thrombocytopaenia, revealing that the epitope corresponds to the heparin-binding site on PF4.

heading: Metabolic control of TFH cells and humoral immunity by phosphatidylethanolamine
description: Enzymes in the cytidine diphosphate–ethanolamine metabolic pathway, which promotes de novo synthesis of phosphatidylethanolamine, are shown to act as post-transcriptional mediators of the differentiation of T follicular helper (TFH) cells, by regulating the chemokine receptor CXCR5.

heading: Optical manipulation of electronic dimensionality in a quantum material
description: Two-dimensional electronic states are observed at the induced domain walls of a three-dimensional charge density wave material by manipulating the periodic lattice distortion via femtosecond infrared pulses.

heading: Sexual arousal gates visual processing during Drosophila courtship
description: Specific neurons in the fly brain that are activated when males are aroused modulate visual processing to underlie courtship.

heading: Reply to: Caution over the use of ecological big data for conservation
authors: Nuno QueirozNicolas E. HumphriesDavid W. Sims

heading: Quantum phases of matter on a 256-atom programmable quantum simulator
authors: Sepehr EbadiTout T. WangMikhail D. Lukin
description: A programmable quantum simulator with 256 qubits is created using neutral atoms in two-dimensional optical tweezer arrays, demonstrating a quantum phase transition and revealing new quantum phases of matter.

heading: Quantum simulation of 2D antiferromagnets with hundreds of Rydberg atoms
description: Programmable quantum simulation of two-dimensional antiferromagnets is achieved with up to 196 neutral atoms, and the capability of the platform is demonstrated on square and triangular arrays.

heading: BANP opens chromatin and activates CpG-island-regulated genes
description: BANP is identified as the transcription factor that binds the CGCG element in a DNA-methylation-dependent manner, opens chromatin and activates a class of essential CpG-island-regulated genes.

heading: r-Process elements from magnetorotational hypernovae
description: Observations of an extremely metal-poor star suggest that rapidly rotating massive stars with large magnetic fields were a source of r-process elements in the early Universe.

heading: Structure of a mammalian sperm cation channel complex
description: A structure of the sperm-specific CatSper complex features a number of additional components; together, these components and the CatSper complex are termed the CatSpermasome.

heading: Age-related immune response heterogeneity to SARS-CoV-2 vaccine BNT162b2
authors: Dami A. CollierIsabella A. T. M. FerreiraRavindra K. Gupta
description: Individuals over eighty years of age are less likely to mount a good immune response against SARS-CoV-2 (measured by neutralization titres) after the first dose of the BNT162b2 mRNA vaccine, but achieve good neutralization after the second dose.

heading: Demonstration of a trapped-ion atomic clock in space
authors: E. A. BurtJ. D. PrestageT. A. Ely
description: Operating in space, NASA’s Deep Space Atomic Clock, a trapped-ion clock, is shown to have long-term stability and drift that are an order of magnitude better than current space clocks.

heading: Signatures of Wigner crystal of electrons in a monolayer semiconductor
description: The signature of a Wigner crystal—the analogue of a solid phase for electrons—is observed via the optical reflection spectrum in a monolayer transition metal dichalcogenide.

heading: G-protein activation by a metabotropic glutamate receptor
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures show that metabotropic glutamate receptor 2 forms a dimer to which only one G protein is coupled, revealing the basis for asymmetric signal transduction.

heading: Bilayer Wigner crystals in a transition metal dichalcogenide heterostructure
description: Optical signatures reveal correlated insulating Wigner crystals—electron solids—in a bilayer of a two-dimensional transition metal dichalcogenide, MoSe2, with hexagonal boron nitride between the layers.

heading: Microbiota regulate social behaviour via stress response neurons in the brain
authors: Wei-Li WuMark D. AdameSarkis K. Mazmanian
description: The gut microbiota in mice can modulate social behaviour by influencing activity in stress-related brain areas.

heading: Shape of promoter antisense RNAs regulates ligand-induced transcription activation
description: The authors describe a role for the non-coding antisense transcripts produced at promoters in regulating ligand-induced activation of gene transcription.

heading: Cellular fluidics
authors: Nikola A. DudukovicErika J. FongEric B. Duoss
description: Cellular fluidics provides a platform of unit-cell-based, three-dimensional structures for the deterministic control of multiphase flow, transport and reaction processes.

heading: Untangling introductions and persistence in COVID-19 resurgence in Europe
description: In many European countries, more than half of the SARS-CoV-2 lineages circulating in late summer 2020 resulted from new introductions, highlighting the threat of viral dissemination when restrictions are lifted.

heading: Precise date for the Laacher See eruption synchronizes the Younger Dryas
description: A revised date for the Laacher See eruption using measurements of subfossil trees shifts the chronology of European varved lakes relative to the Greenland ice core record, synchronizing the onset of the Younger Dryas across the North Atlantic–European sector.

heading: A highly magnetized and rapidly rotating white dwarf as small as the Moon
authors: Ilaria CaiazzoKevin B. BurdgeMaayane T. Soumagnac
description: A binary star merger has produced a white dwarf with a spin period of under 7 minutes, a magnetic field of 600 to 900 million gauss and a radius only slightly larger than that of our Moon.

heading: cAMP binding to closed pacemaker ion channels is non-cooperative
