description: Direct monitoring of individual cAMP molecules binding to HCN ion channels reveals the binding dynamics underlying the distinct physiological responses of ion channel isoforms.

heading: Ridgecrest aftershocks at Coso suppressed by thermal destressing
description: Thirty years of geothermal heat production at Coso in California depleted shear stresses within the geothermal reservoir, which changed its faulting style and inhibited aftershocks from the 2019 Ridgecrest earthquake.

heading: Asymmetric activation of the calcium-sensing receptor homodimer
description: Cryo-EM structures of human calcium-sensing receptor reveal intrinsic asymmetry in the receptor homodimer upon activation that is stabilized by calcimimetic drugs adopting distinct poses in the two protomers, priming one protomer for G-protein coupling.

heading: Two chemoattenuated PfSPZ malaria vaccines induce sterile hepatic immunity
authors: Agnes Mwakingwe-OmariSara A. HealyPatrick E. Duffy
description: Two malaria vaccines comprising Plasmodium falciparum sporozoites and treatment with either pyrimethamine or chloroquine induced durable protective responses against both the African vaccine strain and a heterologous South American strain of P. falciparum.

heading: Photoinduced copper-catalysed asymmetric amidation via ligand cooperativity
authors: Caiyou ChenJonas C. PetersGregory C. Fu
description: In the presence of three ligands and light, two distinct copper catalysts combine to produce enantioenriched secondary amides from racemic alkyl electrophiles and primary amide nucleophiles.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccines induce persistent human germinal centre responses
authors: Jackson S. TurnerJane A. O’HalloranAli H. Ellebedy
description: Analysis of antigen-specific B cells in lymph nodes of individuals vaccinated with BNT162b2 reveals lasting germinal centre responses, explaining the robust humoral immunity induced by SARS-CoV-2 mRNA-based vaccines.

heading: Past, present and future stars that can see Earth as a transiting exoplanet
description: The Gaia database is used to identify stars from which astronomers on orbiting planets could see Earth transiting the Sun in the past, present and future.

heading: A catalysis-driven artificial molecular pump
authors: Shuntaro AmanoStephen D. P. FieldenDavid A. Leigh
description: A molecular-scale pump whose operation is driven by a catalytic process when in the presence of chemical fuel is autonomous, within an operating window, as long as the fuel lasts.

heading: Caloric restriction disrupts the microbiota and colonization resistance
authors: Reiner Jumpertz von SchwartzenbergJordan E. BisanzPeter J. Turnbaugh
description: Severe caloric restriction in humans leads to reversible changes in the gut microbiota that promote weight loss and the expansion of an enteric pathogen in mice.

heading: Molecular logic of cellular diversification in the mouse cerebral cortex
authors: Daniela J. Di BellaEhsan HabibiPaola Arlotta
description: A single-cell atlas of the developing mouse cortex provides a temporal and spatial assessment of the molecular logic that drives the establishment and organization of cortical cell types.

heading: Efficient Fizeau drag from Dirac electrons in monolayer graphene
description: Fizeau drag of plasmon polaritons by an electron flow in strongly biased monolayer graphene is directly observed by exploiting the high electron mobility and slow plasmon propagation of Dirac electrons.

heading: Fizeau drag in graphene plasmonics
description: Direct infrared nano-imaging of plasmonic waves in graphene carrying high current density reveals the Fizeau drag of plasmon polaritons by fast-moving quasi-relativistic electrons.

heading: Operando optical tracking of single-particle ion dynamics in batteries
description: The dynamics of ions within a working lithium-ion battery are examined using optical interferometric scattering microscopy, which allows ion transport to be related to phase transitions and microstructural features.

heading: Protective efficacy of Ad26.COV2.S against SARS-CoV-2 B.1.351 in macaques
authors: Jingyou YuLisa H. TostanoskiDan H. Barouch
description: SARS-CoV-2 challenge of rhesus macaques demonstrates that the Ad26.COV2.S vaccine induces robust protection against both the WA1/2020 isolate and the B.1.351 variant of concern.

heading: Evaluating microbiome-directed fibre snacks in gnotobiotic mice and humans
description: Fibre snacks that target distinct features of the microbiomes of donors with obesity transplanted into gnotobiotic mice also lead to fibre-specific changes in the microbiome and physiology when used in controlled-diet human studies.

heading: Obesity accelerates hair thinning by stem cell-centric converging mechanisms
description: Obesity in mice, caused by a high-fat diet, induces hair loss as a result of changes in the differentiation of hair follicle stem cells.

heading: Clonal fitness inferred from time-series modelling of single-cell cancer genomes
description: Whole-genome sequencing of human cancer cells in patient-derived mouse xenograft models indicates a key role for TP53 in determining the fitness landscape of polyclonal cancer cell populations.

heading: A transcriptional switch governs fibroblast activation in heart disease
description: BET proteins regulate a reversible transcriptional switch that governs fibroblast activation in heart disease through the transcription factor MEOX1.

heading: Phase separation drives aberrant chromatin looping and cancer development
authors: Jeong Hyun AhnEric S. DavisGang Greg Wang
description: The NUP98–HOXA9 oncogenic fusion protein found in leukaemia undergoes phase separation in the nucleus, which helps to promote activation of leukaemic genes and to establish aberrant chromatin looping.

heading: Limited potential for bird migration to disperse plants to cooler latitudes
description: Interactions between European bird and plant species show that fruiting period has a major effect on seed dispersal by migrating birds, which will influence plant adaptations to climate change through latitudinal dispersal.

heading: Mechanism of disease and therapeutic rescue of Dok7 congenital myasthenia
description: In a mouse model of congenital myasthenia caused by mutations in the Dok7 gene, agonist antibodies against MUSK restore synaptic function and survival.

heading: Magnetic sensitivity of cryptochrome 4 from a migratory songbird
authors: Jingjing XuLauren E. JarochaP. J. Hore
description: Cryptochrome 4 from the night-migratory European robin displays magnetically sensitive photochemistry in vitro, in which four successive flavin–tryptophan radical pairs generate magnetic-field effects and stabilize potential signalling states.

heading: Pleistocene sediment DNA reveals hominin and faunal turnovers at Denisova Cave
description: Ancient mitochondrial DNA from sediments reveals the sequence of Denisovan, Neanderthal and faunal occupation of Denisova Cave, and evidence for the appearance of modern humans at least 45,000 years ago.

heading: Accurately computing the electronic properties of a quantum ring
description: As a blueprint for high-precision quantum simulation, an 18-qubit algorithm that consists of more than 1,400 two-qubit gates is demonstrated, and reconstructs the energy eigenvalues of the simulated one-dimensional wire to a precision of 1 per cent.

heading: Aziridine synthesis by coupling amines and alkenes via an electrogenerated dication
authors: Dylan E. HolstDiana J. WangZachary K. Wickens
description: The synthesis of aziridines—three-membered nitrogen-containing heterocycles—is achieved by a new method involving the electrochemical coupling of alkenes and amines, via a dicationic intermediate.

heading: In vivo monoclonal antibody efficacy against SARS-CoV-2 variant strains
authors: Rita E. ChenEmma S. WinklerMichael S. Diamond
description: Experiments in mouse and hamster models show that monoclonal antibody combinations, using antibodies that correspond to products in clinical development, largely retain their efficacy in protecting against currently prevailing variant strains of SARS-CoV-2.

heading: Dysregulation of brain and choroid plexus cell types in severe COVID-19
description: Single-nucleus transcriptomes of frontal cortex and choroid plexus samples from patients with COVID-19 reveal pathological cell states that are similar to those associated with human neurodegenerative diseases and chronic brain disorders.

heading: Clusters of flowstone ages are not supported by statistical evidence
Reply to: Clusters of flowstone ages are not supported by statistical evidence
authors: Robyn PickeringAndy I. R. HerriesJohn Hancox

heading: Correlated charge noise and relaxation errors in superconducting qubits
description: Cosmic-ray particles and γ-rays striking superconducting circuits can generate qubit errors that are spatially correlated across several millimetres, hampering current error-correction approaches.

heading: Double-helical assembly of heterodimeric nanoclusters into supercrystals
description: Ligand-protected gold nanoclusters are engineered to form complex arrangements of double and quadruple helices, which are based on the pairing of motifs on neighbouring enantiomers, akin to the base pairing seen in DNA double helices.

heading: Tissue-resident macrophages provide a pro-tumorigenic niche to early NSCLC cells
description: Single-cell RNA sequencing and imaging of macrophages in human non-small cell lung cancer and in a mouse model of lung adenocarcinoma show that tissue-resident macrophages have a key role in early tumour progression.

heading: Symmetry-enforced topological nodal planes at the Fermi surface of a chiral magnet
description: Measurements on a chiral magnet show that non-symmorphic symmetries enforce topological crossings exactly at the Fermi level in certain materials; these crossings can be controlled by an applied magnetic field.

heading: ctDNA guiding adjuvant immunotherapy in urothelial carcinoma
description: The authors report on prospective exploratory analyses of circulating tumour DNA in an urothelial carcinoma immunotherapy clinical trial.

heading: GluD1 is a signal transduction device disguised as an ionotropic receptor
description: The ionotropic glutamate delta receptors GluD1 and GluD2 form distinct neurexin–cerebellin complexes that differentially regulate postsynaptic glutamate receptor activities.

heading: A dusty veil shading Betelgeuse during its Great Dimming
description: The southern hemisphere of Betelgeuse during its Great Dimming was an order of magnitude darker than usual, owing to a cool patch on the photosphere and associated dust formation.

heading: Global prevalence of non-perennial rivers and streams
description: Non-perennial rivers and streams are mapped globally, showing that more than half of rivers worldwide experience no flow for at least one day per year.

heading: Geometry of abstract learned knowledge in the hippocampus
authors: Edward H. NiehManuel SchottdorfDavid W. Tank
description: The hippocampus geometrically represents both physical location and abstract variables on a neural manifold in mice performing a decision-making task in virtual reality.

heading: Localization atomic force microscopy
description: A localization algorithm is applied to datasets obtained with conventional and high-speed atomic force microscopy to increase image resolution beyond the limits set by the radius of the tip used.

heading: Structures of Gi-bound metabotropic glutamate receptors mGlu2 and mGlu4
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of mGlu2 and mGlu4 bound to heterotrimeric Gi protein shed light on the molecular basis of asymmetric signal transduction by metabotropic glutamate receptors.

heading: Structural basis of omega-3 fatty acid transport across the blood–brain barrier
authors: Rosemary J. CaterGeok Lin ChuaFilippo Mancia
description: Cryo-electron microscopy and molecular dynamics simulations reveal how MFSD2A transports essential omega-3 fatty acids across the blood–brain and blood–retina barriers as lysolipids.

heading: Structures of human mGlu2 and mGlu7 homo- and heterodimers
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of homo- and heterodimers of mGlu2 and mGlu7 provide insights into their dimerization modes and the subunit conformational changes that characterize the activation of these class C G-protein-coupled receptors.

heading: Naturally enhanced neutralizing breadth against SARS-CoV-2 one year after infection
description: Antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 continue to evolve 6 to 12 months after infection in patients who have recovered from COVID-19, increasing in potency and breadth with time.

heading: BNT162b2-elicited neutralization of B.1.617 and other SARS-CoV-2 variants
description: Samples of serum from individuals immunized with the BNT162b2 vaccine show neutralization activity against engineered SARS-CoV-2s bearing the spike mutations from B.1.617 and other variants.

heading: Perovskite decomposition and missing crystal planes in HRTEM
Reply to: Perovskite decomposition and missing crystal planes in HRTEM
Experimental observation of non-Abelian topological charges and edge states
description: Non-Abelian topological charges and edge states in a PT-symmetric transmission line network are experimentally observed, and a non-Abelian quotient relation for the bulk–edge correspondence is found.

heading: Anisotropic satellite galaxy quenching modulated by black hole activity
description: An analysis of archival data from the Sloan Digital Sky Survey finds that star-forming satellite galaxies are relatively more common along the minor axis of central galaxies owing to the effect of black hole feedback.

heading: Representational drift in primary olfactory cortex
authors: Carl E. SchoonoverSarah N. OhashiAndrew J. P. Fink
description: All odours elicit a unique pattern of neuronal activity in primary olfactory cortex but these patterns drift over time, posing a problem for the perceptual constancy of odours.

heading: NORAD-induced Pumilio phase separation is required for genome stability
description: The noncoding RNA NORAD maintains genome stability in mammalian cells by sequestering Pumilio proteins in phase-separated compartments.

heading: Tracing the origin of hair follicle stem cells
description: Live imaging and single-cell transcriptomics of mouse hair follicles reveal their development from 2D concentric zones in the placode to 3D longitudinal compartments, one of which is a stem cell compartment.

heading: TIM-3 restrains anti-tumour immunity by regulating inflammasome activation
authors: Karen O. DixonMarcin TabakaVijay K. Kuchroo
description: Mouse genetic studies and single-cell transcriptome analysis demonstrate that TIM-3 on dendritic cells has a key role in regulating antitumour immunity via inflammasome activation and is a potential target for anticancer therapy.

heading:
A graph placement methodology for fast chip
            design
description:
Machine learning tools are used to greatly accelerate chip layout
                design, by posing chip floorplanning as a reinforcement learning problem and
                using neural networks to generate high-performance chip layouts.

heading: Concerted cutting by Spo11 illuminates meiotic DNA break mechanics
description: A small proportion of Spo11-dependent DNA double-strand breaks are ‘double cuts’—adjacent breaks that occur in concert—revealing that gap repair during meiosis includes that of DNA gaps generated by Spo11 itself.

heading: Observation of first and second sound in a BKT superfluid
description: First and second sound are experimentally observed in a two-dimensional superfluid, and the temperature-dependent sound speeds reveal the predicted jump in the superfluid density at the infinite-order Berezinskii–Kosterlitz–Thouless transition.

heading: Tomographic reconstruction of oxygen orbitals in lithium-rich battery materials
description: High-energy X-ray Compton measurements and first-principles modelling reveal how the electronic orbital responsible for the reversible anionic redox activity can be imaged and visualized, and its character and symmetry determined.

heading: Quantum-enhanced nonlinear microscopy
authors: Catxere A. CasacioLars S. MadsenWarwick P. Bowen
description: A quantum microscope obtains signal-to-noise beyond the photodamage limits of conventional microscopy, revealing biological structures within cells that would not otherwise be resolved.

heading: Immunogenicity of Ad26.COV2.S vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 variants in humans
description: Analysis of the immunogenicity of the Ad26.COV2.S vaccine against the B1.351 and P.1 SARS-CoV-2 variants of concern shows reduced neutralization antibody titres, but comparable T cell responses and antibody-dependent effector functions.

heading: Defining genome architecture at base-pair resolution
authors: Peng HuaMohsin BadatJames O. J. Davies
description: Micro Capture-C allows physical contacts to be determined at base-pair resolution, revealing that transcription factors have an important role in the maintenance of the contacts between enhancers and promoters.

heading: Spo11 generates gaps through concerted cuts at sites of topological stress
description: Meiotic recombination in yeast is not only initiated by single break sites, but also caused by closely spaced Spo11-dependent double-stranded DNA breaks that create chromosomal gaps.

heading: Nanobodies from camelid mice and llamas neutralize SARS-CoV-2 variants
description: Multivalent nanobodies against SARS-CoV-2 from mice engineered to produce camelid nanobodies recognize conserved epitopes that are inaccessible to human antibodies and show promise as a strategy for dealing with viral escape mutations.

heading: Spread of a SARS-CoV-2 variant through Europe in the summer of 2020
authors: Emma B. HodcroftMoira ZuberRichard A. Neher
description: Analysis of the spread of the 20E (EU1) variant of SARS-CoV-2 through Europe suggests that international travel and insufficient containment, rather than increased transmissibility, led to a resurgence of infections.

heading: Nasal delivery of an IgM offers broad protection from SARS-CoV-2 variants
description: An engineered IgM antibody administered intranasally in mice shows high prophylactic efficacy and therapeutic efficacy against SARS-CoV-2, and is also effective against multiple variants of concern that are resistant to IgG-based therapeutics.

heading: Possible overestimation of isomer depletion due to contamination
Reply to: Possible overestimation of isomer depletion due to contamination
authors: C. J. ChiaraJ. J. CarrollA. B. Hayes

heading: Intrinsic toughening and stable crack propagation in hexagonal boron nitride
description: Single-crystal monolayer hexagonal boron nitride is unexpectedly tough owing to its asymmetric lattice structure, which facilitates repeated crack deflection, crack branching and edge swapping, enhancing energy dissipation.

heading: Widespread deoxygenation of temperate lakes
authors: Stephen F. JaneGretchen J. A. HansenKevin C. Rose
description: Analysis of temperate lakes finds a widespread decline in dissolved oxygen concentrations in surface and deep waters, which is associated with reduced solubility at warmer surface water temperatures and increased stratification at depth.

heading: Hepatic stellate cells suppress NK cell-sustained breast cancer dormancy
authors: Ana Luísa CorreiaJoao C. GuimaraesMohamed Bentires-Alj
description: Liver-resident natural killer (NK) cells sustain the dormancy of disseminated breast cancer cells, and a decrease in NK cells and increase in activated hepatic stellate cells is associated with the formation of liver metastases.

heading: Tracing oncogene-driven remodelling of the intestinal stem cell niche
authors: Min Kyu YumSeungmin HanBenjamin D. Simons
description: By inducing changes in surrounding tissue, mutant intestinal stem cells create an unfavourable niche environment that gives them a competitive advantage over non-mutant neighbours.

heading: Apc-mutant cells act as supercompetitors in intestinal tumour initiation
authors: Sanne M. van NeervenNina E. de GrootLouis Vermeulen
description: Using experiments in organoids and in vivo in mice, the authors show that Apc-mutant cells act as supercompetitors to initiate the formation of adenomas.

heading: Signatures of moiré trions in WSe2/MoSe2 heterobilayers
description: Optical experiments on WSe2/MoSe2 heterobilayers reveal signatures of moiré trions, including interlayer emission with sharp lines and a complex charge-density dependence, features that differ markedly from those of conventional trions.

heading: CO2 doping of organic interlayers for perovskite solar cells
description: CO2 and ultraviolet light are used to initiate the p-type doping of spiro-OMeTAD:LiTFSI films, which show enhanced efficiencies when used as hole-transporting layers in solar cells and have shorter fabrication times compared with interlayers doped using conventional methods.

heading: NOTUM from Apc-mutant cells biases clonal competition to initiate cancer
authors: Dustin J. FlanaganNalle PentinmikkoOwen J. Sansom
description: NOTUM from Apc-mutant cells acts as a key mediator during the early stages of mutation fixation and drives the formation of intestinal adenomas.

heading: Asymmetric response of interfacial water to applied electric fields
description: Experimental measurements of vibrational sum-frequency generation spectra indicate that the dielectric response of water near an electrode may be strongly asymmetric, with different responses to positive and negative electrode charge.

heading: Gating and modulation of a hetero-octameric AMPA glutamate receptor
authors: Danyang ZhangJake F. WatsonIngo H. Greger
description: Analyses of AMPA receptor–auxiliary subunit complexes provide insights into the gating and modulation of the AMPA receptor by TARP-γ8 and CNIH2.

heading: A proximity-dependent biotinylation map of a human cell
authors: Christopher D. GoJames D. R. KnightAnne-Claude Gingras
description: A proximity-dependent biotinylation technique defines the location of more than 4,000 proteins in a human cell, and almost 36,000 proximal interactions between proteins, including those at the interface of the mitochondria and ER.

heading: Telecom-heralded entanglement between multimode solid-state quantum memories
description: Robust heralded entanglement between two solid-state quantum memories with temporal multiplexing is realized using photons at telecommunication wavelengths.

heading: Heralded entanglement distribution between two absorptive quantum memories
description: Heralded entanglement is realized between two solid-state absorptive quantum memories 3.5 metres apart and with a bandwidth of 1 gigahertz, and with a fidelity of approximately 80%.

heading: Base editing of haematopoietic stem cells rescues sickle cell disease in mice
authors: Gregory A. NewbyJonathan S. YenDavid R. Liu
description: A custom adenine base editor can edit the variant of the β-globin gene that causes sickle cell disease into a non-pathogenic variant in human and mouse cells, and transplantation of the edited cells rescues sickle cell disease in mice.

heading: BNT162b2 vaccine induces neutralizing antibodies and poly-specific T cells in humans
description: In a phase-I/II trial in healthy adults, the BNT162b2 vaccine induces neutralizing antibodies and poly-specific T cells against SARS-CoV-2 epitopes that are conserved in a wide range of currently circulating variants.

heading: Swarm Learning for decentralized and confidential clinical machine learning
description: Swarm Learning is a decentralized machine learning approach that outperforms classifiers developed at individual sites for COVID-19 and other diseases while preserving confidentiality and privacy.

heading: RETRACTED ARTICLE: A 10 per cent increase in global land evapotranspiration from 2003 to 2019
description: Using a global mass-balance approach to calculate evapotranspiration, it is shown that global land evapotranspiration increased by 10% between 2003 and 2019, driven mainly by warming land temperatures.

heading: Intercalated amygdala clusters orchestrate a switch in fear state
description: Distinct clusters of inhibitory neurons in the mouse amygdala perform opposing roles in fear extinction.

heading: Structural basis of antifolate recognition and transport by PCFT
authors: Joanne L. ParkerJustin C. DemeSimon Newstead
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of PCFT in a substrate-free state and bound to the antifolate drug pemetrexed provide insights into how this protein recognizes folates and mediates their transport into cells.

heading: Mesozoic cupules and the origin of the angiosperm second integument
description: Analysis of recurved cupules from a newly discovered Early Cretaceous silicified peat in Inner Mongolia, China and comparison with other potentially related Mesozoic plant fossils provides insight into the origins of angiosperms.

heading: Enhancer release and retargeting activates disease-susceptibility genes
description: Disruption of a promoter can release its partner enhancer to activate other promoters in the same contact domain, and this process, named ‘enhancer release and retargeting’, can often lead to gene alterations that cause disease.

heading: Long-range nontopological edge currents in charge-neutral graphene
description: Nanoscale imaging of edge currents in charge-neutral graphene shows that charge accumulation can explain various exotic nonlocal transport measurements, bringing into question some theories about their origins.

heading: A phase-separated nuclear GBPL circuit controls immunity in plants
description: A family of plant guanylate-binding protein-like GTPases controls phase separation and assembly of condensates, thereby forming a circuit that regulates transcriptional responses to biotic stress.

heading: Perovskite-type superlattices from lead halide perovskite nanocubes
description: Through precise structural engineering, perovskite nanocrystals are co-assembled with other nanocrystal materials to form a range of binary and ternary perovskite-type superlattices that exhibit superfluorescence.

heading: Evidence of hydrogen−helium immiscibility at Jupiter-interior conditions
description: Hydrogen and helium mixtures can be compressed to the extreme temperature and pressure conditions found in the interior of Jupiter and Saturn, and the immiscibility revealed supports models of Jupiter that invoke a layered interior.

heading: The universal visitation law of human mobility
description: Using large-scale mobility data from diverse cities around the globe, a simple and robust scaling law that captures the temporal and spatial range of population movement is revealed.

heading: MARK4 controls ischaemic heart failure through microtubule detyrosination
description: MARK4 regulates cardiomyocyte contractility by promoting MAP4 phosphorylation, which facilitates the access of VASH2 to microtubules for the detyrosination of α-tubulin; MARK4 deficiency after acute myocardial infarction limits the reduction in the left ventricular ejection fraction.

heading: An invariant Trypanosoma vivax vaccine antigen induces protective immunity
description: Systemic genome-led vaccinology and a mouse model of Trypanosoma vivax infection identify protective invariant subunit vaccine antigens, and demonstrate the possibility of generating effective vaccines that induce long-lasting protection against trypanosome infections.

heading: NF1 mutation drives neuronal activity-dependent initiation of optic glioma
authors: Yuan PanJared D. HysingerDavid H. Gutmann
description: Mouse models of NF1-associated optic pathway glioma show that tumour initiation and growth are driven by aberrantly high levels of NLGN3 shedding in the optic nerve in response to retinal neuron activity.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 infection induces long-lived bone marrow plasma cells in humans
authors: Jackson S. TurnerWooseob KimAli H. Ellebedy
description: SARS-CoV-2 infection induces long-lived bone marrow plasma cells that correlate with anti-SARS-CoV-2 spike protein antibody titres in individuals who have recovered from COVID-19.

heading: A radical approach for the selective C–H borylation of azines
description: Selective borylation of azines—nitrogen-containing aromatic heterocycles used in the synthesis of many pharmaceuticals—is made possible by forming a radical from an aminoborane using a photocatalyst.

heading: Iron and nickel atoms in cometary atmospheres even far from the Sun
description: High-resolution ultraviolet and optical spectra of a large sample of comets show that Fe i and Ni i lines are ubiquitous, even when the comets are far from the Sun.

heading: Overwintering fires in boreal forests
description: Large forest fires in Alaska and the Northwest Territories can ‘overwinter’ and then reignite in the following fire season, contributing up to one-third of the burned area in individual years.

heading: Discovery, characterization and engineering of ligases for amide synthesis
description: A family of enzymes—coronafacic acid ligases, involved in the synthesis of bacterial phytotoxins—are found to catalyse amide bond formation with a wide range of substrates.

heading: In vivo CRISPR base editing of PCSK9 durably lowers cholesterol in primates
description: In a cynomolgus macaque model, CRISPR base editors delivered in lipid nanoparticles are shown to efficiently and stably knock down PCSK9 in the liver to reduce levels of PCSK9 and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

heading: Precision test of statistical dynamics with state-to-state ultracold chemistry
description: The chemical reaction 2KRb → K2 + Rb2 is studied under ultralow temperatures at the quantum state-to-state level, allowing unprecedented details of the reaction dynamics to be observed.

heading: Tunable non-integer high-harmonic generation in a topological insulator
description: High-harmonic generation from the Dirac-like surface state of a topological insulator is separated from bulk contributions and continuously tuned by the carrier-envelope phase of the driving lightwave.

heading: Gaseous atomic nickel in the coma of interstellar comet 2I/Borisov
description: Atomic nickel vapour is found in the cold coma of the interstellar comet 2I/Borisov at a distance of 2.3 astronomical units, equivalent to an equilibrium temperature of 180 kelvin.

heading: Diverse functional autoantibodies in patients with COVID-19
authors: Eric Y. WangTianyang MaoAaron M. Ring
description: Rapid extracellular antigen profiling of a cohort of 194 individuals infected with SARS-CoV-2 uncovers diverse autoantibody responses that affect COVID-19 disease severity, progression and clinical and immunological characteristics.

heading: MIR-NATs repress MAPT translation and aid proteostasis in neurodegeneration
description: The natural antisense transcript MAPT-AS1 interferes with translation of mRNA transcript into tau protein in the brain and may represent a general mechanism for controlling levels of intrinsically disordered proteins, with particular relevance for neurodegeneration.

heading: Sensory neuron-derived TAFA4 promotes macrophage tissue repair functions
description: Specialized somatosensory neurons that express Gαi-interacting protein (GINIP) promote tissue repair in a model of UV-induced skin damage by secreting the neuropeptide TAFA4, which regulates skin-resident macrophages to release IL-10 and limit fibrosis.

heading: The nutritional quality of cereals varies geospatially in Ethiopia and Malawi
authors: D. GashuP. C. NalivataM. R. Broadley
description: Geospatial variation in the micronutrient composition (calcium, iron, selenium and zinc) of staple cereal grains is nutritionally important at subnational scales in Ethiopia and Malawi; these data could be used to improve surveillance of micronutrient deficiencies in the region.

heading: Ubiquitylation of lipopolysaccharide by RNF213 during bacterial infection
description: Upon Salmonella invasion of the mammalian cytosol, ubiquitylation of a non-proteinaceous substrate—the lipid A moiety of bacterial lipopolysaccharide—by the E3 ubiquitin ligase RNF213 marks the bacteria as cargo for antibacterial autophagy.

heading: Cortex-dependent corrections as the tongue reaches for and misses targets
authors: Tejapratap BolluBrendan S. ItoJesse H. Goldberg
description: Three-dimensional imaging of the lingual kinematics of mice drinking from a water spout reveals that successful licks have the hallmarks of online motor control, requiring rapid adjustments controlled by anterolateral motor cortex.

heading: Interpreting type 1 diabetes risk with genetics and single-cell epigenomics
authors: Joshua ChiouRyan J. GeuszKyle J. Gaulton
description: A genome-wide association study combined with single-cell epigenomics identifies risk loci for type 1 diabetes.

heading: Ultrahigh-energy photons up to 1.4 petaelectronvolts from 12 γ-ray Galactic sources
description: Observations of γ-rays with energies up to 1.4 PeV find that 12 sources in the Galaxy are PeVatrons, one of which is the Crab Nebula.

heading: Skeletal editing through direct nitrogen deletion of secondary amines
authors: Sean H. KennedyBalu D. DherangeMark D. Levin
description: Nitrogen is ‘deleted’ from secondary amines using anomeric amide reagents, which react with the amine to form an isodiazene, after which nitrogen gas is released and the resulting carbon radicals combine to form a carbon–carbon bond.

heading: Thymic development of gut-microbiota-specific T cells
authors: Daniel F. Zegarra-RuizDasom V. KimGretchen E. Diehl
description: In young mice, antigens from the gut microbiota are trafficked by CX3CR1+ dendritic cells from the gut to the thymus, where they induce the expansion of T cells that are specific to commensal microorganisms.

heading: Structure and dynamics of a mycobacterial type VII secretion system
authors: Catalin M. BunducDirk FahrenkampThomas C. Marlovits
description: A cryo-electron microscopy structure of the inner membrane complex of the ESX-5 type VII secretion system of Mycobacterium tuberculosis reveals an important role of interactions with MycP5 protease for complex integrity.

heading: Ultralow contact resistance between semimetal and monolayer semiconductors
description: Electric contacts of semimetallic bismuth on monolayer semiconductors are shown to suppress metal-induced gap states and thus have very low contact resistance and a zero Schottky barrier height.

heading: Structures of telomerase at several steps of telomere repeat synthesis
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of Tetrahymena telomerase with telomeric DNA at several steps of nucleotide addition provide insights into the structural basis of telomere repeat synthesis.

heading: Lineage tracing of human development through somatic mutations
authors: Michael Spencer ChapmanAnna Maria RanzoniAna Cvejic
description: Whole-genome sequencing of haematopoietic colonies from human fetuses reveals the somatic mutations acquired by individual progenitors, which are used as barcodes to construct a phylogenetic tree of blood development.

heading: High-performance brain-to-text communication via handwriting
authors: Francis R. WillettDonald T. AvansinoKrishna V. Shenoy
description: A brain–computer interface enables rapid communication through neural decoding of attempted handwriting movements in a person with paralysis.

heading: DHODH-mediated ferroptosis defence is a targetable vulnerability in cancer
description: DHO dehydrogenase regulates ferroptosis by preventing mitochondrial lipid peroxidation and its inhibition suppresses growth in tumours with low levels of GPX4.

heading: Reconstruction of ancient microbial genomes from the human gut
authors: Marsha C. WibowoZhen YangAleksandar D. Kostic
description: Ancient microbiomes from palaeofaeces are more similar to non-industrialized than industrialized human gut microbiomes regardless of geography, but 39% of their de novo reconstructed genomes represent previously undescribed microbial species.

heading: Cross-tissue organization of the fibroblast lineage
authors: Matthew B. BuechlerRachana N. PradhanShannon. J. Turley
description: Single-cell and genetic tools are used to characterize the diversity of fibroblasts across healthy and perturbed tissues in mice and humans.

heading: CMOS-based cryogenic control of silicon quantum circuits
authors: Xiao XueBishnu PatraLieven M. K. Vandersypen
description: A cryogenic CMOS control chip operating at 3 K is used to demonstrate coherent control and simple algorithms on silicon qubits operating at 20 mK.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 uses a multipronged strategy to impede host protein synthesis
description: RNA sequencing, ribosome profiling and metabolic labelling of newly synthesized RNA reveal the strategy used by SARS-CoV-2 to shut off cellular protein synthesis in the host and allow the translation of viral transcripts.

heading: An aged immune system drives senescence and ageing of solid organs
authors: Matthew J. YousefzadehRafael R. FloresLaura J. Niedernhofer
description: An aged, senescent immune system has a causal role in driving systemic ageing, and the targeting of senescent immune cells with senolytic drugs has the potential to suppress morbidities associated with old age.

heading: Ubiquitous atmospheric production of organic acids mediated by cloud droplets
description: The oxidation of hydrated formaldehyde from cloud droplets is the dominant source of atmospheric formic acid, increasing atmospheric acidity by reducing cloud and rainwater pH.

heading: Widespread six degrees Celsius cooling on land during the Last Glacial Maximum
description: Analyses and modelling of noble gases in groundwater show that the mean annual surface temperatures of low-altitude, low-to-mid-latitude land masses were about 6 °C cooler during the Last Glacial Maximum than during the Late Holocene.

heading: A dynamic stability design strategy for lithium metal solid state batteries
description: A multi-layered electrolyte, in which a less stable electrolyte is sandwiched between two electrolyte layers that are more stable, can inhibit the growth of lithium dendrites in highly pressurized solid-state lithium metal batteries.

heading: Hippocampal AMPA receptor assemblies and mechanism of allosteric inhibition
description: Analyses of hippocampal AMPA receptor–auxiliary subunit complexes provide insights into the predominant assemblies and organization of the AMPA receptor, TARP-γ8 and CNIH2/SynDIG4 and explain the mechanism of inhibition of a clinically relevant, brain-region-specific allosteric inhibitor.

heading: The epidemiological impact of the NHS COVID-19 app
description: Statistical analysis of COVID-19 transmission among users of a smartphone-based digital contact-tracing app suggests that such apps can be an effective measure for reducing disease spread.

heading: Mitochondrial TNAP controls thermogenesis by hydrolysis of phosphocreatine
authors: Yizhi SunJanane F. RahbaniBruce M. Spiegelman
description: Tissue nonspecific alkaline phosphatase (TNAP) within mitochondria hydrolyses phosphocreatine to initiate a futile cycle of creatine dephosphorylation and phosphorylation in thermogenic fat cells.

heading: RNA transcripts stimulate homologous recombination by forming DR-loops
description: RNA transcripts stimulate homologous recombination through the formation of DR-loops, intermediate structures that contain both DNA–DNA and DNA–RNA hybrids.

heading: Neutralizing antibody vaccine for pandemic and pre-emergent coronaviruses
authors: Kevin O. SaundersEsther LeeBarton F. Haynes
description: Immunization of macaques with nanoparticle-conjugated receptor-binding domain of SARS-CoV-2 adjuvanted with 3M-052 and alum results in cross-neutralizing antibodies against bat coronaviruses, SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 variants, and may provide a platform for developing pan-coronavirus vaccines.

heading: Correlative operando microscopy of oxygen evolution electrocatalysts
authors: J. Tyler MeffordAndrew R. AkbashevWilliam C. Chueh
description: Mapping the operational chemical, physical and electronic structure of an oxygen evolution electrocatalyst at the nanoscale links the properties of the material with the observed oxygen evolution activity.

heading: ARAF mutations confer resistance to the RAF inhibitor belvarafenib in melanoma
description: The development, characterization and phase I clinical testing of the RAF inhibitor belvarafenib in cancer and a new resistance mechanism mediated by ARAF mutations are described.

heading: Rashba valleys and quantum Hall states in few-layer black arsenic
description: Two-dimensional electronic systems in few-layer black arsenic show gate-tunable Rashba bands with unique spin–valley flavours and unconventional quantum Hall states due to synergetic spin–orbit coupling and the Stark effect.

heading: Response of the microbiome–gut–brain axis in Drosophila to amino acid deficit
description: In Drosophila, an amino acid deficit triggers the expression of the neuropeptide CNMamide in gut enterocytes, which promotes a compensatory appetite for essential over non-essential amino acids, and this process is modulated by the microbiome.

heading: Distinct fission signatures predict mitochondrial degradation or biogenesis
description: Mitochondrial fission at the organelle periphery generates small daughter mitochondria that are removed by mitophagy whereas fission at the midzone leads to proliferation.

heading: A lysine–cysteine redox switch with an NOS bridge regulates enzyme function
authors: Marie WensienFabian Rabe von PappenheimKai Tittmann
description: A NOS bridge between cysteine and lysine residues serves as an allosteric redox switch in the transaldolase enzyme of Neisseria gonorrhoeae, demonstrating the existence of protein regulatory switches that contain covalent crosslinks other than disulfides.

heading: Epigenetic silencing by SETDB1 suppresses tumour intrinsic immunogenicity
authors: Gabriel K. GriffinJingyi WuBradley E. Bernstein
description: A CRISPR–Cas9 screen of chromatin regulators in mouse tumour models treated with immune checkpoint blockade identifies SETDB1 as an epigenetic checkpoint protein that suppresses tumour-intrinsic immunogenicity.

heading: Earliest known human burial in Africa
description: The earliest known human burial in Africa, that of a young child, is dated to around 78,000 years ago.

heading: The Paris Climate Agreement and future sea-level rise from Antarctica
description: An observationally calibrated ice sheet–shelf model suggests that global warming of 3 °C will trigger rapid Antarctic ice loss, contributing about 0.5 cm per year of sea-level rise by 2100.

heading: Fast odour dynamics are encoded in the olfactory system and guide behaviour
description: Fast temporal dynamics of the olfactory environment can be perceived by mice and used to perform scene segmentation.

heading: Polypeptide organic radical batteries
authors: Tan P. NguyenAlexandra D. EasleyKaren L. Wooley
description: An environmentally friendly, all-organic radical battery is demonstrated, in which redox-active polypeptides perform as both cathode and anode materials, with a metal-free organic electrolyte.

heading: Jets from MRC 0600-399 bent by magnetic fields in the cluster Abell 3376
authors: James O. ChibuezeHaruka SakemiTsutomu T. Takeuchi
description: Radio observations of the cluster Abell 3376, combined with numerical modelling, attribute the bent jets associated with the second-brightest galaxy in the cluster to an ordered magnetic field at the discontinuity.

heading: A high-quality bonobo genome refines the analysis of hominid evolution
authors: Yafei MaoClaudia R. CatacchioEvan E. Eichler
description: A high-quality bonobo genome assembly provides insights into incomplete lineage sorting in hominids and its relevance to gene evolution and the genetic relationship among living hominids.

heading: Replication stress promotes cell elimination by extrusion
authors: Vivek K. DwivediCarlos Pardo-PastorH. Robert Horvitz
description: A cell-cycle checkpoint triggers the extrusion of both nematode and mammalian cells experiencing replication stress.

heading: Projected land ice contributions to twenty-first-century sea level rise
description: Efficient statistical emulation of melting land ice under various climate scenarios to 2100 indicates a contribution from melting land ice to sea level increase of at least 13 centimetres sea level equivalent.

heading: Global miRNA dosage control of embryonic germ layer specification
description: The levels of microRNAs in mouse and human cells control lipid metabolism and germ cell specification during development.

heading: AI-based pathology predicts origins for cancers of unknown primary
authors: Ming Y. LuTiffany Y. ChenFaisal Mahmood
description: A deep-learning-based algorithm uses routinely acquired histology slides to provide a differential diagnosis for the origin of the primary tumour for complicated cases of metastatic tumours and cancers of unknown primary origin.

heading: COVID-19 tissue atlases reveal SARS-CoV-2 pathology and cellular targets
authors: Toni M. DeloreyCarly G. K. ZieglerAviv Regev
description: Single-cell analysis of lung, heart, kidney and liver autopsy samples shows the molecular and cellular changes and immune response resulting from severe COVID-19 infection.

heading: A molecular single-cell lung atlas of lethal COVID-19
description: Lung samples collected soon after death from COVID-19 are used to provide a single-cell atlas of SARS-CoV-2 infection and the ensuing molecular changes.

heading: Quantifying forest change in the European Union
authors: Iddo K. WernickPhilippe CiaisPekka E. Kauppi

heading: Phosphorus-mediated sp2–sp3 couplings for C–H fluoroalkylation of azines
description: Bench-stable fluoroalkylphosphine reagents are used to form C–CF2X bonds in a one-pot process, reliably fluoroalkylating pyridine building blocks and drug and agrochemical intermediates.

heading: Reply to Wernick, I. K. et al.; Palahí, M. et al.
Concerns about reported harvests in European forests
Direct assessment of the acidity of individual surface hydroxyls
description: Non-contact atomic force microscopy measurements are used to probe the hydrogen bond strength of individual surface hydroxyl groups and determine their acidity with atomic precision.

heading: Towards complete and error-free genome assemblies of all vertebrate species
authors: Arang RhieShane A. McCarthyErich D. Jarvis
description: The Vertebrate Genome Project has used an optimized pipeline to generate high-quality genome assemblies for sixteen species (representing all major vertebrate classes), which have led to new biological insights.

heading: Universal nomenclature for oxytocin–vasotocin ligand and receptor families
description: A revised, universal nomenclature for the vertebrate genes that encode the oxytocin and vasopressin–vasotocin ligands and receptors will improve our understanding of gene evolution and facilitate the translation of findings across species.

heading: Direct observation of chemical short-range order in a medium-entropy alloy
description: Direct experimental evidence of chemical short-range atomic-scale ordering (CSRO) in a VCoNi medium-entropy alloy is provided via diffraction and electron microscopy, analysed from specific crystallographic directions.

heading: Expanded diversity of Asgard archaea and their relationships with eukaryotes
description: Comparative analysis of 162 genomes of Asgard archaea results in six newly proposed phyla, including a deep branch that is provisionally named Wukongarchaeota, and sheds light on the evolutionary history of this clade.

heading: Plume-driven recratonization of deep continental lithospheric mantle
authors: Jingao LiuD. Graham PearsonJohn P. Armstrong
description: Upwelling of mantle plumes is proposed as a mechanism for craton healing after substantial disruption of their roots, enabling them to return to their original lithospheric thickness.

heading: PIK3CA and CCM mutations fuel cavernomas through a cancer-like mechanism
authors: Aileen A. RenDaniel A. SnellingsMark L. Kahn
description: Aggressive cerebral cavernous malformations (CCMs) are found to grow through a three-hit cancer-like mechanism, involving gain of function of a gene that promotes vascular growth, and loss of function of genes that suppress it.

heading: Coupling of activity, metabolism and behaviour across the Drosophila brain
description: Two-photon microscopy across the fly brain using sensors that permit simultaneous measurement of neural activity and metabolic flux reveals global and local coordination of neural activity and energy metabolism.

heading: Transition from an atomic to a molecular Bose–Einstein condensate
description: A Bose-Einstein condensate of molecules is produced by pairing atoms in an atomic condensate; this transition is the bosonic analog of the Bardeen-Cooper-Schrieffer superfluid to BEC crossover in Fermi gases.

heading: Structural basis of GABAB receptor–Gi protein coupling
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structure of heterodimeric GABAB receptor in complex with Gi1 protein reveals that the mode of G-protein binding in this class-C G-protein-coupled receptor differs from that of other classes.

heading: Evolutionary and biomedical insights from a marmoset diploid genome assembly
description: A trio-binning approach is used to produce a fully haplotype-resolved diploid genome assembly for the common marmoset, providing insight into the heterozygosity spectrum and the evolution of the sex-differentiation region.

heading: Accelerated global glacier mass loss in the early twenty-first century
description: Analysis of satellite stereo imagery uncovers two decades of mass change for all of Earth’s glaciers, revealing accelerated glacier shrinkage and regionally contrasting changes consistent with decadal climate variability.

heading: C. difficile exploits a host metabolite produced during toxin-mediated disease
description: RNA-sequencing experiments determine that sorbitol, a metabolite produced by the host enzyme aldose reductase, is exploited by Clostridium difficile in its adaptation to inflammatory conditions in the gut.

heading: X-ray quasi-periodic eruptions from two previously quiescent galaxies
description: X-ray quasi-periodic eruptions are detected from two previously inactive galaxies, with observations suggesting that the very-high-amplitude X-ray bursts may arise from an orbiting compact object.

heading: Strongly reducing magnesium(0) complexes
description: Strongly reducing β-diketiminate complexes containing magnesium in its zero oxidation state are reported, among which is a compound with a linear triatomic Mg–Mg–Mg core.

heading: Meningeal lymphatics affect microglia responses and anti-Aβ immunotherapy
description: Meningeal lymphatic drainage can affect the microglial inflammatory response and anti-amyloid-β immunotherapy in mouse models of Alzheimer’s disease.

heading: Somatic mutation landscapes at single-molecule resolution
authors: Federico AbascalLuke M. R. HarveyIñigo Martincorena
description: NanoSeq is used to detect mutations in single DNA molecules and analyses show that mutational processes that are independent of cell division are important contributors to somatic mutagenesis.

heading: Small-molecule inhibition of METTL3 as a strategy against myeloid leukaemia
description: Treatment with a specific inhibitor of the N6-methyladenosine methyltransferase METTL3 leads to reduced growth of cancer cells, indicating the potential of approaches targeting RNA-modifying enzymes for anticancer therapy.

heading: Structure of the human Mediator–RNA polymerase II pre-initiation complex
description: The structure of a recombinant 20-subunit version of human Mediator bound to the transcription pre-initiation complex is determined, providing insight into the regulation of RNA polymerase II initiation.

heading: Structures of mammalian RNA polymerase II pre-initiation complexes
description: The high-resolution structure of the mammalian pre-initiation complex in different functional states provides detailed insights into the mechanism of transcription initiation.

heading: High-dimensional characterization of post-acute sequelae of COVID-19
description: Healthcare data from the US Department of Veterans Affairs are used to characterize the six-month incident sequelae of individuals who survive for at least thirty days after developing COVID-19.

heading: All-sky dynamical response of the Galactic halo to the Large Magellanic Cloud
authors: Charlie ConroyRohan P. NaiduBenjamin D. Johnson
description: The detection of structure in the distribution of giant stars in the outer Galactic halo shows the substantial global impact of the Magellanic clouds on our Galaxy.

heading: High CO2 levels drive the TCA cycle backwards towards autotrophy
description: In the deltaproteobacterium Hippea maritima, the tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle can be reversed by high partial pressures of CO2 for the autotrophic fixation of carbon.

heading: Multistable inflatable origami structures at the metre scale
description: Origami-inspired multistable structures that can be inflated from flat to three dimensions have been designed; a library of foldable shapes is created and then combined to build metre-scale functional structures.

heading: Gasdermin D pore structure reveals preferential release of mature interleukin-1
description: A cryo-electron microscopy study of the gasdermin D pore reveals a model of pore assembly and a charge-based mechanism for the preferential release of mature cytokines.

heading: Equity is more important for the social cost of methane than climate uncertainty
description: Accounting for equity influences the social cost of methane more than climate model uncertainty does and produces results that differ by over an order of magnitude between low- and high-income regions.

heading: Overriding water table control on managed peatland greenhouse gas emissions
description: Halving average drainage depths in agricultural peatlands could reduce greenhouse gas emissions by the equivalent of 1 per cent of all anthropogenic emissions.

heading: Mouse prefrontal cortex represents learned rules for categorization
description: Neurons in the mouse medial prefrontal cortex acquire category-selective responses with learning.

heading: A single-molecule van der Waals compass
description: The orientation of a rotating para-xylene molecule in the nanochannel of a zeolite framework can be visualised by electron microscopy to determine the host–guest van der Waals interaction inside the channel.

heading: Unveiling African rainforest composition and vulnerability to global change
description: A large dataset of 6 million trees from 193 taxa is used to map the floristic and functional composition of central African forests and predict their vulnerability to climate change.

heading: Near-complete depolymerization of polyesters with nano-dispersed enzymes
description: Nanoscopic dispersion of enzymes with deep active sites enables chain-end-mediated processive biodegradation of semi-crystalline polyesters with programmable latency and material integrity.

heading: High-entropy ejecta plumes in Cassiopeia A from neutrino-driven convection
description: The abundances of stable Ti and Cr relative to Fe observed in the Cassiopeia A core-collapse supernova remnant reveal that Ti and Cr must have formed in neutrino-driven plumes that helped to drive the explosion.

heading: Structure of human telomerase holoenzyme with bound telomeric DNA
authors: George E. GhanimAdam J. FountainThi Hoang Duong Nguyen
description: A high-resolution structure of human telomerase bound to telomeric DNA reveals details of telomerase assembly and its active site, and sheds light on how mutations alter telomerase function.

heading: A highly stable and flexible zeolite electrolyte solid-state Li–air battery
description: Flexible, stable and energy-dense solid-state Li–air batteries are realised using ultrathin, chemically inert ion-conductive zeolite membranes as a solid electrolyte.

heading: Adjuvanting a subunit COVID-19 vaccine to induce protective immunity
authors: Prabhu S. ArunachalamAlexandra C. WallsBali Pulendran
description: Trials in rhesus macaques show that a subunit vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, comprising the spike protein receptor-binding domain displayed on a nanoparticle protein scaffold, produces a robust protective response against the virus.

heading: HP1 drives de novo 3D genome reorganization in early Drosophila embryos
description: The heterochromatin protein HP1 has an essential role in establishing several features of the 3D nuclear organization of the genome during early embryonic development in Drosophila.

heading: Liquid-induced topological transformations of cellular microstructures
description: A two-tiered dynamic design strategy achieves topological transformations of two-dimensional polymeric cellular microstructures in a reversible and temporally controllable manner through exposure to different liquids.

heading: A quantum magnetic analogue to the critical point of water
authors: J. Larrea JiménezS. P. G. CroneF. Mila
description: The pressure dependence and magnetic field dependence of the specific heat of a quantum magnet, SrCu2(BO3)2, demonstrate that its phase diagram contains a line of first-order transitions terminating at a critical point, in analogy with water.

heading: Dynamics of large effusive eruptions driven by caldera collapse
description: A model for eruptions resulting in caldera collapse reconciles observations of quasi-periodic stick–slip events along annular faults and the large erupted volumes characteristic of such events, highlighting the role of topography-generated pressures.

heading: CRL4AMBRA1 is a master regulator of D-type cyclins
description: Biochemical and genetics studies identify CRL4AMBRA1 as the ubiquitin ligase that has a key role in regulating the stability of D-type cyclins during cell-cycle progression.

heading: The antibiotic darobactin mimics a β-strand to inhibit outer membrane insertase
description: Structural studies resolve how the antibiotic darobactin inhibits the bacterial BAM insertase.

heading: Genomic insights into population history and biological adaptation in Oceania
description: Genomic analyses of human populations in the Pacific provide insights into the peopling history of the region and reveal episodes of biological adaptation relating to the immune system and lipid metabolism through introgression from archaic hominins and polygenic adaptation.

heading: Organelle degradation in the lens by PLAAT phospholipases
description: In the eye lens of zebrafish and mice, the phospholipases Plaat1 and PLAAT3, respectively, are essential for macroautophagy-independent organelle degradation that produces an organelle-free zone and achieves optimal transparency.

heading: AMBRA1 regulates cyclin D to guard S-phase entry and genomic integrity
description: AMBRA1-mediated degradation of cyclin D through CRL4–DDB1 regulates cell proliferation and prevents replication stress in neurodevelopment and cancer.

heading: Subterahertz collective dynamics of polar vortices
description: A dynamical study shows that vortices of electrical polarization have higher frequencies and smaller size than their magnetic counterparts, properties that are promising for electric-field-driven data processing.

heading: The AMBRA1 E3 ligase adaptor regulates the stability of cyclin D
description: AMBRA1 is the main regulator of the degradation of D-type cyclins, and loss of AMBRA1 promotes cell proliferation and tumour growth, and reduces the sensitivity of cancer cells to inhibition of CDK4 and CDK6.

heading: Non-reciprocal phase transitions
description: A theoretical study of non-reciprocity in collective phenomena reveals the emergence of time-dependent phases heralded by exceptional points in contexts ranging from synchronization and flocking to pattern formation.

heading: Structural basis of long-range to short-range synaptic transition in NHEJ
description: Double-strand DNA break repair by the non-homologous end joining pathway involves the transition from a complex that bridges the DNA ends to a complex that aligns the DNA for ligation through the dissociation of the kinase subunits of the DNA-PK complexes.

heading: Multilevel proteomics reveals host perturbations by SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV
description: Multi-omics profiling of effects of SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV on A549, a lung-derived human cell line, produces a dataset enabling identification of common and virus-specific mechanisms of infection.

heading: People systematically overlook subtractive changes
authors: Gabrielle S. AdamsBenjamin A. ConverseLeidy E. Klotz
description: Observational and experimental studies of people seeking to improve objects, ideas or situations demonstrate that people default to searching for solutions that add new components rather than for solutions that remove existing components.

heading: Isospin Pomeranchuk effect in twisted bilayer graphene
description: An electronic analogue of the Pomeranchuk effect is present in twisted bilayer graphene, shown by the stability of entropy in a ferromagnetic phase compared to an unpolarized Fermi liquid phase at certain high temperatures.

heading: The structure, function and evolution of a complete human chromosome 8
authors: Glennis A. LogsdonMitchell R. VollgerEvan E. Eichler
description: The complete assembly of human chromosome 8 resolves previous gaps and reveals hidden complex forms of genetic variation, enabling functional and evolutionary characterization of primate centromeres.

heading: Drugs that inhibit TMEM16 proteins block SARS-CoV-2 spike-induced syncytia
description: Lungs from patients who died from COVID-19 show atypical fused cells, the formation of which is mediated by the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein, and drugs that inhibit TMEM16F can prevent spike-induced syncytia formation.

heading: Cell-programmed nutrient partitioning in the tumour microenvironment
authors: Bradley I. ReinfeldMatthew Z. MaddenW. Kimryn Rathmell
description: Positron emission tomography measurements of nutrient uptake in cells of the tumour microenvironment reveal cell-intrinsic partitioning in which glucose uptake is higher in myeloid cells, whereas glutamine is preferentially acquired by cancer cells.

heading: Evaluating eligibility criteria of oncology trials using real-world data and AI
description: Trial Pathfinder uses data from electronic health records of patients with cancer to evaluate eligibility criteria and broaden restrictive criteria, which facilitates the design of more-inclusive trials while maintaining safeguards for patient safety.

heading: Fossoriality and evolutionary development in two Cretaceous mammaliamorphs
description: Fossiomanus sinensis and Jueconodon cheni, a newly described Early Cretaceous tritylodontid and eutriconodotan, respectively, show convergence on a fossorial body plan and provide insights into the evolution of the axial skeleton in mammaliamorphs.

heading: Five carbon- and nitrogen-bearing species in a hot giant planet’s atmosphere
description: The signatures of water, carbon monoxide, hydrogen cyanide, methane, ammonia and acetylene are observed in the transmission spectrum of the hot Jupiter HD 209458b, with abundance ratios suggesting a super-solar carbon-to-oxygen ratio.

heading: CAR directs T cell adaptation to bile acids in the small intestine
authors: Mei Lan ChenXiangsheng HuangMark S. Sundrud
description: Activation of the nuclear hormone receptor CAR in T cells protects the small intestine against bile acid-driven inflammation.

heading: Type III-A CRISPR immunity promotes mutagenesis of staphylococci
authors: Charlie Y. MoJacob MathaiLuciano A. Marraffini
description: In Staphylococcus epidermidis and Staphylococcus aureus, non-specific DNase activity of the type III-A CRISPR–Cas system increases the rate of mutations in the host and accelerates the evolution of resistance to antibiotics and to phage.

heading: Demonstration of the trapped-ion quantum CCD computer architecture
authors: J. M. PinoJ. M. DreilingB. Neyenhuis
description: The quantum charge-coupled device architecture is demonstrated, with its various elements integrated into a programmable trapped-ion quantum computer and performing simple quantum operations with state-of-the-art levels of error.

heading: Earthquakes indicated magma viscosity during Kīlauea’s 2018 eruption
authors: D. C. RomanA. SoldatiB. R. Shiro
description: Rotated fault-plane solutions in earthquake swarms at volcanoes could provide an early indication of relatively viscous magma, and hence of the style and hazard potential of an impending eruption.

heading: Diversity-oriented synthesis of polymer membranes with ion solvation cages
authors: Miranda J. BaranMark E. CarringtonBrett A. Helms
description: A diversity-oriented synthesis approach that yields a library of architecturally broad microporous polymers is used to develop structurally diverse polymer membranes with ion specificity and to screen their properties.

heading: Initial Upper Palaeolithic humans in Europe had recent Neanderthal ancestry
description: Genome-wide data for the three oldest known modern human remains in Europe, dated to around 45,000 years ago, shed light on early human migrations in Europe and suggest that mixing with Neanderthals was more common than is often assumed.

heading: Astrocytes close a motor circuit critical period
authors: Sarah D. AckermanNelson A. Perez-CatalanChris Q. Doe
description: The duration of a critical period of plasticity in the developing Drosophila motor circuit, during which motor neurons display activity-dependent refinement of neurite structure and connectivity, is dependent on astrocyte to motor neuron Neuroligin–Neurexin signalling.

heading: Leading hadronic contribution to the muon magnetic moment from lattice QCD
description: A precise theoretical computation of the anomalous magnetic moment of the muon based on ab initio quantum chromodynamics and quantum electrodynamics calculations is presented, which favours the existing experimental values.

heading: Entropic evidence for a Pomeranchuk effect in magic-angle graphene
description: Magic-angle graphene is found to have an exotic phase transition where, on heating, entropy is transferred from motional to magnetic degrees of freedom, analogously to the Pomeranchuk effect in 3He.

heading: Genome-wide enhancer maps link risk variants to disease genes
authors: Joseph NasserDrew T. BergmanJesse M. Engreitz
description: Mapping enhancer regulation across human cell types and tissues illuminates genome function and provides a resource to connect risk variants for common diseases to their molecular and cellular functions.

heading: A biosensor for the direct visualization of auxin
description: A genetically encoded sensor for the quantitative visualization of auxin distribution in plants enables real-time monitoring of its uptake and clearance by individual cells and within cellular compartments.

heading: Pseudo-halide anion engineering for α-FAPbI3 perovskite solar cells
description: Incorporation of the pseudo-halide anion formate during the fabrication of α-FAPbI3 perovskite films eliminates deleterious iodide vacancies, yielding solar cell devices with a certified power conversion efficiency of 25.21 per cent and long-term operational stability.

heading: An amygdala circuit that suppresses social engagement
description: A circuit in the amygdala uses thyrotropin-releasing hormone to suppress male mating when a female mouse is unhealthy.

heading: A myeloid–stromal niche and gp130 rescue in NOD2-driven Crohn’s disease
authors: Shikha NayarJoshua K. MorrisonJudy H. Cho
description: NOD2 deficiency drives fibrosis and stricturing complications in Crohn’s disease through dysregulated homeostasis of activated fibroblasts and macrophages, which is ameliorated by gp130 blockade in human cell and zebrafish models.

heading: Laser cooling of antihydrogen atoms
authors: C. J. BakerW. BertscheJ. S. Wurtele
description: The successful laser cooling of trapped antihydrogen, the antimatter atom formed by an antiproton and a positron (anti-electron), is reported.

heading: Shared mechanisms underlie the control of working memory and attention
description: The prefrontal cortex in monkeys controls working memory in a similar way to attention, by selectively transforming the representations of remembered items.

heading: Innovative Homo sapiens behaviours 105,000 years ago in a wetter Kalahari
description: Human populations in the southern Africa interior were collecting non-utilitarian objects at around 105,000 years ago, suggesting that the development of this innovative behaviour did not depend on exploiting coastal resources.

heading: Three-dimensional nanoprinting via charged aerosol jets
description: A 3D-printing strategy involving jets of charged aerosol particles guided by electric-field lines allows direct deposition of various metal nanostructures, including helices, letters and vertical split-ring resonator structures.

heading: Corticosterone inhibits GAS6 to govern hair follicle stem-cell quiescence
description: Stress inhibits  hair growth in mice through the release of the stress hormone corticosterone from the adrenal glands, which inhibits the activation of hair follicle stem cells by suppressing the expression of a secreted factor, GAS6, from the dermal niche.

heading: Oxygen isotopes trace the origins of Earth’s earliest continental crust
authors: Robert H. SmithiesYongjun LuSimon P. Johnson
description: Oxygen isotopes and whole-rock geochemistry show that the water required to make Earth’s first continental crust was primordial and derived from the mantle, not surface water introduced by subduction.

heading: High and rising economic costs of biological invasions worldwide
description: Analysis of the InvaCost database shows that the costs of biological invasions have markedly increased between 1970 and 2017 and show no sign of slowing down, highlighting the importance of evidence-based and cost-effective management actions.

heading: Soil moisture–atmosphere feedback dominates land carbon uptake variability
description: Factorial climate model simulations show that 90% of the inter-annual variability in global land carbon uptake is driven by soil moisture and its atmospheric feedback on temperature and air humidity.

heading: Determining the three-dimensional atomic structure of an amorphous solid
description: A method that achieves atomic-resolution tomographic imaging of an amorphous solid enables detailed quantitative characterization of the short- and medium-range order of the three-dimensional atomic arrangement.

heading: Flexible scaling and persistence of social vocal communication
description: A population of neurons is identified in the lateral preoptic area that can drive the full range of social communication sounds with affective scaling during mating in mice.

heading: Fertilized egg cells secrete endopeptidases to avoid polytubey
description: Fertilized Arabidopsis egg cells secrete endopeptidases into the extracellular space that cleave the pollen tube attractor LURE1, preventing polytubey.

heading: Flavour Hund’s coupling, Chern gaps and charge diffusivity in moiré graphene
description: Chemical potential measurements in twisted bilayer graphene reveal the importance of Coulomb repulsion and exchange interactions in the symmetry-broken ground state, and provide the charge diffusivity in the strange-metal regime.

heading: Stabilization of liquid instabilities with ionized gas jets
description: A weakly ionized gas jet impinging on a water surface is shown to produce a more stable cavity than does a neutral gas jet, with implications for plasma–liquid interactions.

heading: Structural basis of malaria RIFIN binding by LILRB1-containing antibodies
description: Plasmodium antigens called RIFINs bind to specific antibodies that incorporate the inhibitory receptor LILRB1 through its D3 domain, illustrating the principle of receptor-containing antibodies.

heading: The spatial landscape of lung pathology during COVID-19 progression
authors: André F. RendeiroHiranmayi RavichandranRobert E. Schwartz
description: Imaging mass cytometry of the human lung reveals the cellular composition and spatial architecture during COVID-19 and other acute injuries, enabling the characterization of lung pathophysiology from structural, immunological and clinical perspectives.

heading: A 200-million-year delay in permanent atmospheric oxygenation
authors: Simon W. PoultonAndrey BekkerDavid T. Johnston
description: Sulfur isotope and iron–sulfur–carbon systematics on marine sediments indicate that permanent atmospheric oxygenation occurred around 2.22 billion years ago, about 100 million years later than currently estimated.

heading: Escape of SARS-CoV-2 501Y.V2 from neutralization by convalescent plasma
description: Cross-neutralization assays of early variants and the 501Y.V2 variant of SARS-CoV-2 show that plasma from individuals infected with 501Y.V2 effectively neutralizes all variants, indicating that a vaccine that targets 501Y.V2 may also be effective against other SARS-CoV-2 variants.

heading: Neuronal enhancers are hotspots for DNA single-strand break repair
description: DNA single-strand breaks in neurons accumulate at high levelsin functional enhancers.

heading: Assessing transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 lineage B.1.1.7 in England
description: Genetic and testing data from England show that the SARS-CoV-2 variant of concern B.1.1.7 has a transmission advantage over other lineages.

heading: Bispecific IgG neutralizes SARS-CoV-2 variants and prevents escape in mice
description: The bispecific IgG1-like CoV-X2 prevents SARS-CoV-2 spike binding to ACE2, neutralizes SARS-CoV-2 and its variants of concern, protects against disease in a mouse model, whereas the parental monoclonal antibodies generate viral escape.

heading: Old-growth forest carbon sinks overestimated
authors: Per GundersenEmil E. ThybringVivian K. Johannsen

heading: Reply to: Old-growth forest carbon sinks overestimated
Frequency ratio measurements at 18-digit accuracy using an optical clock network
description: A network of optical atomic clocks based on three different atomic species is reported and their frequency ratios are measured with uncertainties at or below 8 × 10−18.

heading: Breast tumours maintain a reservoir of subclonal diversity during expansion
authors: Darlan C. MinussiMichael D. NicholsonNicholas E. Navin
description: Single-cell analysis of genomes from primary human breast tumours and cell lines shows that chromosomal aberrations continue to evolve during primary tumour expansion, resulting in a milieu of subclones within the tumour.

heading: Presymptomatic training mitigates functional deficits in a mouse model of Rett syndrome
authors: Nathan P. AchillyWei WangHuda Y. Zoghbi
description: In a mouse model of Rett syndrome, intensive training during the presymptomatic period markedly improves the performance of motor and memory tasks and delays the onset of symptoms, providing a rationale for the genetic screening of newborn babies.

heading: NASH limits anti-tumour surveillance in immunotherapy-treated HCC
description: In hepatocellular carcinoma driven by non-alcoholic steatohepatitis, aberrant T cell activation and impaired immune surveillance seem to make hepatocellular carcinoma less responsive to anti-PD1 or anti-PDL1 immunotherapy.

heading: Structural insights into the lipid and ligand regulation of serotonin receptors
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of three different serotonin receptors in complex with serotonin and other agonists provide insights into the role of lipids in regulating these receptors and the structural basis of ligand recognition.

heading: Control and readout of a superconducting qubit using a photonic link
description: High-fidelity control and readout of a superconducting qubit is performed with a low-noise optical fibre link that delivers microwave signals directly to the millikelvin quantum computing environment.

heading: Summertime increases in upper-ocean stratification and mixed-layer depth
description: Oceanographic observations from 1970–2018 reveal substantial changes in the summer upper-ocean structure, showing a thickening of the mixed layer and a density gradient increase at its base.

heading: Macroscopic materials assembled from nanoparticle superlattices
authors: Peter J. SantosPaul A. GabrysRobert J. Macfarlane
description: Polymer-covered inorganic nanoparticles are designed to self-assemble into micrometre-sized superlattice crystallites that can subsequently be built into freestanding centimetre-scale solids with hierarchical order across seven orders of magnitude.

heading: REV-ERB in GABAergic neurons controls diurnal hepatic insulin sensitivity
description: REV-ERB in GABAergic neurons orchestrates the rhythmic sensitivity of hepatic glucose production to insulin-mediated suppression that peaks at wakening, with implications in the extended dawn phenomenon.

heading: Quadrivalent influenza nanoparticle vaccines induce broad protection
description: A nanoparticle influenza vaccine candidate is shown to induce broad cross-reactive antibody responses in animal models.

heading: A trade-off between plant and soil carbon storage under elevated CO2
authors: C. TerrerR. P. PhillipsR. B. Jackson
description: A synthesis of elevated carbon dioxide experiments reveals that when plant biomass is strongly stimulated by elevated carbon dioxide levels, soil carbon storage declines, and where biomass is weakly stimulated, soil carbon accumulates.

heading: A four-qubit germanium quantum processor
authors: Nico W. HendrickxWilliam I. L. LawrieMenno Veldhorst
description: Using germanium quantum dots, a four-qubit processor capable of single-, two-, three-, and four-qubit gates, demonstrated by the creation of four-qubit Greenberger−Horne−Zeilinger states, is the largest yet realized with solid-state electron spins.

heading: Auto-aggressive CXCR6+ CD8 T cells cause liver immune pathology in NASH
description: Liver resident CD8 T cells have an essential role in immunopathology in a mouse model of nonalcoholic steatohepatitis, by becoming auto-aggressive following sequential transcriptional and metabolic activation steps .

heading: Developmental and biophysical determinants of grass leaf size worldwide
authors: Alec S. BairdSamuel H. TaylorLawren Sack
description: Relationships between leaf size and vein architecture in more than 1,700 grass species worldwide show that grasses native to colder and drier climates have shorter and narrower leaves that provide them with physiological advantages.

heading: A vaccine targeting mutant IDH1 in newly diagnosed glioma
description: A phase 1 clinical trial provides evidence that a vaccine against mutant IDH1 is safe and produces a T helper immune response in patients with glioma.

heading: Nondestructive detection of photonic qubits
description: A nondestructive detector of photonic qubits, comprising a single 87Rb atom trapped in the centre point of two crossed fibre-based optical resonators, is demonstrated.
