heading: Ex utero mouse embryogenesis from pre-gastrulation to late organogenesis
description: A new culture system makes it possible to grow mouse embryos and study their development outside the uterus up to the point of late organogenesis.

heading: Primate cell fusion disentangles gene regulatory divergence in neurodevelopment
authors: Rachel M. AgogliaDanqiong SunHunter B. Fraser
description: Cortical organoids derived from tetraploid human–chimpanzee fused induced pluripotent stem cells provide a platform for untangling unique molecular features of human brain development.

heading: Protecting the global ocean for biodiversity, food and climate
description: Using a globally coordinated strategic conservation framework to plan an increase in ocean protection through marine protected areas can yield benefits for biodiversity, food provisioning and carbon storage.

heading: DPP9 sequesters the C terminus of NLRP1 to repress inflammasome activation
description: Structures of NLRP1–DPP9 alone and with a small-molecule inhibitor of DPP9 reveal the mechanisms through which NLRP1 is regulated, providing insights into the role of this complex in inflammasome regulation.

heading: Enabling conditions for an equitable and sustainable blue economy
description: The capacity to create an equitable and sustainable ‘blue economy’ from ocean resources will be determined by addressing social conditions, governance and infrastructure, not just resource availability, as shown by a fuzzy logic model incorporating multidisciplinary criteria.

heading: DNA-driven condensation assembles the meiotic DNA break machinery
description: During meiosis, Mer2 and the Rec114–Mei4 complex form condensates that facilitate the formation of double-strand DNA breaks by recruiting the Spo11 transesterase complex.

heading: The AIM2 inflammasome exacerbates atherosclerosis in clonal haematopoiesis
authors: Trevor P. FidlerChenyi XueAlan R. Tall
description: Accelerated atherosclerosis in a mouse model of clonal haematopoiesis is prevented by genetic interruption of AIM2 inflammasome activation or by inhibition of interleukin-1β.

heading: Structural and biochemical mechanisms of NLRP1 inhibition by DPP9
description: The 2:1 complex between the inflammatory mediator NLRP1 and the dipeptidyl peptidase DPP9 functions to sequester an inflammasome-forming fragment of NLRP1 and enhance NLRP1 autoinhibition.

heading: Shifting attention to accuracy can reduce misinformation online
description: Surveys and a field experiment with Twitter users show that prompting people to think about the accuracy of news sources increases the quality of the news that they share online.

heading: Modelling human blastocysts by reprogramming fibroblasts into iBlastoids
authors: Xiaodong LiuJia Ping TanJose M. Polo
description: Human fibroblasts are reprogrammed to generate blastocyst-like structures called iBlastoids, which recapitulate aspects of embryo implantation.

heading: Extensional tectonics and two-stage crustal accretion at oceanic transform faults
authors: Ingo GrevemeyerLars H. RüpkeColin W. Devey
description: Oceanic transform faults are systemically deeper than their associated fracture zones, owing to the plate boundary experiencing increasingly oblique shear at increasing depths below the seafloor.

heading: Expansible residence decentralizes immune homeostasis
description: Investigations in mice using parabiosis and cohousing experiments reveal that nonlymphoid organs serve as reservoirs of tissue-autonomous cellular immunity, leading to the decentralization of organism-level immune homeostasis.

heading: Blastocyst-like structures generated from human pluripotent stem cells
description: An in vitro culture strategy enables the generation of blastocyst-like structures termed human blastoids from naive human pluripotent stem cells, providing a model for studying human embryogenesis.

heading: Widespread potential loss of streamflow into underlying aquifers across the USA
description: Direct observations of 4.2 million wells across the USA indicate that many streams are potentially losing water to underlying aquifers.

heading: Identification of bacteria-derived HLA-bound peptides in melanoma
description: HLA peptidomic analysis identifies recurrent intracellular bacteria-derived peptides presented on HLA-I and HLA-II molecules in melanoma tumours, revealing how bacteria can modulate immune functions and responses to cancer therapies.

heading: An autonomous debating system
description: An artificial intelligence system that can engage in a competitive debate with humans is presented.

heading: High-order superlattices by rolling up van der Waals heterostructures
description: A simple but flexible technique based on a capillary-force-driven rolling-up process produces high-order van der Waals superlattices that are hard to produce with existing fabrication techniques.

heading: Clofazimine broadly inhibits coronaviruses including SARS-CoV-2
description: The anti-leprosy drug clofazimine inhibits coronavirus replication in several cell models and shows potent antiviral activity against SARS-CoV-2 infection in a hamster model, particularly when used in combination with remdesivir.

heading: Increased mortality in community-tested cases of SARS-CoV-2 lineage B.1.1.7
authors: Nicholas G. DaviesChristopher I. JarvisRuth H. Keogh
description: Analysis of community-tested cases of SARS-CoV-2 indicates that the B.1.1.7 variant is not only more transmissible than pre-existing variants, but may also cause more severe illness, and is associated with a higher risk of death.

heading: Sensitivity of SARS-CoV-2 B.1.1.7 to mRNA vaccine-elicited antibodies
authors: Dami A. CollierAnna De MarcoRavindra K. Gupta
description: Sera from vaccinated individuals and some monoclonal antibodies show a modest reduction in neutralizing activity against the B.1.1.7 variant of SARS-CoV-2; but the E484K substitution leads to a considerable loss of neutralizing activity.

heading: A high-resolution protein architecture of the budding yeast genome
authors: Matthew J. RossiPrashant K. KuntalaB. Franklin Pugh
description: A ChIP–exo method is used to define the genome-wide positional organization of proteins associated with gene transcription, DNA replication, centromeres, subtelomeres and transposons, revealing distinct protein assemblies for constitutive and inducible gene expression.

heading: Inter-mosaic coordination of retinal receptive fields
authors: Suva RoyNa Young JunGreg D. Field
description: Complementary types of retinal ganglion cell form mosaics with receptive fields that are farther apart than would be expected by chance, supporting the efficient coding of natural scenes.

heading: Detection of a particle shower at the Glashow resonance with IceCube
description: A particle shower detected by the IceCube Neutrino Observatory at the very high energy of the Glashow resonance demonstrates its potential for the study of high-energy particle physics and astrophysics.

heading: Non-ammocoete larvae of Palaeozoic stem lampreys
authors: Tetsuto MiyashitaRobert W. GessMichael I. Coates
description: Growth series of Palaeozoic stem lampreys do not include a filter-feeding larval phase seen in modern lampreys, which suggests that modern lamprey larvae are a poor model of vertebrate ancestry.

heading: Towards real-time photorealistic 3D holography with deep neural networks
description: A deep-learning-based approach using a convolutional neural network is used to synthesize photorealistic colour three-dimensional holograms from a single RGB-depth image in real time, and termed tensor holography.

heading: Mutual potentiation of plant immunity by cell-surface and intracellular receptors
authors: Bruno Pok Man NgouHee-Kyung AhnJonathan D. G. Jones
description: In Arabidopsis, two distinct types of immunity—that mediated by cell-surface receptors and that mediated by intracellular receptors—interact with and mutually enhance each other to provide effective defence against pathogens.

heading: Experimental quantum speed-up in reinforcement learning agents
description: A reinforcement learning experiment using a programmable integrated nanophotonic processor shows that a quantum communication channel with the environment speeds up the learning process of an agent.

heading: Thermal-expansion offset for high-performance fuel cell cathodes
description: Highly active but durable perovskite-based solid oxide fuel cell cathodes are realized using a thermal-expansion offset, achieving full thermo-mechanical compatibility between the cathode and other cell components.

heading: Propagation of large earthquakes as self-healing pulses or mild cracks
description: Numerical simulations indicate that seismological observations of large megathrust earthquakes are better matched by crack-like ruptures on persistently weak faults than by self-healing pulse-like ruptures on stronger faults.

heading: Pattern-recognition receptors are required for NLR-mediated plant immunity
description: Bacteria elicit two distinct immune responses in Arabidopsis thaliana, mediated by diverse signalling receptors but working in a synergistic manner.

heading: Measuring human capital using global learning data
description: Analyses of a global database reveal that in many developing countries progress in learning remains limited despite increasing enrolment in primary and secondary education, and uncover links between human capital and economic development.

heading: Large-area display textiles integrated with functional systems
description: A large electronic display textile that is flexible, breathable and withstands repeated machine-washing is integrated with a keyboard and power supply to create a wearable, durable communication tool.

heading: Measurement of gravitational coupling between millimetre-sized masses
description: A direct measurement of the gravitational coupling between two 1-mm-radius gold spheres with masses below 100 mg using a torsional pendulum is reported.

heading: Inherent mosaicism and extensive mutation of human placentas
authors: Tim H. H. CoorensThomas R. W. OliverSam Behjati
description: Phylogenies of human placental cells based on whole-genome sequencing of bulk samples and microdissections reveal extensive mutagenesis in placental tissue, and suggest that mosaicism is a typical part of normal placental development.

heading: Detection of a SARS-CoV-2 variant of concern in South Africa
description: The 501Y.V2 variant of SARS-CoV-2 in South Africa became dominant over other variants within weeks of its emergence, suggesting that this variant is linked to increased transmissibility or immune escape.

heading: Antibody resistance of SARS-CoV-2 variants B.1.351 and B.1.1.7
authors: Pengfei WangManoj S. NairDavid D. Ho
description: The SARS-CoV-2 variant B.1.1.7 can be neutralized by convalescent sera or sera from vaccinated individuals, whereas the B.1.351 variant is resistant to neutralization by these sera and by several monoclonal antibodies that are in clinical use.

heading: Reply to: Hippo signalling maintains ER expression and ER+ breast cancer growth
Van der Waals heterostructure polaritons with moiré-induced nonlinearity
description: Polaritons formed by moiré excitons in heterobilayers of transition metal dichalcogenides exhibit strong nonlinearity owing to quantum confinement by the tunable moiré lattice potential.

heading: The TOR–EIN2 axis mediates nuclear signalling to modulate plant growth
description: In Arabidopsis, phosphorylation of EIN2 by TOR kinase in the presence of glucose prevents the nuclear localization of EIN2, showing that the glucose–TOR–EIN2 axis regulates the transcriptome independently of ethylene signalling pathways.

heading: Quantum circuits with many photons on a programmable nanophotonic chip
description: A system for realizing many-photon quantum circuits is presented, comprising a programmable nanophotonic chip operating at room temperature, interfaced with a fully automated control system.

heading: Hunger enhances food-odour attraction through a neuropeptide Y spotlight
description: Attraction to food odours is enhanced in mice that are experiencing hunger through a mechanism involving neuropeptide Y.

heading: Stress-induced amorphization triggers deformation in the lithospheric mantle
description: Amorphization at grain boundaries in olivine-rich rocks under stress and consequent grain-boundary sliding could explain the decrease in viscosity between the lithosphere and the asthenosphere.

heading: State-dependent encoding of exploratory behaviour in the amygdala
description: Deep-brain calcium imaging of mice engaged in social or spatial exploration reveals that these state-dependent behaviours are encoded by distinct neuronal ensembles of the basolateral amygdala.

heading: Hippo signalling maintains ER expression and ER+ breast cancer growth
The RNA m6A reader YTHDC1 silences retrotransposons and guards ES cell identity
description: N6-methyladenosine RNA and its reader YTHDC1 serve as a bridge to silencing retrotransposons through the RNA derived from these retrotransposons in mouse ES cells.

heading: Anaerobic endosymbiont generates energy for ciliate host by denitrification
description: ‘Candidatus Azoamicus ciliaticola’ transfers energy to its ciliate host in the form of ATP and enables this host to breathe nitrate, demonstrating that eukaryotes with remnant mitochondria can secondarily acquire energy-providing endosymbionts.

heading: Actin cables and comet tails organize mitochondrial networks in mitosis
authors: Andrew S. MooreStephen M. CosciaErika L. F. Holzbaur
description: During mitosis, complementary actin-based mechanisms ensure equal and random distributions of mitochondria among daughter cells following symmetrical cell division.

heading: Ligand-engineered bandgap stability in mixed-halide perovskite LEDs
authors: Yasser HassanJong Hyun ParkHenry J. Snaith
description: The binding of multidentate ligands to the surface of lead halide perovskite nanocrystals suppresses the formation of surface defects that result in halide segregation, yielding materials with efficient and colour-stable red emission.

heading: MAP3K2-regulated intestinal stromal cells define a distinct stem cell niche
description: A subset of intestinal stromal cells that is regulated by the kinase MAP3K2 protects intestinal stem cells against injury by producing the WNT agonist R-spondin 1.

heading: Human alteration of global surface water storage variability
authors: Sarah W. CooleyJonathan C. RyanLaurence C. Smith
description: Data from the ICESat-2 satellite quantifying the variability of water levels in natural and human-managed water bodies show that a disproportionate majority of global water storage variability occurs in human-managed reservoirs.

heading: Self-powered soft robot in the Mariana Trench
description: A free-swimming soft robot inspired by deep-sea creatures, with artificial muscle, power and control electronics spread across a polymer matrix, successfully adapts to high pressure and operates in the deep ocean.

heading: Monocyte-derived S1P in the lymph node regulates immune responses
description: Monocyte-derived sphingosine 1-phosphate gradients in the lymph nodes regulate the response of T cells under inflammatory conditions.

heading: Structural insights into the inhibition of glycine reuptake
description: Serial synchrotron crystallography reveals the structure of the human glycine transporter GlyT1, showing how a state-specific inhibitor exerts its effects, and potentially informing the design of new GlyT1 inhibitors to treat a range of disorders of the central nervous system.

heading: Climate-driven flyway changes and memory-based long-distance migration
description: The routes and lengths of migrations of Eurasian Arctic peregrine falcons have probably been shaped by climate change across the Last Glacial Maximum–Holocene transition and by selection for long-term memory acting on ADCY8, respectively.

heading: Centromeres are dismantled by foundational meiotic proteins Spo11 and Rec8
description: The meiotic proteins Spo11 and Rec8, which ensure meiotic recombination and reductional chromosome segregation, have additional activities that challenge centromere stability by promoting centromeric nucleosome remodelling in both fission yeast and human cells.

heading: Warming impairs trophic transfer efficiency in a long-term field experiment
authors: Diego R. BarnecheChris J. HulattGabriel Yvon-Durocher
description: In artificial ponds exposed to seven years of experimental warming, energy transfer between two trophic levels of freshwater plankton decreased by 56% and the biomass of both levels was reduced.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 spike D614G change enhances replication and transmission
authors: Bin ZhouTran Thi Nhu ThaoMartin Beer
description: A SARS-CoV-2 variant containing a D614G substitution in the spike protein shows enhanced binding to human ACE2, increased replication in human cell cultures and a competitive advantage in animal models of infection.

heading: Deterministic multi-qubit entanglement in a quantum network
description: High-fidelity deterministic quantum state transfer and multi-qubit entanglement are demonstrated in a quantum network comprising two superconducting quantum nodes one metre apart, with each node including three interconnected qubits.

heading: A mechanosensitive peri-arteriolar niche for osteogenesis and lymphopoiesis
description: A peri-arteriolar niche in the bone marrow for osteogenesis and lymphopoiesis is maintained by mechanical stimulation and is depleted during ageing.

heading: Reset of hippocampal–prefrontal circuitry facilitates learning
authors: Alan J. ParkAlexander Z. HarrisJoshua A. Gordon
description: Exposure to a novel experience can ‘reset’ connections between the hippocampus and prefrontal cortex in mice, allowing them to overcome an existing learned behaviour and to replace it with a new one.

heading: Multi-kingdom ecological drivers of microbiota assembly in preterm infants
description: Absolute microbial abundances delineate longitudinal dynamics of bacteria, fungi and archaea in the infant gut microbiome, uncovering drivers of microbiome development masked by relative abundances and revealing notable parallels to macroscopic ecosystem assemblies.

heading: A multi-scale brain map derived from whole-brain volumetric reconstructions
authors: Christopher A. BrittinSteven J. CookNetta Cohen
description: Two complete volumetric reconstructions of the Caenorhabditis elegans main neuropil (the nerve ring) reveal multi-scale spatial organization that supports both conserved and variable circuitry, and enables the derivation of a modular structure–function model of the neuropil.

heading: Spatiotemporal dissection of the cell cycle with single-cell proteogenomics
description: Spatial and temporal variations among individual human cell proteomes are comprehensively mapped across the cell cycle using proteomic imaging and transcriptomics.

heading: Sulfur sequestration promotes multicellularity during nutrient limitation
authors: Beth KellyGustavo E. CarrizoErika L. Pearce
description: Depriving unicellular Dictyostelium discoideum of nutrients generates reactive oxygen species that sequester cysteine within glutathione, which maintains this amoeba in a nonproliferating state that promotes aggregation into a multicellular organism.

heading: An organoid-based organ-repurposing approach to treat short bowel syndrome
description: In a rat model of short bowel syndrome, transplantation of small intestinal organoids into the colon partially restores intestinal function and improves survival—a proof of principle that organoid transplantation might have therapeutic benefit.

heading: Lipid signalling enforces functional specialization of Treg cells in tumours
description: Identification of a metabolic checkpoint involving lipid signalling that is specific to regulatory T cells (Treg cells) in the tumour microenvironment raises the possibility of targeting this checkpoint for treatment of cancer.

heading: The asymmetry of antimatter in the proton
description: Quark–antiquark annihilation measurements provide a precise determination of the ratio of down and up antiquarks within protons as a function of momentum, which confirms the asymmetry between the abundance of down and up antiquarks.

heading: Structural and developmental principles of neuropil assembly in C. elegans
authors: Mark W. MoyleKristopher M. BarnesDaniel A. Colón-Ramos
description: The C. elegans neuropil is shown to be organized into four strata composed of related behavioural circuits, and its design principles are linked to the developmental processes that underpin its assembly.

heading: First return, then explore
description: A reinforcement learning algorithm that explicitly remembers promising states and returns to them as a basis for further exploration solves all as-yet-unsolved Atari games and out-performs previous algorithms on Montezuma’s Revenge and Pitfall.

heading: Efficient perovskite solar cells via improved carrier management
description: An improved device design for perovskite-based photovoltaic cells enables a certified power conversion efficiency of 25.2 per cent, translating to 80.5 per cent of the thermodynamic limit for its bandgap, which approaches those achieved by silicon solar cells.

heading: Nuclear sensing of breaks in mitochondrial DNA enhances immune surveillance
description: Breaks in mitochondrial DNA cause leakage of mitochondrial RNA into the cytoplasm, enhancing immune surveillance and synergizing with nuclear DNA damage to mount a robust type-I interferon immune response.

heading: Angular momentum generation in nuclear fission
description: γ-ray spectroscopy experiments on the origin of spin in the products of nuclear fission of spin-zero nuclei suggest that the fission fragments acquire their spin after scission, rather than before.

heading: Strong tough hydrogels via the synergy of freeze-casting and salting out
description: A strategy that combines freeze-casting and salting-out treatments produces strong, tough, stretchable and fatigue-resistant poly(vinyl alcohol) hydrogels.

heading: Experimental demonstration of the mechanism of steady-state microbunching
description: The mechanism of steady-state electron microbunching is demonstrated, providing a basis that will enable its full implementation in electron storage rings to generate high-repetition, high-power coherent radiation.

heading: Genomic insights into the formation of human populations in East Asia
description: Genome-wide data from 166 East Asian individuals dating to between 6000 bc and ad 1000 and from 46 present-day groups provide insights into the histories of mixture and migration of human populations in East Asia.

heading: Concerns about phytoplankton bloom trends in global lakes
Reply to: Concerns about phytoplankton bloom trends in global lakes
authors: Jeff C. HoAnna M. MichalakNima Pahlevan

heading: Closed-loop recycling of polyethylene-like materials
description: Polycarbonates and polyesters with materials properties like those of high-density polyethylene can be recycled chemically by depolymerization to their constituent monomers, re-polymerization yielding material with uncompromised processing and materials properties.

heading: High-resolution X-ray luminescence extension imaging
description: Using lanthanide-doped nanomaterials and flexible substrates, an approach that enables flat-panel-free, high-resolution, three-dimensional imaging is demonstrated and termed X-ray luminescence extension imaging.

heading: Structure and inhibition mechanism of the human citrate transporter NaCT
description: Structures of the human sodium-dependent citrate transporter NaCT in complexes with citrate or a small-molecule inhibitor reveal how the inhibitor—which binds to the same site as citrate—arrests the transport cycle of NaCT.

heading: Creatine kinase B controls futile creatine cycling in thermogenic fat
description: Upon induction by thermogenic stimuli, creatine kinase B traffics to mitochondria to trigger the futile creatine cycle in thermogenic fat.

heading: Loop extrusion as a mechanism for formation of DNA damage repair foci
description: During the repair of double-stranded DNA breaks, cohesin mediates the extrusion of loops of DNA along which phosphorylated H2AX spreads to establish a repair zone.

heading: Localization of lattice dynamics in low-angle twisted bilayer graphene
authors: Andreij C. GadelhaDouglas A. A. OhlbergAdo Jorio
description: Nano-Raman spectroscopy reveals localization of some vibrational modes in reconstructed twisted bilayer graphene and provides qualitative insights into how electron–phonon coupling affects the vibrational and electronic properties of the material.

heading: Glutamate transporters have a chloride channel with two hydrophobic gates
description: Glutamate transporters conduct chloride ions through an aqueous channel with hydrophobic gates that forms during the glutamate transport cycle.

heading: Coherent X-ray−optical control of nuclear excitons
description: Suitably shaped X-ray pulses are used to coherently steer the quantum dynamics of atoms’ nuclei rather than their electrons, with few-zeptosecond temporal stability of the phase control.

heading: Million-year-old DNA sheds light on the genomic history of mammoths
authors: Tom van der ValkPatrícia PečnerováLove Dalén
description: Siberian mammoth genomes from the Early and Middle Pleistocene subepochs reveal adaptive changes and a key hybridization event, highlighting the value of deep-time palaeogenomics for studies of speciation and long-term evolutionary trends.

heading: Affinity-coupled CCL22 promotes positive selection in germinal centres
description: CCL22 promotes positive selection in germinal centres by highlighting affinity-enhanced B cells for helper T cells to sense and seek remotely.

heading: Self-similar mesocrystals form via interface-driven nucleation and assembly
authors: Guomin ZhuMaria L. SushkoJames J. De Yoreo
description: Mesocrystal formation is investigated for haematite in the presence of oxalate, showing that chemical gradients at interfaces cause nucleation near surfaces rather than in the bulk, followed by particle attachment.

heading: Metabolic support of tumour-infiltrating regulatory T cells by lactic acid
authors: McLane J. WatsonPaolo D. A. VignaliGreg M. Delgoffe
description: The tumour microenvironment is low in glucose and high in the alternative metabolite lactate, which regulatory T cells are shown here to use, maintaining their ability to suppress effector immune cells.

heading: CTLA-4 blockade drives loss of Treg stability in glycolysis-low tumours
description: CTLA-4 promotes glucose uptake by tumour-infiltrating regulatory T cells, making them unstable.

heading: Macrophages provide a transient muscle stem cell niche via NAMPT secretion
authors: Dhanushika RatnayakePhong D. NguyenPeter D. Currie
description: Specific macrophage populations provide a transient niche that activates muscle stem cells after muscle injury and supply proliferation-inducing cues that govern the repair process mediated by these cells in both zebrafish and mouse injury models.

heading: Thermally reconfigurable monoclinic nematic colloidal fluids
description: Dispersion of colloidal disks in a nematic liquid crystal reveals several low-symmetry phases, including monoclinic colloidal nematic order, with interchange between them achieved through variations in temperature, concentration and surface charge.

heading: A decline in emissions of CFC-11 and related chemicals from eastern China
description: Atmospheric data and chemical-transport modelling show that CFC-11 emissions from eastern China have again decreased, after increasing in 2013–2017, and a delay in ozone-layer recovery has probably been avoided.

heading: A decline in global CFC-11 emissions during 2018−2019
authors: Stephen A. MontzkaGeoffrey S. DuttonChristina Theodoridi
description: Atmospheric concentration measurements at remote sites around the world reveal an accelerated decline in the global mean CFC-11 concentration during 2018 and 2019, reversing recent trends and building confidence in the timely recovery of the stratospheric ozone layer.

heading: mRNA vaccine-elicited antibodies to SARS-CoV-2 and circulating variants
description: The Moderna (mRNA-1273) and Pfizer–BioNTech (BNT162b2) vaccines elicit anti-RBD antibodies similar to those elicited through natural infection with SARS-CoV-2, but their potent neutralizing activity was reduced or abolished by new viral variants of concern.

heading: A universal 3D imaging sensor on a silicon photonics platform
description: A compact, high-performance silicon photonics-based light detection and ranging system for three-dimensional imaging is developed that should be amenable to low-cost mass manufacturing

heading: Protecting a bosonic qubit with autonomous quantum error correction
description: A logical qubit encoded in multi-photon states of a superconducting cavity is protected with autonomous correction of certain quantum errors by tailoring the dissipation it is exposed to.

heading: A quantum enhanced search for dark matter axions
authors: K. M. BackesD. A. PalkenH. Wang
description: A quantum enhanced search for dark matter that uses vacuum squeezing to overcome the quantum noise limit finds no evidence of dark matter axions in a well motivated mass range.

heading: Cooperative epithelial phagocytosis enables error correction in the early embryo
description: Mechanical load-sharing enables the long-range cooperative uptake of apoptotic cells by multiple epithelial cells; and clearance of these apoptotic cells facilitates error correction, which is necessary for developmental robustness and survival of the embryo.

heading: Sequencing of 53,831 diverse genomes from the NHLBI TOPMed Program
authors: Daniel TaliunDaniel N. HarrisGonçalo R. Abecasis
description: The goals, resources and design of the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) programme are described, and analyses of rare variants detected in the first 53,831 samples provide insights into mutational processes and recent human evolutionary history.

heading: Visualization of the mechanosensitive ion channel MscS under membrane tension
description: The authors report the structural characterization of the mechanically activated channel MscS in different membrane environments and show how the mechanosensation of MscS can be visualized.

heading: The kinetic landscape of an RNA-binding protein in cells
description: Time-resolved RNA–protein cross-linking with a pulsed femtosecond ultraviolet laser, followed by immunoprecipitation and high-throughput sequencing, enables the determination of binding and dissociation kinetics of the RNA-binding protein DAZL within cells.

heading: Non-coding deletions identify Maenli lncRNA as a limb-specific En1 regulator
description: The long non-coding RNA locus Maenli controls mouse limb development by regulating En1 activity, and the absence of the homolgous MAENLI locus is associated with severe congenital limb defects in humans.

heading: Facile route to bulk ultrafine-grain steels for high strength and ductility
description: Bulk ultrafine-grained steel is prepared by an approach that involves the rapid production of coherent, disordered nanoprecipitates, which restrict grain growth but do not interfere with twinning or dislocation motion, resulting in high strength and ductility.

heading: Complex structures arising from the self-assembly of a simple organic salt
description: Frank–Kasper phases are observed in small organic molecules from the crystallization of fampridine hydrochloride into two distinct structures, indicating that complex self-assembled structures can arise from simple organic salts.

heading: In situ mapping identifies distinct vascular niches for myelopoiesis
description: A combination of fluorescent antibodies is used to build visual maps of all myeloid cells in the bone marrow, providing new insight into how the bone marrow microenvironment regulates cell-fate decisions.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 infection is effectively treated and prevented by EIDD-2801
authors: Angela WahlLisa E. GralinskiJ. Victor Garcia
description: Human and bat coronaviruses replicate efficiently in immunodeficient mice implanted with human lung tissue, and treatment or prophylaxis using EIDD-2801 in this model suggests that this oral antiviral agent may be effective in preventing COVID-19.

heading: SARS-CoV-2 evolution during treatment of chronic infection
authors: Steven A. KempDami A. CollierRavindra K. Gupta
description: Chronic infection with SARS-CoV-2 leads to the emergence of viral variants that show reduced susceptibility to neutralizing antibodies in an immunosuppressed individual treated with convalescent plasma.

heading: Reply to: On the measured dielectric constant of amorphous boron nitride
Issues with combining incompatible and sterile insect techniques
On the measured dielectric constant of amorphous boron nitride
Reply to: Issues with combining incompatible and sterile insect techniques
Viscoelastic control of spatiotemporal order in bacterial active matter
description: Introducing viscoelasticity by addition of DNA into the fluid surrounding a suspension of Escherichia coli produces a giant oscillating vortex with a period controllable through the DNA concentration.

heading: Bayesian reaction optimization as a tool for chemical synthesis
authors: Benjamin J. ShieldsJason StevensAbigail G. Doyle
description: Bayesian optimization is applied in chemical synthesis towards the optimization of various organic reactions and is found to outperform scientists in both average optimization efficiency and consistency.

heading: Elevated NSD3 histone methylation activity drives squamous cell lung cancer
description: The histone H3K36 methyltransferase NSD3, which is associated with the common 8p11–12 chromosomal amplification, is an oncogenic driver in lung squamous cell carcinoma.

heading: A gene–environment-induced epigenetic program initiates tumorigenesis
description: In mouse models of pancreatic cancer, a cooperative interaction between tissue damage and Kras gene mutation rapidly induces cancer-associated chromatin states in pre-malignant tissue, leading to gene dysregulation and neoplastic transformation.

heading: Ubiquitin ligation to F-box protein targets by SCF–RBR E3–E3 super-assembly
authors: Daniel Horn-GhetkoDavid T. KristBrenda A. Schulman
description: Cryo-electron microscopy of neddylated SCF-family ligases interacting with the RBR-type E3 ligase ARIH1 reveals the steps through which E3–E3 super-assemblies ubiquitylate a diverse set of substrates presented on F-box proteins.

heading: Skin-resident innate lymphoid cells converge on a pathogenic effector state
authors: Piotr BieleckiSamantha J. RiesenfeldRichard A. Flavell
description: In studies using mouse models of psoriasis, a spectrum of innate lymphoid cell types is reconfigured and converges via multiple trajectories on a type 3-like state, demonstrating the range and flexibility of innate lymphoid cell responses in the skin.

heading: Molecular basis for control of antibiotic production by a bacterial hormone
description: X-ray crystallography and cryo-electron microscopy structures of the transcriptional repressor of the methylomycin gene cluster, MmfR, reveal the molecular basis for regulation of antibiotic biosynthesis by AHFCA hormones in Actinobacteria.

heading: Regulatory genomic circuitry of human disease loci by integrative epigenomics
authors: Carles A. BoixBenjamin T. JamesManolis Kellis
description: The authors present EpiMap, a compendium that comprises 10,000 epigenomic maps across more than 800 biosamples for the annotation of genome-wide association study circuitry.

heading: Antiferromagnetic half-skyrmions and bimerons at room temperature
description: A family of topological antiferromagnetic spin textures is realized at room temperature in α-Fe2O3, and their reversible and field-free stabilization using a Kibble–Zurek-like temperature cycling is demonstrated.

heading: Glacial episodes of a freshwater Arctic Ocean covered by a thick ice shelf
description: Unexpected intervals of low 230Th concentration in marine sediment cores are explained by considering that during at least two such periods, the Arctic Ocean and Nordic seas were composed entirely of fresh water and covered by a thick ice shelf.

heading: BRCA1 and RNAi factors promote repair mediated by small RNAs and PALB2–RAD52
description: Single-stranded, DNA-damage-associated small RNAs generated by a BRCA1–RNA-interference complex promote PALB2–RAD52-mediated DNA repair at transcriptional termination pause sites that contain R-loops and are rich in single-stranded DNA breaks in both quiescent and proliferating cells.

heading: Structural and spectroscopic characterization of an einsteinium complex
authors: Korey P. CarterKatherine M. ShieldRebecca J. Abergel
description: An einsteinium coordination complex is synthesized and spectroscopically characterized using less than 200 nanograms of einsteinium, enabling examination of its structure and measurement of an einsteinium bond distance.

heading: Generating conjectures on fundamental constants with the Ramanujan Machine
description: An approach called the Ramanujan Machine demonstrates the use of algorithms to find mathematical conjectures in the form of formulas of fundamental constants, some of which remain unproved.

heading: IgA transcytosis and antigen recognition govern ovarian cancer immunity
description: In patients with high-grade serous ovarian cancer, robust and protective humoral responses are dominated by B-cell-derived polyclonal IgA that binds to polymeric IgA receptors that are universally expressed on ovarian cancer cells.

heading: Dynamic regulation of TFH selection during the germinal centre reaction
description: T follicular helper cells undergo antigen-dependent selection in germinal centres, with higher-affinity T cell receptors supporting stronger proliferation leading to their clonal dominance.

heading: Tunable strongly coupled superconductivity in magic-angle twisted trilayer graphene
description: Highly tunable moiré superconductivity is observed in magic-angle twisted trilayer graphene, and observations suggest that this superconductor can be tuned close to the crossover to a two-dimensional Bose–Einstein condensate.

heading: BNT162b vaccines protect rhesus macaques from SARS-CoV-2
description: BNT162b1 and BNT162b2 are two candidate mRNA vaccines against COVID-19 that elicit high virus-entry inhibition titres in mice, elicit high virus-neutralizing titres in rhesus macaques and protect macaques from SARS-CoV-2 challenge.

heading: Cell competition constitutes a barrier for interspecies chimerism
description: Primed pluripotent stem cells from distant species compete with each other, and inactivation of NF-κB signalling in normally outcompeted human cells improves their survival and chimerism in mouse embryos.

heading: A monotreme-like auditory apparatus in a Middle Jurassic haramiyidan
description: A fossil of the Middle Jurassic haramiyidan Vilevolodon diplomylos with a well-preserved malleus, incus and ectotympanic sheds light on the evolutionary transition from a dual to a single function for the ossicles in mammals.

heading: De novo design of modular and tunable protein biosensors
description: A modular de novo designed biosensor platform consisting of a cage and key molecule is developed, and used to create sensors for seven distinct proteins including the spike protein from SARS-CoV-2 and anti-SARS antibodies.

heading: A growth-factor-activated lysosomal K+ channel regulates Parkinson’s pathology
description: The identification of a lysosomal K+ channel complex—comprising AKT and the pore-forming TMEM175—provides insights into the mechanisms through which variants of the pore-forming protein affect the development of Parkinson’s disease.

heading: Systematic analysis of binding of transcription factors to noncoding variants
description: An ultra-high-throughput multiplex protein–DNA binding assay is used to assess binding of 270 human transcription factors to 95,886 noncoding variants in the human genome, providing data to improve prediction of the effects of noncoding variants on transcription factor binding and thereby increase understanding of molecular pathways involved in diverse human traits and genetic diseases.

heading: Inceptor counteracts insulin signalling in β-cells to control glycaemia
description: The insulin inhibitory receptor (inceptor) is identified as a negative regulator of insulin and IGF1 signalling that could be targeted for β-cell regeneration in treatments for diabetes.

heading: Measuring the α-particle charge radius with muonic helium-4 ions
description: The 2S–2P transitions in muonic helium-4 ions are measured using laser spectroscopy and used to obtain an α-particle charge-radius value five times more precise than that from electron scattering.

heading: Integrated spatial genomics reveals global architecture of single nuclei
description: Multiplexed imaging of 3,660 chromosomal loci in individual mouse embryonic stem cells by DNA seqFISH+ with immunofluorescence of 17 chromatin marks and subnuclear structures reveals invariant organization of loci within individual cells, and heterogeneous and long-lived distinct combinatorial chromatin states in cellular subpopulations.

heading: Aneuploidy renders cancer cells vulnerable to mitotic checkpoint inhibition
description: Aneuploid cancer cell lines show increased dependence on the spindle assembly complex (SAC); initially they are resistant to SAC perturbations, but over time they accumulate chromosomal aberrations that impair their fitness.

heading: Whole-genome doubling confers unique genetic vulnerabilities on tumour cells
authors: Ryan J. QuintonAmanda DiDomizioNeil J. Ganem
description: Cancer cells that have undergone whole-genome doubling are more reliant than their near-diploid counterparts on DNA-replication factors, the spindle-assembly checkpoint and a mitotic kinesin protein, KIF18A.

heading: Neuroprosthetic baroreflex controls haemodynamics after spinal cord injury
authors: Jordan W. SquairMatthieu GautierAaron A. Phillips
description: An epidural spinal cord stimulation system regulates blood pressure in the acute and chronic phases of spinal cord injury.

heading: Global and regional drivers of land-use emissions in 1961–2017
authors: Chaopeng HongJennifer A. BurneySteven J. Davis
description: Trends in the rate of region- and sector-specific land-use greenhouse gas emissions in 1961–2017 show an acceleration of about 20% per decade after 2001.

heading: Metastability of diamond ramp-compressed to 2 terapascals
description: X-ray diffraction measurements of solid carbon compressed to pressures of about two terapascals (approximately twenty million atmospheres) find that carbon retains a diamond structure even under these extreme conditions.

heading: Half a century of global decline in oceanic sharks and rays
authors: Nathan PacoureauCassandra L. RigbyNicholas K. Dulvy
description: The global abundance of oceanic sharks and rays has decreased by 71% since 1970 and 24 species are threatened with extinction owing to a concomitant increase in fishing pressure.

heading: Single-neuronal predictions of others’ beliefs in humans
authors: Mohsen JamaliBenjamin L. GrannanZiv M. Williams
description: Recordings of cells in the human dorsomedial prefrontal cortex identify a population of neurons that encode information about others’ beliefs and distinguish them from self-belief-related representations, providing insight into cellular-level processing underlying human theory of mind.

heading: Genomic mechanisms of climate adaptation in polyploid bioenergy switchgrass
authors: John T. LovellAlice H. MacQueenJeremy Schmutz
description: The genome of the biofuel crop switchgrass (Panicum virgatum) reveals climate–gene–biomass associations that underlie adaptation in nature and will facilitate improvements of the yield of this crop for bioenergy production.

heading: Seasonal origin of the thermal maxima at the Holocene and the last interglacial
description: Reanalysis of Holocene sea surface temperature records affirms the role of retreating ice and rising greenhouse gases in driving a steady increase in global temperatures over the past 12,000 years.

heading: AIM2 in regulatory T cells restrains autoimmune diseases
description: The inflammasome receptor AIM2 acts independently of the inflammasome to reduce autoimmunity and stabilize regulatory T cells.

heading: A thin mantle transition zone beneath the equatorial Mid-Atlantic Ridge
authors: Matthew R. AgiusCatherine A. RychertJ.-Michael Kendall
description: Data from ocean bottom seismometers show that the mantle transition zone beneath the equatorial Mid-Atlantic Ridge is thin and warm, which suggests more material transfer than previously thought.

heading: METTL3 regulates heterochromatin in mouse embryonic stem cells
description: Binding of METTL3 to chromatin is enriched over IAP family endogenous retroviral elements in mouse embryonic stem cells, helping to ensure the integrity of heterochromatin at these elements.

heading: Ebola virus antibody decay–stimulation in a high proportion of survivors
description: In many survivors of Ebola virus infection, antibody responses show long-term patterns of decline followed by restimulation, possibly owing to recrudescence of persisting virus.

heading: Global absence and targeting of protective immune states in severe COVID-19
authors: Alexis J. CombesTristan CourauMatthew F. Krummel
description: Patients with mild COVID-19 show a pattern of interferon-stimulated gene (ISG) expression across all major cell types, but in patients with severe disease, antibodies block the production of these ISG-expressing cells.

heading: Loss of furin cleavage site attenuates SARS-CoV-2 pathogenesis
authors: Bryan A. JohnsonXuping XieVineet D. Menachery
description: Experimental deletion of the furin cleavage site of the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein highlights an important role for this site in infection and the need to consider this site when evaluating the neutralization activities of antibodies.

heading: NINJ1 mediates plasma membrane rupture during lytic cell death
authors: Nobuhiko KayagakiOpher S. KornfeldVishva M. Dixit
description: The small transmembrane protein NINJ1 promotes plasma membrane rupture in lytic cell death associated with pyroptosis, necrosis and apoptosis.

heading: A reprogrammable mechanical metamaterial with stable memory
description: A reprogrammable mechanical metamaterial constructed of bistable unit cells that can be switched independently and reversibly between two stable states with distinct mechanical properties using magnetic actuation is demonstrated.

heading: Lake heatwaves under climate change
authors: R. Iestyn WoolwayEleanor JenningsStephen C. Maberly
description: Modelling and remote sensing show that by the end of the twenty-first century, lake heatwaves will be several degrees Celsius warmer and some will be months longer, with potentially major adverse consequences for lake ecosystems.

heading: A stable low-temperature H2-production catalyst by crowding Pt on α-MoC
description: A stable, low-temperature water–gas shift catalyst is achieved by crowding platinum atoms and clusters on α-molybdenum carbide; the crowding protects the support from oxidation that would cause catalyst deactivation.

heading: Wetting regulates autophagy of phase-separated compartments and the cytosol
authors: Jaime Agudo-CanalejoSebastian W. SchultzRoland L. Knorr
description: A theoretical model, in vitro reconstitution and in vivo experimentation show that competition between droplet surface tension and membrane sheet instability dictates the form and function of autophagosomal membranes.

heading: Dopamine-based mechanism for transient forgetting
authors: John Martin SabandalJacob A. BerryRonald L. Davis
description: A dopamine neuron that underpins transient forgetting in Drosophila is activated by the presentation of interfering stimuli immediately before memory retrieval, modulating this retrieval by stimulating a dopamine receptor in mushroom body neurons.

heading: Striatal activity topographically reflects cortical activity
authors: Andrew J. PetersJulie M. J. FabreMatteo Carandini
description: Simultaneous mapping of activity across the cortex and dorsal striatum in mice shows that activity in each part of the striatum precisely mirrors that in topographically associated cortical regions, consistently across behavioural contexts.

heading: Trapped fractional charges at bulk defects in topological insulators
description: It is experimentally shown that crystallographic defects may trap fractional charges, as well as topological states, in the bulk of topological crystalline insulators.

heading: Monitoring hiring discrimination through online recruitment platforms
description: An analysis of the search behaviour of recruiters on a Swiss online recruitment platform shows that jobseekers from minority ethnic groups are less likely to be contacted by recruiters, and also provides evidence of gender-based discrimination.

heading: Survey of spiking in the mouse visual system reveals functional hierarchy
description: A large, open dataset containing parallel recordings from six visual cortical and two thalamic areas of the mouse brain is presented, from which the relative timing of activity in response to visual stimuli and behaviour is used to construct a hierarchy scheme that corresponds to anatomical connectivity data.

heading: Observation of the onset of a blue jet into the stratosphere
description: Observations from the International Space Station show a blue jet that is initiated by an intense blue flash in the top of a thunderstorm cloud.

heading: Restoring metabolism of myeloid cells reverses cognitive decline in ageing
authors: Paras S. MinhasAmira Latif-HernandezKatrin I. Andreasson
description: In aged mice, inhibition of prostaglandin E2 (PGE2) signalling through its receptor EP2 improves cellular bioenergetics, reduces inflammatory responses and restores hippocampal plasticity to youthful levels, resulting in an improvement in spatial memory and cognition.

heading: Decoding and perturbing decision states in real time
authors: Diogo PeixotoJessica R. VerheinWilliam T. Newsome
description: In macaque motor cortex, moment-to-moment fluctuations in neurally derived decision variables are tightly linked to decision state and predict behavioural choices with better accuracy than condition-averaged decision variables or the visual stimulus alone, and can be used to distinguish between different models of decision making.

heading: Bulk–disclination correspondence in topological crystalline insulators
description: It is experimentally shown that topological states exist at crystallographic defects in the bulk and that disclination defects trap fractional charges characteristic of topological crystalline insulators.

heading: Tracking break-induced replication shows that it stalls at roadblocks
description: A method of tracking break-induced replication reveals the details of this repair process and shows that it can be impaired by certain genomic elements and by transcription.

heading: The Card1 nuclease provides defence during type III CRISPR immunity
authors: Jakob T. RostølWei XieLuciano A. Marraffini
description: Structural analyses of the type III CRISPR accessory protein Card1, which induces dormancy in infected hosts to provide immunity against phage infection, reveal the mechanisms by which it cleaves single-stranded RNA and DNA.

heading: Correlation-driven topological phases in magic-angle twisted bilayer graphene
description: Correlation-driven topological phases with different Chern numbers are observed in magic-angle twisted bilayer graphene in modest magnetic fields, indicating that strong electronic interactions can lead to topologically non-trivial phases.

heading: Evolution of antibody immunity to SARS-CoV-2
description: In a cohort of 87 individuals with COVID-19, the memory B cell response at 6.2 months after the onset of disease evolves in a manner that is consistent with the persistence of SARS-CoV-2 antigen.

heading: Giant lungfish genome elucidates the conquest of land by vertebrates
description: A chromosome-quality genome of the lungfish Neoceratodus fosteri sheds light on the development of obligate air-breathing and the gain of limb-like gene expression in lobed fins, providing insights into the water-to-land transition in vertebrate evolution.

heading: Giant nonlinear optical responses from photon-avalanching nanoparticles
authors: Changhwan LeeEmma Z. XuP. James Schuck
description: Room-temperature photon avalanching realized in single thulium-doped upconverting nanocrystals enables super-resolution imaging at near-infrared wavelengths of maximal biological transparency and provides a material platform potentially suitable for other optical technologies.

heading: m6A RNA methylation regulates the fate of endogenous retroviruses
description: A CRISPR screen in mouse embryonic stem cells shows that transcripts derived from endogenous retroviruses are destabilized by m6A RNA methylation.

heading: A bright γ-ray flare interpreted as a giant magnetar flare in NGC 253
description: The γ-ray burst GRB 200415A is probably a giant flare emitted from a magnetar in the nearby starburst galaxy NGC 253.

heading: Entangling logical qubits with lattice surgery
description: Two logical qubits are encoded in ensembles of four physical qubits through the surface code, then entangled by lattice surgery, which is a protocol for carrying out fault-tolerant operations.

heading: Loop extrusion mediates physiological Igh locus contraction for RAG scanning
description: Long-distance V(D)J recombination is facilitated by contraction of the Igh locus and linear RAG scanning along chromatin, both driven by cohesin-mediated loop extrusion, which allows recombination of widely separated gene segments to occur.

heading: Functional refolding of the penetration protein on a non-enveloped virus
description: Electron cryomicroscopy and cryotomography studies reveal that rotaviruses attach to a target cell through the outer-layer protein VP4, which—following cleavage—rearranges to enable perforation of the membrane and delivery of the viral genome into the host cell.

heading: Rapid spectral variability of a giant flare from a magnetar in NGC 253
description: Observations of a giant flare associated with the starburst galaxy NGC 253 suggest that the flare is probably associated with relativistic plasma in the magnetic field of a magnetar.

heading: Chaperone-mediated autophagy sustains haematopoietic stem-cell function
description: Haematopoietic stem cells show progressive functional decline with age that can be reversed by stimulation of chaperone-mediated autophagy in old mice and aged humans.

heading: Structure and function of a neocortical synapse
description: Electrophysiology combined with correlated light and electron microscopy confirms the long-standing assumption that the size of a synapse is proportional to its strength, and reveals that neocortical synapses may have greater computational capacity than thought.

heading: Dire wolves were the last of an ancient New World canid lineage
authors: Angela R. PerriKieren J. MitchellLaurent A. F. Frantz
description: Dire wolves split from living canids around 5.7 million years ago and originated in the New World isolated from the ancestors of grey wolves and coyotes, which evolved in Eurasia and colonized North America only relatively recently.

heading: Antarctic icebergs reorganize ocean circulation during Pleistocene glacials
description: Iceberg-trajectory models along with multi-proxy evidence from sediment cores from the Indian Ocean show that northward shifts in Antarctic iceberg melt redistributed freshwater in the Southern Ocean during the Pleistocene.

heading: Local immune response to food antigens drives meal-induced abdominal pain
authors: Javier Aguilera-LizarragaMorgane V. FlorensGuy E. Boeckxstaens
description: In mice, oral tolerance to food antigens can break down after enteric infection, and this leads to food-induced pain resembling irritable bowel syndrome in humans.

heading: Patterns of de novo tandem repeat mutations and their role in autism
description: A bioinformatics pipeline to identify tandem repeat mutations is developed and used to characterize precise changes in repeat copy number associated with autism spectrum disorder.

heading: STING controls nociception via type I interferon signalling in sensory neurons
description: Studies using mouse and non-human primate models identify the innate immune regulator STING—acting via type I interferons—as a key regulator of nociception, suggesting new targets for the treatment of chronic pain.

heading: Transporting and concentrating vibrational energy to promote isomerization
authors: Jascha A. LauLi ChenAlec M. Wodtke
description: Infrared absorption by a thick CO crystal produces many vibrational quanta that can be transported and concentrated at a salt interface to drive orientational isomerization of CO molecules with enhanced efficiency.

heading: Circuits between infected macrophages and T cells in SARS-CoV-2 pneumonia
description: Analysis of bronchoalveolar lavage fluid samples from patients with SARS-CoV-2-induced respiratory failure suggests that SARS-CoV-2 infects alveolar macrophages to cause release of T cell chemoattractants, thereby inducing local inflammatory cytokine release and further T cell activation, ultimately resulting in a positive feedback loop that drives alveolar inflammation.

heading: Competing magnetic orders in a bilayer Hubbard model with ultracold atoms
description: A bilayer Fermi–Hubbard model is realized in two coupled two-dimensional layers of fermionic ultracold atoms by tuning the interlayer coupling strength to create a crossover between magnetic orderings.

heading: Control of osteoblast regeneration by a train of Erk activity waves
authors: Alessandro De SimoneMaya N. EvanitskyStefano Di Talia
description: The rate of scale regeneration in zebrafish is controlled by the frequency of rhythmic travelling waves of Erk activity, which are broadcast from a central source to induce ring-like patterns of osteoblast tissue growth.

heading: Design of biologically active binary protein 2D materials
authors: Ariel J. Ben-SassonJoseph L. WatsonDavid Baker
description: Design of a two-component protein array enables robust formation of complex large-scale ordered biologically active materials.

heading: Gut-licensed IFNγ+ NK cells drive LAMP1+TRAIL+ anti-inflammatory astrocytes
authors: Liliana M. SanmarcoMichael A. WheelerFrancisco J. Quintana
description: A subpopulation of astrocytes characterized by the expression of LAMP1 and TRAIL limits inflammation in the central nervous system through a mechanism involving the microbiota-modulated expression of IFNγ in meningeal natural killer cells.

heading: Structures of the glucocorticoid-bound adhesion receptor GPR97–Go complex
description: The authors report on the structure of a glucocorticoid-bound adhesion G-protein-coupled receptor–G protein complex.

heading: Poleward and weakened westerlies during Pliocene warmth
authors: Jordan T. AbellGisela WincklerTimothy D. Herbert
description: Analysis of dust from marine sediments in the North Pacific shows that warm periods during the Pliocene witnessed weaker and more poleward westerlies than during subsequent glacial periods.

heading: Platypus and echidna genomes reveal mammalian biology and evolution
description: New reference genomes of the two extant monotreme lineages (platypus and echidna) reveal the ancestral and lineage-specific genomic changes that shape both monotreme and mammalian evolution.

heading: In vivo base editing rescues Hutchinson–Gilford progeria syndrome in mice
authors: Luke W. KoblanMichael R. ErdosDavid R. Liu
description: In a mouse model of progeria, an adenine base editor delivered with adeno-associated virus corrects the pathogenic mutation in LMNA, rescues vascular pathology and markedly extends the lifespan of the mice.

heading: An integrated space-to-ground quantum communication network over 4,600 kilometres
description: A quantum network that combines 700 fibre and two ground-to-satellite links achieves quantum key distribution between more than 150 users over a combined distance of 4,600 kilometres.

heading: Origins of structural and electronic transitions in disordered silicon
authors: Volker L. DeringerNoam BernsteinStephen R. Elliott
description: Machine learning models enable atomistic simulations of phase transitions in amorphous silicon, predict electronic fingerprints, and show that the pressure-induced crystallization occurs over three distinct stages.

heading: 11 TOPS photonic convolutional accelerator for optical neural networks
description: An optical vector convolutional accelerator operating at more than ten trillion operations per second is used to create an optical convolutional neural network that can successfully recognize handwritten digit images with 88 per cent accuracy.

heading: Genomic basis of geographical adaptation to soil nitrogen in rice
description: OsTCP19 is a modulator of the tillering response to nitrogen in rice, and introgression of an allele of OsTCP19 associated with a high tillering response into modern rice cultivars markedly improves their nitrogen-use efficiency.

heading: Single-defect phonons imaged by electron microscopy
description: State-of-the-art electron energy-loss spectroscopy in a transmission electron microscope maps the detailed phonon spectra of single defects in silicon carbide

heading: Parallel convolutional processing using an integrated photonic tensor core
description: An integrated photonic processor, based on phase-change-material memory arrays and chip-based optical frequency combs, which can operate at speeds of trillions of multiply-accumulate (MAC) operations per second, is demonstrated.

heading: Activation and disruption of a neural mechanism for novel choice in monkeys
authors: Alessandro BongioanniDavide FolloniMatthew F. S. Rushworth
description: The primate medial frontal cortex has a key role in mediating the ability to choose between new options based on little or no direct experience.

heading: Mitochondrial sorting and assembly machinery operates by β-barrel switching
description: Proteins are inserted into the outer mitochondrial membrane by the mitochondrial sorting and assembly machinery, two structural forms of which are presented here, suggesting the mechanism involved.

heading: A functional map for diverse forelimb actions within brainstem circuitry
description: This study reveals a functional map for skilled forelimb movements within the lateral rostral medulla of the brainstem on the basis of the identification of specific neuronal populations by axonal targets.

heading: Landau quantization and highly mobile fermions in an insulator
description: Pronounced quantum oscillations in magnetoresistance, a phenomenon that was only expected in metals with highly mobile carriers, are observed in the strongly insulating state of two-dimensional WTe2.

heading: Reply to: The effect of interventions on COVID-19
The effect of interventions on COVID-19
Nociceptive nerves regulate haematopoietic stem cell mobilization
description: Stimulation of pain-sensing neurons, which can be achieved in mice by the ingestion of capsaicin, promotes the migration of haematopoietic stem cells from the bone marrow into the blood.

heading: Chromothripsis drives the evolution of gene amplification in cancer
authors: Ofer ShoshaniSimon F. BrunnerDon W. Cleveland
description: Chromothripsis—a process during which chromosomes are ‘shattered’—drives the evolution of gene amplification and subsequent drug resistance in cancer cells.

heading: Pairing of segmentation clock genes drives robust pattern formation
authors: Oriana Q. H. ZinaniKemal KeseroğluErtuğrul M. Özbudak
description: The pairing of genes is essential for robust expression of segmentation clock genes during development in zebrafish embryos.

heading: Molecular basis of nucleosomal H3K36 methylation by NSD methyltransferases
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the nucleosome-bound NSD2 and NSD3 histone methyltransferases reveal the molecular basis of their histone modification activity, and show how mutations in these proteins can lead to oncogenesis.

heading: Cell-type-specific asynchronous modulation of PKA by dopamine in learning
authors: Suk Joon LeeBart LodderBernardo L. Sabatini
description: The net PKA activities in each class of spiny projection neuron in the nucleus accumbens of the mouse are dichotomously modulated by asynchronous positive and negative dopamine signals during different phases of learning.

heading: RETRACTED ARTICLE: IspH inhibitors kill Gram-negative bacteria and mobilize immune clearance
description: A class of compounds with a dual mechanism of action—direct targeting of IspH and stimulation of cytotoxic γδ T cells to enhance pathogen clearance—are active against multidrug-resistant bacteria.

heading: A genetic history of the pre-contact Caribbean
authors: Daniel M. FernandesKendra A. SirakDavid Reich
description: Ancient DNA reveals genetic differences between stone-tool users and people associated with ceramic technology in the Caribbean and provides substantially lower estimates of population sizes in the region before European contact.

heading: Astrocytes phagocytose adult hippocampal synapses for circuit homeostasis
description: In adult mice, astrocytes carry out phagocytosis of excitatory hippocampal synapses through MEGF10 to maintain synaptic and circuit homeostasis.

heading: Superconducting qubit to optical photon transduction
description: A chip-scale platform is developed for the conversion of a single microwave excitation of a superconducting qubit into optical photons, with potential uses in quantum computer networks.

heading: Mastering Atari, Go, chess and shogi by planning with a learned model
description: A reinforcement-learning algorithm that combines a tree-based search with a learned model achieves superhuman performance in high-performance planning and visually complex domains, without any knowledge of their underlying dynamics.

heading: Xolography for linear volumetric 3D printing
description: By combining the use of photoswitchable photoinitators and intersecting light beams, objects and complex systems can be produced rapidly with higher definition than is possible using state-of-the art macroscopic volumetric methods.

heading: Mechanism of EBV inducing anti-tumour immunity and its therapeutic use
description: Expression of the Epstein–Barr virus protein LMP1 in B cells increases expression of—and promotes T cell responses to—tumour-associated antigens, delineating a mechanism of infection-induced anti-tumour immunity, which could inform immune-based approaches to cancer treatment.

heading: Plasmonic topological quasiparticle on the nanometre and femtosecond scales
description: Topological plasmonic spin textures are excited by shining light on a structured silver film, and imaging defines how these quasiparticle field and spin textures evolve on the nanometre and femtosecond scales.

heading: Evolving schema representations in orbitofrontal ensembles during learning
description: Rats learning to solve a succession of odour-sequence problems developed an orbitofrontal cortical representation that reflected the structure—or schema—common across problems.

heading: Boundary-anchored neural mechanisms of location-encoding for self and others
description: In real-world spatial navigation and observation tasks, oscillatory activity in the human brain encodes representations of self and others, with oscillatory power increasing at locations near the boundaries of the room.

heading: RANK links thymic regulatory T cells to fetal loss and gestational diabetes in pregnancy
description: RANK promotes the hormone-mediated development of thymic regulatory T cells during pregnancy; loss of RANK is associated with impaired maturation of maternal regulatory T cells, leading to fetal loss and the development of gestational diabetes.

heading: Underdetection of cases of COVID-19 in France threatens epidemic control
description: Analyses of virological and surveillance data in France show that a substantial proportion of symptomatic cases of COVID-19 have remained undetected and that easily accessible and efficient testing is required to control the pandemic.

heading: Reply to: Beta human papillomaviruses and skin cancer
authors: John D. StrickleyJonathan L. MesserschmidtShadmehr Demehri

heading: Beta human papillomaviruses and skin cancer
Sixteen facial expressions occur in similar contexts worldwide
description: An analysis of 16 types of facial expression in thousands of contexts in millions of videos revealed fine-grained patterns in human facial expression that are preserved across the modern world.

heading: Mapping routine measles vaccination in low- and middle-income countries
authors: Alyssa N. SbarraSam RolfeJonathan F. Mosser
description: Although progress in the coverage of routine measles vaccination in children in low- and middle-income countries was made during 2000–2019, many countries remain far from the goal of 80% coverage in all districts by 2019.

heading: Small-molecule inhibitors of human mitochondrial DNA transcription
description: Inhibitors of mitochondrial transcription that target human mitochondrial RNA polymerase provide a chemical biology tool for studying the role of mitochondrial DNA expression in a wide range of pathologies.

heading: Fat1 deletion promotes hybrid EMT state, tumour stemness and metastasis
description: In mouse and human squamous cell carcinoma, loss of function of FAT1 promotes tumour initiation, malignant progression and metastasis through the activation of a hybrid epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition phenotype.

heading: Entanglement on an optical atomic-clock transition
description: A many-atom state of trapped 171Yb atoms that are entangled on an optical atomic-clock transition overcomes the standard quantum limit, providing a proof-of-principle demonstration towards entanglement-based optical atomic clocks.

heading: Creation of bladder assembloids mimicking tissue regeneration and cancer
description: Multilayer 3D reconstitution of bladder stem cells with stromal cells enables recapitulation of the architecture and molecular functions of bladder tissue.

heading: Self-assembly of a layered two-dimensional molecularly woven fabric
authors: David P. AugustRobert A. W. DryfeRobert J. Young
description: An anion and metal ion template is used to form woven polymer patches that are joined together by polymerization into a fully woven, two-dimensional, molecular patchwork.

heading: Tuning the Chern number in quantum anomalous Hall insulators
description: The number of edge channels in quantum anomalous Hall insulators is controlled by varying either the magnetic dopant concentration or the interior spacer layer thickness, yielding Chern numbers up to 5.

heading: Cortical response selectivity derives from strength in numbers of synapses
description: Live neuron imaging and electron microscopy reconstruction shows that the selectivity of cortical neuron responses to visual stimuli arises from the total number of synapses activated rather than being dominated by a small number of strong synaptic inputs.

heading: Half-minute-scale atomic coherence and high relative stability in a tweezer clock
authors: Aaron W. YoungWilliam J. EcknerAdam M. Kaufman
description: A tweezer clock containing about 150 88Sr atoms achieves trapping and optical excited-state lifetimes exceeding 40 seconds, and shows relative fractional frequency stability similar to that of leading atomic clocks.

heading: Sorting nexin 5 mediates virus-induced autophagy and immunity
description: Genome-wide siRNA screens identify an essential function for sorting nexin 5 in virus-induced autophagy and immunity mediated via class III phosphatidylinositol-3-kinase complex 1.

heading: Antidepressant actions of ketamine engage cell-specific translation via eIF4E
description: The antidepressant-like effects of ketamine in mice depend on the expression of specific eIF4E-binding proteins in excitatory and inhibitory neurons.

heading: Capping pores of alphavirus nsP1 gate membranous viral replication factories
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of non-structural protein 1 (nsP1) of chikungunya virus reveal the mechanisms that underpin the association of viral replication machinery with virus-induced membranous organelles within host cells.

heading: Anti-tumour immunity induces aberrant peptide presentation in melanoma
description: Tryptophan depletion in melanoma cells after prolonged treatment with interferon-γ (IFNγ) results in ribosomal frameshifting and the production of aberrant peptides that can be presented to T cells and induce an immune response.

heading: Maximizing US nitrate removal through wetland protection and restoration
authors: F. Y. ChengK. J. Van MeterN. B. Basu
description: Analysis of US continental wetland inventory data combined with model simulations indicate that a spatially targeted 10% increase in wetland area could double wetland nitrogen removal.

heading: Topological superconductivity in a van der Waals heterostructure
description: A van der Waals structure based on a two-dimensional magnet and layered superconductor offers a potential system in which topological superconductivity could be easily tuned and integrated into devices.

heading: Reconstitution of the oocyte transcriptional network with transcription factors
description: Eight transcription factors are identified that, when overexpressed, are sufficient to grow oocyte-like cells from mouse pluripotent stem cells.

heading: More than one million barriers fragment Europe’s rivers
authors: Barbara BellettiCarlos Garcia de LeanizMaciej Zalewski
description: Validated barrier inventories and modelling indicate that Europe’s rivers are fragmented by more than one million barriers, such as dams, weirs and fords, causing major impacts on biodiversity.

heading: Spin transport in a tunable Heisenberg model realized with ultracold atoms
description: Spin transport far from equilibrium is studied in a Heisenberg model with adjustable anisotropy realized with coupled ultracold 7Li atoms, and different dynamical regimes are found for positive and negative anisotropies.

heading: Measuring DNA mechanics on the genome scale
description: A high-throughput, chromosome-wide analysis of DNA looping reveals its contribution to the organization of chromatin, and provides insight into how nucleosomes are deposited and organised de novo.

heading: Strongly correlated Chern insulators in magic-angle twisted bilayer graphene
description: Strong electron–electron interactions in magic-angle twisted bilayer graphene can fundamentally change the topology of the system’s flat bands, producing a hierarchy of strongly correlated topological insulators in modest magnetic fields.

heading: Genetic mechanisms of critical illness in COVID-19
description: A genome-wide association study of critically ill patients with COVID-19 identifies genetic signals that relate to important host antiviral defence mechanisms and mediators of inflammatory organ damage that may be targeted by repurposing drug treatments.

heading: Reply to: Crop asynchrony stabilizes food production
Crop asynchrony stabilizes food production
Bidirectional perisomatic inhibitory plasticity of a Fos neuronal network
authors: Ee-Lynn YapNoah L. PettitMichael E. Greenberg
description: Novel experiences in mice lead to opposing effects on inhibition of Fos-activated hippocampal CA1 pyramidal neurons by parvalbumin- and cholecystokinin-expressing interneurons, revealing the roles of FOS and SCG2 in neural plasticity and consolidation of memories.

heading: Quantification of an efficiency–sovereignty trade-off in climate policy
description: An integrated assessment model analysis shows that a moderately differentiated carbon price could achieve as much climate mitigation as a uniform carbon tax, avoiding concerns regarding equity between participating countries or sovereignty.

heading: Histone H1 loss drives lymphoma by disrupting 3D chromatin architecture
description: Mutations in histone H1 induce the remodelling of chromatin architecture to a more relaxed state, which leads to malignant transformation through changes in histone modifications and the expression of stem cell genes.

heading: Capillary condensation under atomic-scale confinement
authors: Qian YangP. Z. SunA. K. Geim
description: In the tiniest of capillaries, barely larger than a water molecule, condensation is surprisingly predictable from the macroscopic Kelvin condensation equation, a coincidence partially owing to elastic deformation of the capillary walls.

heading: Impacts of speciation and extinction measured by an evolutionary decay clock
authors: Jennifer F. Hoyal CuthillNicholas GuttenbergGraham E. Budd
description: Analysis of data on species co-occurrence in the Paleobiology Database using a new machine learning algorithm reveals that mass extinctions and mass radiations are not coupled in evolutionary history.

heading: A non-hallucinogenic psychedelic analogue with therapeutic potential
authors: Lindsay P. CameronRobert J. TombariDavid E. Olson
description: Psychedelic alkaloids served as lead structures for the development of tabernanthalog, a non-hallucinogenic and non-toxic analogue that reduces alcohol- and heroin-seeking behaviour and produces antidepressant-like effects in rodents.

heading: Global human-made mass exceeds all living biomass
description: Estimates of global total biomass (the mass of all living things) and anthopogenic mass (the mass embedded in inanimate objects made by humans) over time show that we are roughly at the timepoint when anthropogenic mass exceeds total biomass.

heading: A metastasis map of human cancer cell lines
description: A method in which pooled barcoded human cancer cell lines are injected into a mouse xenograft model enables simultaneous mapping of the metastatic potential of multiple cell lines, and shows that breast cancer cells that metastasize to the brain have altered lipid metabolism.

heading: Dipolar evaporation of reactive molecules to below the Fermi temperature
description: A strongly interacting gas of polar molecules is created by combining an electric field with two-dimensional optical confinement, enabling evaporative cooling and opening up the exploration of low-entropy many-body phases.

heading: Arterialization requires the timely suppression of cell growth
description: Arterial development relies on the timely and MYC-dependent suppression of endothelial metabolism and the cell cycle in pre-arterial endothelial cells through Notch signalling.

heading: Unveiling the strong interaction among hadrons at the LHC
