authors: Z. K. MinevS. O. MundhadaM. H. Devoret
description: Experiment overturns Bohr’s view of quantum jumps, demonstrating that they possess a degree of predictability and when completed are continuous, coherent and even deterministic.

heading: Observation of thermal Hawking radiation and its temperature in an analogue black hole
authors: Juan Ramón Muñoz de NovaKatrine GolubkovJeff Steinhauer
description: The spectrum of Hawking radiation is measured in an analogue black hole composed of rubidium atoms, confirming Hawking’s prediction that Hawking radiation is thermal with a temperature given by the surface gravity.

heading: Learning the signatures of the human grasp using a scalable tactile glove
description: Tactile patterns obtained from a scalable sensor-embedded glove and deep convolutional neural networks help to explain how the human hand can identify and grasp individual objects and estimate their weights.

heading: Specialized coding of sensory, motor and cognitive variables in VTA dopamine neurons
description: Two-photon calcium imaging of a large population of dopamine neurons in the ventral tegmental area of mice performing a virtual-reality navigation task reveals the organization principles of the dopamine system.

heading: Metabolic control of BRISC–SHMT2 assembly regulates immune signalling
description: Cryo-electron microscopy and mutation experiments demonstrate that the inactive SHMT2 dimer—and not the pyridoxal-5′-phosphate-bound tetramer—binds to BRISC, which reveals a mechanism for the regulation of deubiquitylases and inflammatory signalling.

heading: Cas13-induced cellular dormancy prevents the rise of CRISPR-resistant bacteriophage
authors: Alexander J. MeeskeSandra Nakandakari-HigaLuciano A. Marraffini
description: The RNA-cleaving Cas13 degrades both host and bacteriophage transcripts, thereby rendering infected cells dormant and broadly resistant to phage-mediated lysis.

heading: Long-term ex vivo haematopoietic-stem-cell expansion allows nonconditioned transplantation
description: An albumin-free culture system for the long-term ex vivo expansion of mouse haematopoietic stem cells produces 236- to 899-fold expansion, and generates cultures that robustly engraft in recipient mice without toxic pre-conditioning.

heading: Multiple liquid crystalline geometries of highly compacted nucleic acid in a dsRNA virus
authors: Serban L. IlcaXiaoyu SunJuha T. Huiskonen
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of the bacteriophage ɸ6 dsRNA genome shows that the genome is packaged in a spooled manner that is more similar to dsDNA viruses than to other dsRNA viruses.

heading: Cryo-EM structures of herpes simplex virus type 1 portal vertex and packaged genome
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the herpesvirus capsid including the viral genome reveal ordered DNA structures and structural features of the capsid that suggest possible mechanisms for viral genome encapsidation.

heading: Asia’s shrinking glaciers protect large populations from drought stress
description: Glaciers in the high mountains of Asia provide a uniquely drought-resilient source of water, supplying summer meltwater sufficient for the basic needs of around 200 million people.

heading: Growth dynamics in naturally progressing chronic lymphocytic leukaemia
description: Analysis of growth dynamics in a dataset from 107 patients with chronic lymphocytic leukaemia (CLL) reveals both exponential and logistic patterns of growth, which are associated with differences in genetic attributes and clinical outcomes.

heading: Genome-wide cell-free DNA fragmentation in patients with cancer
description: Analyses of fragmentation patterns of cell-free DNA in the blood of patients with cancer and healthy individuals using a machine learning algorithm provide a proof-of principle approach for the early detection and screening of human cancer.

heading: Multi-omics of the gut microbial ecosystem in inflammatory bowel diseases
description: The Inflammatory Bowel Disease Multi’omics Database includes longitudinal data encompassing a multitude of analyses of stool, blood and biopsies of more than 100 individuals, and provides a comprehensive description of host and microbial activities in inflammatory bowel diseases.

heading: Longitudinal multi-omics of host–microbe dynamics in prediabetes
description: Deep profiling of transcriptomes, metabolomes, cytokines, and proteomes, alongside changes in the microbiome, in samples from individuals with and without prediabetes reveal insights into inter-individual variability and associations between changes in the microbiome and other factors.

heading: Distinct fibroblast subsets drive inflammation and damage in arthritis
authors: Adam P. CroftJoana CamposChristopher D. Buckley
description: Distinct subsets of fibroblasts, which differ in their expression of thymus cell antigen 1 (THY1), are responsible for inflammation and tissue damage in mouse models of arthritis.

heading: DNA damage detection in nucleosomes involves DNA register shifting
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures reveal that the DNA-repair factor UV-DDB exposes inaccessible nucleosome lesions for binding by inducing a translational shift in the nucleosome position.

heading: Immunization expands B cells specific to HIV-1 V3 glycan in mice and macaques
authors: Amelia EscolanoHarry B. GristickMichel C. Nussenzweig
description: The immunogen RC1 facilitates recognition of the V3-glycan patch on the envelope of HIV-1 and elicits specific serological responses in mice and macaques, making it a possible priming immunogen for sequential vaccination strategies in humans.

heading: Elastic colloidal monopoles and reconfigurable self-assembly in liquid crystals
description: Unstructured light controls the elastic monopole moments of nematic liquid-crystal colloidal particles and switches them to quadrupoles, with like-charged monopoles attracting and oppositely charged ones repelling, enabling reconfigurable dynamic self-assembly.

heading: Design and evolution of an enzyme with a non-canonical organocatalytic mechanism
authors: Ashleigh J. BurkeSarah L. LovelockAnthony P. Green
description: A hydrolytic enzyme with a non-canonical organocatalytic mechanism was generated by introducing Nδ-methylhistidine into a designed active site using engineered translation components, allowing optimization of enzyme performance using laboratory evolution.

heading: Absence of amorphous forms when ice is compressed at low temperature
authors: Chris A. TulkJamie J. MolaisonDennis D. Klug
description: Slow compression of ice at low temperature results in the sequential formation of a series of crystalline phases, challenging theories that connect amorphous ice to supercooled liquid water.

heading: The rheology and thermal history of Mars revealed by the orbital evolution of Phobos
description: Insights into the thermal and rheological history of Mars are generated by considering the interplay between the thermochemistry of the planet and the orbital evolution of its closest satellite, Phobos.

heading: Early fungi from the Proterozoic era in Arctic Canada
authors: Corentin C. LoronCamille FrançoisEmmanuelle J. Javaux
description: Morphological, ultrastructural and spectroscopic analyses identify a fungal affinity for microfossils in shale from Arctic Canada, which pushes back the date for this kingdom to 1,010–890 million years ago.

heading: Increase in CFC-11 emissions from eastern China based on atmospheric observations
description: Emissions from eastern China account for approximately 40 to 60 per cent of the global rise in emissions of trichlorofluoromethane (CFC-11), which may be a result of new production and use.

heading: A rigorous electrochemical ammonia synthesis protocol with quantitative isotope measurements
description: A protocol for the electrochemical reduction of nitrogen to ammonia enables isotope-sensitive quantification of the ammonia produced and the identification and removal of contaminants.

heading: Superconductivity at 250 K in lanthanum hydride under high pressures
authors: A. P. DrozdovP. P. KongM. I. Eremets
description: A lanthanum hydride compound at a pressure of around 170 gigapascals is found to exhibit superconductivity with a critical temperature of 250 kelvin.

heading: A conserved PLPLRT/SD motif of STING mediates the recruitment and activation of TBK1
description: A molecular model of STING-mediated signalling is proposed, as structural analysis identifies a crucial motif for the binding of TBK1 to STING, and a separate model involved in IRF-3 binding.

heading: Global change drives modern plankton communities away from the pre-industrial state
description: Seafloor-derived planktonic foraminifera communities of pre-industrial age are compared with communities from sediment-trap time series and show that Anthropocene communities of a globally distributed zooplankton group differ from their unperturbed pre-industrial state.

heading: Dissociable dopamine dynamics for learning and motivation
authors: Ali MohebiJeffrey R. PettiboneJoshua D. Berke
description: The dopamine projection from midbrain dopamine cells to the nucleus accumbens is essential for normal motivation, yet motivation-related changes in nucleus accumbens dopamine release occur independently of dopamine cell firing.

heading: Genomic characterization of metastatic breast cancers
authors: François BertucciCharlotte K. Y. NgFabrice André
description: Patient data from six clinical trials are used to compare the genomic landscapes of breast cancer metastases with those of primary tumours, revealing an increase in mutational burden and clonal diversity.

heading: Fast and inefficient star formation due to short-lived molecular clouds and rapid feedback
authors: J. M. Diederik KruijssenAndreas SchrubaEwine F. van Dishoeck
description: Observations that molecular gas in NGC 300 is spatially uncorrelated with high-mass stars are attributed to rapid evolution, with molecular clouds quickly destroyed by stellar feedback, and low star-formation efficiency.

heading: Genome–lamina interactions are established de novo in the early mouse embryo
description: Spatial genome organization into lamina-associated domains is first established in the mouse zygote immediately after fertilization without inheritance from the maternal germline—with the paternal and maternal pronucleus exhibiting different organization, which subsequently converges prior to implantation of the embryo.

heading: Lattice anchoring stabilizes solution-processed semiconductors
description: The stability of both colloidal quantum dots and perovskites can be improved by combining them into a hybrid material in which matched lattice parameters suppress the formation of undesired phases.

heading: Epitaxial growth of a 100-square-centimetre single-crystal hexagonal boron nitride monolayer on copper
description: The epitaxial growth of large single-crystal hexagonal boron nitride monolayers on low-symmetry copper foils is demonstrated.

heading: Exome sequencing of 20,791 cases of type 2 diabetes and 24,440 controls
description: Exome-sequencing analyses of a large cohort of patients with type 2 diabetes and control individuals without diabetes from five ancestries are used to identify gene-level associations of rare variants that are associated with type 2 diabetes.

heading: Active chromatin marks drive spatial sequestration of heterochromatin in C. elegans nuclei
authors: Daphne S. CabiancaCelia Muñoz-JiménezSusan M. Gasser
description: MRG-1 indirectly promotes anchoring of chromatin in differentiated intestinal cells in Caenorhabditis elegans by sequestering the histone acetyltransferase CBP-1/p300.

heading: Mitochondrial protein translocation-associated degradation
description: In Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Ubx2 promotes clearing trapped precursor proteins from the channel of the translocase of the outer membrane, in a translocation-associated degradation pathway that maintains the protein import capacity of mitochondria.

heading: A massive white-dwarf merger product before final collapse
authors: Vasilii V. GvaramadzeGötz GräfenerOlga I. Spiridonova
description: The merger of two white dwarfs created a massive, hot, luminous, rotating and magnetized star with a lifetime of several thousand years, which will collapse into a type Ic supernova.

heading: Late steps in bacterial translation initiation visualized using time-resolved cryo-EM
description: A time-resolved cryo-electron microscopy approach is used to visualize, at near-atomic resolution and on a sub-second timescale, short-lived intermediate states of a fundamental biomolecular reaction.

heading: Temporal and spectral fingerprints of ultrafast all-coherent spin switching
description: Antenna-enhanced terahertz pulses ballistically switch spins in antiferromagnetic TmFeO3 with minimal energy dissipation between metastable minima of the anisotropy potential, as characterized by unique temporal and spectral fingerprints.

heading: Mitochondrial fragmentation drives selective removal of deleterious mtDNA in the germline
authors: Toby LieberSwathi P. JeediguntaThomas R. Hurd
description: An in situ hybridization approach is used to visualize mitochondrial DNA germline selection in Drosophila, revealing the role of mitochondrial fragmentation in the selection against deleterious mutations.

heading: Epigenetic evolution and lineage histories of chronic lymphocytic leukaemia
description: A single-cell approach is used to follow the heritable stochastic changes to DNA methylation that occur in primary chronic lymphocytic leukaemia and healthy B cells, allowing the tracing of cell lineage histories and evolution during treatment with ibrutinib.

heading: Chang’E-4 initial spectroscopic identification of lunar far-side mantle-derived materials
description: Initial spectral observations by China’s Chang’E-4 far-side lunar rover suggest the presence of materials that may originate from the Moon’s mantle.

heading: Self-verifying variational quantum simulation of lattice models
description: Quantum-classical variational techniques are combined with a programmable analogue quantum simulator based on a one-dimensional array of up to 20 trapped calcium ions to simulate the ground state of the lattice Schwinger model.

heading: Cavity quantum electrodynamics with atom-like mirrors
description: An array of superconducting qubits in an open one-dimensional waveguide is precisely controlled to create an artificial quantum cavity–atom system that reaches the strong-coupling regime without substantial decoherence.

heading: Distinct modes of cell competition shape mammalian tissue morphogenesis
authors: Stephanie J. EllisNicholas C. GomezElaine Fuchs
description: Cell competition in the developing mouse epithelium involves apoptosis and engulfment when the epithelium has only one layer, but switches to involve asymmetric cell division and differentiation of ‘loser’ cells as the epithelium becomes stratified.

heading: Progenitors from the central nervous system drive neurogenesis in cancer
description: In a mouse model of prostate cancer, neural progenitors from the central nervous system that express doublecortin infiltrate tumours and metastases, and can generate new adrenergic neurons in tumours.

heading: Total synthesis of Escherichia coli with a recoded genome
description: High-fidelity convergent total synthesis is used to produce Escherichia coli with a 61-codon synthetic genome that uses 59 codons to encode all of the canonical amino acids.

heading: Tracing the origin of adult intestinal stem cells
description: Lineage tracing, biophysical modelling and intestinal transplantation approaches are used to demonstrate that, in the mouse fetal intestinal epithelium, cells are highly plastic with respect to cellular identity and, independent of LGR5 expression and cell position, can contribute to the adult stem cell compartment.

heading: Mapping HIV prevalence in sub-Saharan Africa between 2000 and 2017
authors: Laura Dwyer-LindgrenMichael A. CorkSimon I. Hay
description: Fine-scale estimates of the prevalence of HIV in adults across sub-Saharan Africa reveal substantial within-country variation and local differences in both the direction and rate of change in the prevalence of HIV between 2000 and 2017.

heading: Climatic controls of decomposition drive the global biogeography of forest-tree symbioses
authors: B. S. SteidingerT. W. CrowtherIrie Casimir Zo-Bi
description: A spatially explicit global map of tree symbioses with nitrogen-fixing bacteria and mycorrhizal fungi reveals that climate variables are the primary drivers of the distribution of different types of symbiosis.

heading: Targeting the CBM complex causes Treg cells to prime tumours for immune checkpoint therapy
authors: Mauro Di PilatoEdward Y. KimThorsten R. Mempel
description: Disruption of the CARMA1–BCL10–MALT1 (CBM) signalosome causes Treg cells to produce IFNγ and develop dominant anti-tumour activity in synergy with anti-PD-1 treatment, and in the absence of autoimmunity.

heading: Sampling the volatile-rich transition zone beneath Bermuda
authors: Sarah E. MazzaEsteban GazelAlexander V. Sobolev
description: The formation of Bermuda sampled a previously unknown mantle reservoir that is characterized by silica-undersaturated melts enriched in volatiles and by a unique lead isotopic signature, which suggests that the source is young.

heading: An apical hypoxic niche sets the pace of shoot meristem activity
authors: Daan A. WeitsAlicja B. KunkowskaFrancesco Licausi
description: Hypoxia in the shoot meristem of Arabidopsis links the regulation of metabolic activity to development by inhibiting proteolysis of a substrate of the N-degron pathway, which controls class-III homeodomain-leucine zipper transcription factors.

heading: Transcriptional cofactors display specificity for distinct types of core promoters
description: A screen of 23 transcriptional cofactors for their ability to activate 72,000 candidate core promoters in Drosophila melanogaster identified distinct compatibility groups, providing insight into mechanisms that underlie the selective activation of transcriptional programs.

heading: Molecular recording of mammalian embryogenesis
authors: Michelle M. ChanZachary D. SmithJonathan S. Weissman
description: A multi-channel molecular recording technique is applied as a lineage tracer to assemble cell-fate maps from fertilization through gastrulation in the mouse, providing insights into ontogeny in a complex multicellular organism.

heading: Fidelity benchmarks for two-qubit gates in silicon
authors: W. HuangC. H. YangA. S. Dzurak
description: Two-qubit logic gates in a silicon-based system are shown (using randomized benchmarking) to have high gate fidelities of operation and are used to generate Bell states, a step towards solid-state quantum computation.

heading: Nanosecond X-ray diffraction of shock-compressed superionic water ice
description: The atomic structure of H2O is documented at several million atmospheres of pressure and temperatures of several thousand degrees, revealing shockwave-induced ultrafast crystallization and a novel water ice phase, ice XVIII, with exotic superionic properties.

heading: Next-generation characterization of the Cancer Cell Line Encyclopedia
authors: Mahmoud GhandiFranklin W. HuangWilliam R. Sellers
description: The original Cancer Cell Line Encyclopedia (CCLE) is expanded with deeper characterization of over 1,000 cell lines, including genomic, transcriptomic, and proteomic data, and integration with drug-sensitivity and gene-dependency data.

heading: Collapsars as a major source of r-process elements
authors: Daniel M. SiegelJennifer BarnesBrian D. Metzger
description: A rare type of supernova—triggered by the collapse of a rapidly rotating single star—could have provided more than 80 per cent of the r-process elements in the Universe.

heading: Rising rural body-mass index is the main driver of the global obesity epidemic in adults
description: Contrary to the view that urbanization is a major driver of the global rise in obesity, the global increase in body-mass index is shown to be mostly due to increases in the body-mass indexes of rural populations.

heading: MicroRNA therapy stimulates uncontrolled cardiac repair after myocardial infarction in pigs
description: MicroRNAs delivered by adeno-associated viral vectors improve global and regional contractility, increase muscle mass and reduce scar size in a porcine model of myocardial infarction.

heading: Charting cellular identity during human in vitro β-cell differentiation
authors: Adrian VeresAubrey L. FaustDouglas A. Melton
description: Single-cell transcriptional profiling of in vitro human pancreatic β-cell differentiation reveals progenitor and terminal fates, produces a detailed time course of endocrine induction and underpins a lineage model.

heading: Hypo-osmotic-like stress underlies general cellular defects of aneuploidy
description: A common aneuploidy gene-expression signature is identified in yeast that is suggestive of hypo-osmotic stress, and which leads to cells that exhibit increased plasma-membrane stress and impaired endocytosis.

heading: Aqueous Li-ion battery enabled by halogen conversion–intercalation chemistry in graphite
description: Composite cathodes created by anionic redox reactions of bromine and chlorine intercalated into graphite, combined with water-in-salt electrolyte and graphite anodes, provide aqueous lithium-ion batteries with improved energy density.

heading: Atomic rheology of gold nanojunctions
description: The mechanical behaviour of gold nanojunctions is investigated at the atomic scale using tuning-fork atomic-force microscopy, revealing a fluidic state at high strains with signatures of viscous-like dissipation and capillary-like adhesion.

heading: An ultra-stable gold-coordinated protein cage displaying reversible assembly
authors: Ali D. MalayNaoyuki MiyazakiJonathan G. Heddle
description: An artificial protein cage is readily assembled by metal ion coordination and disassembled by reducing agents, and displays excellent chemical and thermal stability.

heading: Three-dimensional quantum Hall effect and metal–insulator transition in ZrTe5
description: Evidence of the three-dimensional quantum Hall effect and a magnetic-field-driven quantum phase transition are observed in zirconium pentatelluride crystals.

heading: Time-resolved protein activation by proximal decaging in living systems
description: The authors report a general strategy for in vivo protein activation using light-controlled proximal decaging directed by in silico screening.

heading: A new Jurassic scansoriopterygid and the loss of membranous wings in theropod dinosaurs
description: A newly described Jurassic scansoriopterygid reveals that membranous wings and the styliform element were widespread in this clade, which suggests that a distinctive wing architecture evolved near the split between the Scansoriopterygidae and the paravian lineages.

heading: All-optical spiking neurosynaptic networks with self-learning capabilities
authors: J. FeldmannN. YoungbloodW. H. P. Pernice
description: An optical version of a brain-inspired neurosynaptic system, using wavelength division multiplexing techniques, is presented that is capable of supervised and unsupervised learning.

heading: Sensory experience remodels genome architecture in neural circuit to drive motor learning
description: The authors identify a role for genome architecture reorganization in anterior dorsal cerebellar vermis granule neurons in learning a conditioned startle paradigm in mice.

heading: Mapping the world’s free-flowing rivers
description: A comprehensive assessment of the world’s rivers and their connectivity shows that only 37 per cent of rivers longer than 1,000 kilometres remain free-flowing over their entire length.

heading: Industrial-era decline in subarctic Atlantic productivity
authors: Matthew B. OsmanSarah B. DasEric S. Saltzman
description: A continuous, multi-century record of subarctic Atlantic marine productivity shows that a marked decline in net primary productivity has occurred across the subarctic Atlantic basin over the past two centuries.

heading: High-temperature bulk metallic glasses developed by combinatorial methods
description: Bulk metallic glasses made from alloys of iridium, nickel, tantalum and boron are developed by combinatorial methods, with higher strength at high temperature than those previously produced.

heading: A nearby neutron-star merger explains the actinide abundances in the early Solar System
description: Actinides in the early Solar System could have originated in the merger of two neutron stars about 300 parsecs away.

heading: Externalized histone H4 orchestrates chronic inflammation by inducing lytic cell death
description: Histone H4 is released from neutrophil extracellular traps and induces membrane lysis in vascular smooth muscle cells, leading to the destabilization of atherosclerotic plaques.

heading: Childhood cerebellar tumours mirror conserved fetal transcriptional programs
authors: Maria C. VladoiuIbrahim El-HamamyMichael D. Taylor
description: Sequencing data from the developing cerebellum are compared with bulk sequencing data from paediatric tumours, providing insights into their potential origins and suggesting that many cerebellar tumours have their origins early in utero.

heading: Arabidopsis FLL2 promotes liquid–liquid phase separation of polyadenylation complexes
description: A genetic screen for factors required by the Arabidopsis RNA-binding protein FCA identifies FLL2 as necessary in the formation of FCA nuclear bodies, and thus a role for FLL2 in liquid–liquid phase separation.

heading: RB constrains lineage fidelity and multiple stages of tumour progression and metastasis
authors: David M. WalterTravis J. YatesDavid M. Feldser
description: Loss of RB promotes both malignant progression and the development of metastatic disease; however, whereas reactivation of the RB pathway can revert metastatic tumour cell states to non-metastatic cell states, malignant cell proliferation is supported by MAPK–CDK2-dependent suppression of RB.

heading: Twentieth-century hydroclimate changes consistent with human influence
authors: Kate MarvelBenjamin I. CookA. Park Williams
description: Multiple observational datasets and reconstructions using data from tree rings confirm that human activities were probably affecting the worldwide risk of droughts as early as at the beginning of the twentieth century.

heading: Innervation of thermogenic adipose tissue via a calsyntenin 3β–S100b axis
description: The newly identified calsyntenin 3β protein has a role in the innervation of thermogenic fat through a mechanism of communication—which is unique to mammals—between thermogenic adipocytes and sympathetic neurons.

heading: 78Ni revealed as a doubly magic stronghold against nuclear deformation
description: A spectroscopic study of 78Ni confirms its doubly magic nature and reveals it as a stronghold beyond which the magic numbers 28 and 50 break down because of competing deformation.

heading: Prophylactic TNF blockade uncouples efficacy and toxicity in dual CTLA-4 and PD-1 immunotherapy
description: In mice, prophylactic administration of TNF inhibitors mitigates some of the immune-related adverse effects of immune checkpoint blockade treatment, and also improves to some extent the anti-tumour effect of this immunotherapy.

heading: A late Middle Pleistocene Denisovan mandible from the Tibetan Plateau
description: Fossil evidence indicates that Denisovans occupied the Tibetan Plateau in the Middle Pleistocene epoch and successfully adapted to this high-altitude hypoxic environments long before the regional arrival of modern Homo sapiens.

heading: Subthreshold firing in Mott nanodevices
authors: Javier del VallePavel SalevIvan K. Schuller
description: Mott materials feature scale-less relaxation dynamics after the insulator-to-metal transition that make its electric triggering dependent on recent switching events.

heading: A vitamin-C-derived DNA modification catalysed by an algal TET homologue
description: An algal TET dioxygenase homologue, CMD1, uses vitamin C as a glycerol donor to modify 5-methylcytosine and helps to regulate gene transcription in response to high light levels.

heading: Voltage imaging and optogenetics reveal behaviour-dependent changes in hippocampal dynamics
authors: Yoav AdamJeong J. KimAdam E. Cohen
description: A combination of improved near-infrared voltage indicators, high-speed microscopes and targeted gene expression schemes enabled simultaneous in vivo optogenetic control and recording of voltage dynamics in multiple neurons in the hippocampus of behaving mice.

heading: Proteomics reveals NNMT as a master metabolic regulator of cancer-associated fibroblasts
description: The authors find that stromal methyltransferase nicotinamide N-methyltransferase (NNMT) regulates the transition of normal fibroblasts to cancer-associated fibroblasts through histone methylation and promotes ovarian cancer growth and metastasis.

heading: Synthesis and breakdown of universal metabolic precursors promoted by iron
authors: Kamila B. MuchowskaSreejith J. VarmaJoseph Moran
description: A chemical reaction network that overlaps with the biological Krebs and glyoxylate cycles arises from pyruvate and glyoxylate in the presence of iron, suggesting how early metabolic pathways might have arisen from CO2.

heading: Single-cell transcriptomic analysis of Alzheimer’s disease
description: Single-cell transcriptomics from 48 individuals with varying degrees of Alzheimer’s disease pathology demonstrates that gene-expression changes in Alzheimer’s disease are both cell-type specific and shared, and that transcriptional responses show sexual dimorphism.

heading: CD8+ T cells regulate tumour ferroptosis during cancer immunotherapy
description: Interferon-γ induces ferroptotic cell death in tumours by suppressing cystine uptake and promoting lipid peroxidation.

heading: A rapidly changing jet orientation in the stellar-mass black-hole system V404 Cygni
authors: James C. A. Miller-JonesAlexandra J. TetarenkoValeriu Tudose
description: The relativistic jets associated with the black-hole X-ray binary system V404 Cygni change their orientation on time scales of minutes to hours, implying that the direction of the jets is being affected by the dynamics of the surrounding accretion flow that powers them.

heading: Imaging individual barium atoms in solid xenon for barium tagging in nEXO
description: Single barium atoms trapped in a solid xenon matrix can be imaged and counted by scanning with a focused laser, providing a possible tagging technique for the neutrinoless-double-β-decay experiment nEXO.

heading: Quaternary-centre-guided synthesis of complex polycyclic terpenes
authors: Pengfei HuHyung Min ChiScott A. Snyder
description: An approach in which quaternary centres are leveraged to improve synthetic planning can lead to shorter and optimized syntheses, demonstrated here on a series of polycyclic terpenes.

heading: Phylogenetic evidence for Sino-Tibetan origin in northern China in the Late Neolithic
description: Divergence estimates from phylogenetic analyses of 109 languages of the Sino-Tibetan family support a model in which this family originates in the Yellow River basin of northern China.

heading: Topological superconductivity in a phase-controlled Josephson junction
description: Majorana bound states are created in a two-dimensional architecture by confining Majorana channels within a planar Josephson junction, using the phase difference across the junction and an in-plane magnetic field.

heading: Evidence of topological superconductivity in planar Josephson junctions
description: Evidence is found for phase-tunable Majorana zero modes in scalable two-dimensional Josephson junctions produced by top-down fabrication.

heading: Single-cell transcriptomes of the regenerating intestine reveal a revival stem cell
description: Single-cell transcriptome profiling reveals the presence in the intestinal crypt of revival stem cells, which give rise to crypt-base columnar cells and are essential for repair of the intestinal epithelium following injury.

heading: SR-B1 drives endothelial cell LDL transcytosis via DOCK4 to promote atherosclerosis
authors: Linzhang HuangKen L. ChamblissPhilip W. Shaul
description: The SR-B1 receptor partners with DOCK4 and RAC1 to drive the uptake and transcytosis of LDL in endothelial cells, thereby promoting atherosclerosis in mice.

heading: Observation of two-neutrino double electron capture in 124Xe with XENON1T
description: Two-neutrino double electron capture is observed experimentally in 124Xe with the XENON1T detector, yielding a half-life of 1.8 × 1022 years.

heading: Forearc carbon sink reduces long-term volatile recycling into the mantle
authors: P. H. BarryJ. M. de MoorK. G. Lloyd
description: In the forearc regions of Costa Rica, helium and carbon isotope data reveal that about 20 per cent less carbon is being transported into the deep mantle than previously thought.

heading: NAD metabolic dependency in cancer is shaped by gene amplification and enhancer remodelling
description: NAD metabolic pathway choice in cancer is largely dependent on the tissue of origin, with implications for the development of precision treatments.

heading: Molybdenum-catalysed ammonia production with samarium diiodide and alcohols or water
description: The molybdenum-catalysed reduction of nitrogen to ammonia is achieved under ambient conditions, using samarium(ii) diiodide in combination with either simple alcohols or water as the proton source.

heading: Structural basis of ligand recognition at the human MT1 melatonin receptor
description: The MT1 melatonin receptor differs markedly from 5-HT receptors and shows atypical ligand entry; its structure with various ligands sheds light on receptor specificity.

heading: Self-organization and symmetry breaking in intestinal organoid development
description: Single-cell-based imaging and sequencing approaches are used to characterize organoid development and the intestinal regeneration process, which is driven by transient activation of YAP1.

heading: XFEL structures of the human MT2 melatonin receptor reveal the basis of subtype selectivity
description: Structural and functional studies show that the MT2 melatonin receptor, unlike the MT1 receptor, contains an extracellular opening for ligand entry, shedding light on receptor subtype specificity.

heading: Greater vulnerability to warming of marine versus terrestrial ectotherms
authors: Malin L. PinskyAnne Maria EikesetJennifer M. Sunday
description: Comparisons across terrestrial and marine ectotherms reveal that marine species experience temperatures closer to their upper thermal limits, and that local extirpations related to warming are more common in the ocean.

heading: Serotonin transporter–ibogaine complexes illuminate mechanisms of inhibition and transport
description: Cryo-electron microscopy reveals three conformations of the serotonin transporter in complex with ibogaine, detailing the structural rearrangements that occur between the different stages of its transport cycle.

heading: Speech synthesis from neural decoding of spoken sentences
authors: Gopala K. AnumanchipalliJosh ChartierEdward F. Chang
description: A neural decoder uses kinematic and sound representations encoded in human cortical activity to synthesize audible sentences, which are readily identified and transcribed by listeners.

heading: Chiral twisted van der Waals nanowires
description: A tunable interlayer twist that evolves naturally during synthesis of van der Waals nanowires made from layered crystals of germanium sulfide could produce new electronic structure and correlation phenomena.

heading: Neurocranial development of the coelacanth and the evolution of the sarcopterygian head
description: Micro-computed tomography and magnetic resonance imaging of a growth series of the coelacanth Latimeria chalumnae traces the ontogeny of the brain and neurocranium, which sheds light on neurocranial evolution in sarcopterygian fishes.

heading: Needle-like structures discovered on positively charged lightning branches
description: Radio interferometric observations of lightning over the Netherlands reveal small needle-shaped plasma structures associated with the positive leader channels, explaining why cloud-to-ground lightning connects to the ground multiple times.

heading: Astrophysical detection of the helium hydride ion HeH+
description: Studies of the planetary nebula NGC 7027, using an upgraded spectrometer onboard a high-altitude observatory, have identified the rotational ground-state transition of the helium hydride ion—the first molecule to form after the Big Bang and an essential precursor to molecular hydrogen.

heading: Resonant electro-optic frequency comb
authors: Alfredo RuedaFlorian SedlmeirHarald G. L. Schwefel
description: A low-power, fixed microwave signal in combination with an optical-pump signal generates an optical frequency comb that spans the whole wavelength range of the telecommunications C-band, with possible applications ranging from spectroscopy to optical communications.

heading: Targeting LIF-mediated paracrine interaction for pancreatic cancer therapy and monitoring
description: A systematic proteomic investigation of disease mediators secreted by pancreatic stellate cells identifies leukaemia inhibitory factor (LIF) as a key factor that acts on cancer cells, promoting tumour progression and chemoresistance.

heading: LLGL2 rescues nutrient stress by promoting leucine uptake in ER+ breast cancer
description: The polarity protein LLGL2 supports tumour growth in breast cancer by promoting leucine uptake and adaptation to nutrient stress.

heading: Transcriptome-wide off-target RNA editing induced by CRISPR-guided DNA base editors
description: CRISPR DNA base editors induce transcriptome-wide off-target RNA editing, which can be reduced by using engineered variants that retain on-target DNA editing activities.

heading: Observation of room-temperature polar skyrmions
description: Chiral polar-skyrmion bubbles are observed in superlattices of titanium-based perovskite oxides at room temperature.

heading: Mammalian ISWI and SWI/SNF selectively mediate binding of distinct transcription factors
description: Genetic deletion of mammalian chromatin remodelling complexes reveals that ISWI and SWI/SNF are required for binding of specific transcription factors and that ISWI regulates nucleosome positioning and nuclear organization in stem cells.

heading: Fatty acid transport protein 2 reprograms neutrophils in cancer
authors: Filippo VegliaVladimir A. TyurinDmitry I. Gabrilovich
description: The lipid transporter FATP2 reprograms neutrophils to polymorphonuclear myeloid-derived suppressor cells by mediating the uptake of arachidonic acid and promoting the synthesis of prostaglandin E2.

heading: Predicting disruptive instabilities in controlled fusion plasmas through deep learning
description: Using data from plasma-based tokamak nuclear reactors in the US and Europe, a machine-learning approach based on deep neural networks is taught to forecast disruptions, even those in machines on which the algorithm was not trained.

heading: Restoration of brain circulation and cellular functions hours post-mortem
description: A specialized technology can restore and preserve microcirculation and cellular functions hours post-mortem in an isolated pig brain.

heading: Compartmentalized gut lymph node drainage dictates adaptive immune responses
authors: Daria EsterházyMaria C. C. CanessoDaniel Mucida
description: Immune responses in the gut and associated draining lymph nodes differ between tolerogenic and inflammatory depending on their anatomical location.

heading: Electric field correlation measurements on the electromagnetic vacuum state
description: Electro-optic detection in a nonlinear crystal is used to measure coherence properties of vacuum fluctuations of the electromagnetic field and deduce the spectrum of the ground state of electromagnetic radiation.

heading: Production of phosphorene nanoribbons
authors: Mitchell C. WattsLoren PiccoChristopher A. Howard
description: Phosphorene nanoribbons are produced in liquids through the intercalation of black phosphorous crystals with lithium ions, enabling the search for predicted exotic states and applications of these nanoribbons.

heading: Associating HIV-1 envelope glycoprotein structures with states on the virus observed by smFRET
description: Single-molecule fluorescence resonance energy transfer imaging of conformational states of HIV-1 envelope glycoprotein trimers on intact virus and of trimers used in previous structural studies reveal the latter as downstream—rather than pre-triggered—conformations.

heading: Martian dust storm impact on atmospheric H2O and D/H observed by ExoMars Trace Gas Orbiter
authors: Ann Carine VandaeleOleg KorablevMaria Paz Zorzano
description: High-resolution measurements of Martian atmospheric dust, water and semiheavy water, obtained by the ExoMars Trace Gas Orbiter during a global dust storm on Mars, are reported.

heading: Developmental origin, functional maintenance and genetic rescue of osteoclasts
authors: Christian E. Jacome-GalarzaGulce I. PercinFrederic Geissmann
description: Multinucleated osteoclasts required for normal bone development and tooth eruption in the mouse originate from embryonic erythro-myeloid progenitors and are maintained after birth by fusion with circulating monocytes.

heading: p38γ is essential for cell cycle progression and liver tumorigenesis
description: The stress-activated kinase p38γ has a role in regulating entry into the cell cycle; in the liver, it can induce cellular proliferation during regeneration and promote the development of hepatocellular carcinoma.

heading: Prioritization of cancer therapeutic targets using CRISPR–Cas9 screens
authors: Fiona M. BehanFrancesco IorioMathew J. Garnett
description: In a screen of 324 human cancer cell lines and utilising a systematic target prioritization framework, the Werner syndrome ATP-dependent helicase is shown to be a synthetic lethal target in tumours from multiple cancer types with microsatellite instability, providing a new target for cancer drug development.

heading: WRN helicase is a synthetic lethal target in microsatellite unstable cancers
authors: Edmond M. ChanTsukasa ShibueAdam J. Bass
description: Depletion of the DNA helicase WRN induced double-stranded DNA breaks, and promoted apoptosis and cell cycle arrest selectively in cancers with microsatellite instability, indicating that WRN is a promising drug target for the treatment of these cancers.

heading: A magnetar-powered X-ray transient as the aftermath of a binary neutron-star merger
authors: Y. Q. XueX. C. ZhengF. Vito
description: Observations of an X-ray transient associated with a galaxy at redshift 0.738 suggest that the X-ray transient is powered by a millisecond magnetar and that it is the remnant of a merger between two neutron stars.

heading: A new species of Homo from the Late Pleistocene of the Philippines
authors: Florent DétroitArmand Salvador MijaresPhilip J. Piper
description: Homo luzonensis, a new species of Homo from the Callao Cave in the Philippines from the Late Pleistocene epoch, is described.

heading: Transposon molecular domestication and the evolution of the RAG recombinase
authors: Yuhang ZhangTat Cheung ChengDavid G. Schatz
description: Identification of the changes that converted a transposase to a recombinase sheds light on the evolution of the vertebrate adaptive immune system.

heading: Visualization of clustered protocadherin neuronal self-recognition complexes
description: Clustered protocadherin ectodomains spontaneously assemble to form a zipper-like lattice of alternating cis and trans interactions at membrane contact sites, which probably represents their mode of function in neuronal self-recognition.

heading: Nitrosative stress drives heart failure with preserved ejection fraction
authors: Gabriele G. SchiattarellaFrancisco AltamiranoJoseph A. Hill
description: iNOS-driven dysregulation of the IRE1α–XBP1 pathway leads to cardiomyocyte dysfunction in mice and recapitulates the systemic and cardiovascular features of human heart failure with preserved ejection fraction.

heading: No detection of methane on Mars from early ExoMars Trace Gas Orbiter observations
authors: Oleg KorablevAnn Carine VandaeleMaria Paz Zorzano
description: Highly sensitive measurements of the atmosphere of Mars with the ExoMars Trace Gas Orbiter do not detect any methane over a range of latitudes in both hemispheres, in contrast to previous local or remote detections.

heading: The bone marrow microenvironment at single-cell resolution
description: The transcriptional landscape of cell populations of the mouse bone marrow microenvironment, mapped at single-cell resolution, reveals cellular heterogeneity in this niche as well as substantial transcriptional remodelling under stress conditions.

heading: The emergent landscape of the mouse gut endoderm at single-cell resolution
description: The developing mouse gut endoderm, mapped at single-cell resolution, reveals trajectories of cell differentiation before and during gastrulation and the emergence of regionalized cell identities along the anterior–posterior axis of the gut tube.

heading: Global glacier mass changes and their contributions to sea-level rise from 1961 to 2016
description: The largest collection so far of glaciological and geodetic observations suggests that glaciers contributed about 27 millimetres to sea-level rise from 1961 to 2016, at rates of ice loss that could see the disappearance of many glaciers this century.

heading: Global warming impairs stock–recruitment dynamics of corals
authors: Terry P. HughesJames T. KerryRachael M. Woods
description: A regional-scale shift in the relationships between adult stock and recruitment of corals occurred along the Great Barrier Reef, following mass bleaching events in 2016 and 2017 caused by global warming.

heading: Observation of fermion-mediated interactions between bosonic atoms
description: Embedding a Bose–Einstein condensate of caesium atoms in a degenerate Fermi gas of lithium atoms gives rise to fermion-mediated attractive boson–boson interactions, which can lead to the formation of a train of Bose–Fermi solitons.

heading: Nuclear positioning facilitates amoeboid migration along the path of least resistance
description: Geometrically defined microenvironments are used to show that leukocytes migrate along chemokine gradients using the nucleus as a mechanical gauge to sample potential paths and identify the path of least resistance.

heading: Oxytocin-dependent reopening of a social reward learning critical period with MDMA
description: A critical period for social reward learning in mice, which closes at maturity, can be reopened by MDMA-mediated upregulation of oxytocin-dependent plasticity.

heading: An allosteric mechanism for potent inhibition of human ATP-citrate lyase
description: The structure of human ATP-citrate lyase, in complex with a newly developed small-molecule inhibitor, shows extensive conformational changes that reveal an allosteric site for the inhibitor to bind and indirectly compete with the citrate substrate.

heading: Visualizing vibrational normal modes of a single molecule with atomically confined light
authors: Joonhee LeeKevin T. CramptonV. Ara Apkarian
description: The vibrational normal modes in a single molecule are imaged using tip-enhanced Raman spectromicroscopy performed in the atomistic near-field.

heading: Five decades of northern land carbon uptake revealed by the interhemispheric CO2 gradient
description: Measurements of the interhemispheric gradient of atmospheric carbon dioxide show that the Northern Hemisphere carbon land sink remained stable between the 1960s and the late 1980s, then increased during the 1990s and 2000s.

heading: Stem cell competition orchestrates skin homeostasis and ageing
description: COL17A1-driven stem cell competition and symmetric cell divisions initially govern skin homeostasis, but the same mechanisms result in skin ageing later in life.

heading: A widespread coral-infecting apicomplexan with chlorophyll biosynthesis genes
authors: Waldan K. KwongJavier del CampoPatrick J. Keeling
description: A newly identified lineage of apicomplexans, named corallicolids, are intracellular symbionts of many coral species, and possesses a plastid that retains genes for chlorophyll biosynthesis despite lacking photosystem genes.

heading: TMK1-mediated auxin signalling regulates differential growth of the apical hook
description: In Arabidopsis thaliana, a newly identified auxin signalling pathway that involves TMK1 protein cleavage and IAA32 and IAA34 transcriptional repressors mediates complex developmental outcomes by allowing distinct interpretations of varying concentrations of cellular auxin.

heading: CD22 blockade restores homeostatic microglial phagocytosis in ageing brains
authors: John V. PluvinageMichael S. HaneyTony Wyss-Coray
description: CD22 inhibits microglial phagocytosis in the ageing brain, and treatment with a CD22-blocking antibody restores microglial homeostasis and cognitive function in ageing mice.

heading: Precise therapeutic gene correction by a simple nuclease-induced double-stranded break
description: Disease-causing microduplications can be corrected by harnessing an endogenous double-stranded break DNA repair pathway.

heading: Structure of ATP citrate lyase and the origin of citrate synthase in the Krebs cycle
authors: Koen H. G. VerschuerenClement BlanchetKenneth Verstraete
description: Crystal structures of ATP citrate lyase from bacteria, archaea and humans unravel how the enzyme directs the formation of the central metabolite acetyl-CoA, and shed light onto the evolutionary origins of the Krebs cycle.

heading: Innate lymphoid cells support regulatory T cells in the intestine through interleukin-2
description: A microbiota- and IL-1β-dependent axis of IL-2 production by group-3 innate lymphoid cells is shown in a mouse model to be necessary to maintain immunological homeostasis and regulatory T cells in the small intestine.

heading: Nonreciprocal control and cooling of phonon modes in an optomechanical system
authors: H. XuLuyao JiangJ. G. E. Harris
description: A cavity optomechanical scheme produces robust nonreciprocal coupling between phononic resonators and is used to control the resonators’ thermal fluctuations.

heading: Ultrafast spin-lasers
description: Room-temperature modulation frequencies exceeding 200 GHz are demonstrated in birefringent semiconductor spin-lasers by coupling the spin of the charge carriers to the light polarization.

heading: PTC-bearing mRNA elicits a genetic compensation response via Upf3a and COMPASS components
description: mRNA that contains a premature termination codon (PTC) triggers a genetic compensation response that involves both transcription of its homologous genes and degradation of the mutated transcript by the nonsense-mediated decay pathway.

heading: Object-vector coding in the medial entorhinal cortex
authors: Øyvind Arne HøydalEmilie Ranheim SkytøenEdvard I. Moser
description: Cells in the mouse medial entorhinal cortex that fire when mice are at a specific distance and direction from a stationary object suggest that vector coding is important for rodent navigation.

heading: Genetic compensation triggered by mutant mRNA degradation
authors: Mohamed A. El-BrolosyZacharias KontarakisDidier Y. R. Stainier
description: Transcriptional adaptation, a genetic compensation process by which organisms respond to mutations by upregulating related genes, is triggered by mRNA decay and involves a sequence-dependent mechanism.

heading: Quantum Kibble–Zurek mechanism and critical dynamics on a programmable Rydberg simulator
description: A Rydberg atom quantum simulator with programmable interactions is used to experimentally verify the quantum Kibble–Zurek mechanism through the growth of spatial correlations during quantum phase transitions.

heading: Climate–land-use interactions shape tropical mountain biodiversity and ecosystem functions
description: Elevational trends in biodiversity and ecosystem functions across natural and anthropogenic habitats on Mount Kilimanjaro show that the effects of land use are strongly mediated by climate.

heading: Mapping changes in housing in sub-Saharan Africa from 2000 to 2015
description: The prevalence of improved housing (with improved drinking water and sanitation, sufficient living area and durable construction) in urban and rural sub-Saharan Africa doubled between 2000 and 2015.

heading: Chemosensory modulation of neural circuits for sodium appetite
description: Sodium appetite in mice is driven by a neural circuit that is focused on neurons of the pre-locus coeruleus and integrates the sensory detection of sodium and internal signals.

heading: Mid-latitude net precipitation decreased with Arctic warming during the Holocene
authors: Cody C. RoutsonNicholas P. McKayToby Ault
description: A reduced gradient in temperatures between low and high latitudes during the Holocene led to drier mid-latitudes.

heading: Structural variation in the gut microbiome associates with host health
description: The authors systematically characterize structural variation in the genomes of gut microbiota and show that they are associated with bacterial fitness and with host risk factors, and that examining genes coded in these regions facilitates investigation of mechanisms that may underlie these associations.

heading: Attachment of the blastoderm to the vitelline envelope affects gastrulation of insects
description: In the red flour beetle (Tribolium castaneum) and fruit fly (Drosophila melanogaster), spatiotemporally coordinated integrin-dependent attachments between the blastoderm and vitelline envelope counteract tissue-intrinsic contractile forces to create asymmetric movements of embryonic tissue.

heading: Anaerobic oxidation of ethane by archaea from a marine hydrocarbon seep
description: An archaeon, ‘Candidatus Argoarchaeum ethanivorans’, which is involved in the oxidation of ethane observed in anoxic marine habitats, is identified and metabolically characterized.

heading: CAR T cell trogocytosis and cooperative killing regulate tumour antigen escape
description: Chimeric antigen receptors (CARs) promote antigen loss in tumour cells by trogocytosis, which results in T cell fratricide killing and exhaustion but can be counteracted by cooperative killing and combinatorial targeting.

heading: Colossal barocaloric effects in plastic crystals
description: Colossal barocaloric effects are observed in the plastic crystal neopentylglycol and found to originate from the extensive molecular orientational disorder, giant compressibility and highly anharmonic lattice dynamics of the material.

heading: A gut-to-brain signal of fluid osmolarity controls thirst satiation
authors: Christopher A. ZimmermanErica L. HueyZachary A. Knight
description: Drinking behaviour in mice is regulated by a signal derived from the water and salt content of the gastrointestinal tract that is transmitted to forebrain neurons that control thirst via the vagus nerve.

heading: Van der Waals contacts between three-dimensional metals and two-dimensional semiconductors
description: Ultraclean van der Waals bonds between gold-capped indium and a monolayer of the two-dimensional transition-metal dichalcogenide molybdenum disulfide show desirably low contact resistance at the interface, enabling high-performance field-effect transistors.

heading: Error mitigation extends the computational reach of a noisy quantum processor
description: The accuracy of computations on noisy, near-term quantum systems can be enhanced by extrapolating results from experiments with various noise levels, without requiring additional hardware modifications.

heading: Efficient, stable and scalable perovskite solar cells using poly(3-hexylthiophene)
authors: Eui Hyuk JungNam Joong JeonJangwon Seo
description: A double-layered halide architecture for perovskite solar cells enables the use of dopant-free poly(3-hexylthiophene) as a hole-transport material, forming stable and scalable devices with a certified power conversion efficiency of 22.7 per cent.

heading: Syndecan 1 is a critical mediator of macropinocytosis in pancreatic cancer
authors: Wantong YaoJohnathon L. RoseGiulio F. Draetta
description: In an inducible mouse model of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, the signalling defect that underlies 90% of these tumours causes increased cell-surface expression of syndecan 1, leading to misregulation of macropinocytosis, and linking the defective signalling with nutrient-salvage pathways.

heading: Transcriptome-scale super-resolved imaging in tissues by RNA seqFISH+
description: seqFISH+, an evolution of sequential fluorescence in situ hybridization with super-resolution imaging capabilities, is used to image mRNAs of 10,000 genes in cultured cells and mouse brain slices, demonstrating the ability to generate spatial atlases and to perform discovery-driven studies in situ.

heading: Measurement of quantum back action in the audio band at room temperature
description: Future gravitational-wave detectors are expected to be limited by quantum back action, which is now found in the audio band in a low-loss optomechanical system.

heading: Observation of unconventional chiral fermions with long Fermi arcs in CoSi
description: Angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy measurements in CoSi reveal the presence of unconventional chiral fermions near the Fermi level, with giant surface Fermi arcs and one pair of well separated chiral nodes.

heading: Structural basis of unidirectional export of lipopolysaccharide to the cell surface
authors: Tristan W. OwensRebecca J. TaylorDaniel Kahne
description: Crystal structures of a five-protein complex comprising the inner-membrane components of the bacterial lipopolysaccharide transporter provide insight into the mechanism of extraction of lipopolysaccharide from the inner membrane and its transport to the outer membrane.

heading: A potassium channel β-subunit couples mitochondrial electron transport to sleep
description: Sleep deprivation in Drosophila elevates reactive oxygen species in sleep-promoting neurons, leading to changes in potassium currents and spiking activity and thereby connecting energy metabolism, oxidative stress, and sleep.

heading: Particle robotics based on statistical mechanics of loosely coupled components
description: A stochastic robotic system shows deterministic behaviour—such as locomotion, object transport and phototaxis—from the collective motion of many loosely coupled disk-shaped ‘particles’ that perform only volumetric oscillations.

heading: A NIK–SIX signalling axis controls inflammation by targeted silencing of non-canonical NF-κB
authors: Zixu LiuKatrina B. MarNeal M. Alto
description: Non-canonical NF-κB is regulated by a negative feedback loop involving NIK-mediated activation of SIX1 and SIX2.

heading: Topological chiral crystals with helicoid-arc quantum states
authors: Daniel S. SanchezIlya BelopolskiM. Zahid Hasan
description: Angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy measurements reveal that CoSi and RhSi are nearly ideal topological conductors, with structural chirality and surface helicoid arcs of topological charge ±2 arising from bulk multifold chiral states.

heading: Structural basis of lipopolysaccharide extraction by the LptB2FGC complex
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of LptB2FGC, in nucleotide-free and vanadate-trapped states, reveal the mechanism of lipopolysaccharide extraction from the inner membrane of Gram-negative bacteria and a role for LptC in efficient lipopolysaccharide transport.

heading: Neoantigen-directed immune escape in lung cancer evolution
description: RNA sequencing data and tumour pathology observations of non-small-cell lung cancers indicate that the immune cell microenvironment exerts strong evolutionary selection pressures that shape the immune-evasion capacity of tumours.

heading: An X-ray chimney extending hundreds of parsecs above and below the Galactic Centre
description: Huge X-ray structures, termed Galactic Centre ‘chimneys’, extending hundreds of parsecs above and below the Galactic plane, appear to be exhaust channels connecting the Galactic Centre region to the Fermi bubbles.

heading: Deep electrical imaging of the ultraslow-spreading Mohns Ridge
description: An inversion model for the ultraslow-spreading Mohns Ridge, combining controlled source electromagnetic and magnetotelluric data, reveals passive mantle upwelling controlled by slow and asymmetric plate movements.

heading: Recruitment of BRCA1 limits MYCN-driven accumulation of stalled RNA polymerase
description: In human neuroblastoma tumours, MYCN is engaged in a USP11–BRCA1-dependent manner to suppress the accumulation of stalled RNAPII and induces both the activation and repression of genes.

heading: The expanding landscape of ‘oncohistone’ mutations in human cancers
authors: Benjamin A. NacevLijuan FengC. David Allis
description: The characterization of missense histone mutations that occur across several cancer types provides insight into the potential role of these mutations in altering chromatin structure and potentially contributing to tumour development.

heading: Novel tau filament fold in chronic traumatic encephalopathy encloses hydrophobic molecules
authors: Benjamin FalconJasenko ZivanovSjors H. W. Scheres
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of tau filaments from the brains of three individuals with chronic traumatic encephalopathy reveal distinct assembled tau conformers, with a novel protofilament fold enclosing hydrophobic molecules.

heading: Diverse and robust molecular algorithms using reprogrammable DNA self-assembly
description: A set of 355 self-assembling DNA ‘tiles’ can be reprogrammed to implement many different computer algorithms—including sorting, palindrome testing and divisibility by three—suggesting that molecular self-assembly could be a reliable algorithmic component in programmable chemical systems.

heading: RETRACTED ARTICLE: Complex societies precede moralizing gods throughout world history
description: Belief in moralizing gods followed the expansion of human societies and may have been preceded by doctrinal rituals that contributed to the initial rise of social complexity.

heading: The unexpected surface of asteroid (101955) Bennu
authors: D. S. LaurettaD. N. DellaGiustinaB. Marty
description: Observations of asteroid (101955) Bennu with NASA’s OSIRIS-REx spacecraft reveal an unexpected surficial diversity that poses a challenge to the success of the sample-return mission.

heading: Attosecond angular streaking and tunnelling time in atomic hydrogen
authors: U. Satya SainadhHan XuI. V. Litvinyuk
description: Simulation and measurement of the photoionization of atomic hydrogen at attosecond resolution confirm that the tunnelling of the ejected electron is instantaneous.

heading: Visualizing DNA folding and RNA in embryos at single-cell resolution
authors: Leslie J. MateoSedona E. MurphyAlistair N. Boettiger
description: Optical reconstruction of chromatin architecture and multiplex RNA labelling traces the DNA path in single cells and its relationship to transcription.

heading: Self-formed bedrock waterfalls
authors: Joel S. ScheingrossMichael P. LambBrian M. Fuller
description: Even in the absence of external perturbations, waterfalls can gradually form from planar bedrock riverbeds as a result of unstable interactions between flow hydraulics, sediment transport and bedrock erosion.

heading: Site-selective and versatile aromatic C−H functionalization by thianthrenation
description: A highly site-selective aromatic C–H functionalization reaction that does not require a particular directing group or arene substitution pattern provides functionalized arenes that can participate in various transformations.

heading: Supervised learning with quantum-enhanced feature spaces
authors: Vojtěch HavlíčekAntonio D. CórcolesJay M. Gambetta
description: Two classification algorithms that use the quantum state space to produce feature maps are demonstrated on a superconducting processor, enabling the solution of problems when the feature space is large and the kernel functions are computationally expensive to estimate.

heading: Structure of the human LAT1–4F2hc heteromeric amino acid transporter complex
description: The cryo-EM structure of the LAT1–4F2hc complex, a heteromeric amino acid transporter, is characterized, providing insights into its function and the mechanisms through which mutations of this complex could cause disease.

heading: Optical clock comparison for Lorentz symmetry testing
description: Agreement between two single-ion clocks is demonstrated experimentally at the 10−18 level over a six-month period, confirming a key postulate of Einstein’s theory of relativity with hundredfold-improved precision.

heading: Feature-selective encoding of substrate vibrations in the forelimb somatosensory cortex
description: Responses to passive vibration of the forelimb in the mouse somatosensory cortex rely on a rate code that is selectively tuned to a combination of stimulus frequency and amplitude, and originate from deep mechanoreceptors close to the bones.

heading: Enzyme-catalysed [6+4] cycloadditions in the biosynthesis of natural products
authors: Bo ZhangKai Biao WangHui Ming Ge
description: Enzymatic catalysis of pericyclic [6+4] cycloaddition reactions to form ten-membered rings is observed during biosynthesis of the macrocyclic antibiotic streptoseomycin, and the mechanism of these transformations is established.

heading: New insights from uncultivated genomes of the global human gut microbiome
authors: Stephen NayfachZhou Jason ShiNikos C. Kyrpides
description: Draft prokaryotic genomes from faecal metagenomes of diverse human populations enrich our understanding of the human gut microbiome by identifying over two thousand new species-level taxa that have numerous disease associations.

heading: Small-molecule ion channels increase host defences in cystic fibrosis airway epithelia
authors: Katrina A. MuragliaRajeev S. ChorghadeMartin D. Burke
description: Amphotericin B forms nonselective transmembrane ion channels, and restores host defences of cystic fibrosis airway epithelia independently of the regulatory function of cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance.

heading: Efficacy of MEK inhibition in patients with histiocytic neoplasms
authors: Eli L. DiamondBenjamin H. DurhamDavid M. Hyman
description: A proof-of-concept clinical trial of patients with histiocytoses with MAPK-pathway mutations showed durable responses to treatment with the MEK1 and MEK2 inhibitor cobimetinib, which indicates that histiocytic neoplasms are dependent on MAPK signalling.

heading: Histone H3 trimethylation at lysine 36 guides m6A RNA modification co-transcriptionally
description: METTL14 recognizes the trimethyl mark on lysine 36 of histone H3 that directs m6A modifications co-transcriptionally.

heading: Glucocorticoids promote breast cancer metastasis
authors: Milan M. S. ObradovićBaptiste HamelinMohamed Bentires-Alj
description: In patient-derived xenograft models of breast cancer in mice, an increase in stress hormones during progression or treatment with their synthetic derivatives activates the glucocorticoid receptor, and results in increased metastatic colonization and reduced survival.

heading: Dynamics of breast-cancer relapse reveal late-recurring ER-positive genomic subgroups
description: A statistical framework for breast-cancer recurrence uses long-term follow-up data and a knowledge of molecular subcategories to model distinct disease stages and to predict the risk of relapse.

heading: Mechanism of DNA translocation underlying chromatin remodelling by Snf2
description: Cryo-EM structures of yeast Snf2 bound to the nucleosome in the presence of ADP or an ATP analogue reveal that Snf2 binding leads to distortion of the DNA, and a two-step mechanism underlying chromatin remodelling by Snf2 is proposed.

heading: Discovery of a pathway for terminal-alkyne amino acid biosynthesis
authors: J. A. MarchandM. E. NeugebauerM. C. Y. Chang
description: Microbial generation of a terminal-alkyne-containing amino acid can be encoded into E. coli and provides the potential for in vivo generation of proteins and natural products for click chemistry.

heading: A distance to the Large Magellanic Cloud that is precise to one per cent
description: A new calibration of the surface brightness–colour relation of eclipsing binary stars gives a distance to the Large Magellanic Cloud that is precise to one per cent.

heading: Histone serotonylation is a permissive modification that enhances TFIID binding to H3K4me3
authors: Lorna A. FarrellyRobert E. ThompsonIan Maze
description: In serotonin-rich tissues, tissue transglutaminase 2 is able to attach serotonin to a glutamine residue in histone H3; this modification mediates permissive gene expression in these tissues.

heading: Broadband electro-optic frequency comb generation in a lithium niobate microring resonator
description: Using a thin-film lithium niobate photonic platform, an electro-optic frequency comb generator is realized that is capable of producing wide and stable spectra, spanning more frequencies than the entire telecommunications L-band.

heading: TRAIP is a master regulator of DNA interstrand crosslink repair
authors: R. Alex WuDaniel R. SemlowJohannes C. Walter
description: The E3 ubiquitin ligase TRAIP governs the choice between the NEIL3 or the Fanconi anaemia pathway for the repair of DNA interstrand crosslinks.

heading: Single-neuron perturbations reveal feature-specific competition in V1
description: A combination of optogenetics and calcium imaging at the single-neuron level provides evidence for feature-specific competition among neurons in primary visual cortex.

heading: Structural basis of STING binding with and phosphorylation by TBK1
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of human TBK1 in complex with cyclic GMP–AMP-bound chicken STING reveals a binding mode that suggests that STING phosphorylation by TBK1 requires oligomerization of both proteins.

heading: Wetland carbon storage controlled by millennial-scale variation in relative sea-level rise
authors: Kerrylee RogersJeffrey J. KellewayColin D. Woodroffe
description: Wetlands exposed to rapid sea-level rise over the late Holocene contain more soil carbon than those that experienced a long period of sea-level stability.

heading: Autophagy induction via STING trafficking is a primordial function of the cGAS pathway
description: The authors report that the cGAS–STING pathway drives a form of autophagy that is independent of interferon induction and distinct from the conventional autophagy.

heading: Effective breast cancer combination therapy targeting BACH1 and mitochondrial metabolism
authors: Jiyoung LeeAli E. YesilkanalMarsha Rich Rosner
description: The transcription factor BACH1, which targets mitochondrial metabolism, is expressed at high levels in several types of cancer; reducing its expression in tumours makes them more susceptible to treatment with mitochondrial inhibitors.

heading: Molecular streaming and its voltage control in ångström-scale channels
description: Pressure-driven transport of aqueous salts through ångström-scale channels created from two-dimensional materials shows a transistor-like effect in which applying a tiny bias voltage can increase transport by up to 20 times.

heading: Cryo-EM structures of STING reveal its mechanism of activation by cyclic GMP–AMP
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of full-length STING show that cyclic GMP–AMP induces a half-turn rotation of the ligand-binding domain relative to the transmembrane domain, forming a tetramer and higher-order oligomers for signalling.

heading: Resonantly hybridized excitons in moiré superlattices in van der Waals heterostructures
authors: Evgeny M. AlexeevDavid A. Ruiz-TijerinaAlexander I. Tartakovskii
description: Excitonic bands in MoSe2/WS2 heterostructures can hybridize, resulting in a resonant enhancement of moiré superlattice effects.

heading: S-Geranylgeranyl-l-glutathione is a ligand for human B cell-confinement receptor P2RY8
authors: Erick LuFinn D. WolfreysJason G. Cyster
description: S-geranylgeranyl-l-glutathione (GGG) is identified as a cell signalling molecule that interacts with the receptor P2RY8 to mediate migration inhibition and growth regulation of germinal-centre B cells.

heading: Verified quantum information scrambling
description: A quantum circuit in an ion-trap quantum computer provides a positive test for the scrambling features of a given unitary process.

heading: p53 regulation of ammonia metabolism through urea cycle controls polyamine biosynthesis
description: p53 regulates the metabolism of ammonia by repressing genes of the urea cycle that function to eliminate excess ammonia.

heading: Hepatocytes direct the formation of a pro-metastatic niche in the liver
authors: Jae W. LeeMeredith L. StoneGregory L. Beatty
description: Pancreatic cancer activates IL-6–STAT3 signalling in hepatocytes to induce the formation of a pro-metastatic niche in the liver.

heading: Gboxin is an oxidative phosphorylation inhibitor that targets glioblastoma
authors: Yufeng ShiS. Kyun LimLuis F. Parada
description: Gboxin and its chemical derivatives inhibit the growth of primary human and mouse glioblastoma cells, but not of mouse embryonic fibroblasts or neonatal astrocytes, by targeting mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation complexes.

heading: HIV-1 remission following CCR5Δ32/Δ32 haematopoietic stem-cell transplantation
description: An adult infected with HIV-1 who underwent allogeneic haematopoietic stem-cell transplantation for Hodgkin’s lymphoma using cells from a CCR5Δ32/Δ32 donor achieved full remission of HIV-1 for 18 months after transplantation and 16 months after cessation of antiretroviral therapy.

heading: Random anti-lasing through coherent perfect absorption in a disordered medium
description: Coherent perfect absorption in a disordered medium is demonstrated experimentally in the microwave regime through the realization of a random anti-laser that absorbs engineered radiation with near-perfect efficiency.

heading: Managing nitrogen to restore water quality in China
description: Estimates of spatial patterns of nitrogen discharge into water bodies across China between 1955 and 2014 show that current discharge rates are almost three times the acceptable threshold, and ways to restore a clean water environment are suggested.

heading: Comprehensive search for topological materials using symmetry indicators
description: An algorithm based on symmetry indicators is used to search a crystallographic database and finds thousands of candidate topological materials, which could be exploited in next-generation electronic devices.

heading: Complete biosynthesis of cannabinoids and their unnatural analogues in yeast
authors: Xiaozhou LuoMichael A. ReiterJay D. Keasling
description: Genetic engineering of yeast enables the production of cannabinoids and cannabinoid analogues from the simple sugar galactose, without the need to cultivate Cannabis.

heading: Breast cancer cells rely on environmental pyruvate to shape the metastatic niche
description: Exogenous pyruvate is needed for breast cancer cells to form metastases, and the inhibition of pyruvate metabolism impairs collagen hydroxylation and the growth of lung metastases in different mouse models.

heading: Encoding a qubit in a trapped-ion mechanical oscillator
authors: C. FlühmannT. L. NguyenJ. P. Home
description: A single logical qubit is encoded, manipulated and read out using a superposition of displaced squeezed states of the harmonic motion of a trapped calcium ion.

heading: An integrative systems genetic analysis of mammalian lipid metabolism
authors: Benjamin L. ParkerAnna C. CalkinBrian G. Drew
description: The integration of liver and plasma quantitative lipidomic and proteomic data from 107 distinct mouse strains provides important insights into regulators of mammalian lipid metabolism.

heading: Catalogue of topological electronic materials
description: Topological materials are thought to be scarce, but an algorithm that diagnoses nontrivial topology in nonmagnetic materials finds the opposite: more than 30 per cent of the 26,688 materials studied are topological.

heading: Structure of the IFNγ receptor complex guides design of biased agonists
authors: Juan L. MendozaNichole K. EscalanteK. Christopher Garcia
description: The X-ray structure of the hexameric complex of interferon-γ bound to its receptors is solved at 3.25 Å resolution, providing a basis for engineering variants of interferon-γ that enable decoupling of its immunomodulatory functions.

heading: Entanglement of bosonic modes through an engineered exchange interaction
authors: Yvonne Y. GaoBrian J. LesterRobert J. Schoelkopf
description: Two superconducting cavity modes are entangled using an exponential-SWAP logic gate.

heading: A complete catalogue of high-quality topological materials
description: Topological quantum chemistry and newly developed codes are used to analyse and compute the topological properties of materials in a large crystal database and to identify new topological phases, finding that more than 27 per cent of all materials in nature are topological.

heading: Exposing Anopheles mosquitoes to antimalarials blocks Plasmodium parasite transmission
authors: Douglas G. PatonLauren M. ChildsFlaminia Catteruccia
description: Treatment of female Anopheles gambiae mosquitoes with atovaquone causes arrest of the Plasmodium falciparum parasite in the midgut, and this holds promise for malaria eradication in areas with insecticide-resistant mosquito populations.

heading: Genome-wide analysis identifies NR4A1 as a key mediator of T cell dysfunction
description: Tolerant T cells display characteristic patterns of gene expression and epigenetics that are distinct from other types of T cells and are orchestrated by the transcription factor NR4A1.

heading: NR4A transcription factors limit CAR T cell function in solid tumours
description: Transfer of NR4A-deficient T cells expressing chimeric antigen receptors is shown to reduce tumour burden and increase survival by shifting T cell transcriptional programs away from exhaustion and towards increased effector function.

heading: Colonic epithelial cell diversity in health and inflammatory bowel disease
description: Profiling of single epithelial cells in healthy and inflamed colons identifies specialized cellular subpopulations, including a type of goblet cell that secretes the antibacterial protein WFDC2, which preserves the integrity of the epithelial barrier layer.

heading: A radical switch in clonality reveals a stem cell niche in the epiphyseal growth plate
authors: Phillip T. NewtonLei LiAndrei S. Chagin
