description: Uranium-series dating of rock art from Borneo reveals a minimum date for figurative artwork of 40,000 years ago, and a distinct style of parietal art in Southeast Asia at the Last Glacial Maximum.\

heading: Cryo-EM structures of a human ABCG2 mutant trapped in ATP-bound and substrate-bound states
authors: Ioannis ManolaridisScott M. JacksonKaspar P. Locher
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the ABCG2 protein in ATP- and substrate-bound states reveal the location of substrate binding, conformational changes required for substrate translocation and how inhibitors might be distinguished from substrates.

heading: Design of amidobenzimidazole STING receptor agonists with systemic activity
authors: Joshi M. RamanjuluG. Scott PesiridisJohn Bertin
description: A small-molecule agonist for the cGAS–STING pathway has systemic activity in a mouse model of colon cancer.

heading: Repeated multi-qubit readout and feedback with a mixed-species trapped-ion register
description: A multi-qubit mixed-species register is used for repeated correlation measurements using conditional feedback to stabilize two-qubit subspaces and Bell states, achieving up to 50 sequential measurements with negligible crosstalk.

heading: Emergent constraints on climate sensitivity
Dinosaur egg colour had a single evolutionary origin
description: A phylogenetic assessment based on Raman microspectroscopy of pigment traces in fossilized eggshells from all major dinosaur clades reveals that eggshell coloration and pigment pattern originated in nonavian theropod dinosaurs.

heading: Climate constraint reflects forced signal
Cox et al. reply
authors: Peter M. CoxMark S. WilliamsonChris Huntingford

heading: Deconstructive diversification of cyclic amines
description: The silver-mediated deconstructive functionalization of saturated nitrogen heterocycles via acylic haloamine intermediates provides access to various acyclic amines as well as enabling ring contraction and skeletal remodelling.

heading: Assumptions for emergent constraints
authors: Patrick T. BrownMartin B. StolpeKen Caldeira

heading: Active superelasticity in three-dimensional epithelia of controlled shape
description: Theoretical modelling in combination with measurements of tension and shape in epithelial domes of controlled geometry reveals a plateau of tension in tissue that is maintained by heterogeneous strain across cells.

heading: Three-dimensional collective charge excitations in electron-doped copper oxide superconductors
description: Resonant inelastic X-ray scattering on electron-doped copper oxide superconductors reveals a three-dimensional charge collective mode, which has properties suggestive of the long-sought acoustic plasmon.

heading: Measurement-based quantum control of mechanical motion
description: The displacement of a mechanical resonator is measured to within 35% of the Heisenberg uncertainty limit, enabling feedback cooling to the quantum ground state, nine decibels below the quantum-backaction limit.

heading: Resting zone of the growth plate houses a unique class of skeletal stem cells
description: In a mouse model, PTHrP-positive chondrocytes in the resting zone of the growth plate constitute a unique stem-cell population, which is initially unipotent and makes columnar chondrocytes that later exhibit multipotency.

heading: The SWI/SNF complex is a mechanoregulated inhibitor of YAP and TAZ
description: The ARID1A-containing SWI/SNF complex operates as an inhibitor of the pro-oncogenic transcriptional coactivators YAP and TAZ; this interaction is regulated by cellular mechanotransduction.

heading: TDP-43 and RNA form amyloid-like myo-granules in regenerating muscle
authors: Thomas O. VoglerJoshua R. WheelerRoy Parker
description: Cytoplasmic, amyloid-like oligomeric assemblies that contain TDP-43 are increased in damaged tissues with elevated regeneration, thereby enhancing the possibility of amyloid fibre formation and/or aggregation of TDP-43 in disease.

heading: Metal-free ribonucleotide reduction powered by a DOPA radical in Mycoplasma pathogens
description: A subclass of ribonucleotide reductase in Mycoplasma pathogens contains a stable radical formed from a modified tyrosine residue, overturning the presumed requirement for a dinuclear metal site in aerobic ribonucleotide reductase.

heading: Conformational transitions of the serotonin 5-HT3 receptor
description: Cryo-electron microscopy of the serotonin 5-HT3 receptor in complex with various ligands yields four distinct structures, capturing serotonin binding in detail and increasing understanding of the gating mechanism of the receptor.

heading: Targeted neurotechnology restores walking in humans with spinal cord injury
description: Spatially selective and temporally controlled stimulation of the spinal cord, together with rehabilitation, results in substantial restoration of locomotor function in humans with spinal cord injury.

heading: Cryo-EM reveals two distinct serotonin-bound conformations of full-length 5-HT3A receptor
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the serotonin-bound 5-HT3A serotonin receptor show the receptor populating two distinct states, characterized by twisting in the extracellular and transmembrane domains relative to the apo state, which creates pathways for ion permeation.

heading: The metabolite dimethylsulfoxonium propionate extends the marine organosulfur cycle
description: A structurally unusual zwitterionic metabolite, dimethylsulfoxonium propionate (DMSOP), is synthesized by several dimethylsulfoniopropionate-producing microalgae and marine bacteria and is readily metabolized into dimethylsulfoxide by marine bacteria, expanding our knowledge of the marine organosulfur cycle.

heading: Quantification of ocean heat uptake from changes in atmospheric O2 and CO2 composition
description: An independent estimate based on atmospheric O2 and CO2 measurements suggests that global oceans absorbed about 0.83 watts per square metre of heat over the past three decades—at the high end of previous estimates.

heading: DYNLL1 binds to MRE11 to limit DNA end resection in BRCA1-deficient cells
description: DYNLL1 antagonizes end resection of DNA double-strand breaks, thereby inhibiting homologous repair, and the loss of DYNLL1 correlates with poor progression-free survival of patients with BRCA1-mutant ovarian cancer.

heading: m6A facilitates hippocampus-dependent learning and memory through YTHDF1
description: Neuronal stimulation induces protein translation of m6A-methylated neuronal mRNAs facilitated by YTHDF1, and this process contributes to learning and memory.

heading: Shared and distinct transcriptomic cell types across neocortical areas
description: Single-cell transcriptomics of more than 20,000 cells from two functionally distinct areas of the mouse neocortex identifies 133 transcriptomic types, and provides a foundation for understanding the diversity of cortical cell types.

heading: Distinct descending motor cortex pathways and their roles in movement
description: Transcriptional profiling and axonal reconstructions identify two types of pyramidal tract neuron in the motor cortex: one type projects to thalamic regions and produces early and persistent preparatory activity, and the other type projects to motor centres in the medulla and produces motor commands.

heading: Distinct proteostasis circuits cooperate in nuclear and cytoplasmic protein quality control
authors: Rahul S. SamantChristine M. LivingstonJudith Frydman
description: Ubiquitin chains linked to cytoplasmic misfolded proteins are different from those linked to nuclear misfolded proteins, each requiring a distinct combination of molecular chaperones and ubiquitination circuitries.

heading: Emergence of multi-body interactions in a fermionic lattice clock
description: Clock spectroscopy of ultracold strontium atoms in a three-dimensional optical lattice is used to observe the onset of multi-body interactions that result from the underlying pairwise interactions between atoms.

heading: The merger that led to the formation of the Milky Way’s inner stellar halo and thick disk
authors: Amina HelmiCarine BabusiauxAnthony G. A. Brown
description: A galaxy slightly larger than the Small Magellanic Cloud merged with the Milky Way about 10 billion years ago,  thickening the ancient disk and forging the Galaxy’s inner halo.

heading: Vowel recognition with four coupled spin-torque nano-oscillators
description: A network of four spin-torque nano-oscillators can be trained in real time to recognize spoken vowels, in a simple and scalable approach that could be exploited for large-scale neural networks.

heading: Lineage tracking reveals dynamic relationships of T cells in colorectal cancer
description: An integrated RNA-sequencing approach demonstrates that CXCL13+ TH1-like cells are preferentially enriched in microsatellite-instable tumours from patients with colorectal cancer, and IGFLR1 is identified as a co-stimulatory molecule.

heading: Base-free nickel-catalysed decarbonylative Suzuki–Miyaura coupling of acid fluorides
authors: Christian A. MalapitJames R. BourMelanie S. Sanford
description: This nickel-catalysed Suzuki–Miyaura coupling of aryl boronic acids with in-situ-generated acid fluorides does not require an exogenous base and is applicable to a range of base-sensitive boronic acids and bioactive carboxylic acids.

heading: Credibility-enhancing displays promote the provision of non-normative public goods
authors: Gordon T. Kraft-ToddBryan BollingerDavid G. Rand
description: A field study and three experiments demonstrate that people who engage in rare (non-normative) prosocial behaviours will be more effective advocates for those behaviours than people who merely praise the virtues of these prosocial behaviours.

heading: Nuclear cGAS suppresses DNA repair and promotes tumorigenesis
description: DNA damage induces translocation of cyclic GMP–AMP synthase to the nucleus, where it suppresses homologous recombination by interfering with the formation of the PARP1–Timeless complex.

heading: CO2 storage and release in the deep Southern Ocean on millennial to centennial timescales
authors: J. W. B. RaeA. BurkeB. J. Taylor
description: Analysis of deep-sea coral boron isotope data, as a proxy for pH and thus CO2 chemistry, provides evidence of CO2 storage in the deep Southern Ocean during the last ice age, and its rapid release on millennial to centennial timescales during deglaciation.

heading: Remarkable muscles, remarkable locomotion in desert-dwelling wildebeest
authors: Nancy A. CurtinHattie L. A. Bartlam-BrooksAlan M. Wilson
description: Wildebeest, particularly during their long migrations under hot arid conditions, gain a considerable increase in range as a result of having highly efficient muscles.

heading: Mechanoresponsive stem cells acquire neural crest fate in jaw regeneration
authors: Ryan C. RansomAva C. CarterMichael T. Longaker
description: Reversion of adult skeletal stem cells to a developmental state underlies the growth of new bone during jaw regeneration, in a process that relies on mechanotransduction via the focal adhesion kinase protein.

heading: Rock fluidization during peak-ring formation of large impact structures
authors: Ulrich RillerMichael H. PoelchauTimothy J. Bralower
description: Catastrophic rock weakening upon impact of a meteorite, and hence flow, is shown to be followed by regained rock strength that enabled the formation of the peak ring during cratering.

heading: A gut microbial factor modulates locomotor behaviour in Drosophila
authors: Catherine E. SchretterJost VielmetterSarkis K. Mazmanian
description: Female Drosophila that lack a microbiota are hyperactive, and xylose isomerase from Lactobacillus brevis is sufficient to reverse this effect.

heading: In-plane anisotropic and ultra-low-loss polaritons in a natural van der Waals crystal
description: Observation of the anisotropic propagation of polaritons along the surface of layered, semiconducting α-MoO3 confirms the existence of this phenomenon in natural materials.

heading: Temporal development of the gut microbiome in early childhood from the TEDDY study
authors: Christopher J. StewartNadim J. AjamiJoseph F. Petrosino
description: Metagenomic sequencing analysis of stool samples from 903 children as part of the TEDDY study shows that breastfeeding was the most important factor associated with microbiome structure, and the cessation of breast milk resulted in faster maturation of the gut microbiome.

heading: The Moral Machine experiment
description: Responses from more than two million people to an internet-based survey of attitudes towards moral dilemmas that might be faced by autonomous vehicles shed light on similarities and variations in ethical preferences among different populations.

heading: Transcriptional regulation of nitrogen-associated metabolism and growth
description: The yeast one-hybrid network for nitrogen-associated metabolism in Arabidopsis reveals the transcription factors that regulate the architecture of root and shoot systems under conditions of changing nitrogen availability.

heading: Comprehensive measurement of pp-chain solar neutrinos
description: All components of the proton–proton nuclear fusion chain, in which hydrogen is converted into helium in the Sun, are described, with several implications for fundamental solar and particle physics.

heading: Palladium-mediated enzyme activation suggests multiphase initiation of glycogenesis
authors: Matthew K. BilyardHenry J. BaileyBenjamin G. Davis
description: The mechanism of glycogenesis, initiated by glycogenin, involves three distinct kinetic phases, with the final phase involving a refining process where only glucose is tolerated as a substrate.

heading: The human gut microbiome in early-onset type 1 diabetes from the TEDDY study
authors: Tommi VatanenEric A. FranzosaRamnik J. Xavier
description: An analysis of more than 10,000 metagenomes from the TEDDY study provides a detailed functional profile of the gut microbiome in relation to islet autoimmunity, and supports the protective effects of short-chain fatty acids in early-onset type 1 diabetes.

heading: Gene expression variability across cells and species shapes innate immunity
description: Comparison of transcriptomic data from immune-stimulated cells across different species sheds light on the architecture of the innate immune response.

heading: De novo NAD+ synthesis enhances mitochondrial function and improves health
description: Genetic or pharmacological inhibition of α-amino-β-carboxymuconate-ε-semialdehyde decarboxylase increases NAD+ and improves mitochondrial function in nematodes and mice, and may have therapeutic potential in kidney and liver disease.

heading: Gate-tunable room-temperature ferromagnetism in two-dimensional Fe3GeTe2
description: Monolayers of Fe3GeTe2 exhibit itinerant ferromagnetism with an out-of-plane magnetocrystalline anisotropy; ionic gating raises the ferromagnetic transition temperature of few-layer Fe3GeTe2 to room temperature.

heading: Catalytic enantioconvergent coupling of secondary and tertiary electrophiles with olefins
description: Nickel-catalysed coupling of racemic alkyl electrophiles and olefins in the presence of a hydrosilane is achieved with good enantioselectivity and yield under very mild reaction conditions.

heading: Space-borne Bose–Einstein condensation for precision interferometry
authors: Dennis BeckerMaike D. LachmannErnst M. Rasel
description: A Bose–Einstein condensate is created in space that has sufficient stability to enable its characteristic dynamics to be studied.

heading: Re-evaluating the p7 viroporin structure
authors: Benjamin P. OestringerJuan H. BolivarJason R. Schnell

heading: Reassessing evidence of life in 3,700-million-year-old rocks of Greenland
authors: Abigail C. AllwoodMinik T. RosingChristopher M. Heirwegh
description: In contrast to a previous study of 3,700-million-year-old rocks of the Isua supracrustal belt in Greenland, which presented fossil evidence of stromatolites (macroscopic remains of layered microbial communities), this study shows that these ‘stromatolites’ are features of deformation unconnected to the processes of organic life.

heading: Chen et al. reply
A separated vortex ring underlies the flight of the dandelion
description: The flight of dandelion seeds is enabled by an extraordinary vortex ring, which was revealed by the visualization of the flow around the seed.

heading: Glacial expansion of oxygen-depleted seawater in the eastern tropical Pacific
authors: Babette A. A. HoogakkerZunli LuEric Galbraith
description: A downward expansion of oxygen depletion in the eastern Pacific Ocean during the last ice age suggests an increase in the respired carbon reservoir, contributing to the lower levels of atmospheric carbon dioxide during this period.

heading: Elucidating the control and development of skin patterning in cuttlefish
description: Tracking analyses of tens of thousands of individual chromatophores in freely behaving cephalopods enable studies of behaviour and development at cellular resolution.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of the Ebola virus nucleoprotein–RNA complex at 3.6 Å resolution
description: Near-atomic resolution cryo-electron microscopy structures of the Zaire ebolavirus nucleoprotein indicate a complex transition from the RNA-free to RNA-bound forms of the protein, and reveal the mechanism of oligomer formation and helical assembly.

heading: A mesocortical dopamine circuit enables the cultural transmission of vocal behaviour
description: A dopaminergic mesocortical circuit in juvenile zebra finches detects the presence of an adult zebra finch tutor and helps to encode the performance of the tutor, facilitating the cultural transmission of vocal behaviour.

heading: Functional genomic landscape of acute myeloid leukaemia
authors: Jeffrey W. TynerCristina E. TognonBrian J. Druker
description: Analyses of samples from patients with acute myeloid leukaemia reveal that drug response is associated with mutational status and gene expression; the generated dataset provides a basis for future clinical and functional studies of this disease.

heading: Biodiversity increases and decreases ecosystem stability
description: Species richness was found to increase temporal stability but decrease resistance to warming in an experiment involving 690 micro-ecosystems consisting of 1 to 6 species of bacterivorous ciliates that were sampled over 40 days.

heading: A cortico-cerebellar loop for motor planning
description: The cerebellum is critical for the coding of future movement in the frontal cortex.

heading: LILRB4 signalling in leukaemia cells mediates T cell suppression and tumour infiltration
description: The receptor LILRB4 on monocytic leukaemia cells suppresses T cell activity and support the infiltration of tumour cells into tissues.

heading: A two per cent Hubble constant measurement from standard sirens within five years
description: Gravitational-wave observations of binary neutron-star mergers will enable precision measurements of the Hubble constant within five years.

heading: Ceramic–metal composites for heat exchangers in concentrated solar power plants
description: A robust ceramic/refractory metal (ZrC/W)-based composite for use in heat exchangers in concentrated solar power plants above 1,023 kelvin is described, having attractive high-temperature thermal, mechanical and chemical properties combined with cost-effective processing.

heading: Improved limit on the electric dipole moment of the electron
description: An experimental measurement of the electric dipole moment of the electron with sensitivity an order of magnitude better than previous studies increases the accessible mass range of fundamental particles by a factor of three.

heading: Genome organization and DNA accessibility control antigenic variation in trypanosomes
authors: Laura S. M. MüllerRaúl O. CosentinoT. Nicolai Siegel
description: Long-read sequencing allows the assembly of antigen-gene arrays in Trypanosoma brucei and, coupled with deletion experiments, demonstrates that histone variants act as a molecular link between genome architecture, chromatin conformation and antigen variation.

heading: A protein functionalization platform based on selective reactions at methionine residues
authors: Michael T. TaylorJennifer E. NelsonMatthew J. Gaunt
description: This methionine-selective functionalization strategy uses hypervalent iodine reagents to introduce new groups via the formation of a sulfonium intermediate, which can then undergo further visible-light-mediated reactions to form a diverse range of protein conjugates.

heading: Security and eavesdropping in terahertz wireless links
description: Contrary to current expectation, eavesdropping on terahertz wireless data links is shown to be easier than expected, by placing an object in the path of the signal that scatters part of it to a receiver located elsewhere.

heading: Transcription factor dimerization activates the p300 acetyltransferase
description: The activation of the histone acetyltransferase p300 depends on the activation and oligomerization status of transcription factor ligands.

heading: A metabolite-derived protein modification integrates glycolysis with KEAP1–NRF2 signalling
authors: Michael J. BollongGihoon LeeRaymond E. Moellering
description: Inhibition of the glycolytic enzyme PGK1 using a small molecular probe reveals a molecular link between glycolysis and the KEAP1–NRF2 signalling cascade.

heading: The dispersion–brightness relation for fast radio bursts from a wide-field survey
authors: R. M. ShannonJ.-P. MacquartC. J. Riseley
description: A large-scale survey of fast radio bursts—short pulses of radio waves that seem to come from cosmological distances—finds 20 such events, including both the nearest and the most energetic bursts observed so far.

heading: Trade-offs in using European forests to meet climate objectives
description: Simulations of commonly proposed forest-management portfolios for Europe show that no single portfolio would meet all the requirements of the Paris Agreement, and climate benefits from forest management would be modest and local.

heading: Pathogen elimination by probiotic Bacillus via signalling interference
description: Lipopeptides secreted by Bacillus bacteria block quorum sensing by Staphylococcus aureus and thereby inhibit the growth of this opportunistic pathogen in the gut, suggesting why people in rural Thailand who are colonized by Bacillus are not also colonized by S. aureus.

heading: Perovskite light-emitting diodes with external quantum efficiency exceeding 20 per cent
description: A strategy for managing the compositional distribution in metal halide perovskite light-emitting diodes enables them to surpass 20% external quantum efficiency—a step towards their practical application in lighting and displays.

heading: Options for keeping the food system within environmental limits
description: A global model finds that the environmental impacts of the food system could increase by 60–90% by 2050, and that dietary changes, improvements in technologies and management, and reductions in food loss and waste will all be needed to mitigate these impacts.

heading: Trans-differentiation of outer hair cells into inner hair cells in the absence of INSM1
description: Conditional deletion of Insm1 in mice demonstrates that INSM1 is the key switch that causes the maturation of outer hair cells in the cochlea, with its absence resulting in an increase in inner hair cells instead.

heading: Electronic noise due to temperature differences in atomic-scale junctions
description: A fundamental electronic noise—beyond electronic thermal noise and voltage-activated shot noise—that is generated by temperature differences across nanoscale conductors is demonstrated, with possible implications for thermometry and electronics.

heading: IRE1α–XBP1 controls T cell function in ovarian cancer by regulating mitochondrial activity
authors: Minkyung SongTito A. SandovalJuan R. Cubillos-Ruiz
description: In human and mouse models of ovarian cancer, endoplasmic reticulum stress and the activation of the IRE1α–XBP1 pathway decreases the metabolic fitness of T cells and limits their anti-tumour functions.

heading: Perovskite light-emitting diodes based on spontaneously formed submicrometre-scale structures
description: The formation of submicrometre-scale structure in perovskite light-emitting diodes can raise their external quantum efficiency beyond 20%, suggesting the possibility of both high efficiency and high brightness.

heading: Genome-wide association studies of brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank
authors: Lloyd T. ElliottKevin SharpStephen M. Smith
description: Genome-wide association studies of brain imaging data from 8,428 individuals in UK Biobank show that many of the 3,144 traits studied are heritable, and genes associated with individual phenotypes are identified.

heading: Cervical excitatory neurons sustain breathing after spinal cord injury
authors: Kajana SatkunendrarajahSpyridon K. KaradimasMichael G. Fehlings
description: A population of cervical interneurons is identified that can regulate diaphragm function by modulating phrenic motor neurons; targeting this small population of neurons may be a functional strategy to restore breathing after traumatic spinal cord injury.

heading: Neural blastocyst complementation enables mouse forebrain organogenesis
authors: Amelia N. ChangZhuoyi LiangFrederick W. Alt
description: Neural blastocyst complementation creates a vacant forebrain niche in host embryos that can be populated by donor embryonic stem cell-derived dorsal telencephalic progenitors, resulting in a mouse brain organogenesis model.

heading: Social regulation of a rudimentary organ generates complex worker-caste systems in ants
description: In the ant genus Pheidole the growth of rudimentary wing discs—which influence developmental allometry to produce castes with distinct morphologies—is socially regulated to determine the worker-to-soldier ratio in Pheidole colonies.

heading: The UK Biobank resource with deep phenotyping and genomic data
description: Deep phenotype and genome-wide genetic data from 500,000 individuals from the UK Biobank, describing population structure and relatedness in the cohort, and imputation to increase the number of testable variants to 96 million.

heading: Battery-operated integrated frequency comb generator
description: Integrating an optical Kerr frequency comb source with an electronically excited laser pump produces a battery-powered comb generator that does not require external lasers, moveable optics or laboratory set-ups.

heading: A cell identity switch allows residual BCC to survive Hedgehog pathway inhibition
authors: Brian BiehsGerrit J. P. DijkgraafFrederic J. de Sauvage
description: When basal cell carcinoma is treated with a Smoothened inhibitor, a subset of cancer cells evades treatment by switching identity, allowing residual tumours to regrow when treatment is discontinued.

heading: A slow-cycling LGR5 tumour population mediates basal cell carcinoma relapse after therapy
description: Treatment of basal cell carcinoma with Smoothened inhibitors leaves a small population of quiescent cells that can drive relapse but can be eliminated by additional treatment with a Wnt signalling inhibitor.

heading: Exciton-polariton topological insulator
description: A part-light, part-matter exciton-polariton topological insulator is created in an array of semiconductor microcavities.

heading: Asymmetric α-arylation of amino acids
authors: Daniel J. LeonardJohn W. WardJonathan Clayden
description: This approach introduces an aryl substituent to the α-carbon of amino acids without a transition-metal catalyst, and uses the inherent chirality of the amino acid itself as the source of asymmetry.

heading: Crystal structure of a membrane-bound O-acyltransferase
description: Crystal structures of DltB, a bacterial membrane-bound O-acyltransferase, are reported both alone and in complex with the d-alanyl donor protein DltC.

heading: Effects of climate warming on photosynthesis in boreal tree species depend on soil moisture
authors: Peter B. ReichKerrie M. SendallRebecca A. Montgomery
description: Low soil moisture may reduce, or even reverse, the potential benefits of climate warming on photosynthesis in mesic, seasonally cold environments, both during drought and in regularly occurring, modestly dry periods during the growing season.

heading: Ferroelectric polymers exhibiting behaviour reminiscent of a morphotropic phase boundary
description: An organic copolymer with compositionally tailored tacticity exhibits behaviour reminiscent of a morphotropic phase boundary, with an intramolecular order-to-disorder transition in the crystalline phase and a very large piezoelectric coefficient.

heading: Handover mechanism of the growing pilus by the bacterial outer-membrane usher FimD
description: The structure of a pilus assembly intermediate reveals the timing of subunit polymerization and how chaperone–subunit complexes are transferred from N-terminal to C-terminal domains of the usher in the formation of bacterial pili.

heading: Multi-axial self-organization properties of mouse embryonic stem cells into gastruloids
description: Cultures grown from small aggregates of mouse embryonic stem cells can be induced to organize spatial and temporal patterns of gene expression that parallel those of the early embryo, offering a potentially useful system for studying early development.

heading: Transcriptional recording by CRISPR spacer acquisition from RNA
authors: Florian SchmidtMariia Y. CherepkovaRandall J. Platt
description: An RNA-adapting CRISPR–Cas system is coupled with amplification and sequencing steps to record, retrieve and analyse changes in the transcriptome of a bacterial cell over time.

heading: Antibody and TLR7 agonist delay viral rebound in SHIV-infected monkeys
authors: Erica N. BorducchiJinyan LiuDan H. Barouch
description: In monkeys infected with an AIDS-like virus, a combination of a broadly neutralizing antibody and an immune stimulator during antiretroviral therapy suppressed viral rebound after antiretroviral drug discontinuation.

heading: Single-cell transcriptomics of 20 mouse organs creates a Tabula Muris
description: A ‘mouse atlas’, comprising single-cell transcriptomic data from more than 100,000 cells from 20 organs and tissues, has been created as a resource for cell biology.

heading: Genomes of Asgard archaea encode profilins that regulate actin
description: Asgard archaea encode functional profilins that can interact with mammalian actin, which suggests that—similar to eukaryotic cells—they possess a regulated actin cytoskeleton.

heading: Widespread seasonal compensation effects of spring warming on northern plant productivity
description: Widespread but contrasting delayed responses of ecosystem productivity to spring warmth across northern ecosystems is inferred from satellite data, with higher areal fractions of adverse effects than beneficial effects.

heading: Solution-processable 2D semiconductors for high-performance large-area electronics
description: By intercalating large ammonium molecules to exfoliate MoS2 with preservation of the 2H-phase, highly uniform solutionprocessable 2D semiconductor nanosheets are obtained for the scalable fabrication of large-area thin-film electronics.

heading: OTX2 restricts entry to the mouse germline
description: The transcription factor OTX2 ensures that germline induction is initially kept in check and only proceeds after OTX2 downregulation.

heading: Very-high-energy particle acceleration powered by the jets of the microquasar SS 433
description: Observations of teraelectronvolt γ-rays accelerated by the jets of the miniature quasar SS 433 are reported.

heading: Nearly all the sky is covered by Lyman-α emission around high-redshift galaxies
description: Lyman-α emission from atomic hydrogen shows the location of warm gas and is ubiquitous around galaxies between redshifts of 3 and 6, thereby covering nearly all the sky.

heading: Multicomponent synthesis of tertiary alkylamines by photocatalytic olefin-hydroaminoalkylation
description: Complex tertiary alkylamines are prepared in one step from readily available amines, carbonyls and alkenes, via the visible-light-mediated reduction of in-situ-generated iminium ions to form alkyl-substituted α-amino radicals.

heading: Chang et al. reply
authors: Andy J. ChangNoah S. KimMark A. Krasnow

heading: Outbursts of luminous blue variable stars from variations in the helium opacity
description: Three-dimensional simulations of the convective envelopes of massive stars suggest that it is the helium opacity that controls outbursts in luminous blue variable stars.

heading: The role of Olfr78 in the breathing circuit of mice
An evolving jet from a strongly magnetized accreting X-ray pulsar
authors: J. van den EijndenN. DegenaarJ. V. Hernández Santisteban
description: Observations of a jet from a strongly magnetized neutron star reveal that strong magnetic fields do not prevent jet formation and suggest that stellar properties influence jet power.

heading: Erythro-myeloid progenitors contribute endothelial cells to blood vessels
description: New blood vessel endothelial cells arise from differentiation of erythro-myeloid progenitor cells to complement the proliferation of pre-existing endothelial cells.

heading: Combination therapy with anti-HIV-1 antibodies maintains viral suppression
description: Combination therapy with the anti-HIV-1 monoclonal antibodies 3BNC117 and 10-1074 maintains long-term suppression in the absence of antiretroviral therapy in individuals with antibody-sensitive viral reservoirs.

heading: Self-powered ultra-flexible electronics via nano-grating-patterned organic photovoltaics
description: Detection of biometric signals by self-powered electronic devices that are highly flexible and can be applied to skin.

heading: Plant functional trait change across a warming tundra biome
authors: Anne D. BjorkmanIsla H. Myers-SmithEvan Weiher
description: Analyses of the relationships between temperature, moisture and seven key plant functional traits across the tundra and over time show that community height increased with warming across all sites, whereas other traits lagged behind predicted rates of change.

heading: Mechanosensing by β1 integrin induces angiocrine signals for liver growth and survival
description: In mouse and human liver models, blood vessel perfusion and mechanical stretching release angiocrine signals from endothelial cells that lead to hepatocyte survival and liver growth.

heading: Multi-step self-guided pathways for shape-changing metamaterials
description: A scheme for implementing multi-step topological reorganization of a mechanical metamaterial is demonstrated, which proceeds autonomously, without the need for external control.

heading: Common genetic variants contribute to risk of rare severe neurodevelopmental disorders
authors: Mari E. K. NiemiHilary C. MartinJeffrey C. Barrett
description: A genome-wide association study of approximately 7,000 patients with neurodevelopmental disorders demonstrates that overall risk and clinical presentation in putative monogenic disorders is also influenced by common genetic variants present in the general population.

heading: Subcycle observation of lightwave-driven Dirac currents in a topological surface band
description: Time- and angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy reveals how Dirac fermions in the band structure of the topological surface state of Bi2Te3 are accelerated by the carrier wave of a terahertz-frequency light pulse.

heading: Principles of nucleosome organization revealed by single-cell micrococcal nuclease sequencing
description: Single-cell micrococcal nuclease sequencing simultaneously measures chromatin accessibility and genome-wide nucleosome positioning in single cells to reveal principles of nucleosome organization.

heading: A natural variant and engineered mutation in a GPCR promote DEET resistance in C. elegans
authors: Emily J. DennisMay DobosiewiczLeslie B. Vosshall
description: DEET interferes selectively with chemotaxis of Caenorhabditis elegans nematodes, and mutations in the str-217 gene or silencing of the pair of chemosensory neurons that express it makes worms DEET-resistant.

heading: The interaction landscape between transcription factors and the nucleosome
description: A method for systematically exploring interactions between the nucleosome and transcription factors identifies five major interaction patterns.

heading: Discovery of a periosteal stem cell mediating intramembranous bone formation
authors: Shawon DebnathAlisha R. YallowitzMatthew B. Greenblatt
description: A periosteal stem cell specialized in intramembranous bone formation has been identified and was found to be essential for normal bone development and fracture healing.

heading: Integrated lithium niobate electro-optic modulators operating at CMOS-compatible voltages
description: Chip-scale lithium niobate electro-optic modulators that rapidly convert electrical to optical signals and use CMOS-compatible voltages could prove useful in optical communication networks, microwave photonic systems and photonic computation.

heading: Architecture of the TRPM2 channel and its activation mechanism by ADP-ribose and calcium
description: Structures of the transient receptor potential melastatin 2 channel in the apo resting (closed) state and in the ADP-ribose/Ca2+-bound active (open) state are determined by cryo-electron microscopy.

heading: Evidence that CD32a does not mark the HIV-1 latent reservoir
authors: Christa E. OsunaSo-Yon LimJames B. Whitney

heading: Device-independent quantum random-number generation
description: Genuine, unpredictable quantum random-number generation that is provably secure against quantum and classical adversaries is demonstrated, certified by the loophole-free violation of a Bell inequality.

heading: Conflicting evidence for HIV enrichment in CD32+ CD4 T cells
Descours et al. reply
The role of CD32 during HIV-1 infection
authors: Lynn N. BertagnolliJennifer A. WhiteJanet D. Siliciano

heading: Superstructures generated from truncated tetrahedral quantum dots
description: Truncated tetrahedral nanocrystals can self-assemble into one-, two- and three-dimensional superstructures.

heading: Tc toxin activation requires unfolding and refolding of a β-propeller
description: A high-resolution cryo-electron microscopy structure of a complete Tc holotoxin complex reveals the precise mechanism of Tc toxin assembly, gate opening and release of the cytotoxic enzyme into the translocation channel.

heading: Clearance of senescent glial cells prevents tau-dependent pathology and cognitive decline
authors: Tyler J. BussianAsef AzizDarren J. Baker
description: In a mouse model of tau-dependent neurodegenerative disease, the clearance of senescent glial cells prevents the degeneration of cortical and hippocampal neurons and preserves cognitive function.

heading: Absolute timing of the photoelectric effect
description: The absolute timing of the photoelectric effect has proved difficult to measure, but the delay between photon arrival at a tungsten surface and ejection of photoelectrons has now been determined.

heading: A dynamically young and perturbed Milky Way disk
description: An analysis of the motions of six million stars in the Milky Way disk reveals substructures such as snail shells and ridges, indicating that our Galaxy has been recently perturbed.

heading: Nuclear envelope assembly defects link mitotic errors to chromothripsis
description: The mitotic spindle prevents normal nuclear envelope assembly on missegregated chromosomes, leading to spontaneous envelope disruption of micronuclei and subsequent genome instability.

heading: Transience of the North American High Plains landscape and its impact on surface water
authors: Sean D. WillettScott W. McCoyHelen W. Beeson
description: The High Plains region of North America is in a transient state, with a younger, efficient network of river channels progressively cannibalizing an older, less efficient region, aiding water retention for wetlands and groundwater recharge.

heading: Ice loss from the East Antarctic Ice Sheet during late Pleistocene interglacials
authors: David J. WilsonRachel A. BertramCarlota Escutia
description: Studies of an Antarctic marine sediment core suggest that the East Antarctic Ice Sheet retreated in the vicinity of the Wilkes Subglacial Basin during extended warm periods of the late Pleistocene, when temperatures were similar to those predicted to occur within this century.

heading: mRNA circularization by METTL3–eIF3h enhances translation and promotes oncogenesis
description: METTL3, the enzyme responsible for m6A modification, influences translation by interacting with eIF3h to mediate looping between the regions near the stop codon and 5′ cap of mRNA.

heading: Ring nucleases deactivate type III CRISPR ribonucleases by degrading cyclic oligoadenylate
authors: Januka S. AthukoralageChristophe RouillonMalcolm F. White
description: In the CRISPR type III system, ‘ring’ nucleases possess a metal-independent mechanism that cleaves cyclic oligoadenylate ring molecules to switch off the antiviral state in cells.

heading: Glider soaring via reinforcement learning in the field
description: A reinforcement learning approach allows a suitably equipped glider to navigate thermal plumes autonomously in an open field.

heading: Hydraulic diversity of forests regulates ecosystem resilience during drought
authors: William R. L. AndereggAlexandra G. KoningsNicole Zenes
description: The diversity in the hydraulic traits of trees mediates ecosystem resilience to drought and will probably have an important role in future ecosystem–atmosphere feedback effects.

heading: T cells in patients with narcolepsy target self-antigens of hypocretin neurons
description: The detection of hypocretin-specific autoreactive CD4+ and CD8+ T cells in patients with narcolepsy reveals the autoimmune aetiology of this disorder.

heading: Sensation, movement and learning in the absence of barrel cortex
authors: Y. Kate HongClay O. LacefieldRandy M. Bruno
description: Mice can learn to detect objects with their whiskers and respond appropriately even in the absence of their primary somatosensory cortex.

heading: Time-asymmetric loop around an exceptional point over the full optical communications band
description: Time-asymmetric light transmission over the entire optical communications band is achieved using a silicon photonic structure with photonic modes that dynamically encircle an exceptional point in the optical domain.

heading: The role of miniaturization in the evolution of the mammalian jaw and middle ear
authors: Stephan LautenschlagerPamela G. GillEmily J. Rayfield
description: Biomechanical analyses of mammaliaform and cynodont fossils demonstrate that miniaturization drove the evolutionary transformation of the mammalian jaw, which preceded the optimization of bite force-to-joint load in the mandible

heading: Structure of the membrane-assembled retromer coat determined by cryo-electron tomography
description: The retromer complex (the vacuolar protein sorting heterotrimer Vps26–Vps29–Vps35) has been resolved in association with membranes and the sorting nexin protein Vps5 using cryo-electron tomography.

heading: Does the galaxy NGC1052–DF2 falsify Milgromian dynamics?
In vivo CRISPR editing with no detectable genome-wide off-target mutations
authors: Pinar AkcakayaMaggie L. BobbinJ. Keith Joung
description: A strategy developed to define off-target effects of gene-editing nucleases in whole organisms is validated and leveraged to show that CRISPR–Cas9 nucleases can be used effectively in vivo without inducing detectable off-target mutations.

heading: Future response of global coastal wetlands to sea-level rise
description: A global modelling approach shows that in response to rises in global sea level, gains of up to 60% in coastal wetland areas are possible, if appropriate coastal management solutions are developed to help support wetland resilience.

heading: Touch and tactile neuropathic pain sensitivity are set by corticospinal projections
description: Somatosensory corticospinal neurons facilitate touch sensitivity and touch-evoked neuropathic pain in mice.

heading: Optimized arylomycins are a new class of Gram-negative antibiotics
authors: Peter A. SmithMichael F. T. KoehlerChristopher E. Heise
description: Chemical optimization of arylomycins results in an inhibitor of bacterial type I signal peptidase that shows activity both against multidrug-resistant clinical isolates of Gram-negative bacteria in vitro and in several in vivo infection models.

heading: Tunable long-distance spin transport in a crystalline antiferromagnetic iron oxide
description: Tunable spin transport over long distances is demonstrated through the antiferromagnetic insulator haematite, paving the way to the development of spin-logic devices based on antiferromagnetic insulators.

heading: Three-dimensional printing of hierarchical liquid-crystal-polymer structures
description: 3D printing of liquid-crystal polymers can create lightweight hierarchical structures with very high stiffness and toughness.

heading: Accurate classification of BRCA1 variants with saturation genome editing
authors: Gregory M. FindlayRiza M. DazaJay Shendure
description: Germline BRCA1 loss-of-function variants are associated with predisposition to early-onset breast and ovarian cancer; here the authors use CRISPR/Cas9 genome editing to functionally assess thousands of BRCA1 variants in order to facilitate the clinical interpretation of these variants.

heading: A flavin-based extracellular electron transfer mechanism in diverse Gram-positive bacteria
authors: Samuel H. LightLin SuDaniel A. Portnoy
description: The Gram-positive Listeria monocytogenes pathogen possesses a distinctive extracellular electron transfer mechanism, which is probably present in numerous ecologically diverse species of the Firmcutes phylum.

heading: De novo design of a fluorescence-activating β-barrel
description: The elucidation of general principles for designing β-barrels enables the de novo creation of fluorescent proteins.

heading: A cortical filter that learns to suppress the acoustic consequences of movement
description: Training of mice to associate a particular sound frequency with locomotion results in selective suppression of cortical responses to that frequency during movement, consistent with a motor-dependent form of auditory cortical plasticity.

heading: The genetic basis and cell of origin of mixed phenotype acute leukaemia
authors: Thomas B. AlexanderZhaohui GuCharles G. Mullighan
description: A large-scale genomics study shows that the cell of origin and founding mutations determine disease subtype and lead to the expression of multiple haematopoietic lineage-defining antigens in mixed phenotype acute leukaemia.

heading: Autogenous and efficient acceleration of energetic ions upstream of Earth’s bow shock
authors: D. L. TurnerL. B. Wilson IIIJ. L. Burch
description: Observations of a hot flow anomaly accelerating solar-wind ions suggest a mechanism for such acceleration—a Fermi acceleration trap caused by Earth’s bow shock interacting with the solar wind.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of the active, Gs-protein complexed, human CGRP receptor
description: The structure of a complex containing calcitonin gene-related peptide, the human calcitonin gene-related peptide receptor and the Gs heterotrimer, determined using Volta phase-plate cryo-electron microscopy, provides structural insight into the regulation of G-protein-coupled receptors by receptor activity modifying protein 1.

heading: GAPDH inhibits intracellular pathways during starvation for cellular energy homeostasis
description: During starvation, glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH) targets GTPase-activating proteins to inhibit multiple intracellular transport pathways, thereby promoting energy homeostasis.

heading: An abstract drawing from the 73,000-year-old levels at Blombos Cave, South Africa
description: A silcrete flake with a 73,000-year-old cross-hatched ochre drawing, from Blombos Cave, South Africa, demonstrates that early Homo sapiens used a range of media and techniques to produce graphic representations.

heading: Necroptosis microenvironment directs lineage commitment in liver cancer
description: The tumour microenvironment determines which type of liver cancer develops, with transformed hepatocytes giving rise to intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma or hepatocellular carcinoma depending or whether they are surrounded by cells undergoing necroptosis or apoptosis.

heading: Giant and anisotropic many-body spin–orbit tunability in a strongly correlated kagome magnet
authors: Jia-Xin YinSongtian S. ZhangM. Zahid Hasan
description: The topological magnet Fe3Sn2 exhibits a giant nematic energy shift of a many-body electronic state, demonstrating anisotropic spin–orbit tunability.

heading: Sensing with tools extends somatosensory processing beyond the body
description: Tools are embodied by the human somatosensory system, serving as sensory extensions of the human body.

heading: Extremely efficient terahertz high-harmonic generation in graphene by hot Dirac fermions
description: Efficient terahertz harmonic generation—challenging but important for ultrahigh-speed optoelectronic technologies—is demonstrated in graphene through a nonlinear process that could potentially be generalized to other materials.

heading: Experimental and computational framework for a dynamic protein atlas of human cell division
description: Quantitative live-cell imaging provides a dynamic protein atlas of mitosis.

heading: Coherent encoding of subjective spatial position in visual cortex and hippocampus
authors: Aman B. SaleemE. Mika DiamantiMatteo Carandini
description: When running through a virtual reality corridor, a mouse’s position is represented in both the hippocampus (as expected) and the primary visual cortex, for places that are visually identical.

heading: A topological source of quantum light
description: Topologically protected edge states realized in a square array of ring resonators are used to demonstrate a robust source of heralded single photons produced by spontaneous four-wave mixing.

heading: Tracing HIV-1 strains that imprint broadly neutralizing antibody responses
description: Similarity of antibody responses in HIV-1 transmission pairs reveals a significant impact of the virus genome on imprinting antibody responses.

heading: Climate-induced changes in continental-scale soil macroporosity may intensify water cycle
authors: Daniel R. HirmasDaniel GiménezCassandra J. Wilson
description: Soil macroporosity responds rapidly to climate variations and may induce wide-ranging changes in soil hydraulic conductivity by the end of the century.

heading: A complex dynamo inferred from the hemispheric dichotomy of Jupiter’s magnetic field
authors: Kimberly M. MooreRakesh K. YadavSteven M. Levin
description: Maps of Jupiter’s internal magnetic field at a range of depths reveal an unusual morphology, suggesting that Jupiter’s dynamo, unlike Earth’s, does not operate in a thick, homogeneous shell.

heading: Synthetic three-dimensional atomic structures assembled atom by atom
description: Arbitrarily shaped, defect-free three-dimensional synthetic structures with up to 72 individually controlled atoms are assembled using holographic methods and moving tweezers.

heading: Extensive sex differences at the initiation of genetic recombination
description: Differential DNA methylation and the long-range effects of chromatin organization lead to pronounced differences in recombination landscape between males and females.

heading: A fluid-to-solid jamming transition underlies vertebrate body axis elongation
description: Cell collectives in embryonic tissues undergo a fluid-to-solid jamming transition, similar to those that occur in soft materials such as foams, emulsions and colloidal suspensions, to physically sculpt the vertebrate body axis.

heading: Deterministic teleportation of a quantum gate between two logical qubits
authors: Kevin S. ChouJacob Z. BlumoffR. J. Schoelkopf
description: A teleported controlled-NOT gate is realized experimentally between two logical qubits implemented as superconducting cavity quantum memories, thus demonstrating an important tool for universal computation in a quantum modular architecture.

heading: Superluminal motion of a relativistic jet in the neutron-star merger GW170817
authors: K. P. MooleyA. T. DellerK. Hotokezaka
description: Emission from the radio counterpart of the gravitation-wave event GW170817 was powered by a wide-angle outflow at early times, but probably dominated by a narrowly collimated jet at later times.

heading: Sorting ultracold atoms in a three-dimensional optical lattice in a realization of Maxwell’s demon
description: An experiment inspired by Maxwell’s ‘demon’ thought experiment uses a series of reversible operations to fully fill a three-dimensional optical lattice with ultracold atoms and realize a low-entropy state.

heading: In vivo reprogramming of wound-resident cells generates skin epithelial tissue
authors: Masakazu KuritaToshikazu AraokaJuan Carlos Izpisua Belmonte
description: Four transcription factors that specify keratinocyte cell fate, facilitate in vivo reprogramming of wound-resident mesenchymal cells, epithealization and regeneration of skin epithelial tissues in mice.

heading: A homing system targets therapeutic T cells to brain cancer
description: Therapeutic T cells bearing ligands engineered to optimize adhesion and transmigration through the blood–brain barrier can be targeted to brain tumours.

heading: Coupling of bone resorption and formation by RANKL reverse signalling
description: Osteoclasts secrete small extracellular vesicles that stimulate osteoblasts, promoting bone formation via receptor activator of nuclear factor-kappa B ligand (RANKL), thereby linking bone formation and resorption.

heading: Population dynamics of normal human blood inferred from somatic mutations
authors: Henry Lee-SixNina Friesgaard ØbroPeter J. Campbell
description: Analysis of blood from a healthy human show that haematopoietic stem cells increase rapidly in numbers through early life, reaching a stable plateau in adulthood, and contribute to myeloid and B lymphocyte populations throughout life.

heading: Hundred-fold enhancement in far-field radiative heat transfer over the blackbody limit
description: Rates of radiative heat transfer between sub-wavelength planar membranes are experimentally and theoretically shown to exceed the blackbody limit in the far field by more than two orders of magnitude.

heading: Precancerous neoplastic cells can move through the pancreatic ductal system
authors: Alvin P. Makohon-MooreKaren MatsukumaChristine A. Iacobuzio-Donahue
description: Comparison of multiple lesions from individual pancreases sheds light on how ancestral clones can spread through the ductal system and give rise to precursor lesions, with acquisition of further mutations leading to pancreatic cancer.

heading: An orthogonal proteomic survey uncovers novel Zika virus host factors
description: Integrative analyses identify host proteins that are modulated by Zika virus at multiple levels and provide a comprehensive framework for the understanding of Zika virus-induced changes to cellular pathways.

heading: Phosphocode-dependent functional dichotomy of a common co-receptor in plant signalling
description: The plant receptor kinase co-receptor BAK1 contains phosphosites that are required for immune function but not for brassinosteroid-regulated growth in Arabidopsis thaliana; an additional tyrosine phosphosite may be required for the function of many Arabidopsis receptor kinases.

heading: Ancient herders enriched and restructured African grasslands
authors: Fiona MarshallRachel E. B. ReidStanley H. Ambrose
description: Isotopic and sedimentary analyses of soils at Pastoral Neolithic archaeological sites in Kenya demonstrate the long-term influence of nutrient enrichment on savannah environments that has accompanied pastoralist settlement over the past three millennia.

heading: Acceleration of electrons in the plasma wakefield of a proton bunch
description: Electron acceleration to very high energies is achieved in a single step by injecting electrons into a ‘wake’ of charge created in a 10-metre-long plasma by speeding long proton bunches.

heading: A Brownian quasi-crystal of pre-assembled colloidal Penrose tiles
description: A lithographic patterning and release method is used to create a dense, fluctuating, Brownian system of mobile colloidal kite- and dart-shaped Penrose tiles over large areas that retains quasi-crystalline order.

heading: Required growth facilitators propel axon regeneration across complete spinal cord injury
authors: Mark A. AndersonTimothy M. O’SheaMichael V. Sofroniew
description: Stimulating the intrinsic growth capacity of neurons and providing growth-supportive substrate and chemoattraction can allow axon regrowth across anatomically complete spinal cord injuries in adult rodents.

heading: Structures of filaments from Pick’s disease reveal a novel tau protein fold
description: The structures of tau filaments from patients with the neurodegenerative disorder Pick’s disease show that the filament fold is different from that of the tau filaments found in Alzheimer’s disease.

heading: Deep learning of aftershock patterns following large earthquakes
authors: Phoebe M. R. DeVriesFernanda ViégasBrendan J. Meade
description: Neural networks trained on data from about 130,000 aftershocks from around 100 large earthquakes improve predictions of the spatial distribution of aftershocks and suggest physical quantities that may control earthquake triggering.

heading: Structural mechanisms of selectivity and gating in anion channelrhodopsins
authors: Hideaki E. KatoYoon Seok KimKarl Deisseroth
description: Crystal structures and molecular simulations of the designed anion-conducting channelrhodopsin iC++ provide molecular insights that enable structure-based design of channelrhodopsins with desirable properties for use as optogenetic tools.

heading: Sensitivity of atmospheric CO2 growth rate to observed changes in terrestrial water storage
description: The growth rate of global atmospheric CO2 concentration is faster in drier years, independently of temperature; this relationship is underestimated in current carbon cycle models.

heading: The gravitationally unstable gas disk of a starburst galaxy 12 billion years ago
description: The molecular gas in the inner kiloparsec of a submillimetre-bright galaxy is clumpy and gravitationally unstable, collapsing to form stars at a rate that will deplete the gas in about 100 million years.

heading: Crystal structure of the natural anion-conducting channelrhodopsin GtACR1
authors: Yoon Seok KimHideaki E. KatoKarl Deisseroth
description: The crystal structure of anion channelrhodopsin-1 (ACR1) from the algae Guillardia theta provides insights into the basis of anion conductance.

heading: Measurements of the gravitational constant using two independent methods
description: The Newtonian gravitational constant is measured with two independent methods, yielding results with relative standard uncertainties of 11.6 parts per million—the lowest uncertainty reported until now.

heading: Cotranslational assembly of protein complexes in eukaryotes revealed by ribosome profiling
description: Cotranslational assembly is a prevalent mechanism for the formation of oligomeric complexes in Saccharomyces cerevisiae, with one subunit serving as scaffold for the translation of partner subunits.

heading: Integrating time from experience in the lateral entorhinal cortex
description: Temporal information that is useful for episodic memory is encoded across a wide range of timescales in the lateral entorhinal cortex, arising inherently from its representation of ongoing experience.

heading: Jurassic stem-mammal perinates and the origin of mammalian reproduction and growth
description: A well-preserved clutch of Kayentatherium wellesi perinates sheds light on the timing of the evolution of mammalian traits, including reduced clutch sizes and the allometric lengthening of the face during ontogeny.

heading: Role of glutamine synthetase in angiogenesis beyond glutamine synthesis
description: The enzyme glutamine synthetase is active in endothelial cell migration during angiogenesis, through autopalmitoylation and the regulation of RHOJ signalling.

heading: The NORAD lncRNA assembles a topoisomerase complex critical for genome stability
authors: Mathias MunschauerCelina T. NguyenEric S. Lander
description: The long non-coding RNA NORAD interacts with proteins involved in DNA replication and repair, and controls the ability of RBMX to form a ribonucleoprotein complex that helps to maintain genomic stability.

heading: Malaria parasite translocon structure and mechanism of effector export
authors: Chi-Min HoJosh R. BeckZ. Hong Zhou
description: Cryo-electron microscopy analysis of the purified Plasmodium translocon of exported proteins (PTEX) reveals two distinct resolved states, suggesting a mechanism by which Plasmodium falciparum exports malarial effector proteins into erythrocytes.

heading: All-inorganic perovskite nanocrystal scintillators
description: All-inorganic perovskite nanocrystals containing caesium and lead provide low-cost, flexible and solution-processable scintillators that are highly sensitive to X-ray irradiation and emit radioluminescence that is colour-tunable across the visible spectrum.

heading: Past experience shapes sexually dimorphic neuronal wiring through monoaminergic signalling
description: In Caenorhabditis elegans, starvation early in life suppresses later sex-specific pruning of synapses through lasting changes in monoaminergic signalling.

heading: Widespread intronic polyadenylation inactivates tumour suppressor genes in leukaemia
description: The inactivation of tumour suppressor genes at the level of mRNA occurs by the generation of truncated proteins in leukaemia.

heading: A Triassic stem turtle with an edentulous beak
description: A Triassic stem turtle from China has a mixture of derived characters and plesiomorphic features, including an edentulous beak and a rigid puboischiadic plate.

heading: Stepwise and independent origins of roots among land plants
description: Meristems of the rooting axes of Asteroxylon mackiei preserved in 407-million-year-old Rhynie chert lack root caps, which demonstrates that the evolution of the root systems of modern vascular plants occurred in a stepwise fashion.

heading: The genome of the offspring of a Neanderthal mother and a Denisovan father
description: Genomic evidence of the offspring of a Neanderthal mother and a Denisovan father suggests that mixing among different hominin groups may have more been frequent than previously appreciated.

heading: RAP2 mediates mechanoresponses of the Hippo pathway
description: The Ras-related GTPase RAP2 is a key intracellular signal transducer by which extracellular matrix rigidity controls mechanosensitive cellular activities through YAP and TAZ.

heading: Magnetoelectric inversion of domain patterns
description: The magnetization or polarization of domain states in multiferroics can be reversed while retaining the overall domain pattern, owing to the inherent versatility in coupling the large number of multiferroic order parameters.

heading: SIRT6 deficiency results in developmental retardation in cynomolgus monkeys
description: A cynomolgus monkey model deficient in SIRT6 protein exhibits severe retardation in prenatal development, in which neuronal differentiation is delayed by activation of the H19 long non-coding RNA.

heading: Observation of the 1S–2P Lyman-α transition in antihydrogen
authors: M. AhmadiB. X. R. AlvesJ. S. Wurtele
description: The observation of the 1S–2P Lyman-α transition in the antihydrogen atom, the antimatter counterpart of hydrogen, is reported.

heading: Structure of paused transcription complex Pol II–DSIF–NELF
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of a paused transcription elongation complex of RNA polymerase II bound to DRB sensitivity-inducing factor and negative elongation factor is reported at 3.2 Å resolution.

heading: Parkin and PINK1 mitigate STING-induced inflammation
authors: Danielle A. SliterJennifer MartinezRichard J. Youle
description: Acute and chronic mitochondrial stress in mice require PINK1 and parkin to restrain STING-mediated innate immunity.

heading: Observation of topological phenomena in a programmable lattice of 1,800 qubits
authors: Andrew D. KingJuan CarrasquillaMohammad H. Amin
description: A large-scale programmable quantum simulation is described, using a D-Wave quantum processor to simulate a two-dimensional magnetic lattice in the vicinity of a topological phase transition.

heading: Crystal structure of the Frizzled 4 receptor in a ligand-free state
description: The crystal structure of the Frizzled 4 receptor transmembrane domain is reported to a resolution of 2.4 Å in a ligand-free state.

heading: Structure of activated transcription complex Pol II–DSIF–PAF–SPT6
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of an activated transcription elongation complex of RNA polymerase II bound to DRB sensitivity-inducing factor and the elongation factors PAF1 complex and SPT6 is reported at 3.1 Å resolution.

heading: Allergic inflammatory memory in human respiratory epithelial progenitor cells
authors: Jose Ordovas-MontanesDaniel F. DwyerAlex K. Shalek
description: Single-cell RNA sequencing is used to characterize cell types in nasal tissues from human patients with chronic rhinosinusitis, revealing a role for tissue stem cells in allergic inflammatory memory.

heading: A multi-cohort study of the immune factors associated with M. tuberculosis infection outcomes
description: Integrated analyses of multiple cohorts are used to obtain a better understanding of the immune state of latent infection with Mycobacterium tuberculosis, and factors that mediate and/or predict transitions from latent infection to active disease.

heading: Fitness benefits and emergent division of labour at the onset of group living
authors: Y. UlrichJ. SaragostiD. J. C. Kronauer
description: Experimental data from, and mathematical modelling of, colonies of the clonal raider ant Ooceraea biroi demonstrate that increases in group size generate division of labour among similar individuals, increased homeostasis and higher colony fitness.

heading: Photonic topological Anderson insulators
description: A counter-intuitive state—known as a topological Anderson insulator—in which strong disorder leads to the formation of topologically protected rather than trivial states is realized in a photonic system.

heading: Resonant domain-wall-enhanced tunable microwave ferroelectrics
description: The domain-wall structure and dynamics are found to enhance, rather than inhibit, the high-frequency performance of an intrinsically tunable material, obtaining ultralow loss and exceptional frequency selectivity.

heading: Cooperative asymmetric reactions combining photocatalysis and enzymatic catalysis
authors: Zachary C. LitmanYajie WangJohn F. Hartwig
description: A cooperative chemoenzymatic reaction combines photocatalytic alkene isomerization with enzymatic reduction to generate enantioenriched products in a stereoconvergent manner.

heading: Atomic iron and titanium in the atmosphere of the exoplanet KELT-9b
authors: H. Jens HoeijmakersDavid EhrenreichLuca Di Fabrizio
description: Cross-correlation analysis of high-resolution spectra obtained as the exoplanet KELT-9b transited its host star reveals neutral and singly ionized atomic iron and singly ionized atomic titanium in the exoplanet’s atmosphere.

heading: Restoration of vision after de novo genesis of rod photoreceptors in mammalian retinas
description: Müller glia in mature mouse retina can be stimulated to produce rod cells; this treatment restores visual responses in a model of congenital blindness.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of the insect olfactory receptor Orco
authors: Joel A. ButterwickJosefina del MármolVanessa Ruta
description: A cryo-electron microscopy structure of the insect Orco subunit, which forms ion channels with diverse olfactory receptors, reveals a tetrameric cation channel and sheds light on insect olfaction.

heading: Autism-like phenotype and risk gene mRNA deadenylation by CPEB4 mis-splicing
description: CPEB4 binds the mRNA of genes known to be associated with autism and shows an isoform imbalance in individuals with autism, and an equivalent imbalance in mice induces an autism-like phenotype.

heading: Sulfoxaflor exposure reduces bumblebee reproductive success
authors: Harry SiviterMark J. F. BrownEllouise Leadbeater
description: Chronic exposure to sulfoxaflor (a sulfoximine-based insecticide) has severe sub-lethal effects on bumblebee (Bombus terrestris) colonies; exposed colonies produced fewer workers and fewer reproductive offspring than unexposed control colonies.

heading: Alpha-kinase 1 is a cytosolic innate immune receptor for bacterial ADP-heptose
description: The bacterial metabolite ADP-heptose activates NF-κB in host cells via alpha-kinase 1 and the TIFA–TRAF signalling pathway.

heading: Cryo-STEM mapping of solid–liquid interfaces and dendrites in lithium-metal batteries
authors: Michael J. ZachmanZhengyuan TuLena F. Kourkoutis
description: Direct observation of the anode–electrolyte interface in a lithium-metal battery, without removing the liquid electrolyte, reveals two types of dendrites, one of which may contribute disproportionately to capacity fade.

heading: Modulating plant growth–metabolism coordination for sustainable agriculture
description: The balance of DELLA and GRF4 proteins in plants ensures the co-regulation of growth with metabolism and tipping this balance towards GRF4 leads to higher efficiency of nitrogen use.

heading: Marine heatwaves under global warming
authors: Thomas L. FrölicherErich M. FischerNicolas Gruber
description: Satellite observations and Earth system model simulations reveal that marine heatwaves have increased in recent decades and will increase further in terms of frequency, intensity, duration and spatial extent.

heading: Probing high-momentum protons and neutrons in neutron-rich nuclei
description: Electron-scattering experiments reveal that the fraction of high-momentum protons in medium-to-heavy nuclei increases considerably with neutron excess, whereas that of high-momentum neutrons decreases slightly, in contrast to shell-model predictions.

heading: Large deletions induced by Cas9 cleavage
Inter-homologue repair in fertilized human eggs?
Unique features of mammalian mitochondrial translation initiation revealed by cryo-EM
description: A cryo-electron microscopy structure of the mammalian mitochondrial translation initiation complex reveals unique features that are necessary to initiate mitochondrial translation and highlights a possible membrane-targeting peptide.

heading: Genetic and transcriptional evolution alters cancer cell line drug response
description: The extent, origins and consequences of genetic variation within human cell lines are studied, providing a framework for researchers to measure such variation in efforts to support maximally reproducible cancer research.

heading: 5-HT release in nucleus accumbens rescues social deficits in mouse autism model
authors: Jessica J. WalshDaniel J. ChristoffelRobert C. Malenka
description: Stimulating the release of serotonin (5-HT) in the nucleus accumbens in wild-type mice promotes sociability, and rescues deficits in social behaviours in a mouse model of autism.

heading: Ecosystem warming extends vegetation activity but heightens vulnerability to cold temperatures
authors: Andrew D. RichardsonKoen HufkensPaul J. Hanson
description: Experimental whole-ecosystem warming treatments of a Picea–Sphagnum peat bog reveal the likely phenological consequences of future temperature increases that exceed those of historical climate regimes.

heading: Diode fibres for fabric-based optical communications
description: A scalable thermal drawing process is used to integrate light-emitting and photodetecting diodes into textile-ready polymer fibres, which can be woven into fabrics with possible optical communication and health monitoring applications.

heading: Global land change from 1982 to 2016
authors: Xiao-Peng SongMatthew C. HansenJohn R. Townshend
description: Satellite data for the period 1982–2016 reveal changes in land use and land cover at global and regional scales that reflect patterns of land change indicative of a human-dominated Earth system.

heading: Gamete fusion triggers bipartite transcription factor assembly to block re-fertilization
description: During sexual reproduction in Schizosaccharomyces pombe, the rapid reconstitution of a bipartite Mi–Pi transcription complex after fusion blocks re-fertilization and induces meiosis, which ensures that the genome is maintained.

heading: Engineering of robust topological quantum phases in graphene nanoribbons
description: Graphene nanoribbons are used to design robust nanomaterials with controlled periodic coupling of topological boundary states to create quasi-one-dimensional trivial and non-trivial electronic quantum phases.

heading: RNA velocity of single cells
authors: Gioele La MannoRuslan SoldatovPeter V. Kharchenko
description: RNA velocity, estimated in single cells by comparison of spliced and unspliced mRNA, is a good indicator of transcriptome dynamics and will provide a useful tool for analysis of developmental lineage.

heading: Ma et al. reply
Estimating global agricultural effects of geoengineering using volcanic eruptions
description: Analysis of the El Chichón and Mount Pinatubo volcanic eruptions suggests that solar radiation management strategies using stratospheric sulfate aerosols would do little to counterbalance the effects of climate change on global crop yields.

heading: Exosomal PD-L1 contributes to immunosuppression and is associated with anti-PD-1 response
description: Melanoma cells release programmed death-ligand 1 (PD-L1) on the surface of circulating exosomes, suggesting a mechanism by which tumours could evade the immunesystem, and the potential application of exosomal PD-L1 to monitor patient responses to checkpoint therapies.

heading: Xenon isotopic constraints on the history of volatile recycling into the mantle
description: Mantle xenon isotope systematics reveals that no substantial recycling of atmospheric xenon into the deep Earth occurred before 2.5 billion years ago, indicating that downwellings were drier in the Archaean era than today.

heading: Reverse weathering as a long-term stabilizer of marine pH and planetary climate
description: Elevated rates of reverse weathering within silica-rich oceans led to enhanced carbon retention within the ocean–atmosphere system, promoting a stable, equable ice-free climate throughout Earth’s early to middle ages.

heading: Topological band engineering of graphene nanoribbons
authors: Daniel J. RizzoGregory VeberFelix R. Fischer
description: A topologically engineered graphene nanoribbon superlattice is presented that hosts a one-dimensional array of half-filled, in-gap localized electronic states, enabling band engineering.

heading: Neonatal selection by Toll-like receptor 5 influences long-term gut microbiota composition
description: Age-dependent epithelial expression of the innate immune receptor TLR5 in the gut of newborn mice selects against the presence of flagellated bacteria and influences microbiota composition throughout life.

heading: Topological negative refraction of surface acoustic waves in a Weyl phononic crystal
description: Sound waves in a specially designed crystal undergo ‘topologically protected’ negative refraction, whereby no reflection is allowed, at certain facets of the crystal and positive refraction at others.

heading: Direct arylation of strong aliphatic C–H bonds
authors: Ian B. PerryThomas F. BrewerDavid W. C. MacMillan
description: Direct coupling of aliphatic C–H nucleophiles to aryl electrophiles is described, through the combination of light-driven polyoxometalate hydrogen atom transfer and nickel catalysis.

heading: Structure and function of the global topsoil microbiome
description: Metagenomic, chemical and biomass analyses of topsoil samples from around the world reveal spatial and environmental trends in microbial community composition and genetic diversity.

heading: A revised airway epithelial hierarchy includes CFTR-expressing ionocytes
authors: Daniel T. MontoroAdam L. HaberJayaraj Rajagopal
description: Single-cell RNA sequencing analysis identifies cell types and lineages in airway epithelium, including the pulmonary ionocyte, a new cell type predominantly expressing the cystic fibrosis gene CFTR.

heading: Human glioblastoma arises from subventricular zone cells with low-level driver mutations
authors: Joo Ho LeeJeong Eun LeeJeong Ho Lee
description: Human neural stem cells from the subventricular zone are identified as the cells of origin that contain the driver mutations for glioblastomas.

heading: Extensive loss of past permafrost carbon but a net accumulation into present-day soils
description: Comparing the northern permafrost region of the Last Glacial Maximum with the same area today shows that the soil carbon stock has now increased, suggesting that permafrost carbon made no net contribution to preindustrial atmospheric carbon.

heading: Categorical perception of colour signals in a songbird
authors: Eleanor M. CavesPatrick A. GreenStephen Nowicki
description: Female zebra finches exhibited categorical perception of colour signals, as they categorized colour stimuli that varied along a continuous scale and showed increased discrimination between colours from opposite sides of the category boundary compared to equally different colours from within a category.

heading: Inositol phosphates are assembly co-factors for HIV-1
authors: Robert A. DickKaneil K. ZadroznyVolker M. Vogt
description: Inositol hexakisphosphate, which is found in all mammalian cells, binds to two separate sites to promote the assembly and maturation of HIV-1 virus particles.

heading: CRISPR-guided DNA polymerases enable diversification of all nucleotides in a tunable window
authors: Shakked O. HalperinConnor J. TouJohn E. Dueber
description: A system that targets DNA polymerase activity with CRISPR-guided nickases to provide genetic diversification at user-defined loci enables forward genetic approaches.

heading: Inhibitors of histone acetyltransferases KAT6A/B induce senescence and arrest tumour growth
authors: Jonathan B. BaellDavid J. LeaverTim Thomas
description: Selective inhibitors of KAT6A and KAT6B inhibit MYST-catalysed histone acetylation, induce cell cycle exit and cellular senescence without causing DNA damage, and arrest lymphoma progression in mouse models.

heading: Karyotype engineering by chromosome fusion leads to reproductive isolation in yeast
