description: Yeast chromosomes have been fused to produce viable strains with only two chromosomes that are reproductively isolated from the sixteen-chromosome wild type, but otherwise show high fitness in mitosis and meiosis.

heading: A single-cell atlas of the airway epithelium reveals the CFTR-rich pulmonary ionocyte
authors: Lindsey W. PlasschaertRapolas ŽilionisAron B. Jaffe
description: Single-cell RNA sequencing analysis is used to identify cell types in the tracheal epithelium, including previously unidentified ionocytes, which express high levels of the cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator, CFTR.

heading: Blue boron-bearing diamonds from Earth’s lower mantle
authors: Evan M. SmithSteven B. ShireyWuyi Wang
description: Mineral inclusions in blue boron-bearing diamonds reveal that such diamonds are among the deepest diamonds ever found and indicate a viable pathway for the deep-mantle recycling of crustal elements.

heading: Globally rising soil heterotrophic respiration over recent decades
description: Global soil respiration is rising, probably in response to environmental changes, suggesting that climate-driven losses of soil carbon are occurring worldwide.

heading: Cryo-EM of the dynamin polymer assembled on lipid membrane
authors: Leopold KongKem A. SochackiJenny E. Hinshaw
description: A cryo-electron microscopy structure of human dynamin-1 demonstrates conformational changes and sheds light on the fission of membranes during endocytosis.

heading: Shared evolutionary origin of vertebrate neural crest and cranial placodes
description: Similarities between the patterning of the lateral plate in Ciona and of the neural plate ectoderm in vertebrates indicate that compartmentalization of the lateral plate ectoderm preceded the advent of vertebrates.

heading: Creating a functional single-chromosome yeast
description: Successive fusion of yeast chromosomes is used to produce a single-chromosome strain that is viable, albeit with slightly reduced fitness.

heading: Building C(sp3)-rich complexity by combining cycloaddition and C–C cross-coupling reactions
authors: Tie–Gen ChenLisa M. BartonPhil S. Baran
description: Combining cycloaddition and carbon–carbon cross-coupling offers a way of simplifying the enantioselective preparation of chemical building blocks, natural products and medicines such as the antipsychotic asenapine.

heading: Hurricane-induced selection on the morphology of an island lizard
authors: Colin M. DonihueAnthony HerrelJonathan B. Losos
description: Two populations of Anolis lizards that survived Hurricanes Irma and Maria had larger toepads, longer forelimbs and shorter hindlimbs relative to the pre-hurricane populations, which suggests hurricane-induced natural selection.

heading: The formation of solar-neighbourhood stars in two generations separated by 5 billion years
description: The two episodes of star formation predicted by the ‘cold flow’ theory of galactic gas accretion also explain the observed bimodality in the chemical-abundance distribution of solar-neighbourhood stars.

heading: Room-temperature electrical control of exciton flux in a van der Waals heterostructure
description: Heterobilayer excitonic devices consisting of two different van der Waals materials, in which excitons are shared between the layers, exhibit electrically controlled switching actions at room temperature.

heading: 53BP1 cooperation with the REV7–shieldin complex underpins DNA structure-specific NHEJ
description: The specificity of 53BP1 and its co-factors for particular DNA substrates during non-homologous end joining (NHEJ) derives from REV7–shieldin, a four-subunit DNA-binding complex that is required for REV7-dependent NHEJ but not for REV7-dependent DNA interstrand cross-link repair.

heading: Spontaneous emission of matter waves from a tunable open quantum system
description: An open quantum system containing ultracold rubidium atoms trapped in an optical lattice undergoes spontaneous emission of matter waves into free space.

heading: Functional aspects of meningeal lymphatics in ageing and Alzheimer’s disease
description: Meningeal lymphatic dysfunction promotes amyloid-β deposition in the meninges and worsens brain amyloid-β pathology, acting as an aggravating factor in Alzheimer’s disease and in age-associated cognitive decline; improving meningeal lymphatic function could help to prevent or delay age-associated neurological diseases.

heading: Ecosystem restructuring along the Great Barrier Reef following mass coral bleaching
authors: Rick D. Stuart-SmithChristopher J. BrownGraham J. Edgar
description: Fish and invertebrate communities transformed across the span of the Great Barrier Reef following the 2016 bleaching event due to a decline in coral-feeding fishes resulting from coral loss, and because of different regional responses of key trophic groups to the direct effect of temperature.

heading: Accumulation of 8,9-unsaturated sterols drives oligodendrocyte formation and remyelination
description: Many small molecules that stimulate oligodendrocyte formation act not through their canonical pathways but by inhibiting enzymes within the cholesterol biosynthesis pathway and thereby inducing the accumulation of 8,9-unsaturated sterols.

heading: Coherent spin–photon coupling using a resonant exchange qubit
authors: A. J. LandigJ. V. KoskiT. Ihn
description: Coherent coupling between a three-electron spin qubit and single photons in a microwave resonator is demonstrated, which, unlike previous demonstrations, does not require ferromagnetic components near the qubit.

heading: New mitochondrial DNA synthesis enables NLRP3 inflammasome activation
description: New mitochondrial DNA synthesis links the priming and activation of the NLRP3 inflammasome.

heading: Mitochondrial double-stranded RNA triggers antiviral signalling in humans
description: Mitochondrial double-stranded RNA can induce an interferon response if released into the cytoplasm, but self-recognition is prevented by SUV3 helicase and PNPase exoribonuclease.

heading: Cyclin-dependent kinase 12 is a drug target for visceral leishmaniasis
description: A series of compounds are discovered for the treatment of visceral leishmaniasis, and cdc2-related kinase 12 (CRK12) is identified as the probable primary drug target.

heading: Niobium tungsten oxides for high-rate lithium-ion energy storage
authors: Kent J. GriffithKamila M. WiaderekClare P. Grey
description: Micrometre-sized particles of two niobium tungsten oxides have high volumetric capacities and rate performances, enabled by very high lithium-ion diffusion coefficients.

heading: Rapid glaciation and a two-step sea level plunge into the Last Glacial Maximum
description: Details of the drops in sea level associated with glaciation during the Last Glacial Maximum are revealed using a coral proxy from the Great Barrier Reef.

heading: Differential tuning of excitation and inhibition shapes direction selectivity in ferret visual cortex
description: Inhibition to the null direction of motion has a critical role in the direction selectivity of neurons in ferret primary visual cortex.

heading: Ferroelectric switching of a two-dimensional metal
description: Two- and three-layer WTe2 exhibits spontaneous out-of-plane electric polarization that can be switched electrically at room temperature and is sufficiently robust for use in applications with other two-dimensional materials.

heading: Automethylation-induced conformational switch in Clr4 (Suv39h) maintains epigenetic stability
description: An autoinhibitory conformation of the histone H3K9 methyltransferase Clr4 of Schizosaccharomyces pombe helps to prevent aberrant heterochromatin formation and maintains epigenetic stability.

heading: Controlling an organic synthesis robot with machine learning to search for new reactivity
description: A robot instructed by a machine learning algorithm and coupled with real-time spectroscopic systems provides fast and accurate reaction outcome predictions and reactivity assessments, leading to the discovery of new reactions.

heading: Thymic tuft cells promote an IL-4-enriched medulla and shape thymocyte development
authors: Corey N. MillerIrina ProektMark S. Anderson
description: A comprehensive analysis of the thymic medulla identifies a tuft-cell-like thymic epithelial cell population that is necessary for shaping thymic function.

heading: Global surface warming enhanced by weak Atlantic overturning circulation
description: In preindustrial times, a weak Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation led to cooling in the Northern Hemisphere, but now it is predicted to cause accelerated global surface warming.

heading: The shieldin complex mediates 53BP1-dependent DNA repair
description: The 53BP1 effector complex shieldin is involved in non-homologous end-joining and immunoglobulin class switching, and acts to protect DNA ends to facilitate the repair of DNA by 53BP1.

heading: 53BP1–RIF1–shieldin counteracts DSB resection through CST- and Polα-dependent fill-in
description: 53BP1 and shieldin recruit the CTC1–STN1–TEN1 complex and polymerase-α to sites of DNA damage to help control the repair of double-strand breaks.

heading: Photoswitching topology in polymer networks with metal–organic cages as crosslinks
authors: Yuwei GuEric A. AltJeremiah A. Johnson
description: Using topology-switching metal–ligand cages to crosslink polymer networks produces gels whose chemical and mechanical properties can be radically and reversibly switched on irradiation.

heading: Glucose-regulated phosphorylation of TET2 by AMPK reveals a pathway linking diabetes to cancer
description: Modulation of DNA 5-hydroxymethylcytosine by glucose reveals an AMPK–TET2–5hmC axis that links diabetes to cancer.

heading: Single-cell mapping of the thymic stroma identifies IL-25-producing tuft epithelial cells
description: A comprehensive characterization of the thymic stroma identifies a tuft-cell-like thymic epithelial cell population that is critical for shaping the immune niche in the thymus.

heading: Accumulation of succinate controls activation of adipose tissue thermogenesis
authors: Evanna L. MillsKerry A. PierceEdward T. Chouchani
description: A comparative metabolomics approach is used to identify succinate as a key activator of thermogenesis in brown adipose tissue.

heading: Pancreatic islets communicate with lymphoid tissues via exocytosis of insulin peptides
authors: Xiaoxiao WanBernd H. ZinselmeyerEmil R. Unanue
description: A sensitive T cell tracking assay reveals immunogenic activity of specific catabolized peptide fragments of insulin and their effects on T cell activity in lymph nodes, highlighting communication between pancreatic islets and lymphoid tissue.

heading: Electron ptychography of 2D materials to deep sub-ångström resolution
description: Combining an electron microscope pixel-array detector that collects the entire distribution of scattered electrons with full-field ptychography greatly improves image resolution and contrast compared to traditional techniques, even at low beam energies.

heading: The outer membrane is an essential load-bearing element in Gram-negative bacteria
authors: Enrique R. RojasGabriel BillingsKerwyn Casey Huang
description: The outer membrane of Gram-negative bacteria is shown to be at least as stiff as the cell wall, and this property enables it to protect cells from mechanical pertubations.

heading: Triple oxygen isotope evidence for limited mid-Proterozoic primary productivity
authors: Peter W. CrockfordJustin A. HaylesBoswell A. Wing
description: Triple oxygen isotope measurements of 1.4-billion-year-old sedimentary sulfates reveal a unique mid-Proterozoic atmosphere and demonstrate that gross primary productivity in the mid-Proterozoic was between 6% and 41% of pre-anthropogenic levels.

heading: Leukaemia hijacks a neural mechanism to invade the central nervous system
authors: Hisayuki YaoTrevor T. PriceDorothy A. Sipkins
description: Expression of α6 integrin enables acute lymphoblastic leukaemia cells to use neural migratory pathways to invade the central nervous system and metastasize to the brain.

heading: Complex silica composite nanomaterials templated with DNA origami
description: DNA origami is used as a template to produce complex geometric shapes of nanoscale silica hybrid materials.

heading: Genome-centric view of carbon processing in thawing permafrost
authors: Ben J. WoodcroftCaitlin M. SingletonGene W. Tyson
description: Analysis of more than 1,500 microbial genomes sheds light on the processing of carbon released as permafrost thaws.

heading: X-ray and cryo-EM structures of the mitochondrial calcium uniporter
description: X-ray and cryo-electron microscopy structures of fungal mitochondrial calcium uniporter proteins reveal a tetrameric architecture and shed light on the function of the channel.

heading: Seabirds enhance coral reef productivity and functioning in the absence of invasive rats
authors: Nicholas A. J. GrahamShaun K. WilsonM. Aaron MacNeil
description: Productivity of coral reefs is enhanced near islands with no invasive rats, as populations of seabirds, which transfer nitrogen from deeper areas of ocean to the nearshore waters via their guano, are much larger than on rat-infested islands.

heading: Reprogramming human T cell function and specificity with non-viral genome targeting
description: A non-viral strategy to introduce large DNA sequences into T cells enables the correction of a pathogenic mutation that causes autoimmunity, and the replacement of an endogenous T-cell receptor with an engineered receptor that can recognize cancer antigens.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of a fungal mitochondrial calcium uniporter
description: A cryo-electron microscopy structure of fungal mitochondrial calcium uniporter shows that the channel is tetrameric and sheds light on channel assembly and function.

heading: Cryo-EM structures of fungal and metazoan mitochondrial calcium uniporters
description: Structures of the mitochondrial calcium uniporter from fungal and metazoan organisms reveal a tetrameric architecture and shed light on the function of the channel.

heading: Structures of human Patched and its complex with native palmitoylated sonic hedgehog
description: High-resolution structures of the human plasma membrane protein patched 1 alone and in complex with the native form of the ligand sonic hedgehog are determined.

heading: Metallic nanoparticle contacts for high-yield, ambient-stable molecular-monolayer devices
description: A top-contacting method for the fabrication of molecular devices uses metallic nanoparticles to electrically contact self-assembled monolayers, enabling the preparation of thousands of identical, ambient-stable metal–molecule–metal devices.

heading: Hot streaks in artistic, cultural, and scientific careers
description: The career trajectories of around 30,000 artists, film directors and scientists show that individuals in each domain have ‘hot streaks’ during which their works have increased impact, despite showing no increase in productivity.

heading: Evolution of a central neural circuit underlies Drosophila mate preferences
description: A female Drosophila melanogaster pheromone is recognized by males from both the same and a closely related species through conserved peripheral sensory neurons; the signal is then differentially propagated to promote conspecific and suppress interspecies courtship.

heading: Insights into clonal haematopoiesis from 8,342 mosaic chromosomal alterations
description: Analysis of genotyping data for more than 150,000 individuals from the UK Biobank using long-range phase information sheds light on mechanisms of clonal haematopoiesis.

heading: PtdIns(4,5)P2 stabilizes active states of GPCRs and enhances selectivity of G-protein coupling
authors: Hsin-Yung YenKin Kuan HoiCarol V. Robinson
description: Mass spectrometry-based assays are used to reveal specificity and structural determinants of lipid binding to class A G-protein-coupled receptors, and the effects of specific lipids on receptor coupling to G proteins.

heading: Electrically controlled water permeation through graphene oxide membranes
authors: K.-G. ZhouK. S. VasuR. R. Nair
description: The rapid water transport through graphene oxide membranes can be switched off by introducing localized electric fields within the membranes that ionize surrounding water molecules and thus block transport.

heading: Atmosphere–soil carbon transfer as a function of soil depth
description: This study of whole-soil carbon dynamics finds that, of the atmospheric carbon that is incorporated into the topmost metre of soil over 50 years, just 19 per cent reaches the subsoil, in a manner that depends on land use and aridity.

heading: North Pacific freshwater events linked to changes in glacial ocean circulation
description: Sediment-core and modelling analyses suggest that, during distinct cold periods known as Heinrich Stadials, changes in ocean circulation in the North Atlantic triggered discharge of freshwater from the Cordilleran Ice Sheet into the North Pacific.

heading: Histidine catabolism is a major determinant of methotrexate sensitivity
authors: Naama KanarekHeather R. KeysDavid M. Sabatini
description: Histidine metabolism influences the sensitivity of cancer cells to methotrexate, with mice bearing leukaemia xenografts showing increased response to the drug upon histidine supplementation.

heading: Majorana quantization and half-integer thermal quantum Hall effect in a Kitaev spin liquid
description: Half-integer quantization of the thermal Hall effect in a Kitaev spin liquid reveals chiral currents of charge-neutral Majorana fermions around the edges of the sample, produced by strong electronic correlations.

heading: Prespliceosome structure provides insights into spliceosome assembly and regulation
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of the Saccharomyces cerevisiae prespliceosome provides insights into splice-site selection and early spliceosome assembly events.

heading: Hominin occupation of the Chinese Loess Plateau since about 2.1 million years ago
description: An Early Pleistocene artefact assemblage from the Chinese Loess Plateau indicates that hominins had left Africa by at least 2.1 million years ago, and occupied the Loess Plateau repeatedly for a long time.

heading: Resistance-gene-directed discovery of a natural-product herbicide with a new mode of action
description: Fungal genome mining targeted to self-resistance genes close to biosynthetic gene clusters identifies a pathway that produces aspterric acid, which proves to be a potent inhibitor of plant growth.

heading: Prediction of acute myeloid leukaemia risk in healthy individuals
description: Individuals who are at high risk of developing acute myeloid leukaemia can be identified years before diagnosis using genetic information from blood samples.

heading: A two-million-year-long hydroclimatic context for hominin evolution in southeastern Africa
description: A multiple-proxy reconstruction for the catchment of the Limpopo River and of sea surface temperatures in the Indian Ocean provides evidence for hydroclimatic changes that may have been important in hominin evolution.

heading: Targeting STING with covalent small-molecule inhibitors
authors: Simone M. HaagMuhammet F. GulenAndrea Ablasser
description: The discovery and characterization of small-molecule antagonists that inhibit the stimulator of interferon genes (STING) protein may help to develop therapies for the treatment of autoinflammatory disease.

heading: Universality of free fall from the orbital motion of a pulsar in a stellar triple system
authors: Anne M. ArchibaldNina V. GusinskaiaIngrid H. Stairs
description: The accelerations of a pulsar and a white dwarf in a three-star system differ by at most a few parts per million, providing a much improved constraint on the universality of free fall.

heading: Structure of the origin recognition complex bound to DNA replication origin
description: The cryo-EM structure of the yeast origin recognition complex (ORC) bound to a 72-base-pair origin DNA sequence provides insights into the basis of the origin selection mechanism.

heading: Species-specific activity of antibacterial drug combinations
description: Screening pairwise combinations of antibiotics and other drugs against three bacterial pathogens reveals that antagonistic and synergistic drug–drug interactions are specific to microbial species and strains.

heading: Evolution of cooperation in stochastic games
description: Cooperation is more likely to evolve in a public-goods-distribution game when payoffs can change between rounds so that the stakes increase when players cooperate and decrease when players defect.

heading: Spatial correlation bias in late-Cenozoic erosion histories derived from thermochronology
authors: Taylor F. SchildgenPieter A. van der BeekRasmus C. Thiede
description: Reported acceleration of erosion in mountainous landscapes during the late Cenozoic is the result of combining thermochronology data with disparate exhumation histories, thereby converting spatial variations in erosion rates into temporal increases.

heading: Suppression of insulin feedback enhances the efficacy of PI3K inhibitors
authors: Benjamin D. HopkinsChantal PauliLewis C. Cantley
description: Glucose–insulin feedback can reactivate PI3K in tumours treated with PI3K inhibitors, reducing therapeutic efficacy, but this effect can be reduced by using drugs or diet to suppress the insulin response.

heading: CRISPR screens identify genomic ribonucleotides as a source of PARP-trapping lesions
description: Mutations in all three genes encoding ribonuclease H2 sensitize cells to poly(ADP–ribose) polymerase inhibitors by compromising ribonucleotide excision repair.

heading: The purinergic receptor P2RX7 directs metabolic fitness of long-lived memory CD8+ T cells
authors: Henrique Borges da SilvaLalit K. BeuraStephen C. Jameson
description: Activation of P2RX7 receptors by extracellular ATP is required for the generation, maintenance and function of central and tissue-resident CD8+ memory T cells.

heading: Single-cell analysis of early progenitor cells that build coronary arteries
description: During development, new arteries can arise from pre-existing veins; the cell fate switch involved occurs gradually and before the onset of blood flow in mouse embryo hearts.

heading: An inverse latitudinal gradient in speciation rate for marine fishes
authors: Daniel L. RaboskyJonathan ChangMichael E. Alfaro
description: Contrary to previous hypotheses, high-latitude fish lineages form new species at much faster rates than their tropical counterparts especially in geographical regions that are characterized by low surface temperatures and high endemism.

heading: Kinase-controlled phase transition of membraneless organelles in mitosis
description: The dual-specificity kinase DYRK3 acts as a central ‘dissolvase’, mediating the phase transitions of several types of membraneless organelles during mitosis.

heading: Scaling up molecular pattern recognition with DNA-based winner-take-all neural networks
description: DNA-strand-displacement reactions are used to implement a neural network that can distinguish complex and noisy molecular patterns from a set of nine possibilities—an improvement on previous demonstrations that distinguished only four simple patterns.

heading: Mechanism for remodelling of the cell cycle checkpoint protein MAD2 by the ATPase TRIP13
description: Structural analysis demonstrates how TRIP13 and p31comet disassemble the mitotic checkpoint complex.

heading: Synchronous tropical and polar temperature evolution in the Eocene
description: A 26-million-year record of equatorial sea surface temperatures reveals synchronous changes of tropical and polar temperatures during the Eocene epoch forced by variations in concentrations of atmospheric carbon dioxide, with a constant degree of polar amplification.

heading: Flying couplers above spinning resonators generate irreversible refraction
description: One-way propagation of light through a standard telecommunications fibre is demonstrated by coupling the fibre to a rapidly rotating silica-glass sphere.

heading: The helicase Ded1p controls use of near-cognate translation initiation codons in 5′ UTRs
description: The helicase Ded1p associates with the pre-initiation complex and influences translation from near-cognate initiation codons by controlling the levels of mRNA secondary structure in 5′ untranslated regions.

heading: Macromolecular organic compounds from the depths of Enceladus
description: The detection of complex organic molecules with masses higher than 200 atomic mass units in ice grains emitted from Enceladus indicates the presence of a thin organic-rich layer on top of the moon’s subsurface ocean.

heading: Induction of innate immune memory via microRNA targeting of chromatin remodelling factors
authors: John J. SeeleyRebecca G. BakerSankar Ghosh
description: The microRNAs miR-221 and miR-222 regulate the reprogramming of macrophages during the development of lipopolysaccharide tolerance, and increased expression of these microRNAs is associated with immunosuppression and poor prognosis in patients with sepsis.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of an essential Plasmodium vivax invasion complex
description: Structural studies show that conserved residues in Plasmodium vivax reticulocyte-binding protein 2b determine interactions with transferrin receptor 1 that are essential for host invasion, suggesting avenues for designing vaccines that work across P. vivax strains.

heading: OTULIN limits cell death and inflammation by deubiquitinating LUBAC
authors: Klaus HegerKatherine E. WickliffeVishva M. Dixit
description: OTULIN, which removes ubiquitin chains deposited by LUBAC, promotes LUBAC activity by preventing its auto-ubiquitination, thereby supporting normal mouse embryo development and preventing pro-inflammatory cell death in adult mice.

heading: Robust relationship between air quality and infant mortality in Africa
description: A 10 μg m−3 increase in the concentration of ambient respirable particulate matter is associated with a 9% rise in infant mortality in Africa and this increase is not affected by household wealth.

heading: Acquired resistance to IDH inhibition through trans or cis dimer-interface mutations
authors: Andrew M. IntlekoferAlan H. ShihEytan M. Stein
description: A new mechanism of acquired clinical resistance in two patients with acute myeloid leukaemia driven by mutant IDH2 is described, in which a second-site mutation on the wild-type allele induces therapeutic resistance to IDH2 inhibitors.

heading: IL-23 secreted by myeloid cells drives castration-resistant prostate cancer
description: IL-23 produced by myeloid-derived suppressor cells regulates castration resistance in prostate cancer by sustaining androgen receptor signalling.

heading: Non-gravitational acceleration in the trajectory of 1I/2017 U1 (‘Oumuamua)
description: ‘Oumuamua—the first known interstellar object to have entered the Solar System—is probably a comet, albeit with unusual dust and chemical properties owing to its origin in a distant solar system.

heading: Evidence for extremely rapid magma ocean crystallization and crust formation on Mars
authors: Laura C. BouvierMaria M. CostaMartin Bizzarro
description: Isotopic compositions of ancient zircons from the NWA 7034 Martian meteorite suggest that Mars must have formed its primordial crust extremely swiftly, less than 20 million years after the formation of the Solar System.

heading: High speed of fork progression induces DNA replication stress and genomic instability
description: Inhibition of PARP is shown to accelerate the speed of replication fork elongation, which prevents fork stalling and induces DNA damage, with implications for genomic instability and cancer treatment.

heading: Parasitic helminths induce fetal-like reversion in the intestinal stem cell niche
authors: Ysbrand M. NusseAdam K. SavageOphir D. Klein
description: Larvae of the parasitic helminth Heligmosomoides polygyrus induce granuloma formation and a fetal-like developmental program in granuloma-associated crypts of infected adult mice.

heading: Low-temperature crystallization of granites and the implications for crustal magmatism
authors: Michael R. AckersonB. O. MysenE. B. Watson
description: Thermobarometry and diffusion modelling in quartz crystals show that some granites may crystallize at much lower temperatures than we had thought, possibly explaining observations of cold magma storage.

heading: Structure of a human synaptic GABAA receptor
authors: Shaotong ZhuColleen M. NovielloRyan E. Hibbs
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of the type A GABA receptor bound to GABA and the benzodiazepine site antagonist flumazenil reveals structural mechanisms that underlie intersubunit interactions and ligand selectivity of the receptor.

heading: A standing molecule as a single-electron field emitter
description: Precision control over matter at the atomic scale enables a planar dye molecule to be lifted up and placed on its edge—a configuration that is surprisingly stable.

heading: Hippocampal neurogenesis confers stress resilience by inhibiting the ventral dentate gyrus
description: Adult neurogenesis in the hippocampus confers resilience to chronic stress in mice by inhibiting the activity of mature granule cells in the ventral dentate gyrus.

heading: Multifunctional ferrofluid-infused surfaces with reconfigurable multiscale topography
authors: Wendong WangJaakko V. I. TimonenJoanna Aizenberg
description: By infusing a ferrofluid into a microstructured matrix and applying a magnetic field, dynamic, multiscale topographical reconfigurations emerge, enabling functions such as colloidal self-assembly, switchable adhesion and friction, and biofilm removal.

heading: Decarboxylative sp3 C–N coupling via dual copper and photoredox catalysis
authors: Yufan LiangXiaheng ZhangDavid W. C. MacMillan
description: The synergistic combination of copper catalysis and photoredox catalysis forms sp3 C–N bonds in a rapid, room-temperature coupling protocol with high efficiencies and regioselectivities and a broad substrate scope.

heading: Epigenetic inheritance mediated by coupling of RNAi and histone H3K9 methylation
description: In Schizosaccharomyces pombe, histone H3K9 methylation acts synergistically with short interfering RNA to perpetuate gene silencing during multiple mitotic and meiotic cell divisions.

heading: Self-assembly of highly symmetrical, ultrasmall inorganic cages directed by surfactant micelles
description: Machine-learning algorithms are used to generate single-particle three-dimensional reconstructions, revealing that highly symmetrical dodecahedral silica cages, around 10 nm in size, self-assemble in the presence of surfactant micelles.

heading: Heterointerface effects in the electrointercalation of van der Waals heterostructures
description: The electrointercalation of lithium into van der Waals heterostructures of graphene, hexagonal boron nitride and molybdenum dichalcogenides is studied at the level of individual atomic interfaces.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of the serotonin 5-HT1B receptor coupled to heterotrimeric Go
description: The high-resolution structure of the serotonin 5-HT1B receptor in complex with the agonist donitriptan and a Go heterotrimer highlights features that may underlie the specificity of receptor–G-protein coupling and kinetics of signalling.

heading: Nuclear ARP2/3 drives DNA break clustering for homology-directed repair
description: Polymerization of actin in the cell nucleus, promoted by the ARP2/3 complex, drives the clustering of double-strand DNA breaks into nuclear compartments where they can undergo homology-directed repair.

heading: A distinct abundant group of microbial rhodopsins discovered using functional metagenomics
description: An analysis based on functional metagenomics reveals a previously unknown group of microbial light-sensory rhodopsins that are widespread among a diverse range of microorganisms.

heading: A synaptic threshold mechanism for computing escape decisions
authors: Dominic A. EvansA. Vanessa StempelTiago Branco
description: In the midbrain defensive circuit, the decision to escape is computed by an unreliable synaptic connection that thresholds threat information integrated in the medial superior colliculus, and controls activation of dorsal periaqueductal grey neurons.

heading: Ballistic molecular transport through two-dimensional channels
description: Specular scattering of atoms of helium gas flowing through atomically flat, two-dimensional channels results in frictionless gas flow, which is much faster than expected assuming purely diffusive scattering.

heading: Altered exocrine function can drive adipose wasting in early pancreatic cancer
authors: Laura V. DanaiAna BabicMatthew G. Vander Heiden
description: Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma in mice induces loss of adipose tissue through altered function of the exocrine pancreas, and supplementing pancreatic enzymes attenuates the wasting of peripheral tissues induced by pancreatic cancer.

heading: Nuclear F-actin and myosins drive relocalization of heterochromatic breaks
description: Relocalization of heterochromatic double-strand breaks to the nuclear periphery in Drosophila cells occurs via directed motions driven by nuclear actin filaments and myosins activated by the Smc5/6 complex.

heading: A naturally occurring antiviral ribonucleotide encoded by the human genome
authors: Anthony S. GizziTyler L. GroveSteven C. Almo
description: Viperin inhibits the replication of various viruses by catalysing the conversion of CTP to ddhCTP, which is a unique nucleotide that functions as replication-chain terminator of RNA-dependent RNA polymerases.

heading: A stromal cell population that inhibits adipogenesis in mammalian fat depots
description: Single-cell transcriptomics reveals that, in mice and humans, a population of cells in the stromal vascular fraction of adipose tissue regulates adipogenesis by suppressing adipocyte formation in a paracrine manner.

heading: Observations of the missing baryons in the warm–hot intergalactic medium
description: Observations of two absorbers of highly ionized oxygen in the X-ray spectrum of a quasar account for the missing baryons in the Universe.

heading: A multiprotein supercomplex controlling oncogenic signalling in lymphoma
authors: James D. PhelanRyan M. YoungLouis M. Staudt
description: A pro-survival multiprotein signalling supercomplex consisting of the B cell receptor, MYD88, TLR9 and mTOR is discovered that coordinates NF-κB activation in diffuse large B cell lymphoma, and provides mechanistic insight into the efficacy of drug combinations.

heading: Structure of the adenosine-bound human adenosine A1 receptor–Gi complex
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of the human adenosine A1 receptor in complex with adenosine and heterotrimeric Gi2 protein provides molecular insights into receptor and G-protein selectivity.

heading: Codon-specific translation reprogramming promotes resistance to targeted therapy
description: Enzymes that catalyse modifications of wobble uridine 34 tRNA are essential for the survival of melanoma cells that rely on HIF1α-dependent metabolism through codon-dependent regulation of the translation of HIF1A mRNA.

heading: Enantioselective remote meta-C–H arylation and alkylation via a chiral transient mediator
description: Remote, enantioselective C–H activation reactions can be achieved by relaying ortho-C–H activation to the meta position, using a chiral norbornene as the mediator.

heading: Loss of coral reef growth capacity to track future increases in sea level
description: Analyses of current coral reef growth rates in the tropical western Atlantic and Indian Ocean show that few reefs will have the capacity to track sea-level rise projections under Representative Concentration Pathway scenarios without sustained ecological recovery.

heading: An Early Cretaceous eutherian and the placental–marsupial dichotomy
description: Morphological studies and phylogenetic analyses based on the newly discovered Early Cretaceous eutherian mammal Ambolestes zhoui show that the oldest purported metatherian Sinodelphys is instead a eutherian.

heading: Novel soil bacteria possess diverse genes for secondary metabolite biosynthesis
description: Metagenomic and soil microcosm analyses identify abundant biosynthetic gene clusters in genomes of microorganisms from a northern Californian grassland ecosystem that provide a potential source for the future development of bacterial natural products.

heading: Printing ferromagnetic domains for untethered fast-transforming soft materials
description: Programmed ferromagnetic domains are 3D-printed into soft materials capable of fast transformations between complex three-dimensional shapes via magnetic actuation.

heading: A Cdk9–PP1 switch regulates the elongation–termination transition of RNA polymerase II
authors: Pabitra K. ParuaGregory T. BoothRobert P. Fisher
description: The kinase Cdk9 and the phosphatase Dis2 regulate the termination of transcription in fission yeast in part by controlling the phosphorylation state of the elongation factor Spt5.

heading: Antarctic ice shelf disintegration triggered by sea ice loss and ocean swell
authors: Robert A. MassomTheodore A. ScambosSharon E. Stammerjohn
description: Less sea ice allowed ocean swells to flex weakened ice shelves in Antarctica, contributing to their collapse.

heading: Quantitative phosphoproteomic analysis of the molecular substrates of sleep need
description: A subset of synaptic proteins are cumulatively phosphorylated during wakefulness and dephosphorylated during sleep, in accordance with sleep need; this may represent a common mechanism underlying regulation of both synaptic homeostasis and sleep–wake homeostasis.

heading: Deterministic delivery of remote entanglement on a quantum network
description: Remote deterministic spin–spin entanglement is achieved using nitrogen–vacancy centres in diamonds and a single-photon entangling protocol, with much improved entangling rates compared to previously used two-photon protocols.

heading: Velocity-resolved kinetics of site-specific carbon monoxide oxidation on platinum surfaces
description: The catalytic oxidation of carbon monoxide over platinum proceeds through two distinct channels: it is dominated at low temperatures by the more active step sites and at high temperatures by the more abundant terrace sites of the platinum surface.

heading: Structural basis of G-quadruplex unfolding by the DEAH/RHA helicase DHX36
authors: Michael C. ChenRamreddy TippanaAdrian R. Ferré-D’Amaré
description: A mechanism for the unfolding of guanine-rich DNA ‘quadruplexes’ by helicases is suggested, based on the structure of a DNA-bound helicase.

heading: Extensive retreat and re-advance of the West Antarctic Ice Sheet during the Holocene
authors: J. KingslakeR. P. SchererP. L. Whitehouse
description: Radiocarbon dating of sediment cores and ice-penetrating radar observations are used to demonstrate that the West Antarctic Ice Sheet has not retreated progressively during the Holocene epoch, but has instead showed periods of retreat and re-advance.

heading: Deterministic quantum state transfer and remote entanglement using microwave photons
description: Deterministic quantum state transfer and entanglement generation is demonstrated between superconducting qubits on distant chips using single photons.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of human rhodopsin bound to an inhibitory G protein
description: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of human rhodopsin bound to the inhibitory Gi protein-coupled receptor provides insights into ligand–receptor–G-protein interactions.

heading: Minimal East Antarctic Ice Sheet retreat onto land during the past eight million years
authors: Jeremy D. ShakunLee B. CorbettCarling C. Hay
description: Analysis of cosmogenic isotopes from a marine sediment core shows that much of the land-based East Antarctic Ice Sheet has remained stable for the past eight million years, including during the warm Pliocene epoch.

heading: Protection from UV light is an evolutionarily conserved feature of the haematopoietic niche
authors: Friedrich G. KappJulie R. PerlinLeonard I. Zon
description: Melanocytes above the haematopoietic niche protect haematopoietic stem cells from ultraviolet-light-induced DNA damage in aquatic vertebrates throughout evolution; this niche moved to the bone marrow during the transition to terrestrial life.

heading: Mass balance of the Antarctic Ice Sheet from 1992 to 2017
Structure of the µ-opioid receptor–Gi protein complex
description: A cryo-electron structure of the µ-opioid receptor in complex with the peptide agonist DAMGO and the inhibitory G protein Gi reveals structural determinants of its G protein-binding specificity.

heading: Structural basis for regulation of human acetyl-CoA carboxylase
description: Cryo-electron microscopy studies of distinct, catalytically active and inactive filaments of human acetyl-CoA carboxylase 1 reveal the structural basis of its regulation.

heading: Induction and transcriptional regulation of the co-inhibitory gene module in T cells
description: A module of co-inhibitory T cell receptors, driven by the cytokine IL-27, is identified in mice that is regulated by the transcription factors PRDM1 and c-MAF.

heading: Structural basis of mitochondrial receptor binding and constriction by DRP1
description: Cryo-electron microscopy is used to resolve the structure of human dynamin-related protein 1 co-assembled with its receptor mitochondrial dynamics protein of 49 kDa, along with an analysis of structure- and disease-based mutations.

heading: Targeted therapy in patients with PIK3CA-related overgrowth syndrome
description: A PI3KCA inhibitor reverses symptoms in a mouse model of PROS/CLOVES syndrome, which results from gain-of-function mutations in PI3KCA, and produces improvements in patients with PROS/CLOVES syndrome.

heading: Gate-tunable frequency combs in graphene–nitride microresonators
description: Coupling graphene sheets with a silicon nitride ring microresonator allows the nonlinear cavity dynamics to be altered by a gate voltage, resulting in tunable, chip-scale, optical frequency combs.

heading: A global slowdown of tropical-cyclone translation speed
description: The translation speed of tropical cyclones has decreased globally by 10% over the past 70 years, compounding the increases in cyclone-related local rainfall that have resulted from anthropogenic warming.

heading: Prevalent lightning sferics at 600 megahertz near Jupiter’s poles
description: Observations of broadband emission from lightning on Jupiter at 600 megahertz show a lightning discharge mechanism similar to that of terrestrial lightning and indicate increased moist convection near Jupiter’s poles.

heading: Oxidized phospholipids are proinflammatory and proatherogenic in hypercholesterolaemic mice
description: A single-chain variable fragment of the antibody E06, which binds to the phosphocholine headgroup of oxidized phospholipids, blocks the uptake of oxidized low-density lipoprotein by macrophages, and reduces inflammation and atherosclerosis in hypercholesterolaemic mice.

heading: Equivalent-accuracy accelerated neural-network training using analogue memory
description: Analogue-memory-based neural-network training using non-volatile-memory hardware augmented by circuit simulations achieves the same accuracy as software-based training but with much improved energy efficiency and speed.

heading: Mechanism of parkin activation by PINK1
description: Structural mass spectrometry of full-length human parkin and a structure of the activated parkin core reveal large-scale domain rearrangements involved in activation of parkin by PINK1.

heading: Dynamic allostery can drive cold adaptation in enzymes
authors: Harry G. SaavedraJames O. WrablVincent J. Hilser
description: By engineering entropy-tuning changes into distal sites of a bacterial adenylate kinase, an allosteric tuning mechanism based on protein dynamics is revealed.

heading: Environment and host as large-scale controls of ectomycorrhizal fungi
authors: Sietse van der LindeLaura M. SuzMartin I. Bidartondo
description: Analyses of data from 137 forest plots across 20 European countries show that ectomycorrhizal fungal diversity is strongly influenced by environmental and host species factors and provide thresholds to inform ecosystem assessment tools

heading: GLI1-expressing mesenchymal cells form the essential Wnt-secreting niche for colon stem cells
description: GLI1-positive cells in the colon secrete Wnt ligands and thereby support homeostasis of intestinal stem cells.

heading: Visualizing late states of human 40S ribosomal subunit maturation
description: Cryo-EM structures of late intermediates in the assembly of human 40S ribosomal subunits help to define the principles by which immature rRNA conformations and ribosomal biogenesis factors shape the 40S maturation process.

heading: EMI1 switches from being a substrate to an inhibitor of APC/CCDH1 to start the cell cycle
authors: Steven D. CappellKevin G. MarkTobias Meyer
description: The transition between early mitotic inhibitor 1 acting as a substrate of the APC/C and as an inhibitor of the same complex results in an irreversible switch that mediates human cell-cycle commitment.

heading: A molecular rheostat adjusts auxin flux to promote root protophloem differentiation
authors: P. MarhavaA. E. L. BassukasC. S. Hardtke
description: The coordinated action of BREVIS RADIX (BRX) and PROTEIN KINASE ASSOCIATED WITH BRX (PAX) regulates auxin flux during the development of protophloem sieve elements in the root meristem of Arabidopsis.

heading: Parallel emergence of stable and dynamic memory engrams in the hippocampus
description: Imaging of hippocampal neuron activity in mice performing a memory task across several days identifies both stable and dynamic memory engrams.

heading: Comprehensive suppression of single-molecule conductance using destructive σ-interference
authors: Marc H. GarnerHaixing LiGemma C. Solomon
description: Highly insulating silicon-based molecules, engineered so that conduction is fully suppressed by σ quantum interference even for molecules less than a nanometre long, could prove useful in molecular-scale electronic circuitry.

heading: Genomic atlas of the human plasma proteome
authors: Benjamin B. SunJoseph C. MaranvilleAdam S. Butterworth
description: A genetic atlas of the human plasma proteome, comprising 1,927 genetic associations with 1,478 proteins, identifies causes of disease and potential drug targets.

heading: Observation of half-integer thermal Hall conductance
description: Measurements of the thermal Hall conductance in the first excited Landau level of the quantum Hall effect show the existence of a state with non-Abelian excitations.

heading: Stellar populations dominated by massive stars in dusty starburst galaxies across cosmic time
description: Observations of 13CO and C18O emission from four dusty starburst galaxies at redshifts of approximately two to three reveal that massive stars are more numerous in starburst events than in ordinary star-forming spiral galaxies.

heading: Euryhaline ecology of early tetrapods revealed by stable isotopes
description: An approach using multiple stable isotopes reveals that early tetrapods of the Devonian period were euryhaline animals that inhabited aquatic environments of highly variable salinity.

heading: Pairwise and higher-order genetic interactions during the evolution of a tRNA
description: Mutagenesis of a yeast tRNA shows that the effects of mutations and how they interact varies both in magnitude and sign between genotypes.

heading: Magnetic edge states and coherent manipulation of graphene nanoribbons
description: By functionalizing molecular graphene nanoribbons with stable spin-bearing nitronyl nitroxide radical groups, delocalized magnetic edge states are observed, with microsecond-scale spin coherence times.

heading: The origin of squamates revealed by a Middle Triassic lizard from the Italian Alps
authors: Tiago R. SimõesMichael W. CaldwellRandall L. Nydam
description: Computed tomography scanning of the Triassic fossil Megachirella wachtleri combined with a broad morphological and molecular phylogenetic analysis of reptile relationships confirm it as the most primitive stem squamate.

heading: Disruption of TET2 promotes the therapeutic efficacy of CD19-targeted T cells
authors: Joseph A. FraiettaChristopher L. NoblesJ. Joseph Melenhorst
description: Genetically engineered T cells that induced remission in a patient with chronic lymphocytic leukaemia were found to have disruption of the TET2 gene, which caused T cell changes that potentiated their anti-tumour effects.

heading: A per-cent-level determination of the nucleon axial coupling from quantum chromodynamics
authors: C. C. ChangA. N. NicholsonA. Walker-Loud
description: Lattice quantum chromodynamics and a method inspired by the Feynman–Hellmann theorem are used to make a theoretical determination of the nucleon axial coupling with a precision of one per cent, giving the value 1.271 ± 0.013.

heading: Potential enthalpic energy of water in oils exploited to control supramolecular structure
authors: Nathan J. Van ZeeBeatrice AdelizziE. W. Meijer
description: Less than 0.01 per cent by weight of water in an alkane solvent is sufficient to interact with co-dissolved supramolecular polymeric chains by hydrogen bonding and modulate the structure of the assembly.

heading: Simulating the vibrational quantum dynamics of molecules using photonics
description: By mapping vibrations in molecules to photons in waveguides, the vibrational quantum dynamics of various molecules are simulated using a photonic chip.

heading: A small amount of mini-charged dark matter could cool the baryons in the early Universe
description: Calculations show that if some dark-matter particles—less than one per cent—have a tiny charge, their coupling to baryons could cool the baryons enough to explain puzzling astrophysical observations.

heading: Phase-separation mechanism for C-terminal hyperphosphorylation of RNA polymerase II
description: The histidine-rich domain of cyclin T1 promotes phase separation into liquid droplets, which facilitates the hyperphosphorylation of the C-terminal domain repeats of RNA polymerase II.

heading: Disruption of the beclin 1–BCL2 autophagy regulatory complex promotes longevity in mice
description: A knock-in mutation in beclin 1 that increases autophagy in mice extends animal lifespan, improves healthspan, and also rescues early lethality in mice deficient in the anti-ageing protein klotho.

heading: Pyramidal cell regulation of interneuron survival sculpts cortical networks
description: Excitatory input onto inhibitory interneurons in the developing mouse cortex acts through PTEN to protect interneurons from cell death and thus regulate the balance between excitation and inhibition.

heading: Hippo/Mst signalling couples metabolic state and immune function of CD8α+ dendritic cells
description: A data-driven analysis helps to identify specific roles of the Hippo signalling kinases Mst1 and Mst2 in integrating metabolic activity and cytokine signalling in dendritic cells, and thereby orchestrating immune cell function.

heading: The coding of valence and identity in the mammalian taste system
description: The identity and hedonic value of tastes are encoded in distinct neural substrates; in mice, the amygdala is necessary and sufficient to drive valence-specific behaviours in response to bitter or sweet taste stimuli, and the cortex can independently represent taste identity.

heading: Molecular tuning of electroreception in sharks and skates
authors: Nicholas W. BellonoDuncan B. LeitchDavid Julius
description: Shark and skate electrosensory cells use specific potassium channels to support either indiscriminate detection of electrical stimuli or selective frequency tuning, respectively, demonstrating adaptation of sensory systems through discrete molecular modifications.

heading: Rapid recovery of life at ground zero of the end-Cretaceous mass extinction
authors: Christopher M. LoweryTimothy J. BralowerWilliam Zylberman
description: Micro- and nannofossil, trace fossil and geochemical evidence from the Chicxulub impact crater demonstrates that proximity to the asteroid impact site did not determine rates of recovery of marine ecosystems after the end-Cretaceous mass extinction.

heading: Self-organization of a human organizer by combined Wnt and Nodal signalling
authors: I. MartynT. Y. KannoA. H. Brivanlou
description: Stimulation of Wnt and Nodal pathways in micropatterned human embryonic stem cell colonies induce these colonies to exhibit characteristic spatial expression patterns of the organizer and reproduce organizer function when grafted into a host embryo.

heading: Large potential reduction in economic damages under UN mitigation targets
authors: Marshall BurkeW. Matthew DavisNoah S. Diffenbaugh
description: If the world can meet the target of limiting global warming to 1.5 °C, economic damage will probably be greatly reduced, especially in poorer countries.

heading: Inference of ecological and social drivers of human brain-size evolution
description: Using estimates of metabolic costs of the brain and body, mathematical predictions suggest that the evolution of adult Homo sapiens-sized brains and bodies is driven by ecological rather than social challenges and is perhaps strongly promoted by culture.

heading: Mechanism of phosphoribosyl-ubiquitination mediated by a single Legionella effector
description: Crystal structures of the Legionella effectors SdeA and SdeD uncover the mechanism of a unique phosphoribosyl-ubiquitination reaction.

heading: Long-term effects of species loss on community properties across contrasting ecosystems
description: A long-term biodiversity manipulation experiment using plant communities on thirty Swedish lake islands reveals the importance of environmental context for determining the consequences of species loss at the ecosystem level.

heading: Reconstruction of antibody dynamics and infection histories to evaluate dengue risk
authors: Henrik SaljeDerek A. T. CummingsSimon Cauchemez
description: Analyses of antibody dynamics and subclinical infections show that across the population, variability in the infection strength of dengue viruses results in large-scale temporal changes in infection and disease risk that correlate poorly with age.

heading: Insights into catalysis and function of phosphoribosyl-linked serine ubiquitination
description: Structural and functional investigations demonstrate how bacterial enzymes ubiquitinate host proteins.

heading: Cortical direction selectivity emerges at convergence of thalamic synapses
description: Direction selectivity emerges de novo in layer 4 neurons of primary visual cortex through the convergence of synaptic inputs from thalamic neurons that respond with distinct time courses to visual stimuli in distinct locations.

heading: Fundamental limits to graphene plasmonics
authors: G. X. NiA. S. McLeodD. N. Basov
description: The fundamental limits to plasmon damping in graphene are determined using nanoscale infrared imaging at cryogenic temperatures, and plasmon polaritons are observed to propagate over 10 micrometres in high-mobility encapsulated graphene.

heading: Body-size shifts in aquatic and terrestrial urban communities
description: The urban-heat-island effect drives community-level shifts towards smaller body sizes; however, habitat fragmentation caused by urbanization favours larger body sizes in species with positive size–dispersal links.

heading: Late-surviving stem mammal links the lowermost Cretaceous of North America and Gondwana
authors: Adam K. HuttenlockerDavid M. GrossnickleZhe-Xi Luo
description: An exceptionally preserved skull of Cifelliodon wahkarmoosuch sheds light on the evolution of the ancestral mammalian brain.

heading: Structural basis of ubiquitin modification by the Legionella effector SdeA
description: Crystal structures of the Legionella effector SdeA in a ligand-free state and in complex with ubiquitin and NADH provide insight into SdeA-mediated phosphoribosyl-linked ubiquitination.

heading: Pulsar emission amplified and resolved by plasma lensing in an eclipsing binary
authors: Robert MainI-Sheng YangMarten H. van Kerkwijk
description: Radiation from the ‘black widow’ pulsar B1957+20 is amplified when a companion brown dwarf passes in front of the source, suggesting that plasma flowing from the companion acts as a lens.

heading: Activity-dependent neuroprotective protein recruits HP1 and CHD4 to control lineage-specifying genes
description: ADNP interacts with the chromatin remodeller CHD4 and the heterochromatin protein HP1 to form a complex termed ChAHP that represses gene expression independently of the histone H3K9me3 modification.

heading: An increase in the 12C + 12C fusion rate from resonances at astrophysical energies
description: The rate of carbon burning—12C + 12C fusion—in stars is boosted by resonant behaviour at astrophysical energies.

heading: Rapid emergence of subaerial landmasses and onset of a modern hydrologic cycle 2.5 billion years ago
authors: I. N. BindemanD. O. ZakharovA. Bekker
description: The use of triple-oxygen-isotope data from continental shales spanning the past 3.7 billion years suggests that continental crust with near-modern average elevation and extent emerged about 2.5 billion years ago.

heading: Addressing the minimum fleet problem in on-demand urban mobility
description: An optimal computationally efficient solution to the problem of finding the minimum taxi fleet size using a vehicle-sharing network is presented.

heading: Reciprocal signalling by Notch–Collagen V–CALCR retains muscle stem cells in their niche
description: Muscle stem cell quiescence in mice is maintained by a Notch–Collagen V–CALCR signalling pathway that is activated and sustained in a cell-autonomous fashion.

heading: Observation of anisotropic magneto-Peltier effect in nickel
description: A ‘magneto-Peltier effect’ produces cooling or heating in a material without junctions, by forcing a change in angle between the current and magnetization in a single ferromagnetic nickel slab.

heading: The pressure distribution inside the proton
authors: V. D. BurkertL. ElouadrhiriF. X. Girod
description: Measurements of the quark pressure distribution in the proton reveal a strong repulsive pressure near the proton’s centre (stronger than the pressure in neutron stars) and a binding pressure at greater distances.

heading: KLHL22 activates amino-acid-dependent mTORC1 signalling to promote tumorigenesis and ageing
description: In response to amino acid stimulation, the ubiquitin E3 ligase CUL3–KLHL22 promotes the activation of mTORC1, which may drive tumour growth in breast cancer.

heading: An unexpected and persistent increase in global emissions of ozone-depleting CFC-11
authors: Stephen A. MontzkaGeoff S. DuttonJames W. Elkins
description: Atmospheric CFC-11 concentrations have been declining less rapidly since 2012; evidence suggests that this finding is explained by an increase in the emission of CFC-11during these years.

heading: Structure of a volume-regulated anion channel of the LRRC8 family
description: The structure of a homomeric channel of subunit A of leucine-rich repeat-containing protein 8 (LRRC8) determined by cryo-electron microscopy and X-ray crystallography reveals the basis for anion selectivity.

heading: Spatiotemporal regulation of liquid-like condensates in epigenetic inheritance
description: ZNFX-1 and WAGO-4 localize to germ granules in early Caenorhabditis elegans embryogenesis and later separate to form independent liquid-like droplets, and the temporal and spatial ordering of these droplets may help cells to organize complex RNA processing pathways.

heading: RSPO2 inhibition of RNF43 and ZNRF3 governs limb development independently of LGR4/5/6
description: Independently of the LGR4/5/6 receptors, RSPO2 acts as a direct antagonistic ligand to RNF43 and ZNRF3 during embryogenesis, and specifies the position and number of limbs that an embryo should form.

heading: Structural basis for gating pore current in periodic paralysis
authors: Daohua JiangTamer M. Gamal El-DinWilliam A. Catterall
description: Crystal structures and molecular dynamics simulations of voltage-gated sodium channels containing mutations that cause hypokalaemic and normokalaemic periodic paralysis indicate the pathogenic mechanisms of these conditions and suggest a target for the design of potential therapeutic and symptomatic drugs.

heading: Microbial signals drive pre-leukaemic myeloproliferation in a Tet2-deficient host
description: Microbial signals are crucial to the development of pre-leukaemic myeloproliferation, which can be induced by disrupting the intestinal barrier or by introducing systemic bacterial stimuli in Tet2-deficient mice.

heading: Emerging trends in global freshwater availability
description: Analysis of 2002–2016 GRACE satellite observations of terrestrial water storage reveals substantial changes in freshwater resources globally, which are driven by natural and anthropogenic climate variability and human activities.

heading: Thickness-independent capacitance of vertically aligned liquid-crystalline MXenes
description: Electrode films prepared from a liquid-crystal phase of vertically aligned two-dimensional titanium carbide show electrochemical energy storage that is nearly independent of film thickness.

heading: Approaching the Schottky–Mott limit in van der Waals metal–semiconductor junctions
description: In metal–semiconductor junctions, interfacial bonding and disorder cause deviations from theoretical predictions for the energy barrier, but delicately transferring pre-fabricated metal films onto two-dimensional semiconductors can overcome this challenge.

heading: Bystander CD8+ T cells are abundant and phenotypically distinct in human tumour infiltrates
description: Human lung and colorectal tumours contain a population of tumour-infiltrating lymphocytes that are specific for tumour-unrelated antigens and, unlike tumour-antigen-specific tumour-infiltrating lymphocytes, do not express CD39.

heading: Dynamic band-structure tuning of graphene moiré superlattices with pressure
description: For appropriately aligned layers of different two-dimensional materials, the separation between layers—and hence the interlayer coupling—is very sensitive to pressure, leading to pressure-induced changes in the electronic properties of the heterostructures.

heading: SWI2/SNF2 ATPase CHR2 remodels pri-miRNAs via Serrate to impede miRNA production
description: The chromatin remodelling protein CHR2 interacts with Serrate in Arabidopsis to regulate microRNA biogenesis.

heading: Microglial control of astrocytes in response to microbial metabolites
authors: Veit RothhammerDavis M. BoruckiFrancisco J. Quintana
description: TGFα and VEGF-B produced by microglia regulate astrocyte function in the experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis model of multiple sclerosis.

heading: Mxra8 is a receptor for multiple arthritogenic alphaviruses
authors: Rong ZhangArthur S. KimMichael S. Diamond
description: The cell adhesion molecule Mxra8 is identified as a receptor for multiple arthritogenic alphaviruses such as chikungunya virus, and anti-Mxra8 monoclonal antibodies are shown to reduce rates of chikungunya virus infection in mice and a range of human cells.

heading: Mutant phenotypes for thousands of bacterial genes of unknown function
authors: Morgan N. PriceKelly M. WetmoreAdam M. Deutschbauer
description: A large-scale mutagenesis screen identifies mutant phenotypes for over 11,000 protein-coding genes in bacteria that had previously not been assigned a specific function.

heading: The onset of star formation 250 million years after the Big Bang
description: Observation of the emission line of doubly ionized oxygen at a redshift of 9.1096 reveals that star formation began at a redshift of about 15, around 250 million years after the Big Bang.

heading: ANKRD16 prevents neuron loss caused by an editing-defective tRNA synthetase
description: ANKRD16 attenuates neurodegeneration induced by a mutation in the editing domain of alanyl tRNA synthetase by directly accepting mis-activated serine from the synthetase before transfer to the tRNA, establishing a new mechanism by which editing defects are prevented.

heading: The effect of hydration number on the interfacial transport of sodium ions
description: A sodium ion hydrated with three (rather than one, two, four or five) water molecules diffuses orders of magnitude more quickly than the other ion hydrates owing to the interfacial symmetry mismatch.

heading: Electron magnetic reconnection without ion coupling in Earth’s turbulent magnetosheath
authors: T. D. PhanJ. P. EastwoodW. Magnes
description: Observations of electron-scale current sheets in Earth’s turbulent magnetosheath reveal electron reconnection without ion coupling, contrary to expectations from the standard model of magnetic reconnection.

heading: Diverse reprogramming codes for neuronal identity
description: A screen in which combinatorial pairs of transcription factors are exogenously expressed in fibroblasts identifies different combinations that reprogram these cells into induced neuronal cells with diverse functional properties.

heading: Control of cardiac jelly dynamics by NOTCH1 and NRG1 defines the building plan for trabeculation
authors: Gonzalo del Monte-NietoMirana RamialisonRichard P. Harvey
description: A new model of cardiac trabeculation in mice is presented in which NOTCH1 and NRG1 have opposing roles in extracellular matrix degradation and synthesis that are essential for defining trabecular architecture.

heading: Rapid energy-efficient manufacturing of polymers and composites via frontal polymerization
authors: Ian D. RobertsonMostafa YourdkhaniScott R. White
description: Frontal polymerization of dicyclopentadiene is used to generate thermoset polymers and composite materials with much lower energy requirements and cure times than are needed in conventional oven or autoclave curing approaches.

heading: Lethal trap created by adaptive evolutionary response to an exotic resource
description: Local extinction of the butterfly Euphydryas editha occurred after the population was caught in an eco-evolutionary trap set when the insects evolved unanimous preference for an exotic host, Plantago lanceolata, and sprung when that host became embedded in grasses after humans removed cattle.

heading: Self-reporting and self-regulating liquid crystals
description: Liquid crystals are used to self-report and self-regulate either continuous or transient release of droplets or microparticles trapped within them in response to thermal, chemical, mechanical or biological stimuli.

heading: Precision measurement of the weak charge of the proton
description: Measurement of the asymmetry in the parity-violating scattering of polarized electrons on protons gives the weak charge of the proton as 0.0719 ± 0.0045, in agreement with the standard model.

heading: Cellular milieu imparts distinct pathological α-synuclein strains in α-synucleinopathies
authors: Chao PengRonald J. GathaganVirginia M.-Y. Lee
description: Distinct strains of misfolded α-synuclein proteins, which aggregate in neurons in Lewy body diseases or in oligodendrocytes in multiple system atrophy, are formed as a consequence of differences between intracellular environments.

heading: 137 ancient human genomes from across the Eurasian steppes
authors: Peter de Barros DamgaardNina MarchiEske Willerslev
description: Sequences of 137 ancient and 502 modern human genomes illuminate the population history of the Eurasian steppes after the Bronze Age and document the replacement of Indo-European speakers of West Eurasian ancestry by Turkic-speaking groups of East Asian ancestry.

heading: Highly durable, coking and sulfur tolerant, fuel-flexible protonic ceramic fuel cells
description: Tests on a versatile protonic ceramic fuel cell resistant to carbon deposition and sulfur poisoning show that its durability and the wide range of fuels it can accept make it suitable for use in industry in the near future.

heading: Vector-based navigation using grid-like representations in artificial agents
description: Grid-like representations emerge spontaneously within a neural network trained to self-localize, enabling the agent to take shortcuts to destinations using vector-based navigation.

heading: Challenging local realism with human choices
description: The BIG Bell Test, which used an online video game with 100,000 participants worldwide to provide random bits to 13 quantum physics experiments, contradicts the Einstein–Podolsky–Rosen worldview of local realism.

heading: Reconstitution reveals motor activation for intraflagellar transport
authors: Mohamed A. A. MohamedWilli L. SteppZeynep Ökten
description: Reconstitution of a functional intraflagellar transport complex in Caenorhabditis elegans provides insight into the recruitment and activation of the kinesin-2 motor protein.

heading: An exclusive metabolic niche enables strain engraftment in the gut microbiota
authors: Elizabeth Stanley ShepherdWilliam C. DeLoacheJustin L. Sonnenburg
description: Finely tuned control of strain engraftment and abundance in the mouse gut microbiota was achieved using the marine polysaccharide porphyran, which could exclusively be used by an introduced subset of wild-type or genetically modified Bacteroides strains.

heading: Ancient hepatitis B viruses from the Bronze Age to the Medieval period
description: Phylogenies reconstructed using 12 hepatitis B virus genomes, which were recovered from ancient human genome data, reveal a complex history of hepatitis B evolution that is not evident when using only modern samples.

heading: Genome sequence of the progenitor of wheat A subgenome Triticum urartu
description: The genome sequence of Triticum urartu, the progenitor of the A subgenome of hexaploid wheat, provides insight into genome duplication during grass evolution.

heading: An absolute sodium abundance for a cloud-free ‘hot Saturn’ exoplanet
authors: N. NikolovD. K. SingJ. J. Spake
description: The optical transmission spectrum for the ‘hot Saturn’ exoplanet WASP-96b reveals a clear atmosphere, an atmospheric sodium abundance and hence its metallicity, which is consistent with the metallicity trend observed in Solar System planets and exoplanets.

heading: Overcoming the rate–distance limit of quantum key distribution without quantum repeaters
authors: M. LucamariniZ. L. YuanA. J. Shields
description: Twin optical fields enable a form of quantum key distribution that can exceed the secret-key capacity without using quantum repeaters and that has security independent of the measuring devices.

heading: Complete Ichthyornis skull illuminates mosaic assembly of the avian head
authors: Daniel J. FieldMichael HansonBhart-Anjan S. Bhullar
description: High-resolution computed tomography of three-dimensionally preserved specimens of Ichthyornis dispar clarifies the mosaic evolution of the avian head, revealing a kinetic feeding apparatus reminiscent of modern birds, a transitional beak and a dinosaurian temporal region.

heading: Catalytic activation of β-arrestin by GPCRs
description: Transient engagement of the G protein-coupled receptor core can act as a catalyst to activate cellular β-arrestin function after dissociation from the receptor.

heading: Diametric neural ensemble dynamics in parkinsonian and dyskinetic states
authors: Jones G. ParkerJesse D. MarshallMark J. Schnitzer
description: In mouse models of Parkinson’s disease and dyskinesia, striatal spiny projection neurons of the direct and indirect pathways have abnormal, imbalanced levels of spontaneous and locomotor-related activity, with the two different disease states characterized by opposite abnormalities.

heading: Helium in the eroding atmosphere of an exoplanet
authors: J. J. SpakeD. K. SingN. Madhusudhan
description: A detection of helium absorption at 10,833 Å on the exoplanet WASP-107b reveals that its atmosphere is extended and eroding, and demonstrates a new way to study upper exoplanetary atmospheres.

heading: Male-killing toxin in a bacterial symbiont of Drosophila
description: The Spaid protein is identified and shown to be responsible for the male-killing effects of Spiroplasma poulsonii in Drosophila.

heading: Structural principles of distinct assemblies of the human α4β2 nicotinic receptor
authors: Richard M. Walsh JrSoung-Hun RohRyan E. Hibbs
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of two stoichiometries of heteromeric acetylcholine receptors in complex with nicotine reveal principles of subunit assembly and the structural basis of the distinctive biophysical and pharmacological properties of the different stoichiometries.

heading: Molecular mechanism of GPCR-mediated arrestin activation
authors: Naomi R. LatorracaJason K. WangRon O. Dror
description: Molecular dynamics simulations and site-directed fluorescence spectroscopy show that the transmembrane core and cytoplasmic tail of G-protein-coupled receptors independently and cooperatively activate arrestin.

heading: Subepithelial telocytes are an important source of Wnts that supports intestinal crypts
authors: Michal Shoshkes-CarmelYue J. WangKlaus H. Kaestner
description: Subepithelial telocytes are identified as a source of Wnt signals that enable proliferation and differentiation of intestinal stem cells, an essential function for maintenance of the intestinal epithelium.

heading: Earliest known hominin activity in the Philippines by 709 thousand years ago
authors: T. IngiccoG. D. van den BerghJ. de Vos
description: Stone tools and a disarticulated and butchered skeleton of Rhinoceros philippinensis, found in a securely dated stratigraphic context, indicate the presence of an unknown hominin population in the Philippines as early as 709 thousand years ago.

heading: De novo formation of the biliary system by TGFβ-mediated hepatocyte transdifferentiation
authors: Johanna R. SchaubKari A. HuppertHolger Willenbring
description: In a mouse model of a human cholestatic liver disease caused by impaired NOTCH signalling, hepatocytes transdifferentiate into cholangiocytes and form a therapeutically effective biliary system, driven by TGFβ signalling.

heading: A midline thalamic circuit determines reactions to visual threat
authors: Lindsey D. SalayNao IshikoAndrew D. Huberman
description: Separate outputs of the ventral midline thalamus comprise neural circuits that determine avoidance-based or confrontational responses to visual threat.

heading: Lightwave valleytronics in a monolayer of tungsten diselenide
description: A strong lightwave in a monolayer of tungsten diselenide drives changes in the valley pseudospin, making valley pseudospin an information carrier that is switchable faster than a single light cycle.

heading: Chromatin analysis in human early development reveals epigenetic transition during ZGA
description: By applying an optimized ATAC-seq protocol to human early embryos, distinct accessible chromatin landscapes are found before and after zygotic genome activation, revealing a marked epigenetic transition during zygotic genome activation and putative regulatory elements wiring human early development.

heading: Blastocyst-like structures generated solely from stem cells
description: Trophoblast and embryonic stem cells interact in vitro to form structures that resemble early blastocysts, and the embryo provides signals that drive early trophectoderm development and implantation.

heading: Hyperexpandable, self-healing macromolecular crystals with integrated polymer networks
authors: Ling ZhangJake B. BaileyF. Akif Tezcan
description: The integration of macromolecular ferritin protein crystals with hydrogel polymers gives a composite material that expands isotropically and reversibly to twice its size while maintaining periodicity, resists fragmentation and self-heals efficiently.

heading: Structural basis for dual-mode inhibition of the ABC transporter MsbA
description: Crystal structures of the ABC transporter MsbA in complex with two selective small-molecule antagonists reveal an unprecedented allosteric mechanism of inhibition.

heading: Quaternary stereocentres via an enantioconvergent catalytic SN1 reaction
authors: Alison E. WendlandtPrithvi VangalEric N. Jacobsen
description: Cooperation between a chiral hydrogen-bond-donor catalyst and a strong Lewis-acid promoter in an SN1-type reaction mediates the formation of tertiary carbocations and enables control over enantioselectivity and product distribution.

heading: Stabilized entanglement of massive mechanical oscillators
authors: C. F. Ockeloen-KorppiE. DamskäggM. A. Sillanpää
description: Quantum entanglement is demonstrated in a system of massive micromechanical oscillators coupled to a microwave-frequency electromagnetic cavity by driving the devices into a steady state that is entangled.

heading: Earthquake-induced transformation of the lower crust
description: During continent collision and associated mountain building, a surprisingly large volume of the lower crust is shown to be affected by earthquake aftershocks, producing a top-down effect on crustal geodynamics.

heading: Remote quantum entanglement between two micromechanical oscillators
description: Remote quantum entanglement is demonstrated in a micromachined solid-state system comprising two optomechanical oscillators across two chips physically separated by 20 cm and with an optical separation of around 70 m.

heading: Architecture of an HIV-1 reverse transcriptase initiation complex
authors: Kevin P. LarsenYamuna Kalyani MathiharanElisabetta Viani Puglisi
description: A cryo-EM structure of an initiation complex of HIV-1 reverse transcriptase sheds light on the initiation of reverse transcription of viral RNA.

heading: Structure of the alternative complex III in a supercomplex with cytochrome oxidase
description: The structure of alternative complex III, a key enzyme in the bacterial electron transport chain, is reported both alone and as a supercomplex with an aa3-type cytochrome c oxidase.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of the gasdermin A3 membrane pore
description: High-resolution cryo-electron microscopy structures of the membrane-pore-forming domain of the mouse gasdermin GSDMA3 show that it forms pores with 26-, 27- or 28-fold symmetry and indicate that it may also form a parallel, soluble, pre-pore ring structure.

heading: An optical-frequency synthesizer using integrated photonics
authors: Daryl T. SpencerTara DrakeScott B. Papp
description: An optical-frequency synthesizer based on stabilized frequency combs has been developed utilizing chip-scale devices as key components, in a move towards using integrated photonics technology for ultrafast science and metrology.

heading: Low-loss plasmon-assisted electro-optic modulator
description: Ohmic losses in plasmonic devices can be reduced by exploiting ‘resonant switching’, in which light couples to surface plasmon polaritons only when in resonance and bypasses them otherwise.
