heading: Genomic variation in 3,010 diverse accessions of Asian cultivated rice
description: Analyses of genetic variation and population structure based on over 3,000 cultivated rice (Oryza sativa) genomes reveal subpopulations that correlate with geographic location and patterns of introgression consistent with multiple rice domestication events.

heading: Cryo-EM structure of substrate-bound human telomerase holoenzyme
authors: Thi Hoang Duong NguyenJane TamKathleen Collins
description: A cryo-electron microscopy structure of the substrate-bound human telomerase holoenzyme, which lengthens the protective caps on chromosomes.

heading: Deep mitochondrial origin outside the sampled alphaproteobacteria
authors: Joran MartijnJulian VossebergThijs J. G. Ettema
description: Genome data for thirteen alphaproteobacteria-related clades expand the coverage of alphaproteobacterial diversity and suggest that mitochondria diverged from Alphaproteobacteria before the diversification of all currently known alphaproteobacterial lineages.

heading: A massive core for a cluster of galaxies at a redshift of 4.3
authors: T. B. MillerS. C. ChapmanA. L. Strom
description: Observations of carbon monoxide and ionized carbon lines from the source SPT2349-56 show it to contain a cluster of at least fourteen gas-rich galaxies with redshifts of 4.31, in a highly dense core region.

heading: LUBAC is essential for embryogenesis by preventing cell death and enabling haematopoiesis
description: The HOIL-1 component of the LUBAC ubiquitin ligase complex is required for LUBAC activity, which prevents lethality during embryogenesis by preventing aberrant TNFR1-mediated endothelial cell death and RIPK1-mediated defects in haematopoiesis.

heading: Nanoscale synthesis and affinity ranking
description: A system that combines nanoscale synthesis and affinity ranking enables high-throughput screening of reaction conditions and bioactivity for a given protein target, accelerating the process of drug discovery.

heading: Integrating photonics with silicon nanoelectronics for the next generation of systems on a chip
authors: Amir H. AtabakiSajjad MoazeniRajeev J. Ram
description: A way of integrating photonics with silicon nanoelectronics is described, using polycrystalline silicon on glass islands alongside transistors on bulk silicon complementary metal–oxide–semiconductor chips.

heading: Laser spectroscopic characterization of the nuclear-clock isomer 229mTh
description: Laser spectroscopy is used to investigate the hyperfine structure and determine the fundamental nuclear properties of the isomer 229mTh, the strongest candidate for the realization of a nuclear clock.

heading: Pluripotency factors functionally premark cell-type-restricted enhancers in ES cells
authors: Hong Sook KimYuliang TanMichael G. Rosenfeld
description: Binding of an embryonic stem in two cases cell-specific transcription factor pre-marks cell-type-restricted enhancers in embryonic stem in two cases cells, and this premarking is required for the robustness of enhancer activation in differentiated cells.

heading: Two separate outflows in the dual supermassive black hole system NGC 6240
description: Observations of NGC 6240 show two differently driven outflows of different gases with a combined outflow rate comparable to the star formation rate, suggesting possible negative feedback on star formation.

heading: Mechanism of NMDA receptor channel block by MK-801 and memantine
description: A high-resolution X-ray structure and molecular dynamics simulations of the N-methyl-d-aspartate receptor in complexes with channel-blocking ligands reveals the molecular basis of the ligand binding and channel block.

heading: Identification of the tumour transition states occurring during EMT
description: Epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition in tumour cells occurs through distinct intermediate states, associated with different metastatic potential, cellular properties, gene expression, and chromatin landscape

heading: Electrophilic properties of itaconate and derivatives regulate the IκBζ–ATF3 inflammatory axis
description: The immunoregulatory metabolite itaconate and its dimethyl derivative induce electrophilic stress and react with glutathione to induce both Nrf2-dependent and Nrf2-independent responses, resulting in AF3-mediated inhibition of the inflammation-related protein IκBζ.

heading: Renewing Felsenstein’s phylogenetic bootstrap in the era of big data
description: A new version of the phylogenetic bootstrap method enables assessment of the robustness of phylogenies that are based on large datasets of hundreds or thousands of taxa.

heading: Genetic identification of leptin neural circuits in energy and glucose homeostases
description: A subset of neurons in the hypothalamus is identified as the primary site of action for regulating energy balance and glucose homeostasis by leptin.

heading: SAMHD1 acts at stalled replication forks to prevent interferon induction
description: SAMHD1 has an essential role in the replication stress response and prevents inflammation by activating the MRE11 nuclease to degrade nascent DNA strands at stalled replication forks, thus enabling replication.

heading: A library of atomically thin metal chalcogenides
description: Molten-salt-assisted chemical vapour deposition is used to synthesize a wide variety of two-dimensional transition-metal chalcogenides.

heading: Amino-acid- and peptide-directed synthesis of chiral plasmonic gold nanoparticles
description: Chirality can be ‘encoded’ into gold nanoparticles by introducing chiral amino acids or peptides during the growth process, leading to the formation of helicoid morphologies.

heading: Global warming transforms coral reef assemblages
authors: Terry P. HughesJames T. KerryGergely Torda
description: Acute heat stress from the extended marine heatwave of 2016 is a potent driver of the transformation of coral assemblages, which affects even the most remote and well-protected reefs of the Great Barrier Reef.

heading: A randomized trial of normothermic preservation in liver transplantation
authors: David NasrallaConstantin C. CoussiosPeter J. Friend
description: Normothermic machine perfusion of the liver improved early graft function, demonstrated by reduced peak serum aspartate transaminase levels and early allograft dysfunction rates, and improved organ utilization and preservation times, although no differences were seen in graft or patient survival.

heading: Structural basis of ligand binding modes at the neuropeptide Y Y1 receptor
description: Crystal structures of the neuropeptide Y1 receptor in complex with two distinct antagonists combined with NMR, molecular docking and mutagenesis studies inform a proposed model for receptor–agonist binding.

heading: Vertically migrating swimmers generate aggregation-scale eddies in a stratified column
authors: Isabel A. HoughtonJeffrey R. KoseffJohn O. Dabiri
description: Laboratory experiments with the brine shrimp Artemia salina illustrate the potential for turbulence generated by the diurnal vertical migrations of aggregations of centimetre-scale zooplankton to affect the physical and biogeochemical structure of oceanic water columns.

heading: Synthesis, structure and reaction chemistry of a nucleophilic aluminyl anion
description: An aluminium compound is synthesized in which the aluminium is formally anionic; reactions with various substrates suggest that this compound acts as the nucleophilic partner in both metal–carbon and metal–metal bond-forming reactions.

heading: Alteration of the magnetosphere of the Vela pulsar during a glitch
authors: Jim PalfreymanJohn M. DickeyWillem van Straten
description: Single-pulse radio observations of a glitch in the Vela pulsar show sudden changes in the pulse shape coincident with the glitch, indicating that the glitch could affect the pulsar’s magnetosphere.

heading: Innate immune memory in the brain shapes neurological disease hallmarks
description: Peripheral stimuli can induce acute immune training and tolerance in the brain and lead to long-lasting epigenetic reprogramming of microglia; these changes alter pathology in mouse models of stroke and Alzheimer’s pathology .

heading: Experimentally generated randomness certified by the impossibility of superluminal signals
description: 1,024 random bits that are uniformly distributed to within 10−12 and unpredictable assuming the impossibility of superluminal communication are generated and certified using a loophole-free Bell test.

heading: Genome evolution across 1,011 Saccharomyces cerevisiae isolates
description: Whole-genome sequencing of 1,011 natural isolates of the yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae reveals its evolutionary history, including a single out-of-China origin and multiple domestication events, and provides a framework for genotype–phenotype studies in this model organism.

heading: Anomalously weak Labrador Sea convection and Atlantic overturning during the past 150 years
authors: David J. R. ThornalleyDelia W. OppoLloyd D. Keigwin
description: Palaeoclimate records show that the Atlantic meridional overturning circulation weakened substantially at the end of the Little Ice Age, probably in response to enhanced freshwater fluxes from the Arctic and Nordic seas.

heading: Activity-based E3 ligase profiling uncovers an E3 ligase with esterification activity
description: Non-lysine ubiquitination activity of the E3 ubiquitin ligase MYCBP2 is identified by activity-based profiling; biochemical and structural analysis of MYCBP2 suggests the basis for its mechanism and specificity.

heading: Structure and regulation of the human INO80–nucleosome complex
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structure of the human INO80 chromatin remodeller in complex with a bound nucleosome reveals that its motor domains are located at the DNA wrap around the histone core.

heading: Intra-tumour diversification in colorectal cancer at the single-cell level
description: Organoids derived from individual cells from colorectal cancers and adjacent normal tissue are used to investigate intra-tumour diversification at the genomic, epigenetic and functional levels.

heading: Structural basis for ATP-dependent chromatin remodelling by the INO80 complex
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of the evolutionarily conserved core of a fungal INO80 complex bound to the nucleosomal substrate reveal the mechanism underlying nucleosome sliding and histone editing used by this ATP-dependent chromatin remodeller.

heading: Functional circuit architecture underlying parental behaviour
description: Galanin-expressing neurons in the medial preoptic area coordinate different aspects of motor, motivational, hormonal and social behaviour associated with parenting by projecting to different brain regions depending on the type of behaviour and sex and reproductive state of mice.

heading: Reversible Mn2+/Mn4+ double redox in lithium-excess cathode materials
description: Lithium-rich cathode materials in which manganese undergoes double redox could point the way for lithium-ion batteries to meet the capacity and energy density needs of portable electronics and electric vehicles.

heading: Observed fingerprint of a weakening Atlantic Ocean overturning circulation
description: A characteristic ‘fingerprint’ of sea-surface temperatures suggests that the Atlantic overturning circulation has slowed substantially since the mid-twentieth century, as predicted by climate models in response to increasing carbon dioxide emissions.

heading: An evolutionarily conserved ribosome-rescue pathway maintains epidermal homeostasis
authors: Kifayathullah Liakath-AliEric W. MillsFiona M. Watt
description: Loss of the ribosome-rescue factor Pelo in a subset of mouse epidermal stem cells results in hyperproliferation and altered differentiation of these cells.

heading: High male sexual investment as a driver of extinction in fossil ostracods
authors: Maria João Fernandes MartinsT. Markham PuckettGene Hunt
description: Ostracod species (small, bivalved crustaceans) with high sexual dimorphism, and therefore high male investment, had markedly higher extinction rates than low-investment species, indicating that sexual selection can be a substantial risk factor for extinction.

heading: Aspm knockout ferret reveals an evolutionary mechanism governing cerebral cortical size
description: In a ferret model, the microcephaly-associated gene Aspm regulates cortical expansion by controlling the transition of ventricular radial glial cells to more differentiated cell types.

heading: Vms1 and ANKZF1 peptidyl-tRNA hydrolases release nascent chains from stalled ribosomes
authors: Rati VermaKurt M. ReichermeierRaymond J. Deshaies
description: The Cdc48 adaptor Vms1 is a peptidyl-tRNA hydrolase that cooperates with the ribosome quality control complex to catalyse the removal of nascent polypeptides from stalled ribosomes.

heading: Investigating non-Joulian magnetostriction
Lens regeneration in children
authors: Demetrios G. VavvasThaddeus P. DryjaScott R. Lambert

heading: Liu et al. reply
Improving outcomes in congenital cataract
authors: Ameenat Lola SoleboChristopher J. HammondJugnoo S. Rahi

heading: Climatic control of Mississippi River flood hazard amplified by river engineering
authors: Samuel E. MunozLiviu GiosanJeffrey P. Donnelly
description: A suite of river discharge, tree-ring, sedimentary and climate data shows that the Mississippi’s flood magnitude has risen by about twenty per cent over the past half-century, largely owing to engineering works.

heading: Molecular nucleation mechanisms and control strategies for crystal polymorph selection
authors: Alexander E. S. Van DriesscheNani Van GervenMike Sleutel
description: Cryo-transmission electron microscopy reveals the initiation of glucose isomerase crystals and their growth into different crystalline or gel polymorphs, and shows that mutating specific amino acids controls which polymorph grows.

heading: A density cusp of quiescent X-ray binaries in the central parsec of the Galaxy
authors: Charles J. HaileyKaya MoriBenjamin J. Hord
description: Observations of 12 X-ray binaries that contain black holes within the central parsec of the Galaxy suggest the existence of hundreds more, and even more isolated black holes.

heading: Distributed hepatocytes expressing telomerase repopulate the liver in homeostasis and injury
authors: Shengda LinElisabete M. NascimentoSteven E. Artandi
description: A population of hepatocytes expressing high levels of telomerase are distributed throughout the liver and regenerate the liver during homeostasis and after injury.

heading:
Cryo-EM structure of the
            Blastochloris viridis LH1–RC complex at 2.9 Å
authors: Pu QianC. Alistair SiebertC. Neil Hunter
description: A cryo-electron microscopy structure of the light-harvesting–reaction centre (LH1–RC) complex of the photosynthetic bacterium Blastochloris viridis suggests factors that underlie the large redshift in the absorption spectrum of bacteriochlorophyll in the complex and that promote quinone–quinol translocation across the LH1 ring.

heading: Structure of photosynthetic LH1–RC supercomplex at 1.9 Å resolution
description: The structure of the Thermochromatium tepidum calcium-ion-bound light-harvesting–reaction centre (LH1–RC) supercomplex, which performs the primary reactions of photosynthesis in purple photosynthetic bacteria, is resolved to the atomic level.

heading: Characterization of the 1S–2S transition in antihydrogen
authors: M. AhmadiB. X. R. AlvesJ. S. Wurtele
description: The shape of the spectral line and the resonance frequency of the 1S–2S transition in antihydrogen agree very well with those of hydrogen.

heading: Accelerated increase in plant species richness on mountain summits is linked to warming
description: Analysis of changes in plant species richness on mountain summits over the past 145 years suggests that increased climatic warming has led to an acceleration in species richness increase.

heading: The evolutionary history of vertebrate RNA viruses
description: Around 200 new vertebrate-specific viruses are discovered, and every vertebrate-specific viral family known to infect mammals and birds is also present in amphibians, reptiles or fish, suggesting that evolution of vertebrate viruses mirrors that of vertebrate hosts.

heading: Crystal structures of the gastric proton pump
description: Crystal structures of the gastric proton pump in complex with two inhibitory drugs reveal the mechanism that generates the steep acidic gradient across the membranes of parietal cells.

heading: Fatal swine acute diarrhoea syndrome caused by an HKU2-related coronavirus of bat origin
description: Analysis of viral samples from deceased piglets shows that a bat coronavirus was responsible for an outbreak of fatal disease in China and highlights the importance of the identification of coronavirus diversity and distribution in bats in order to mitigate future outbreaks of disease.

heading: A small peptide modulates stomatal control via abscisic acid in long-distance signalling
description: In an Arabidopsis model, the CLE25 peptide acts as a root-to-shoot signalling molecule that modulates abscisic acid expression to close stomata and enhance resistance to dehydration.

heading: Advanced maturation of human cardiac tissue grown from pluripotent stem cells
description: A tissue culture system that provides an increasing intensity of electromechanical stimulation over time enables an in vitro model of cardiac tissue derived from human induced pluripotent stem cells to develop many of the characteristics of adult cardiac tissue.

heading: Metabolic enzyme PFKFB4 activates transcriptional coactivator SRC-3 to drive breast cancer
description: The glycolytic enzyme PFKFB4 directly phosphorylates and regulates binding of the coactivator SRC-3 to ATF4 and thereby increases the transcriptional activity of this complex, leading to increased expression of metabolic genes, and enhancing tumour growth and metastasis.

heading: Is plasticity caused by single genes?
Ghalambor et al. reply
authors: Cameron K. GhalamborKim L. HokeKimberly A. Hughes

heading: Contesting the evidence for non-adaptive plasticity
Planning chemical syntheses with deep neural networks and symbolic AI
authors: Marwin H. S. SeglerMike PreussMark P. Waller
description: Deep neural networks and Monte Carlo tree search can plan chemical syntheses by training models on a huge database of published reactions; their predicted synthetic routes cannot be distinguished from those a human chemist would design.

heading: A galaxy lacking dark matter
description: Galaxies normally have far more dark matter than normal matter, but the dynamics of objects within the ultra-diffuse galaxy NGC1052–DF2 suggest that it has a very little dark matter component.

heading: Itaconate is an anti-inflammatory metabolite that activates Nrf2 via alkylation of KEAP1
authors: Evanna L. MillsDylan G. RyanLuke A. O’Neill
description: WebTreatment of lipopolysaccharide-activated macrophages with the cell-permeable itaconate derivative 4-octyl itaconate activates the anti-inflammatory transcription factor Nrf2 by alkylating key cysteine residues on the KEAP1 protein.

heading: A new class of synthetic retinoid antibiotics effective against bacterial persisters
description: Synthetic retinoid compounds can kill both growing and persister MRSA cells by disrupting the membrane lipid bilayer, and are effective in a mouse model of chronic MRSA infection.

heading: The logic of single-cell projections from visual cortex
authors: Yunyun HanJustus M. KebschullThomas D. Mrsic-Flogel
description: Tracing of projection neuron axons from the primary visual cortex to their targets shows that these neurons often project to multiple cortical areas of the mouse brain.

heading: Whole-organism clone tracing using single-cell sequencing
description: A single-cell sequencing method is developed that uses transcriptomics and CRISPR–Cas9 technology to investigate clonal relationships in cells present in different zebrafish tissues.

heading: RETRACTED ARTICLE: Quantized Majorana conductance
description: In a step towards topological quantum computation, a quantized Majorana conductance has been demonstrated for a semiconducting nanowire coupled to a superconductor.

heading: Structure of the peptidoglycan polymerase RodA resolved by evolutionary coupling analysis
description: Evolutionary coupling-enabled molecular replacement determination of the structure of Thermus thermophilus RodA reveals a highly conserved cavity in its transmembrane domain, and mutagenesis experiments in Bacillus subtilis and Escherichia coli show that perturbation of this cavity abolishes RodA function.

heading: Architecture of the human GATOR1 and GATOR1–Rag GTPases complexes
authors: Kuang ShenRick K. HuangDavid M. Sabatini
description: Cryo-electron microscopy and biochemical analyses of the GATOR1 protein complex reveal that two binding modes underpin its ability to regulate Rag GTPases as a GTPase-activating protein for RAGA.

heading: Room-temperature nine-µm-wavelength photodetectors and GHz-frequency heterodyne receivers
description: Quantum-well photodetectors fabricated from photonic metamaterials show enhanced room-temperature sensitivity to long-wavelength infrared radiation and produce gigahertz-frequency heterodyne signals when pumped with quantum cascade lasers.

heading: van Berlo et al. reply
authors: Jop H. van BerloOnur KanisicakJeffery D. Molkentin

heading: A lithium–oxygen battery with a long cycle life in an air-like atmosphere
description: A lithium–oxygen battery, comprising a lithium carbonate-based protected anode, a molybdenum disulfide cathode and an ionic liquid/dimethyl sulfoxide electrolyte, operates in a simulated air atmosphere with a long cycle life of up to 700 cycles.

heading: Isotopic evolution of the protoplanetary disk and the building blocks of Earth and the Moon
description: The mass-independent calcium isotope composition of inner-Solar-System bodies is correlated with their masses and accretion ages, indicating a rapid growth for the precursors of Earth and the Moon during the protoplanetary disk’s lifetime.

heading: Image reconstruction by domain-transform manifold learning
authors: Bo ZhuJeremiah Z. LiuMatthew S. Rosen
description: Image reconstruction is reformulated using a data-driven, supervised machine learning framework that allows a mapping between sensor and image domains to emerge from even noisy and undersampled data, improving accuracy and reducing image artefacts.

heading: Kitcre knock-in mice fail to fate-map cardiac stem cells
Maximizing and stabilizing luminescence from halide perovskites with potassium passivation
description: Modifying the surfaces and grain boundaries of perovskites with passivating potassium halide layers can mitigate non-radiative losses and photoinduced ion migration, increasing luminescence yields and improving charge transport and interfaces with device electrodes.

heading: Continuous-wave room-temperature diamond maser
authors: Jonathan D. BreezeEnrico SalvadoriChristopher W. M. Kay
description: A continuous-wave room-temperature maser is demonstrated by combining a cavity with a high Purcell factor with the narrow linewidth of nitrogen–vacancy defect centres in diamond.

heading: Encoding of danger by parabrachial CGRP neurons
authors: Carlos A. CamposAnna J. BowenRichard D. Palmiter
description: Single-cell recordings show that CGRP-expressing neurons in the parabrachial nucleus in mice respond to both noxious stimuli and signals of feeding satiety.

heading: Optogenetic regulation of engineered cellular metabolism for microbial chemical production
authors: Evan M. ZhaoYanfei ZhangJosé L. Avalos
description: Finely tuned optogenetic control of engineered Saccharomyces cerevisiae enhances the biosynthesis of valuable products such as isobutanol in laboratory-scale fermenters.

heading: Structural insights into the voltage and phospholipid activation of the mammalian TPC1 channel
description: Structures of the voltage-gated and phosphatidylinositol 3,5-bisphosphate-activated mouse two-pore channel TPC1 in apo and ligand-bound states provide insights into the selectivity and gating mechanisms of mammalian two-pore channels.

heading: Moving magnetoencephalography towards real-world applications with a wearable system
description: A new magnetoencephalography system allows high-spatiotemporal-resolution imaging of human brain function in moving subjects.

heading: Reconstructing the genetic history of late Neanderthals
description: Genetic similarity among late Neanderthals is predicted well by their geographical location, and although some of these Neanderthals were contemporaneous with early modern humans, their genomes show no evidence of recent gene flow from modern humans.

heading: Insulin resistance in cavefish as an adaptation to a nutrient-limited environment
authors: Misty R. RiddleAriel C. AspirasNicolas Rohner
description: Cavefish populations of the Mexican tetra, Astyanax mexicanus, carry a mutation in the insulin receptor gene that renders them insulin- and starvation-resistant relative to surface populations of the same species.

heading: The protein histidine phosphatase LHPP is a tumour suppressor
authors: Sravanth K. HindupurMarco ColombiMichael N. Hall
description: Decreased expression of histidine phosphatase LHPP, a novel tumour suppressor, results in increased global histidine phosphorylation and hepatocellular carcinoma.

heading: Hepatocyte-secreted DPP4 in obesity promotes adipose inflammation and insulin resistance
description: Hepatocytes secrete DPP4, which promotes adipose tissue inflammation and insulin resistance in obese mice, suggesting a new specific target for treatment of metabolic disorders.

heading: De novo mutations in regulatory elements in neurodevelopmental disorders
authors: Patrick J. ShortJeremy F. McRaeMatthew E. Hurles
description: Analysis of rare de novo mutations in gene regulatory elements suggests that 1–3% of patients with neurodevelopmental disorders carry such mutations in elements that are active in the fetal brain.

heading: Shifts in tree functional composition amplify the response of forest biomass to climate
description: Forest inventory data from the 1980s and 2000s show the response of eastern USA forests to climate variability; direct effects of climate on forest biomass are amplified by changes in tree species composition.

heading: Extensive impact of non-antibiotic drugs on human gut bacteria
description: A screen of more than 1,000 drugs shows that about a quarter of the non-antibiotic drugs inhibit the growth of at least one commensal bacterial strain in vitro.

heading: Timing of oceans on Mars from shoreline deformation
authors: Robert I. CitronMichael MangaDouglas J. Hemingway
description: Ancient shorelines on Mars must have formed before and during the emplacement of the Tharsis volcanic province, instead of afterwards as previously assumed, suggesting that oceans on Mars formed early.

heading: Massive Dirac fermions in a ferromagnetic kagome metal
description: Fe3Sn2 hosts massive Dirac fermions, owing to the underlying symmetry properties of the bilayer kagome lattice in the ferromagnetic state and the atomic spin–orbit coupling.

heading: Redox-influenced seismic properties of upper-mantle olivine
authors: C. J. Cline IIU. H. FaulI. Jackson
description: Redox conditions and associated defect chemistry rather than water content, as previously thought, strongly influence the seismic properties of olivine, the main constituent mineral of Earth’s upper mantle.

heading: A quantized microwave quadrupole insulator with topologically protected corner states
authors: Christopher W. PetersonWladimir A. BenalcazarGaurav Bahl
description: A quantized quadrupole topological insulator composed of capacitively coupled microwave resonators has corner states that are protected by bulk topology and exhibit exceptional robustness against edge deformation.

heading: High-resolution magnetic resonance spectroscopy using a solid-state spin sensor
authors: David R. GlennDominik B. BucherRonald L. Walsworth
description: High-resolution nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy at the scale of single cells is achieved by combining a magnetometer consisting of an ensemble of nitrogen–vacancy centres with a narrowband synchronized readout protocol.

heading: Carbon dioxide addition to coral reef waters suppresses net community calcification
description: In situ carbon dioxide enrichment experiments show that ocean acidification poses a threat to coral reefs by reducing the saturation state of aragonite and the concentration of carbonate ions and that this impairs community calcification.

heading: Diffusible repression of cytokinin signalling produces endodermal symmetry and passage cells
description: In an Arabidopsis model, repression of cytokinin in the root meristem produces a distinct population of xylem-pole endodermal cells, which resist suberization to become passage cells that enable transport across the otherwise-impermeable endodermis.

heading: A single-cell RNA-seq survey of the developmental landscape of the human prefrontal cortex
description: WebAnalysis of gene expression at single-cell resolution in the developing prefrontal cortex of the human embryo reveals a diversity of cell types, elucidates cell lineages and identifies signalling pathways that regulate development.

heading: A TRP channel trio mediates acute noxious heat sensing
description: Three transient receptor potential channels (TRPA1, TRPV1 and TRPM3) mediate sensitivity to acute noxious heat in mice in a redundant system; mice lacking all three show severe deficits in heat sensing, whereas double-knockout mice do not.

heading: Carbonate-sensitive phytotransferrin controls high-affinity iron uptake in diatoms
authors: Jeffrey B. McQuaidAdam B. KustkaAndrew E. Allen
description: Phytotransferrin, a functional analogue of transferrin, has an obligate requirement for carbonate to bind iron, which suggests that acidification-driven declines in the concentration of seawater carbonate ions may negatively affect diatom iron acquisition.

heading: DNA methylation-based classification of central nervous system tumours
authors: David CapperDavid T. W. JonesStefan M. Pfister
description: An online approach for the DNA methylation-based classification of central nervous system tumours across all entities and age groups has been developed to help to improve current diagnostic standards.

heading: Placentation defects are highly prevalent in embryonic lethal mouse mutants
description: Analysis of embryonic lethal and sub-viable mouse knockout lines reveals that ablation of many genes affects placental development, and that the occurrence of placental defects is co-associated with abnormal brain, heart and vascular system development.

heading: The cis-regulatory dynamics of embryonic development at single-cell resolution
authors: Darren A. CusanovichJames P. ReddingtonEileen E. M. Furlong
description: An improved assay for chromatin accessibility at single-cell resolution in Drosophila melanogaster embryos enables identification of developmental-stage- and cell-lineage-specific patterns of chromatin-level transcriptional regulation.

heading: Integrative structure and functional anatomy of a nuclear pore complex
authors: Seung Joong KimJavier Fernandez-MartinezMichael P. Rout
description: The structure of the yeast nuclear pore complex, determined at sub-nanometre precision using an integrative approach that combines a wide range of data, reveals details of its architecture, transport mechanism and evolutionary origins.

heading: Dysregulation of expression correlates with rare-allele burden and fitness loss in maize
authors: Karl A. G. KremlingShu-Yun ChenEdward S. Buckler
description: A multi-tissue gene expression resource representative of the genotypic and phenotypic diversity of modern inbred maize reveals the effect of rare alleles and evolutionary history on the regulation of gene expression.

heading: A single population of red globular clusters around the massive compact galaxy NGC 1277
description: The massive relic galaxy NGC 1277 has few blue globular clusters, indicating that it has undergone little mass accretion and is a candidate ‘red nugget’ in the nearby Universe.

heading: Humans thrived in South Africa through the Toba eruption about 74,000 years ago
authors: Eugene I. SmithZenobia JacobsCurtis W. Marean
description: Youngest Toba Tuff glass shards found together with evidence of human occupation at two archaeological sites from the southern coast of South Africa indicate that early modern humans thrived in this region despite the eruption of the Toba supervolcano about 74,000 years ago.

heading: A suppression of differential rotation in Jupiter’s deep interior
description: The determination of Jupiter’s even gravitational moments by the Juno spacecraft reveals that more than three thousand kilometres below the cloud tops, differential rotation is suppressed and the gas giant’s interior rotates as a solid body.

heading: Jupiter’s atmospheric jet streams extend thousands of kilometres deep
description: The determination of Jupiter’s odd gravitational harmonics by the Juno spacecraft reveals that the observed jet streams extend to about three thousand kilometres below the cloud tops.

heading: CaSiO3 perovskite in diamond indicates the recycling of oceanic crust into the lower mantle
description: The composition of natural calcium silicate perovskite, the fourth most abundant mineral in the Earth, found within a diamond indicates an origin from oceanic crust subducted deeper than 700 kilometres into the Earth’s mantle.

heading: GaN/NbN epitaxial semiconductor/superconductor heterostructures
description: Group III/nitride semiconductors have been grown epitaxially on the superconductor niobium nitride, allowing the superconductor’s macroscopic quantum effects to be combined with the semiconductors’ electronic, photonic and piezoelectric properties.

heading: Monolayer atomic crystal molecular superlattices
description: Superlattices consisting of alternating monolayer atomic crystals and molecular layers allow access to stable phosphorene monolayers with competitive transistor performance and to bulk monolayer materials with tunable optoelectronic properties.

heading: Clusters of cyclones encircling Jupiter’s poles
description: Visible and infrared images obtained from above each pole of Jupiter by the Juno spacecraft reveal polygonal patterns of large cyclones; it is unknown how these cyclones evolved, or how they persist without merging.

heading: Measurement of Jupiter’s asymmetric gravity field
authors: L. IessW. M. FolknerS. J. Bolton
description: Precise Doppler tracking of the Juno spacecraft in its polar orbit around Jupiter is used to determine the planet’s gravity harmonics, showing north–south asymmetry caused by atmospheric and interior flows.

heading: Social norm complexity and past reputations in the evolution of cooperation
authors: Fernando P. SantosFrancisco C. SantosJorge M. Pacheco
description: In a binary decision game in which players strategically help certain individuals but not others, simple moral principles maximize cooperation, even when including the historical reputations of players.

heading: Altruism in a volatile world
description: A derivation of Hamilton’s rule that considers explicit environmental stochasticity can predict when organisms should pay a cost to influence the variance in the reproductive success of their relatives, formalizing the link between bet-hedging and altruism.

heading: Pervasive phosphorus limitation of tree species but not communities in tropical forests
description: In lowland tropical forests in Panama, widespread species-level phosphorus limitation of tree growth is not reflected in community-wide growth or biomass owing to the presence of a few species tolerant of low phosphorus availability.

heading: Gating mechanisms of acid-sensing ion channels
description: X-ray and cryo-electron microscopy structures of the acid-sensing ion channel ASIC1a reveal the molecular mechanisms of channel gating and desensitization.

heading: Human hippocampal neurogenesis drops sharply in children to undetectable levels in adults
authors: Shawn F. SorrellsMercedes F. ParedesArturo Alvarez-Buylla
description: Recruitment of young neurons to the hippocampus decreases rapidly during the first years of life, and neurogenesis does not continue, or is extremely rare, in the adult human brain.

heading: Pursuing sustainable productivity with millions of smallholder farmers
description: Millions of Chinese smallholder farmers were persuaded to adopt enhanced management practices, which led to a greater yield, reduced nitrogen fertilizer use and improved environmental performance throughout China.

heading: Epigenetic reprogramming enables the transition from primordial germ cell to gonocyte
authors: Peter W. S. HillHarry G. LeitchPetra Hajkova
description: Gonadal germline epigenetic reprogramming involves an interplay between DNA methylation, the polycomb complex and Tet1 in both DNA methylation dependent and independent roles, to ensure the activation of a specific subset of genes critical for progression of gametogenesis.

heading: EWS–FLI1 increases transcription to cause R-loops and block BRCA1 repair in Ewing sarcoma
authors: Aparna GorthiJuly Carolina RomeroAlexander J. R. Bishop
description: The EWS–FLI1 fusion protein, expressed in Ewing sarcoma, increases global transcription, causes accumulation of R loops and replication stress, and impairs BRCA1-mediated repair.

heading: Confocal non-line-of-sight imaging based on the light-cone transform
description: A confocal scanning technique solves the reconstruction problem of non-line-of-sight imaging to give fast and high-quality reconstructions of hidden objects.

heading: Correlated insulator behaviour at half-filling in magic-angle graphene superlattices
description: When the two graphene sheets in a van der Waals heterostructure are twisted relative to each other by a specific amount, Mott-like insulating phases are observed at half-filling.

heading: Modular assembly of the nucleolar pre-60S ribosomal subunit
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of multiple states along the assembly pathway of the nucleolar pre-60S ribosomal subunit suggest that folding of the pre-ribosomal RNA and sequential binding of transient assembly factors are regulated by steric hindrance among these factors.

heading: Unconventional superconductivity in magic-angle graphene superlattices
description: A superlattice consisting of two graphene sheets twisted relative to each other by a specific amount exhibits superconductivity when doped electrostatically, with a relatively high critical temperature.

heading: Developmental diversification of cortical inhibitory interneurons
description: The embryonic emergence of interneuron subtypes in mice is revealed by integrated single-cell transcriptomic analysis along a developmental time course.

heading: Hadean silicate differentiation preserved by anomalous 142Nd/144Nd ratios in the Réunion hotspot source
authors: Bradley J. PetersRichard W. CarlsonMary F. Horan
description: Neodymium-142 isotope data from young Réunion Island volcanic rocks reflect the effects of geological processes that occurred more than four billion years ago, showing that the deep mantle may preserve geochemical signatures of the primordial Earth.

heading: Mapping child growth failure in Africa between 2000 and 2015
authors: Aaron Osgood-ZimmermanAnoushka I. MillearSimon I. Hay
description: Geospatial estimates of child growth failure in Africa provide a baseline for measuring progress and a precision public health platform to target interventions to those populations with the greatest need.

heading: Fast quantum logic gates with trapped-ion qubits
authors: V. M. SchäferC. J. BallanceD. M. Lucas
description: Fast and high-fidelity two-qubit logic gates are demonstrated by using amplitude-shaped laser pulses to ensure that the gate operation is insensitive to the optical phase of the pulses.

heading: An absorption profile centred at 78 megahertz in the sky-averaged spectrum
authors: Judd D. BowmanAlan E. E. RogersNivedita Mahesh
description: The 21-cm absorption profile is detected in the sky-averaged radio spectrum, but is much stronger than predicted, suggesting that the primordial gas might have been cooler than predicted.

heading: Mapping local variation in educational attainment across Africa
description: Local-level analyses show that, despite marked progress in educational attainment from 2000 to 2015 across Africa, substantial differences persist between locations and sexes that have widened in many countries.

heading: Possible interaction between baryons and dark-matter particles revealed by the first stars
description: The large absorption of the 21-centimetre transition of hydrogen around redshift 20 is explained by radiation from the first stars, combined with excess cooling of the cosmic gas caused by baryon–dark matter scattering.

heading: Pan-cancer genome and transcriptome analyses of 1,699 paediatric leukaemias and solid tumours
description: Analysis of the genomes, exomes and transcriptomes of 1,699 childhood cancers identifies 142 driver genes.

heading: Recognition of DHN-melanin by a C-type lectin receptor is required for immunity to Aspergillus
authors: Mark H. T. StappersAlexandra E. ClarkGordon D. Brown
description: The C-type lectin receptor MelLec recognizes DHN-melanin in conidial spores of Aspergillus fumigatus and other DHN-melanized fungi, revealing an important role for this receptor in antifungal immunity in both mice and humans.

heading: Structure of the insulin receptor–insulin complex by single-particle cryo-EM analysis
description: Cryo-electron microscopy structures of insulin in a complex with the insulin receptor define the S2 binding site on the receptor and suggest a mechanism for downstream propagation of insulin signalling.

heading: Evolved Cas9 variants with broad PAM compatibility and high DNA specificity
authors: Johnny H. HuShannon M. MillerDavid R. Liu
description: Phage-assisted continuous evolution of Cas9 variants with broad PAM compatibility and high DNA specificity that can be used for transcriptional activation, gene disruption and base editing.

heading: The SMAD2/3 interactome reveals that TGFβ controls m6A mRNA methylation in pluripotency
description: The SMAD2 and SMAD3 protein interactome links TGFβ signalling to diverse effectors including m6A methyltransferase, which has a role in regulating differentiation of human pluripotent stem cells.

heading: Regeneration of the lung alveolus by an evolutionarily conserved epithelial progenitor
authors: William J. ZachariasDavid B. FrankEdward E. Morrisey
description: An evolutionarily conserved alveolar epithelial progenitor lineage that derives from alveolar type 2 cells is responsive to Wnt signalling and acts as a major facultative progenitor in regenerating the distal lung.

heading: Hierarchical roles of mitochondrial Papi and Zucchini in Bombyx germline piRNA biogenesis
authors: Kazumichi M. NishidaKazuhiro SakakibaraMikiko C. Siomi
description: The biogenesis of piRNAs in the silkworm Bombyx is simpler than in Drosophila, with the exonucleases Trim and Nbr having no major role, and the endonuclease Zuc acting at the 3′ rather than the 5′ end.

heading: Environment dominates over host genetics in shaping human gut microbiota
description: Statistical analyses of a metagenomics-sequenced human cohort identify a relatively minor role for genetics in determining microbiome composition and show that several human phenotypes are as strongly associated with the gut microbiome as with host genetics.

heading: The landscape of genomic alterations across childhood cancers
authors: Susanne N. GröbnerBarbara C. WorstStefan M. Pfister
description: Analyses of genomes from 914 children, adolescents, and young adults provide a comprehensive resource of genomic alterations across a spectrum of common childhood cancers.

heading: Hierarchical neural architecture underlying thirst regulation
description: Thirst is regulated by hierarchical neural circuits in the lamina terminalis, and these integrate the instinctive need for water with consequent drinking behaviour to maintain internal water homeostasis.

heading: The mechanism of eukaryotic CMG helicase activation
authors: Max E. DouglasFerdos Abid AliJohn F. X. Diffley
description: In vitro experiments, using purified proteins and an assay that detects DNA unwinding, reveal the mechanism of activation of eukaryotic DNA replication.

heading: Two chemically similar stellar overdensities on opposite sides of the plane of the Galactic disk
description: Fourteen stars from stellar overdensities above and below the Galactic disk have the same elemental abundances as disk stars, suggesting that these stars originated in the disk, perhaps being removed during interaction with passing dwarf galaxies.

heading: Predicting soil carbon loss with warming
authors: Natasja van GestelZheng ShiBruce A. Hungate

heading: Crowther et al. reply
authors: T. W. CrowtherM. B. MachmullerM. A. Bradford

heading: Palladium-catalysed electrophilic aromatic C–H fluorination
description: An approach for the direct electrophilic C–H fluorination of arenes is reported, using a palladium catalyst and mild fluorinating reagents.

heading: A surge of light at the birth of a supernova
description: The discovery of a newly born type IIb supernova reveals a rapid brightening at optical wavelengths that corresponds to the shock-breakout phase of the explosion.

heading: Multi-terminal memtransistors from polycrystalline monolayer molybdenum disulfide
authors: Vinod K. SangwanHong-Sub LeeMark C. Hersam
description: Polycrystalline monolayer molybdenum disulfide is used to fabricate a multi-terminal device combining a memristor and a transistor, which can mimic biological neurons with multiple synapses for neuromorphic computing applications.

heading: Adolescence and the next generation
authors: George C. PattonCraig A. OlssonSusan M. Sawyer
description: Investing in adolescents as the parents of the next generation is important for the wellbeing of current and future generations.

heading: Sterically controlled mechanochemistry under hydrostatic pressure
description: ‘Molecular anvil’ molecules consisting of a compressible mechanophore and incompressible ligands react under hydrostatic pressure to produce elemental metal via an unexplored mechanism.

heading: Extreme disorder in an ultrahigh-affinity protein complex
description: A high-affinity complex of histone H1 and prothymosin-α reveals an unexpected interaction mechanism, where the large opposite net charge enables the two proteins to remain highly disordered even in the complex.

heading: Intragenic origins due to short G1 phases underlie oncogene-induced DNA replication stress
description: Oncogene activation results in firing of ectopic origins of replication within transcribed genes, resulting in replication stress and genome instability.

heading: Population snapshots predict early haematopoietic and erythroid hierarchies
authors: Betsabeh Khoramian TusiSamuel L. WolockMerav Socolovsky
description: Single-cell transcriptomics, fate assays and a computational theory enable prediction of cell fates during haematopoiesis, discovery of regulators of erythropoiesis and reveal coupling between the erythroid, basophil and mast cell fates.

heading: The genomic history of southeastern Europe
description: Genome-wide ancient DNA data from 225 individuals who lived in southeastern Europe between 12000 and 500 bc reveals that the region acted as a genetic crossroads before and after the arrival of farming.

heading: The cryo-electron microscopy structure of huntingtin
description: The structure of huntingtin in complex with an interactor is determined to an overall resolution of 4 Å, paving the way for improved understanding of the cellular functions of this protein.

heading: Global elevational diversity and diversification of birds
description: A global study of all bird species in mountainous areas shows that richness decreases predictably with elevation, whereas diversification rates increase.

heading: Electromechanical vortex filaments during cardiac fibrillation
description: Using optical mapping and 3D ultrasound, the dynamics and interactions between electrical and mechanical phase singularities were analysed by simultaneously measuring the membrane potential, intracellular calcium concentration and mechanical contractions of the heart during normal rhythm and fibrillation.

heading: Probing the interatomic potential of solids with strong-field nonlinear phononics
description: Ultrashort mid-infrared laser pulses can drive atoms far from their equilibrium positions in LiNbO3, exciting high phonon harmonics and providing a way to map the interatomic potential.

heading: Phase-plate cryo-EM structure of a biased agonist-bound human GLP-1 receptor–Gs complex
description: The structure of the glucagon-like peptide 1 receptor (GLP-1R) with its biased agonist exendin-P5 sheds light on both receptor activation and the mechanism of biased agonism.

heading: Circadian clock neurons constantly monitor environmental temperature to set sleep timing
description: The DN1p clock neurons of Drosophila melanogaster continuously report temperature changes into the circadian neural network, to control the timing of sleep and activity.

heading: The Beaker phenomenon and the genomic transformation of northwest Europe
description: Genome-wide data from 400 individuals indicate that the initial spread of the Beaker archaeological complex between Iberia and central Europe was propelled by cultural diffusion, but that its spread into Britain involved a large-scale migration that permanently replaced about ninety per cent of the ancestry in the previously resident population.

heading: Evolutionary history resolves global organization of root functional traits
description: Analyses of a global dataset of plant root traits identify an ancestral conservative strategy based on thick roots and mycorrhizal symbiosis, and an evolutionarily more-recent opportunistic strategy of thin roots that efficiently use photosynthetic carbon for soil exploration.

heading: Skin electronics from scalable fabrication of an intrinsically stretchable transistor array
description: A scalable process is described for fabricating skin-like electronic circuitry that can be bent and stretched while retaining desirable electronic functionality.

heading: Pulsating aurora from electron scattering by chorus waves
description: High-angular-resolution measurements allow the direct observation of the scattering of energetic electrons by chorus waves in the magnetosphere, which causes quasiperiodic electron precipitation that gives rise to pulsating aurorae.

heading: Freezing on a sphere
authors: Rodrigo E. GuerraColm P. KelleherPaul M. Chaikin
description: Freezing on a spherical surface is shown to proceed by the sequestration of defects into 12 icosahedrally coordinated ‘seas’ that enable the formation of a crystalline ‘continent’ with long-range orientational order.

heading: Ketamine blocks bursting in the lateral habenula to rapidly relieve depression
description: The rapid antidepressant activity of ketamine results from reversal of increased burst firing and synchronization in the lateral habenula in rat and mouse models of depression.

heading: A spin–orbital-entangled quantum liquid on a honeycomb lattice
description: A quantum-liquid state of spin–orbital-entangled magnetic moments is observed in the 5d-electron honeycomb iridate H3LiIr2O6, evidenced by the absence of magnetic ordering down to 0.05 kelvin.

heading: Astroglial Kir4.1 in the lateral habenula drives neuronal bursts in depression
description: Increased expression of the potassium channel Kir4.1 on astrocytes in the lateral habenula drives neuronal bursting in rodent models of depression.

heading: A programmable two-qubit quantum processor in silicon
authors: T. F. WatsonS. G. J. PhilipsL. M. K. Vandersypen
description: A two-qubit quantum processor in a silicon device is demonstrated, which can perform the Deutsch–Josza algorithm and the Grover search algorithm.

heading: A molecular atlas of cell types and zonation in the brain vasculature
description: Single-cell transcriptomic analysis of the murine blood–brain barrier provides molecular definitions of the main vascular cell types, classifies perivascular cell types and sheds light on the organization of the arteriovenous axis.

heading: Transcriptional regulation by NR5A2 links differentiation and inflammation in the pancreas
description: In mouse pancreas cells with only one copy of the Nr5a2 gene, the orphan nuclear receptor NR5A2 undergoes a marked transcriptional shift from differentiation-specific to inflammatory genes, which results in an epithelial-cell-autonomous basal pre-inflammatory state.

heading: Peptidoglycan synthesis drives an FtsZ-treadmilling-independent step of cytokinesis
authors: João M. MonteiroAna R. PereiraMariana G. Pinho
description: Single-cell fluorescence microscopy reveals that cytokinesis occurs in two stages in Staphylococcus aureus, an initial slow phase followed by a faster phase after MurJ protein recruitment to the midcell triggers peptidoglycan synthesis.

heading: Global patterns of tropical forest fragmentation
description: Satellite data and modelling reveal that tropical forest fragments have similar size distributions across continents, and that forest fragmentation is close to a critical point, beyond which fragment numbers will strongly increase.

heading: A coherent spin–photon interface in silicon
description: A single spin in silicon is strongly coupled to a microwave-frequency photon and coherent single-spin dynamics are observed using circuit quantum electrodynamics.

heading: TGFβ drives immune evasion in genetically reconstituted colon cancer metastasis
authors: Daniele V. F. TaurielloSergio Palomo-PonceEduard Batlle
description: A combination of TGFβ inhibition and checkpoint-inhibition therapy provokes a potent cytotoxic response against metastatic tumours derived from colorectal cancers in mice.

heading: Tissue stiffening coordinates morphogenesis by triggering collective cell migration in vivo
description: Stiffening of the mesoderm owing to an accumulation of cells triggers collective migration of neural crest cells during morphogenesis.

heading: TGFβ attenuates tumour response to PD-L1 blockade by contributing to exclusion of T cells
description: In humans, TGFβ signalling is associated with lack of response to immunotherapy in immune-excluded tumours; in mouse models of this immune phenotype, robust tumour infiltration by T cells and tumour regression are observed only when checkpoint inhibition is combined with inhibition of TGFβ signalling.

heading: Meridional overturning circulation conveys fast acidification to the deep Atlantic Ocean
authors: Fiz F. PerezMarcos FontelaXose A. Padin
description: There has been about a forty per cent reduction in the transport of carbonate ions to the deep North Atlantic Ocean since preindustrial times, severely endangering cold-water corals.

heading: MEK drives BRAF activation through allosteric control of KSR proteins
description: KSR–MEK complexes allosterically activate BRAF through the action of N-terminal regulatory region and kinase domain contacts, thus challenging the accepted role of KSR as a scaffold for MEK recruitment to RAF.

heading: Contesting early archaeology in California
authors: Joseph V. FerraroKatie M. BinettiSteven L. Forman

heading: Holen et al. reply
authors: Steven R. HolenThomas A. DeméréKathleen A. Holen

heading: Limited emission reductions from fuel subsidy removal except in energy-exporting regions
description: Contrary to the hopes of policymakers, fossil fuel subsidy removal would have only a small impact on global energy demand and carbon dioxide emissions and would not increase renewable energy use by 2030.

heading: Isomer depletion as experimental evidence of nuclear excitation by electron capture
authors: C. J. ChiaraJ. J. CarrollS. A. Karamian
description: Experimental evidence is presented for isomer depletion through nuclear excitation by electron capture in molybdenum-93 nuclei.

heading: Cryo-EM shows how dynactin recruits two dyneins for faster movement
authors: Linas UrnaviciusClinton K. LauAndrew P. Carter
description: Cryo-electron microscopy and single-molecule studies reveal that the adaptors BICDR1 and HOOK3 recruit two dynein molecules to dynactin and thereby increase the force and speed of the dynein–dynactin microtubule motor.

heading: Experimental observation of Bethe strings
description: Many-body two- and three-string states are realized experimentally in the antiferromagnetic Heisenberg–Ising chain SrCo2V2O8 in strong longitudinal magnetic fields.

heading: Magnetic cage and rope as the key for solar eruptions
description: Measurements and modelling of a large confined eruption on the Sun show that its evolution is controlled by a multilayer magnetic cage containing a twisted flux rope, which can sometimes be ejective.

heading: Processing bulk natural wood into a high-performance structural material
description: A process is described for the transformation of bulk wood into a low-cost, strong, tough, lightweight structural material, by the partial removal of lignin and hemicellulose followed by hot-pressing to densify the natural wood.

heading: Cognitive performance is linked to group size and affects fitness in Australian magpies
authors: Benjamin J. AshtonAmanda R. RidleyAlex Thornton
description: Wild Australian magpies (Cracticus tibicen dorsalis) living in large groups show increased cognitive performance, which is associated with increased reproductive success.

heading: Structural basis for DNMT3A-mediated de novo DNA methylation
description: A crystal structure of DNMT3A and its regulatory partner DNMT3L bound to DNA reveals the mechanistic basis for DNMT3A-mediated DNA methylation and establishes its aetiological link to human disease.

heading: c-MAF-dependent regulatory T cells mediate immunological tolerance to a gut pathobiont
description: The transcription factor c-MAF is required for the generation of Helicobacter-specific regulatory T cells that selectively restrain pro-inflammatory TH17 cells; the absence of c-MAF in mouse regulatory T cells results in pathobiont-dependent inflammatory bowel disease.

heading: Fluctuating interaction network and time-varying stability of a natural fish community
description: A method for modelling time-varying dynamic stability in a natural marine fish community finds that seasonal patterns in community stability are driven by species diversity and interspecific interactions.

heading: Posterior parietal cortex represents sensory history and mediates its effects on behaviour
authors: Athena AkramiCharles D. KopecCarlos D. Brody
description: A working memory task in rats demonstrates that the posterior parietal cortex is a critical locus for the representation and use of prior stimulus information.

heading: Genomics of the origin and evolution of Citrus
description: The origin, evolution and domestication of Citrus and the genealogy of the most important wild and cultivated citrus varieties.

heading: Mechanical regulation of stem-cell differentiation by the stretch-activated Piezo channel
description: Stem cells of the Drosophila midgut sense mechanical signals in vivo through the stretch-activated ion channel Piezo, which is expressed on previously unidentified enteroendocrine precursor cells.

heading: Teneurin-3 controls topographic circuit assembly in the hippocampus
authors: Dominic S. BernsLaura A. DeNardoLiqun Luo
description: The transmembrane protein teneurin-3 is expressed in multiple topographically interconnected areas of the hippocampal region and acts in both projection and target neurons to control wiring specificity from CA1 to the subiculum.

heading: Asparagine bioavailability governs metastasis in a model of breast cancer
authors: Simon R. V. KnottElvin WagenblastGregory J. Hannon
description: In a mouse model of breast cancer, asparagine bioavailability strongly influences metastasis and this is correlated with the production of proteins that regulate the epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition, which provides at least one potential mechanism for how a single amino acid could regulate metastatic progression.

heading: Global patterns of declining temperature variability from the Last Glacial Maximum to the Holocene
description: Temperature variability decreased globally by a factor of four between the Last Glacial Maximum and the Holocene epoch, as a result of changes in the meridional temperature gradient.

heading: Southern Hemisphere climate variability forced by Northern Hemisphere ice-sheet topography
authors: T. R. JonesW. H. G. RobertsJ. W. C. White
description: An Antarctic ice core reveals that, during the last ice age, the topography of Northern Hemisphere ice sheets shifted tropical Pacific convection eastward, increasing climate variability in the high southern latitudes.

heading: Early Middle Palaeolithic culture in India around 385–172 ka reframes Out of Africa models
description: Lithic assemblages from the archaeological site of Attirampakkam, India, document processes of transition from Acheulian to Middle Palaeolithic cultures and substantial behavioural changes around 385,000 years ago and thereafter.

heading: Generating carbyne equivalents with photoredox catalysis
authors: Zhaofeng WangAna G. HerraizMarcos G. Suero
description: A photocatalytic strategy is described that generates diazomethyl radicals as direct equivalents of carbynes, which are often too reactive to use, enabling the functionalization of a range of medically useful compounds.

heading: Reconciling divergent trends and millennial variations in Holocene temperatures
description: Analysis of pollen records from North America and Europe reveals a warming trend over the Holocene, consistent with climate-model simulations.

heading: A clumpy and anisotropic galaxy halo at redshift 1 from gravitational-arc tomography
description: The halo of gas around a galaxy at redshift 1 is clumpy and anisotropic, with little variation in gas velocity, suggesting that it consists of entrained recycled material.

heading: HER kinase inhibition in patients with HER2- and HER3-mutant cancers
authors: David M. HymanSarina A. Piha-PaulDavid B. Solit
description: In a basket trial design, the efficacy of the pan-HER kinase inhibitor neratinib is tested in patients with 21 different tumour types, and responses are determined by mutation and tissue type, and are restricted to HER2-mutant cancers.

heading: Dynamics and number of trans-SNARE complexes determine nascent fusion pore properties
description: Analysis at high temporal and spatial resolution shows that the number and dynamics of SNARE proteins available during exocytosis determines the size and stability of fusion pores.

heading: Evolutionary history of the angiosperm flora of China
description: A dated phylogeny and spatial distribution data for Chinese angiosperms show that eastern China has tended to act as a refugium for older taxa whereas western China has acted as a centre for their evolutionary diversification.

heading: Dynamic basis for dG•dT misincorporation via tautomerization and ionization
authors: Isaac J. KimseyEric S. SzymanskiHashim M. Al-Hashimi
description: A kinetic model is proposed to predict the probability of dG•dT misincorporation across different polymerases, and provides mechanisms for sequence-dependent misincorporation.

heading: High performance plasma amyloid-β biomarkers for Alzheimer’s disease
description: Measurement of human plasma amyloid-β biomarkers using immunoprecipitation coupled with mass spectrometry reliably predicts individual brain amyloid-β status and has potential clinical utility.

heading: Dopamine neuron activity before action initiation gates and invigorates future movements
authors: Joaquim Alves da SilvaFatuel TecuapetlaRui M. Costa
description: The activity of dopamine neurons in the substantia nigra pars compacta before movement initiation affects the probability and vigour of future movements.

heading: Enhancer redundancy provides phenotypic robustness in mammalian development
description: Gene enhancer knockout phenotypes and analysis of enhancer activity patterns show that developmental genes are regulated by multiple redundant enhancers in mouse embryos.

heading: A photophoretic-trap volumetric display
description: Photophoretic optical trapping of cellulose particles and persistence of vision are used to produce real-space volumetric images that can be viewed from all angles, in geometries unachievable by holograms and light-field technologies.

heading: Early episodes of high-pressure core formation preserved in plume mantle
authors: Colin R. M. JacksonNeil R. BennettYingwei Fei
description: Xenon isotopic anomalies found in modern plume rocks are explained as the result of iodine-to-plutonium fractionations during early, high-pressure episodes of core formation.

heading: Enhancement and sign change of magnetic correlations in a driven quantum many-body system
description: By periodically modulating the position of degenerate fermions unidirectionally in a three-dimensional optical lattice, antiferromagnetic correlations in this many-body system can be reduced, enhanced or even switched to ferromagnetic correlations.

heading: A parsec-scale optical jet from a massive young star in the Large Magellanic Cloud
authors: Anna F. McLeodMegan ReiterChristopher J. Evans
description: Observations of a highly collimated, parsec-scale jet emitted from a massive young stellar object in the Large Magellanic Cloud indicate that jet launching and collimation are independent of stellar mass.

heading: Small-scale soft-bodied robot with multimodal locomotion
description: A tiny soft-bodied robot is described that can be magnetically actuated to swim, climb, roll, walk and jump, while carrying a load.

heading: Tet2 promotes pathogen infection-induced myelopoiesis through mRNA oxidation
description: A report of RNA 5-methylcytosine oxidation by mammalian Tet2, showing that Tet2 promotes infection-induced myelopoiesis in mice via a mechanism involving the repression of Socs3 mRNA, a previously unknown regulatory role of Tet2 at the epitranscriptomic level.

heading: The genome of Schmidtea mediterranea and the evolution of core cellular mechanisms
authors: Markus Alexander GrohmeSiegfried SchloissnigJochen Christian Rink
description: An improved genome assembly for Schmidtea mediterranea shows that the genome is highly polymorphic and repetitive, and lacks multiple genes encoding core components of cell biological mechanisms.

heading: Structure of the D2 dopamine receptor bound to the atypical antipsychotic drug risperidone
description: An X-ray structure of the D2 dopamine receptor bound to the atypical antipsychotic drug risperidone reveals an extended binding pocket and indicates structural features that could be used to design drugs that specifically target the D2 receptor.

heading: Biomechanics of predator–prey arms race in lion, zebra, cheetah and impala
authors: Alan M. WilsonTatjana Y. HubelTimothy G. West
description: Analysis and modelling of locomotor characteristics of two pursuit predator–prey pairs show that hunts at lower speeds enable prey to use their maximum manoeuvring capacity and favour prey survival.

heading: Mitochondrial translation requires folate-dependent tRNA methylation
authors: Raphael J. MorscherGregory S. DuckerJoshua D. Rabinowitz
description: Mammalian mitochondria use folate-bound one-carbon units generated by the enzyme SHMT2 to methylate tRNA, and this modification is required for mitochondrial translation and thus oxidative phosphorylation.

heading: The axolotl genome and the evolution of key tissue formation regulators
description: Sequencing and assembly of the 32-Gb genome of the Mexican axolotl reveals that it lacks the developmental gene Pax3, which is essential in other vertebrates; the genome sequence could improve our understanding of the evolution of the axolotl’s remarkable regenerative capabilities.

heading: The honeycomb maze provides a novel test to study hippocampal-dependent spatial navigation
description: A newly designed honeycomb maze presents several advantages over current spatial navigation assays that include greater control over the rat’s choices throughout the task and the collection of electrophysiological data during navigation.

heading: Sequences enriched in Alu repeats drive nuclear localization of long RNAs in human cells
description: A sequence that is frequently found in Alu elements drives the localization of some long RNAs to the nucleus in human cells.

heading: A major lineage of non-tailed dsDNA viruses as unrecognized killers of marine bacteria
authors: Kathryn M. KauffmanFatima A. HussainMartin F. Polz
description: Members of a family of marine dsDNA non-tailed bacterial viruses have short, 10-kb genomes, infect a broader range of hosts than tailed viruses and belong to the double jelly roll capsid lineage of viruses, which are associated with diverse bacterial and archaeal hosts.

heading: Mitochondria–lysosome contacts regulate mitochondrial fission via RAB7 GTP hydrolysis
description: Formation of inter-organelle contacts between mitochondria and lysosomes, regulated by lysosomal RAB7 GTP hydrolysis, allows for bidirectional regulation of mitochondrial and lysosomal dynamics.

heading: Tissue-selective effects of nucleolar stress and rDNA damage in developmental disorders
description: Mutations associated with Treacher Collins syndrome perturb the subnuclear localization of an RNA helicase involved in ribosome biogenesis through activation of p53 protein, illustrating how disruption in general regulators that compromise nucleolar homeostasis can result in tissue-selective malformations.

heading: Evolutionary routes and KRAS dosage define pancreatic cancer phenotypes
description: Oncogenic dosage variation along distinct evolutionary routes defines fundamental aspects of pancreatic cancer biology and phenotypic diversification.

heading: Strong disk winds traced throughout outbursts in black-hole X-ray binaries
authors: B. E. TetarenkoJ.-P. LasotaG. R. Sivakoff
description: Analysis of the light curves of outbursts in black-hole X-ray binaries suggests that throughout the accretion process mass is lost from the accretion disks through strong, magnetically driven disk winds.

heading: Structure and mechanogating mechanism of the Piezo1 channel
description: The electron cryo-microscopy structure of full-length mouse Piezo1 reveals unique topological features such as the repetitive transmembrane helical units that constitute the highly curved transmembrane region, and identifies regions and single residues that are crucial for the mechanical activation of the channel.

heading: The atomic structure of a eukaryotic oligosaccharyltransferase complex
description: The high-resolution structure of the entire eukaryotic oligosaccharyltransferase complex is determined, revealing the role of membrane lipids in mediating inter-subunit interactions, and the mechanism by which the complex enables protein N-glycosylation.

heading: Innate and adaptive lymphocytes sequentially shape the gut microbiota and lipid metabolism
authors: Kairui MaoAntonio P. BaptistaRonald N. Germain
description: Distinct populations of lymphocytes act sequentially during development to direct maturation of the mammalian gut microbiota.

heading: Emergent constraint on equilibrium climate sensitivity from global temperature variability
authors: Peter M. CoxChris HuntingfordMark S. Williamson
description: Equilibrium climate sensitivity—which remains the largest uncertainty in climate projections—is constrained to a ‘likely’ range of 2.2–3.4 K by taking into account the variability of global temperature about long-term historical warming.

heading: Molecular mechanism of promoter opening by RNA polymerase III
authors: Matthias K. VorländerHeena KhatterChristoph W. Müller
description: Cryo-EM structures of Pol III preinitiation complexes are presented, comprising Pol III and the transcription factor TFIIIB bound to a natural promoter in different functional states.

heading: Centimetre-scale electron diffusion in photoactive organic heterostructures
description: For a suitably designed organic multilayer structure, optically or electrically generated electrons confined to a thin fullerene channel can diffuse over surprisingly long distances of several centimetres.

heading: Structural basis of RNA polymerase III transcription initiation
description: Detailed structures of yeast RNA polymerase III and its initiation complex shed light on how the transcription of essential non-coding RNAs begins and allow comparisons with other RNA polymerases.

heading: Chromosomal instability drives metastasis through a cytosolic DNA response
authors: Samuel F. BakhoumBryan NgoLewis C. Cantley
description: In chromosomally unstable tumour cells, rupture of micronuclei exposes genomic DNA and activates the cGAS–STING cytosolic DNA-sensing pathway, thereby promoting metastasis.

heading: Clonal evolution mechanisms in NT5C2 mutant-relapsed acute lymphoblastic leukaemia
authors: Gannie TzonevaChelsea L. DieckAdolfo A. Ferrando
description: Mutations in the nucleotidase-encoding gene NT5C2 drive chemotherapy resistance in relapsed acute lymphoid leukaemia but the mutations also lead to a loss-of-fitness phenotype and to collateral drug sensitivity, which could be exploited for therapy.

heading: Structures of β-klotho reveal a ‘zip code’-like mechanism for endocrine FGF signalling
description: Crystal structures of free and ligand-bound β-klotho reveal that it acts as a primary receptor for FGF21, and demonstrate how a sugar-cutting enzyme has evolved to become a receptor for hormones that regulate metabolic processes.

heading: Structure and mutagenesis reveal essential capsid protein interactions for KSHV replication
description: Cryo-electron microscopy reveals the structure of the Kaposi’s sarcoma-associated herpesvirus capsid, and experiments with polypeptides that mimic the smallest capsid protein demonstrate the potential for structure-derived insights to help to develop antiviral agents.

heading: Monitoring T cell–dendritic cell interactions in vivo by intercellular enzymatic labelling
description: Interactions between receptors and ligands on immune cells are visualized in vivo and in vitro using an enzyme-tagged ligand that, when cells interact, leaves behind a detectable label on the receptor-expressing cell.

heading: Midbrain circuits that set locomotor speed and gait selection
description: Speed and gait selection in mice are controlled by glutamatergic excitatory neurons in the cuneiform nucleus and the pedunculopontine nucleus, which act in conjunction to select context-dependent locomotor behaviours.

heading: Regulation of embryonic haematopoietic multipotency by EZH1
authors: Linda T. VoMelissa A. KinneyGeorge Q. Daley
description: The production of haematopoietic stem cells is repressed during early mammalian embryogenesis by an epigenetic mechanism that involves the action of the Polycomb protein EZH1.

heading: A Myc enhancer cluster regulates normal and leukaemic haematopoietic stem cell hierarchies
description: A blood enhancer cluster forms a highly combinatorial system that allows precise control of Myc expression across normal and leukaemic haematopoietic stem-cell hierarchies.

heading: Atomic structure of the eukaryotic intramembrane RAS methyltransferase ICMT
authors: Melinda M. DiverLeanne PediStephen B. Long
description: The X-ray structure of the integral membrane protein isoprenylcysteine carboxyl methyltransferase suggests mechanisms by which it recognizes both water-soluble and membrane-bound reactants to catalyze the methylation of RAS and other CAAX proteins at the membrane-cytosol interface.

heading: α-Klotho is a non-enzymatic molecular scaffold for FGF23 hormone signalling
description: The crystal structure of shed ectodomain of α-klotho bound to the FGFR1c ligand-binding domain and FGF23 unveils the mechanism by which klotho co-receptors promote hormonal FGF signalling.

heading: Observation of a phononic quadrupole topological insulator
description: A two-dimensional phononic quadrupole topological insulator is demonstrated experimentally using mechanical metamaterials, which has both the one-dimensional edge states and the zero-dimensional corner states predicted by theory.

heading: A rapid decrease in the rotation rate of comet 41P/Tuttle–Giacobini–Kresák
authors: Dennis BodewitsTony L. FarnhamMatthew M. Knight
description: The rotation rate of comet 41P/Tuttle–Giacobini–Kresák decreased rapidly between March and May 2017, owing to gas emission from the comet aligning to produce an anomalously strong torque.

heading: Rotation in [C ii]-emitting gas in two galaxies at a redshift of 6.8
description: The emission of singly ionized carbon is used to identify two galaxies with redshifts of nearly 7—corresponding to the Universe’s first billion years—and with velocity structures suggestive of rotation.

heading: Bright triplet excitons in caesium lead halide perovskites
authors: Michael A. BeckerRoman VaxenburgAlexander L. Efros
description: The lowest-energy exciton state in caesium lead halide perovskite nanocrystals is shown to be a bright triplet state, contrary to expectations that lowest-energy excitons should always be dark.

heading: An extreme magneto-ionic environment associated with the fast radio burst source FRB 121102
description: Polarimetric observations of the repeating fast radio burst source FRB 121102 suggest that the bursts may originate from a neutron star in the extreme magneto-ionic environment of an accreting massive black hole or supernova remnant.

heading: Neurexin controls plasticity of a mature, sexually dimorphic neuron
description: The DVB neuron in Caenorhabditis elegans shows male-specific morphological plasticity that is controlled by neurexin and influences mating behaviour.

heading: An extracellular network of Arabidopsis leucine-rich repeat receptor kinases
description: A high-throughput assay is used to analyse 40,000 potential extracellular domain interactions of a large family of plant cell surface receptors (LRR-RKs) and provide a cell surface interaction network for these receptors.

heading: Architecture of a channel-forming O-antigen polysaccharide ABC transporter
description: The crystal structure of a channel-forming O-antigen polysaccharide ABC transporter suggests a novel biopolymer translocation mechanism.

heading: Paternal chromosome loss and metabolic crisis contribute to hybrid inviability in Xenopus
description: In hybrid inviability between Xenopus laevis and Xenopus tropicalis, genomic regions on two X. laevis chromosomes are incompatible with the X. tropicalis cytoplasm and are mis-segregated during mitosis, leading to unbalanced gene expression at the maternal to zygotic transition, followed by cell-autonomous catastrophic embryo death.
